Reviews.Title: “Excellent Maui Property”
Reviews.Author: seatrader1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Sept 2011 for 10 days with 6 other family members for a mini family reunion. We had an excellent stay. We had a 2-bedroom lockoff oceanview that faced the public park and ocean. Having the 2-bedroom lockoff was fantastic because we had the full kitchen with plenty of space to entertain everyone in the 1-bedroom because of the full deck. The studio side was great for the parents to have their own retreat. This was my first time to this particular Westin property and thought it was great. I've been to the Westin Maui several times and really enjoy that property too. The mid-week cleaning didn't occur on the day we were told but a "reminder" phone call was enough to prompt them for the next day. It wasn't a big deal but definately out of the norm for a Westin property. We already have a 2-bedroom lockoff oceanfront booked for this Sept...can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: funseekers88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newer North Villas. This is a great place to stay with family. Our first room was facing the Pirate ship pool, only stay in this part of the building if you have small children or don't mind the sounds of screaming small children all day and night. After three days of pleading with the front desk we were moved to a room facing the main pool which is much quieter and much sunnier! The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. The beach in front of the resort is rocky and not that great for swimming. The pools are beautiful but very shallow. Overall a well thought out nicely equipped resort but we probably won't stay on this part of Kaanapali Beach again as we prefer being on the other side of Black Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Charityamber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the Westin Kaanapali Villas for our 11 year anniversary. It was the first time we had been to Maui and our whole trip was amazing! This property is beautiful, room was great, the staff were over-all very nice and friendly. The location is wonderful the beach and the snorkeling was also amazing! We cannot wait to come back to Maui and would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Maui Mike at pool rental hut”
Reviews.Author: Er1cBr0wn
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note how nice the guys were at the pool towel and rental shop. Our Snorkel that we brought from home had broken and he went out of his way to help us at no charge. Little things like that go a long way in making a great vacation experience. Way to go Mike!

Reviews.Title: “Not What we Paid For H B 65”
Reviews.Author: HelenB65
Reviews.Content: Arrived after long flight from Australia 1st March 2012 - paid for an ocean view one bedroom apartment and a studio for our adult son. Apartments allocated had a partial ocean view through some shoreline trees and overlooked an abandoned building site. I complained and was reallocated the same room types overlooking the pool area after pushing my case. Americans seem to have no idea exactly what an ocean view means since we have always experienced problems with this in the past and always pay top dollar to alleviate any problems on check in. Resort was extremely well kept but paying for parking is a let down. As golfers access to laundry facilities is always a plus as was the case here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Sarry2323
Reviews.Content: The Westin really gave you a true resort feel from the grounds to the variety of restaurants. This was our first stay at the property and it was everything we expected, the grounds were impecably kept, the rooms were spacious and the staff friendly.The beach in front of the resort offered great swimming and snorkelling, and was long enough to beach walk everyday. There were plently of pool chairs as we spent have our days at the beach and half at the pool. It would have been nice for the resort to offer chairs at the beach for free when paying such a high price for accomadations.The shuttle service was perfect for those not wanting to drive everywhere. We were not asked once to purchase a timeshare or sit through a long presentation as some other reviews have mentioned. My only complaint is that the rooms and hallway areas could have been cleaner, the carpet was also worn in our unit and the maid staff was not very consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid front desk staff; possible health hazard”
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: Our third stay here. First two were four star +. The third was our last stay. It took 8 tries to get room card keys that worked; then it went down hill from there. Flight was late getting in and by the time we finally got keys to our room, we were ready to crash. Got up and went to breakfast. When we returned to our room, we noticed a strange chemical smell - something like turpentine or laquer thinner. Front desk sent Security to check it out; yes, Security -- not Housekeeping, not Maintenance. We were told to go about our day and it would be fixed by the time we got back. Inconvenient; we had planned on spending the day, reading, relaxing, and swimming; i.e., we had not planned on leaving the resort. Returned to the same smell. Front desk explained that, although some persons from housekeeping and maintenance noticed the smell, there was no agreement regarding what it might be. So, they decided to try to "ionize" the room and hope it would take care of the problem. Front desk eventually found an alternate room for us. The room seemed to be OK although there was a slight musty smell even though the windows and lanai doors were open. Next day; same problem. We awoke with headaches and the smell of turpentine. Returned to front desk. Front desk claims there is no notes in our records indicating a prior problem. They offer to send Housekeeping to check out the situation. We wait for Housekeeping (for 2 hours). Housekeeping arrives; they offer to "spray" and/or put the "ionizer" in the room -- but, ionizer requires that we leave the room for 8-10 hours. Fortunately, we have an outting planned so the 8-10 hours fits our schedule. We return to a room with all of the windows and lanai doors open (not exactly a "secure" environment for our belongings); but at least there is no noticeable odor. Next morning, same headaches, same odor. Front desk tells me there is no record of any problem or complaint in our file. We insist that Housekeeping and Maintenance be sent to our room. Maintenance shows up in 45 minutes; housekeeping takes 2 hours again. We go into the room with both representatives; one says "chemical smell ... not paint based ... but definitely chemical", the other says "not chemical ... more like something is rotting ... fruit or something that was sweet". They send us to the front desk to see if there is a different room. On our way, we pass an area where painters are spray painting some doors or other larger items. When I get to the front desk, I'm told that there is nothing in our records about any problems and that the resort is completely full. I ask for a manager. She asks me what the problem is; I replay our experience thus far over 3 days -- and I mention the painters working on another building. She asks me where my room is at and where the painters are. Then she goes and gets a map and shows me that my room is not near where I say the painters are so therefore whatever I smell is not a result of the painters work on the resort. I reply that I don't really care what the cause is, that I just want a room that does not have a chemical smell and that does not give me a headache from breathing whatever is in the room. She tells me that I am "mistaken" and that there is nothing wrong with the room I am in. She then asks what I would like her to do. I ask her to go to my room and smell it for herself -- and to talk to the 4 housekeeping staff, 3 maintenance personnel, 2 security personnel, and 1 conceirge representative who had gathered in the room -- all but 1 of whom detected a strange odor but could not agree on what it might be. The "Front Desk Manager" gave me a disgusted look, then got up and walked away without saying a word and without taking any action to try to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cuddles521
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two weeks at the villas in January. This is a beautiful ocean front property with nicely furnished rooms. Even though we stayed in a efficient suite we had a kitchen, large bathroom with jacczzi tub and separate shower, king size bed, safe and washer/dryer in room. Beds are most comfortable and their bedding is heavenly. Guest service is fabulous. They are friendly, courteous, professional and very accommodating. We were assigned a room without a liani and they went out of their way to get us a room with one. When we go to Hawaii we want to spend our time outside as much as possible and morning coffee and evening wind down is just perfect on a liani. There are suites that do not have them and that is a shame. Bouquet goes out to Stephanie who found us a room with a beach and ocean view. The next week we had to move and this was a bit difficult to accommodate us because they were painting part of the resort.. They did find us a suite with a liani that had a mountain view. This was closer to the highway and prone to more road noise. Did not mine the road noise as much as the noise that the shuttle buses made. All in all noise is noise and we enjoyed sitting on the liani and enjoyed the Hawaii terrain and air. Shuttle bus service is great and one really does not need to rent a car if you are staying around the resort. The shuttle goes to three Starwood properties, Whalers Village, Safeway and right into Lahania town. This is just wonderful. Enjoyed the swimming pools, beach and the boardwalk that connects all the Kaanapali properties. The boardwalk is great for a run or leisurly walk . We even walked the opposite way to the supermarket "Times" for the extra exercise and to pick up a bottle of wine and some groceries. Whale watching was great and we even had a monk seal beached one day. Enviromental people sealed the area off and watched it until the tide took it back into the ocean. One can rent kayaks and paddle boards at the beach and on fridays they sit up a big tent and the locals come and displace their crafts. Resort is beauitfully maintained inside and throughout the grounds. Everyone goes out of their way to be friendly. Spent time at this resort before and will definitely come here again. From Cuddles - Sherwood Park, Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Time Shared with Monsoon Weather”
Reviews.Author: surfcity6
Reviews.Content: Off the bat, I knew my stay at this property was a timeshare deal although the paperwork received from Westin did not say so. The full court press is on even before you leave home with correspondence from your "vacation concierge ". I was never interested in a timeshare sales presentation or purchase. The room was a vanilla flavor much like their sister property in Kauai. The accomodations are pretty much impersonal. The prices were high for hotel services matching some of the grande dame properties in Hawaii. I have had far better acommodations in Hawaii and after visiting this place would have second thoughts about rebooking another stay. It will be a cold day in hell that I book any vacation in Maui. I can get the same experience in a Southern California suburb without adverse weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Limited Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: kellyscairns
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed there for a week in September 2011. The room and view was beautiful, except, it was kind of hidden by the buildings. The only bad thing I can say is, we were supposed to receive Comp Breakfast for "Going Green", and not having our room cleaned everyday. We never received that! We were charged for everytime we went to Breakfast. SURPRISE! Also we were charged for Pool Towels, that we NEVER used. The shuttle service left us on the side of the road, just to walk 5 miles back to the Resort, NO FUN! The conceirges were great with helping plan trips to different areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great all inclusive vacation spot.”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily_sara
Reviews.Content: The north villas are really close to the beach. The rooms are in the North Villas all have a king bed and jacuzzi tub, kitchen, washer and dryer. You have the option to go green and not have your room turned down during your stay and you'll receive a voucher for one of their restaurants. I would not choose this because the restaurant is not that good. You can also turn in your towels to the pool staff or front desk and they will give you fresh new ones at any time which is convienant. We stayed her for a friend's wedding. It is family type of place so if you are looking for something less family oriented look else where. Although it is family spot I really didn't notice many kids. I would stay here again but it would not be my first choice. I I guess I just expected more out of the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home in Jan/Feb”
Reviews.Author: pwom
Reviews.Content: As owners we come to the Westin Villas every year for 5-6 weeks. This year we shared our wonderful experiences with family. A very special time. The Westin staff always go the extra mile to accomodate your needs. The resort is well managed and is always beautifully maintained inside and throughout the grounds. The rooms have fully equipped kitchens to prepare meals. There are Bar B Q's throughout. There are pools, hot tubs, childrens play area with pirate ship and slides etc. Three restaurants to accomodate desires plus 2 gift and asundry markets on property. The ocean snorkeling and whale watching in front of the resort are a must. You can also rent kayaks and paddle boards to experience the whales or just enjoy the water. We use the shuttles that take you to Whalers village by the Westin Hotel, Sheraton Hotel, Lahiana Cannery, Lahaina, and the Gateway. In 6 weeks we had a car for a week. It is do able and saves alot of money. You can walk North 1.5 miles to a wonderful farmers market, or 1 mile South to Black Rock on a pathway or the beach, There are things to do for all ages. It is our facvorite time of year to spend time at this beautiful resort. We are very lucky. We have already booked for 2013 and anticipate seeing friends and staff at the resort. See you all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lori K
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time at the Westin. The beach is excellent with great snorkeling. We rented a one bedroom villa which was spacious for a family of four. There is a pullout couch and we rented a cot for $5 per night. Our unit had a full kitchen so we could cook some meals, saved a lot of money that way. There was a BBQ area which was nice and clean. The on site restaurants were pricey but the food was good. Location was perfect as it was only a 5 minute drive into Lahaina. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Upcoming stay”
Reviews.Author: cbrifly
Reviews.Content: My family will stay at the Westin Villas during the last week of March. We booked an oceanview 2 bedroom villa. Any chance we will be on an upper floor on the ocean side of the building?

Reviews.Title: “great weather”
Reviews.Author: dhauk
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to attach some photos, including the whale photos from our room

Reviews.Title: “our favorite place to stay on our favorite Island!”
Reviews.Author: LaneCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We've traveled here about 5 times, alone and with family. It's big, beautiful, has great staff, lots of fun activities for adults and children, a nice little "General Store" (not cheap, but it IS Hawaii where nothing is cheap). And the snorkeling right off the beach outside the resort is terrific. We're going back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation Spot!”
Reviews.Author: SDNative73
Reviews.Content: This resort was the perfect "home base" for our family vacation in February. And I use the word "home" literally, because that's what it seemed like, with all the amenities inside our villa. We cooked over half our meals in the fully loaded kitchen (or on the grills just outside the building). This was a huge benefit of staying at the Westin Villas, not only because we love to cook, but also because we saved plenty of money! We also loved the number of pools, including the "kiddie pool" with the pirate ship. The beach at Kaanapali is just steps away, too, and the "beach boardwalk" the connects all the properties along Kaanapali is very convenient for walks and runs. Another convenience of this property is the "Starwood Bus" that connects all three Starwood properties in Kaanapali, as well as the Lahaina bus that runs a separate route down to the center of Lahaina village. No rental car needed! All in all, we had a fantastic experience at the Westin Villas, and we would definitely return for any future visits to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay For Our First Trip To Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Darlene E
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and the Westin VIllas lived up to their excellent reviews! We checked in about 1/2 hour earlier then the 4 pm check in with no problem. We had the 2 bedroom lock off which was spacious, modern and very clean. The one thing we do wish they had was a true 2 bedroom villa rather then the lock off which had two 1 bedroom villas connected by an entry foyer. We had our boys 12 and 15 stay on the one side and my husband and I on the other. This worked okay with us as we just propped open the doors, otherwise every time the boys wanted to come over to us they would have had to use a door key. we are owners in Florida and their 2 bedroom is like one very large condo. This resort is just beautiful. We enjoyed the pool with the waterslide and had no problem finding lounge chairs. My husband and older son enjoyed the snorkelling in the ocean right off the resort's beach and even swam with a turtle. We had stayed our first few nights at the Sheraton just up the beach and found the villas to be more private with a lot less people traffic from the other various hotels. Yes, it is further down from Whalers Village with its shops and restaurants but the added privacy is worth it and everything is just a free shuttle ride away. I would highly recommend staying at the villas and we will most definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Beach Shack”
Reviews.Author: LizandB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nine day stay at the Westin -- had a wonderful time , as usual. We have to give a special shout-out to the really sweet guys at the "Shack, who we dealt with daily. They were outstanding!! Thanks, Guys! NYC

Reviews.Title: “Superb As Usual”
Reviews.Author: CdnLib
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to this resort but as I really enjoy Westin elsewhere, I was not disappointed here at Kaanapali. The suites are nicely appointed and well equipped. The service is fantastic for a resort of this type. The grounds are incomparable to anything else I've seen on Maui. The spa/ gym/ pool and beach facilities are just right. All in all if I was to be asked about this resort, I would have to give it 5 out 0f 5.

Reviews.Title: “HAVE YOUR WALET READY !”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: The wife & I had booked a King Ocean view. Were told breakfast was included. Our buffet breakfast cost us about $60, it was nice. Our room was on the 4th floor, you could see the ocean thru the trees. We went for drinks at the pool side lounge, I had to get up and get our 2nd drinks, then ask someone where our waiter was to sign for the tab as I was not going to wait on myself. I have had better service at some low end places. They charge you for every thing from parking to a $25 resort fee every day. The lobby was very nice and the beach was beautiful. The Luau was the best one I have ever been to, but it was also extra, $130 plus tax per person. All in all way over priced for what you get. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on Kaanapali!”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ocean front property. Spacious, nicely furnished condos, friendly service, excellent amenities. On site dining choices a little limited, but many options available a short, free shuttle ride or car ride away.Especially good spot for families.

Reviews.Title: “We had a beautiful ocean front room !!!”
Reviews.Author: World T
Reviews.Content: The best part of our vacation was our room !! It was absolutely beautiful with an amazing view ocean front view of the beach. In the morning we would hear the whales and loved spending nights there and just hanging out at the balcony. The beach was beautiful and we had a lot of fun in the pool too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Exotic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SherlockFamilyReview
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! What a place!!! First class service, amenities, and atmosphere. Can't say enough about our whole experience. Staff was exceptionally professional and courteous. We will DEFINITELY be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: she-muff
Reviews.Content: This place had the perfect location and amenities for our little family. First off, the "room" was huge! Sure our view was of the parking lot but who cares when you have a full kitchen, washer/dryer and a spacious bathroom with separate shower and jacuzzi? It was very clean and everything looked brand-new even though we were supposedly in one of the older buildings, number 4. Our toddler loved playing in the jacuzzi every night and we loved having a fridge at our disposal. It was great to have so much space to ourselves, which made it very easy to relax. The location was also wonderful, very close to Lahaina for shopping and Napili (and of course Kaanapali) for swimming. The resort offers a shuttle to Lahaina but you will probably have a car and can get there quicker by driving. We've never had a problem finding street parking in Lahaina so found it easier to drive ourselves instead of having to wait for a shuttle. What I really liked was being right across the street from the Sugar Cane Train depot. Now the train itself is overpriced but if you have a kid who loves trains, the attraction is priceless. It was very easy to walk over and hop on the train for a ride to Lahaina and back. There is also a little farmers market at the depot that sells fruits and shave ice, also overpriced, but may be worth checking out for some. The grounds were spacious and my husband did say he didn't like all the walking but I enjoyed how much there was to see. The main pool and slide were a real treat although our son was too young to ride on it. No matter, the pirate ship pool with nearby playground was perfect for him. I really liked how there were several shallow baby pools besides that that he could safely play in too. The beach was also great for kids, with wonderfully textured sand to play in and calm waters in which to frolic. I saw there were stacks of chairs and umbrellas on the beach but didn't see any attendants nearby for set up. Are you supposed to go all the way back to the pool area to ask for that service? That does remind me that service was a bit lacking here. Most of the staff could use a refresher course in Aloha 101. While the room attendants and valet were courteous, the pool attendants were almost flippant and the front desk staff very impersonal and unhelpful. The concierge were hit or miss and while they do give you a nice welcome gift (for us, a reusable shopping tote, very helpful as Maui County has a plastic bag ban), they will also ask you to attend a timeshare presentation. However, a simple "No, thank you" will get them off your back; I was afraid they'd be more pushy. I'd read some reviews from couples who were disappointed by the lack of romantic atmosphere and turned off from all the "screaming" kids. While I encountered lots of kids while there, they all seemed very well behaved and I found the area quiet as a whole. Our room seemed especially quiet; I didn't even realize we had neighbors till we were all checking out on the last day. So maybe all the children around is not ideal for a romantic getaway but this was certainly the place for a family vacation. I liked seeing all the families around and like I said, all the children were quite well behaved and respectful. I never encountered any pushing or excessive yelling. All in all, if you are looking for mini retreat for your family, this is the place. We really enjoyed our stay at this Westin and had a relaxing time!

Reviews.Title: “Watching Whales Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kendmv
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Westin. The resort is as good as always. Our room was clean and the bedding that they use is great! The staff at the Westin are very friendly. My wife and I watched the sunset every evening as we sipped our drinks at the many bars on the beach. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another visit, another great time!”
Reviews.Author: abc_sea
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 10 day stay for the second year in a row and both of our experiences have been stellar. Regarding other reviews about bad room assignments, I think that the hotel does their best to accommodate as far as views/room preferences, but its a hotel with most people staying for a week's time, who all want the same views, so they don't have a lot of flexibility. We arrived on a late flight (9pm) and were greeted by name at the front desk. (which was a nice touch). We staying on SPG cash and points and were still given what I think is a decent room in the North, building 6, 3rd floor. It overlooked the pirate ship and had a view of the ocean. Highlights -The bellhops are really helpful and quick. We had a whole load of Costco groceries they helped us with. -Our jacuzzi tub quit working, they had someone reset the breaker and confirmed that it worked within the hour. -Spa was excellent -Kid's loved feeding the koi, I think they did it almost every day -Grounds are immaculate Room to improve -Housekeeping comes at inopportune times (lunch, naptime), but it's probably hard to manage around everyone's schedules. -More BBQs

Reviews.Title: “Not great if you are not an owner”
Reviews.Author: mcnurse888
Reviews.Content: Paid a premium price booked through SPG. We have stayed at the Sheraton Maui several times and thought we would stay at the Villas as we were going for 15 dyas for our 25 anniversary. Booked an oceanview one bedroom and was assured several times we would have a great view ect. What a disappointment we had a room in building 7 that basically was on the highway. There was so much traffic noise you couln't sit out on your balcony. We had a decent view of the ocean but with all the sirens ect. you couldn't enjoy it. We requested to change rooms and were told by the frontdesk staff that unless you are an owner you will never get a room in the front buildings. I guess I can understand this but if we had been told this when we booked we would have booked elsewhere. Tried switching to the Sheraton but couldn't get a room so stayed at the villas. The units themselves are nice , very clean and the heavenly bed was wonderful. Pools have tons of kids so thee adult only pool was nice but it is very small and out of the way so a lot of shade not much sun. The barbques were a joke tried severl times to use them but had to wait so long we just ended up cooking n the room or going out for dinner. They supposedly have a time limit on the barbques but one fellow there told my husband he owns 4 units so he can use them for as long as he likes !! Schmuck !! Really wanted to like the Villas and were thinking of buying one but we will stay t the Marriott or the Sheraton nxt time we come.

Reviews.Title: “Not seeing the benefit of ownership”
Reviews.Author: ofthemoon
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVE this place, which is why we purchased one week every other year. However, we are consistently told that our requested view is not guaranteed. Great. We understand. However, we've now used our place three times and have yet to get the view we want. When discussing with the current management we were told that we need to call as early as possible to reserve. When told that we did that, they said yes, we were the 8th caller that day (one year in advance). The EIGHTH and we still could not get the unit we wanted. Also, we asked for a later checkout and I mentioned we were gold members and the lady kind of chuckled and said all our owners are gold members (as in being one is nothing special) and we could have one extra hour (check out moved from 10 am to 11 am). So while we love it here, it's getting increasingly evident that there is no benefit to buying here. It would have been cheaper to pay an owner to rent out their place than to pay the annual fees and the purchase price we did. (Yes, we understand the other benefits ownership provides.) We were contacted by someone at Westin after my husband posted a negative review, but nothing could be done or explained to us to our satisfaction. They did give us a $100 room credit and 20,000 star points for our disappointment, which made us feel that at least they tried. And lastly, most people who work here are absolutely wonderful, friendly and caring - particularly Dee Dee. Others need a basic class in how to handle stress on the job and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Westin Lagunamar but traded to Maui to allow some family members to visit Maui. This is a beautiful property on one of the best beaches in Maui. If you're into snorkelling, you will not be disappointed with the massive reef a few feet off the beach. This does make swimming a challenge however. Beach shoes a must! Our check-in was quick and efficient without any orientation or direction to our building. We had to ask a guest for direction as this was our first visit to this property. We got a 2 bedroom lockout in building 2 on the 5th floor. The room was clean and met our expectations. We had a few issues in our two week stay that were handled quickly and efficiently by the staff. We had a dryer that would not dry, a faulty toaster, and can opener. All were corrected in less than a half hour. We discovered some water damage in bathroom, and a crack in the bathroom wall, but other than that the room was in good shape. We enjoyed the "heavenly" bed, and all the facilities spending most of our time snorkelling, and watching the whales play. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed once again”
Reviews.Author: Ellen G
Reviews.Content: As owners since 2004, we have come to expect a poor reception each year when we return to our home resort. This year was no exception. Year after year the greeting at the front desk has become more & more impersonal. We cringe at being told, "You're next." No Aloha, no welcome, not even a simple hello. We have reached out to management on more than one occasion and despite being told that changes have been made and new management is in place, in our view nothing has changed. Why is it that non-owners are getting better service and placement than those of us who have paid a VERY high premium? At first glance the place might look decent but as previously mentioned by another reviewer it is a glorified Courtyard by Marriott - rugs need replacing and the units need a good cleaning - sorry, but I can't stand smudged mirrors and handprints all over the windows. And as far as that supposed Heavenly Bed goes - how about using bedding that fits the bed? This year we continued our journey on to Australia, New Zealand and Fiji. Our stay at the Westin Sydney was wonderful. Friendly service, beautiful property. Sheraton Fiji Denarau resort - lovely, warmest greeting and service ever. Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas - you need to take a lesson from these Starwood properties. And to those who are raving about this place - Have you ever been anywhere else in the world????

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place”
Reviews.Author: hapi2travel
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners at another location, but we always trade out to stay here. We love the location, the cleanliness and having our own kitchen. The resort and pool area is very well-kept and the snorkeling is great right in front of the resort. We actually stayed in another hotel in another part of the island. We won't do that again. (that's another review) I think we were spoiled . We will back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Family Vacation Perfected”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: We visited here for a week with two families. Shared a two bedroom oceanview. Plenty of room and the two washer and dryers were awesome with the number of little ones we had. Great restaurants! Beautiful grounds. Pirate ship for the kids and waterslide. Beach has coral right at the surf and can be tricky. Great snorkeling right off the beach. Shuttles to everywhere are super convenient. Excellent customer service. Little things like knowing your name when you call and stuff. Only complaint- we were in building 3 and had an airconditioning unit right outside our window so we couldn't hear the waves.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but I liked the Marriott better.”
Reviews.Author: Trendchaser
Reviews.Content: I have been to mauI 3 times. Twice before we sayed at the marriott beach club napili towers, but this time we wanted to try something different and bought a weeks stay here on eBay for $1500. Our suite was large and had an ocean view. It was my first time staying at the Westin. For the price we paid, this can't be beat. Sadly, I would have rather paid $800 more and stayed at the Marriott for a room with no view. Here is why... Kids pirate pool is nice. But it's tucked away from the from the main pool and it's not a short walk either as the property is huge. No view from here. Just a pirate pool in between some buildings. At the Marriott, the pirate pool was next to the beach and the other pools, it was connected. No special trip to go to the pirate pool. Ashame, because of this we only used it once here at the Westin. The mariott was close to whalers village. A 10 minute romantic beautiful stroll down the beach walk. The Westin is not walking distance. You got to drive and pay parking. The beach at the westin is top notch but the resort is not right on the beach. There is a small green buffer area separating the hotel from the beach. The marriott was right smack on the beach. The pool at the Westin is smallish compared to Marriotts mega pool. There is a BBQ area overlooking the ocean but it's quite far from the rooms. The Marriott had a BBQ at every picnic table rather than several bbq station. Add all these things up and it makes a huge huge difference in the quality between the two places. Don't get me wrong he, this place was a very nice place to spend my vacation. Definitely 4 or 5 star place. But its hard to compare when you already stayed at a place worthy of 6 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room & location”
Reviews.Author: 50Somethings98380
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean resort villas & we enjoyed our first stay at this beautiful hotel. We were in section 7 and had an ocean view from the 4th floor. The room was immaculate & updated - granite, furnishings, etc. Fortunately we found the stairs at the end of the building because it was a long maze to get to the front desk. This made life much easier toting groceries, snorkel stuff and getting to the car. Used the BBQ area a few times and the workout room - both were great. Also very relaxing hanging out at the pool and enjoying a good book. Love the boardwalk to check out different areas and of course whale watching.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Purchase Was a Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: paintjoe
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this timeshare! We own an ocean view timeshare in KOR South and purchased a second unit in the newer KOR North. We were sold an Oceanfront and paid a premium price to face the ocean and be able to enjoy the sunset from our lanai. The unit was represented to us as truly ocean front. In actuality the unit we have had the last 3 years is over the noisy restaurant sideways looking at the ocean. No beautiful sunsets from these rooms.After consistently being assigned terrible "Oceanfront" villas we learned the "secret"...be the first to call in one year in advance at 9AM Eastern time for your specific date. Today I tried this technique and as we were at the Westin in Hawaii I woke up at 3:30 AM so that I could be first in line at 4:00 AM (9 AM Eastern). My call placed at 9 AM was answered and I was told "sorry, no availablity for my date (one year in advance) or the two dates before". Unbelievable! Add to this disappointment the fact that the annual assessment charges have doubled while the current outside purchase price of available units is half of what we paid and you can see why we feel ripped off and warn others to stay away from the Westin's sales pitch. Buyer beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, happy holidays”
Reviews.Author: Shackleford_LB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 11 nights at the Westin KOR. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this very comfortable beachfront hotel. We stayed in a studio ocean facing villa in the north block. The room was perfect for us, lovely king bed, full kitchen and laundry facilities, gorgeous bathroom with jacuzzi bath and huge shower, and a balcony for taking in the sunset. It was easy to get around the resort of Ka'anapali, with a frequent free shuttle between the Westin Maui (Whalers Village) and the Sheraton Maui, and further afield into Laihina for eating and shopping. The hotel has two markets for stocking up on groceries, BBQ areas for DIY cooking, and two restaurants and a pool bar. We particularly liked the Ocean Grill - lobster fritters were yummy! The beach is lovely, great for a long walk or swimming and snorkelling. The coral reef is just metres off shore. It's colourful and full of fish - a real delight. The waves are mostly gentle, but depending on wind direction can be a bit rough, so caution is advised, as there are no lifeguards. The pools are endless, always a spot for everyone. And a very nice children's pool and play area too. The staff were helpful and welcoming, especially the shuttle drivers - mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “4 Weeks of Aloha Spirit at Westin Villas”
Reviews.Author: ABohemianGirl
Reviews.Content: I have written prior reviews regarding our travels, but under an ancient email address, thus having to start again on my review "status". My family has been coming to Maui since the early eighties. We originally stayed at The Kaanapali Alii until the first Westin Resort Villas opened. We have a 2 bedroom in both north and south villas. Although this timeshare is not as intimate as the Alii, we enjoy every amenity the KORV has to offer. This year we stayed 4 weeks. Jan. 6th to Feb. 3rd. We stayed in studios 2417 (2 weeks) 5605 & 3612. Front desk staff are professional and full of aloha spirit. Each time we walked thru the lobbies the staff were always smiling and pleasant. People who complain about THIS staff must have walked in with a chip on their shoulders to start with. They are awesome. We needed to move several times, which yes, is annoying. However, we understand because you are able to call exactly one year in advance of your reservation. That means if you are spending several weeks, you have to call the 1st week, then put in a request to automatically be reserved for the following week. You are able to put in a request for a certain building, or a certain floor, but you are not guaranteed that you'll get it. The best group of guys are the bell staff. Every one of them are friendly, fast and efficient. When we first got to the Westin, we were loaded up with cases of wine and groceries. These guys had our luggage and everything loaded onto a cart and beat us to our room! Give them a BIG, well deserved gratuity. Sometimes they will pass on a special percentage off a restaurant. As in our case, we got free hula pies at Kimo's. The studios are spacious. We used the little kitchenette alot and it is stocked with most of the things you need. We love using the BBQ grills. We never had to wait for a grill, and they were cleaned every day. We met alot of fun people. One guy had caught an ahi one morning, and brought a big platter of it down and shared with us. The beds are true to the Westin "heavenly" promise. I prefer no down pillows or comforter. Just ask and they will give you down substitutes. Although we had a rental car for the month, we made use of the shuttle service at least 2 or 3 times a week. The shuttle takes you to the Westin resort (south of the villas) the Sheraton, and 3 stops in Lahaina. They run from I believe 10 am to after 10 pm. Be sure to tip the driver. They appreciate it. Here is a breakdown of this years stay: (Suite numbers break down to blg#, floor#, room#) Room 2417: (Blg 2, 4th floor, room 17.) South Complex. Ocean view. Good location, right next to the foyer/elevator. It overlooks the main pool area. Note the sun shines most of the day on your room. The pool can get noisy, but never bothered us. Blg 2 has full refrigerators, a plus. Room 5605: North Complex Awesome corner suite! Ocean front. Had a window over the tub area and beautiful views. LOVED this room! Con: A maze to get from lobby to room. Long way from the BBQ grills. The view made it an easy trade. Room 3612: South Complex Room was clean. Faced the jacuzzi as well as the Ocean Bar and Grill. Noisy. Very early morning heard carts rumbling and dishes tinkling. Blg 3 has small dorm sized refrigerators. Blg 3 facing south is nice. It looks over the park. Internet was fast. Room service speedy. A phone call gets your trash emptied, towels replenished, reservations made. The cleaning staff for the rooms, hallways, the groundskeepers, pool shack guys.. everyone who needs to make the wheel turn, were so nice and we always made sure to say aloha to them. They work hard. Acknowledge them. It may make their day. Observations: Smokers. They can smoke on the balconies. Lounge chair hogs: They are at every resort. Pool Servers: Sorry to say, most were spotty and slow. Prices: We think the prices are fair for a resort. Food: Average. Ticked I wanted a kid burger and they said no. Of note: Whale watch on a raft with Pacific Whale Foundation at sunrise. Duke's, Seahouse, for Happy Hour. Betty's for Lobster: $13.95 (Wednesdays) also lobster benedict. (oh) Also, you can watch Feast of Lele for free, as Betty's is directly behind the show! Pacific O for lunch. Beachfront. Mixed Plate Lahaina. Beachfront. Cheap. Great food. Westin Resort @ Tropica for Sunday brunch. Oceanfront. Lulu's Surf Club by Safeway. Good breakfast, pool tables. Fun evenings. There are no plastic bags allowed on Maui. Bring your recycled bags. Take the trail from Ritz Carlton to D.C. Fleming beach. Beautiful. Roy's is moving to the Kaanapali Golf Course on Kaanapali Parkway. Finally final note: Thank you to Sulin Aipa for your making things right this year. You are a godsend. Allen and Joy Sellers

Reviews.Title: “Think twice about ownership at this place!”
Reviews.Author: gdines
Reviews.Content: Well, for those thinking about buying a timeshare here, don't waist your time requesting a particular building or floor, they put you where they want and there is no changing.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with 3 young boys”
Reviews.Author: Doc T
Reviews.Content: They loved the pirate water play park and easy access to beach. concierge was helpful and without long lines. kids club was great as well. grocery store nearby, almost walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be!!”
Reviews.Author: Terri W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a stay at The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas and to say I was disappointed is an understatement! We had stayed there 6 years ago when the property was fairly new and thought it would be the same quality vacation that we had on that trip, not the case. We received a room in building 4 (one of the older buildings in the "South" section of the property), our view was the top of a palm tree, and the hotel drive up entry. The bathroom had mold on the ceiling and the room over all was looking VERY worn. We decided to stay there and take advantage of one of those great American Express travel deals (BIG MISTAKE) and were constantly being hounded by the concierge to come and talk about their property and to schedule an appointment to look at some larger units at the property in hopes of us purchasing a time share. I had advised the concierge who had contacted me several times before our arrival that this is our vacation and we want to do nothing but rest and relax unfortunately this was not the case. We will not be staying at this Westin property again and will definitely not be taking advantage of any American Express travel "deals" again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: pd2think
Reviews.Content: If you do not object to a room overlooking the parking lot or exceptionally poor service, this may be the resort for you! The units are fine, but far from luxurious (think about a slight upgrade over Marriott Courtyard). The service, however, has been remarkably disappointing...as have the failures by management in service recovery. As Starwood owners, we are quite disappointed. Next time, we are returning to the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “First of more stays at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas”
Reviews.Author: messymoose
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to this Westin property and it won't be our last. We received top notch service from the moment we drove up to the lobby until the moment we left. When we arrived we actually drove to the South Villas as we were unsure as to what property we were staying at. The valet employee quickly checked for us and informed us that we were staying at the North Villas, so we went there. We were greeted by Tosh with a big smile and he quickly went to work loading up all of our groceries we had purchased as well as our luggage while we checked in. We were in our room barely 5 minutes when Moo knocked on our door to deliver our luggage and groceries. Moo was extremely helpful, putting away groceries, filling us in with information about the property, giving us tips about things to do, just a very kind man. We booked an island view studio so I was kind of expecting to look over the parking lot but to my surprise we were placed in building 5, fifth floor overlooking the kids (pirate ship) pool. We didn't have kids with us so I was a bit concerned that it may be too noisy, but it wasn't at all! It turned out to be a nice room location and we were not bothered by any excessive activity or noise whatsoever. And you can't beat the HEAVENLY BED!! I swear this is the biggest reason I love Westin's, the BED! I actually bought a heavenly bed for home so when I travel and stay at a Westin there is no transition! The outdoor BBQ's are a great addition to vacation cooking, we used the BBQ's 3-4 times during our 7 day stay and it was perfect. The property is very well taken care of, extremely clean, well manicured lawns, just a beautiful setting. We took advantage of the boardwalk between our hotel and the Aston Maui Villas were our friends were staying next door, nice walk, the pathway is lit at night for your safety but the lighting stops as soon as you leave the Westin grounds of course. We signed up for an outrigger canoe trip through the concierge and it was awesome! Guides were extremely friendly, we left right from our beach so no need to drive to our excursion. We saw many many whales on our canoe trip, got close to a few, but not too close! The whales were extremely active during our entire trip, in fact, the day before we left we were treated to a very up close encounter when two smaller whales made their way extremely close to shore. They casually swam by us in very shallow water approximately 20-30 feet off the beach, very unusual and it was a bit concerning for many people as they thought they may beach themselves, but they didn't, they just swam by very slowly and gave everyone some great picture and video shots! We will be back for sure and I highly recommend this property to anyone travelling as a couple, group, with kids, whatever the type of travel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We would do this again, it grew on us.”
Reviews.Author: dlstew
Reviews.Content: I first wished for a better view, a closer to beach location, but as each day passed and we enjoyed our view of the beach, with Molikai the distance and the whales jumping, we loved our location. After breakfast, and then a walk along the great beach boardwalk, we were able to snorkle each day from in front of our unit with great fish viewing. We took the shuttle to the Sheraton, one day to snorkel there and it was good, but not better that @ Westin. If you want a great walk, but not all of your energy, take the free shuttle to the Westin property beyond the Sheraton, and walk the beach walk back to the Westin Villas. We loved eating @ Aloah Mixed Plate. We actually ate there several times because everything we had was great and reasonable.Great relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “30th Anniversary in Maui”
Reviews.Author: ASUParent
Reviews.Content: Luxury in paradise! To celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary Fran and I took a one week trip to Maui by trading Westin Kierland, AZ time share unit for a stay at the Westin Kaanapali during January. The weather, island travel, the ocean, and the food were all fantastic! Staying at the Westin in Kaanapali was a dream! The Westin looks for every way to please and being situated on one of the prime beaches in Hawaii made it truly spectacular. During breakfast on our first day we were able to spot whales a mile off shore flipping fins and on occasion breaching ... what a start. Later that week we went out whale watching and got much closer. We did not have an ocean view from our room more of an "island side" view but the inside of the suite was well appointed, quiet and we made many of our meals there. Being in Kaanapali made it tough to get to the East side of the island and back in a day but we did it and although our time was limited the sights and side trips on the "Road to Hana" were spectacular. The Westin is well situated to take in all the activities on the island's West side. Next time we go back it will be to the Westin for sure but maybe an extra day to stay on the East side to do more hiking.

Reviews.Title: “Massive resort”
Reviews.Author: Norcalrjg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom ocean view suite in late January. The rooms are spacious and pretty well equipped. The resort reached out to us before our arrival asking if we had any special requests. I thought it was a nice touch at the time and we requested a quiet room near family members we were traveling with. We were placed in rooms two floors apart at the end of the North tower closest to the highway. Of course we were told the resort was fully booked when we inquired about other rooms. Our buildiing (1 of 8) seemed to be only half full at most. We never used the lanai or left the slider open during or stay because of the traffic noise. But the ocean view was still beautiful - as long as we didn't look to the right where the highway is. Overall, an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Georgeous resort!”
Reviews.Author: trhb
Reviews.Content: I'm an glad we stayed here, so I know to bring my kids back! This is a 5 star resort for families! It is ok for couples as well; I would prefer the Ritz without kids ! The grounds are georgeous and the beach is fabulous with the best snorkeling I have seen ( water needs to be calm to do this ). The whales were breaching about a 1/4 mile away! There were not swarms of kids, when we were there 1/29-2/4, the North pool was pretty quiet and pool side service was great! Westin put the pirate pool in its own coutryard, so out of site, out of mind! I am not a huge fan of the Kaanapali strip, but I loved the location on the North Kaanapali-- quieter and not congested!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Lousy Weather In December”
Reviews.Author: Soxpacker
Reviews.Content: We are owners at The Westin Lagunamar Cancun and decided to trade a week in Maui. We were contemplating Maui or the Bahamas and figured December weather might be an issue in either, but in Maui at least with a rental car we could explore the island. The resort was beautiful, with coy ponds, and beautiful grounds. Snorkeling right at the beach at the resort was tremendous! We stayed in the North resort on the top floor facing the ocean, it was beautiful! Only problem was it was quite windy most days, and the last three days was overcast and rained 2 days straight! Luckally we rented a Jeep and one day went to Hana, and traveled all the way around the island. Another day we north to Ka'apalua it was beautiful. I would highly recommend renting a jeep. We ate at a lot of great restaurants all over the island. Our favorites were: Ululani's Shave Ice, Aloha Mixed Plate, Tasty Crust Restaurant(in Wailuku, unbelievable banana mac pancakes, with cocanut syrup!). Star Noodle, in Lahaina, phenominal. Paia Fish Market was awesome. Lahaina Grill, delicious but very expensive..$200 easy.

Reviews.Title: “Maui-velous resort for families and couples”
Reviews.Author: vagabondshoes
Reviews.Content: Believe it or not, but we won a few nights stay at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas through a contest! We've been to Maui the previous year and the whole family loved it, so we added a few more nights to our stay. When we checked-in, our luck continued, because they upgraded us from a studio to a one-bedroom suite. This was very nice! The accommodation is first rate that's on par with other 4-5 star suite hotels. We felt quite pampered. The kids have of course been spoiled rotten and will never expect anything less! We loved all three main swimming pools and the beautiful beach. All the staff at the resort we're very helpful and friendly. We liked the place so much, we bought a timeshare!

Reviews.Title: “Best place on Maui”
Reviews.Author: StarWatcher
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott time share members and were able to book a stay at the Westin Villas. It is now our favorite place! We always stayed in Kapalua in the past and loved it there. But the Westin is just amazing. We stayed in Sept. 2011 and are going back in Sept. 2012. It is peaceful, beautifully kept, very clean, the staff are super nice and helpful. My husband has a high stress job and he was able to completely relax. The beach is nice, clean, and not crowded (at least not in Sept. I don't know about summer time). The amenities, the pool, the room. We put in for a studio just to be able to get into the resort and they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom unit when we arrived. Really nice. Everything is up to date decor. The outdoor dining by the pool was great, but the fancy restaurant over by the newer condos was just ok. We went to other restaurants on the island for variety. We LOVED our stay and will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Four years - four visits”
Reviews.Author: amjj32
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to the Westin and we've enjoyed every one. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The variety in the pools means that we always have something new to explore and the beach is just perfect. We always get an Ocean View room, but were quite disappointed on this visit. It was a first floor "Ocean View" room, though you could only see the ocean if you were on the lanai and standing on a chair. Perhaps when the resort opened it was ocean view, but it definitely isn't any longer. After a few visits down to the front desk to discuss the problem, we talked Mylin who said she would see what she could do. Since we were renters, our request to move was processed only after the owners. At 10pm that night, she called to tell us that she had gotten us a room that she thought we'd really like. Fortunately, she was right! We spent the rest of our trip in a lovely Ocean View room. I'm still thankful that she was able to help us - it really saved our trip. As always, the service continued to be wonderful. We're looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Kylaco01
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay. We had a room with an ocean view, which we were able to see both sunrise and sunset everyday! Our room was always cleaned, nothing thrown away just organized for us. Everyone was so helpful and nice! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Units 6253 - 6254”
Reviews.Author: jayckgb
Reviews.Content: Overall a fantastic experience in terms of the property, service and cleanliness. Our unit location for the North tower was perfect, close to the pool, close to the parking lot (with a 7 month old that is important. Service during business hours second to none, the service from the Graveyard shift front desk staff was less desirable. They were surly and uninformed. What do you expect for those times of day I guess. Pools were a bit cold, the pool in the south tower was way better with Waterslide, nice kid area. Kids pool was ok but chilly, quite shady. Tennis facilities were great. All in all a great stay. We booked through mauiholiday.com who claim to have a deal with Westin Villas which I was able to confirm through Hotwire. About 20% in savings.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here having booked an ocean view room under their "sunsational promotion" which is advertised to include a room upgrade. Well when we checked in, they said they were "fully committed" and that there was no upgrade available. (Sounds like false advertising to me) We were then given a room that overlooked a parking lot, with the balcony covered by a large tree. When we went back to the front desk change the room, the lady was impatient and she urged us to keep the room, but after I protested, then she got us into an ocean view room that overlooked the pool. The room was nice, and had a nice view, but you could hear the traffic from the main highway as the property is closer to the highway that the older properties off Kaanapali Parkway. The customer service at this hotel is terrible. Never use their concierge service-- they totally misbooked our whale watching trip and when I called to speak to the manager of the concierge service, she put me on hold 3 times, each for more than 10 times, never speaking to me when I called. I finally had to call the hotel manager, speaking to a Sue Lin there, and then finally the concierge manager called me back. The staff at this hotel doesn't care about their customers. They seem like they would rather be somewhere else than taking care of their customers. I will never stay at a Westin property again if I have other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: Snowlover81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as "guests" of my sister, who had just purchased a time-share through Starwood. We knew the stay included a time-share sales meeting of 90 minutes but felt it was worth it to get the nightly rate that accompanied it. The first few nights we stayed in a studio sized room that faced the parking lot. It was nice but smaller than I had hoped for. I like to have a kitchen when I travel because of our kids, the refridgerator was dorm size. After a few nights we moved to a one bedroom, ocean view room. Loved having the kitchen and washer-dryer in the room. Room service was fine. The resort grounds were amazing and the snorkeling out in front of the hotel wasn't bad. One night, there was a rude, rowdy group of 20 years olds in the pool, swearing and scaring off kids. When I challenged them to watch their language, they started to verbally harass me. I think they probably came in off the beach and were not guests there. If you purchase food, stop at Costco near the airport, much better prices. It's true, the grocery store prices are outrageous. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great property”
Reviews.Author: sherretzm_shop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North villas and really enjoyed our time there. Lots of whales, nice pools and fun activities. The food wasn't so good at the pool bars and even French fries wasn't possible for them! Cheesy happ hour too. Just 2 hours long and only $2 reduction on beer or selected(very small selection) cocktails. Great place to stay with great BBQ grills, so buy what you need or want and cook it yourself or visit the locate area and try their fare. We love BBQ and the Safeway was only minutes away, so we BBQ'd almost every night. Except for visits to Famous Dave's and The Plantation Restaurants. O ly bad report is their lack of adequate parking. They have spaces for all the cars, the problem is they are only wide enough for compact cars. Big problem for a resort that thinks they are first class!!!!! Choose the smallest rental you can fit into or never leave your parking space once you find one. Quiet enough to relax in but still there's enough activities to keep the entire family happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GeneB4
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious but dated from the 1980's. The hotel is very clean and the people are exceptionally nice. There is a separate adult pool and it's own bar so there are opportunities to socialize as a family in the large recreational pools or the separately, quiet, adult pool. The beach walk allows easy access to the next door shopping and restaurants at Whalers Village. The only negatives were the dated decor and the fact that half the rooms face away from the ocean with no peek through opportunities anywhere on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “The complete package and a great value”
Reviews.Author: JNBChicago
Reviews.Content: The Villas are great when you want to get the best value for your vacation buck. Each unit has a kitchen and washer and dryer so you can save on dining costs and travel light. We usually had breakfast in the room and watched the whales do their thing right in front of our unit. Saw a lot more families this year because it is so family friendly. Staff very friendly and helpful. The only drawback is that the Villas are right off Rt 30 and so you can get road noise if you are on the upper floors. Even though the rooms are heavily used, they are kept in good shape. If at all possible, get the one bedroom rather than the studio. We stayed in both and felt a little tight in the studio. Plan on using the outdoor grills, great way to meet people and socialize.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelAL0t
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this resort a couple weeks ago. Overall we really liked it there...very well maintained and clean resort. Pros: Very clean rooms. Kitchens with all the needed utensils. Beautiful grounds. Nice walking trails to Whalers Village. Free Shuttles. Ample amount of parking. Grills on site. Great for families. Cons: Beach out front is nice but isn't a great swimming beach. Front Desk staff could be a little more friendly. No hospitality suite. Most flights leave at night so not having a hospitality suite with a child was a huge negative and would probably prevent me from returning. Checkout was at 10....we had no where to let our daughter take a nap and using the locker room showers was less than ideal. Every time we have stayed in Hawaii we have always at least had access to a hospitality suite for an hour to get cleaned up before our long return home. So like I said it was a really great stay definitely the nicest place we have stayed at in Maui, but with the early checkout and no hospitality suite I can't say we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, beautiful property, rooms & beach!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this resort twice in the past three years, and it is my #1 choice to go for a Hawaiian holiday. We've also been to the big island and Oahu, but this is my favorite place by far. The resort is wonderful! Big enough to feel luscious, small enough that you're not hiking to the pool. Their kids pool is amazing: a pirate ship with slides, wheels, spouts, etc all within a shallow kid pool, set away from the main pools as not to bother adults with screaming kids. :) We LOVE the one bedroom room and felt it was a great option for our family of four. This is a very clean resort and the maid service is awesome! We do not have vacation ownership here, and like it better that way as we get daily maid service when we stay. The kitchen is very well equipped to cook if you so desire. We stock up at costco across from the airport on the way to the resort so we can make some breakfasts and lunches. The beach that this resort sits on is beautiful!! You don't have to go anywhere else to enjoy perfect white sand. We will definitely be back to this resort in the future, hopefully many times!

Reviews.Title: “The very best location.”
Reviews.Author: JDub2011
Reviews.Content: I keep going back. Been to 5 of the Hawaiin Islands this is the best and best location.

Reviews.Title: “Amongst the best”
Reviews.Author: Sbain76
Reviews.Content: This place is very, very good. I want to just note what I believe makes this place exceptional. All hotels give you a place to sleep and almost everywhere in Maui has a pool so those don't differentiate. 1) three pools, all great and clean and nicely decorated. One with water slide and one for kids with a pirate ship. At least two spas. The only improvement would be to have an "adults only" area. 2). Housekeeping is very good and everything is very clean. I believe in high end little things make or break. In this case, a "make" was the fact my wife needed femine products unexpectedly and they delivered them to our room. Also another person in our party hurt their foot and security was extremely helpful fixing her up and rendering first aid. 3). Location is ok but not in the heart of Kaanapali so almost everything off resort requires a drive. Not a ton of reasons to leave though. 4) the units have full kitchens so we hit Costco and bought $500 worth of food. The bell hops had rubber bins and unloaded our entire vehicle and hauled it all to our room. Nice touch. All in all, amongst my favorites and although pricey in many ways worth the money, and I don't say that much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: pawsthebest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite at the Villas. I have to say this was one of the biggest most beautiful suites I have ever stayed in! Really spacious, big kitchen with full cooking area, washer and dryer and the bathroom was enormous with a jacuzzi, big separate shower and a private area for the toilet. The grounds were beautifully kept and very clean, parking was free and free wifi as well. The actual people staying here are a bit snobbish but the staff was very nice and friendly. The only thing you have to be careful of is the beach in back of the property. It is has a lot of reef and you don't know until you actually take a few steps into the water. Myself and my boyfriend cut our feet pretty badly several times just getting in and out of the water. We ended up having to move down quite a ways to avoid the reef since there were a lot of waves and we couldn't control where we stepped because the waves knocked us around a bit since the water was rough. It would help if there was a sign warning guests about this. Other than that we enjoyed the resort very much and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice for hotels on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Mcfogwell
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property Great location Attentive staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this resort and we all had a good time. It is far from any of the towns, so a car rental is helpful to get around. Kids playground was great. My husband swam with turtles on the beach. Good food. Would definately go back with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: HawaiigirlDelaware
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Westin North Villas. This was a Getaway through Interval International. We were in a one bedroom unit in Building 7, 4th floor. As other people have mentioned, you do have some traffic noise from this building. You only heard it while out on the lanai and even then it wasn't that bad most of the time. Even though we were in one of the buildings farthest from the ocean, we still had a pretty good view of the ocean. The two room unit was clean and very well equipped with everything you would need. We only had one minor maintenance issue and it was fixed almost immediately. The staff seemed very friendly and helpful and they didn't bug you about buying a timeshare unit. We only received one call asking if we would be interested and that was it. The pool area was ok but the pools were not heated and pretty cold in January. The beach seemed clean but not that big in front of the Westin North. Great walking/jogging path right near the ocean. We did not eat at the Westin but many restaurants close buy. Duke's at the Honua Kai is a short walk and is wonderful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place if you have kids and like to go to bed early.”
Reviews.Author: vettegirl1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the resort after stopping at Costco. We were greeted by a friendly front desk person who upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. We were there on the timeshare package they offer which was an excellent deal. The room was large with a huge kitchen, large bathroom with spa tub, and windows galore. We had a nice view of Lanai and the Sugarcane Train was across the street. The downside was the pool area was full of kids, I have seen this many children at at Disney Resort. Kind of surprised for early December. Also there was no lightlife at all, as everything closes early. We did listen to the timeshare presentationf or the extra resort credit, but it didn't make sense to us so of course we didn't buy. This place is lovely but I would not return, as we prefer Oahu.

Reviews.Title: “1st week in our Villa. Loved the larger 1 bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoNancy
Reviews.Content: Tosh is an outstanding Bellman. Rob is great as a concierge. We got very good service from Jason K at the front desk & Lee in engineering was terrific!! Ocean front is memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Seven years at the same place!”
Reviews.Author: ron60878
Reviews.Content: We have celebrated our anniversary there for the last seven years.......may there be many more. Always great to get there right after the Christmas celebrations and relax. Everytime we arrive it is like seeing old friends again. Greeted by Danny one of the bellman, Asesa (sp?) who always remembers us and makes sure we have enough to eat and drink at the pool and Tina the shuttle driver who gives the extra effort at picking you up at the grocery store. These are just a few of the staff who work so hard to make your stay memorable. Not to be forgotten is Nancy on the concierge staff who went above and beyond the call of duty to help us at the start of this years trip. No other place we visit each year have such long term staff.........must be a great place to work as well as visit! Ron & Susie

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views and comfort”
Reviews.Author: kstar54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas North in early January (stayed 5 nights at Sheraton Maui first; please see separate review). We are Starwood owners and used staroptions for a 2-bedroom unit. We had requested an oceanfront unit as it was our anniversary celebration; even though requests are difficult to accommodate, we were more than pleasantly surprised with the unit we were assigned! We were in building 5, 6th floor and had the most spectacular view of the ocean! It was better than anything I could have imagined. We've stayed in these villas before, but our unit during an earlier stay didn't have much of a view- this one was terrific. The unit itself was what we expected: clean, well-furnished, and convenient with the appliances. A friend stayed in the studio side of the villa and was very pleased with the room and facilities. We did not have much noise from others, except once being able to hear people talking in the bathroom of the villa next to us. Service was very good. Since we were out golfing every day, we didn't make much use of the restaurants. We did go to the sports bar a couple times- the hamburgers were pretty good. No fries, though, which are always a nice/guilty treat after golfing! We used the valet parking- great service. We want to give very special recognition to Toshi. He managed to handle 3 large golf travel bags and 5 suitcases with ease- from getting them from our rooms to loading them in the mid-size SUV. His service was the best we have ever had at any hotel or resort. Really cannot say enough about him! Our Starwood experiences have sometimes been less than acceptable, but our stays at the Sheraton and Westin VILLAS resorts on Maui convinced us that our ownership is a good value. We will certainly measure all future Starwood stays agains these two superb experiences.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lily v
Reviews.Content: Really loved it there.We were there in november for 6 nights and we loved it.Beautiful property inside and out and so convenient ,relaxing and classy. We had a studio on the 5th or 6th floor which was big enough for the 2 of us.Having a washer and dryer was really convenient.The cleaning was great although i have to say those white floor tiles don't make it easy for the cleaning crew. Had dinner at the italian restaurant on the property as well as the casual one by the pool{ocean} i think and bothwere very good.Our best meal was at the westin resort and spa,an easy walk from the villas The location is great and the free shuttle to whalers village,lahaina and sheraton is certainly convenient.The beach is super. All employees were friendly and helpful and it was hard to leave.Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the service”
Reviews.Author: Cmrooo
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui several times and I must say the service and attention we received here at the Westin Villas has been top notch. I had a small incident during one of our beach walks and everyone from the building 3 concierge to the security people were so helpful and attentive. John Dair with security not only came back to the room with a bag of ice but he called the next day to see how I was doing. They only thing that keeps me from giving this place five stars is that the views from many of the rooms are just ok. That said we plan on staying here again and can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids...but we didn't bring any...”
Reviews.Author: mogabs
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Maui and we had a great time at the Westin Villas. The rooms are timeshare units, so all have a good sized kitchen/kitchenette -- we took advantage of this by stopping at the Costco right by the airport, which I would highly recommend. We decided to get lounge chairs at Costco for the beach (which was worth it) and snorkels (which was not worth it -- you can rent snorkels for $35 for the week at the Westin; the adult snorkels were $42 at Costco). The Westin property is split into a North property (newer and all rooms have an outdoor lanai) and the South property (older and basic rooms don't have outdoor space), which each have seperate reception and parking areas. I would call the day before you arrive to determine if your room is in the North or South property, as we parked and dragged our stuff to the South reception, only to be told we were due at the North reception. Not a big deal, but would have been nice to know. The room itself was large and the property was well maintained, though be advised that because its a timeshare property, the rooms don't get cleaned everyday. There are a number of different pools and lots of kids, though the large group of lounge chairs closest to the beach by the restaurant/bar seemed to be the quietest with the best sun. My one complaint would be the lounge chairs themselves, which were very uncomfortable. We ate at the restaurant on the property, which had large portions and was generally good, but I'd also recommend walking up the beach boardwalk (its lit all the way) about 8 minutes to the Duke's restaurant, which had great seafood and a nice bar. Overall, this is a great family resort, and I'd definitely come back with the family, but probably not the best place if you're looking for a quiet couples trip.

Reviews.Title: “Back again and still loving the place!”
Reviews.Author: maromatic
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to this property..and by no means my last! This time is without kids..takes on a whole new light. Searched out adult pool this morning...tucked way in back by building 8. No much sun exposure if any...and not very inviting. Will opt to sun at one of the many other watering holes. Again, booked through Costco Travel. After many, many hours of research, Costco Travel by far has the BEST packages. With all the extras that they include...it's a steal! My room is on the 6th floor, which is the highest floor in the building. The room is located several floors up from the lobby in the tower where Pulehu restaurant is located. Room 6650 looks straight out over the pool with a view of the ocean. Lovely! Quiet location..priceless! Had dinner at Pailolo last night....the sports bar at the property. Very casual menu, burgers, nachos, hotdogs...etc. My $16 hamburger was good...large patty with nice fresh produce and a sizable bun...of which I opted to eat only the bottom portion. Live (loud) music was being played. Turning the volume down would have been much nicer...as it was hard to hear my table mate speak over the man singing. My room, one bedroom, is as awesome as it was the last stay. This time I am not at a room by the kiddie Pirate pool. When strolling by the Pirate pool this morning on the way to breakfast, I noticed the new addition of a play structure on the lawn adjacent to the Pirate pool. Very cool! That has been added since our visit in April 2011. Seems a few basketball hoops have been mounted along the side of several of the pools. Also nice to have options while enjoying the pools. Excited to be here and look forward to planning visit #4 to this property. ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Honeymoon Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aliobaba
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended!! We stayed at the Westin Villas North January 3 - 10, 2012 and were absolutely happy with the experience start to finish. Between us we had over 100 hotel night last year for business and we are huge Starwood fans and this totally met our expectations. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite, and greeted with champagne and cookies for our honeymoon. Very nice touch! From the valet to concierge to the towel hut to the restaurants the service was very attentive and friendly. The yoga was fun and relaxing, every restaurant on the resort was great, and the shuttle to the Whalers Village was very convenient. Best part is that you can charge dinners at other Starwood resorts to your room - more points!
