There were a lot of families, but with four pools, the beach and the children's pool it was still relaxing and romantic for us as a couple. We would absolutely come back again with friends, by ourselves or with a family. It was so hard to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: CAL32
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past and this last trip was even better. We were upgraded to a one bedroom which made the trip complete. The overall staff from front desk to the Bell people and the concierge were unbelieveable. They took care of us and treated our two year old like a king. This is a must stay for families with kids as they have a kids pool and many activities set-up for them. Overall, the room was great and the property is big with lots to do. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice property, suite not Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: yr66
Reviews.Content: We were there during the Christmas holidays so the hotel was quite busy, but service in general was still good (didn't run out of pool towels or anything). Our "oceanview" one bedroom suite just had a "peek-a-boo" view of the ocean in between buildings when you look on the patio, so it was somewhat disappointing. We had stayed at the other Westin Maui Resort and Spa before and loved it, so decided to try this one. The layout of that property allowed for rooms with true ocean front view. Our "heavenly bed" was bumpy and the sofabed caved into the middle. The shower wasn't "heavenly" either with the dual shower heads like the other property, although the jacuzzi bathtub was great. The kitchen was very basically equipped and we had problems with the fridge's ice-maker. They're all small things and didn't really interfere with our enjoyment of the suite; it's just that we've expected better given the high rate and past great experience with other Westin suites. The beach in front of the property was great for snorkeling (we swam with sea turtles) but watch out for sharp coral/rocks. Their pools were also nice, but best for families with younger children, say 8 and under. My kids, 10 & 13, were more interested in riding the waves on the beach. Overall a good stay, but we prefer the other Westin Maui property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - quality resort - high prices”
Reviews.Author: Victoriagurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a garden suite (Queen & pull-out sofa) with our two boys 13 & 9. Our room had no view but we weren't too upset, we weren't in Hawaii to sit inside. The room was facing the main driveway into the resort and toward the highway but the windows provide complete silence. There was ZERO hallway noise as there is a main door to two separate suites blocking any noise you might get. The room was well-appointed with everything a small family could need for a week at the beach. I cannot tell you enough how handy the washer & dryer are when you are swimming and playing all day with kids! Tip the housekeeping staff to ensure well-stocked sundries. The only issue we had was the set-up with the washroom. It is divided between the bedroom with slated french doors and when one uses the washroom in the night, there is only one main light for the room which wakes everyone up. The toilet is in a separate room but it all runs on the same light for the entire washroom. We stocked the kitchen and used it to its' fullest potential. From the Westin & Sheraton there is a free shuttle that will take you to Lahaina (the driver will tell drop you off right at a supermarket) and you can shop reasonably to stock your kitchen. There is also a small fruit market directly across the highway from the resort - we bought a pineapple at day! The small shop in the South tower is well stocked but totally overpriced. This is where you can get your lattes in the morning (small line-up...expensive). We never rented a car while here - the shuttle took us everywhere we needed/wanted to go and it is free (tip the drivers). The pools are great, the pool bar at the South Tower is friendly and the happy hour decent enough but the food is only mediocre however the breakfast buffet is worth it. Eat late and it lasts you most of the day! Use the public BBQ if you can - great dinner al fresco. Bring your own snorkle gear! Trust me on this one. We brought ours and the best snorkeling in Maui is directly off the resort's main beach. Black Rock has nothing on the snorkeling here but to rent is ridiculously expensive! You get towel "cards" at the front desk and you exchange your towels daily - if you lose a towel its' $15. We tried to book a trip with a concierge (they are everywhere!) but when I thought I was asking questions, he thought he was booking and a family catamaran trip came to over $540 and I was presented a bill. When I explained the misunderstanding he got snotty and gave me real attitude. Left a bad taste in my mouth. Check the public notice boards for all the free things - Lei making - Ukelele lessons - Snuba lessons. Well worth it and a great experience. The Pulehu restaurant is nice, great ambiance, good food but totally overpriced for a place with paper napkins. Make a reservation. If you are a runner - get up early and run the boardwalk South through all the other hotels and you can make your way to Whaler's Village and back. It is a windy, indirect path but keep the water to your right and you will be fine. Loved the resort however one is misguided if you think the name Villa implies there are actual Villas - I am not sure what they were thinking on this one. The resort seemed ideal for all types of vacationers - with kids, families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: cpmurphyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Villas in October and would highly recommend. We are a family of 2 adults, 2 kids (ages 8 and 9) and stayed in a 1 bedroom in the south tower. Our friends stayed in the north tower so we were able to compare both buildings. You really can't go wrong with either one so don't analyze it too much. Their north tower room was newer and the furnishings a bit more "hip" but our south tower room was way bigger and was furnished just fine. The south tower has the pool with the slide. The north tower has the more relaxed pool. Both are easy to walk to so don't sweat it. Our unit had a washer/dryer which came in handy so no need to bring much clothes for the family. The kitchen is so nice to have. Like everyone says, stock up at Costco when you arrive. We ate most breakfasts and lunches in our condo and would go out for dinner. We never did bbq on the grills but we say lots of people doing that and we thought it looked like a great idea. I just never made it to a grocery store after our initial Costco run! We booked through mauihawaiivacations.com and thought we got a great rate - around $379/night. Not bad for Maui! If and when we do return to Maui we would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: scvgal
Reviews.Content: This was our first family stay at the Westin Kaanapali Villas. We stayed in the North building in a two bedroom lock off. As usual, the Westin is excellent and exactly what you expect down to the lighted vanity mirror in every resort. The beach is beautiful and clean and we even spotted whales off the coast as we relaxed under our umbrella in the sand. We are Starwood owners (not at this property however) and were still upgraded to ocean view. We want to return again as it was just an wonderful vacation. Do remember that it is free valet parking for the first 24 hours, which makes a check-in with luggage and groceries that much easier. Plentiful self-parking after that. You have to ask for robes if you desire one, and paying for an umbrella and chair on the beach is a must. They do whisk the setup away promptly at 4 with not much apology, but know your beach comfort ends at 4....Just a few tips to help you anticipate and enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Gigglysunshine
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now. The first time we were fortunately enough to successfully trade our timeshare into the 2 bedroom suite at the North building. We had a view of the pirate ship children's pool with partial ocean almost a "peek a boo" view if we looked to the far left we could see a little bit of the water. This was called a partial ocean view room. But a great view nonetheless. We attended the timeshare presentation and did not purchase a unit at that point so we instead bought the explorer package that would allow us to come back within 18 months and stay at the property again. We watched the outdoor movie that was set up right by the beach at the tip of the property. It was beautiful. Many people moved beach chairs from around the pool to the lawn and watched the movie. Bring some beach towels from the suite or maybe a small blanket. It's a little chilly at night by the beach, but the setup was perfect. When we returned the second time, we had our 8 month old with us. The property was perfect for families. Although this time we only had the studio suite, it was enough for us to stay. Our baby wasn't old enough for any of the kids activites, but we could see there was a kids recreation centre so maybe when we go back in a couple of years, we will get to review that. We ate at the poolside cafe where they have happy hour between 4-6pm, and appies were on a discount. it made the food quite affordable. We took the free shuttle to Lahaina and Whalers Village. It was especially convenient to shuttle to Whalers Village because parking is quite expensive there otherwise. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recoemmend this beautiful property to couples and families alike!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a beautiful beach.”
Reviews.Author: Kasa05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and we would stay there again. The rooms were lovely -- we had a studio which was a nice size and perfect for our needs. The balcony was very small, though. The pool complexes are very nice and we were always able to find chairs (although not always in the shade). The complimentary shuttle is very convenient, although not always timely. The hotel location is wonderful -- Kaanapali beach is GORGEOUS!

Reviews.Title: “Traffic and sirens not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Keri C
Reviews.Content: Seems to be a lovely resort- valets, bellmen, and our concierge, Nancy, were all very pleasant and helpful. However, we are quite disappointed by our room in Building 4, which faces the parking lot and highway. On our first visit to Hawaii, this is not what we anticipated. We were looking forward to a view of lush tropical grounds and the relaxing sounds of birds. Since the room has a fully equipped kitchen, we anticipated making a few dinners and eating them al fresco. Instead, we are looking at a parking lot and listening to the roar of traffic going by and, last night, the sirens of fire engines. Not exactly the ambience we were hoping for. We just spoke with Ivan at the front desk and were told that there are no rooms available for us to relocate to. Suffice it to say, we are extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation ruined by timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: RunFar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Starwood owners in Maui and love the Westin Kaanapali villas. We bought a one bedroom when the Westin first opened and we were staying at the Sheraton. The grounds and villas are always so well maintained and we enjoy the suggestions of the concierges no matter how many years we have come to Maui. This year we had the pleasure of being greeted by Julia who made dinner reservations for us and sent us to some new locations. We watched 2 football games at the Pailolo Bar & Grill. The food was surprisingly good, and the service excellent. I would love to give this review 5 stars, but our timeshare presentation not only prevented that, but really ruined what was a perfect vacation. Each year we meet with a different individual, some better than others, but this time we met with a woman (I believe her name was Stephie) who really frustrated us. She yawned at least a dozen times and no matter how politely we said we weren't interested in purchasing at this time, she didn't stop. She even brought in another woman to pressure us further. When I mentioned about banking this year and doing 2 weeks the next, she laughed and said I'd probably end up with a room that faces the parking lot instead of our partial ocean view. I was almost in tears when we left. Last year the gentleman we met with showed us new Westin properities, gave us some helpful suggestions and planned a future vacation for us. When we left I filled out a comment card and asked the manager to contact me. I left my number and email address and since it has been 2 months and no response, I wrote this review.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE and VERY HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: Koreanguy_12
Reviews.Content: It was only a day trip to Maui but the hotel itself was the best of the best in Hawaii. Nice kitchen area and the laundry in the room!! Neat. Nice pool and great beach around the hotel!!! I lost my cell during my checkout in the hotel and the staff found it and sent it kindly to my home in Korea. Thank YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding vacation resort for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: l s
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas for many years. As soon as you walk into the lobby of this resort you can feel your tension and stress melting away. The location (beachfront) is amazing, the rooms are spectacular, but most importantly the staff is professional, courteous, and always there to make your trip even more special. There is one particular front desk manager, Temoana Folaumoeloa, who is just wonderful to deal with. She has helped us to create some amazing memories at the resort. Unlike a lot of the resorts on the island, this resort has multiple restaurants that serve everything from hamburgers/hot dogs to elegant sea food and steak house dishes. A great selection for the adults and the kids. The other thing that you will notice at this resort is that you are not packed in like sardines. So many of the hotels crowd so many people into the hotel that there is never any room to sit out at the pool, get a dinner reservation or just to walk the grounds. It is located only 4 miles north of the town of Lahaina filled with shops, restaurants and sight seeing activities. We highly recommend that you give the Westin Kaanapoli Ocean Resort Villas a try. It is fantastic. Leonard S.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing- giant sea turtles right at the beach.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineCritic
Reviews.Content: Bed was like heaven- could not be more comfortable. We had a studio and it was perfect for just my husband and I. Room was very nice and open with granite counter tops, kitchen with stove top, all the utensils, plates, cups, silverware and even a cutting board with knifes, a microwave, full sized fridge and freezer. The property has lots of gas BBQ grills around the property for guests to use, so no need to bring charcoal. We stopped at the Safeway about 4 miles down the road and picked up pineapple sausage with sweet Hawaiian King Rolls and cooked out- it was better than several of the meals we had in Maui restaurants and half the price. Our room was on the ground floor- I typically donâ€™t care for the ground floor but it was nice to be able to walk outside and use the grills right at our door and walk directly onto the beach. Pools and hot tubs were clean- nice temperature on the hot tubs. You can snorkel right on the beach, they rent the snorkeling gear for $18/day or $35 for the week. I had a giant sea turtle swim up right next to me and it was actually a little scary to have such a giant turtle so close to me that I could touch it. We spent 5 nights at the Westin and then went over to the Ritz Carlton for a night and wish we had stayed all of our nights at the Westin instead- beds are more comfy here and it is much more up to date than the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas - a great family spot”
Reviews.Author: soloZ06
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent. Great Kitchen with every utensil you could think of included. Great balcony that was accessible from the living area or the bedroom. There was a washer and dryer in the room which was awesome! The beach, though not as scenic as on the other side of Black Rock, was less crowded and the snorkeling was great especially with younger children. We tried all of the pools and they were perfect for what we wanted. There was a self-park fee, but that could be offset by limiting the room cleaning. The only downside with staying here was the calls trying to get you to "pick up your free prize" which of course was a carrot to get you to purchase a condo. This was handled easily enough by just deleting the messages. The food was of course pricey, but we usually went to Lahina or ate in the room. I do recommend though that you have at least one breakfast at the Westin Spa and Resort at the Ocean Side seating. The food and view is better than at the Ocean Resort Villas and your breakfast vouchers can be used there as well. All in all a great family vacation and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pool lounging gripe”
Reviews.Author: Alison F
Reviews.Content: Why don't hotels enforce the "no saving lounges" at the pools? Especially during high and peak travel times & seasons? While at Oahu's Wailea, if a pool lounge was empty for an hour, it was cleared off for people - instead of towels & magazines - to enjoy. This past week at Westin's Ocean Villa Resort - where we have traveled to at least 6 previous times but never over the Christmas/New Year's Holiday - we found most lounges were 'taken' by towels & magazines by 9 a.m.! My son & I sat at the pool for over 2 hours surrounded by these saved seats. People will not like having their items confiscated, but tough! If you're not going to enjoy the pool when you come down, then let someone else do so. I am one of those live-by-the-rules person which is why this bugs me....

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep420
Reviews.Content: I will rate it at 3.5 stars out of 5. We had a studio - it was smaller than our expectation. The kitchenette was well stocked with utensils, etc. There are two towers and depending on where your room is, you may have a decent walk to the other tower for breakfast, mini-store, restaurant, etc. The resort is family/kid friendly and the location is good. The beach and pools are all enjoyable - though pools were a little crowded. Wifi was terrible - it was barely usable. Pulehu, the italian restaurant, did not meet our expectations. Both the food and service were quite average. Overall, I think that this property may be a good choice for families with young children otherwise the Westin Resort may be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, terrific service”
Reviews.Author: tony d
Reviews.Content: Though the property is quite large (long walk from room to lobby), this was a terrific value. Large, clean, comfortable room. Huge bathroom. We were there over Christmas and it was far less crowded than we anticipated. The buildings are well back from the beach, so there is virtually no surf sounds in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The beach was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: roger w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a ocean front one bedroom at the end of October. The beach next to Westin ocean resort villas offers one of the best snorkeling spot on Maui. There was beautiful corral with lots of colorful tropical fish. Mom even saw a sea turtle. The beach was not crowded and it was clean. We also enjoyed the helpful advice the staff gave us outside in the pool area. The room was spectacular, with a beach view. The room has a comfy couch bed, a kitchen that has everything we expected, and a big bathroom. The size of the room is very decent and is big enough to make it feel like home. The room service did not respond when we asked for a vase. But I think the kanapali Westin still deserves a thumbs-up. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Westin Kaanapali North Villas”
Reviews.Author: kamilshakra
Reviews.Content: We own an oceanfront timeshare at the Westin Villas North. For the last 5 years we have come to this property in January for 2 weeks and we have had the best services and quality stay everytime. The comforts of the villa (especially the Heavenly beds and jaccuzi tubs are great) and the resort aminities are first class all the way. This year we brought our daughter and son-in-law and our 1 1/2 years old grandson with us. The General Manager of the resort, Angela Nolan went out of her way to accomodate our needs and I can't thank her enough for making our stay at the Westin North Villas a stay to remeber for a life time.

Reviews.Title: “love it love it love it.”
Reviews.Author: icreasor
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this resort, people go out of their way to make sure you are happy. The whole experience was very positive, the restaurant has delicious food all day long. the pools and hot tubs clean, lots of towels everywhere you look. nice cabanas. I am looking forward to go back some day. Shuttle to Lahaina is is free almost every hour.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort”
Reviews.Author: Samson47
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Ocean Resort Villas with a couple of good friends and had a fantastic time. The hospitality on Maui is first rate. We enjoyed the restaurants at the resort and in Lahaina where there is fantastic variety and had a great game of golf on the nearby course. We own a vacation unit at the resort, so may be biased, but recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: JanetWK
Reviews.Content: As a Westin Vacation Owner I had not had the pleasure of staying at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas until this past fall. What a treat! It was all that I expected and more! The check in process was seamless. all through my stay I found the personnel in the lobby area friendly and eager to help, whether it was to simply answer a question, provide directions, or to discuss activities for the week. The rooms are well planned, clean and have all that one needs to vacation: a huge kitchen in the 1 bedroom, with a slightly smaller one in the studio; a washer and dryer in both; a lovely balcony facing the pool and courtyard with a limited view of the ocean from where I was located; very comfortable beds; fabulous shower and tub in a huge bathroom. There is once a week maid service to freshen the room and provide clean linens. The grounds are magnificent with beautiful flowers and trees, a well-manicured lawn area, playground space for young children and the beach and ocean just a few feet from the hotel. There are restaurants on the grounds to satisfy ones needs: the Ocean Pool Bar and Grill is located poolside between the two South towers and is easy for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Pailolo Bar and Grill is located in the North Towers area near a pool; The Pulehu Italian Grill and Cafe sports an outstanding Italian menu and seems to be busy everynight. I came in one night after having eaten in Lahaina and wanted some of their sorbet. There was a long line waiting, but when I told the hostess what I wanted and that I was alone, she accommodated me within minutes. (I was dressed nicely, not in shorts and a T-Shirt like many who were waiting. I have to believe that had something to do with the quick service, as this is a restaurant where one should not come in from the beach or trekking all day and expect to eat.) It was the best sorbet I have had! In addition, there is the General Store and the market where one can buy limited food items as well as sundries and souvenirs. There are programs for everyone at the Westin! Many programs are designed specifically for children, while others appeal to adults only and then for all ages. There was ample room for all programs to be held with out infringing on the space of others. Free shuttle service is provided to the other Starwood properties on the island, to Whaler's Village and to Lahaina, the Cannery and Hilo Hatties. Being an owner, I chatted with the sales staff about the property and the options available. There is no high pressure and they are there to serve. Because I had such a great time, my daughter, son-in-law and I are going back this coming June for a week's stay. We anticipate it will be a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: KweenKayo
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and selected this property for my family based on location, condo amenities, and recommendations of people I know who own there. Well....it was quite simply the worst place I have ever stayed. Not for more upscale travelers with no little kids. The building and setting could be in anywhere USA. No Hawaain feel, charm, or hospitality. Examples: couldn't sit on our balcony as so close to the highway, felt like back in LA...cost $100 for us to sit on beach with chairs and umbrellas per day!!!...pool heater broken so couldn't swim once...17 turns in hallway to get to our room- like a rat's maze...I could go on and on. Checked out and moved to the Ritz Carlton- best thing we ever did! Hoping for a refund of our pre-paid last 3 nights. Also, need to mention....I have never seen so many posted rules everywhere!!! Felt like Big Brother...really appalling.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sarahwinter_11
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this resort. We requested an ocean view and what a beautiful view we had. We watched the humpback whales (pack some binoculars) every morning from the balcony. We (a family with 4 teenagers/young adults) booked a 1 bedroom with attached studio suite. Each suite had a pull-out couch. The studio suite also had a queen size bed. We also requested minimal housekeeping service and for that received 10 coupons for buffet breakfast. Check-in was quick and the staff very friendly and helpfull. We did not use the pool (s) as we preferred the beach. Snorkeling is great right in front of hotel but we also walked to the other side of Black Rock (15 min walk) and it was also great snorkeling. I found the beach very busy on that side of the rock and was glad we had a quieter beach in front of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Plantriptoday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Villas for 4 nights this December. Overall, our experience was very positive. The studio was comfortably furnished and well appointed. The resort itself was quite pleasant - on the beach and the pool was great. The service was very helpful - I requested a different room upon check in and the front desk clerk really worked to make it happen. My only issue with the hotel is that response times tended to be slow. I don't mean to imply that service was slow, rather that sometimes there just didn't seem to be enough staff so there were long hold times on the phone when calling the front desk or housekeeping. Once a person was reached, they were consistently helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb spotless relaxed resort”
Reviews.Author: ald59
Reviews.Content: Third time back to this resort and it only improves each time.The 2 bedroom villas have all the facilities you would want (full kitchen ,laundry spa bathtub outside balcony) and can easily sleep 8.The rooms are spotless and are well maintained.Plenty of activities for kids and watersides/pirate pool for kids,plenty of other pools as well as adult only pools.The big plus is the beach on the resort which within metres off the shoreline you can snorkel and see lots of coloured fish and turtles if you are lucky and in the distance you can see the whales .Even though we were there between xmas and new year it did not seem that busy because of the size of the resort and it is so relaxing . Restaurants are average but there are great places nearby(check trip advisor)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - especially kid-friendly.”
Reviews.Author: undercovert
Reviews.Content: We are SVO owners at the Westin Princeville Ocean Resort Villas and this was our first time to trade and visit the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. We were very impressed. We have small children but did not bring them on this trip. This resort was very kid-friendly with a pirate ship/play area in one of the pools, and a kids entertainment room downstairs in the basement of Bldg. 2. We stayed on the 5th floor of Bldg. 2 and had a great view over the pool to the ocean beyond. The room, grounds, and pool were well-maintained. We stayed in a 1 BR unit and it was fantastic - no complaints. We thought the Italian restaurant on the property was just okay - nice setting, but the food was average, especially for Maui. The other 2 smaller restaurants (one by the pool and the other sports bar at the far end of the property) were both good. Everything is expensive in Maui, so just know that on the front end and expect it. This resort was actually built in 2 phases so if you go on the SVO website, it appears at the Westin Kaanapali and the Westin Kaanapali - North. This confused me at first, but don't be mistaken - these are NOT 2 separate properties. It is all the same thing. They do have 2 separate check-in areas, with a lot of redundant services, but everything flows together seamlessly. You can walk out the front door of one building and go to one set of pools, and go out the back door to another set of pools, or another part of the property. They do have free WiFi, and we were able to pick it up and use it no problem in our room and at the pool. The concierge told us that sometimes the reception was spotty, and maybe it is in different buildings, but we never had any problems. This resort is on the beach which is very nice. There is a very nice and well-maintained boardwalk along the beach. In summary, we were very pleased with the resort and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LMBDOS
Reviews.Content: My family & I just spent a week at the Westin Ka'anapali in Maui (Lahaina) and it was breathtaking. We booked a 2-bedroom villa and got upgraded to an ocean front room. The view was spectacular! Here are the positives about the resort - great location, well appointed rooms (washer, dryer, full kitchen, spa bathtub, balcony, Bose system), great BBQ grills, great amenities. Easy access to the beach, walking trails, great pool activities for kids make it lots of fun. The south villas seem like more fun when we strolled over to that side. The negatives (service was less than stellar at the poolside bar restaurant, only one guy - Hudson was pleasant), the vacation/concierge desk attendants were condescending and only interested in selling vacation ownership plans).

Reviews.Title: “Save our Xmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TAC613
Reviews.Content: We were so grateful to find a fabulous room with a full kitchen and washer and dryer at the Westin Resort in Maui after we left a horrible location (see my other review!). Sharla as the front desk was wonderful and helped us get squared away in the perfect location. The room was spacious and beautiful and the kitchen had everything we needed after our trip to Costco! The pools were so much fun my daughters (age 11 and 14) had a blast! The beach was steps from our room and the snorkeling right off the beach was fantastic!!!! Yes it was windy and a bit rainy- but it never lasted long! Chris and his colleagues at the valet station were a delight and SO helpful! Fish at the pool side bar mixes a mean drink. Overall, the customer service was a delight! I have learned my lesson - stick with a Westin and your vacation will be a dream! Thank you so much!!!! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Westin Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn P
Reviews.Content: My family had not been on a real vacation in years. We decided last summer that we were going to get out of rainy Seattle during Christmas and go to Maui. So glad we did! By late August we were a little late getting in the game, but eventually found a nice place at the Westin Kaanapali. We could only afford a studio (2 adults one 12-year old), and it was a little cramped, but given the $'s we saved, well worth it. The rooms are clean and efficient with a kitchen, washer and dryer. VERY tiny closet. Don't pack a lot of clothes. The beach is why we go to Maui and Kaanapali beach is fantastic. Right out in front of the hotel is snorkeling and just a few yards south is great for swimming (no coral). Plus you can take a long walk and sight see. Room tip - ask for what you want up front. We got exactly what we asked for. I suggest North building, 6th floor (the top), with no parking lot views. We had room 6658 which has the best view for a studio, that's for sure! Includes a spectacular ocean view with a rainbow right out the window every morning.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: mackymac23
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am normally a Best Western or Country Inn and Suites type person. I don't think I've every paid over 150 a night for lodging. But, this trip was for my mom's 75th birthday, and I wanted it to be really nice. It was. I don't know what it was about this property but it was the most relaxing vacation Ive ever had. Maybe it was maintenance coming at 4 am to give me a new coffee maker? The pools and the slide, which my daughter loved? The help one of the reservation managers gave (thanks Sulinn) to make this week really special for my mom's birthday? I am going again in February 2013. My family and I agreed we would forego Christmas and birthday presents until then and just save for another trip to this Westin. It is expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: RetiredVP14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay for 8 days in an ocean view one-bedroom. The facility was very well maintained. The grooming of the grounds and building maintenance was evident but not distracting. The pools and beach area were top notch. The kitchen was great and the in room laundry allowed us to travel with only carry-on luggage, The staff was very friendly and helpful. It is close to shopping, dining and other attractions. The food on property is just OK and expensive, so we usually ate elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “North Villas are very nice, but location is very windy”
Reviews.Author: deenmachine
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay on Maui. We were thrilled to get the Westin villas on a trade through Interval Intl. We stayed in a 2 bdrm (it was actually a 1 bdrm w/an adjoining king suite) in bldg 8 on the 4th floor, end unit. There were 3 of us. We had an ocean view but could also see a fenced off piece of undeveloped land btwn the Westin and Honua Kai and could hear some road noise when on the lanai. We were fine with this, but just letting you know in case you book into the far side of bldg 8. Also, you need to park in a parking garage in bldg 6 and walk past the pools and a BBQ area to get to bldg 8. The property is very nice. Great amenities in the condos and at the resort. FYI, the condo has a cooktop but no oven and the lanai was quite small. I think the most important consideration in whether to pick this property is location. We found it to be extremely windy. We've stayed at other properties along Kaanapali Beach and really think the further north you get, the windier it is. We stayed at the resort beach and pools a couple of days but it was very windy and drizzly. We decided to go down to Wailea area beaches and had great weather the days down there. So, if you like to venture out most days and see the great Maui sights and beaches then the Westin is a great property. If you want to relax at the resort beach and pools, I would choose a more protected site or at least ask for a unit on the inner side. Btw, we stayed at the Sheraton down the road the night before our timeshare week started and really enjoyed the suite and property. As for beaches, my husband especially liked Ulua Beach for snorkeling (a family friendly beach near the Wailea Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “If you have children, this is a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GinebraLV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. â–²The rooms are big and comfortable. If you are going with children, try to stay in a room with 1 or 2 bedrooms. It may rain, so you'll need the extra space for the little ones. â–²If you are thinking on eating at the hotel, there are restaurants there, but you'll have every cooking utensil to make any meal in your room... dishes, silverwear, pans (different sizes), oven dish, colander, grill set, etc.. â–²If you want to store left overs, you'll need to either bring containers from home, or buy some there â–²There are grills outside, next to the pool areas, so you can make a bbq at night. â–²If you are celebrating a birthday (my husband and I did), you can buy candles and matches at the general store, or just bring them with you to save money and time, but they won't give almost anything at the front desk like a regular hotel would do.. oh, and you are not allowed to light the candles in the room... â–²They have a DVD player and a movie rental kiosk, that's good for a nice rest after a busy day. â–²Close to the hotel, there is a supermarket and some local restaurants. â–²The pools are awesome, the beach is amazing. â–²Bring your snorkling gear!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Tekysales
Reviews.Content: We had a 1 bedroom. It's nice so our young child can sleep in one room while we wind down in the evening. Everything you'd expect from Westin - clean, nice furniture, big bathroom, friendly staff. A brand new play structure opened while we there. The pirate ship pool is a big hit with the kids. The pool bar happy hour is a big hit too. The $4 Mai Tai was a near daily ritual. If you're looking for a meal deal, the south villa's pool restaurant had a great early bird 3 course meal for $29 with choice of mahi, steak, etc. We've stayed in most the areas around Maui and this part of Kaanapali tended to be a little windier that other places and the water is a bit rougher because of it if you're into water activities. Out of the week we were there the conditions were only suitable for SUP 3 days. Other areas of Maui had calmer water and winds.

Reviews.Title: “In Maui with a Baby”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Gal_19
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 (2 parents and a 1 year old.) The Westin Villas is the best place for a family. The grounds: They have several pools with full pool side drink and food service. Plenty of shade for those who don't fare well in the direct sun. They also feature a kids' pirate pool and playground as well as a slide and a wading pool. The hotel is located directly on the beach just north of Black Rock and the popular shopping area, Whaler's Village. Both are walking distance from the Villas using a nice paved path but the hotel also provides a shuttle service to Whaler's Village as well as to Lahaina. Super convenient. The beach in front of the hotel offers some of the best snorkeling I have experienced. As a guest, you are able to rent beach chairs and umbrellas. I actually preferred this beach to the more populated one by the resorts near Whaler's Village which can get very crowded. The rooms: The rooms are 1 bedroom condos equipped with a full kitchen and washer/dryer (life savers when you have a kid.) There is a relaxing balcony to enjoy as well. If you require it, the hotel offers a crib, high chair and even a diaper genie! Although this my not be important to many, the bathroom has 2 entries which is great when you don't want to disturb the kids. The staff: The staff are only so so. Nothing bad to report but they are simply not very prompt or helpful. We kept receiving calls daily about a technician wanting to enter our room to install a new router (why now? Why not wait until we check out?). We would give them a time and they would never show. But without a doubt they would call when the baby was napping asking to install yet again. Housekeeping was fine but we had to forgo it one day since they did not show up during the 4 hours we were out and when we returned the baby needed her nap. (You can tell the napping baby set the schedule.) Food: We ate at the breakfast buffet at the pool side restaurant. Very good. It was part of the room reservation deal. I would highly recommend the Italian restaurant in the hotel called Pulehu. Quite good if you don't feel like traveling off grounds for dinner. Overall: The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas will be one of our regular vacation spots in the years to come!! P.S. I know I am writing from a parents perspective but I promise you, there were plenty of young honeymooners and older couples there as well. I would definitely some here with only my husband (and plan to.)

Reviews.Title: “Maui Magic!”
Reviews.Author: LStevens24
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and venue with idea accommodations i.e. kitchenette, access to BBQ, various pools, fitness centers/health club, the spar was incredible according to my wife and restaurants. Rooms were sound proof, Tiki lamps provided a perfect setting and excellent snorkel reefs right in front. The overall services was top notch! Go to Costco when leaving the airport...

Reviews.Title: “24 hour hot tubs:-) South Villas”
Reviews.Author: SOKICKASS
Reviews.Content: Go to Costco after you leave the airport. Buy your booze and lounge chair and some snacks. I always briny own snorkel gear. Great snorkeling right on the hotels beach. No need to bring find. The south villas have ovens in the rooms. The crab feed on Wednesday is amazing! Take the shuttle or walk 10 minutes south along the beach to the Sheraton. The pool there during the day is huge. Great loungers and an early happy hour at there pool bars. Black Rock is right next to the Sheraton pool. You'll be sure to see Lots of turtles. Don't be scared to jump off black Rock. It's so worth it. Under water cameras are great for pictures with fish and turtles. Front street was a lot of fun. Go to captain jacks for a burger. Go into the art galleries. They are magical. Take advantage of the hot tubs after 10pm. There's no one in them and you can bring your own drinks dwn as long as they aren't in GLASS containers. We had a 2br villa. Very accommodating. Hige kitchen, dining room and family room and bathrooms. Just a tip. Don't put bubble bath in the jetted tub. That was a mess:-). And safe way is five minutes away. Use the grills at night. They over look the beach. There's tables dwn there to eat at. The kitchens are stocked with cutlery, plates, pots and pans and glasses and a cork screw and a blender we used often. But foil at safeway. Always comes in handy when using a grill. Just ask the bar for some empty plastic cups and straws and youre set. Happy hour at the sports bar/pool restaurant where they have the crab feed is at 3-6. Lots of good 3-5apps and always a drink special. Making things very affordable. And they do have a gift shop with a market with everything from booze and dairy to meats and pizzas and shaved ice.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront villa with amenities”
Reviews.Author: Vickiwms
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the westin ka anapali villas north. Had a lovely accommodation with kitchen ,access to BBQ, pools, children's pools,hot tubs, health club, and restaurants. Well sound proofed with doors closed, nice balcony overlooking the ocean. A 2 minute walk across the lawn to the ocean and good snorkeling with easy access for beginners. building 5 and 8 are our favorites. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Paridise”
Reviews.Author: bounder04
Reviews.Content: On the sunny side of Maui, upon arrival you are greeted with a fantastic ocean view from the lobby. The grounds are clean and beautifully landscaped. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean. The property has several pools including one just for the kids and you are steps from the beach to dip in the warm ocean or sunbathe. There are several restaurants on site if you wish to dine out or you can cook your own meals in your kitchen or barbques near the pool. If you plan to make your own meals, Safeway in Lahaina and Costco in Kahului are the cheapest stores. My wife and I enjoyed the property so much, we became time share owners. Now we look forward to spending time at the villas every chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jlcarp
Reviews.Content: Secluded and private property located on Kaanapali in West Maui, the Westin Villas is a great resort property for a long stay on the west side. We were here for a week at the end of October/beginning of November. We stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club last year, so we had that experience to compare it to. The Westin Resort Villas are located on the other (north) side of Black Rock, so itâ€™s a bit more secluded. The Westin hotel is actually located on the Kaanapali strip adjacent to the other hotels. Overall, I was impressed with the villas property and location. We were upgraded to an ocean front room, so the view overlooked the pool and was very close to the ocean. We got great views of the sunrise and sunset every day. The pool is nice, but it gets crowded; this was really my only complaint. We thought we would avoid this because we went during the off season, but one of the pool attendants told us the property stays busy year round. I remember looking around at night and every room was occupied (It wasnâ€™t really too much of a problem though because we didnâ€™t spend all day every day at the resort). People do get up at 6am and reserve pool chairs for the whole day, which is annoying. We never had this issue at Marriott. Also you cannot move the pool chairs onto the green grass adjacent to the pool bar; which you could do at the Marriott (Marriott actually positions their pool recliners on the grass). I liked being on the grass because you could actually have some space from the people next to you and you can avoid the hot cement. However one of the pool attendants asked me to move my chair back to the concrete, so just be aware that seating selection is not that great. The beach, however is awesome. The water feels amazing and there is a ton of amazing snorkeling right off the shore. The beach is also a nice and close walk and not a trek which is perfect. Parking is not actually that bad; it is close to the buildings and we could always find a spot. The rooms are also really nice and spacious; the walls are thick so we did not hear our neighbors at all. We could however hear people down at the pool in the early morning. I also liked that the property is just the right size â€“ it is not too big as to be overwhelming, but not too small either. Would def. return to vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelover71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love this place for ourselves and for our family. The location is awesome and close to everything especially the beach! You can walk from the ocean front property to the water in seconds, it's that close and there are grills to cook on while watching the sunset. The rooms are well planned out and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Anthony G
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the North Villas. We purchased in 2008 and have been back every year. Although there have been cut backs due to the economy that we have seen such as reduced staff and shuttle service not running as frequently, they have managed to keep up their standards. The property is impeccably maintained and the rooms are still in very good shape. The staff is very attentive and helpful. Bell staff is extremely helpful and efficient. Jason leads the crew during the day and does a great job. These guys are not the kind of guys who are there with their hand out when they do something for you. They are genuinely appreciative of any tips and always seem happy to help. Jacob at the front desk was most helpful as well in finding us the room we wanted. They have local vendors in the lobby daily selling all kinds of one of a kind items. Check out Larry Dalinka who makes the most amazing bracelets which you will not find anywhere else. He is a craftsman and a great guy as well. Hint: If you are renting a car, go to Avis across the street. They will pick you up. Their cars are the cleanest and their service was flawless. They have special rates for the Westin Villas as well. Aloha Y'all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: Edgar H
Reviews.Content: We had a studio room with an ocean view. I think most of the rooms had views of the ocean based on the shape of the buildings. The units were very clean and self contained, with a cook top and a microwave but no oven. There were barbeques available near the beach and poolside which was a huge bonus. The Beach was very nice and the snorkeling directly in front of the villas was very nice. The only negative feature was the pools were only 4' deep at the 'deep' end.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families with children. Adults only: stay at The Westin”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLatina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 5 nights at The Westin Villas in Maui. As soon as we got there we were disappointed to learn the villas were NOT located next to The Westin Resort which has the best location in Ka'anapali. Anyway, that is our fault for not doing enough research. THE GOOD: * Room - we stayed at the smallest room (the studio) and it was very roomy, clean and modern. Also, it has a kitchen which comes very handy if you want to save money by at least eating breakfast in your room. The rooms are also very quiet since there is an extra door separating them from the hallway. I just wished the studios had a balcony, but they don't. * Service - except for the bartender and one of the servers, the service was very good everywhere. Employees where helpful and friendly. THE NOT TOO GOOD: * Ocean: although the hotel is ocean front, the beach has rocks and unless you take a walk further down, you will find rocks which don't allow you to stand up so you have no choice but to just float/swim. I found this to be very disappointing. Also, if you expect a Caribbean ocean you will be disappointed. Maui isn't the Caribbean. * Location: yes, it is in Kaanapali, and although you can walk to Whaler's Village, it takes about 20-25 minutes to get there. I wish the Westin Villas was located where the Westin and Sheraton are. * Lounge Chairs - I don't know if I am being unreasonable here, but I was surprised to find out guests had to pay $12.50 in order to use a lounge chair for the day plus $7.50 for an umbrella. Maybe it's because I've been to the Caribbean too much where lounge chairs and umbrellas are always available for free. Also, please keep in mind this hotel is perfect for family with children. However, if you are planning an adult only trip you might want to go to a different hotel unless you don't mind seeing children everywhere you go! Overall, I would only go back to The Westin Villas if it's with my children, otherwise I would stay at The Westin Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Style Makes You Feel at Home”
Reviews.Author: Korgirl125
Reviews.Content: After a week in Maui, I did not want to go home. Maui was amazing of course, but Westin Villas made me want to live there. I got a one bedroom suite with a small view of the ocean. First the bed was so comfortable, bathroom was spacious, full kitchen was convenient and living area was relaxing. Second, the hotel location on the beach was perfect for those who want to get away from the busy areas. We rented snorkels nearby and was able to walk outside and dive in. We saw different fishes but didn't see any turtles. If you go south the black rock, you will see the turtles. If pool is your preference, you can choose from 3 different options. Third, hotel service was pretty good. I had a issue with the valet not getting my bags to the room and losing my bag tags. My recommendations, walk with the bag guys to your room. All other staff were excellent. Food onsite wasnt too bad. There are restaurants and a small market. You can pick up cooked or uncooked food. There are grills onsite if you want to BBQ. I would recommend crab feat on Wednesday. It was 44 for all you can eat which also includes appetizers and dessert. Have a great trip! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious villas”
Reviews.Author: Centuryclubtraveler
Reviews.Content: Staying here will probably get you more value per square foot than anywhere else on Ka'anapali Beach. This plays out especially well if you come with children or extended family. My wife and I took our two young boys here for a five-day stay and ended up purchasing a timeshare. We especially enjoyed the free shuttle to the two other local Starwood hotels and to Lahaina. This allowed us to shop in Lahaina, have dinner at the Westin Maui, and snorkel at Black Rock without worrying about driving and parking. Bonuses inside the villa and grounds include the washer/dryer, kitchenette, pirate ship pool, and outdoor grills. The concierge service was better than anywhere else I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Erin H
Reviews.Content: I don't write reviews of hotels very often (ever) but I just want to make sure that there was a way my husband and I could praise Jeremy and John who are wait staff a the Pailolo Sports bar (beyond tips). Thanks you guys for taking such great care of us and remembering our names! Thank you also to poolside server, Jao (who's passion is dancing!) and S. Phillips who checked us in for being incredibly pleasant and courteous. You all were AMAZING! Many Alohas and we will see you next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: honeypie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Ocean Villas for 6 nights in October 2011. We are two couples, in our mid-30s, no children. Yes, this resort is great for families, but I wanted to say that it was really nice for just couples too! It was extremely comfortable, resort was immaculately maintained and beach was superb, the size was perfect (not too big that its overwhelming, not too small that you don't have all the perks of a resort), the service was great, and actually, we didn't find that there were too many loud/noisy children running around. I've been to some resorts that are even more 'family-oriented' where the pool was overcrowded with kids and their parents, and kids were running around poolside knocking over drinks etc... the Westin was NOT like this. It was calm, tranquil, and just a fantastic place to be. Being two couples in our mid-thirties, we actually wanted to escape from our hectic city life, wasn't really looking for nightlife (we get enough of that at home!) and the Westin Ocean Villas was just the place for the R & R we were looking for. We were upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite on arrival; the suite was just perfect. With a full kitchen and ensuite laundry, we could stay here another week or two! Having a kitchen and BBQ facilities nearby was awesome; we stocked up at the Costco (just beside Kapului airport) and had breakfasts at home, and about 3 dinners at home. This was both economical and made for some fun nights, sitting on the patio, sipping drinks. The snorkelling right off the Westin Villas beach is just suberb! But also highly recommended, is to take the Westin shuttle over to Black Rock and snorkel there! We saw sea turtles there, and more fish than I can dream up. Being a foodie, food was also really important to my vacations... top spots in Maui (Kaanapali) were SENSEI sushi and Merrimans (both just about 10-15 min from the Westin Villas. Paia Fish Market and Mama's Fish house also top my Maui Eats list, but they were about 40 min away in Paia. We loved Maui and can't wait to return!!! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: AKG86
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 8 night stay at this Westin and overall our family had a great time. The resort is beautiful and just big enough to keep the 2 kids busy (Koi pond, pools, hot tub and beach) without worrying about them getting lost. We loved having the Studio condo with washer/dryer, big shower/tub and kitchen -- it was very convenient especially with kids that are fussy eaters. While we liked the beach at the resort, we also appreciated the close proximity to other beaches, restaurants and Lahaina for shopping. We found the resort staff very friendly and responsive for meal requests, activity ideas and housekeeping. Our building 3 room was a great size for us with a nice ocean view. There were a couple of nights that we wish the restaurants or room service stayed open past 830-9pm, but once the kitchen was stocked -- it was all good! We did the find the breakfast buffet a little pricey for what you get, but ordering a la carte was a good option for us. I have stayed at many Starwood properties worldwide, and I would recommend this resort for families as a good introduction to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Families - Not for Couples”
Reviews.Author: camachomarie
Reviews.Content: As I was relaxing in the hot tub this cute little boy sneezed right in my face. Yes, his mom was very apologetic but that really isn't the way I wanted to spend my night. Way too many kids. This place is great for families and only families. Really if I even had one kid I don't think I would stay here. I would only stay here if I had multiple children or came with family. Not good for couples! I loved the fact that the rooms were more like a condo in that they had a washer/dryer and kitchen. I used the washer/dryer numerous times and was glad it was there. I never knew what I was missing. Since there was a kitchen we were able to save a ton of money on food and drinks. We would make our pina coladas and then take them to the beach. Perfect. The beach outside this hotel is actually pretty good and has some great snorkeling. When staying at hotels I am a clean freak and I really thought our room could use a deep clean. Also, housekeeping didn't clean our room one day which was a true bummer. I love coming back to a nice clean room after being out all day, so when I came back and it was still dirty it totally ruined my chi. I didn't have the heart to ask them to come clean it since it was after 9pm already, but Mr. C really knew I wanted it so he called and asked. Yes, they did come and clean, but really all I think they did was make the bed. Fail. What is up with the towel cards? I really don't see the point of these. You lose one and you have to pay $15 for those horrible towels. Note to self *bring my own beach towels. As another side note what is with the people who are bright red, yet still tanning in the sun. Dude, get under an umbrella that looks like it hurts. Favorite places to eat: Gazebo Restaurant (Best Brunch - White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Pancakes are a must - Portions are huge and the price is right) 5315 Lower Honoapiilani Rd Lahaina, HI 96761 Mama's Fish House (Expensive and worth every penny. This place is a little far from Kaanapali so it is best to go when you are either coming or going from the airport. I loved everything. You can't go wrong.) 99 Poho Pl Paia, HI 96779 Stayed Sept 2010

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Euvitin
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location. It's centrally located in Kaanapali wherein it's near the other nice hotels and restaurants in that area and also near Napili and Kapalua where the other good restaurants are. Because it's a timeshare villas so the rooms are spacious and nice. The pool area is nice as well. The room is clean and the amenities are replenished everyday. You can grill outside if you're not in the mood to eat out. The price of the breakfast buffet is pretty high for what you get. You are better off eating at its sister property Westin Maui resort for a few more dollars you have more choices. Other than that everything else is great even the staff. It's always a pleasure to stay at this property

Reviews.Title: “A True Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love staying at The Westin. The hotel is so clean, beautiful and luxurious. We enjoyed every moment spend in the hotel. The view was unparalleled, and there is nothing like waking up to the sound of the ocean! The service was amazing, and the whole experience was great. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: tdumpling
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon and the welcome was lovely--champagne in the room, and other little welcome treats. The concierge was incredibly helpful as well. The pools were great and the addition of an adult area was much appreciated. The grounds were impeccable as well. There were a few little things that keep me from giving it an excellent review: my husband asked for a remote control as ours wasn't working. I jumped into the shower, figuring I could hide in the bathroom once they knocked. BUT THE GUY DIDN'T KNOCK--he just came in. Luckily the small wall blocked any view he may have gotten! Also, the bathtub drain didn't drain well and they made a mistake on our bill that they finally figured out and rectified. However, overall it was a great stay at a very nice resort!

Reviews.Title: “So Close...”
Reviews.Author: Stanima
Reviews.Content: We spent a really lovely 13 nights here recently and had a wonderful holiday. The location is perfect as you're a stone's throw from Whaler's Village and the other Westin where there are some good restaurants. The kitchenettes are great too for not having to eat out all the time. Plus if you are a guest and forego maid service you can get some free breakfast buffets which is nice. The pool and beach are both great and there's really good snorkelling 2 minutes from your front door. BUT..... There's just something a bit off about this place. If you stay at a lot of Westins you will notice the difference. They are quite focused on the owners and their interests versus the guests we felt. I think the main way this shows is that the restaurants aren't all that busy and the wait staff there, although well-intentioned are fairly unskilled. Our feeling was that the owners don't eat out there much so the restaurants get second priority. We got asked 5 times in 7 minutes if everything was OK with our meal at one point. At another place we found out they only serve food until 6 after waiting for a server for almost 10 minutes. Plus the drinks are really small and overpriced. Also, my wife is a Platinum Starwood member and the upgrade we were entitled too upon check-in was pretty minimal. Partial beach view from the back of the resort. Check-out at 10 a.m is a bit harsh also we thought. I know this sounds whiney but if your expectations are high this place just falls a bit short, in part because the Westins generally are so good. However, having seen some of the older places in Ka'anapali I still would stay here again. I just wouldn't waste any more money in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PickyLaura
Reviews.Content: If we ever return to Maui we will definitely try to stay here again. We had the best service during our stay. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Our room was clean and comfortable. We couldn't have asked for more in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Front Condos with Hotel Feel”
Reviews.Author: Rsauer3473
Reviews.Content: Westin Kaanaapali Ocean Resort Villas actually includes two time share resorts- the original and the Westin Kaanaapali Ocean Resort Villas North built a few years later than its sister property. The resorts timeshare properties managed by the Westin and its parent organization Starwood. Each is comprised of a number of six story buildings on the beach about two miles from the main part of Kaanapali. This leads to some confusion as there is a Westin Hotel in Kaanapali and some guests assume they will be able to amble down the beachfront walkway to their resort. It will be a LONG walk. The resort includes hundreds of studio and one bedroom units that can be combined into spacious two bedroom suites. Studios include a queen be and sofa bed in the room and the one bedroom has a separate bedroom with a king bed. Each unit has a kitchen area though the studio features a small rangetop and microwave. All units have washers and dryers which can be a godsend to families with small children. Televisions are in every living room and separate bedroom. A significant difference between the two resorts is that the Noth property has studios with small lanais; the south resort studios have a patio door and a railing to allow fresh air but no chairs. All one bedroom units have lanais. the grounds are luxuriantly tropical with palms and other foliage that whisk in the wind. As the resort is on the west side of Maui, guests have a beautiful view of the islands of Lanai and Molokai across the strait. There are several large pools and a kiddies' pirate ship play area. A full range of resort activities is published weekly and the resort offers free shuttle buses to Kaanapali and Lahaina- a boon as parking can be difficult in these tourist meccas. Snorkeling is exceptional here as there are schools of tropical fish as well as a number of green sea turtles. The resort has several restaurants and bars as well a a spa in the North property. There is a business Center and free WiFi for guests. During holiday seasons and Spring Breaks the resort is apt to be crowded and getting a poolside lounge chair can be a challenge. This is not an inexpensive resort- studios range from $300 to $450 per night depending on view to $500-$700 for a one bedroom. Units can be rented through the Westin or Starwood's SPG.com website though you might find better buys on sites like VRBO.com where owners (like us) rent their units out to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property on a more quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: This property is on the other side of the black rock and the Sheraton, and the location is more quiet and less busy than Kaanapali itself, and the row of hotels. We stayed there on 11/6/2011, and had a delightful one bedroom, with a full kitchen, living and dining room. Our room had ocean views from the bedroom and the living room, and it was a wonderful location. The beach was excellent with very good snorkeling right off the beach. The property had two large swimming pools with a 90 foot water slide on the south end, and on the north end there was a pool that also had lots of play area, and was 3 to 4 feet deep. They had a very good health club with thread mills etc. to work out in when the weather was not too good for walking outside, otherwise there was a walk way along the beach that went for more than a mile. The facilities are well kept, and comes complete with a washer and dryer and a full kitchen. One of the best hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Geared more toward families with small children.”
Reviews.Author: Jmmum
Reviews.Content: Pros - We booked a studio, but were upgraded upon arrival to a one bedroom. The rooms very very spacious and very well appointed. Granite counter tops in kitchen and bathrooms. Very large bathroom with shower and garden tub. The kitchen had everything you needed except coffee filters, and groceries. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Cons- Three restaurants, but only one was open for breakfast lunch and dinner. One was a pool/sports bar that served sports bar type food, and no breakfast. The third restaurant was Italian, but the food was nothing special, and not worth the prices. In addition, it was only open a couple of days a week, and only for dinner. There were two "markets" that sold trinkets, and groceries so that the families could cook in the kitchen, or use one of the many outdoor grills. My idea of a vacation is not spending my time buying groceries and cooking. I can do that at home. There was one designated 'kiddie' pool, and one designated "adult" pool, which was very tiny, and hidden behind one building. Sun never reached the pool, and 10 adults in the pool would have been over crowded. The other pools were huge. However, the maximum depth in all of the pools was 4 feet. And none of the pools were heated. I know this keeps down the cost of chemicals, but, what is the point of having a pool for guests yet making them miserable to use? So, the pools were not really usable by anyone other than very warm blooded children. When sitting around the pool, the servers didn't want to seem to stop to take a drink order. When one did finally bring a drink, he didn't return for 45 minutes.I gave up. The gym was very small, and didn't have a variety of equipment. We had booked an early morning snorkeling trip, and when we arrived at the valet desk to pick up our car, there was only a security guard on duty, who was loading a guest's van. When my husband went searching for someone at the front desk, he finally found someone in a back room, who came out and told us there was no one on duty at 6:30 a.m., and we would have to wait for the security guard. Although she knew we were waiting, she took her time loading the car and chatted with the driver before starting to search the valet stand for our car keys. When she found them, she had us get in her golf cart as she drove us through the parking garage looking for our car. She seemed as though she had no clue how to find our car. We finally found the car and sped away, hoping we could make our 30 minute drive to take our snorkeling trip. Luckily, the boat had not left the dock, although we were about 10 minutes late. When we expressed out dismay at this ordeal to the front desk, they grouchily told us that the valet desk wasn't manned 24 hours. However, this was not noted in any of our information, nor was there a sign posted. Luckily, we had actually left our room a little earlier than necessary, since we were not exactly sure of the marina location. We have stayed in Maui before at other hotels that had rooms not quite this nice, but had much better amenities. Otherwise, I would have given an above average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Dave03060
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to accompany friends of ours who owned a timeshare at the villas. Everything about this place was breath taking. The views, beaches, and services were all top notch and I would highly recommend staying that this resort if you ever get the opportunity to!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to base your vacation in Maui”
Reviews.Author: cuspdoc
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the North building on 4 occasions. I am an owner in Starwood Vacations but do not own here. I do exchange here on a regular basis as it is my favorite. Facilities in the North buildings are wonderful. We always stay in a one bedroom 1st floor away from the pool as it is quite and accessible to the beach. Plenty of room and quite. The resort has numerous pool, resturants, and a great spa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but pay attention”
Reviews.Content: Unlike 99% of the other condo locations in Hawaii where every unit in a building can be different because of different owners, all of these units were built by Westin. Therefore, each are furnished and finished the same - very good quality. Good soundproofing as well. We had a 1 bedroom, which was great - we could close the door and my freind could watch TV in bed while I was in the living room. Very good sized lanai as well. Our unit had a full kitchen so we had the fridge with an icemaker, full oven as well. I believe the studio room only has a mini fridge and a microwave (which I understand is also a convection oven). There is an in room safe and the closet is a good size although a little awkward to access because it is behind one of the bathroom doors. Good number of pools available - the adult pool at the far north end of the resort is very quiet, but very shady & while we were there the tradewinds were a little high so this pool was so breezy it was impossible to stay there. The pirate pool was working but the area close by was being worked on (blue board walls were up so don't know what they were doing). It is likely the reason why the north pool which others have said is so quiet turned out to be the busiest and the noisiest of all. The cost to rent a lounger and an umbrella for the day for 2 people is $45. Too steep it seems for almost everyone because I think we saw one maybe two set up while we were there. Pool loungers are plentiful but not those with a palapa so good luck getting shade. People were putting their towels out well before 8 am and contrary to what they say we never saw a staff member removing these. Here is the pay attention part: We did not book direct with the Westin, we got a good rate through another booking agency. Be very sure of what you have booked and have an email or the booking confirmation to back it up --- we were told free parking - they tried to charge us. The booking agency had our room as ocean view & Westin said 'no' island view. This meant her making some calls, going to a back room and we were left to wait and wait and wait. She brought out the map & showed us 2 room options and then 10 mins later confirmed one of those was not actually an option because it was a handicapped room and they needed it. I pointed to the map & said so there are no rooms in this area (the north area) and she said no, not that had an oceon view. We asked to see the other room & more than once we had mentioned our wish for no parking lot (which was also on our booking confirmation). Sure enough we looked at that room and it was over a parking lot with trees in front so no view at all. Back to the front desk and this time we insisted on a manager, who was with another client, and as it turned out in another building, so more waiting. The manager actually listened and showed us on the map the original room we had, although it was called island view, in fact it overlooked the koi pond, the pool, and was on the side where you could see some oceon !! So if the first girl had listened to us re: no parking lot and when I pointed to the map if she had showed us the original room we had on the map we would have taken it, no question. This whole process TOOK OVER 2 HOURS, we ended up on the south side with a full oceon view overlooking the park that is adjacent to the Westin (the parking lot was off to the left but that was ok). So again, be specific on your intent. We did hear a few owners during our stay who had issues with their room placement as well. In addition, painting the exterior was taking place so noise during the scaffolding procedure, then the spraying, this made some of the palapas even busier as no one wanted to be need where that was taking place. If you go without maid service, which for us was daily, you get a voucher for breakfast so we did that for 2 days so each of us could have 1 free breakfast buffet - it was really good. Waffles, eggs, eggs benedict, potatos, fruit, cereal, pastries Overall a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TulsaDad318
Reviews.Content: We have been Starwood Owners at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort for 8 years now. We have travelled there every year but one and we love our home away from home. The villas are beautifully laid out with a view of the ocean ( you have to be in a ocean view unit) just sitting on your couch or balcony. The entire resort is kept in immpecible condition constantly cleaning and updating as the years have gone by. The staff is friendly and the pools and ammenities are excellent as well. Wether an owner or a visitor to this property, I can't imagine anyone being disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: WS62001
Reviews.Content: I gave the value a 5 because they upgraded my wife and I for free to a larger and more loaded villa on our honeymoon. Our room had a wonderful view of the beach. Full kitchen less a real oven (But you have access to a grill down stairs), range top, dishes, a fridge, dish washer, washer and dryer. It would make a nice apartment. It was a much more pricey room so there seemed to be almost no kids. Though we did walk about the resort and there were lots of kids on the other end of the resort. Thus not so peaceful. But our side was perfect for a honeymoon. Service was prompt. We chose to do our own housekeeping and got free breakfast in exchange. Also bought groceries down the road rather than paying the high prices at the on resort market. Our experience at the resort was superb. No real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: raslas
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 15th wedding Anniversary here and loved every minute of it. It has multiple levels of sun decks and swimming pools and rests along the ocean shore, stocked with activities in the sun. The food was good yet spendy. As with any Westin, it is quite elegant so you feel required to "dress up" just to walk to the pool or eat breakfast...not always what individuals are looking for. Obviously a repeat visit is in order!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bundan
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over the ones in Wailea because this is a time share type resort and has a 4 star rating in travel advisor. Turns out it was a bad choice. There were only 2-3 front desk working when I checked in and I stood there for at least 20 minutes in line (and there were only 3 people in front of me). I told the front desk tomorrow was my birthday and I was wondering if they can do something special for me. She agreed but the special surprise was a filthy jacuzzi tub. I complained about it to the front desk and they sent housekeeping up. Housekeeping came and they said engineering has to fix it. There it goes 5 hours down the drain. Called and spoke to the manager who offered me to switch to an oceanview room the next day. But when I went upstair to check the room the jacuzzi tub spitted out even more "junk" so it's pointless for me to switch room. I ended up not able to enjoy the jacuzzi tub for my whole stay. I also didn't receive anything "special" for my b-day. When I checked out they charged me local call fee, which I called front desk to clarify and make sure they're free b4 placing the calls. They ended up waving the charge but that shows inconsistency in terms of providing guest information. Shower and bed is just so-so. Definitely NOT so heavenly compare to other Westin I stayed at. Very "rough" heavenly bath robes (too many washes w/ bleach) are available per request at the front desk. The only thing I like about the room is the full kitchen and the washer/dryer. Otherwise I would rather stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KenVicLee
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, this was not our time share. Friends had asked us to join them for a week in their two bedroom suite. We were happy to do so. We had previously stayed with other friend in Kaanapali's Marriott time share property. We felt this Westin facility, while lacking some of the pool amenities, was a better hotel. The finishes in the kitchen, the set up of the bathroom, the location of the balconies, the quality of the beds, were all superior. The one major flow this facility had, in our estimation, was the location. This hotel is north of Black Rock where the Sheraton is perched. That meant it was not an easy hike to the restaurants at Whalers Cove.
