So while members of our group routinely hiked down the beach to Whalers Cover, it was not likely we would amble over there for dinner knowing we would have to repeat the hike back. That also meant the amenities of other hotels were not in close proximity. If you wanted to go to another hotel's restaurant, not likely. If you wanted to attend another hotel's luau, not happening. While maybe there is some benefit to being a little secluded from the rest of the Kaanapali hotels, we could see no huge benefit in it. We were on the third floor of the six story North Tower. Fortunately for us that meant we could park on the same level as, and relatively close to, our room. That said, nearly all the spaces on our level were designated to "compacts" and we had a Hyundai Santa Fe and a Dodge Caravan. Sometimes there were no parking spaces because over-sized Chevy Tahoes and Dodge Challengers were hogging two spots. The one huge compliment I will give this facility was its cleanliness. As our week progressed and we hiked in and out of the room it occurred to me that it would be some job to clean up after us. We had six adults squeezed into two beds and two bathrooms. We surfed, golfed, zip-lined and snorkeled. We ate in the rooms about half the time. Kudos to house cleaning for making the suite look nearly unlived in when we first checked in. I have also stayed in a private condo in Wailea which I can use for comparison. The Wailea condo had a large lanai. But private condo's are not as polished as this Westin suite. Private condos also do not have access to room service, to coffee in the convenience store, a sports bar next to the beach or fresh towels at the pool. The Westin took care of its guests even if it did wrangle our friends into another presentation trying to upgrade their time share package. At the end of the week I had to admit this was a good experience. In part because our room location overlooking the pool and, by extension, the ocean, was perfect. But also because the seldom seen but very efficient Westin staff was on hand to keep order where there was chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spot, big rooms, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: srothnu
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and we were so pleased with the lovely beach and the size of the one bedroom suites to accomodate our family. You can get a deal if you book through websites where condo owner can post rather than booking directly throught he hotel. We were annoyed that we had to change rooms for our 8th night. And, we had to call for service many times before getting what we asked for. The pools were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin C
Reviews.Content: I love Westin, but not this one. Their rooms are designed unfriendly, bathtubs are so dirty, food is bad, pools are boring(compare to others), and people here are unfriendly. I loved to stay with Westin around the world, but this one is worse than staying at a holiday inn. We booked 2 rooms located in each their 2 different buildings, and they all feel the same way to us. Especially all the staffs we met here, they would amaze you with their unprofessional and unfriendly attitudes. My wife and I stayed at Hyatt maui few years ago, and that was a totally different story. We felt so welcomed to their resort, and everyone treated you nicely. However, at Westin we felt like they only welcome their timeshare members, and others are not that important. So, your money, your call!! Good luck!! Btw, the room WiFi here is free, but it doesn't work functional lol....you have to reconnect it every 2 MIN, and half of their TVs in workout room don't work either. Also, of course they charge you the chair and unbrara on beach, but with same price that you get a private cabana with food service at Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation - great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joresa
Reviews.Content: This was a fantactic place to stay while on vacation. The rooms are fabulous. Full kitchen and very comfortable. Great bed, large bathroom and a washer and dryer! The resort has a lot to offer. Lots of activites on site and the staff is very helpful. Internet was slow and I ended up having to plug in with the phone jack to make it work. Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “"What a beautiful part of the world"”
Reviews.Author: Davidedm
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Villas as it was classed as a category 6 Starwood resort not certain where they got the level 6 from but it wasnâ€™t for the service they offer. We stayed there the first week of November and arrived just before midnight after a grueling day of travel of late flight then being redirected & yet another late flight having spent many hours on the go to be greeted with the comment â€œweâ€™ve been waiting for youâ€� I showed them my Platinum Starwood card & politely asked if there was a possibility of an upgrade to Ocean View or even partial Ocean View as I had requested in my reservation, no we have put you in Mountain View corner unit. OK, we got the message it was Building 2. Yes it had a mountain view along with a view of the parking lot as well as the highway which by the way is noisy with traffic especially weekdays early morning so donâ€™t go to bed with the windows or patio doors open (in Building 2 all even numbered Villas face the road so go odds ). Breakfasts are the normal Westin buffet style and similar prices to US & Canada, midweek we went up to the restaurant up at the Plantation Golf Course for breakfast, a la carte views of the Bay to die for and almost half the price, great for couples. After a couple of days the trip had caught up with us & we started with colds, so I thought Iâ€™ll go down & try again & see if we can get relocated to another quieter room possibly with a view of the ocean they said they could move us for an extra $150 extra a night, â€œno thanks I said not at that price & I left No doubt about the location is beautiful, staff not as friendly as you might expect or as accommodating, I spend a lot of nights on the road staying in Starwood Hotels & give them a lot of business hence the Platinum Status & I was disappointed, they might look after their Vacation Club Members very well but as a Platinum guest I would have to think twice.I would recommend Starwood members to consider the hotels rather than the villas

Reviews.Title: “Horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Amy U
Reviews.Content: Westin is known for it's "Heavenly Beds," the beds at this resort are far from heaven. The beds was lumpy and I felt like I was sleeping in a hole. The linen was the worse I have ever came across at a Westin... no fitted sheets, too small and very stiff. Nothing like waking up with your feet touching the actual mattress or trying to cover your shoulders only to expose your feet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property if you can get past the annoying time-share issues”
Reviews.Author: Roadiejen
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood villa owners and just stayed here for the first time (this is not our home property). What we liked: nice location that's close to lots of restaurants and activities in Kaanapali and Lahaina, as well as Kapalua. The pool was never that crowded (we were there Halloween week) and the beach was scenic and very quiet). It's fun to walk on the boardwalk as well as the beach. The Italian restaurant in the newer North villas was quite good (especially by time share resort standards). The room was well-furnished and clean. We didn't have the bug issues that others have reported (but heard of others who had bad issues while we were there). What we didn't like: the wireless service is very spotty and definitely comes and goes throughout the day (despite the fact that they did an upgrade to supposedly better quality during our stay). Our view was okay--it was considered "ocean view" (bldg 7) but was very distant. As owners who reserved far in advance, I was hoping for more. Service from the bar while at the pool is also really poor--it wasn't crowded but I still waited forever for a server to come by. The worst part of our trip was our owner update. The person who did our update clearly had a set spiel and, although we are very experienced travellers in general as well as seasoned owners, we felt like it was very "101" type of information. Plus, they try to make you feel badly about what you currently own so that you'll upgrade to more ("gosh, this new rollover feature is really going to hurt owners like you." Hmmm, really? I don't think so since we are never able to use all of our points.). Also, the ONE thing we really want is the ability to view availability and book rooms online for the owner part of the program just like you can with hotels, and our salesperson told us they have no intention of ever adding that feature nor do they plan to ever add more resorts. Great! Gosh, how can we sign up to buy more now that we know Starwood will never do the two things we want? Plus, on the very last day of our trip, we just asked for a tour of the model in the other building so we could see the difference and know where to book next time. Yet, they stuck us with another sales person who proceeded to grill us the whole way on the tour about how many StarOptions we had, how long we'd been owners, etc. It's very hard for them to get out of sales mode. Then, she didn't even know how to find the model rooms and took us the wrong way. Very aggravating. We will go back--this is one of the better properties. But I'll skip the owner update next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Khokhonut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin as part of a time share exchange program. We had a 2 bedroom unit, which was amazing! We had a one door entrance from the main hallway that opened up into a small entry way with two seperate keyed doors/units. The unit to the right was the "master", it had a full kitchen, dining room, living area, bedroom with king size bed, an amazing bathroom, a balcony, and a washer/dryer. The room to the left was the secondary room/unit and it was pretty amazing too. It had a large bathroom, a washer/dryer, one king size bed and a microwave, apt. size refrigerator, and a sink, it had a small balcony as well. Every single staff member that we dealt with for the entire 8 days were friendly and helpful. We never had one problem, but I am confident that if we had encountered a problem they would have worked with us to fix it. We took advantage of their valet parking since it only cost a couple dollars more than the regular resort parking fee. It was so handy to come "home" and just let them take care of the car for you. If you had any groceries or other shopping bags they were more than happy to get them to your room for you as well. The pools were amazing. At the times we went they weren't ever over crowded. What we simply could not get enough of was the ocean right there at the hotel. There is the most amazing coral reef and fish just right there. We spent hours each day just floating around snorkeling, it was amazing. My one pet peeve where that is concerned is that they have no chairs available on the beach unless you rent them. We've been to other resorts where they have basic chairs and you can pay for upgrades, but here none were available without renting. It was ok, we took our towels and it all worked out, but just be warned. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!! If you have the opportunity I highly recommend this place :)

Reviews.Title: “willi2”
Reviews.Author: willi2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property and great location! I was especially impressed by the staff's smiles and willingness to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I specifically wanted to say "thanks again" to Alex at the Front Desk.... He was very professional and most gracious as we requested a room upgrade for our stay. He diligently searched for just the right room for us and we were so blessed by that! Thanks again, Alex! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: svshetty
Reviews.Content: Me and wife went to Hawaii for honeymoon and we stayed here. This hotel is the best, they had champagne bottle waiting for us :) Even though I didn't mention ocean view, I got ocean view room. Rooms are pretty spacious. As in Hawaii we get up early in the morning for drives, this resort has breakfast items to grab and go early 5 am in the morning. The ambiance is really wonderful with parrots saying 'Aloha'

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction.. Beware.”
Reviews.Author: Luxguide
Reviews.Content: Just checked in today. Paid full normal expedia rate for a week Ocean View. First of all.. the checkin is 2 people and a few hundred customers. If it is in the afternoon, your waiting in line like we did for an hour. Ok.. got past that, got our room, and the room is under construction. I am talking Plastic covering the windows so you can't see out them and paint and brown paper covering the floors. See the photos. Took me half an hour of trying to call the front desk and finally got through. Talked to the manager, he said " sorry, no more rooms, can't move you " . I had Expedia call them since it was booked through them, and after another half an hour, the Expedia rep came back to me from hold and said " the manager kept hanging up on me every time I called " Wow..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: vancouverchu
Reviews.Content: Modern, well maintained and managed facility. Two on-site markets have a variety of food that were only slightly more expensive than the local Safeway Provides an excellent option/rest from a week of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Always are favorite vacation place”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Westin villas makes us happy..each trip brings new memories and special staff that we like to acknowledge..this trip our pool bar server Jeremy was the best!!! It's great to come back a year later and see familiar staff...Tosh wins our vote for most helpful and friendly at the bellmans desk and Jenny was awesome at the front desk and super helpful...thanks for another fantastic visit and we look forward to our return next year...btw Joesph helped me find the perfect Maui jims at the pool service cabana :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun For Families or Couples”
Reviews.Author: 808tyme
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 out of the last 4 years and will be going again in February 2012. We love the resort! The villas are always clean, well stocked, and the service is great. We are Westin owners and have been happy with all the resorts that we have visited, but this is currently our favorite. We utilize the resort to it's full potential. We primarily prepare our own meals and love to barbaque at sunset. We do eat at both Pailolo Sports Bar and the Ocean Pool Bar & Grill once are twice on our visits. We had a great time last year at Pailolo watching the Super Bowl. If you will be there for the Super Bowl I suggest reserving a table. While watching the game we periodically were interrupted by breaching whales just off the beach! We have also taken advantage of the Kids Club on several occasions to get out for some adult time. Last year our daughter was able to hunt for crabs at night on the beach during a Kids Club event while we went into Lahaina for dinner. The pools are wonderful and our daughter loves the water slide. Don't forget to head down to the beach at sunset and enjoy the view!

Reviews.Title: “Our family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RocknRoni
Reviews.Content: Like all the Westin Resorts it a bit pricier then most but we had a very enjoyable stay. We did have to call up housekeeping when we arrived as the sheets on the pull out were not changed from the last guest. The one bedroom accommodated us very well. We purchase our groceries from Costco (out by the airport) which made it a bunch cheaper because the grocery stores in the area are VERY pricey. We utilized the shuttle service to go back and forth to Lahaina and it was very accommodating for pick up times. The bus drivers were very friendly and always assisted with the kids. The pools get evacuated quite frequently because there are a bunch of irresponsible parents that donâ€™t put their kids in swim diapers. Happy hour for drinks are very reasonable price at the Pailolo Bar & Grill. Kids under 3 eat for free always. Pulehu, an Italian Grill is overpriced pasta dishes. My girls loved the pirate ship at the kiddies pool but I do recommend that you highly supervise as the big kids get in and push them over. This isnâ€™t monitored or enforced by staff. The Westin Kids Club is too expensive and wonâ€™t take kids less than 5 years even if they are potty trained. Attend the regular free shows like the Hawaiian dancers and leave your gratuity for the group, much cheaper. Overall we had a good time and enjoyed the island relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Would got back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: sunny1010Ontario
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, we stayed at this hotel in the second half of our trip. This place is amazing! We had a 1 bedroom suite which had everything you could possibly need. It also had an ocean view. Staff was friendly and the grounds were super clean. lots of chairs by the pools so you didn't have to race to get a chair. This place is definitely Maui at it's finest. I can't wait to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “"There are no adequate words!"”
Reviews.Author: Terri L
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, you could tell that time and attention was spent on the landscaping and keeping all of the trees, shrubs and beautiful flowers healthy and trimmed. The staff was exceptionally friendly, from the registration desk, to housekeeping staff, restaurants, and just staff you meet on the grounds. Our concierge, Kela, was awesome. He steered us to good restaurants and a trip to Lanai for snorkling. The snorkling trip was fantastic from start to finish. Our room with a balcony was great. My friend would've liked an ocean view, since it was her first trip there in 40 years, but the view of the mountains was gorgeous. The bathroom was HUGE and had accordian doors separating the sunken bathtub from the rest of the bathroom, but you could leave them open. The kitchen was all in working order and spotless. I never go to Hawaii without getting a place with a kitchen so I can have breakfast there before taking off for the day. I liked that parking was free. Whatever we needed was supplied without having to ask twice. I would recommend these villas to anyone and I would happily go back...and plan to.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property!!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling for our 10th anniversary and stayed 5 nights in Wailea at the Marriot, then moved to the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas for the next 4 nights. WHAT A DIFFERENCE!!! I have been a Marriott Platinum member for the last 7+ years and was treated better at the Westin without any status. From the time we checked in to the minute we left it was a fantastic experience. Sheena Phillips at the front desk took the time to find us a very special studio room on the 3rd floor of building 5 that overlooked the beach pool and had direct views of the ocean. I mentioned that I recently joined SPG and she also gave us some free breakfast certificates that we used at the ocean pool bar & grill. THANK YOU SHEENA! The bellman that helped us get into the room was a 4th or 5th generation local that gave us some great suggestions about dining and activities in addition to making sure the room had everything we needed. The pool side service was flawless, the fitness center was well equipped and not too busy, and the beach activities attendant was very pleasant. Parking was free during our stay compared to $25/day at the Marriott in Wailea. We are going back and looking forward to another visit to Maui and the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Soleil1973
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous grounds, attentive staff...I can't say enough about this place! The only negative was the concierge service. I asked two different ones about different excursions and neither of them were very knowledgeable. All they did is try to push a time share on us. Everything about this resort was amazing except the restaurant Pulehu (DON'T go there!) and the concierge service. I would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a Villa!”
Reviews.Author: JaneH222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 20th wedding anniversary and were quite overwhelmed at the size of the place, having only stayed at a house in North Shore, Kauai before. The suite we had was a decent sized hotel room, not a Villa! After doing the timeshare tour we understood what the villas were. The resort we was good, we only used the hot-tub once and the happy hour bar a few times, which was great value. Snorkeling from the beach made it a good location and being able to walk down the beach-walk was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel/TIme Share”
Reviews.Author: skimamm
Reviews.Content: The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort VIllas are time shares but we were able to get a room for the week as a hotel rental. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a large 1 bedroom with no extra cost and we did not use SPG credit card or points for this stay. We booked through United Travel (via Expedia.com) and the room rate was $100.00 cheaper than going through SPG. You have to pay for those points somehow! Each unit has full kitchen with clothes washer/dryer which means you can pack half of what you would normally take for a week in Hawaii. The property is immaculate and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. The beachfront boardwalk is also kept very clean and the snorkeling off the hotel beachfront was great. We were not bugged about the timeshare aspects at all. They ask if you are interested and if you decline, enough said. We had room cleaning daily unlike the timeshare owners. We ate at the Pulehu Italian Restaurant on the North grounds and the Caesar Salad was way overpriced - $12.00 for 4-5 small romaine leaves with shaved parmesan. Good thing we went for the Prix Fixe deal. If a la carte, I would have sent it back. Our seating was right off the Koi Pond and it was a pretty setting. The entree's were delicious and well proportioned. Overall and A stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable property and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas through an invitation we received from Westin, which included the "opportunity" for fractional ownership. I say "opportunity" because we were not obligated to attend any sales pitch to take advantage of this package, which included 6 nights in a luxurious beach front Westin condo, with rental car and either points or $100 cash. We were skeptical at this offer, but what a surprise! The large unite we had included full kitchen, living room, 2 TV's, Bose stereo, DVD, dining area, separate bedroom with enormous bathroom (jetted tub, separate shower, 2 sinks), and washer/dryer. We lucked out and got a ground unit, which allowed us to walk out to the pool which overlooked Kaanapali beach. The grounds were spectacular, (plants, nice pool's, bar, restaurant, etc.) and the snorkeling was some of nicest we have done in Maui (turtles, ray's, eelâ€™s, all kinds of fish!). Best of all, it was right in front of the hotel with a wonderful beach and sunsets! You can walk to Whalers Village or take the free shuttle, which allowed for a nice walk every morning with ride back from the other Westin or Sheraton at Blackrock. We also took full advantage of the kitchen and cooking amenities, fresh fruit every morning, BBQ fish and chicken on the grill in the evening. We literally stayed at the resort the whole visit except for some shopping! The parking was also included; (not the $30/day charge at most resorts!) We did talk with several "owners" who have various packages and they all were very satisfied with Westin over Marriott and other "time share" type packages they had experience with. We did also attend the sales pitch which was not high pressure at all, plus we got additional points to use at other Starwood properties WW. I highly recommend at least visiting this property if you cannot stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Luster is off!”
Reviews.Author: nanapapa2289
Reviews.Content: The luster is off. I have always had trouble booking our timeshare on the owners web site. This year so excited that I was able to book on line I didn't notice or get notice that I was booking studio side of lock out only, for 2 weeks. All 1 bedrooms were booked, and when we tried to get into a bigger villa nothing could be done for owners of villas KORV and KORVN with"elite" status. We had 2 guest come for the second week of our stay, 4 of us in the studio, not terrible but not as comfortable as a 1 bdrm with balcony. Some of the appliances were not working when we first checked in, after the 1st week cleaning mold grew in the shower. We found the restaurant to be over priced for the quality, the best thing about the breakfast buffet is the fresh sliced papaya, but hardly worth $ 25.00. Cost cutting measures are understandable but they really do show at this resort. Still Maui is one of the most beautiful places on earth and Kaanapali the best place to enjoy it from. This resort is very nice, but not like it used to be. Maybe not what you expect for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: We got a 5 night deal at this place prepaid which included a car and $75 resort credit. Internet is free but parking is $8 a day. My husband attended a conference at the Westin hotel. We received several calls in advance from the concierge who sounded friendly but could not help us with early check in or room location. We arrived at the villas at 2pm and was surprised to get room keys right away. We went to 3112 and unpacked everything only to realize there was NO Shower!! There is some hose attachment in a deep tub, no shower curtain of any kind and a curtain to separate the toilet from the rest of the bathroom. This didn't even make sense if it was trying to be a handicapped accessible room. My husband stormed out to the nearest "concierge" (there's one around every bend), and insisted she call the front desk to relocate us. We repacked and were given another room in the North building near the elevator 6538. This unit had a larger refrigerator, nice shower, big jacuzzi tub combination microwave/oven/broiler, stovetop, toaster, coffeemaker/ silverware/ plates/ detergent/ dishwasing soap//pots/pans, etc. and washer/dryer. Small but adequate terrace with a decent enough view. Internet is free but on the slow side but there are 2 business centers with free internet and a kiosk to print boarding passes in the lobby. There is a handy Shuttle as well to the other Westin hotels and to Lahaina. We shopped at Foodland and Safeway finding Foodland to be a little more upscale. We got our wine at Costco. There are 2 markets in the Villas with a large variety of items but pricey. There are also many BBQs all over the complex. At the pool you exchange towel cards for towels. The good seats are reserved by 8am, but seating was always available somewhere. We tended to stay at the North pool because of the ocean view. The pools are large and relaxing but shallow and there are several jacuzzis. The beach is just fabulous!! Great sandy bottom with snorkeling very close, the water hs wonderful clarity, lots of coral and a great variety of fish. Also the occassional turtle comes by. Snuba is available to try in the pool at 11am. Water activites are also available such as kayaking and paddle boarding. IN the morning the beach path is great for walks. The gym seems wells equipped I only used it to weigh in. There is an onsite Spa as well. We ate one dinner prepaid from an online deal at the Italian restaurant. It was good for the price. All our dinners were expensive though. You can 15 minutes to Dukes which we ate at twice, great sunset views there. We did not attend the timeshare but saw many people who were participating, After a few days the place does grow on you. The grounds are kept immaculate, constant cleaning, sweeping and polishing. However, check out time is 10am which is a pain (we did get it extended to 11). The place was full of young families (preschool age). Beware the concierges, they are sales people and lurk around every corner. No you don't get housekeeping unless you pay for it, just one "tidy" during your stay. We were lucky to have great weather and a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: rorothedog
Reviews.Content: This Westin Timeshare property is a good place to stay but does have its drawbacks. Rooms- the North Tower had new rooms with great fixtures and a limited kitchenette that was good for snacks but not for doing full meals. There is no traditional housekeeping - they come only once per stay. Service- the concierges are some of the worst I've encountered. All they care about is trying to get you to attend a timeshare presentation. They Do NOT care about helping you plan activities!!!! This was highly disappointing. Pools- beautiful grounds Beach- Rocky, not good for swimming, but good for snorkelers. The beaches were not crowded. Overall, a good resort, but the service is not up to par. Stay here if you get a good price, but definitely not worth a $250/night price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away and Don't Fall for the Ocean View Upgrade Trick”
Reviews.Author: Cath_jockey
Reviews.Content: I had booked 5 nights at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas from October 15 through October 20th and used EXTRA points to book an Ocean View Room for a total of 90,000pts. The room assigned 3116 had a sliver of Ocean that can be seen if standing on the far left side of our balcony and leaning around a tree. After complaining to the manager I was credited 10,000 points which was the difference between island view and ocean view. Our room was right by the only 24 hour jacuzzi and our nights were interrupted by loud patrons right outside our window. Our third day there, we were notified that there would be a COMPLETE power shutdown of our building from 10am to 2pm that day. Though the power went off at 10am, it did not still return when we finally left at 2:45pm. When I called that night to find out if we needed to throw out the contents of our refrigerator due to loss of power I was told by the front desk manager that the power was out for "three hours" which is a complete lie! We were in our unit the whole time and finally left at 2:45pm, a full 4 hours and 45 min after the power shutoff. This from a resort that charges 600/night? What a joke. The manager stated there were no alternate rooms available as they were fully booked. I also noticed the "cut and paste" standard response from management to poor reviews on Trip Advisor. Is that really how much you think of us, your clients? You can't even individually address any of the complaints? Pathetic!

Reviews.Title: “Too big to Fail?”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on our last night of a 14 day trip to Maui. This resort is in sharp contrast to our previous accomodations, which was a small timeshare walking distance to two fantastic beaches near Kapalua. The Beach at the Westin Villas is quite long and relatively narrow at the same time. The real attraction is the number of pools, the size of the suite, and the overall service and ammenities available to you. In a nutshell, you have lots of space within your room, relatively good amount of space in the public areas, and little reason to leave the resort. Our kids enjoyed the pools, and found the beach itself quite boring. The water was very calm, which would be great for small kids and snorkeling. We started our vacation at the Fairmont, and I would say this is similiar to the size and ammenities there. The pools at the Westin were better, but at the same time, there were alot more people (even though the Fairmont was quite crowded as well). What took us by surprise was the absolute number of people at the resort. After spending days in sleepy Hana at a private villa, and then at a small timeshare, the size of the Westin and the absolute energy was a little bit overwhelming at time. There is no doubt kids will have fun here. If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place to soak up Maui, you would either need to go to your suite, or find another place to stay. Don't get me wrong. The beds were wonderful, the amount of space in the room was great, the view from our room was nice, and everywhere was clean. We did enjoy it. I just feel that this resort could have easily have been in Southern California or Florida. If you are looking for an authentic Hawaiian experience, I would look elsewhere or spend a lot of time outside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Typical bait and switch! BEWARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vita R
Reviews.Content: We PRE-PAID a 1 bedroom DELUXE OCEAN VIEW room for 10 nights. Received a 1 bedroom PARKING LOT VIEW room. Front desk and hotel manager showed us 3 other rooms, none that had an ocean view and hotel refused to refund us the difference. After one month, we are still struggeling with the Travel Agency and the Hotel. Our first 2-3 days were wasted trying to get a room that we paid for. No follow-up from the hotel manager. Although room service was included daily, the maid forgot to make the bed once and did not clean the surfaces in the bathroom....$20. a day tip is way too much for what we received. Nice property - lousy customer service from front desk and manager.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Katherine5711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the North Villas in a One bedroom with an attached studio lock off withour brother and sister in law. The location is GREAT if you wish to be on this side of the island. We have stayed at the Grand Wailea a year ago and found the two sides of the island to be very different. This side of the island is much more busy and you can find a lot of neat local spots. Also, we thought the beaches and snorkling was better. The Wailea side however is very nice as it is much more upscale and has great places to eat if you are willing and wanting to spend even more money. The thing we really enjoyed about the Villas was the chance to get a larger room with a kitchen and living room for a decent price. It was so nice to be able to cook breakfast and some lunches in our room and just hang out. If you are looking for a true vacation where you eat out every meal and aren't in your room much I would not stay here. The property is very nice but I have seen pools with more slides, swim up bars etc. Also, the dining onsite is very limited. The property is HUGE, so there is some walking but even at 6 months pregnant I didn't really think it was all that bad. The parking is a nightmare for a normal size car or larger but never did we not find a spot. We didn't have that much of a problem finding pool chairs either. The italian restaurant was just okay, everyone seemed pleased with their dished but not overly impressed. I do have to say that the bartender at the Sports Bar and Grill noticed that I was pregnant and made me a local juice drink for free which I thought was really nice and actually made my day. You can also have a photographer take pictures of you out near the beach and you can purchase them for a decent price. One complaint was that our internet was not working in our room. After sitting on hold for 20 minutes the guy simply told my husband "sorry, some places the service signal is pretty weak." All in all we were impressed and the villas were exactly what we were looking for for this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “WOWED AT THE WESTIN!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanine R
Reviews.Content: Everyone, and we mean everyone, should make it a priority to stay at the Westin Villas in Maui Kanapali at least once in their lifetime, if not, as many times as possible, for as long as possible. If you want to know what heaven feels like this is the place to do it. This marks our third stay and we plan on a forth next year. First of all, the setting is spectacular with views that take your breath away. Each time we have had a different view, from the lagoon/koi pond view, the pool, and the ocean. This time we had the most amazing view ever that had all three views in one. The best is at night when the tiki torches are lit and the grounds softly illuminate as the torches reflect off the grounds and the pools.... Gorgeous!!! Not only are the views breathtaking the rooms and grounds are incredible too! We had the one bedroom and find it very spacious and open. The amenities are well thought-out, and the living room is a good size with a large flat screen TV and DVD playerâ€¦the bedroom also has a nice TV too. The bathroom has a deep jetted tub that makes you feel like you are in a spa. We love to cook down by the pool on the gas grill amidst the light of the tiki torches. We also love that it is right on the beachâ€¦not to mention it has some of the best snorkeling around. We rented chairs and umbrella this year and it was well worth the experience. The stretch of white sand between the Westin and Black Rock makes for the best walks, day or night. There are several pools and Jacuzziâ€™s to experience all in stunning settings. The people who work there bring the experience to life and it is obvious that the management has a special touch with how this piece-of-heaven is run. The people who work there are so personable and are at the heart of it all bringing this resort to life. We have always been met with a smile and depth of resources behind each question. The people who bring the meaning to the Westin experience for us stand behind it. Now for us the Westinâ€™s name will always signify hospitable with heart. We have sent countless friends to this resort and there are very few things that we will put our name too...however, when it comes to this magical place we don't give it a second thought. Cheers! Jeanine R. & Sindy K.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area - great for families”
Reviews.Author: moonstone0005
Reviews.Content: August 2011 trip to Maui We checked in at the Westin Villas on Maui in August 2011. It is a beautiful resort with friendly helpful workers. Our group included a grandmother and two couples each with a child. A reservation had been made for adjoining apartments with ocean view. One of my sons works when on vacation so the ocean view was very important due to his working much of the time he was on Maui. The first problem we ran into was that there was a limited view of the ocean; then another couple walked into one of the apartments while we were in it, and claimed it as theirs. The hotel workers were very nice, but it took a day to get moved to another set of apartments, where the ocean could only be viewed by standing on one corner of the balcony. The next day we were moved to another set of suites with the beautiful ocean view we originally requested and could fully enjoy the resort. Our apartments included full kitchens in each one, which were very nice since we had a baby and a toddler to care for. We stocked up on food and necessities at the local Wal Mart near the airport when we first got to Maui. Please be aware that the use of plastic bags is restricted on Maui, and you must buy reusable bags to transport the things you buy. The childrenâ€™s pool with a large pirate ship taking up most of the central area of the pool was unique with its fountains of spray and slides for the children. The boardwalk along the ocean was wonderful to stroll on in the morning or evening. We rented snorkeling equipment, but the heavy surf on the beach prevented the less adventurous including the grandmother and grandchildren from snorkeling. The adult children enjoyed snorkeling far from the beach in the ocean and seeing the fish and turtles. The beach was a lovely place to sit and listen to the surf and enjoy the sun. There were several restaurants at the resort, where the food was good, and the workers very pleasant. The resort does have a shuttle, but limits use of baby strollers on them. They have their own baby strollers for use on the shuttle, and do not want other strollers brought on board, although they allow large golf bags, pool toys and surf boards, so do not go expecting to use your own baby stroller. We had to rent a taxi or use our own rental vehicles. The people driving the shuttle were very pleasant, but apparently there has been some controversy over the use of baby strollers, so they would not relent on the use of our own simple baby stroller. We drove the road to Hanna and enjoyed the views along the way of the beautiful ocean and rock formations along the shore. We enjoyed the Polynesian Luau at the Westin Hotel just down the road, although we had to rent a taxi to get the baby stroller there, so the baby could lie down to take his bottle during the luau. The food was good, and the show with its dancers and musicians very entertaining. There are several swimming pools at the resort, and these were very pleasant for the grandmother and children to use. It is especially quiet of a morning to use the pools, and the temperature is not so hot. There are very modern barbeque grills around the pools for use on a first come first serve basis. We ate out for all our meals, but saw families enjoying the BBQ areas with their nice tables and seats. It's a lovely resort, with great workers, but you have to be patient and able to communicate what is expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: MKtravelers19
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Westin Villas. Twice in the north building and this trip in the South. All trips in a studio unit. Both complexes are nice with the biggest difference being the north bldg studios have lanai's and the south buildings do not. Depending on how you book, you may or may not have a choice in buildings. The studios are well equipped and big enough for two. The beds, however, didn't seem as "heavenly" as in the past. The sheets were not cotton, a poly blend I believe. We enjoyed the south pool area. Lots of different areas to find a spot and relax. The pool/towel/cabanna/sports guys were really friendly and helpful as were the concierges, especially Rob. The beach in front of the Westin is very nice although rocky in spots. The Westin has done an excellent job of putting in a boardwalk and lovely landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it”
Reviews.Author: joel F
Reviews.Content: First time here, and would love to come back if money allows it. The grounds are really nice, and the rooms are well equipped and spacious. The staff is much friendlier than at the Westin in Lahaina down the road. Espescially the one Valet named AKAMU. He took a lot of time to discuss good snorkeling and surfing sites with us, as well as explaining his ancestral polynesian tattoos on his arms. That dude should get promoted to a bartender or something, as he is super happy and makes our day every time we go by him. It would be nice if they were better coordinated with the Westin in Lahaina, as we had to check out of Lahaina at 11am and we couldn't get our room here until 4pm. If they're the same chain they should be able to provide a seamless transfer.

Reviews.Title: “pulehu italian grill”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: This was are first trip to Maui. The experience was amazing...highlighted by dinner at the pulehu italian grill...the food was amazing and are server Kristen was attentive, informative, and extremely friendly. After eating at many of the restaurants Maui has to offer we were even more impressed by the service we received. Kristen was, by far, the best server during our time on the island. We will definitely recommend your restaurant to friends, even if they are not staying at your resort. Mahalo for a truly memorable experience. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Had a marvelous vacation this past August”
Reviews.Author: tesso
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be more accomodating. We are a family of six and everyone had the best time. The condo was perfect and spotless! We would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: atkinsdj
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this resort. We went with another couple who had never been to Maui. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The rooms are nice and the beds comfortable. The staff is professional and friendly. We found them always willing to help. We only had dinner one time at the on site restaurant, the food was great and the price was good. The beach area is fantastic. Great snorkling right at the resort and you do not have to go very far off shore. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rikou00
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed here for our first visit to Maui. We were extremely pleased that we decided to stay at the Westin Villas, over the other hotels in the area. Luxurious villas > regular hotel rooms any day. From our check-in to our departure, we were treated kindly by every single associate and manager that we ran into. Ami at the front desk was a pleasure to talk too, and was extremely helpful when finalizing our room details upon check-in. We asked for a quieter room, not overlooking the kiddie pool and since a room was available, he was more than happy to accommodate us. Hats off to management for training and hiring such sincere and genuine associates. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa, and our room was immaculate upon checking in. For those who aren't quite sure, yes there is a full kitchen (electric stove & oven, full size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, etc), and a washer and dryer in the room. As well, the kitchen is fully stocked with all the utensils, pots and pans to make a home cooked meal. It was great to make/have breakfast at our own leisure. We had dinner at the poolside restaurant one of the evenings and we had a great experience with our server Eric. He was extremely attentive and pleasant, he did a wonderful job of making us feel welcomed and gave us great recommendations. The food at the restaurant was exceptional, everything tasted great. The dim lights and flickering candles on the tables set up a nice relaxing dining experience. On to the helpful facts: *Parking is $8 a night, and that is the only resort fee that I remember paying. It was a little tricky finding a spot late in the evening. It appeared that most people returned to the hotel in the early evening. *Internet is free. *There is a shuttle that runs between the Sheraton Maui (Black Rock) and the Westin Maui every 15 minutes. As well, there is a shuttle that runs to Lahaina town. *There is a Safeway Grocery Store as well as a Longs Drugs about 5 minutes south of the hotel in Lahaina town. *The sunsets were amazing to watch every night. *There were BBQ grills out by the pool for anyone to use, I believe it was a 1 hour time limit on the grills but we never utilized them. *There were beach lounge chairs available for all hotel guests to use. *There was actually pretty good snorkeling in the beaches along the resort, we saw some decent sized fish and great looking coral out there. This hotel seriously made an amazing impact on our vacation. I haven't been able to shut up about this gorgeous property to any of my friends, and have been recommending it to everyone I have talked too. Hope this helps. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: travelbaseballmomnj
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 5 nights in August 2011. The resort is beautiful and the grounds are immaculately manicured. The kitchen is great for the family. We were able to keep essentials in the room which made those early morning excursions more enjoyable. We would just pack a cooler and head out in our rental car and explore the island. The pools at the resort were fabulous and the staff was attentive. We used the grills(kept very clean) several nights. It was fantastic eating right by the beach. We took advantage of the crab fest that was offered at the hotel as well. My kids loved it. The snorkeling at the resort was breathtaking. The only negatives were check in....long lines and maid service was inconsistant.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: penolan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights from Sept 19-26th in a one bedroom in the South Villas. As I have reviewed this property in the past I can honestly say that it still rates " Excellent " in my opinion. The front desk was especially courtious upon check-in as well as the two other times I required their service. The Bell Desk was also "right on it" getting my gear and food up to the room after I checked in. The one bedroom has a large kitchen(with almost every appliance one would need on vacation), and bathroom with an adequte living room/dining room connecting to the lanai for enterainment. The bathroom has a double vanity, a large shower and jacuzzi tub. The bedroom has a large king bed with HDTV ( there is a larger TV in the living room.) This room also connects to the lanai. The grounds are well maintained adorned with Island flora and connect to the beach area which is great for snorkling or just swimming. The Westin Ocean Resort also has about a dozen grills for outside dining or just to cook and bring back to your room. This is particularly nice around sunset. This property also has an exercise room, sauna, and a "killer" steam room. One of the great things about this property is it's location. It's away from the crowded hotel row of Kaanapali Beach but close enough for a leisurely stroll to Whalers Village. I feel a car rental is a must on the Island of Maui, but if you don't want to drive, the Westin provides a shuttle to Whalers Village and Lahaina. I can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: AZretiree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and it is a beauiful resort with helpful and friendly staff. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: michellegc
Reviews.Content: My family went to this hotel during spring break. The resort was beautiful and my teenaged children found LOTS to do. We all enjoyed the pristine pools and my husband and kids loved the beach and ocean. Everything was wonderfully maintained and the staff was amazingly friendly. We definitely will return. LOVED every second we were there.

Reviews.Title: “I'm impressed.”
Reviews.Author: jenna1z
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday October 7th, 2011 to find a beautiful room with a kitchenette,a bathroom with a jacuzzi and huge shower too. Jason Kamakana checked us in and was very friendly. Brian Bardos brought our things to our room and was there when we noticed that the sheets were not 100% Cotton. We had requested them far in advance and were told they had them so when we found out they were a blend we weren't sure what we were going to do. My husband has a severe allergy to polyester. Brian notified Jason and we also told Caroline our concierge. Together they worked with Marc Grotelueschen the manager to figure out what to do. Caroline was so sweet she even offered to get her own sheets from her house to let us use. Mark contacted Steve H. the director of housekeeping and he went to Costco and bought us sheets. Hannah Aiwohi at the front desk also was involved in helping our situation. All these wonderful people worked together to make sure we had a great stay. The bed was comfortable and the room was very spacious, complete with every thing you could need. The resort is beautiful and all the staff here are so helpful. We were having trouble with our snorkle and Sean at the swim equipment hut fixed our problem. The snorkeling here is incredible right outside the room at the beach. The reef is very colorful and teaming with fish. We dined at Palehu the italian restaurant compiments of the manager for our trouble, the food was delicious, and our waitress was so sweet. I can't remember her name, we were there on Monday, October 10th and she has blond hair. She really enhanced our evening with the great service. The drinks at the bars are good and they have a happy hour every day. It was a pleasure to stay here and I am very impressed by the way they handled our situation. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It wasn't overcrowded, the kids were all well behaved around us and the guests here are also nice. It's a really good feeing being here. We're leaving tommorrow and we're bringing great memories with us. Thanks to all the staff at the KOR, Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie32114
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for our honeymoon at the end of September and were very impressed with how beautiful and well kept the property is! Our suite was very nice, great size and the washer and dryer was a bonus! I would have loved to have an ocean view room, especially since it was our honeymoom, but we were told none were available and to check back another day. (The hotel didn't seem that busy to have none left but I suppose its possible... and we never went back to check again) Our view was still very nice though. The beach and view was amazing! We did alittle snorkeling which was so close to the shore. (though if you do, but the snorkle gear at an ABC store, its about $7 compared to the resorts $30+) I do wish we would have known what day they were cleaning our room because I would have liked the sheets changed and the room is only cleaned once for the week. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site, we ate in Lahaina most nights and at Dukes the resort down from the Westin.. all very good and resonably prices. Overall I would highly recommend! Overall I would highly recommend this resort

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Richard D
Reviews.Content: The property is amazing! We loved the beach, the pool, the spa, the food and the rooms are awesome! This is going to become our annual vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise revived”
Reviews.Author: HRHCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Just a fantastic and magical place. Pool, spa, sports bar, helpful and kind staff, good food, lovely rooms. A return is a must on our to do list!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous, relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fashion_Jetsetter
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at this resort because it was highly recommended by a friend. The room was nice - we had our own mini kitchen, washer/dryer, whirlpool, Patio and the king sized bed was heavenly! I slept like a baby for 6 nights that we were there! The restaurant was great - everything was fresh and the price was reasonable. We also liked the casual / sports bar by the water - they have the best happy hour! We really had a great stay at this property. Although we saw more couples with children, we didn't feel left out. We are in our early 30's. It was a romantic vacation! I will go back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for families and/or true relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights from Sept 15 to 20. We stayed in the studio suites in the South Towers in Bldg 3. I really love this place almost to the point where I almost bought a timeshare here and still thinking of buying it. I think this place is a good place to stay if you have families or if you really want to get away from your busy life and truly want to relax. The grounds are big and lots of green lawn. Has adult and kid pools. It's right on the beach so you just have to walk there, rinse off and go to your room. I didn't really care for any lounge chairs and stuff, so we were content playing in the sand and swimming in the ocean and in the pools. So the stuff I loved about this place... - Washer/Dryer - I loved it! I didn't have to wash our swim suites every day by hand - Quiet - At least for us in bldg 3, I felt like it was really quiet (except housekeeping staff, see below) - Kitchenette (at least for the studio) - I loved having a bigger sized fridge than the little ones you get at other hotels. We were able to store our milk and juice in the fridge. We're your basic cereal type of people, so this worked out great for us. - Size of the room - at least for south towers, I felt like the room space was decent. Stuff where they can improve... - Recycling bin - It would be nice if each room had one. We went through a lot of water bottles and coke cans. We just made our own with a brown paper bag, but it would have been nice if they had one in each suite. - Housekeeping - this is the reason this hotel couldn't get a 5 rating from me. Our room was clean for the most part when we checked in, but there were lot of places where you can totally tell it was not dusted!!!! You can see it on top of the microwave, on the shelves in the bathroom, and night stands. - Housekeeping Staff - This only goes for bldg 3 and at least where I stayed. The housekeeping staff were so freakin LOUD!!! They would talk to each other in the hallways and when they were cleaning the room next to us so loud I was afraid my children were going to wake up from their naps! - New carpet on the first floor of bldg 3 - they really need to replace or have a good cleaning, it's kind of dirty and not very appealing. I couldn't help noticing the dirty carpet every time I had to walk through the bldg. Also I did check out the suites in North Towers. I think maybe it might be nice to stay here because at least it has separate showers. The South Towers (at least for us) only had the jacuzzi tub with the shower head and that was a little inconvenient. Except for some of the stuff they need improvements the need, it really is a great hotel if you really want to relax and have fun. I saw people using the grills which looked nice too. All the staff I encountered were super nice. I will most likely to stay at this place again especially after staying at the Westin Maui Resort & Spa and couple miles down for the next 5 nights we stayed in Maui. We wanted to try both resorts, so we split up our time evenly between the two, but I really wished I stayed at this one. Westin Maui Resort and Spa was nice too, but their beach (well there wasn't much of one because it had eroded so much) and I felt like there is way too much commotion going on the first floor of the lobby area with bunch of vendors. I think I would stay at the Villas and just take the shuttle the next time because I did like the Westin Maui Resort & Spa being close to the Whaler's village and their restaurant Tropica was pretty good and right on the ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Bad room location”
Reviews.Author: EdR1956
Reviews.Content: This was the first visit to our timeshare at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas North (9/23 to 9/30) since our purchase. Although the resort was nice, the room location we were given soured our stay. For those interested, our room number was 6442 (Building 6, 4th floor, Room 42). This end of this building is located adjacent to the maintenance and receiving facility where the facility has a generator than ran 24/7. The generator was loud enough to drown out our attempt to have a normal conversation let alone hear music from inside our unit while sitting out on the balcony. In addition, morning deliveries started around 7:30 a.m. which made it difficult to sleep in. As a timeshare owner, I requested more than once to be moved to another unit and was told the resort was full. However, during our evening walks, we noticed quite a few units in other buildings that were dark, which I did mention on my last request. Again I was told the resort was full. I do not know if other owners have complained, however, I cordially invite any corporate executive to stay in this unit for a few days just to experience what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids-not fancy but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: ykodama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the North Tower for a week from 8/26-9/2. The front desk people were always nice but at check in never explained that beach towels were available and I had no idea about the towel cards. They are very useful to have for the beach and pool. I figured it out after watching people exchange towels with their towel cards. I wish I knew when the house keeping people were supposed to come. They just make the beds and do very light cleaning. The room was nice but the kitchen appliances were not that great. The coffee maker was moldy smelling and the only coffee available was Starbucks, which is strange since there is great local Hawaiian coffee! Their idea of green living was strange- not encouraging the changing of sheets- to be green. It seemed like it was more for the Westin to save money because there were plenty of non-green things happening at this resort! The rental station people were nice except for some who treated me like a rich tourist constantly pushing Maui Jim sunglasses on me. They also push the tea tree aloe lotion too. I did not like how they kept saying I could charge it to my room. It doesn't make it less expensive! I finally bought the tea tree aloe lotion because I needed it. Also the lounge chair and umbrella rental is 45$ per day and necessary with kids on a beach but expensive if you need it every day! The snorkel gear that we rented was not that great either and that was about $30 a week as was a boogie board. My daughter kept getting water in her snorkel. We eventually rented from Boss Frog and they were more attentive about the fitting of the snorkel. My kids who are 7 and 10 loved it here though and loved the water slide and pools. The nice part is that it doesn't feel pretentious but its expensive for what it is. The food which is mediocre is overpriced; The only deals are during Happy Hour where some of the appetizers are half priced. My room faced in and I couldn't deal with the second hand smoke wafting from other people's balconies. Once I turned off the air conditioner I was never able to turn it back on again. My one phone in the bedroom had a bright blinking red light that I couldn't turn off. It was possibly broken and I just unplugged it and used the phone in the kitchen. I couldn't be bothered to call housekeeping to keep fixing these minor problems. I would say their beds were comfortable but this is not luxury. It is like suburban living on a beach front property with heavily chlorinated pools filled with kids. The views are amazing but I couldn't stop feeling sad about the way it used to look 15 years ago, when there were less hotels and the coral reefs were healthier and there were more fish. I don't know if I would go back although the kids had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: CopperBoyBJCM
Reviews.Content: Our 4th visit to this Westin was another great experience! View was amazing. Sports bar is very nice for football watching. Pool is perfect temperature on the north side. Free shuttle service is a bonus. It will take you to Whaler's Village and Lahaina. Can't go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn D
Reviews.Content: We arrived on September 15th at this hotel 3 hours prior to check in. Alex at the front desk greeted us. Alex took good care of us and gave us a room with an ocean view and allowed us to check in immediately. This was nice as we saw other guests being turned away for a few more hours. Since we have been travelling since 3:00 am this was very nice. We stayed in the North Towers and while the rooms were newer and nice, they were a bit removed from things. Additionally, Alex didn't mention he was giving us an ADA room. Initially this was a bit of a turn off but the view made is easy to over look it. The only real gripe is have is that the closets are TINY and that the games being played at the pool for shade at 7:30 in the morning is a JOKE. Towels marking chairs and no people to be found for those chairs until around 11:00 am. Also the resort is kinda spread out and where this room was located was a bit of a HIKE to everything. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: StarWatcher
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Westin Resort Villas in mid September. Upon arrival we were taken care of immediately by staff. They brought our groceries up to our room for us. Check in was a breeze. We had a lock-off booked and they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom villa in the South towers. It was beautiful, relaxed, very clean and well maintained. The room was beautifully decorated and new. The grounds were lush and the pool area was beautiful too. The beach was great and close by. It was very relaxing. The staff were so attentive and helpful. The concierge made dinner reservations for us every night to wherever we wanted to go. It was such a peaceful time for my husband and me. This was our first time here and we are seriously thinking about going back next year. The ONLY negative I could find was that they charged to use lounging chairs and umbrellas at the beach. It was very expensive. 20.00 per day for an umbrella and 45.00 per day for lounge chairs and umbrella. We thought that was a bit much. Other than that, I can think of nothing else negative. I highly recommend anyone going to this beautiful and fabulous resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBC10
Reviews.Content: Family really enjoyed staying here. Kids could play in pool and just walk over to the beach when they wanted go snorkelling or just play in the ocean. Loved being able to cook in the kitchen and use the barbecue to cook the steaks. Nice friendly staff - thanks for the loan of the boogie boards. Really liked being able to use the departure lounge so we could store our luggage and take showers before leaving on our late flight. Also meant being able to spend another day at the pool. Only draw back was lack of clarity about what mid-week cleaning meant and when it would occur. But would definitely go back to this hotel. Room was spacious and well-laids out. Liked the big bathroom with separate shower and tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Todd T
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just got back from a great vacation at the Westin Kaanapali Villas. This was our first visit to the resort and we look forward to going back. We received especially great service from Jason Kapono at check-in which kicked off a fun 5-night stay. We would highly recommend the resort, our 2 kids (ages 2 and 4) loved it. Only drawback was the early check-out time and somewhat cramped workout facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Very posh and selective.”
Reviews.Author: DiamondSuave
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ambiance! Quiet and peaceful, I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Just an Average Experience for a High End Resort”
Reviews.Author: monsterd131
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a one week stay at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas from 9/17-9/24 and with having high expectations, just turned out to be just an average resort. I am a Worldmark owner, and trade in through Interval International. Last year, we got into a 3 Bedroom Ocean View at the Marriott Ko Olina Resort on Oahu, so was hoping similar or better expectations with the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. We flew out a few days early and stayed 2 days on the Kehei side at our home timeshare, Wyndam Worldmark Resort, which we were able to get a 3 bedroom for a family of 7, which was 4 adults and 3 kids. This resort is clean and average, and met our needs. We came in a few hours early on Saturday, 9/17, to check into the Westin Resort, and when you arrive, we came to the South Lobby first, and the bellman at the front will tell you which section you would be staying, whether North or South Section, and we found out the South Tower is where we would be staying. We checked in at the front lobby and the front desk receptionist started out being nice, and then gave us our room and briefly explained that because we used Interval International to exchange into the property, we would only get to stay in the South Tower areas, and the North Towers were reserved for owners only. So she gave us our room, which was in Building 4, then tells us we were in room 4011/2012, saying it was a good room with a view. I asked her if it was on the 1st floor, then she says no...you sit up a bit. She said this was the only room available for a 2 bedroom connecting unit, so figured would check it out. Well...we walked over to the room and was nice, then went to the balcony....which overlooked the circle driveway entrance to the South Tower, and was basically floor level. She said there was a view...but if you turned, the only view you saw was the South Tower bulding entrance, then just trees. We went back to the lobby and met another Front Desk Receptionist, who took her time in finding us a different room. She says she was moving other people around to accomodate us, and she got us on the 2nd floor of Buliding 4, rooms 4207/4209. We went up, and it was somewhat better, where we got up to the 2nd floor and got a direct view of Kahekili Beach Park in front, then if you sat in the living room on the couch and look around the trees, you would get "some" ocean view. We figured we would keep this room for the week since we wouldn't be in the room that much. Resort was nice and we did enjoy the facilities of the pool (Pictures of the Pirate Ship Pool in the middle of the resort is misleading...our 4 year old thought he was too big for it. The pictures on the site make it look alot bigger than it really is). When using the water slide at resort, we had some issues as some of the other reviewers complained about, which was inconsistency with the rules of the Pool Boys. The 1st time we went, we saw families catching their younger kids at the bottom of the slide, so we did it as well with our 4 year old son (who could swim ok, but just needs a little help). The next day we tried it, I did the same, the Pool Boy then says, no one is allowed to stay at within the roped in areas to catch their kids and then he says if I stood outside the ropes near the drop off point, and my kid swims to me, that would be ok...so I did this a few times, which got old, so we left. We stayed in the pool area, and another mother and daugher with a little girl about the same age, but could not swim, went down the pool and the mother was there for about 20 minutes in the roped area catching her kid. My son then wanted to go back down the slide, but just told him didn't want to deal with the Pool Nazi, so left to the pool near the North Tower. By the way, the 3rd pool, which is through two buildings from where we were in bldg 4..its a hike, but it's the best pool of all three at the resort. However, they call the pool a Lazy River....it is no such thing....just a pool with a few turns here and there, with no current. The other issues that came up, which is mentioned by other reviewer is ANT PROBLEMS. Day 3 into our trip, we noticed Ants coming up by the living room tv, and behind the dining tables, as well as the kitchen walls. We complained the maintenance man was going to spray our room after we ate dinner, but the canned spray he brought smelled, so he said he would come back when we were out. The next day, as we were leaving for the pool, I guess Westin brought in the Professionals, Orkin Exterminators to spray our room. Well, when they were done....they sprayed so much that you can see the pesticide dripping from the walls and counters, so I had to wipe it down so my son would not touch it. The funny thing is that nite....we STILL HAD ANT problems. The maintenance person that was going to initially spray the room came in the day after while we were out and sprayed again...and you know what....STILL NO HELP! At this point, we just dealt with it...making sure after we ate to WIPE EVERYTHING DOWN!!!! And this didn't help....so if you see any small dots on the walls in your room or kitchen....these are DEAD ANTS that the maids don't wipe down.....so you will have ant problems no matter what. The positive was parking was easy, which we parked in the lot by the Beach Park. Also, drinks at the hotels bars had good deals.....so that is another plus! On the last day, we understood check out to be by 10am, which was not a problem. We were just finishing up some things and got a knock on our door at 9:30am....it was Maid Service, asking if they can start cleaning the rooms already. We told him we were getting ready to leave...so he waited around a few minutes, then he got the hint it would take longer, so says he would come back after we leave. So overall, be careful, if you are paying for the resort...it is NOT worth the money, look elsewhere, maybe the Honua Kai Resort which is next door. We are somewhat lucky that we just traded in and only cost the exchange fees. So in comparing this to the Marriott Ko Olina resort, this was a huge step below in regards to quality. We will not be returning to exchange into this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Vacation at WKORV North”
Reviews.Author: Vacationlvrs
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to this resort and we were lucky enough to get upgraded to an ocean front two-bedroom villa (which is the one-bedroom with an attached studio villa). We had two of everything (washer/dryers, refrigerators, microwaves, etc.) We took our 24-year old son and his college buddy and they made good use of the studio. The lanais (balconies for you mainland folks) had spectacular views. We stopped by the Costco on the way from the Kahului airport and were able to make good use of the fully equipped kitchens and poolside BBQ facilities. A mid-week snorkel sail on the Terralani catamaran was a wonderful day trip. We also snorkeled right outside our villa on Kaanapali beach and saw lots of tropical fish and sea turtles. The staff at the Westin were extremely helpful during the entire visit. On Fridays, there is a beach front food/crafts market where you could pick up some nice gifts and garments. Will definitely return in a couple years.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Condos be aware of checkout times”
Reviews.Author: williesmom237
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a beautiful one bedroom condo in this Starwood Property using free nights accumulated from a promotion. No ocean view,...just views of the property but our room size was upgraded because we have Platinum status. The condo was comfortable and impeccable with a fully equipped kitchen, washer, dryer, and jacuzzi. I have two issues with the property. Their check out time is 10:00 am! They extended our check out time by a two hours because of our Platinum status but could only offer us a "lounge" after that. I had to fork out an extra "free" night to extend our stay by a few hours past the checkout time. Our return flight left for the mainland at 9:00 pm so we would have been stranded many hours without a room. My second issue was the lack of adequate parking. To make matters worse, many guests were selfish enough to take up two spaces with their vehicles. We would return to this property but would try to find an earlier flight home to avoid paying for an extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Mylin, the consumate professional at the Westin Ocean Front Villas”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: Mylin, the front desk receptionist at the South Tower of the Westin Ocean Front Villas was able to handle a very complex set of reservations and make a difficult trip traveiling with grandchildren into a memorable event that will last in the young children's memories. Starwood had difficulty in working through "Cash and Points" and we ended up with three different reservations. Mylin's care, courtesy and professionals showed through in pulling together this disparate reservations and providing us with the rooms and amenities a plantinum member is supposed to have. We are very appreciative of all that she has done. She has a great heart and cares for the visitors and their personal situations. Above all she goes beyond the norm when a situation that is troubling is recognized and her wit, kindness, and caring shows through. She is a role model that all at the Westin Ka'anapali would do well to emulate. The hotel is in a premier location, and for this time, the assistance and professionalism is what a world class resort should be.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for -”
Reviews.Author: rgh1949
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were finally able to schedule a long-awaited Hawaiian vacation with our youngest daughter and her husband. We spent several days in Honolulu visiting Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, the original Roy's and Top of Waikiki. Then on to Maui for a week at the Westin Resort. We found everything to be just as we hoped for, and one of the quickest timeshare check-ins we have ever experienced. Even the obligatory timeshare presentation was well-handled, with our presenter fully understanding our desire to be on vacation. We loved everything about the Lahaina area, and would welcome a return visit. We did stay in the North complex - not sure if there is much difference or not? Parking can be a bit of a hassle - we rented a full size and many spaced are marked "Compact Only". All in all, we liked everything about the resort - fine accommodations, multiple pools plus a great beach, good restaurants and bar services, excellent and friendly concierges and wonderful staff. We would definitely return there when we get back to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Probably will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Valleyxray
Reviews.Content: We had a partial ocean view which overlooked the park and empty lot next door. When we opened the back slider all we heard was traffic. The resort was way too big for our taste. Broke a sweat hiking back to our room. On a positive note the room itself was very quiet when back slider was closed, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Alex”
Reviews.Author: CCubedT
Reviews.Content: Alex at the front desk worked tirelessly to help us upgrade to a better view room. Made a good vacation great. We appreciated his initiative and effort on our behalf.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - great room and very nice property for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: JackR46
Reviews.Content: We had some free Starwood resort nights available to use, so I researched the reviews on Tripadvisor for all of the Starwood properties on Maui. I decided to stay here. From our experience, here's my comments (especially in relation to some other reviews that I checked and considered before booking here), We arrived late at night on Thursday, so when we checked in, we were the only people in line and were greeted courteously and efficiently. I am a platinum spg member, so I was offered a studio suite with a partial ocean view (which was what I had booked) or to be upgraded to a full one bedroom suite, but with no ocean view. I realize that all spg upgrades are dependent upon availability at check-in, so I am always pleased and appreciative when we are offered an upgrade. In some instances I am willing to pay extra or prefer to have a "view" room - other times not. In this case, since we were staying for 3 nights, I preferred to have some extra room rather than a "view". When the receptionist described the room - top floor, corner room, I was delighted, as I am a light sleeper and this sounded wonderful. I noticed at the time that the "Timeshare desks" near the check-in counter were closed. First impression of our room was "fantastic".
