You can check out the more-detailed reviews of the rooms from other members. Briefly, ours was very spacious, clean, well laid out, great bathroom, large veranda, etc. We unpacked, relaxed a bit and then went to bed (extremely comfortable mattress and pillows). It was then that we found out about what would be our only major complaint with our entire stay. Our room was on the highway side of the closest building to the highway. The sound proofing was not that great, as we heard a lot of traffic noise from the adjacent highway. I initially thought that there might even be an open room window to allow so much noise to come in - but there wasn't. Also, apparently one of the things-to-do while in Maui is to rent a motorcycle and drive around on the island. So there is more noise from cycles than one would usually expect. I felt like we were in Los Angels next to a freeway. I pulled out the earplugs and eventually got to sleep. The next morning, I asked my wife if she wanted to see about changing rooms, but she said we were already unpacked, so let's just stay. The other bad thing about having that heavy traffic through much of the day, was that in the evening when we wanted to just sit out on the nice veranda and enjoy the atmosphere, the noise of the traffic made us just go back inside. I know that the resort has no control over this traffic, but if you have a choice, other areas of the hotel may be more secluded from the traffic noise. Here's my responses to some other reviews (1) We had no problems with noise from other guests - but we were not in a high traffic area for other guests nor near the spa or pool (2) All the staff members were friendly and courteous to any request (3) We were not pressured into a timeshare presentation (4) I do not know about pool charges, pool activities or ease in getting gazebos, grills, etc. We walked through the pool area a number of times, especially on the way to take walks along the beach. The pool did often appeared to be quite busy.(5) We had no problems with anything in the room (6) I did notice that when I walked through the reception area a little after 4:00 PM on Sunday, the check-in line was quite long and all the "timeshare desks" were busy. I assume that many people may book their stay for an entire week (Sunday to Sunday?) and check-in time is not until 4:00. So, if possible I would recommend that when you arrive in Maui, if at all possible, you find something else to do first and then check in at the resort later in the day - unless you don't mind (or don't have a choice) waiting in long lines tor check in. Of course, maybe that was just due to a big group or tour or some event where lots of people were checking in all at once? (7) We drove by the other Starwood properties, just to check them out, but we did not go inside nor try to use their facilities. All-in-all, other than the highway traffic noise, this Starwood property was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best”
Reviews.Author: CtJbl
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased with our week-long stay at this resort. I will not go into too much detail since many of the other reviews more than adequately cover the amenities, etc., but I do want to take a minute to recognize the staff. Everyone we came into contact with at this resort was extremely helpful and attentive - and pleasant. Our thanks to Stephanie for her tireless efforts (and patience) to find us an ocean view room after 3 nights looking out on the resort entrance. We will most certainly return to The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas the next time Maui is our vacation destination!

Reviews.Title: “NOT Your Typical Starwood Hotel - Checked Out 8 Nights Early”
Reviews.Author: jcdnsd
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Starwood property -- we planned to stay for 9 nights and only stayed for one, as we checked out as soon as possible. In the past we have had great experiences with Starwood hotels -- you can usually rely on a set standard of nice accommodations, amenities and service. WOW. Not with the Westin Maui Villas. Yes, the entrance has your typical Westin appearance, but once you get to the pool area(s), it feels like a really bad water park -- overwrought with large groups of partying parents (think wife-beater tanks, white sunglasses and backward baseball hats) with running, screaming, unattended children. We were taken to our room, which overlooked one of the pools, and I almost started crying (and NOT tears of joy) when we stepped out on the balcony and it literally smelled like old fried food and smelly diapers. Our daughter (yes! we have small children) said, "you can still hear the kids with the door shut." Not the way we wanted to spend 9 nights in Maui. It was too late to find other accommodations that night, so we elected to stay and see if things got better. Nope. Around 6:15 p.m., we headed downstairs to one of the only places open for dinner. The surly hostess asked if we had a reservation, as the "6:30 p.m. FEEDING" was about to take place. We stood aside as large masses of people came scurrying down to get in line -- like cattle on a low budget cruise ship. Blech! We were SO over the Westin Villas at that point. We happily drove away the next morning and will never go back. If you are considering this place, b/c of the kitchen and washer/dryer, but you also want to experience the peace and beauty of Hawaii, do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor-No more”
Reviews.Author: paul9762
Reviews.Content: Checked in for a 12 night stay, big time disappointment. I've been coming here for the last 5 years (and was a huge fan, recommended several friends) booked my stay 6 months in advance. I specifically requested buildings 2,3 or 5. I paid for an ocean view, I'm starwood gold (means nothing). They put me in building 4. Take a look at the picture. This is ocean view. Maybe if u brought a 30 foot ladder. I spent 45 minutes at the front desk with them trying to fix the situation, but to no avail. So now i am moved to another room with an island view but still paying for the ocean. I won't be coming back.They don't stand behind there product. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Yes! Bits of No!”
Reviews.Author: lwoodoe
Reviews.Content: As grandparents, this was our first vacation with our newest grandbaby,(6 months) so accommodations and location were more crirtical than usual. The Westin Ocean Resort Villas i were just right. I reserved two villas, side by side, and the crib, high chair and wireless Inernet were complimentary. The full kitchen and laundry facilities in-villa were exactly what we were looking for during this family vacation. The view of Lanai and Molokai from the Westin beach is beautiful. The beach access and poolside amenities were wonderful, esp,. for folks with lots of "family" gear! The hotel provides a "green card" program so that opting for no housekeeping for a day provides one villa with one coupon for $25.00 toward the wonderful, fresh breakfast buffet poolside. Also, the gas grills by the beach/pool area are well maintained and easily accessed from the villas. We used them a lot. The only issues- the large flat screen TV in the main living area of our villa ( headquarters!!) had no volume, and the pipes of one bathroom sink were quite loud--were immediately fixed after one simple phone call. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible all the way around”
Reviews.Author: JMWorldTour
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19 month old son and i stayed in the north tower villa. Platinum spg earned us an upgrade to 1 bedroom (vs the studio) which was perfect! The kitchen was great for breakfast and a few dinners during our 10 day stay. There is a dishwasher, microwave, stove top (no oven) and full fridge/freezer. Large patio with table for 4 and many gas grills on the property to BBQ. There is also a washer/dryer which was a pleasant surprise and I used it often. Would have packed much less if I knew we had free, in unit laundry. The beach access is easy and beautiful. There are multiple pools for kids, adults or both and good restaurants on the property. The entire staff was extremely friendly and it's as if they took their training in the 4 seasons school of incredible hospitality. The location on Kaaba ali was convenient to many other activities on the island, but I would have been completely fine just staying put on the Sheraton property. Wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort for our family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: boysrthebest
Reviews.Content: This resort hotel was so gorgeous and incredible! It really made our vacation the BEST! At the time of our visit, our sons were 8 months and 4 years old. The beach access, the modern decor, the whole atmosphere really was exceptional. There's plenty of swimming to do in different areas of the resort. Their's also a separate kid-friendly area for swimming with a pirate ship! This place is pretty kid-friendly and has a kid's club for older children too, with activities. The restaurants, the food, the service - all impeccable! If you want to eat in your suite, the small kitchen really is great. It's also so helpful to have a refrigerator and dishwasher available when you have young children (bottles, etc.). That's a big reason we picked this place. They really made the suites classy and modern. My husband has been to Hawaii 5 separate times and said it was the best place he's ever stayed at in Hawaii. I've been twice and I have to agree!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL- Stay in the NORTH Section”
Reviews.Author: cgeorgo
Reviews.Content: Without re-writing luvtotravel2840's review word for word (you hit it on the head!) I will just say that the Westin Kaanapali Villas are GREAT, do not get it confused with the Westin Maui. We were in the North section, every room is ocean view, the "main" section has island views (aka parking lot). We requested this in our reservation, we also requested a high floor and were given floor 5, out of 6 :) The studio was enough for us for our honeymoon, it still had the washer/dryer, full size fridge, whirlpool tub, balcony ect. The bed really is Heavenly. Pools are great, very large, beach is BEAUTIFUL, we wish we would have rented the chairs and umbrella on the beach more times, we didnt make time until the last day. The other section of Kaanapali beach, down by the Hyatt is not NEARLY as nice, it stunk like stagnant water and there were a bunch of nuts in the sand. North of Black Rock is the place to be! The drive to Lahaina isnt bad and there is a shuttle from this resort. We took the shuttle to the Westin Maui for the Luau so we didnt have to drive after the $100, er' I mean "free" mai tai's. We didnt eat at the Italian place but did get snacks and drinks from the pool bar. $6 drinks of the day and $4 mai tais at happy hour, not bad for a resort on Maui...although we DID find $2 mai tais at Famous Daves (he he) Get some food and BBQ on one of the grills, very nice set up and then wander out to watch the sunset. Maybe it was the time of year we came (Sept 3-12) and everyone else was back home getting kids ready for school but it wasnt super busy, we scored shaded lounges 3 out of 7 days, and moved to shaded ones later in the day a few times... My only complaints (and they are more like minor annoyances): - The hot tub by the water slide was unbarably HOT, so we couldnt even sit in it (the other one wasnt this way), -The elevators seem to be in strange places, the halls were a bit "mazelike" and we never quite figured out a quick way to get to our car even though it was parked directly below our room... I am rating the spa as "Average" due to the high price for what I personally experienced... all I got was a standard "heavenly manicure" and it was about 20 minutes for a polish removal, tiny hand massage and re-polish. My technican was a sweet heart and I enjoyed talking with her but $68 after all was said and done was a tad high for what I had done. The spa was very clean, and modern though. And I will say we NEVER EVER were approached about a timeshare- I also think this is another attribute to staying in the North Section, the timeshare office seems to be in the "main" building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful low key resort”
Reviews.Author: Familyfunn2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a studio unit with a small kitchen. We were there for a week at the end of August. We have stayed on the main Kaanapali beach before, this one is just past Black rock to the North. We loved the location, easy walk back to the main part to Kaanapali. The hotel was beautiful and employees very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort - BEST beach on Maui”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel2840
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Maui part of our honeymoon and LOVED it. The resort is gorgeous with an amazing open air lobby that looks out to the ocean. We stayed in a studio king that overlooked the pool & grounds (and a sliver of the ocean). The room was very spacious, modernly decorated and the amenities were very nice. We had complimentary laundry detergent and dishwasher detergent, which was perfect to wash our swimsuits and glasses that we used. The full sized fridge was very useful and my husband loved having an ice machine in the room. Even though it was just the two of us, these extra amenities are nice to have when traveling with a family. The resort is centrally located, near the fun little town of Lahaina. The resort offers a free shuttle to and from the town which is very nice considering parking is a a minimum and very costly. Overall a great location and close to other attractions and things to do. Now onto the reason why you come to Hawaii... the ocean! The resort is right on one of the best beaches in the world, Kaanapali Beach. We were able to go to a few other resorts while we were here for different activities, and what we noticed and favored about the Westin Villas is that there are no stairs to have to climb to get to the ocean, no sand dunes to jump over, the ocean is literally steps away from the resort. You can also rent kayaks, snorkel gear, stand up paddles, inner tubes, anything you want and the prices are pretty reasonable (i think it was like $30 to rent snorkel gear the whole week). If you don't want to go in the ocean, there are tons of pools (and one designated only for adults - although it's not in the sunniest of places). There are also tons of lounge chairs close to the pools, and we never worried about having to save chairs or having chairs available at any time of day. When I come back to Maui I would stay at this hotel again - worth every penny! I also want to mention that we are not timeshare owners or ever have any intention of purchasing one. We LOVED how we were not hassled to buy one, consider it or even look at the details. I got the feeling that if you wanted to seek that part out you could, but they will leave you alone if you don't. Worth every penny! PS - If you have time, do a tour from Hawaiian Paddle Sports. We did the south turtle town kayak tour and it was the best kayak/snorkel tour I have ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean view resort”
Reviews.Author: kaloooha1
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was gorgeous. The resort was fabulous they have everything a person needs and wants. The kids club is expensive but you can join activites like the feeding the koi fishing or learn to play the ukulele.the pool is big and beautiful.the westin has many significant things but there is a down side the Westin charges the guest for everything. We had to paid for beach chairs,umbrellas and pool toys for my boys. This is ridiculous, as a guess at Westin at least they can provide us with chairs and umbrella it is a beach front property but over all the westin was a fun and exciting trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amenities (plus you can use SPG points to boot!)”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with this timeshare. Had all the kitchen stuff we wanted (fridge, stove, oven, dishes, etc.), which is a BIG bonus on Maui, as the price to eat out is so darn expensive. We hit the Costco and saved a ton on our vacation experience. Location was great (Kaanapali beach). They had a shuttle to the other SPG properties nearby (Sheraton Black Rock and Westin hotel). The villas were really spacious. Full kitchen. Nice decor. Plus, we used SPG points for the stay (I think 12K per night). Most other hotel programs either make it very difficult to use points for vacation villas, or they cost a TON of points. Not SPG. Great value. Also, we were upgraded for FREE to a full Villa (usually you get a studio for SPG points, but we got a free upgrade ... note I am not an elite member with SPG, so this was really nice). Great stay. Great villa. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a fabulous hotel in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Jtbrnc
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 teenage daughters and I stayed at this beautiful hotel in July. We were so impressed with the exotic surroundings the minute we walked through the front entrance--a giant waterfall with pink flamingos and swans in the pool below. It made the long flight to Hawaii well worth it. Even though the pool was a little chilly it was gorgeous. My kids spent a lot of time on the watersides. They also had fun with activities like parasailing and surfing. The beach was beautiful and the waves were fun to body surf on. One of the hotel guests graciously gave us their boogie boards and snorkeling equipment as they were leaving. (we passed them on to other guests when we left). The weather was so wonderful we chose to spend most of our time outdoors, but we had lovely rooms with spectacular ocean front views to return to in the evenings. We never went hungry with the great restaurants in and around the hotel in Whalers Village right next door. This was definitely a vacation to remember. Want to go back right now after writing this review!

Reviews.Title: “Best timeshare on Maui”
Reviews.Author: bdogma
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this resort. It is beautiful but we got the street side parking lot/highway view in Bldg 4. The view of the mountain from our high 6th floor was great but it was very noisy with the constant traffic so we did not use the lanai at all. Apparently, if you do not own a timeshare there, this is the view that you get and the staff are very upfront about that. Owning a Starwood timeshare anywhere should give a better advantage for views (although did not help us). It was fine because we were not in the room very much. Some of our family had difficulty sleeping at night due to the noise though. As "green" as most of the Westin's are, we found it odd that there were several bathroom lights all on one switch so you had to turn all of the lights on at the same time regardless which part of the bathroom you use.. It seemed very wasteful of the expensive electricity on Maui. The 2 bedroom room was clean, updated and very spacious (at least 1200 sf). The entry was nice as it completely separated the two units for privacy and the doors could be left open to adjoin the rooms. Starwood timeshares are great but I was a little disappointed in a concierge for the first time ever. We are not hard to get along with by any means and when I simply asked where to see the sea turtles, a woman basically responded, "there are no guarantees that you will ever see one so go to the aquarium..." and was very arrogant and it was very obvious that she did not want to help us. This was our first encounter with a snotty concierge person with Starwood. Later another concierge told us about the various beaches where we might spot some turtles and was quite pleasant and helpful. There is a concierge in each building lobby which was very nice for questions or booking activities so you don't have to walk to the main building and stand in line. The food and drinks were good but pricey except for the pool restaurant. The beach is dog friendly (which we liked) but very busy so we went to Lanai by ferry for a quiet beach. Free parking was great - we used the underground parking directly under our building. Internet worked well and is included. We would stay here again even with the parking lot view!

Reviews.Title: “Great week”
Reviews.Author: Carole S
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Mylin at the check-in desk, our trip began with a room that had a beautiful ocean view. and balcony. Mylin had listened to us chat about coming from Arizona (lots of sand, but no surf!). We had hoped we would get some view of the ocean but were ready to accept what was available because we were staying in a studio. She was attentive and so helpful. Our stay continued to be one of the best vacations we have had in years. The service staff from check-in to check-out was outstanding. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - some minor maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: Garysgirl03
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at this resort. Great location - perfect for snorkeling or walking along the beach. The shuttle to Whaler's Village and Lahaina is also very convenient. Our room was a studio in building six in the north villas, overlooking the koi pond, the pool, and the ocean in the distance. We loved this room location, and enjoyed sitting out on the lanai and watching the koi fish and the neat-looking bird that lives by the pond. The room was also very quiet and made for a restful night's sleep. We stayed here last year in the same type of room (North Villa studio), and had no problems at all. This year, however, our room had several maintenance issues - it became sort of a game to see what would go wrong next! Immediately upon checking in, we noticed that the safe was not working, which we reported to the front desk the next morning as we were headed out, and they told us we would need to be in the room for them to fix it. We called when we went back for lunch, and the people who tried to fix it were very apologetic and friendly, but they were unfortunately unable to fix it after two hours(!) of attempting to do so. At that point, we just wanted to get on with our first day in Maui, so we decided to just forget about it, though the lack of storage for our valuables made us a bit uncomfortable. Other maintenance issues were a broken coffee maker that spewed coffee all over the floor on our first morning, a very worn iron that leaked water and had a deteriorating coating that flaked off on the clothes, a cordless phone handset that didn't work, and a rather temperamental icemaker. Lastly, the dresser was off balance somehow and tilted so that if you put any sort of weight (such as two pairs of shorts) in two of the drawers, they wouldn't stay closed. Someone had apparently attempted to fix this at some point by wedging some napkins under one of the legs, but this "fix" did not work, and we were unable to use those drawers. We did not report any of these other maintenance issues to the front desk during our stay, since they didn't bother us too much and we knew by then that we would have to be in the room for any of them to be fixed. We did tell them upon check-out so that they would have a chance to fix things for the next guests, and they were again very apologetic. Maintenance issues aside, we would certainly stay here again, but next time, we will make sure everything is functioning in the room prior to unpacking and settling in!

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement, rude manager and average rooms”
Reviews.Author: CCW75
Reviews.Content: Room - We booked through Westin's 1-800 number, specifying that we wanted an ocean view room and in particular one from which we could stand inside of and see the water. We had read one review noting that their room was sold as having an ocean view, but in fact can only see the water from the balcony. When we checked in, the rooms we were given faced an interior courtyard. When we noted the discrepancy, the receptionist said - with a straight face - that these were in fact ocean view rooms because one end of the courtyard was open towards the water. We were skeptical, but willing to give Westin the benefit of the doubt and at least see the room. Unfortunately (for us), we found that a tree blocked the end of the courtyard towards the ocean. No view of the ocean was possible from the room nor from the balcony - even when (literally) leaning over the side, standing on our tip toes on the balcony, etc. The receptionist and (later) two managers confirmed to us that this was not a mistake. Our assigned room, and many other rooms with no ocean views, are classified as ocean view rooms and sold as such. The rooms that actually have ocean views are called "ocean front" rooms and are solely reserved for time share owners. The receptionist tried to "help" us by sending us to another ocean view room (which did at least have a distant view of the ocean). However, while examining that room, another family arrived who was surprised to find us in the room that they had specifically reserved a few months in an advance.. The receptionist then sent us to another ocean view room from which one can only see trees and car parks, and again, not a sliver of the ocean to be seen. After that, we were told by a manager that we were welcome to move to another hotel if we wanted to see the ocean from our room, since the Westin Vila Resort had no rooms for non-owner guests from which the ocean could be seen. We called a few hotels (Sheraton, Hyatt, Ritz, Four Seasons) but all were fully booked if we wanted two adjoining rooms with ocean view. We then understood why the manager could not care less about us - we didn't have a lot of choices. We finally found rooms in another hotel that would become available after a couple of days and told the manager that we would be happy to move. It was at that point that the manager said they would try their best and then found us a room with a view of the ocean (which apparently was an "ocean front" room). Bear in mind that even the "ocean front" rooms partially face other blocks of rooms due to the angular way in which the Westin Villas have been constructed. We have stayed in other resorts which had fully ocean facing rooms, but the Westin Villa's structure trades this benefit for maximizing the number of rooms which (theoretically) allow a glimpse of the ocean from at least some angle of the room or balcony. The manager promised to charge us (lower) "island view" rates for the first two nights that we were stuck with no ocean view. We asked to review the bill a couple of days early to make sure he had done what he agreed. Not only was the credit not given to us, but Westin had added so many debits and credits that the bill was incomprehensible. Of course, the total came up to be higher than what it should have been. The billing was the last straw. I had a fit because we lost so much time walking around the compound looking at different rooms, liaising with the staff about the rooms, looking for another hotel to move, and then trying to sort out the billing. In the end, Westin took off the room charge for the first 2 nights. Service - quality of service varies greatly from person to person. We have never seen such great variation at a hotel. I believe this comes down to poor management and poor staff training, and as a result quality of service comes down to your luck and the individual. The first manager snubbed us (his attitude was more or less "too bad, so sad" until we found another hotel which could accommodate us after the first 3 nights) whereas the second manager tried to help. Customer reps on their in house "service express" line can be very friendly or very rude. As an example, housekeeping forgot to clean our room one day. I called to ask for someone to come in 2 hours but was told to call back when I was ready. I said I will be ready in 2 hours. The customer rep repeated that I should call back then and hung up the phone on me. Housekeeping staff always seem unhappy. Cleanliness - poor. The housekeeping forgot to clean our rooms twice. When they did come, they only did the most noticeable parts, such as the bedding and the towels. They didn't always vacuum and never cleaned the countertops in the kitchen (unless they deliberately kept the mess on the floor and the countertop). Pots I pulled out of the dishwasher were not clean, when they did not just leave the used pots on the stove. They have even forgotten (giving them the benefit of the doubt) to clean the sink so it was filled with debris. Places such as the back of the make-up mirror were covered with dust. I normally would not have noticed that had our baby son not tried to play with every thing. Rooms - Of the ones we've seen, some are tired (two of the rooms we saw had sofas with threadbare cushions) and lack maintenance whereas others are new and reasonably nice. Ground - well manicured and pretty. It also has a nice pond with beautiful fish. Restaurants - only three, not many choices on their menus either. Food in all three is fine. Not spectacular but not bad either. Pools - a bit small for such a large compound. Beaches - good snorkeling, nice sandy beach with reasonably calm water.

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui Vacation to date”
Reviews.Author: Latbrat16
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 12 days in Paradise. What started as a rocky trip ended beautifully. One day prior to leaving for Maui I developed pain in my neck. I wasn't about to give up on this trip. When we arrived at the Westin Kaanapali Resort Ocean Villas North I was in excruciating pain. The concierge (sadly I do not know her name) went to work to find me a chiropractor. The one she choose was great. After two visits and a week of frozen peas on my neck I was almost back to normal. As you can see the first week was not what I had hoped for. Finally I was ready for some fun. With the help, concern and upbeat attitude of Greg and Mike at the pool/towel service station my trip turned from not so great to wonderful. These two wonderful men never failed to ask how I was. They showed true concern for my being. The first week of our stay while I was down they took a little extra time to make sure that my husband was enjoying himself. The little conversations that always included laughter went a long way with someone who found himself trying to have fun alone. This dynamic duo went beyond the call of duty. They suggested great, reasonable places to eat (where the locals go), great places to snorkel and most of all, friendship. We are sure that Mike and Greg will do the same for any Westin guest. The Westin is a beautiful place to stay. A great place to enjoy the beach. Whether it be tanning, swimming, snorkeling, the Westin is a A+ place to stay. So in closing this review, go and enjoy wonderful accommodations, great swimming pools, fabulous beach, beautiful sunsets and very caring employees! We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Go see Ryan Fisher at Pailolo”
Reviews.Author: wonderful17
Reviews.Content: Ryan will take care of you at the bar at Pailolo. Chris will take care of you at ocean pool bar & grill. Service at this Westin is fantastic. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wehad a fabulous time and will definitely visit again”
Reviews.Author: kwright411
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort the week of August 28 through September 4 and had a fabulous time. We were up early every morning ready to enjoy our time by the pool. We would have liked to sit on the beach but were a little put off by the daily charge for the beach chairs and umbrellas, so made due with sitting by the pool every day instead. We enjoyed the pool side service for drinks and would like to give a special recognition to Kelsey. She was always very friendly and came around often throughout the day to ask if she could get us anything. My friends and I were in a two bedroom lockoff and I thought the rooms were very nice and pretty spacious but we didn't actually spend much time there. The only complaint we had is that there is only one light for the entire bathroom and when one person gets up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, they either have to do so in the dark so that they don't disturb the other person or turn on all the lights. I should note that I did have one issue with the Customer Service provided by the Front Desk staff at the end of my vacation that left a sour taste in my mouth. The night before checking out, I requested a copy of my bill just to review all of my charges for the week and found a charge that I did not believe was mine so I requested a copy of the receipt. After waiting for some time the associate at the front desk received it and said that it was billed to me in error and would be removed from my bill. However, when I get to my room, I receive a call from the front desk asking if one of the guests in my party is named XXX and says that the charge is for them. When I ask my guest if they made such a charge and they say no, I tell the associae that I will come down to review the receipt immediately. She says that is not necessary and she will leave a copy at the front desk for me to review the next morning when I am leaving. Well the next morning when I am leaving the receipt is nowhere to be found and another copy needs to be requested so once again I'm forced to wait for a copy of the receipt. (the chrages are still on my final bill) In the meantime, my shuttle has now arrived to take me to the airport and when I'm asking the associate if there is some way to speed up the process she says I can go get the receipt myself at the North Front Desk (I was staying in the South area). So I have my airport shuttle transport me to the North Area and there appears to be only one person on duty there, who is helping another guest and I can no longer wait. I immediately call to speak with the Manager and end up leaving a voice message. An hour and a half passes without a return phone call, so I call again. I finally reach the Manager and the charges are determined not to be mine, so they are finally removed from my bill. So although, everything was resolved appropriately, I think some improvement is needed in customer service. So despite these few issues, overall, we had a fabulous vacation and agreed that we would all visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: MelI92
Reviews.Content: As Starwood vacation villa owners, we always wonder if we will be treated the same if we exchange our home villa for one in an alternate location. This year we went to the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. After some discussion we chose the North villas over the South. Glad we did. If you are looking for a place to take children, we suggest the South Villas, with the pirate themed pool. As a couple without small children we found the North villas to be the better choice. Quieter for sure! We were greeted by the staff and were shown to a lovely one-bedroom villa with an ocean view. The villa was large and up to date in every way. Having mentioned that this trip was in celebration of a special anniversary, we were greeted by a bottle of champagne and a selection of chocolates in our room. We also received several calls throughout our stay from management inquiring as to our satisfaction. A couple of notes: First, for a good lunch, leave the property and walk north on the boardwalk to the Hanua Kai villas and visit Duke's. Great food (better than the westin). Second, avoid the on-property Pulehu restaurant at all costs. The food is mediocre and the service way below par. The wait staff, which seemed very unmotivated and unresponsive, repeatedly confused our order with another table's and didn't seem to care much about the mistakes. With that said, the on-site market is very good and the other service personnel, from water-sports to engineering demonstrated genuine interest in us as guests. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool side service”
Reviews.Author: KALibrarian
Reviews.Content: Kalolo Faiva and Sean Girady were great help at the South Shack gettign my family set up for snorkeling. The waters, beach, facility and amenities were all great. Shuttles into Lahaina and to Whalers Village made getting around easy, which you will probably want to use as the food at the Villa was expensive and not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place but common sense in customer service sorely lacking”
Reviews.Author: iprose
Reviews.Content: We are on our honeymoon trip right now, staying here for two weeks through an exchange of my stepfather's 2-bedroom condo in Cancun which he gave us as a wedding present. We are in a very nice one bedroom this week and are booked for a studio for our second week's stay. We were told repeatedly before arriving and at check-in that we could upgrade to a one-bedroom for the second week, but staff is now giving us the run around, making us move from our room to a smaller one in another building this Sunday, even though they confirmed that the very room we are staying in will be empty for several weeks after we check out. Seems like an unnecessarily unpleasant thing to do to anyone on a vacation, let alone a honeymoon, when it could easily be resolved if the resort wanted to do so. Not much explanation, just technicalities and refusal to do a kind service. Throwing a damper on an otherwise pleasant experience in a beautiful location. I expect more from a resort of this caliber and wouldn't take their word again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Beach Guru Harrison....”
Reviews.Author: christine d
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few days ago and our trip has been lovely. Everyone has been very nice, accommodations are perfect, weather has been spectacular. We spent the entire day on the beach yesterday underneath a comfortable big umbrella, and two fabulous lounge chairs set up for us by our wonderful Beach Activities Guru named Harrison. He welcomed us to the Island and made our first beach day extra special. Thank you Harrison : )

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service. Will return.”
Reviews.Author: Bravofam
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and by far the best. We stayed last year at the same time of year. We brought my mom this year to celebrate her 70th birthday. Our room was an upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom. The front desk girl was very nice and told us because they had the availability, they would honor our request. Our room overlooked one of the pools. This was fine and put us at a great location for pool, gym and beach access. We went green for half of our stay which reduced the amount of housecleaning days. They gave us an option of a room credit or complimentary breakfast. We took the breakfast. My mom unfortunately broke glass in our room and cut her feet. The staff responded quickly with Loss Prevention Supervisor Kevin bringing a medic to look over my mom and care for her wounds. They did a great job of calming her. This happened at the beginning of dinner. Mark G was the manager on duty and came to check on us. We were upset, tired and very hungry. Mark calmed us down brought in housecleaning and provided Dinner at Pulehu, a restraunt at the resort. The staff their spoiled us, especially my four year old daughter. Food is amazing by the way. Mark G and Kevin arranged for a Doctor to see her the next day at no charge to us. The manager the next morning was Jasmin who did a great follow up. The Westin did more than they had to and made this trip a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing Maui experience!”
Reviews.Author: marissacocores
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and we loved that we had a mini kitchen and washer and dryer. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We went to the beach and brought lunch in a cooler. The guy renting out beach chairs and umbrellas, Harrison, was so nice and gave us great service. Harrison gave us great tips on what to do while we were staying in Maui and fun things to do within the resort. It was easy to get rentals. We had so much fun paddle boarding, snorkeling, and kayaking. This is a great place for relaxing with friends or the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful site, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Will M
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time to this resort. It is situated on a great beach and convenient to both Kapalua, Lahaina and Whalers Village. The Westin has a free shuttle that takes you over the the Sheraton, Westin, Whalers Village and even downtown Lahaina. The activity booth on the hotel premises has everything you need for snorkeling, etc. There were baby sea turtles in the water in front of the hotel. We rented a covered awning and Harrison was extremely courteous and helpful with some great local information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Jared S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a fantastic time. The resort was well maintained, the staff was friendly and the units were extremely nice. The pool area was great, not too crowded, and the beach off the resort had some of the best snorkeling I have seen. The GM Angela Nolan has clearly put together a very fine staff with great detail. The daily drink specials at the pool bar for $5 - 6 was pretty good for a resort of this level. The breakfast was great too! Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: ColeenAnn
Reviews.Content: This trip was our second stay at the villas, and we could not have been more pleased! The grounds are beautiful and well kept, the staff is friendly and welcoming, the restaurants are excellent~everything you need for a perfect vacation! I have stayed a much more expensive resorts on Maui, but we will always come back to the Westin Villas from now on. In my opinion, the kitchen in the villa makes a huge difference in the vacation, both from a money saving and a convenience perspective. However, if you are in the mood to have lunch and drinks delivered poolside or an excellent meal in a restaurant, they have that to offer as well. All in all, a perfect vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Domlovedmaui
Reviews.Content: We have had the best experience at this hotel. It's our second time staying here and can't imagine staying anywhere else. I have to say Hannah at the front desk was amazing and made our stay even more delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting better”
Reviews.Author: Jsanzone23
Reviews.Content: From the outside the property looks wonderful and it truly a nice place. Unfortunately the cons far outweigh the proâ€™s of this resort. My family and I stayed for one week at the beginning of August. From the moment we checked in the staff was unfriendly and did not care about anything other than getting done and on with the next person as fast as possible. I have this pet peeve and donâ€™t appreciate being called buddy everyday at the towel shack. I have a hard time thinking that paying that much money for a stay here you should be called â€œbuddyâ€�. Time and time again I overheard the guys at the towel/beach rental shack curse and say derogatory things about women and their cleavage. Uncalled for in my book. Also if you donâ€™t get to a pool chair by 9 then forget about it. Overall there were numerous issues wrong with this resort and intimately it came down to the staff. This is everyone from the guys out front, to the check in staff and even the bar staff. For this I would gladly pay more money and stay somewhere else rather than here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Maxspeed
Reviews.Content: The staff are excellent in this comfortable, high quality hotel/condo. The rooms are spacious complete with spa, laundry and kitchen facilities. The BBQ area is clean and the guests seem to accommodate each others needs nicely ie people share the BBQ with no issues whatsoever. Stay and enjoy this beautiful, oceanside facility

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Property”
Reviews.Author: CalifWings
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to book this property as we usually stay on the other side of Black Rock. So glad we did! We loved the location. We always go to Maui over the 4th of July holiday. We booked a premuim deluxe oceanfront studio from an owner on Redweek. Loved the large windows on the two sides of the room. We do like having the kitchen for breakfast and drinks, but don't cook otherwise. We are on vacation! We were in building 2 room 2526. It was great having the elevator so easy access. We do love the Westins Heavenly Beds. In fact I ordered 4 pillows before we came home! Having the washer and dryer is great also. As we could only rent that room for 7 nights, and we were there for 8, we did book a single room using our SPG points. We were moved to building 3. We were dreading the room change-but boy did they make it easy! We went on to the beach and they called us to let us know the room was ready. They even moved our bags so they were there when we went to the new room. The room was not as nice but adequate.The room was a standard hotel room and the building was more run down, carpets etc. We love the beach location. We rented chairs and an umbrella everyday. I am a very begginer snorkeler, but I really enjoyed it on the days when the surf was calm. My husband body surfed and boogie boarded most days. We didnt use the pools much as we found the water to be a alittle gungy. Lots of children. But again we love the ocean and that is what we go for! We ate lunch at the sports bar and grill nearly every day for lunch. The bartender's were all friendly and fun to talk with . Ask for a Tropical Monkey! Great Nachos and Burgers also. Most evenings we drove into Lahiana for dinners. We love the Aloha Mixed Plate behind Safeway. Good value and great food. We found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Especially the water sports personnel. We loved it so much that we have already booked for next July! This will be the place we come back to when we vaction in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great room - nice location”
Reviews.Author: rtk56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in July on our honeymoon. The resort is lovely - and we were in a room in the more "quiet" area. Unfortunatley, we didn't have a balcony in our studio, but could see the ocean in the distance. The room was spotless - jacuzzi tub - and washer/drier combo which was very convenient. Were given the option of skipping housekeeping and getting a free breakfast voucher - but just one! Upon learning it was our honeymoon, the front desk agent gave us two vouchers. We also had a bottle of complimentary wine delivered to our room! The pool was very crowded - however, we were out there early, so were able to find seats. The beach is very quiet - great views. Our dinner at the Italian restaurant was delicious! And I had a pedicure at the Spa which was fabulous! It is somewhat crowded with a lot of kids at the main pool, but a very small complaint. Overall, a great visit - with friendly staff. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: EES_75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Westin villa property with our 6-month old daughter. At first we thought the resort seemed like Disneyland -- it is quite large, with kids and families everywhere. But the family-friendly atmosphere grew on us as we realized this is what much of our travel will be like in the coming years with our growing family. It was nice to be surrounded by so many other parents, grandparents, children and babies. The resort is well-located with a lovely, long beach great for taking long walks. The ocean is very calm in this area which is great for swimming and snorkeling. Our room was very nice. The kitchenette, microwave and washer/dryer were especially useful for the baby. We had housekeeping "refresh" the room once during our 5-night stay; I believe you can request service more frequently if you wish. We got a great deal here through Starwood - otherwise I am not sure we would have paid the high room fee for this type of a resort (so large and busy); it probably would have seemed overpriced. But the service really was great -- valet parking, concierge, etc -- all very helpful and friendly. And they do make things fairly affordable once you arrive - valet parking only $9/night, good happy hour specials, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A great condo experience with most of the amenities and services of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonn B
Reviews.Content: Our family usually stays at high end luxury resorts (Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, etc.). We chose to stay at this property because we got a good deal and thought we would give the "condo" approach a try as we have two kids that are getting older and a single room in a hotel can be a challenge. We were impressed with the quality of the rooms, the pool has a "hotel like" water slide for the kids and it is on a very nice beach in close proximity to shops and restaraunts (long walk or short drive). We also liked happy hour by the pool ($4 Mai Tais!) and enjoyed the option of having some meals in the room. We did not like that maid service was offered only every three days. Many employees went out of their way to be friendly and extra helpful, including Sheena at the front desk when we checked in. I usually just take care of the logistics at check in and try to move through the process as efficiently as possible. I found myself having a nice conversation with Sheena as she asked about my family and the kids, all without slowing down the check in process. Overall we enjoyed it and will likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: plswinters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the North Villas August 14th - 21st to celebrate my 50th birthday. We had a 1 bedroom villa in building 6 with a pool and ocean view. The room was great with a fully equipped kitchen. Since my husband is a fantastic cook we ate a lot of our meals at our villa on the Lani. There are large grills located on the property where we met many nice people that gave us ideas on where to go and what to see since they had been on Maui before. We purchased most of our groceries from Safeway (be sure to get a Safeway savings card, it's free) and found the prices for the things we purchased to be not anymore than other vacation destinations we have visited. We also purchased items at Farmland Foods and Times Market. Since we rented the property we had daily maid service and always found our room to be very neat and clean. It's also nice having a washer and dryer available. We enjoyed the pool area and especially the beach which has one of the best reef's we've snorkeled on before. The only negative was I was treated very rudely by a towel boy who said I was damaging the reef with my sunscreen and I needed to purchase their brand of natural sunscreen. I had not worn the sunscreen in the ocean but had put it on to use at the pool. Checkout is at 10am and we didn't need to be at the airport until 8pm so we were given key cards to use at a lounge room which allowed us to use the pools and beach until we needed to leave. The lounge has access to showers and towels, so we were able to enjoy another full day at the resort. My husband and I would recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Saralpo
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare at Atlantis Harborside for Maui. (Atlantis can't be compared to anything.) Maui is beautiful. The resort is the prettiest of the Starwood places I've been. the pools and landscaping are super. But, you get a studio for the price of a small one bedroom elsewhere, and ocean view included parking lot view. There also seemed to be a lot of nickle and diming. Every activity carried a fee.Still, if you have the opportunity Hawaii is Hawaii. It is a Westin, so you get a great bed, and there are two free shuttle buses that take you where you need to go locally. A car is not necessary if you aren't going to do much off property, but may be cheaper than taxis if you have a family with you.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Hjhair
Reviews.Content: I checked in yesterday with another family. We were checking 2 rooms that we wanted close together. In the computer they were reserved in buildings on opsite sides of this vast property. Hannah was the lucky one to help us with our demands. She was so patient and accomadating. She did finally get us in the same building just down the hall from eachother. Yeah for Hannah. And the rest of the trip is a fairytail and sunset ending and happy children...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views coupled with spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: Locke_it_Up
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort and I will definitely be coming back. My one bedroom villa was the perfect place to come back to after exploring Maui, but I could have easily spent my entire stay at the resort. The beds are exactly as they call them: heavenly. I tend to be a restless sleeper, but I didn't miss a wink of sleep during my 6 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Monk657
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights for our honeymoon. Great staff (front desk, concierge, cleaners, restaurant, bell staff) everyone greeted us saying hello and seemed happy to work there. Great buffet breakfast with lots of variety. Beach access, lots of pools with separate pools for kids. Also recommend the spa. Gym meets your needs and despite being small was not over crowded. Will definitely go back. Concierge staff were great resources for other places to go and eat and also arranged for extracurricular activities for us. I definitely recommend trying to catch the sunrise on Mt. Haleaakala...but be sure to dress for the temperature drop and being a camera (this is one opportunity to take a picture where you are literally above the clouds).

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: elijahice
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the resort villas - one trip to the south and second to the north. With that said, we knew what to expect. My wife and I travelled w my 4 year old daughter and 2 year old son. The room was pretty good. We stayed in building 6 on the fourth floor. There were 2 minor problems w the room. One was the block wall on the balcony. We had a room w an ocean view but the kids couldn't enjoy it because of the wall. Second, the heavenly bed was not as heavenly as I remembered. Other than that the room was fine. It was clean and had all the amenities. The bathroom and kitchen were great. The kids were able to sleep in the living room and leave mommy and daddy to their own room. The kids enjoyed having a tv in "their" room. Heck, by the end of the trip, my daughter was ready to make this a one way trip and stay in Hawaii. We made it a point not to argue with the front desk about the room and enjoy our vacation. A lot of people seem to make a big stink about room location which ruins the whole vibe of the trip. Hell, if you can't have a good time in Maui, I don't know what to tell you. With that said, the property location was great. We didn't go much further than lahaina which was ok with us. We spent more time at the resort than we have in the past. The kids really enjoyed the pool and beach adjacent to the property was perfect. Bottom line is we had a great time and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love it !”
Reviews.Author: Anna C
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui was fabulous. The Luau was definitely a 5 star event. I liked that we did not have wait in long buffet lines. The food was excellent and there was bottomless drinks included.

Reviews.Title: “Best pool complex on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Adventureparents
Reviews.Content: The pool, waterfall, watersides of this hotel are the best in Maui. We checked out the Grand Wailea and this is BETTER than their famous, overcrowded property which gets much accolade for being amazing. The Westin is clean, spacious and has the sound of the waterfalls that eliminates noise and creates peace. You can also turn your chairs around and face the ocean and have the best of both worlds. A few times, the pineapple man comes around with pineapple pieces for guests at the pool. The Koi pond is gorgeous and the kids can feed them in the morning which is fun too. Breakfast is free for kids under 3, 1/2 price for younger family members and true delight for a special, first day big breakfast. Just down the path, is Whalers village, and I would walk down to the ABC store for a less expensive option or drive/taxi to the Safeway for provisions after the first day. FYI - the water is great in Maui- bring your own reusable bottle and save money on bottled water! Another nice touch by the pool, the have small, free lockers for wallet, cell etc

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back! Heads up about the waterslide rules...”
Reviews.Author: Kate P
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a 10 day trip to Maui. This was our first time at the Westin Kaanapali. We loved the room, and the customer service from the bell desk and the front desk was great. The grounds were very impressive. We had a 1-bdrm in Bldg 3 with a pool and ocean view to the side...all very lovely to wake up to after such a long flight from Calgary. We found the bed very comfortable and the amount of room for us and our boys (ages 4 and 6) to be perfect. The kitchen was stocked with the utensils, pots, etc. that we needed. We were on the 2nd floor and part of our view looked onto the back of the Pool Cafe, but the noise from the restaurant was the only issue (wait staff dropping plates, etc.). Above ground parking was ample and easy to access. My only one issue with the hotel was with inconsistency with the rules about the water slide. The water-sports center that oversees the slide was inconsistent with what was allowed and not allowed. On the first day, my boys wore life jackets down the slide - just to be safe - and they had a blast; only to be told the next day - after 10 turns down the slide with their life jackets on - that they were not allowed to go down the slide with the jackets on, and the attendant overseeing the slide made them sit to the side (why not send them back down?) while I waited anxiously at the bottom because some time had passed since they had gone up. Then we were also told that we were not allowed to 'catch' our kids at the bottom of the slide - another inconsistency because throughout our 10 days there, we noticed some parents were allowed to catch their kids and some were literally scolded for doing so. Imagine having to explain that the rules are not always the same to a 4 and 6 year old! Also, kids who were going down the slide doing turns, etc. were not 'reprimanded'. There are actually rules on the board about doing things like that down the slide. Clearly, a blind eye was turned to many things. When I approached the water-sports center, they told me that there were liability issues. OK. I totally get that. However, if that's the case...make the rules consistent and visible and post it along with the other rules on the board. I was also disappointed that when I tried to reach the manager on duty, my call was never returned. I was able to speak to Cameron, the manager of the water-sports centre, who started to re-explain the liability issue, but we got cut off, and he never returned my call again. We paid a pretty penny for this resort and I would expect that calls would be returned and concerns would be followed up until closure. One other thing was that the cleaning staff missed doing our room one day. Other than that, only our sheets and towels were done the other days. Sticky sunscreened floors were a bit gross to walk on after 10 days! (cleaning should be provided every day for renters). Having said that, we did not let these inconsistencies ruin our trip, we enjoyed the ocean and beautiful beach that was only 2 minutes from our building and my kids had fun at the Keiki pool (pirate ship) even though it was a bit young for them. The location on Kaanapali Beach is fantastic! We also made use of the Late Departure Lounge which provided safe storage for our daypacks and the front desk was more than happy to provide me with a safety deposit box for our passports, etc. that we didn't want to leave in the lockers. It was easy to enjoy a full day on the beach and in the pool and be able to clean up before getting on the plane. I would not recommend eating there due to the outrageous cost for what you get. Use your kitchen and it will be well worth it! The community BBQs were also perfect. All in all, it was a wonderful trip with great service and accommodations. We would definitely stay at the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “the aloha spirit”
Reviews.Author: cyn1975
Reviews.Content: we try and stay at this resort when we go to Maui. Dee dee at the front desk treats guests as if they were family. Jessica the concierge goes beyond the call of duty. the property is beautiful and kept up. Every room is close to the beach. the gym is clean. the employees are friendly but Dee dee and Jessica are exceptional. A bit pricey but worth saving for.

Reviews.Title: “Labyrinth hotel with itty bitty parking spaces..and good luck finding your room when you're tired!”
Reviews.Author: Marcngin
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice enough but...parking after sunset at the north villas was frustrating as many of the spots were for compact cars (we had a Hyundai Santa Fe, not the biggest car ever made, but still) and people would take up ore than one spot by trying to park their cars in these compact spots, thanks. Now I usually good with directions, but I found myself really co fused by the similarity of the hallways and lack of signage to the parking garages. There were signs for the pool and lobby, so what about the parking lots? After a long day of exploring Hana or Haleakala, having to navigate these hallways was almost as bad....get some signage please! I like Westin properties usually, and I understand these are earmarked for time shares, but improvements should be made to accommodate all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great family location”
Reviews.Author: Tmarr35
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights here last week with my wife and 2 girls(6 & 3). First room not to my liking but Jason kapono at the front desk took great care of us. Agreed to an upgrade charge for ocean front room andcouldnt have been happier. Perg the bellman gave us great info, all around a greatvstaff who wants to make you happy. Only disconnect is that the front desk can't just move your rooms around. Perhaps because of their timeshare issues but very room change has to go through "room control" for any changes. Seemed like the great front desk staff would have been much better off handling the room switches instead of going through "oz" in room control.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HuntingtonBeach
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. There are two types of rooms here: the studio, and the 1 bedroom. We stayed in the studio, which was plenty big for the two of us, and with the fold out sofa you could easily add two small kids or one big kid. The bed is extremely comfortable, the appliances are new, the air conditioning is quiet and powerful, and the bathroom is huge. The kitchenette was a really nice touch- with a cook top, microwave, toaster, and small fridge/freezer, plus the bbq tools (and access to a bunch of bbqs around the property), you can make as many meals in the unit as you like, and you can easily warm up leftovers. There is plenty of parking in the basement, with lots of elevators. There are also free shuttles that go to Lahaina and the other Westin (to the south) to get you around. The pools are pretty good- there are some water slides and a pirate ship play area for the kids, and there is an adults only pool (although it is small and seems like an afterthought). The beach is only a few steps away, and actually has a very nice reef for snorkeling. Just head to the northern most portion of the property and swim out from there. The reef stretches for several hundred feet in both directions, and is very close to shore. There were eels, a turtle, and fish of all kinds. The waves are very gentle here, so it's kid friendly but don't let the little ones wander too far out- the reef is sharp and close to shore. Other nice touches: -Rooms are well insulated from noise (other than hearing the loud "clack" of your neighbor's door) -HBO included, as well as a DVD player (there is a Redbox down the street at Walgreens) -Free wireless internet -Washer and dryer in unit Minor nits to pick: -Each unit has a shared entryway which means that you have to use your key twice to get in your unit (once on the shared door, and then again on your own door). The shared entryway also means that you clearly hear the shared door and your neighbor's door close. We were awoken by our neighbor's door a couple of times. The plus to the entryway setup is that you are well insulated from any noise in the hallway. Of course, if you want to tweak your neighbor just wait for them to leave and then use the security bar on the shared door- they won't be able to get back in! -You can't just head down to the pool and ask for a towel- you have to get towel cards from the front desk. They keep track of how many cards are issued to each guest, and each card can be exchanged for a towel. A little surprising that the resort is so concerned about losing towels when the rooms are at this price point. -Not enough outlets around the room to plug in phones and laptops. -No iPod dock on the Bose system.

Reviews.Title: “Westin - just average”
Reviews.Author: marenostrum
Reviews.Content: I want to do justice to this very big investment on Kaâ€™anapali Beach. The Westin â€œproductâ€� is slightly different than the Westin Hotel system since this property is geared more towards timeshares than a hotel. During the 10 days that we stayed, the property was at 100% capacity and we experienced these service strains. The vast majority of guests were families with children. So, a tranquil spot may be a slight challenge to find. The beach does offer some repose to the packed hotel. I am sure that the experience would be very different in low/off season. The good news- - We had a one bedroom corner unit with a Mountain view. It was very spacious and comfortable. The internet/wifi is free and room service although it can take upwards of 1 hour, was very good. This permitted us to avoid the crowds. - Given that it is condo living, the local Safeway and the market across the street made for great food variety. - The fish and chips were surprisingly good and the Margherita pizza warmed in the oven after delivery was tasty. - The Concierge in each of the buildings is a nice feature. The mediocre news- - For such a large population and seven buildings, I was surprised with the limited restaurants on site. Yet, you can take a shuttle to the (Hotel) Westin and Sheraton for dinner. - This portion of Kaâ€™anapali beach is narrow and you have limited access to beach chairs & umbrellas (for which you pay). - You are regularly approach for time share solicitations. - Housekeeping services were erratic notwithstanding we were considered Hotel guests and should have had it every day. The bad news- - The beach services are woefully overpriced with $75 stand-up paddle lessons for 30 minutes or bogie board rental for $18 per day. - The beach chairs an umbrella is around $40 and get this...only until 4:30pm! They collect all items very early. - It is very hard to find pool chairs if you arrive later in the day (say after a morning excursion) With the pluses and minuses, we spent much time away from the property so that its shortcomings were not felt so much. Apart from the golf outings, we had an all day hiking expedition (Kayak & waterfall hike) www.hikemaui.com ; a sailing snorkeling trip to Molokini; an all day Lanai boat trip with abundant snorkeling and swimming www.mauioceanriders.com; a trip to Haleakala; naturally two days of two hour surf lessons from www.goofyfootsufschool.com with groups of max 5 people and many others around you; and the obligatory and well performed luau with excellent food in Lahaina www.oldlahainaluau.com . These activities are guaranteed to make your kids sleep at night! As for restaurants, we tried all three on property which were â€œokayâ€�â€¦tasty items were the pizza from the Italian Restaurant and the fish & chips. And it stops there. Other dining options that we experienced were as locals say ONO (good): Mamaâ€™s Fish House, a little far since you are going back to the airport, but worth the drive; Merrimanâ€™s at Kapalua, only 10 minutes away, dined twice, expensive great views and totally worth it; Longhiâ€™s Italian Restaurant in Lahaina, 10 minutes away with complimentary valet parking so that you can walk around after dinner; Pacific O & its sister restaurant Iâ€™O both located at 505 Front Street are very good. Pacific O offers great al fresco dining with a wonderful view. In summary, I think that when we go back to Maui, we will be exploring other lodging options, perhaps in Wailea or if in Kaâ€™anapali another hotel. Background- as part of our three week golf vacation, we stayed on three islands, three hotels and played 7 different courses totaling 12 rounds. On the Big Island, we stayed at Mauna Kea Beach hotel and played Hapuna, Makalei and Mauna Kea. On Maui, we stayed at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Villas and played Kapalua, Makena, Wailea Emerald & Gold. On Oahu, we stayed at the Royal Hawaiian but did not play golf. My handicap index is 3.7 and played from the â€œtipsâ€� with the exception of Kapalua since they were not available. All have been reviewed on this web site.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: pantsday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2011. It was actually during the tsunami resulting from the earthquakes in Japan. The staff did an amazing job at keeping all the guests updated on what to do and not do during the tsunami warning. We received frequent voicemails throughout the night (the warning was overnight) with instructions. Since the hotel is new, it is enforced and tsunami-resistant so only the first floor needed to be relocated to higher floors. All other floors were instructed to stay in their rooms. It was obvious they had practiced these drills before and were very comforting and knowledgeable. Excellent disaster planning, and happily the tsunami resulted to be exceedingly minor. All and all, we had a great time. I loved that this place was still on beautiful Kaanapali beach, but away from the tourist drag. The rooms were huge and almost too big for two people. The bathroom was amazing with a wonderful soaker tub. Most of the guests had purchased villas so they were knowledgeable and helpful. We even inherited boogie boards and beer from departing guests and passed them on when we had to leave. Really wonderful place, I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else on Kaanapali beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough propery but not impressed, be wary of upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: mytravels8227
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Westin around 6p and were told we were receiving an upgraded room. This was great news, however, it went downhill fast. The room was located in the furthest end of the property and on the first floor facing the parking lot. Yes, it was a larger room than originally booked but we soon found ants in the kitchen and in the drawers. When we called the front desk to have housekeeping clean up, we waited for 30minutes and they never showed. We stopped by the reservation desk on way to dinner and reminded them that housekeeping never came to look at the problem. I stated that if the problem could not be fixed we would like another room once we finished with dinner (ate at grill next to pool, surprisingly good food). The front desk was nice in handling the problem and were able to move us rooms, which was appreciated. Downside, we were "downgraded" to smaller room but ant free, so no complaints. When we went to get our luggage to move rooms a note had been placed on the door by housekeeping that the ants had been cleaned and "poisoned" to kill off the ants. Surprise, the ants were still coming in from the outside and had spread to the table in the living room. Luckily we got out of there quick! Room keys did not originally work in the new room, so after walking back and forth a couple more times we finally made it in around 10p. Smaller studio room was nice however, the kitchen could use some better utensils/cookware and shutters from bed looking straight into bathroom was a bit strange. Fitness room located in basement, use the newer fitness room across the property. Great location near the beach and the shuttles provided to Lahaina and between the other properties was a plus. Nice property, but the rocky start left a bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Wife, Happy Life!”
Reviews.Author: johnmichaelphillips
Reviews.Content: My wife is a SPG point management guru and booked us 6 nights at the Westin Villas in Princeville, Kaua'i and 9 nights at the Westin Villas in Ka'anapali, Maui. While I prefer the island of Kaua'i for adventure, my wife prefers the conveniences, resorts, restaurants and shops of Maui. So we split the time, not so evenly as you might have noticed. In any event, of the two properties I prefer Maui considering the layout, beach access and beachwalk to Whaler's Village, etc. However, this review may have been different if not for Alex at registration. My wife had made a reservation 330 days in advance, the earliest permitted, with a note to stay in the North Building as the studios have walk out balconies whereas the South do not. Well, upon checkin we had been booked into South with no 9 consecutive night availabilities in the North. After a bit of nudging and low level escalation, our noted request was heard. Thanks to Alex and the management team for acknowledging our SPG Gold status and making the adjustments resulting in an ocean view with balcony from the top floor of the North Building. Happy Wife, Happy Life!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Resort with Family- kitchen made the trip affordable”
Reviews.Author: rrlawgirl
Reviews.Content: We are SVO owners and stayed at the Westin Villas Maui and the Westin Princeville in consecutive weeks. It was our first time to Hawaii. The Westin Villas were really great. We stayed in Building 3, which was right on the pool and had a view of the ocean. The North Villas looked awesome and are newer. However, both properties were top notch. The rooms were spacious and typical Westin vacation villas. The concierge when we checked in was awesome. Usually, the first thing they try to do is set you up for a tour, but she was very helpful before even talking to us about a tour. If you want to make the trip somewhat affordable, take advantge of the kitchens. The Safeway down the street is expensive, everything you read is true. However, we have a Safeway card, and saved about $75.00 for the week with the card. Their produce isnt very good and is expensive, and I recommend that you try the farmers market acroos the highway near the Sugar train for local fruits. There are also farmers markets on different days in various locations that are well worth it. I highly recommend you find those instead of buying produce at the grocery stores. The grills at the Villas are huge, really nice and are cleaned every day. There are tables to eat dinner outside and watch the sunset that is just gorgeous. We grilled almost every night. I highly recommend that you make reservations for the Old Lahaina luau before you get to Maui. That is the one a lot of people and books recommend. We could not get in because I didnt make reservations in advance. We went to the Westin Maui Luau and it was really well done, and the food is very good. They had fire knife dancers that were great. The only thing they dont have is the pig ceremony where they take the pig out of the ground after cooking it all day. I do recommend you get the premium seating because you get right in, dont have to wait in line and get to sit in the first three rows. The show looked pretty small from the back. it was nice after a night of Mai Tais to take the shuttle home to the Villas instead of driving. We went on a catamaran snorkeling trip on the Hula Girl, and it was great. Some people in the villas complained about the ones they were on (with different companies), but I thought ours was excellent. If you want to do local snorkeling, around Black Rock near the Sheraton is really good, we saw sea turtles, and took the Westin shuttle down. We did the road to Hana and stayed over one night in Hana because I was worried about driving back. It is very tiring. The roads are hard to navigate. However, you can definitely do it one day if you leave early enough. I wish we had done it in one day instead of two. My kids were climbing the walls the next day. If you are bringing kids, defintely do the stops at the waterfalls or on the black sand beach, anywhere where you can swin or hike a little. They do start to get sitr crazy looking at plants and oceans for 6 hours. There really is nothing in Hana for kids but a great beach. Dont expect to find anything there once you get there. I do HIGHLY recommend Coconut Glen's ice cream right before Hana. The ice cream is awesome and the experience is too. We bought the "Maui Revealed" book and followed it on the road to Hana. It was excellent in showing us where to go. I also bought the road to hana audio tour but it wasnt good at all. By the way, the Maui Revealed book was worth every penny. It was spot on with every activity we did in Maui and was a great resource for restaurants with good food at decent prices too. The only downside to the resort is the pool chair situation. If you arent out there early, you might as well forget it. I know I was there at peak season, but I would like to see more chairs for guests. It was really frustrating, and we ended up renting chairs for the beach at $12 per chair per day, plus $20 for the umbrella just to have somewhere to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, good service and a heavenly bed"”
Reviews.Author: washingtontraveler78
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Westin Kaanapalli Ocean Resort Villas North. Our family of five (mom, dad, two teens and one tween) really enjoyed the ocean-front location, beautiful pool, ample lounge chairs, friendly service and the $4 Mai Tais every afternoon. My only complaint was the lack of ocean view from our room. We bought our week from an owner on VRBO and we went into the trip knowing that we would likely not have a view. I've been to Hawaii a number of times and it's the first time I couldn't see the ocean from our room. I was the only person in our family bothered by this...so maybe it's just me...but, I really missed sitting on our lanai looking out at the ocean. The service here was excellent and every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. I had read some reviews about the lounge chairs being crowded, but even though the hotel was sold out this was not the case. Security was excellent with a security officer on a segway patrolling the grounds. We were at the resort with five other families and I felt comfortable with my kids hanging out with their friends outside at night. All in all, a very positive experience. Oh, and the ocean in front of the resort is very family friendly and relatively calm. At least in July.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Annual Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hockeywriter
Reviews.Content: We own a 2 bedroom lock-off in the Ocean Villas North property and go there every year.
