Whether it is our family or just my husband and I, it just doesn't get any better than this location. The property is right on the beach with a coral reef great for snorkeling right in front of the stretch of beach. Plenty of sand for the kids to play in or purchase a folding lounge chair from a drug store in Lahaina or Kahalui and let your troubles float away as you gaze on the incredible blue water and the neighboring islands of Molokai. The property has several pools (one for adults only) with the one near the pool restaurant offering service as you lounge by the pool. There is also another restaurant open on some days and a market to get the necessities. Each apartment has its own washer and dryer which is a real plus. The one-bedroom unit has a full kitchen and the studio has practically the same. Our next stay will be June 2012 with the whole family. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING. AMAZING. AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: aew516
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this timeshare location in a 2BR unit. The unit was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. There were 6 adults (3 couples), and it could be a bit tight...for weirdos who would choose to stay in the room when they are in PARADISE. My husband and I had been to Hawaii twice previously. On this trip we were traveling with family who had never been there. The resort is on kaanapali beach. Although we weren't sure to expect, this being our first timeshare stay, we couldn't have been more thrilled. The views from our lanai, although further back on the property, still overlooked the beach and had amazing sunset views. The resort is huge, with tons of ammenities available. Service was incredible. They were very accommodating and assisted us in everyway possible. As this is a timeshare, they do not clean the rooms everyday (unless you choose to pay for that service, we did not). However, they will give you extra towels upon request. We also recommend extra pillows if using the pullout couch in the LR. There's a bunch of food options, but we usually ventured out. Poolside bar has a drink of the day each day. There are tons of kiddie options. And even though we knew there were families around, we never felt as though we were being invaded by Disneyland, so it was a great couples location. And, as far as pools are concerned, they were never crowded. If you wanted to be under a huge tiki umbrella, you had to be strategic and keep an eye out, but we always managed to scope one out for my mother-in-law. FANTASTIC snorkeling at the beach right at the hotel. Maui is our favorite island. We absolutely LOVE it there, and this is a great property. We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: blountch
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Maui. The resort was very friendly and relaxing. The studio suite was beautiful - lots of room. It was great having a kitchenette and washer and dryer. We ate a lot healthier that way and saved a lot of money not eating out. The parking is very easy and there are two good pools to choose from. It was pretty windy though so we didn't really spend any time at the pools. They have fun sales tables of jewelry, sea salts, arts etc set up around the pools. We didn't spend much time at the beach - but oddly when we did go to watch the waves, we tried to get a beach chair and were told it was too late in the day - but it was only 4:30. If you have kids and want to have some fun float toys - go to the store and buy them. They charge quite a bit to use theirs. Just one of the flat blue floating boards is $18/day. As for comfort - it is a Westin - the beds of course are quite comfortable. The property is very well kept - clean and modern. Just know if you are expecting the warmth of the Caribbean (as I was), it is much different in Maui. It's warm but windy so it feels cooler. The ocean also isn't nearly as warm and the sand isn't as soft. The concierge are very helpful and great at booking dinners, luaus, plays, trips, etc. The spa is great too - but a little spendy. If you do go for a massage do show up 30 min early. They have rain shows and saunas for you to use prior to your massage and hair dryers and nice hair products to use afterward. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, great location & great for family!”
Reviews.Author: nxle1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas at the end of June 2011. It was our second time back to Maui and our second Westin property. We were back to celebrate our 9th anniversary, and had been there 8 years earlier for our 1st. The resort was very nice, located in a fun area of Maui and had spectacular views of the sunset! I will keep this as brief as possible o avoid a long review. We stayed in the South part of the resort. I thought the South pool was a littler larger and more active than the north pool. They had a great kids pool with a pirate ship. When we saw the area, we both looked at each other and said, "ahhh, the kids (3 yrs & 7 yrs) would have really loved this area. The feeling of regret for not bringing the children only lasted a few minutes though...We didn't eat at the restaurant so couldn't tell you how the food was. There were so many great restaurant around the area to choose from. We chose Pacific'O restaurant for our nice anniversary dinner. Ask for the table by the beach and go around sunset time to see a spectacular sunset from your table (see attached picture). The resort had kitchenettes and was perfect for a family with small kids. The resort had plenty of grills for your use and many families grilled and had dinner right there, over looking the sunset. We didn't bring our kids, but would have found the grill a relaxing place to hang out at the end of the day. You should probably check to see if you either have to reserve the grill or have someone stake out the grill early. I would definitely recommend this resort and location to my family and friends who visit Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: marciaink
Reviews.Content: We went here for our honeymoon in Oct. 2009 and loved it. It's a timeshare facility, but we weren't asked once to buy a timeshare or take a tour. The pool areas are fabulous and the beach is lovely and swimmable. The staff is nice, not over the top, but also not constantly asking for tips / being annoying. They treated us equally as guests, even though we were "renters" not "owners." Go visit the Concierge desk--they set us up with an amazing snorkel boat cruise that ended up being a highlight of the trip. We ate at the nicer restaurant on our last night and got sick (really really sick), so not sure I would eat there again, but there are SO many places in Maui this isn't really a problem. It was probably just a fluke. The grounds are beautifully kept, and the rooms are super duper nice and have modern decor. You won't want to leave the heavenly bed ... they truly are heavenly. We really liked having a fridge and microwave in our room--it was nice to have snacks and breakfast goods in our room. I would highly recommend having this amenity if you plan on going to Hawaii, it's super convenient. Because it wasn't a normal hotel-hotel (bot more of a condo situation), it was a bummer that no one really catered to us like honeymooners, but the resort was so gorgeous and the room was so nice, I still wouldn't trade it and would totally come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great for families, not so great for couples without kids..”
Reviews.Author: SarahBee1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and while the location was beautiful, I wouldn't recommend this place to a romantic getaway. Most of the guests were families with small children and if you want a place for deep peace, quiet and relaxing, this might not be the place for you. We mostly drove into downtown Lahaina for dinner so we didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site. The drinks at the bar were expensive and not very strong. Also be aware that as these are timeshares, maid service is only once per week, which sucks when there is sand all over! Over all, I would recommend this place as the beach, location and grounds are beautiful and the staff was attentive. If I had children I would definitely go back, but I think that next time we will try something closer to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved and we will be back!"”
Reviews.Author: paradiso4
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this resort with our family that consisted of teenagers. This resort was beautiful and we stayed for 9 days and definately will be back. The grounds are beautiful and the suites were nice and clean. They have a great beach. Any issues we had the staff took care of us with ASAP and with a smile. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: Kiki1010
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful place I have stayed. You are greeted with fresh fruit ice water and wet towels. The decor and lobby is so welcoming. We stayed in a two bedroom two bath lock off villa with my parents. Rooms were huge. Two kitchens, separate living area, jacuzzi tub and separate stand up shower in both rooms. Private lanais. A washer and dryer in each room. We picked plumaria flowers every day. They had five gorgeous pools and an outside sports bar. They even had a large pipe slide. Large maintained grounds. So peaceful and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Truly a home away from home. The only bad thing about this resort was having to leave and the food was spendy as usual in Hawaii. But with the full kitchen you can get groceries to save money. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Apartment Complex. Do not stay here! Worst resort ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Penrose72
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I'm a Platinum member with Starwood and I have stayed at a number of Starwood properties. This is by far the worst one I have ever stayed at. I emailed the hotel four times prior to arrival and for whatever reason they were unable to tell me whether I could anticipate an upgrade being a Platinum member. Little did I know this is because this is practically a glorified apartment complex completely filled with time share owners. Here is what has transpired so far: -Check in and ask for an upgrade due to being a Platinum member. I call literally 1 hour prior to check in and they cannot tell me if I'm going to be upgraded. Therefore I pack up the family (after having stayed at the Sheraton on Maui which was absolutely fantastic by the way. I highly recommend this property over the Villas). I check in and they do give me an upgrade from the studio to the 1-bedroom villa. Excellent, or at least so I think. My upgrade is on the 2nd floor, facing the pool directly over the walkway to the pool. Normally a pool view isn't bad, however when there is literally a 24/7 frat party going on at the pool being directly over the walkway to the pool insn't my idea of an upgrade. As soon as I opened up the patio door I could literally hear about 100 people shouting and screaming during an avid game of pool volleyball. Oh by the way, the jacuzzi is open 24 hours (use your imagination here). -Kids: Keep in mind that I brought my two kids and I have to say that aside from a Justin Bieber concert I've never seen more kids in one concentrated area then I have here at the Westin villas. When we first arrived I kid you not that there were literally 50-60 kids in the pool at once, all screaming and dunking each other. Not exactly what I signed up for. -Patio Grills: Good luck gettiing one of these. You literally have to fight the guy in the 24 Jimmie Johnson wife beater and cut-off jean shorts to get one. Keep in mind he's the same guy who just got back from Costco and purchased about 20 lbs of 2-day old chicken, 5 gallons of potato salad and a pony keg of Old Milwaukee. Good luck with that! -Cleaning: Ah yes, you would think that if a resort charged $500-$600/night that it would include cleaning. Not at the Westin Villas. We stayed 5 nights and the room was cleaned once. If you want it cleaned daily you need to pony up an additional $25/night. What a deal! -Getting a Lounge Chair at the Pool: Good lluck!! Be prepared to get up around 6:00 am and beat the stampede of time share owners down to the pool to get anything withing a 100 ft radius of the pool. The great thing is that everyone will reserve 4-6 chairs by putting towels down and then leave to go back to the room for 2 hours. Plan on spending your time at the beach. -The Beach: You mean all 10 feet of sand that runs from the resort to the water. Don't forget the 45% angle the beach is on so if you love lying out in the sun diagonally then by all means this is your place. -The Room: Toilet doesn't flush; Shower broke and we had to call maintenance; ceiling fan runs at about 3 mph; did I mention that you have to pay to get it cleaned? Oh yeah. -Pool: On Day 3 we decided to try our chances at the pool around 4:00 pm. As we stroll up from the beach we notice a number of people leaving the pool area and heading up to their rooms. I look at my wife and think "could this be the moment? could we actually get a lounge chair?" As we get closer to the pool one of the 'security guards' informs us that one of the 8 million little kids decided to drop a Baby Ruth in the pool. That's right folks, a brown log, a muddy missle. In my 38 years of existence I've never had to vacate a pool because some little kid dropped a log in the pool. After asking around this appears to happen quite frequently. They literally close the pool on the spot. We head back to the room and I call the front desk to ask if perhaps they could give us a free movie for the inconvenience. Their response was to send us to the South Pool, which is about a 1/2 mile away. I'm sure it won't be crowded after the 5,000 people at the North pool mosey on over there. -Pool Service: Good luck getting someone to wait on you. We had one server literally walk past us 15 times and not once ask us if we wanted something to drink or eat. He was more concerned with the 15 college kids ordering drinks. Unless you're in a group of 10 or more you may as well do yourself a favor and walk up to the bar yourself. -Use of other Starwood properties: Not so fast!! Being a Westin Villa guest they do not allow you access to the other Westin property or the Starwood (which is awesome by the way!!!). You're stuck fighting the 12.4 billion people staying at the resort for pool chairs and space in the pool-that is if you can dodge the feces some little shaver decides to spit out. -Accommodating: Don't be fooled by the token replies you see by the Westin staff on TripAdvisor. They sent me one as well. They make it appear as if they're so accommodating. I requested to transfer my stay (after 3 hours of being there) back to the Sheraton) and everyone approved it (Sheraton, SPG Platinum) and they said no. Keep in mind they were at 98% occupancy so they literally had about 5-6 rooms available. Thus the sweet upgrade over the walkway to the pool. The Sheraton somehow is rated two categories below the Westin Villas (have no idea how this happened) and yet they still flat out denied my request. Their response was to pay 50% off the rack rate and not give me any of my money back. Yeah, they're real accommodating. Seriously, you'll see a ton of responses from the Westin staff. It's all a big marketing ploy. They don't accommodate anyone! Trust me on this one. I busted my tail to become a Platinum member and have spent thousands of dollars over the last 12 months and they couldn't even transfer my reservation to what they claim is an inferior property. If you're even contemplating staying here please reconsider. If you love being around 2.3 million kids (and that's real close to the actual amount) and you enjoy little ones dropping Caddyshack like Baby Ruth's in the pool then by all means pony up the $500/night and knock yourself out. If you don't want an atmosphere that reminds you of a glorified apartment complex then you'd be better off staying at the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: badger808
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Starwood properties very similar to this. The room was very nice, but I was not impressed with the pool or the restaurants. The pool was shallow and crowded and the restaurants either closed or stopped serving at 6pm. We had to go to the adjoining property for dinner two nights. We then opted to go off property and found that to be a much better option. Also the "fitness club" was very small, with meager equipment, and again crowded. If you plan to stay at this Westin, you would be best off to spend your waking hours on the road. They did have a nice mixer for our teenage daughter that had dancing and served "mocktails". She enjoyed that function.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway for family!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee33
Reviews.Content: The Villa's are a great value for the price when you take into account the full kitchen and resort amenities. This resort hosts a number of things to do for adults and children. The Westin beds are comfortable, the overall resort is well maintained. This is a great place for oceanside walks, exercise programs and has a really nice gym for those who prefer weights. The pools are really outstanding! There are several choices for swimming whether you choose to swim with the kids or relax poolside with a good book. The resort offers BBQ's for additional lunch and dinner options. They also offer a daily drink special if you prefer something tropical. Restaurants are abit pricey, but it's Maui so what isn't? Purchase presentations are offered. However, we found them to be quite pricey. If this is the place for you and you should consider a purchase, try Redweek.com. This is a resale site which seems to offer properties for much less as well as rental options.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay/No disappointments here”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirl62
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Westin Kaanapali Oceanfront Resort and I miss those Hawaiian sunsets already. We stayed there 2 years ago and our 2nd stay was as lovely as our first. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are constantly being cleaned and the staff is always there to assist you with a smile. I will admit I am a Starwoods owner (as well as DVC-also very happy with them) so it means a lot to me to know that something I purchased is not going downhill as many other timeshare properties do. From the minute you check into the beautiful lobby that overlooks the ocean, the check-in staff is ready to assist you with a smile. After a 6000 mile journey it's nice to know you can get into a nice a clean room and rest until you get adjusted to the time change. I have a 12 year old and the beauty of this resort is that it's family friendly and not pretentious (if you want that go to the Grand Wailea, they're screaming with preteniousness!! Been there so I can speak from experience.) and once the kids meet at the pool they become fast-friends and look for each other every day. As a parent of an only child I cannot put into words how important that is for us to see how happy she is and how much fun she is having. I said that I miss the sunsets but I miss everything about the Westin and hope that I am lucky enough to go back (it is a grueling flight from the East Coast but so worth it) I highly recommend it and I am so darn picky, especially about the cleanliness of a room (have you ever read my review of Atlantis??!(LOL) You will love the Westin and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to WKORV”
Reviews.Author: TNeumann
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews here are spot on... great family beach resort. You really can't go wrong with this resort as each unit has a kitchen and plenty of room for a family, get at least a one bedroom if you can. This was our third trip to the resort and each year it gets better and better; landscaping is maturing, boardwalk now extends past Hona Kai resort (Duke's Fish House), transportation options and more onsite restaurant options. We especially liked the new Pulehu restaurant, fixed price menu is a great deal and more food than we needed. The pools at WORV are great as is the beach. There are at least four pools; a big one with a slide, a kids pool, an adult pool and a little shallower 'sport' pool with volleyball and basketball. And the beach is very protected so you rarely have huge waves. Lastly, the ocean views to the West makes for great sunset viewing each night. We enjoyed sunsets down by the beach then cooked out on the BBQ's. Greatest place I know of to cook dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Soyler
Reviews.Content: We had our 3rd annual trip to Maui with our family (9 of us total - 6 adults and 3 kids under age 4). We have a timeshare and are usually on the top floor, however, this year we were on the bottom floor looking out at the koi pond. This was perfect! We were able to open the sliding door right to a lovely semi-private lawn. This was great for kids since we could let them run around and play while we ate at the table outside. We do enjoy our stay, but as always found the staff to be somewhat aloof if not rude and a bit unorganized - it took 4 hours to get our luggage brought to our room and 2 hours to get our car out of valet.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissatisfied owner”
Reviews.Author: Travelen2
Reviews.Content: We have been Owners of the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort for over 8 years and have returned each year our ownership has allowed. We have always looked forward to our stay at the Westin, as we did on the occasion of our present visit. Unfortunately, our current trip has been met with repeated disappointment and unpleasantries. One of the â€œprivilegesâ€� of ownership is the ability to secure a room of your choice (by location floor, etc.) in advance. As an owner, one can place a request a year in advance. As usual, a year to the day before our stay we requested several room options in an area we know to be more quiet (albeit with noise from the road very near the Resort), and to offer us a good view of the ocean and island of Lanai. The system the Resort uses assigns the room not when you make you request, but only a few weeks before your arrival date. Further, if one of the rooms you had requested is not available you will not know that until your arrival. Instead of a top floor room with a nice view of Lanai we were presented with a second floor room overlooking the parking lot of the park next to the Resort. We purposefully chose the park side of the Resort as we have found this be a quieter side of the facility. Being on the park side was a request of ours; however, every other request was ignored (high floor, close to the ocean and suggested room numbers). The Resort claimed to not be able to move us to a different room anywhere near our selection made one year prior, claiming that moving someone else would be â€œunfair.â€� We were initially offered a room facing the interior of the Resort, an option we did not prefer due to prior experience with noise coming from the guests using the 24-hour hot tub. We agreed to stay in this room until other options were presented to us. Later that day we were advised we could change to a room overlooking the childrenâ€™s pool of the adjoining hotel, a room more than half-way back of the Resort with a limited view of the ocean, or a second floor room closer to the ocean. The hot tub is open all night. â€œQuiet timeâ€� is supposedly at 10 p.m. when the pool closes, but as in the past, the noise from guests in the hot tub is not regulated, and the hot tub festivities went well past 10 p.m. As the noise permeated our room we chose to not stay in that room and instead chose the second floor room nearer the ocean. This room is not near the hot tub but near some outdoor grills. A group at the grill area decided to party after their barbeque towards midnight. Again the Resort failed to regulate its noise standards. We called and the response we received was â€œyes we have had several calls about the noise.â€� About an hour after we first called, the party was stopped by security. It should not have taken an hour to accomplish this, given the 10 p.m. curfew. As our room is above a service path there were Resort staff frequenting this path through the night. At about 11 p.m. the staff would disassemble potions of the grills, put these metal pieces into plastic carts and push these down the path that is about 20 feet from our lanai. This made quite the racket. Very early in the morning Resort attendees would straighten chairs, rake the grounds, and push more carts about the facility. As there are more guests than chairs the shaded spots are at a premium. If you are not down by the pool by 7 a.m. forget about getting a shaded spot by the pool. Guests are reserving pool chairs for hours at a time in the morning without been seen. We anticipated this so several weeks we tried to reserve a gazebo. The Resort at which we are staying has only four large gazebos, so we knew reserving one of these would be difficult. When we called to reserve a one we were told to place the request via e-mail via an out-sourced corporation, not affiliated with Westin. Apparently this company handles pool reservations for several other resorts in the area. We did that and never heard back. We called and e-mailed again but again, no response. By the time of our arrival none of the large gazebos were available. We have also found the guests of the Resort to ignore or flaunt the Resort rules. In addition to ignoring quiet time and reserving chairs for endless periods of time, smoking on the Resort premises and in/around the Resort rooms is another example. While the villas are smoke-free, there is no rule against smoking on the lanais or at the pool. We have awoken to the smell of cigarette smoke in our room and the smell of cigarette smoke while standing on our lanai in the evening. Finally, although expressing our extreme displeasure regarding our room assignment there is been absolutely no follow-up with the Resort as to our present accommodations. Considering the above we will not likely ever stay at this facility on our return visit to Maui. Apparently our ownership interest and ongoing payment of yearly dues, fees and taxes do not matter. We would recommend those who want to stay here strongly consider other options. We certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners0709
Reviews.Content: Before coming to Maui, we went to Las Vegas (we stayed at the Bellagio) and Honolulu ( Royal Hawaiian by Sheraton) first. Maui is the most quiet place out of the places we visited. Westin Villas is very pretty and has a lot of good amenities. It is, on the other hand, full of families with kids. If you want a relaxing time with your new wife/husband, go somewhere else. The rooms are very well suited for families too, they have big bathroom and kitchen so it's very homey. I'm used to tempurpedic so my head hurt 2 mornings. It doesn't have the romantic feeling that Bellagio in Las Vegas offered. Overall, it was a good hotel, but didn't quite reached my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great for young active couples!”
Reviews.Author: JMF818
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late twenties and are celebrating our 5 year anniversary. We stayed at the Westin for one week and it was amazing! The location is great and the beach was beautiful. We loved the option of the adult-only pool too. The rooms could use an update, but they were very clean. The resort grounds were beautiful, food and service was great, and there was so much to do near by! We checked out some of the other hotels while we were there (Sheraton, Fairmont, Westin Villas...) but decided we still liked Westin resort and spa best and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Already Planning A Return Visit.”
Reviews.Author: 92081Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the WKV for a week in the beginning of June. This is a spectacular resort . We have been to Maui on several occasions. On this trip, we didnâ€™t want or feel the need to explore the island. We were looking to spend a week relaxing and doing little more than lounging around the pool and beach. I was a little concerned beforehand by the number of â€œfamily friendlyâ€� comments I read about the resort. My kids are grown and I have reached a point in life where I want a more adult environment. That being said, I did not find the large number of families staying there took away from my enjoyment of the resort. Probably, because the overall environment of the resort is so relaxing that oneâ€™s tolerance level is increased. You just donâ€™t seem to be bothered by petty annoyances here. We exchanged with I.I. for a studio which was more than adequate for just the two of us. The efficiency kitchen was equipped with a stove (no oven) dishwasher and a mini-fridge. There was an adequate supply of dishes and utensils. The bathroom was spacious with a large Jacuzzi tub and separate steam shower. The room was equipped with a washer and dryer. We were fortunate to have a full balcony. Most studio units do not have this feature. Thank you Suzy Porter at the front desk for this perk! There are very few ocean front units at the resort. Most units do have a partial ocean view. The degree of that view varies from building to building. On a side note, Iâ€™ve seen several comments where people have complained about their views. If you paid for an ocean view, you have every right to complain and to get what you paid for. If you didnâ€™t pay for an ocean view, quit your whining. You have no right to show up at the resort and demand something you didnâ€™t pay for. We made use of many of the resort amenities. The pools are spacious and relaxing. There are plenty of deck chairs with a decent amount of umbrellas and side tables. This is one of the few resorts Iâ€™ve been to where they make some attempt to enforce the no saving of deck chair rules. In the morning, staff tags those chairs that appear to be being saved. If the chair is still unused an hour later, they open it up. I know this rule is tough to enforce but at least they make an effort. The beach at the resort is spectacular. There is a great snorkeling reef right off the WKV shoreline. We made good use of the resortâ€™s BBQ grills. The grills sit right on the shoreline and make for a great sunset dining spot. There are several tables there as well and the spot can get crowed at dinner time. We used the free resort shuttle to do dinner at Whalers Village on a couple of nights and took a short walk north to Dukeâ€™s on another night. The breakfast buffet poolside is a good spot to start your day. We did a 1 hour couples massage at the spa. The spa was adequate but nothing special. The resort brings in different vendors throughout the week that sell local products and arts. They are only there once a week so if you see something you want, buy it then. Groceries and fresh fish markets are nearby but do require a car for convenience. I found the staff to be exceptional. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. They seemed genuinely concerned about my needs and enjoyment. Every resort says customer service is their top priority, WKV actually backs it up. There were some minor flaws I noticed but frankly, theyâ€™re so trivial I wonâ€™t even bring them up. Overall, this is a fantastic resort and Iâ€™m already planning my return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: pjlord
Reviews.Content: We are first timers to the villas after buying in last year and we will be back. the amenities are great and we love having the full kitchen. Our only experience that was not ordinary was when I cut my foot on a small piece of glass in the room. My wife called and security was here in user a minute to patch me up.

Reviews.Title: “Engaged in Maui”
Reviews.Author: sleeslee84
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and the beach is so close! The views and sunsets are wonderful. The bartenders are super friendly and very funny. The on-site snorkel rental is great and not too bad for the price. We had the breakfast buffet every morning and it was fresh and delicious. The great thing about staying at any of the three Starwood hotels in Lahaina is that they have their own shuttles that will take you to the shopping centers and thats where the bars are! So you dont need to drive! I believe the last shuttle is at 11:00pm. The activities are definitely more for family and kids--nothing too exciting. There is a very funny security guy there on a segway that looked just like Chris Farley. He helped me when I lost a flip flop. It was my first day and I was way too excited with too many pina coladas and I lost a flip flop...DEF a MUST property. I used the gym once out of the seven days but it was very nice---quite small but hey--nobody was even using it!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Najebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from May 13 to May 20 2011. Very nice staff, they unload your stuff and valet parking is free for the first night. We did the check-in at 3:15 and could go to our room right away. Some other people seemed to have to wait for theirs. The lobby is absolutely beautiful, very contemporary but kind of exotic in a good non-tacky way. We got room 8504 which was oceanfront (totally unexpected!) We were very impressed with the room; that ocean view was breathtaking and when youâ€™re not expecting it, I guess it feels even better. We had the studio, which was pretty spacious compared to other studios weâ€™ve had in the past. When you come in, there is like a little foyer that has a door leading to the 1-bedroom unit next door when those lock-offs are turned into 2-bedroom suites. That little â€œfoyerâ€� was practical throughout our stay to leave all our beach stuff and leave the sand right there. You also have a washer dryer in that corner: itâ€™s not a regular size washer, but itâ€™s enough for 2. Youâ€™ll have one detergent package when you arrive and they give you another one when they do your room refresh. Once you pass that little â€œfoyerâ€�, you have a little kitchenette across the bathroom. The fridge is a decent size fridge with a freezer; plenty of space for all your juices, soft drinks etc, and a good size veggie compartment. You also have 2 electric burners, it takes time to boil water but they are fine. The dishwasher is pretty small, if you eat all your meals in the suite, youâ€™ll probably need to use the dishwasher everyday. I believe we got 4 dishwasher detergent units throughout the stay. And I had brought along a couple capsules from home. There is no regular oven, but a micro-wave-convection oven. Other than that you have the regular appliances: toaster, coffee maker, can opener, blender. The bathroom is great, even though there was one thing I didnâ€™t like: the lack of storage. There were no drawers in the bathroom to store all kinds of toiletries. The Jacuzzi that separates the sleeping area from the bathroom is quite large, same for the shower, we loved both. The bed was extremely comfortable, there is a reason for their name: heavenly beds! We slept like babies! The two side tables had two deep drawers: great storage.. The entertainment unit has good storage as well. We loved the Bose cd player, that was a nice touch as we could plug our ipod into it. The living area is good, the sofa is quite comfy, with those 2 ottomans, it was pleasant to sit back and relax in front of the tv. The dining table is small, but enough for 2 to dine. The lanai was our favorite part with 2 chairs and a small coffee table: we had most of our breakfasts out there. The resort. The resort was absolutely beautiful and we really loved the size of it. We were there off-season so it might seem a little over-crowded during peak season, especially with kids running around. Over the week, we probably stayed a couple of mornings by the pool and it was very pleasant. There are some cabanas you can rent for $90/day, they come with 4 long chairs. We didnâ€™t order any cocktails as it was a little early, so I canâ€™t comment on those. The grounds are very well kept, we loved hanging out by the koi fish pond but we also used that great boardwalk along the beach. They seem to offer various activities but we were out and about most days so didnâ€™t take advantage of them. The beach right in front of the resort is narrow but was fine when we were there. Not sure if it would during peak season. You can rent a chair on the beach for $15 and an umbrella for $25 (I think but not 100% sure). We just bought a cheap umbrella from Times for $15 which we used the whole week at all beaches we went to. The snorkeling in front of the resort is great, we even saw turtles so we were quite excited. But itâ€™s way nicer if you go down to Black rock, which is a 10-15 minute walk from the resort. You can rent the gear at the resort but we rented ours at Snorkel Bobâ€™s which is a 5 minute drive away and a little cheaper, especially if you rent your gear by the week. There are several BBQ you can use but we didnâ€™t use them. Every evening it seemed like they were all in use so I guess they worked fine but you might want to get there early to make sure you have a spot. Food I cannot comment on the resortâ€™s restaurants as we never had a meal there: we liked going out to Lahaina or Whaler Village in the evenings. We went once to their little â€œmarketâ€� but it is very pricey so most of the time we just drove down to Times (5 minutes away) where we found that prices are similar to what we have back home (Vancouver, BC). Transportation You get free valet parking the first day which is nice when you have all the luggage and the check-in to take care of. After the first day, parking is free if you park your car yourself. We also used the shuttle many times to go to the Whaler Village and Lahaina, it runs frequently and it was never full (off-season perk I guess). As we went there through our timeshare exchange, the only additional fee we got was the tax: $42.01 for the whole week in the studio unit. Overall we absolutely loved that resort and will definitely stay there again when we go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jack1122
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 wonderful days at this resort! My wife and I have stayed here before as owners but this time, we used our options to book a 2 bedroom lockout as well as a studio, Our son, daughter in law and their 22 month old as well as our 25 year old daughter joined us. Hawaii is expensive but we managed to hit Costco on the way in for breakfast items, snacks, lunch items and of course the drinks. For the size of our group, it paid off. The grounds and beach are beautiful. Check in went smoothly and the front desk and captain service friendly and efficient. The rooms in the North were as expected, clean with good views of the pool and a glimpse of the ocean. They even managed to get all three of our rooms near each other ...a big plus for grandma and grandpa. Sole from concierge services helped us with dinner recommendations and reservations. Merriman's is a wonderful restaurant for adults. great food and a wonderful atmosphere. Lahaina Grill also had good food and service. The day before we left, Austin was helping us with our beach chairs and umbrella setup when a woman ran up and asked for help. The woman's husband and young son were snorkeling when they ran into trouble. Austin stripped off his shirt and shoes and dove into the water along with a couple of good samaritans. Austin brought in the little boy and another gentleman helped the husband to the shore. Austin came back and apologized for the delay in setting up the umbrella! It is not everyday you get to witness real heroes. We asked Austin if this happens often and he said it was his first rescue. If there are any reward programs at the Westin for employees. I highly recommend Austin for consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Irish964
Reviews.Content: We initially were checked in to a sister property and immediately checked out and were fortunately able to get in at the Villas. What a "BIG" difference. The difference for those of you not sure were from the people to the rooms to the food and overall experience. Yes, it was that big of a difference. We checked into our room which was painless; no delays, issues at the front desk or your room is not ready routine. Because we were a last second reservation we did not have an ocean view of the property but that was okay. We were just happy to be there and in a clean room with no smell of mildew. The grounds on the property were excellent, the transportation options to and from the hotel were a nice touch, the kids club is really the only thing that needs some attention. It is okay but a bit small and I think some bigger games and things to do for 7-10 year old children is a must. My kids wanted to participate in the kids club from prior experience at other SPG properties and that is the feedback we got from them. They know....they are there. The food and drinks were very good and were not overly priced but $5.95 for a soda is offensive and something does need to be corrected there. The last point I want to mention and this is probably the best compliment I can give and that was what a manager named Jasmine did for my family. Our return flight was not until very late and I asked if we may be able to have a late checkout. Jasmine said let me see if we can help you and if we are not 100% booked then YES we can extend this to you. This is high season for Maui in case people reading this review are not aware. Well, we were lucky and this courtesy was extended to my family. THANK YOU!! Thank you Jasmine. You were not only professional upon our check-in and making the transition possible from switching properties but more so in our late checkout due to a flight change. So, if someone is considering this property I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place...we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: My2sons
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this beautiful place. There was only one minus and it was not so bad. We really wanted a balcony and booked as soon as we could and were told that we would be in the north buliding but when we checked in we were in the south buliding and the Studios in the south building do not have balconies. We were given an oceanview upgrade. We were in the room so little of the time that it was ok. The room was clean and had everything you could possibly need. We made breakfast and some lunches in our room and dined out in the evenings. Many guests used the grills on the property in the evenings. The staff was extremely kind and accomodating.The pools were clean and not overly crowded. The grounds were lush and well groomed. The Westin shuttle will take you to the other properties and in to Lahaina. (Sons loved the burgers at Cool Cat Cafe)

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Kekoskee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas for a week in July and had a great time! When I read other reviews I wonder if we are talking about the same place. We had maid service every day except when we chose to be "green" and then they gave us new towels and emptied the trash...and we received a free breakfast! We ate at the poolside grill a couple of times and while being a bit expensive....but so is everything in Maui...it was very good food. (Katie was a great server!) I enjoyed one of the best massages I have ever had at their spa so no complaints there. I would say my only complaint would be the shutters between the bathroom and master bedroom ....we had a family of four and when someone used the bathroom at night, it would light up the whole room. Otherwise...great room, great beach, great fun!

Reviews.Title: “For the first time to Maui, the Westin was enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Jahlov
Reviews.Content: We were there in July, 2011. It was my first time in Hawaii and I found the Westin quite enjoyable. The front desk staff were quite helpful and friendly and the concierge desk had all of my excursions ready for me upon my arrival. We had a studio unit which was small but nice and clean. I was concerned that they did not offer a full midweek cleaning. They only offered new towels, made the bed and changed the garbage. The one issue that I had was the lack of enough lounge chairs. The staff seems to police these chairs unfairly and leave some chairs with towels on for hours and some chairs towels were removed. Quick fix is to get more chairs and umbrellas. I had a spa treatment that was ok. The spa was clean and very serene. The workout gym should be bigger with more equipment. All being said, I would go back and recommend highly to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “In response to Penrose72”
Reviews.Author: jlctrc
Reviews.Content: This property consists of Vacation Ownership Villas (aka Timeshares). An owner who books their stay 365 days in advance and pays an ever increasing annual maintenance fee for the privilege of doing so, should rightfully get the higher level floors with a better ocean view. But we don't always have our specific requests met, even making them 12 months in advance. I truly do hope the resort can accomodate your request, but it will depend on the occupancy of the resort and the number of owners booked. Actual room assignments are made very shortly before a guests arrival. If we don't get exactly what we want when our family arrives next week, we will just be happy that we are staying at a nice resort and we are in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “From Hannah at the front desk to Sean at the pool it has been GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: glenjmi
Reviews.Content: From the front desk where I meet Hannah (could not have been more helpful or welcoming) who welcomed me with a smile and was very helpful and patience to Sean whom I had spoken to about cabana rentals a few weeks ago and finally meet, we have been very happy indeed!!!

Reviews.Title: “again it was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: rose220068
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay here . We had a one bedroom villa.. with 2 adults and 3 kids. we got a rollaway which was like a twin bed very very nice.. as always the accommodations are great for a family. plenty of pools, w/in short walking distance-- two pools on the north end, a pirate ship pool for little ones and another 2 pools w/ a water slide and kiddie pool in the main building.. we don't usually eat there. but we did order lunch which was decent. drinks/food are expensive as a hotel would be. but happy hour=4 dollars maitais not to be missed.. we usually found chairs somewhere and they are strict in the mornign about removing towels after a certain amount of time if you don't show up. . we will definitely be back as we enjoy the hotel. only negative as an owner you only get a "tidy" maid service mid week which ddid not seem to include changing of sheets or mopping it would have been nice if the sheets got changed and they mopped the kitchen floor. that is why it doesn't get a 5 star from me.. no turn down service either. all they did was come in give us new towels and take the garbage. nothing else! i did use the spa for a massage and it was decent. it was not my best massage ever but it was nice.. the mattresses and sheets and covers were great i slept very well each night and very comfortable. we had an oceanfront on the 6th floor north building and our view was excellent we used the bbq one night and no issues. but i do think you can run into busy hour after 6. we got there just before 6.. nice size bbq and picnic tables. we choose to eat in our room however... again very nice stay for families!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sensing some slippage...”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyred52
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th year on Maui. We own several weeks at the North Villas, and we've always been pleased. This was definitely our least favorable experience. Apparently, occupancy is now THE game. Some staff mentioned they were at 100% capacity...never a good sign on what purports to be a high-end resort. It had something of the feel of a nice Marriott, not as clean as in the past, not as efficient and much too hectic to be pleasant. The mad dash for a decent set of chaises has reached absurd proportions. (For God's sake, get some form of portable umbrellas and cushions!!!) Even poolside service was slow, erratic and spotty. As an owner we'd like to see some recognition in our treatment of the ever-increasing maintenance fees we pay to support the operation. We were surrounded by what appeared to be conventioneers and unnecessarily aggressive Asians. One night we ate at the South grill. It happened to be their "crab feast", with tables struggling to crack open crab legs for some small semblance of meat. None of us like crack, so we opted for the limited menu options. HORRIBLE! perhaps the worst meal in Hawaii. Clearly each dish was a microwaved retread of something cooked and refrigerated earlier in the day. We dined several evenings at Pulehu. Excellent both times. Impeccable service and excellent meals. The real shining exception, I'm sorry to say. It seemed to me--and, if pressed I'm not sure I could tell you why--that there were people there, using the facilities, who were not Resort guests. Just little bits and pieces of comments we were picking up. Then it occurred to me that the public beach was adjacent and anyone could simply walk on and grab chairs and access to some nice pools. For the first time, I found this stay tiring. The entire feel was frenetic and jumpy, dramatically overcrowded. Everything felt rushed and challenged. Even the "chair patrol" seemed an unnecessary intrusion, albeit one I believe has become quite necessary; far too many guests throw down a towel and disappear for hours while others wander hopelessly looking for a quiet place to relax, read and soak up some rays. Wireless internet is, today, a necessity. It works reasonably well in the rooms but is quite spotty outside. Some booster devices would be welcome. Frankly, I think management needs to get a bit more creative in finding solutions to some of the issues. You can't charge like a Westin and convey an ambiance like a Holiday Inn. In the future it's likely we'll either identify quieter times to visit or we'll head elsewhere. Somewhere between the gray stillness of the Four Seasons and the endless hum of the Waikiki hotels should sit the Westin Resorts. Unfortunately, over these 4 years I have seen it heading more toward the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! We'd definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Eat_Drink_Luv_Travel
Reviews.Content: We knew we wanted to stay someplace right on the beach in Maui, with beautiful sunsets and the chance to do a thousand things or absolutely nothing, as the mood struck us. The Westin KOV is definitely that place! We stopped at the Safeway at the Lahaina Cannery Mall and bought breakfast and lunch essentialsâ€”a great idea, especially if you have a discount cardâ€”and drove the 5 minutes to the lobby of the south villas to check in. A lovely girl checked for available rooms and â€œupgradedâ€� us to the north villas, telling us that even with our studio, we would have an actual lanai instead of a Juliet balcony there. The valet/bellhop was super-fast and really friendly, and brought all the luggage AND all the groceries to us almost as fast as we could walk alone. Loved the welcome desk with the fruited water (pineapple one day, cucumbers another, oranges anotherâ€¦.) and cool towels. Our building was building 7 on the edge of the property. Looking out, we could see the lot next door (empty, probably an addition for another hotel?), the jogging path, and a little slice of the ocean. However, even on the second floor, the noise from other guests was practically nonexistent. We occasionally heard running feet down a hall, but nothing else. We looked out at the tranquility garden and the massage room overhead, next to the fitness room, and that was a great place for reading and quiet. Janet, our personal concierge, was terrific! She made dinner reservations and gave us lots of tips for all of Maui, not just Kaâ€™anapali. We had a casual dinner at the Ocean Pool Bar and Grillâ€”great seafood, amazing pineapple crÃ¨me bruleeâ€”snacks at Pailolo Bar and Grill, and took the shuttle to the â€œotherâ€� Westin to dine at sunset at Tropica. (Note to couplesâ€”reserve a â€œcouples onlyâ€� table beachside at Tropica. Very romantic!) The Kai Ala Market was useful for things we forgot/didnâ€™t know to buy like salt & pepper, sugar for coffee, single-use laundry soap. Behind the concierge desk in the south lobby is a book exchangeâ€”leave yours, pick another. Great for the beach and poolside. Speaking of the pools, we loved them, especially the slide pool. Much has been said about the shallow (4â€™) water, but as a parent, I appreciated that my kid could touch bottom everywhere! Thanks especially to the pool guys at the slide pool who supplied air for my ridiculously large lounge float! The pirate pool was a bit of a disappointment to our 8-year old, but he would have loved it when he was 3 and 4. Very safe and shallow. Great pool towel card exchangeâ€”you can have as many cards as you need, and at the end of your stay, either return the towels or the cards. We refreshed our towels several times/day. The ($6) drinks of the day were fun to try, and we did our best to try a lot of them! Mango Madness and Ocean Tropical Rita were standouts. Happy hour at both poolside bars is 4-6 p.m., and the mai-tais were great. Good lemonade for the soft-drink set. Also loved the kettle chips with Maui sweet onion dip at Pailolo. Yum! The beach in front of the villas is fantastic. There IS a big and quick drop-off, so watch out for your kids, but the immediate access to a beautiful coral reef is unbeatable. Sunsets are incredible with Lanai in one direction and Molokai in anotherâ€”they almost look close enough to swim to. The Westin Heavenly Beds live up to their nameâ€”I swear in my life I WILL have one at homeâ€”and my husband was so in love with the incredible air conditioning, it was tough to get him to leave the room! Loved the Jacuzzi tub, too! We definitely took advantage of the washer/dryer as well. It was great to have a full refrigerator with icemaker for all the drinks and non-restaurant food. Good supply of kitchen items (dishes, cutlery, pots/pans, toaster!)â€”grill tools are under the sink! We used the grill once for burgers and enjoyed eating â€œoutsideâ€� rather than â€œout.â€� Excellent grill facilities. Everyone hereâ€”staff and guestsâ€”are friendly, helpful, fun to talk to, and full of aloha. We made friends with other families and played with other kids. Itâ€™s not hard to see why people return here again and againâ€”itâ€™s a perfect little slice of well-manicured paradise in one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful settings. If we return to this side of Maui again, weâ€™ll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hptorres
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for our long awaited family vacation to Hawaii and it was worth it. It was my wife, my 9 yr old daughter, 4 yr old son and myself. The facilities are simply outstanding, great pools, restaurants and service. Ideal for families! Here are my grades: Rooms & Beds (Studio) A- Comfortable, roomy, clean, great view, full kitchen. Sleeper sofa only OK. Only negatives were in the bathroom (some mold around shower door) and bird poop in balcony. Pools A All pools were clean and well kept, plenty of towels, cold drinking water for guests, small slide for kids on South side. Both Kiddie pools were excellent, especially the Pirate Ship in the North Tower. No negatives really. Lobby,Sorounding Areas and Beach A Very clean, well decorated, no issues AT ALL. Beach is just a few minutes away and it was VERY clean, however, BE CAREFUL with little ones, it goes from shallow to deep QUICK and there is a reef so be careful when entering the water. Staff A Courteous, helpful, no issues either. They are a plus for sure. Jacob at fron desk was A++ Check in/out A- We checked in late so it wasn't crowded but the check out was a bit slower due to an onslaught of arriving guests, still acceptable and not really an issue if you do the express check out which we could not do since we were "transferring" to the Westin down the street, the attendant still called the hotel and arranged an early check in. Restaurants A We had lunch at pool side, food was good and service was very good. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant and it was very good, great food and good service. No complaints. Parking B Only issue with parking is the small spaces, we had a full size car and it was not easy parking if other full size cars or mini-vans were in the tri-spots...not a major issue but one may need to look around for the right spot which can mean a long walk back to the room. Not an issue if you get a compact or smaller which of course, may not work for large families. Elevators A Worked the whole time we were there, were clean and fast. We had a great time at the Villas and will be staying there again, no doubt. This was our first trip to Maui and we LOVED it, perfect balance; IMHO, it's better than Oahu. We spent a LOT of time at the hotel and we loved every minute of it. Can't wait to go back. I highly recommend the Westin Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: patswife86
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here at the Westin. The rooms are quiet, the staff was courteous and polite, the grounds are clean and the food by the pool is good. Finding chairs near the pool was a little challenging on the sunnier days, so we rented a 2 person cabana for a day for $40. The beach is very close--we went snorkeling right off the beach, and found that what we thought were rocks, was actually coral with sea urchins in some of the crevices. (a sign might be helpful to let guests know this) The only issue we encountered were the restaurants, or lack thereof. The pool bar has a restaurant and the food is good--but not for every meal. There's a market and deli, but when on vacation, we prefer a sit-down restaurant. The Pulehu restaurant requires reservations, so we never ate there, due to our lack of planning. This resort location is such that you need to drive to get to the restuarants or you can walk 10 minutes to Duke's up the beach. But, it seems that in Maui, you do need to rent a car to get to restaurants from the resorts, so it's just something you have to plan around. Overall, we had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend with Reservation”
Reviews.Author: MauiMom88
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the property when we arrived. When we got to our ocean view room I was NOT impressed. We were on the 2nd floor and our balcony faced the back of a waterfall. The oceanview was past the parking lot, through a ton of foliage. My worst nightmare had come true and I was ready to leave! I went straight to the front desk to complain, something I normally never do. I was told that they were booked solid, and they had nothing better, but maybe if I checked back in a day or two. I complained that I had made my reservation 6 months prior and had requested the best possible ocean view. I felt he then implieded that because I had made my reservation through a company other than the hotel and made it outside the window(?, don't know what he ment by that) that my room was the best they could offer me. He did check for about 20 minutes to find something, but he said I probably wouldn't be any happier with what he had avialable. He said he would keep checking, and they did move us into a better room about 4 hours later. It was a handicapped room and the studio did not have a shower which I found very strange. A deep tub with a hand-held shower head was all it had. Since we also had a 1 bedroom next door, also handicapped, but with a shower it worked out fine. We did enjoy staying at North Kaanapali, verses Kaanapali. THe hotel had a much bigger pool and more grassy area to play. Only had one day at noon that we couldn't find an empty lounge chair, but some opened up fairly quickly. I wish they would remove towels from chairs after one hour all day long. They only tag from 7-11. So you could get a chair at 11 and hog it all day long, as many families did. The FULL kitchen in the one bedrooms is AWESOME! Full size fridge, stove and oven, and everything you need. Saved us a lot of money with our family of 7. We had cereal, breakfast meat, sandwich fixings, snacks, soda's, and alcohol in the room. Bought it at Safeway down the road. All the kids (age 10-23) enjoyed the pool. The slide wasn't a big hit, too slow. Hyatt has a great slide! The restaurants weren't the greatest. Walked to Duke's next door two days in a row. Get the one bedroom over the studio. The studio balconies, from what I saw, couldn't fit a chair on them. Request the 6th floor or North towers. Building 4 is awful. Too many trees to allow a view. We were in building 3, 3rd floor overlooking the pool. Housekeeping was another roller coaster. For some reason the studio was cleaned early, but our one bedroom was cleaned later in the afternoon, and skipped twice. They didn't always clean the stovetop or dining room table. Had to request shampoo and conditioner. Almost ran out of toilet paper, down to one roll before they restocked. Never got a clean glass in the bathroom. Had 3 still wrapped, but never took out the one I used. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Never had trouble finding a parking spot. We may stay here again, but will look into other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Courteous !”
Reviews.Author: AdventureChicago
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with two wonderful pools and beachfront access with plenty of beach activites to do. I do not suggest renting snorkeling equipt. from the hotel it is $$$$. Bring your own or rent at Boss Frogs in Lahinia. There is also a grocery store close by, highly recommend using the Grills and enjoy the scenery !

Reviews.Title: “Great Service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: HawaiifansMaui
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you about FANTASTIC SERVICE. Our family was checking into the Westin Villas. We have come to the Villas every year since it opened. We have two young girls, my wife and myself. Our girls are too young to stay in their own room. The room that was reserved for us was an efficency and was small for the four of us although it had a pull out couch and a full kitchen. A wonderful young man named Alex was checking us in and noticed our kids. He then went out of his way to find us a better room. Since the resort was full, this was no easy task. He had to check all the cancellations on the computer. Once he found one, he then had to physically check with other reps to make sure that this room was not taken. The entire process took him about twenty minutes and was completely above and beyond our expectations. He is a fantastic representative for the Westin. He has made this week of our lives dramatically better and all on his own iniative. Thank God for Alex. We were blessed to have had him be our representative. He certainly went out of his way to make our stay a great one!

Reviews.Title: “This Westin knows how to create the "WOW" factor”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrandpa70
Reviews.Content: Words seem inadequate to describe our positive experience at this location. We had a week's stay as my surprise birthday gift from my wife. All front desk staff were friendly and helpful. However, two stood out as exceptional; Sheena Phillips and Keith ???. They went above and beyond to make us feel special. We relocated within the property and I left an important item behind and only realized it later the next day. Within 20 minutes of asking to retrieve the item, security was at our door with it. All the employees we encountered were cheerful and helpful. The grounds are extremely well maintained and clean. They have a bank of BBQs that are cleaned every morning for guests to prepare their lunch and dinner items. They have a shuttle service to Whalers Village which has many shops and restaurants. Add a beautiful beach, great weather and fantastic sunsets and you have a recipe for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Villas with nice kitchenette, Free Wifi stinks, loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: Sometravelor
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in this comfortable, well groomed setting. We got 2 adjoining rooms so the kids could stay in another room. The pluses were the really comfortable bed (never slept so well!) and the really quiet atmosphere despite the resort being really busy. Housekeeping also came late, but I tipped them $10 every day and encourage you to do the same. You get what you give! Service improved after the first day. The rooms are quiet: You hear the occasional kid screaming in the hall but never a slamming door. The showers are instant hot and nice and big. The kitchenette was really convenient for cooking, there is a full size fridge and freezer and small microwave and oven. Even had a blender for my smoothies, yeah!. They provide dishes and utensils and cooking pots. But No salt and pepper or foil etc. Gotta buy your own. There is a small store in the lobby for this, with resort prices of course. Also, you can donate your leftover unopened food to the local food bank at the end of your stay... which is very green and selfless. The Really big down side is the sucky Wifi internet connection. Mind you when you go on vacation you should leave the connectivity at home... yeah I know ;))... but it was really frustrating to get dial up internet connection speed on their crappy WiFi network. Everyone at the pool griped about this, too. A couple next to us asked us if we had the same problem and others around us chimed in. It did make for some lively human connectivity to have to gripe about the internet though so I guess that is the gift... but again.... the Westin WiFi is somewhere between sux and blows! The on site restaurants are okay food wise but are over priced of course... its a resort they have to make money. Kobe burger... gotta be kidding.. it is not worth $20! On a side note: Lots of places to eat in Maui but I live in the Bay area and we have better food I must say than Maui.... IMHO... except for their tropical fruits, which you cannot get anywhere that taste this good.. this of course is No reflection on the hotel. Be prepared that the place if full of kids and 30-40 something families predominantly. Be prepared at least in June/ July if you don't want to be among little kids all over the place whining and taking dumps and who knows what else in the pool... (yes this did happen during our stay), might want to think twice. If you have kids or teens this is the place to stay though. They have tons of activities for little kids. It is very safe too. I saw Security twice kick out some little kids in the hot tub who's parents abandoned them... Good job Resort Cop! Without a doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay & more to follow!”
Reviews.Author: emmajima
Reviews.Content: Both the South (original) and the North properties are marvelous. View from south lobby is spectacular. Accommodations are spacious, clean and well-appointed. Staff excellent. Concierges are.... helpful with partnering services, but don't expect bargains through their assistance. We paid double for Ulalena tickets than what we would have gotten as a walk-up to the ticket booth. :( Incredible snorkeling right off the resort beach. Rent gear for the week at Snorkel Bob's or Maui Dive Shop. Most guests shop at Safeway in Lahaina because it's easy to spot. I suggest the Foodland. Great variety of entrees ready-to-eat and deli/salad stuff that blows the doors off of Safeway. Resort dining is pricey for what you get. Walk a bit up the boardwalk to Dukes for lunch or dinner. Great food, music, scenery, prices. Best food value around is CJ's Comfort Zone in the strip mall right by the resort. There's tasty homemade food, mainland prices, walk-up counter service, expansive menu. Also use the resort shuttle to get to the other Starwood Hotels and beaches, it's so easy and stress free! Wireless was painfully slow, but they give a hard wire to use in the rooms. The reosrt is quiet at night and the beds ARE heavenly. If you can' sleep, it's your own fault! Great resort experience, overall. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip with kids”
Reviews.Author: Gabbimama
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the resort, the grounds are very nice and the beach right in front was great for the kids to play at. The only complaint we had was the water temperature of the pools, including the kiddie/pirate ship pool. It was way too cold, and many kids were shivering while playing, including mine. They really need to heat the water a little. Otherwise it was a great stay and we hope to be back soon one day!

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!”
Reviews.Author: upload497
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative notes on this site, we were concerned about what kind of service we were going to get. But, I have to say, not only were we pleasantly surprised, we found the service in the hotel to be truly amazing. Everything from check-in to concierge to restaurants to house keeping was what one would expect from a Westin brand! Maybe we were lucky or may be the management has been listening to all the bad experiences posted on this site and making changes. Whatever it was, I have to say, thank you Westin Villas for making it a very good vacation for our family. I would highly recommend this hotel. Tips: South Tower gardens are more plush, but pool is a bit more crowded (it has a water slide). North tower pool is also very nice but not as crowded. Also good snorkeling to the left of south tower (airport beach) and at the cove by Napoli Inn ( lots of green turtles). For food: Check out Da Kitchen (near airport), Saigon Cafe (near the airport) and Roy's (Kahana). We liked all three restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: fotomann74
Reviews.Content: If you want the ultimate place to stay that offers everything you need, this is it. Beautiful and romantic. We will return. Maurice Wilson Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “exceptional help at the front desk--Hannah”
Reviews.Author: HappyKan
Reviews.Content: Had a big problem with a room and Hannah at the front desk went above and beyond to help. people help make the experience, and Hannah is making our stay here a great experience

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: chelseaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this resort for 7 days the apartments are great have everything you need for a great vacation the beach was great and the bell hops lincon and noah gave us fantastic service the only thing that we thought was a bit to pricey was the beach bar hamburgers should not be $16 and no french fries with that we ate in the itailian rest in the evening and that was not the best we walked down the beach to dukes the next night and that was not great either the one good meal we had was a place called the hula grill great sevice great food lots of choice there's a shuttle that will take you there for free

Reviews.Title: “Great locatio, great facility, great service”
Reviews.Author: mogul23
Reviews.Content: We are owners at this location and brought friends of ours who were visiting for their first time. We thoroughly enjoyed our vacation and had fabulous service from all of the employees. We especially wanted to acknowledge the bell staff....Jason, Tosh, Akamu, Maka, and Hana....they were incredibly friendly and ready, willing, and able to assist us....all with great attitudes and customer service. Also, Benjy was a great waiter at Pulehu.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite places”
Reviews.Author: djssrca
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Vacation Network owners and bought a timeshare at this location (North Villas) in mid-2005. Our first stay was in 2007, and we've been back almost every year since, at various times of the year. This is a gorgeous resort with very comfortable homey villas where you can cook in the fully functional kitchens and barbeque, which we do enjoy as we're not into going out for every meal on a vacation, especially in Hawaii. Not to mention the full-size refrigerator for holding a good supply of liquid refreshment. We like to stop off at the Costco near the Maui airport and load up on groceries and snacks -- saves a bundle of money and is so convenient. Whether you stay at the north or south property, you can use the pools and facilities at both. It's gorgeously landscaped and feels relaxed. Probably my husband's favorite feature is the beach which is steps from your condo and is excellent for swimming and snorkeling most of the year. Another great feature are the complimentary shuttle busses which will take you to the other Starwood hotels (Sheraton Black Rock or Westin Maui, and Whaler's Shopping Village. That gives you alot more choices for shopping and places to go for meals without having to drive your rental car around. I will agree with a few other reviewers who have said that there are a few employees -- especially at the front desk -- who do not always display the warmest aloha spirit... but this is usually the exception rather than the rule. But overall this is a very beautiful and classy place to stay ... our favorite in Maui for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th time - definitely will go back”
Reviews.Author: bedil
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect vacation. We stayed in a deluxe one bedroom with a full kitchen. We were able to cook in our villa and barbecue out by the pool. There is beach access near each building and the rounds are gorgeous. Self Parking is free and if you are handicapped valet parking is free. The resort has a free shuttle that turns every 15-20 minutes and transports you to Lahaina or to Whaler's Village or the other Westin properties. The Westin hotel puts on an EXCELLENT luau. The food is served family style on a lay susan in the center of the table and the drinks are not the typical watered down Mai Tais. They have a full bar and the drinks are included. You can pay extra for priority seating which was definitely worth it. Fantastic show as well as delicious food. Out of 5 luaus we have been to this is by far the best. The Sheraton which is owned by Westin has a great restaurant and while you dine you can see the torch lighting followed by the diving from the cliffs at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, expensive rental”
Reviews.Author: ouilv2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at this resort in early February. The 1 BR/1 BA plus full kitchen living space was great, the tub in the bathroom was a weak imitation of a whirlpool and the drain took about 45 minutes to drain out. Call maintenance the first day if this happens to you! Unfortunately the pool area had nowhere near enough shade for all of the people staying at this resort. At 9 am the pool staff would come by and if you had a towel reserving a chair but you were nowhere near it they would place a tag on your towel. Then when they came back at 10 am if you had not returned and removed the tag yourself your towel and stuff would be removed and taken to the towel hut. It's fair but if you don't know it going in then itâ€™s not fair. They need to explain that process more clearly at check-in. The ocean/beach here is not that great. They charge you for lounge chairs on the beach and the actual beach is OK - a bit rocky and hard to get into without aqua socks or other foot protection. The grills are nice to cook on in the evening but they get crowded and several are very difficult to control from a gas perspective. There is a great market close by - Tyme's with excellent meat and grocery.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Our one bedroom condo was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: maromatic
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Costco Travel and booked 2 studio units. With the package we booked, we got free upgrades to one bedroom units. Fantastic! The kitchen was modern and stylish, the bathroom was HUGE, the bedroom nice size, very comfortable bed and the living room area was perfect. We secured two ground floor units at check in. Lucky for us, the lanais opened up right out to the Pirate Pool! The children were extatic! Can't say a bad thing about the week we spent at the property. Didn't want to leave! With all the amenities in the one bedroom unit, I felt like it was my own condo. Check out time is early...but we were able to get a "day rate" for our room on the last day so we could hang out and not be homeless before our late evening flight. We had to call the morning of checkout to see if we would be granted the "day use" of our room. We had to pay for it, but well worth every penny. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love the villas!”
Reviews.Author: SherryHa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean front 2-bedroom lockoff in April for a week --- wow, gorgeous views, beautiful interiors wonderful staff, can't say enough great things! I love having a washer and dryer in my unit - they are in all the units! We stayed in the villas North! Parking is free when you are an owner. We all enjoy the complimentary shuttle into Lahaina, it saves the hassle of trying to find a place to park. You can get your groceries closeby in Lahaina at Safeway at the Lahaina Cannery Mall -- they also have a small food fair there and some shops - it's air conditioned!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome birthday for my husband!!!”
Reviews.Author: rosecitysweethearts
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th time to stay in the Westin villas and we have been back every year since we purchased our home resort. We also sent 2 of our sons and their wives for their honeymoon. We celebrated by husbands 50th birthday this year and took my brother and his wife .. they now understand why we love it so much!! The grounds are always maintained as well as the pools. We rented a gazebo and relaxed by the wonderful pools overlooking the pacific ocean for 2 of the days. We used the grills on the grounds to cook our fresh fish from the fish market. We look forward to planning next years trip !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities but the staff needs some help”
Reviews.Author: Czern
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom at this property for a week and loved the convenience of having a kitchen to prepare some of our meals. It feels more like a home than a hotel which is really nice. the grounds are lovely, they have a bbq area for guests that was kept immaculate. Being right on the beach was also great and overall I would give this property a very high rating but the front desk not so much. Upon check in the woman who helped us looked bored to the point of yawning in my face at least three times. Normally, front desk personnel will exchange pleasantries such as "have a great stay" but none of that with this person. There was no one else waiting to check in either so I know it wasn't that she was busy. I felt like saying if you don't like your job, get a new one but refrained. Interestingly enough, I stopped at the front desk a couple more times during our stay, in a couple instances for change to tip the housekeeping staff, who were very nice btw, and found the same lack of enthusiam each time. This was a very expensive stay so I would think management would be careful in hiring the help. That was one disappointment in an otherwise enjoyable stay.
