The gym and pool area get very crowded so go early. There is also a small deli on the grounds but if you are planning to cook, stop in to the supermarket up the road and buy your groceries, the selection is much better. I believe it was a Safeway.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it love it!”
Reviews.Author: AliceMadera_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort! The grounds are well manicured, the rooms are nicely decorated, and all of the staff were very nice too. Oh...I forgot to mention the "Heavenly Beds"! The snorkeling just off the beach is fabulous and the walkway in between the resort and the ocean is nice for walking and jogging. We used their convenient shuttle service to go to Whalers Village and into Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: SalehAlrobayan
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife and my little girl it was my second trip to maui, the service was excellent!!! One staff member that should be recognized is Hannah at the front desk. Hannah was extremely helpful and wonderful to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: travlinfamCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had the best experience at the villas in Maui. We started off our vacation in a studio villa, but after the first 2 days we upgraded to a 1 BR with a ocean view!!!WOW- the room was so comfortable and the beds were truly HEAVENLY. Suzy at the front desk was so gracious to find the perfect room tho meet our needs. We will return and highly recommend to families with children!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: misshellokitty007
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this property! My family and I have been visiting this property since the first year that it opened it's doors. It keeps getting better and better every year! It's always soooo exciting to go back each year because they have added some new activity or new concierge desk. I LOVED the welcome Monday "meeting" to welcome everyone and tell all the guests of all the different activities, restuarants & venues on the property. Each manager gave away some freebies and encouraged everyone to attend 1 activity or eat at 1 restaurant. Plus, they had FREE, YES FREE, mixed fruit, fresh juice, and coffee. So nice! I personally like the South side better with the pools and slide, but the NORTH side is great for children with Pirate's cove and the very large children's 1 foot deep swimming pool. There are concierge desks in each building which is extremely helpful since the property is so large! Everyone is super friendly and welcomes you with the Aloha spirit! The only negative remark is the "Wellness Program." I would only recommend this to people who have never ever taken a yoga or fitness class before. The teacher seriously just likes to hear herself speak and is very rude. I have been doing yoga & pilates for 12 years...and I felt like this was a complete waste of money. :( This is seriosuly though the only thing negative I have to say. AWESOME. AWESOME! keep up the great work! My family and I will be back next year. I keep raving to all of my friends and family what a blast my family and I had for the week that we were there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place-Our Home Away from Home in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler123451
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for our 4 or 5th time--lost count. Fantastic place. Great pools, great people, extremely friendly and helpful concierge desk, great location, etc. Easy to get to all of the local beaches, and just a few minutes to Lahina. This is the only place we stay in Hawaii. They do have time share tours available but they certainly donâ€™t push it. This is the place to stay to be near everything, but it still gives you that â€œgetawayâ€� feeling. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: madison25
Reviews.Content: Tasteful decor, but the rooms are on the small side. The "deluxe" 1 bedroom is smaller than other Westin villa properties. A few small problems proved to be distracting. For example, jacuzzi tub was broken. Also, despite what the resort website says, there's no oven in the kitchen. Maybe not a big deal for most people, but half the fun of getting a villa instead of a hotel room is to cook! Nice view, ok pools. Could use a few more waiters around the pool area. Ridiculously fast valets, nice job guys! We had a nice time, but I wouldn't say this property is memorable. I would recommend trading into this place if you are already a member of the Starwood timeshare group, but I wouldn't go out of your way to book a room here otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Darren
Reviews.Content: Just finished our first week in our timeshare ocean front view room at KOR North (May 29 - June 5 2011). We were most impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the pool-beach activity staff, and the hotel staff was just as good (the pool-beach activity staff is contracted out, so they certainly appear to be demonstrating their desire to retain their contract!). The resort is clean, nice quality, and was not overcrowded. The beach is good for swimming and snorkeling, and nice walks either direction. The shuttle is very accomodating and timely for travel to Whaler's Village, Lahaina, etc. In fact next year we are going to try without a rental car all together and see if we can make it work. Overall all, the resort was great. So much so, that we invested in another timeshare unit to become part of the Starwood points plan at the minimum level, and be able to stay 2 weeks next year and have options for travel elsewhere. Starwood really does have it together with this one. We just hope it remains top quality, clean and friendly for the long haul, as we are committed Maui vacationers!

Reviews.Title: “The South Villas....not so much....”
Reviews.Author: AlohaShan
Reviews.Content: We are SVO owners here and have stayed at the North villas numerous times but this was our first stay at the South villas. There are pros and cons to both but overall we prefer the North villas. The South villas are the older villas and the rooms are starting to show signs of use. Our room (3214) had damaged baseboards, ceiling stains from leaks and a loose TP holder and was just a bit worn out and tired overall. We had a 2 bedroom lock-off and the design is a bit different as well with a separate entry foyer that each bedroom opens into. We prefer the more open layout of the North villas. South Pros: More tropical pool design (better for kids, has waterslide), more central pool towel stand, better menu and glassware at pool restaurant/bar. North Pros: Jacuzzi has ocean view, seems more luxurious overall, elegant pool design (more adult oriented), rooms are cleaner and have better floor plan layout.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: atxtravel
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Hawaii we ended up setting the bar very high with our stay at the Westin Resort Villas. We stayed in the North villas and glad we did. If you like things a bit more relaxed I would suggest this side. The South villas pool has a slide which tends to attract many more kids. You can easily go next door and hang out over there but sitting on your lanai on the North side is so much nicer in the evenings on the North side. Ate dinner at the italian restaurant on site one night. Food as very good and reasonably priced (especially with the 15% off deal they were running when you mentioned it at the time of the reservation). The staff was great and took pride in providing good customer service and recognizing us and calling us by name throughout the week. From the guys handling the bags up front to checkin to the concierge and the guys out by the pool. Lincoln, Jason, Cherline, Elijah and Cole all helped to make our trip very enjoyable. The room was very clean and comfortable. Easy to get to a couple of different grocery stores (Times to the north and Safeway in Lahaina). Nice walk down the boardwalk to Black Rock and Whalers Village (about 1.5 miles). A good place to run in the morning. The Westin provides a shuttle to these spots if you dont want to walk which was very nice. The concierge staff did a wonderful job, getting us set up with a luau, surfing lessons and the zipline before we even arrived. They were able to get my wife in to a local dentist on short notice for an emergency tooth problem on our last day. While check-out is at 10:00 we were able to enjoy a full day at the pool and beach on our last day because our luggage was stowed with the staff and we used the guest lounge to shower before heading to the airport. Overall the facility was great, but the staff made the difference. We will definitely go back to the Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular vacation”
Reviews.Author: smf0621
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week's stay at The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas and have nothing but wonderful things to stay about this resort!!! From the smiles from each and every employee at the resort to our fantastic accommodations, we are already planning our next trip to Maui!! This was our first trip to Maui and (because of the wonderful treatment we received at The Westin) it will definitely not be our last. This hotel is definitely 5+ stars in service, cleanliness, efficiency and overall luxury. We were treated as if we were their only customers from the moment we walked into the spectacular lobby. If the opportunity arises to visit this resort, do so without hesitation!! You will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's a real paradise, we loved this place”
Reviews.Author: wolfpar
Reviews.Content: This place is like paradise. Nice gardens, full of well-prepared grass, and lots of care of detail in all things. The room was perfect and we really thank Alex Olpindo for his generous arrangement. All guys were pleasant and very helpful. Andy at the welcome made also the difference. Thank you all guys!!! We had a perfect honeymoon...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: srhbluerain
Reviews.Content: The Westin Villas were perfect for the first leg of our honemoon. It truly is a tropical paradise. The check in process was quick and we were amazed when we got to our suite. It was a large suite with full kitchen, massive bathroom (with two sinks, separate toilet room, hot tub and separate large glass shower), large balcony, king bedroom (I love the Westin Heavenly bed and toiletries), and large living room area with couch and dining room table. We had a view of one of the pools and the ocean. We loved that we had a kitchen so that we could cook a couple of the nights and had breakfast food, drinks, and snacks. There are several restaurants on the property that we tried. We also liked the little convenience store on the property. They have lots of fresh foods, toiletries, gifts, and groceries. It is better to go to the grocery store for a big grocery shopping though. We enjoyed the pasta buffet at the Italian restaurant. It was a LOT of food! We also ate at the bar and grills in the pool area (there are two). The food was good pub fare, nothing spectacular but decent. We loved the pool area. There are lots of families here since it is an all suite hotel but that didn't bother us. A lot of the kids enjoy the pirate ship area which is enclosed and away from the other pool areas. The property is massive and we enjoyed walking around it. There is a free shuttle that you can take to the other Starwood properties and to local shopping areas and downtown Lahaina. The beach in front was one negative since there is a lot of coral so you can't just walk in the water. You have to walk a ways to get to an area without the coral. We did do some snorkeling in front of the hotel. It's good for beginners but there isn't much to see. I recommend driving out to Napili Bay for breakfast and the relaxing and gorgeous beach there. The Westin has lots of activities going on if you wish to participate. We were pretty much beach and pool bums but did enjoy the craft fair that they had one day during the week. We were able to park in the covered parking garage near our room at no charge which was convenient. The only other complaint we had was that the maid was waiting by our door for us to checkout. We weren't even late, she came 15 minutes before checkout and just stood there waiting for us. We thought it was rude and unprofessional of the Westin to let this happen. Overall, we had a wonderful experience at the Westin. Our suite was perfect and it truly is an upscale tropical paradise.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time...we'll be back again.”
Reviews.Author: LC_Darling
Reviews.Content: I must say it was hard to compete with our last trip to WKORV. We got an Ocean Front upgrade in 2009 but occupancy was very low. We knew that we wouldn't be that lucky going back and were just hoping for ocean view! Well we got an ocean view on the 6th floor on the south side and were far from disappointed. We love staying there for the convenience to Lahaina and Kapalua. We hung out at the pool almost every day and my son had a BLAST. We took full advantage of the BBQ and Kitchen for lunches and breakfast. We worked out everyday at the two workout facilities which is important to our choice of hotel. I love the boardwalk where you can almost walk/run from end to end of Kaanapali. Already getting heartsick to go back. ONLY downside our room keys were not working 100% of the time but not a deal breaker. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest starwood hotel on island”
Reviews.Author: tw0thirds
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the north tower in building 7 (or maybe is was 8?) for a few days in May with my wife using points. Over the past few years, we had previously stayed in the Westin Resort and Sheraton down the road and this was our first stay in the Villas. Overall, I like this hotel more than the other starwood properties on the island. The grounds are very nice and the rooms are clean. It is nice having a kitchen(ette) to prepare snacks and other lunches. The hotel also runs a shuttle service between the other starwood properties and downtown Lahaina which is a nice perk. (I am always shocked at how few people tip the drivers!) The pool has many loungers around the property and some umbrellas if you want to escape from the sun. Unfortunately, the loungers are not that comfortable as they have a metal bar across the back which makes for uncomfortable lounging. The pool side drink service is very understaffed and you are much better off hoofing it to the bar vs waiting the 30-60 minutes for the drink boy to show up. I was not impressed with the front-desk. We arrived at Noon during the day of check in. We did not expect our room to be ready upon arrival, but we were hopeful to get a room before 4PM. After checking with the front-desk a few times, the room was still not ready at 4PM. Finally, the front desk called to check on room status instead of relying on the computer status. Sure enough, it was ready but the status was not updated. I wonder how long it had been ready? On the plus side, we were given a "late" checkout of Noon. The standard checkout is 10AM which is way too early. As the hotel is a "resort", they do not honor most SPG "gold" status perks so you will not get a room upgrade or 4PM checkout. I prefer the Wailea side of the island. If I were to return to this side of the island, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep well, great for family with children”
Reviews.Author: linbay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for family traveling with young children. Here is a breakdown of different categories: Location: It's in Ka"anapali, although the official address says Lahaina. When you drive in from the airport, you don't need a map, just follow signs to Lahaina. Once you are in Lahaina, you have to continue going NORTH. There are two Westin resorts, there names are extremely simlar. Just remember this one has "Villas" and the other one don't. You'll need to make a LEFT ON KAI ALA Dr. However, the same street has 2 names, and 2 signs. The other sign is PUUKOLII. Make a LEFT HERE. The location is about 50 minutes from the airport without traffic. Self parking is $ 7, Valet is $ 9 per day. Your first day of valet upon check in is complimentary. If you wish to self park, you can retrieve your car on day 2, there are indoor/outdoor parkings. The hotel does not have anything plazas or anything exciting nearby. The Whalers Village and the other Westin/Sheraton are 30 minute walk away. The hotel does provide a 15 minute interval shuttle that will take you there free of charge. Check in: They have two lobbies, South (the first one as you pull up), and North (the second one). Depending on which building your room is located in, you'll have to check into the corresponding lobby. The two lobbies are walking distance from each other. Difference between North and South: We stayed in the north building # 7 and found this to be more favorable because it's newer, the halls are decorated with art, and it appears that North buildings mostly face the ocean with minimal rooms that face the parking lot. The room: We stayed in the 1 bedroom premium villa full kitchen and laundry. Although it's a full kitchen, they only supply the following: Dish detergent, sponge, coffee, limited creamer, coffee maker, blender, toaster, pots/pans, dishes, utensils. You will need to buy your own oil, seasoning and any other basics you need to fully utilize the kitchen. We had to invest in ketchup, oil, salad dressing, salt and so forth. Being an experienced international traveler, I'm pleased with the room. The bathroom is large, and has two doors, one into the master and the other into the living area. The bathroom also has a jacuzzi tub which we absolutely loved. We were placed on the first floor, which at first we were displeased with. However - we now realize we prefer the first floor, this is why: All rooms have balconies. And if you are on the first floor, instead of a balcony, you have a larger patio that leads to the hotel public grounds. The patio is not completely exposed, it's surrounded by lush plants, but there is an access path to give allow you the opportunity to get to the pool/beach directly from the patio. Someone would have to stay behind to lock the sliding door from the inside. Another reason we like the first floor is that I'm very impressed by the fact that you WILL NOT HEAR ANY NOISE FROM PEOPLE LIVING ABOVE YOU. I have stayed at expensive resorts all over the world including 5 star hotels, historic hotels, and I must say, when it comes to hearing your neighbor above you, price has nothing to do with noise. At the Westin Villas, we have NEVER heard people walking down the hall giggling or talking loudly, or high heels, or people above us, EVER. Our sleep quality is exceptional because we don't hear dumpster trucks, sirens, loud motorcycles or fixed up cars, or beeping trucks backing up. The hotel is absolutely QUIET! The room also offers laundry, so if you want to use it, you'll need to purchase your own detergent/sheets from a store. We found this to be very useful since we stayed 7 nights. The pools: Each south/north buildings have their own multiple pools. I'm disappointed with the appeal of the pools. For the price we are paying on the hotel, we expected the pool areas to be more upscale. However - they do have multiple pools/jacuzzis that appeal to different preferences: children pool, adult only pool, pirate pool and so forth. It's very children friendly. We've stayed at places where they do not allow flotation devices. This place has an "anything goes" mentality. So if you prefer to let your children monkey around in the pool and use flotation devices, this is PERFECT. The pools does have hours, but then again, anything goes here. I find the staffs don't enforce the hours, so I think it's PERFECT if you want to take a midnight dip. Although the pool water is not cold, it's not warm either. You can also rent flotation devices from the hotel directly, it's right next to the pools. Beach access: The hotel has direct beach access. There is also a path that parallels the ocean that runs north/south. Since the resort is on the north end of Ka'anapali, if you want to go for a long walk, you can go further if you head SOUTH. As you walk on the path, you will actually walk through the grounds of multiple resorts. There are signs that will guide you how to continue on the beach path. You can actually access the other Westin & Sheraton Black Rock by foot, as well as the Whaler's Village if you go SOUTH (that means beach is on your right). Other hotel guests: Most likely in the retirement age, or families with young children (like us). This is definitely NOT A ROMANTIC HOTEL. So if you are considering this for romance, you need to look elsewhere. Overall value: We paid about $ 800 per night for a studio/kitchen + 1 bedroom villa with kitchen. So if we break it down, it's about $ 400 per room, not including taxes & parking. As an experienced traveler, I feel that we are paying more due to the fact that the rooms come fully equiped with kitchen/laundry. At the end of the day, I think $ 400 is steep. We do save a little by being able to dine in once a day in our room, but we also invested in things like oil, butter, seasonings that we'll just leave behind for the hotel to throw away. The hotel grounds is nice, but nothing about it wowed us. We most likely will NOT RETURN to this hotel, although we did enjoyed it. Although the hotel is pretty new, you can see visible wear & tear. It makes sense since it appeals to family with children.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Property - Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRC15
Reviews.Content: I always prefer to stay at Westin Hotels. I do a lot of traveling for work and the occasional vacation with family, and Westin never disappoints. This is my second time in Maui and we also stayed at this property before. The employees are always friendly here and very customer service oriented. One person in particular was when I checked-inâ€“ Alex. From the time he first greeted us, you can tell heâ€™s a friendly guy and he turned out to be accommodating as well. To me, I think it makes a huge difference when the person you encounter with at check-in is genuinely friendly and has an approachable persona. Other than the valet guy, really the first person you interact with is the one behind the front desk. As a guest, you then feel like your welcomed warmly to their hotel and vacation finally starts! Since our stay in 2008, I think this property has actually gotten bigger â€“ seems like they added additional tower since. Nice lobby â€“ they had two actually. Both were wide open and the fragrance of the air when you enter is fresh, soothing and very relaxing. I donâ€™t know what it was â€“ white tea maybe? Anyway, awesome beach and there are two pools â€“ one for little kids and the other one for adults. Overall this hotel is wonderful. I would give it 5 stars but they didnâ€™t have in-room dining (no room service) and the breakfast buffet is a little bit lacking. I would expect a little bit more for $25 breakfast. Definitely would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “beyond friendly, but lacking in the accomodations”
Reviews.Author: suesgate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Hawaii every year, and love to stay in Westin, Marriott and Ritz Carlton properties. This time we chose a Westin timeshare. Although the staff was wonderful and accomodating (Jason K at the front desk, Rita in the concierge desk, all of the wait staff) the room was less than to be desired. We were (for some reason) put in a room facing the children's (pirate ship) pool without a balcony, and a sliver of an ocean view. I guess it didnt matter that we are a mature couple, and that we didnt have children with us, when the front desk assigned this studio to us. The room was really run down-torn carpeting, dirty grout (tile) in the kitchen and soiled and stained lampshades. We also were greeted with a big ball of hair in the bathroom....yuk! Also, gecko's were present in the room, and even though we were not bothered by them, I am sure that other people might no have the same affinity for them.... Not going back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: hawaii29220
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 25th marriage anniversary. The accommodations were nice thanks to Mylin. She was very helpful and got our trip off to a nice start. There were 3 downsides to the trip;1. One day our room simply was not cleaned, we left early in the day came back later that evening and the room had not been touched. 2. The power was down in our building for 8 hours and we were forced to have to leave the resort for that day, and no type of compensation was made at all nor offered for the huge inconvenience. 3. My husband and I were here celebrating our 25th marriage anniversary, and typically when we go to a resort (which we frequent) or hotel and let them know that we are celebrating a special occasion, they would either send fruit, flowers, champagne, chocolate, etc to our rooms at some point during the course of our stay. That was not the case here, which actually was quite a bit of a disappointment. Your grounds are beautiful but the lack of engagement actually made our stay here average.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely relaxing getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Jadwall25
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived it was one of the best trips I've ever been on. Beautiful view from the lobby at check in. I was there for my anniversary and front desk clerk Jason Kapono was extremely helpful in accommodating my request. He easily went beyond his normal duties to help us make our trip very special. Ate at all the restaurants at the location and all were outstanding. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. Great pools, great beach, great staff. Not one negative thing to say about this resort. Wonderful. I will go back again, and would recommend it to anyone looking to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kcrum
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were blown away by this resort and if and when we come back to Maui this is where we want to stay. We traded our two bedroom condo for a two bedroom condo (4619/4620) at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas. While checking in we were disappointed because we were given a condo in the 4th building (South property of the Westin). If you were looking at the building map this was one farthest from the ocean; however they honored my request and gave us a high floor which was on the 6th floor. We lucked out and checked in at 3 PM as they already had our studio unit ready so we went up to that side of the condo. At this time housekeeping was just finishing up the large one bedroom side. We couldnâ€™t believe our eyes as these 2 units together were huge (actually sleeps 8 people) for just the two of us. It was like having 2 separate condos with a joint entranceway and then individual doors to each unit. Had we known how big our condo was we would have invited another couple. The view from the large one bedroom lanai was amazing. We had a corner unit and had a direct view across the pool area and straight to the ocean. From the other side of the lanai we could see the mountains and rainbows. Needless to say at this point we were extremely satisfied with our trade. The staff also left a bottle of champagne and a note congratulating us with our 5 year anniversary. What a nice touch! The condo was beautiful. A large kitchen with full stove. Large refrigerator, microwave and front loading washer/dryer. Both the living room/bedroom had large flat screen balconies. Oh and need I mention that Heavenly Bed (I wanted to take it home with us). I used the large Jacuzzi tub most nights. Everyone was right the snorkeling directly in front of the resort is amazing. We compared notes with another couple and all of us said the snorkeling here was better than Hanauma Bay on Oahu. We were blown away by all the tropical fish and beautiful reefs. The grounds were immaculate, pools were really nice and the koi ponds were cool. We ate at both the Ocean Bar & Grill and Pailolo Bar & Grill (both were really good). They both have a Happy Hour every day from 4-6 PM. The boardwalk in front of the resort meanders all the way to the Sheraton Black Rock and up to North Kaâ€™anapali Beach. A short walk from the resort (10 minutes) and you can eat at Dukeâ€™s right along the beach and a great place to watch sunsets. We rented a jeep for the week from Thrifty through Discount Hawaii Car Rental. This was our second time using them (last time was in 2008) and everything was great. I highly recommend them. Having a vehicle on Maui made it even better as we could explore on our own. Parking at the Westin is free as long as you are an owner or exchanger. In fact we couldnâ€™t find anything negative about the entire trip. It was a great experience from check-in to check-out. All the staff (front desk, security, housekeeping, bar/restaurant personnel) we encountered during our stay were smiling, friendly and willing to assist if we had a question or needed something. Thus far the best timeshare trade weâ€™ve received thus far and weâ€™ve stayed at some great ones including several of the Royal Resorts in Cancun and Harborside Resort in Atlantis. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Maui Met our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: snookyT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our 28 yr. old daughter in Hawaii and this was our second and best stop! The one bedroom villa was spacious and comfortable and we loved the spacious lanai or balcony which had a table and 4 chairs. We overlooked the pool and had a wonderful view of the ocean from unit 7463. The only complaint was that the hideabed was not comfortable for our daugher so on the 4th night we requested a cot which was immediately brought to our room. One of the perks we felt was the free shuttle which transported you between Westin properites and also into town for shopping, restaurants, etc. Altho we had a rental car, we still availed ourself of the shuttle a few times. We are timeshare owners and traded through II and were so happy with our experience. We did find the restaurants on site and in the area to be expensive so bought groceries at the nearby Safeway. Make sure you have their store card as it makes a substantial difference in the price you pay. The pool area generally has 2 drink specials each day for $7. We did not want to pay $11 for a footlong hotdog or $16 for a cheeseburger so we made our own lunch and also had breakfast in our room. The check in an check out was efficient and the staff was professional and helpful in every way. There is a long walk to the rooms from the parking area and we felt the parking design to be lacking. The spots were numbered but we were told that didn't mean anything--just park wherever.. The Kaanapali is beautifully maintained and you saw workers everyday weeding, cleaning, etc. The pools are shallow but we didn't mind as they were clean and spacious. The beach rents umbrellas for $20 and chairs for $10 but we would go to the pool early in the day and then to the beach about 2:00 and generally would find a chair/umbrella that had been vacated. Also we were told if you check with the bellboy, you can often score a boogie board or chairs left behind. Then you just return them and they get passed on... Wish we had known this early on... Hopefully, you will enjoy your time at the Westin Kaanapali as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: KnoweledgeTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. We checked in late at night after travelling 24 hours . When I went to the room I was thoroughly disgusted. Our oceanview included a patio window that opened and a gate across the window. No lanai. The curtains had dirty fingerprints all over them and mold on the bottom. The carpet was disgusting. This was an upgrade. I called the office and said I was not going to stay and they told me they had nothing else available. Five minutes later the office called back and changed our rooms. The change was lovely. Modern and clean. One bedroom with living room and kitchenette/bar area However, the buildings are confusing and there are many of them all with their own lobbies. These so called villa's are rented out apartments. Way too big and it is luck of the draw what you will end up with. Take a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes0008
Reviews.Content: We just spend town weeks in a two bedroom, we got a parking lot view but wasnt a big deal the proper tie is fantastic! There is not many hotels close by so gives you the feeling of a private vacation club. The pool is very fun, but as soon as you step I. The ocean you can snorkel and see tons of fish, the water is very calm so even grandma can do it. It is close to a small shopping center which is very convinient, and has a beautiful path form walking full of flowers and next to the ocean. We want to thank Sean, Kalolo and other Hawaiian boy that made our stay, very helpful and always they went beyond their jobs, great positive attitude and very service oriented! We stayed in many hotels and the pool staff is the best, super friendly they remembered us by our names. We took a paddle surf lesson it was our first time and it was the highlight of the vacation, my daughter loved it soo much we end up doing 3 more times....they also told us the best spot to snorkel at the resort, it was also first time in the ocean form my daughter and they made her feel very comfortable with the equipment. Thumbs up for this great team.! Loved staying here great resort full of flowers everywhere, super clean, end very fun for the family...!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DPDDDS
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late April. Have been to Maui several times, and usually stay at the Marriott Ocean Club. I traded my Palm Desert Marriott Time share for the Westin Villas. I had anticipated that my Marriott trade with interval would result in a poor or non-existent view. This was pretty much the case. We were placed in a "ocean view" room, which meant that the primary view was of a parking lot, with a view of the ocean beyond. Initially I was upset and stomped back to the front desk to try and get a better view. After discreetly offering the front desk person a $200 tip to upgrade, with no better room as a result, my wife and I made the best of it, pretending to believe ; "you're hardly ever in your room anyway"! The gym, spa, and room were all excellent. No customer service issues at all. Moved to the Grand Wailea after 5 nights, for a 2 night stay (ocean view)..This place is ideal if you take the whole family. I thought I would miss the close proximity to Whalers Village, but did not miss it at all. Don't overpack...Great washer and dryers in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK Resort but HORRIBLE customer service, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelling602
Reviews.Content: We paid $350 a night for a room on the ground floor, facing a parking lot. I asked for an upgrade and offered to pay the difference. First I was told NO we cannot upgrade your room as you are on the "Explorer package rate". I said I would pay the difference. I was told no, can't do it. An hour later I went back to the front desk and spoke with someone else and told her how disappointed and dissatisfied we were with the accomodations and that we were shocked at them actually. I said I couldn't believe that we were expected to be enticed to purchase a timeshare on the property with accomodations like that. She "searched" (ie made it obvious that this was an inconvenience) the computer to see if she could find another room (It was absolutely NOT fully booked). She came up with a room on the 3rd floor with a partial view for an extra $150 a night. I said you have got to be kidding....$500 a night for a partial view?!?! I said no and could I speak with a manager. I sat waiting for 20 minutes and no manager showed up and the woman at the desk didn't even have the professionalism to come and let me know about the delay. I decided I am not going to waste my vacation by sitting in the lobby, so I left. At 7pm (6 hours later) we received a call from a manager by the name of Michelle. She said she would upgrade us to a 3rd floor partial ocean view room that was handicapp...NO STAND UP SHOWER BATH TUB ONLY. We said fine as the other room was like being in a dungeon...dark!!! Unbelieveable, we couldn't wait to get out of there. We stayed at this highly overpriced resort that offered NO AMENITIES and finally moved to the Hyatt where were in the truly lap of luxery in comparison at $169.00 per night!!!! Very disappointed, never acknowledged again even after relaying our experience to the Vacation Ownership Representative. The resort is "pretty", the food is marginal and of course expensive. My Sprite at the pool bar was $4.95, my husbands Mai Tai was $4.00...does that make sense???!!!?? Eggs benedict one morning was fine, the next time all eggs were hard cooked...for eggs benedict??? A guest at the table over even commented he felt "gipped".

Reviews.Title: “Paradise....all the right things in one place”
Reviews.Author: MRandMrsMontana
Reviews.Content: When booking a trip online 3500 miles away, one can think pictures are deceiving or that your room will vary in some shape or form. NOT the case here. What you see on the websites is definitely what you get and more. My husband and I were not on a tight budget but had to watch our pennies, so we decided to book through a timeshare owner at a lower cost than what the hotel was charging, which was great because the rest of the hotel "extras" were expensive. The minute you walk on to this property you are surrounded with relaxation. The property is very well manicured and decorated to the hilts. I can't say enough about the front desk and the valet, what wonderful people. We only sat at the bar twice but the staff seemed nice too. The room goes beyond your expectations and is nicely arranged so you are not stepping over yourself to move around. The pools are clean and the beaches are perfect, the snorkeling on the hotel beach front is amazing. The only suggestion is to buy your food at the grocery store and cook your own meals. The day we arrived we were pretty tired and didn't feel like going to costco, so we headed straight to the hotel.....bad decision. We sat at the bar, ordered a 20 oz Blue Moon and Bud light; had a pleasant chat asked for the bill and were shocked! $18.00 for 2 beers. We were anticipating a hike in the prices but not 3 times the normal price. The next morning we headed BACK to Costco and picked up a 24 pack of corona for $25.00 and called it a day. The hotel food looks good but we didn't eat there except once, which was breakfast. They have a beautiful buffet for the low cost of $25.00 a plate or a full menu....By the time it was said and done, breakfast for 2 was $52.00 + tip. The hotel has grills that guests can use and they are cleaned daily by the staff and there is always one available, we never had to wait. All in all, Loved the hotel, the room, the staff, the amenities.... skip the hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SidB
Reviews.Content: Amazing place..with kids. Beach, pool, kids theme pool, service...

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for anything better!!!”
Reviews.Author: TAYBUG
Reviews.Content: I had read so many negative and positive reviews about the Westin Villas that I was a little worried about what we would think of this Condo. Well I will tell you this we were so happy with our stay. We started off with a very friendly check in staff and then were blown away by the beautiful lobby and grounds. Our room was in building 6 in the north villas. My family and I were so impressed with our 1 bedroom. Talk about a well kept, stylish, comfortable room. We looked out on the pirate pool and we had no problem with noise, it was great sitting on our lanai and enjoy our coffee every morning. We actualy had a nice view of the ocean, bonus! One thing we were very impressed by was how well kept the grounds are, what a great staff the Westin Villas have. My family and I would like to thank everyone at the Westin Kaanapali Villas for making our family vacation such a special wonderful vacation. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: Pearlllama
Reviews.Content: After staying at the sheraton hotel last year my husband and I wanted to give the ocean resort villas a chance. We spent 5 nights at this hotel in a studio villa deluxe ocean view. Overall, the hotel is clean, modern, spacious bathrooms with walk in shower and large garden tub, flatscreen tv, heavenly bed and small kitchenette. One disappointment was the balcony. it was only about 18" deep. All studios seem to have a one bedroom villa adjacent to them and those are the units that have a balcony large enough for several people to hang out. The hotel seems to be experiencing a staffing shortage at the moment. From front desk slow to answer the phones to housekeeping not doing a thorough job to the wait staff at the outside bars - Hopefully they can work that out becuase it is a nice property with lots of potential. Food at the outside bar is expensive and not that great. They have a great happy hour from 4-6 pm every day which we took advantage of. They have great pools and waterslides for kids and adults. We'd consider bringing our kids with us there next time. Looked at the gym and it seemed to meet the standards of the Westin workout gyms.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip exceeded our high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: flyaway2day2011
Reviews.Content: We were shocked at how great our stay was at this hotel. Spacious one bedrooom w/ kitchen- Mountain view which I prefered ocean view was not an issue- the pool was great for families w/ kids...clean, good mix of people. Getting lounge chairs by the pool was a bit difficult if you did't reserve chairs by 7 am-8. You then had a 1 hr limit on chairs. Other than that the restaurant selection was good and the general store far exceeded our expectations by selling coffees, pastries, and many lunch and dinner options to cook or just heat up. Nice place, got a great deal which is why I decided to stay here. Totally got our money worth!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay so much, I would go back in a minute.”
Reviews.Author: kushka78
Reviews.Content: Recently spent Easter week at the Westin and couldn't have had a more enjoyable time.The hotel facilities are beautiful well cared for; there wasn't one staff person who wasn't agreeable and willing to help with my every request. From maids, to pool staff, to servers, everyone was very accomodating to my needs. I especially enjoyed the spa, and commend the Director Leah and my aestitician, Terri, for the delightful time there. For my 78 year old face they used products which are still unavailable retail, but are fantastic for my aging skin. I'll be watching for them and will return to the Westin Kaanapoli again in the future and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best vacation we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: MacPack95
Reviews.Content: The property was beautiful and the location was prime. Most of all, the staff was EXCELLENT!!! The poolside staff was most attentive and knowledgable about what to do while on vacation, and where to do it!! Cole, The Mikes, Jeff, and everyone were patient with our questions, fun to talk to (there were 11 of us!!!), and made it easy to enjoy our vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “The ideal Hawaiian vacation experience!”
Reviews.Author: rogersivers
Reviews.Content: The best relaxation vacation. The standout of the experience has been the watersport and pool service center staff. Mike Ware, who runs it, is friendly and acommodating! He and his staff create a relaxing, carefree environment around the pool and beach. Their knowledge of the resort takes the guesswork out of planning impromptu activities.

Reviews.Title: “Balanced resort - good combo of hotel/condo, perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: amyeliz6
Reviews.Content: This places makes it so easy to relax. The staff are polite and respectful and genuinely want you to enjoy your stay! The rooms are spacious clean and quiet; full kitchen with quality appliances and decor. Service is top notch and friendly. Boyd checked us in and worked with us to meet our needs, was warm, welcome and professional. Jeremy served us by the pool all week with a huge small, great attitude and always recognized us - called us by our names each day. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “If your on a couples vacation try somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel20
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at the Westin. Upon check in we were told we had a 1st floor room. When I booked last July I requested oceanview and anything except a 1st floor. ( I am very uncomfortable with a ground level room). I was extremely upset. Mylin at the front desk remained calm and professional and kept trying to switch us. After at least 45 minutes she went to talk to management and came back with good news, we were now on the 5th floor. The room was great and I am glad I stood my ground because there is no ocean view on the 1st floor or other lower floors from what I could see. Housekeeping was very layed back, everyone was complaining that they didn't clean rooms until late in the afternoon so we decided to go green for 4 days because the day we did have cleaning it was after 4 oclock and I had to ask for it to get done. Of course on our check out day they rang our bell at 9 and asked when we were leaving so they could clean the room. With a 10 am check out I can't believe they did that! Upon checking out we were told that we owed for our room. We had paid in advance for the room but they insisted they had no payment. I had to call our travel agent who had the receipt that it indeed was paid for. This took about two hours before they gave me a receipt with a zero balance. Not a "we are sorry, or have a drink on us" (we were staying at the pool until it was time to go to the airport) nothing! We were to get a 40.00 credit for going green but there was only 30.00 on the bill. I was so aggervated that I didn't even argue it .I must say that except for Mylin and the bell hops/guys in the front of the hotel no one was very friendly or went out of their way for you. We stayed at Outriggers on Oahu before here and I have never had better customer service. Everyone from the instant you walk on the property was extremely friendly and made you feel welcome. Prices here extremely expensive even for Maui. Go into town, there are great restaurants and drinks are a lot cheaper and better. As for kids, they were everywhere. We like kids, have kids but we were on a couples vacation and this is not the place for it. Breakfast had crying kids everyday. The adult pool is in a corner without any sun. If you were in any of the other pools kids were jumping over you, swimming into you etc. There was no quiet time in or out of the pool. If your on a couples vacation try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “"This vacation was tranquility"!”
Reviews.Author: nancymcfarland
Reviews.Content: We hace cacationed at the the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas a numerous amount of times. Each visit is better than the last. The staff is wonderful and friendly and very accomodating. The resort is a tranquil place. There is so much to do from snorkeling, whale watching, relaxing by the beautiful pools, fine dining, great food, etc. You leave this place knowing that you had a wonderful and relaxing vacation and wanting to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pitousee
Reviews.Content: First off, to all the people complaining about ocean view rooms.. Your in hawaii. Trust me, even if you have a view of only the parking lot, its spectacular. We were really taken aback by the negative reviews. The view, no matter where you are in the hotel, is spectacular. And even if your not looking at the ocean.. .its a short walk away! Why would you want to spend Hawaii in your room anyway? This hotel was amazing. Rooms- The rooms were huge and the beds were SO comfortable. The bed was amazing, so easy to sleep on. The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. The bathroom was AWESOME. My fiance and I are very particular on having a nice bathroom. We were blown away by this one. The shower had a nice glass door on it and the jacuzzi was perfect! We loved coming in after a long day and turning it on. Makes a great bubble bath! The beach is amazing. If you rent snorkeling gear, you can see some amazing coral and fish right off the beach. It was really fun being able to go out to the beach and snorkel right there. The italian grill at the hotel was AWESOME. It was pricey yes, but it was well worth it. Overall, this hotel was amazing. The staff were very nice and helpful. I recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Boyd and Lia's exceptional service made my trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: yippeeyippee
Reviews.Content: It's odd to say that exceptional service would have so much impact on my trip, but it did. I had originally intended to have a highly active vacation, visiting numerous sites/beaches etc.. That was not to be once I was injured in a car accident shortly before our trip. My injuries made it difficult to even walk around the hotel. Boyd and Lia made certain that I had a wonderful room to stay in. Studios on the South property do not have a normal balcony, but ours did. Our first week was spent in room #3231 which had an Oceanfront balcony. It made all of the difference in the world! I could sit on the balcony and truly feel like I was enjoying the best that Hawaii had to offer. The next week we had room # 3327 which also had a full balcony with a beautiful view. It was situated around the corner of our other room. From it we could see the ocean, Lanai and a park which was enjoyable for watching the people and activities. The hotel itself is ideally located. Step out the door for terrific snorkeling or drive 10 minutes to Lahaina for a bustling nightlife. The grounds are beautiful. The jacuzzi's could stand to be warmer. We are a childless couple so I would have preferred a nicer adults only pool. The only one is on the North property & frankly lacks everything along with the children. So if you want a peaceful but lovely swim it needs to be after 8 p.m..

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cindy84
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Westin, stayed there for a week. Very nice property. They are very strict as to the check in time...was not able to check in till exactly 4pm. We had exchanged our week to stay here, it is a lovely resort. Very expensive to eat here though. Found great deal at Duke's just a short walk down the broadwalk. The only thing I would have liked to have seen here is a Adults Only pool, as there very alot of kids here. They do have a small and I mean small adults pool at the North Tower, but does not get alot of sun. Otherwise, great trip.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a relaxing couple vacation, do not come to this property”
Reviews.Author: eugeniof
Reviews.Content: - We booked an ocean view and we got a parking lot view. After complaining, we were moved to a parking lot view one floor higher; the results was that you could see some of the ocean in the distanceâ€¦ - The property is really a timeshare, not an hotel. The name â€œvillasâ€� stays for â€œserviced apartmentsâ€� really, not for little units, as I was expecting. The cons of this is that there are a tons of families and little kids running around in every shared area. If you are a couple looking for a relaxing beach vacation, this is not the placeâ€¦ (the facility is so overcrowded that for breakfast the normal wait time is 10 mins.) - Also, they are not used to service the rooms as an hotel does. They barely clean the rooms during your stay â€“ in fact, at the check-in we were offered a $10/day discount if we wanted to give up the daily room service. Expect to find the hair you lost in the last shower in that same place, the day after! :-s - One day they did not service our room until 7:15pmâ€¦ - The check-out time is ridiculous. 10am. After pulling the SPG membership and telling them that 10am was ridiculous I was offered an 11am â€œlate check-outâ€� and only after more complaining a 12pm - Concierge services closes at 7pm, right when you are thinking what can I do for dinner? - Finally, I had three voice messages from the concierge telling me that my welcome gift was available at the concierge desk and that I had to come there to get it. Only reply possible to this, â€œwhy donâ€™t you just leave it in the room, I am never going to make it by 7pm to your desk, lazy xxx!â€� :-) - Go to the Ritz few miles north, much better facility

Reviews.Title: “My go-to place to stay when in Maui”
Reviews.Author: pixieray
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. I've now stayed at 3 different places in Maui, and this is absolutely my favorite. From the minute you arrive, the staff is so polite, welcoming, and friendly, and the grounds and spacious villas are beautiful and charming with rustling palm trees everywhere. It always feels like a home away from home. While we had a stunning oceanview room, we spent most of the time lounging on the pool chairs in front of the beach - nothing better than watching the Maui sunset there with a mai-tai from the pool bar! I did request an early check-in for noon, but the room still wasn't ready until 3:50PM (10 minutes prior to actual check-in), so I felt that perhaps the staff wasn't as organized as they should have been about the cleaning schedule. However, they did provide us with excellent amenities while we waited (showers, bathroom, etc.), so it didn't hamper our schedule at all. When we finally checked in, Mylin was very thorough and helpful. I also wish that their paddle board/kayak renter had a more "set" schedule, but again, not a big thing that really affected our trip too much. Overall, I just adore this property. It has a wonderful spirit and vibe, and it'll be whatever you need it to be (relaxing, for the kids/family, for a romantic getaway, etc.). Take advantage of the sunsets (with the happy hour!), the snorkeling right in front of the hotel (turtles!), and the beachfront grills. I'm sure that the next time I'm in Maui, I'll be back at the Westin Kanaapali Ocean Villas.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Overseas_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Ocean Resort Villas and it was great to be back. We exchanged in here via Interval International, which always represents great value but also extended our 1 week stay by 3 nights. The resort is stunning, rooms spacious and it would be hard to find fault with any aspect of our stay. Most people hire a car to stay here and so you're not far from anywhere but there is also a free shuttle bus for those who prefer not to drive. Lovely pool on site, including one for the kiddies and the beach provides a great place to snorkel from without having to swim too far out. Some of the earlier reviews talk about pricey food but it's a five star resort and pricing is quite normal from this point of view. Don't forget that you have the option to cook in, as all the units have kitchens and there are also barbeques on site, as well as there being a wide range of dining options within a short drive of the resort. Maui offers an amazing place to visit for those wanting to escape the ''in your face'' commerciality of Waikiki but also offers a classy place to party for those that want to. Amazing golf on the island too - don't forget to play the Kapalua Plantation Course for stunning views and a chance to play where the pros play. Enjoy your stay - no resort is going to please everyone 100% of the time - it's just a fact - we're all different with a variety of expectations but if you don't enjoy your stay here, then you'll struggle anywhere. Have fun! We won't hesitate to keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kinderteacher4
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Westin Villas. We brought our 15 month old daughter. The room was very large. It had a kitchen, washer/dryer, seperate bedroom, and large balcony. The breakfast was included in our package booked with expedia. The breakfast was awesome. The pool and beach area were also nice. It is a short walk to Dukes restaurant. There is also a walking path to Whalers Village or a free shuttle. We really enjoyed our stay. We hope to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “relaxation plus”
Reviews.Author: bluehadjon
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here and its fantastic. There are loads of on site and off site activities to do. The rooms are very nicely appointed with everything you could want for an apartment. The pools are quite nice - although we preferred the adult pool away from all the kids. The beach is also quite good and had a great walking track. We had a couples massage in the tree house - Stacey and Luis both were brilliant - one of the best massages I have ever had!! There are three on site restaurants - a bit pricey but the food is ok. 10 minutes down the road (south) there are loads of great restaurants with excellent food and not as pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility...poor service”
Reviews.Author: scootermc1
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Villas with my family. Loved the resort, rooms were nice, modern, well. Typical Hawaii overcharging for everything. Paid $6.75 for 1/2 gallon of OJ in the onsite market. Not sure how they can sleep at night charging these prices. Same exact product was $1.39 at the local Safeway. Only serious issue was the maid service. Our room was never made without us having to call to complain. Every day, same ritual...we come back to the room at 3pm, realize they didn't clean our room, call down to house keeping, and they rush up at 4pm to clean our room (hastily). We later found out that you could opt out of dAily maid service for a room credit or breakfast voucher. This option was never explained to us...but we really wanted daily service. I am a Starwood Gold member...a fact that was never even acknowledged. Really disappointing for almost $600 per night

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - they charge for everything - even beach chairs.”
Reviews.Author: dozeydon
Reviews.Content: Bellmen are excellent - front desk, pool staff, store and waiters average at best - given price you expect more. All in all a nice hotel - very crowded - Mexico is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, overpriced restaurants - go to Dukes at Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: The property itself is very nice; clean lots of activities, close to Lahaina and the staff are extremely friendly and accomodating. We stayed in the studio, which for a family of four was much better than a hotel with two queen beds. The studios are comfortably furnished, kiids stayed on the hide-a-bed. Bathroom is roomy wih separate shower/tub and there is a small kitchen area with stove, fridge and microwave. Very good for breakfasts and lunches; and washer/dryer in the room was a nice feature also. The one thing I didn't like was the beachside bar - sraff was friendly, food was way overpriced and not worth what you pay - $9 for grilled cheese; $11 plain hotdogs; $17 hamburgers. We spent $80 one night and had very little to show for it. Did not eat at the main restuarant in the facility, so don't kinow how that was. A word of advice if you stay here - walk 1000 feet horth and go to Dukes at Honua Kai. Excellent food, reasonably priced ($28 for prime rib) and don't leave without trying the Kimo's Hula Pie - only $7 and well worth it. Not sure why the Westin bar is so lousy; but with Dukes so close, it doesn''t matter. Beers are $7 or so; best bet is to buy a 12-pack at Safeway, pick up a cheap cooler and bring your own beers to the beach or pool. No glass poolside, so bring cans. So Bottom line, do stay at the Westin; go to Dukes for close-in meals.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed every expectation (and I had high expectations)”
Reviews.Author: scott1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Westin Kaanapali in the newer north area. From the moment we arrived until we left, it exceeded every expectation we had. At no point did the the level of service disappoint us. As we checked in and made our way throughout the resort, we were greeted by every staff person we encountered. The personal concierge was handy. My wife made use of Spa Helani on-site and loved it. The staff was extremely attentive and courteous. The pools and grounds are very nice throughout the Westin complex. Although we didn't have kids, we could see ourself returning with them because it has a lot of fun activities and areas (Westin Kids, pirate ship water play area, and more). The beach in front of the resort isn't the best for swimming, but a short walk down is a great area free of coral. The beach drops quickly, so you can stand in chest high water just a few feet out. We were never asked to participate in a timeshare pitch, although we expected it. After all, this is a timeshare resort. The valet crew was efficient, courteous, and extremely friendly. The cost to valet was only $2 more per night than self-park, a deep discount in Hawaii. Our one-bedroom room was upgraded from our original reservation of a studio. The room was spacious with comfortable seating and the bed was great. The large bathroom opened up to the bedroom. And it was nice to have the washer/dryer combo since we had spent a week on Oahu; we washed all our clothes before going back to the mainland. We even had maid service our one full day there (a total surprise!). Overall, a very nice resort. We have no complaints or concerns... and we will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “aloha dream holiday”
Reviews.Author: aussiefamily001
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week and have a fabulous time. You need the full week to relax & really enjoy this place. loved being able to cook our own meals sometimes( great money saver,take the bus to Lahaina supermarket) loved the pools (my 4 year old loved the toddlers pirate ship)(2 teenagers loved the water slides and larger pools) You can snorkel right off the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and total relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: westinmaui2011
Reviews.Content: We have owned since this property since it was built. We travel each March to unwind and see the whales. Over the years we have seen many changes most for the good and some not as good. We love everything about this property excpet the smoking policy. If you are a non smoker be aware that smokers can and do smoke on their balconies. Since this is a tradewind area you will most likely have their second hand smoke in your room. I know that this is not a management issue, I do feel that this is a health issue. I think that Maui needs to rise to the level of California and take this issue into the 21st century. Even though this is a big deal for us I still recommend this property to all who want a wonderful vacation. There is so much to do or you can do nothing at all. Everone we come in contact with is wrm and friendly and we are looking forward to our return trip in October of this year. An added feature this that whether you are a couple or family you will find what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “quasi balcony doesn't cut it”
Reviews.Author: idwards
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing our stay here, and are prompted to write a review by the sight of my husband wedged on the 18" wide balcony so he can read a book. Really, it's that narrow. There is apparently no maid service, nor can you get an answer when trying to call room service. This is a Westin that checks the boxes for amenities, but doesn't actually provide them. Also beware, it's a high pressure time share situation. The "personal concierge" is relentless, calling as much as 3 times in 30 minutes to get you to go to the sales pitch seminar. Otherwise, the beach is narrow but pretty good- great if you snorkel not so good if you want to play in the water.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Ka`anapali- Love the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Dclem67
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the 2 week trip to Hawaii with the first week (3-5 to 3-12) at the Westin in Maui. We are Starwood owners (though not at this resort) and had one of our best trips ever. I love the location, amenities, staff, pools, snorkeling, beach, bars and restaurants. The staff is great and there are plenty of places to chill by the pool or beach. There is nothing not to like unless you have a disappointing view. We stayed in the older South building (bigger rooms I was told) in building 2 on the 5th floor nearer the ocean than the main building. From our balcony we overlooked the kidâ€™s pool, gardens between the North and South building and had a great open view of Molokai. Watched wales all week long and even had some 150 yards off the beach from time to time. Pictures included. The drinks and food are pricy, but not any more than other parts of the island. Paillo Beach bar has $4 Mai Tais during happy hour every day and the food is good. They have a shuttle to take you just about anywhere. Down to the Sheraton/black rock for the cliff dive ceremony (get to the Cliff Dive Bar early for a good view â€“ highly recommended), the Westin Hotel/Whalers Village and other places. Make sure to go to the Hula Grill, sit in the sand and get a Mai Tai (tasty) while in Whalers Village. Leilaniâ€™s is also a great place to go â€“ right next door. Canâ€™t wait to go back. If you can goâ€¦do it!! NOTE: I must add that we were here the night the Tsunami hit Hawaii. Thankfully there was no damage or even signs of the wave at the Westin. I give the management a HUGE thumbs up on the communication and evacuation plans. Luckily we did not have to move being on the 5th floor. There were PA announcements and phone voice mails about every 45 minute to an hour informing the entire resort of what was happening. Other than not getting any sleep, we felt safe and informed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to vacation on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ititravel
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the 'north villas' during spring break (3/12 - 3/19). Our condos were in building 7. Overall, I would give this resort a very high rating. Here are some pros and a few cons about our stay: pros: 1) Condos were very clean. Bathrooms and kitchens were spotless when we checked in. 2) Nice picture on the hd TVs 3) Staff was very friendly. We were always greeted when walking around the place. Those working at the poolside rental/towel building were always very helpful and friendly. Waiters and bartenders at the poolside bars/restaurants were, for the most part, very attentive and friendly. 4) Concierge was friendly and was not at all pushy about the timeshare presentation. We deferred on the 90 minute presentation. But, the $75 resort credit was tempting. 5) Check in and check out was painless and quick. We had read about long lines at the front desk. I never saw more than one or two people waiting at the desk (this is the north villas lobby). We checked in at about 7:00 pm on Saturday and checked out at 9:30 am on Saturday. 6) If you don't mind not having your condo cleaned every day, I would recommend deferring on the housekeeping service. We got one breakfast coupon for each day we did not get housekeeping service. Well worth it. The breakfast buffet is fantastic (a little pricey if you are paying). 7) Pools were clean and not too crowded. Deck chairs were usually available. We spent most of our time at the beach though. 8) The snorkeling in front of the westin is fantastic. Lots of coral to explore. Saw many fish and turtles. We thought this area was one of the best on the island. 9) Beach was clean and not too crowded. The trees (that blocked our view) were a great place to seek some shade. The water was calm and easy to enter, for the most part. We had a few days of high trade winds, which hampered snorkeling on some of the beaches. 10) Food at the Paillo Grill was great. Again, a little pricy, but, in line with other restaurants on the island. Try the hot dog with onion straws. Delicious! (see picture) 11) The grounds around the resort are meticulously maintained. 12) No need to bring your own beach towels. The Westin had a great system. At check-in they issue a set of towel cards to you. You exchange the cards for towels at the beach house. Bring your dirty towel back at any time for a clean one. At check-out time, return the cards to the front desk. You are charged $15 for each card not returned. A fair system. 13) Shuttle buses are available to get you to Whalers Village and Lahaina. Buses run often and are very convenient. Leave the rental car in the lot! 14) Great water pressure in the showers 15) Kitchen was well equipped and included a dishwasher cons: 1) Carpet had some stains that could have been cleaned a little better 2) Our condo was an 'ocean view'. We had read this from other reviews to be aware of. Yes, we could see the ocean, but, it was not much of a view. We were on the 3rd floor. A higher floor would be better. Building 7 sits behind building 8 and sits at a slight angle with gives all the condos on the north side a view of the ocean. Because of building 8 and a row of trees at the beach, you can only see some water and part of Molokai island. Building 8 has some great views, but, we were told that building is for 'owner only'. If you can get a condo in building 8, take it. The view should be great, especially if you are on an upper floor. 3) Parking seemed to be all 'compact' spots which makes for tight parking. Lots of suvs and vans in the compact spots. A common phrase in our group was, 'oh well, it is a rental'. Parking gets really tight if you return to the resort after 9:00 pm. Squeezing back into a spot became a daily challenge. 4) You can rent a chair ($10) and umbrella ($20) on the beach. Too much. Sit in the sand. I would not hesitate to stay at the Westin again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home in Maui”
Reviews.Author: mship91
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Comfortable rooms and wonderful employees. Everyone seems ready to please and incredibly friendly. Right on the beach and great snorkeling or swimming at your disposal. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiivacation22
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 1 week stay at the Villas and have nothing but good things to say. This was our second visit and I can't overstate how much we enjoyed our stay. We are not Starwood members but still got a great 2 BR villa with a great view during spring break. We stayed in the south villas (6th floor of the 4th building) but everything still looked new. The entire resort looks new, from the rooms to the grounds, lobby, ect.. It is so much more comfortable than staying in a regular hotel room. We had 7 people in a 2 BR lockout unit and still felt comfortable. Two of our kids had to sleep on the sleeper sofa which they didn't find all that great but I guess you can't have everything. I believe the resort was at or near capacity during our spring break trip but it never felt crowded. We never had any problem getting a lounge chair at the pool. The beach in front of the resort is great for snorkeling. The staff was both friendly and helpful. We had great experiences with the Valet service, check-in staff, servers, bell service. We have stayed at the Hyatt, Westin Hotel, and Wailea Marriott and none of the compare to this facility when it comes to comfort. I would recommend this resort over all of the others.

Reviews.Title: “Family and Friend”
Reviews.Author: deborahsvision
Reviews.Content: March 19, 2011 RE: Mr. Miguel Valenzuela The Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas 6 Kai Ala Drive Lahaina, HI 96761 I would like to take this opportunity to inform you about your employee, Mr. Miguel Valenzuela, Service Express Attendant at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas. A couple years ago we met Mr. Valenzuela - a wonderful man and a dedicated employee. Since then he has taken care of our luggage, our needs, and our life in Maui. He proved himself to be exceptionally knowledgeable of every single aspect concerning Maui and the Ocean Resort Villas. Besides Miguel being a friend and Ohana to us as well, on February 19 our flight home was cancelled. That night we were homeless. Miguel offered us to stay at his home. What kind of employee would do that; an outstanding one! Mr. Valenzuela consistently distinguished himself above others that we had encountered since inception of the Ocean Resort Villas. He exhibited professionalism and an outstanding follow through which always catches my eye. He has a thorough and winning way with customers, always going the extra mile to secure our satisfaction. Mr. Valenzuelaâ€™s enthusiasm was most sincere, and his vast experience at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas was refreshing. We thought that Miguelâ€™s initiative and motivation deserve special recognition. In addition, his integrity and dependability was outstanding. Miguel is an asset to your company. His attention to detail, professionalism and compassion for us is second to none. I hope you can recognize him in some way that would benefit him. Thank you for employing such a fine individual. He has the skills to be the ideal manager. Sincerely, Deborah Haley Thomas Haley

Reviews.Title: “We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: jennewaz
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the North property and absolutely love it! We stayed here in 2008, 2009, and just recently for 8 days. The pirate ship pool was a great hit with our 11 month old, our niece (9 months old) and nephew (3 years old). Our only recommendation would be open the towel area at the pirate ship earlier (like 8:30 or 9am rather than 10am) as young children are up at an earlier time and it is a hassle to try to go to the main pool for towels rather than just being able to get them at the pirate ship. Kehaula M. (spelling?) at the front desk is AMAZING! She was such a pleasure to chat with over the phone prior to our arrival to ensure we had everything we needed (highchair, diaper genie, crib, etc.). We were fortunate enough to be able to meet her in person during our stay and she yet again provided us with helpful information, ensured our accommodations were up to par, etc. Thank you so much Kehaula M. (spelling ?). Keep up the amazing job and service you provide. Look forward to seeing you in 2013. You set a high standard for all to follow in your footsteps for customer service. Thank you! The pool bar service at the North side was great! Good Happy Hour. Anytime we called service express and needed something they were quick to respond which was greatly appreciated. The property is still as beautiful as it was brand new. Awesome shuttle service (huge plus with a child). Free internet! We did however encounter one problem....we were there during the Tsunami and because we were on the first floor we had to be evacuated. This was not the problem, however the process in which we were handled during the evacuation for our family was a huge disappointment and struggle. A positive during this time was the sirens/announcements that would go off in the rooms and the property was great. The voicemails they would leave were great as well. However...the NEGATIVES were as follows: We were offered several different alternatives as to where to move, one of which was 'hospitality villas' at the North property. Keep in mind we were a party of 6 adults and 1 child. We went to the first room offered and a family was actually checked into that room. We went back to the lobby and informed the front desk and we were given another key for another hospitality room. We drag all 6 and a baby plus needed bags to the 2nd room and yet again...checked in room. Are you kidding me? Back to the lobby again... At this time when I stated we have already been to two so called hospitality rooms with people checked in and this was not acceptable, the woman at the front desk (unsure of her name) stated in a rude tone "Well be thankful we are not underwater" and slammed the next key on the desk. A manager did walk over and reassured us that the 3rd room was an actual hospitality room and apologized for the first two inconveniences. Another alternative offered was we could remain in the lobby as it was on the 2nd floor. However, they changed their minds on this as the lobby was 'too open of a space'. Okay no problem we can go to a room. After going to another THREE 'hospitality rooms' with all of us in tow as previously mentioned, each room had already had 12+ adults and even more with children. We actually had two of the rooms tell us we are already too full to fit anymore people. After 1 1/2 hours of going from room to room all over the property with all in tow, we planted ourselves in the lobby again with a few other families that had gone through a similar experience thus far. Thirty minutes prior to the scheduled arrival of the potential tsunami, a manager approached all of us to say we had to go to a room. All families present informed him yet again, there was no room for any us, even with splitting up the families. Shuttles had stopped, rooms were full. Oddly enough, after much discussion, he said we have a room on the 5th floor we must go now. Security had to help us as the elevators had already been turned off. They were not thrilled and put up a fuss in having to help us carry our stuff and our child (asleep finally in the stroller) up the stairs. We walk into what appeared to be a 'show room', in which 2 employees were on one couch watching the news. Again are you kidding me...2 employees in an entire open 2 bedroom villa. We were extremely thankful to be in a room with all of our family and enjoyed the company of the other family placed with us. But really, you had this open room the entire timeâ€¦.Come to find out also, as I mentioned they were leaving important voicemails on the phones, well the phones in this room did not work...big problem. My suggestions for this entire evacuation experience is: 1st: make sure the phones in ALL rooms are working (showroom or not) because you never know when you have to use ALL rooms, 2nd: have a better system rather than just giving out 5 keys to each 'hospitality room', i.e. you have 6 in your party here is your key to 7505, next you have 4 in your party here is your key to 7505...7505 is full, move onto the next. Once you have filled rooms with 10-12 people, then start back again at the first room. Also, maybe put out an announcement to all guests, "anyone willing to open their rooms to other guests please notify the front". Therefore a party of 2 possibly staying in a studio, etc. can open their room for another few people. We understand the stress and hassle of an evacuation and the terror of it all, but things could have been handled better and we expected much better. We are extremely thankful that there was no damage and we could continue on our vacation and all was well for all as it was not in Japan unfortunately. Our thoughts and prayers are with them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSherrill
