Reviews.Content: We love it here! Great resort on a perfect beach, close to Lahaina, but not in the chaos of hotel row, much quieter and relaxed. We especially love the full kitchen and the outdoor BBQs!

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property at all times, but management's handling of the imminent tsunami was so professional, calm, competent and controlled, that they get extra stars in my book. We were consistently updated; when it was emergent (first floor evacuate) the message was transmitted on the intercom which is located in each villa; otherwise there were messages left each time there was an update on our phones.

Reviews.Title: “5 weeks of pure joy every year in a fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: pwom
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the KOR and have been coming for 7 years. The resort is the same every year always looks new. It is a family oriented resort with childrens play areas and camps for them if needed. What we like best is that it is well run by competent staff that are friendly and knowledable about the resort. The rooms are spacious, well equiped offer all the amenties of a Westin property and more. The landscaping is emaculate with great pride taken in keeping it prestine. There is a shuttle service taking you to Lahaina for shopping and dining and to Whalers Village. You can arrive without needing a car if you want to use the amenities on resort. The food is good at 3 restaurants on property. There is a maintained walk way that goes from the resort to Whalers villiage about 1-2 miles or go the other direction to farmers market, restaurants and shopping taking your bag and picking up groceries each day 1 mile. I can't wait to return in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “An ocean view does not mean ocean view -- think twice before paying for it.”
Reviews.Author: pmow
Reviews.Content: Just returned; Maui is beautiful. This hotel is nice but we were disappointed in our room with the non-view (parking lot, not ocean) and could not get the front desk or management to help us. The hotel was very full so we were not demanding to be moved, just to receive an adjustment to the charges. The front desk kept saying "that room is deeded ocean view!" -- beware -- you can pay for ocean view and see cars straight out, and off your petite Juliette balcony you will see a speck of ocean through palm trees. room was 3313, try not to get it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: syion
Reviews.Content: The location and amenities are ideal for families with children of all ages. The suites were well designed and equipped. There were plenty of chairs around the pool and although the resort is very large we never felt like it was crowded. The beach was great for swimming and snorkeling with plenty of fish to see.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Maui w/ family..$6000 stay at the Westin Villas has a High Price”
Reviews.Author: mattnjennie
Reviews.Content: The Summary Beware: During a conversation with the Westin VIllas Director of Rooms, Glenn Casil, was honest in stating that independent of the the reservation with Orbitz confirming my Double upgrade to a 1 Bedroom Deluxe Ocean View Sunsational I was effectively last in line behind and in the following order: 1. Timeshare owners 2. Starwood Gold and Platinum Members (which I have been a long time SPG member) 3. First guests that checked in due to the Westins policy of not assigning rooms from reservations but assigning rooms in real time without conditions of the reservation taken. This reminds me of the famous Seinfeld where he is standing at the Rental Ticket Counter with his reservation and after finding-out that no cars were available he shouts, "anyone can TAKE a reservation but you have to learn to HOLD the reservation." This was certainly a Seinfeldian moment at the Westin Villas! The Situation Like the credit card commercial some experiences have a price and some experiences are priceless. Our first night stay at the Westin Villas had a significant price and almost ruined our families trip. Traveling with an 8 and 5 year old can be a challenge, however, being greeted by Moana at the Westin Villas at 11pm after a long cross country trip with my Orbitz reservation started a nightmarish, although, somewhat predictable outcome. Moana first stated that they were 99.9 percent occupied and that my beautiful room was ready. - Note: As a million mile traveler I knew that checking in late is always a risk but hearing that the Hotel had full occupancy during check-in is always a cautionary condition during check-in. Upon taking the room it seemed old stocked with different color appliances, cheap furniture and although only a few years young the villas were well...cheap and aging quickly int he South Tower. Room 3203 was even more interesting as my kids threw open the curtains in anticipation of our beautiful Ocean View only to see a parking lot full of cars and a commercial air conditioning unit directly beneath our lanai. Better yet a large green electrical transformer hummed beautifully throughout the night competing with the air conditioner for attention. I think you get the picture and as a father I really felt that I let down my kids and family with my decision to Reserve an Ocean View Sunsational Deluxe Room through Orbitz at the Westin Kaanapali Resort VIllas. If you have a weeks vacation in which you saved a small fortune to enjoy a week with you family in Maui I can only describe this experience as deceptive and not a pleasant experience. Note: Glen Casil was respectful when we discussed my complaint and the Westin through Orbitz has decided to refund a third of my money. I appreciate the attempts to work with me but the experience as described was my personal experience and it should be a matter of record to ensure that potential clients are not treated with such indignity. I have a higher standard for the Starwood Group and for Orbitz to fully resolve such issues without gratuitous attempts to convince me that if I really look hard enough some 450 yards around the parking lot and past the wall leaning over the railing I can see the Ocean. Really?

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were very nice and great service from the activity department”
Reviews.Author: mona052
Reviews.Content: We had great service from the towel desk and beach staff. Vincent was very accomadating and helpful with aiding us in car rental/transportation information (beyond his work description I'm sure). He was also very friendly and offered us tanning lotion and just overall exceptional service. Also, carlos the shuttle driver was friendly and informative and went the extra mile for us. I had left my ring in the safe after we had checked out and after asking a few times they did come through and shipped the ring to me. That was much appreciated. You do have to pay for lawn chairs on the beach, $10 but it makes it much less populated than the pool area and the beach is beautiful. We saw whales from the shore. Thanks again to vincent and Cameron for helping make our experience at Kaanapali Westin Ocean resort a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you need extra space”
Reviews.Author: Pediatri
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a 1 bedroom villa, standard view. We had a room in the north building that overlooked the pool. Large, modern villa with all the conveniences of home. When you check in, they have you go over to the concierge to pick up a "welcome packet". Of course, that is their plan to get you to talk to someone about buying their timeshare. We were approached, told it would be a 90 minute presentation. We said "no,that we had no interest in buying a timeshare at this time, and if we did it would be with another company". He then offered us some free tickets just to listen, but when we turned him down again he entered something in the computer, and sent us on our way. Not unpleasant, but I would have preferred not to even had the conversation. We had coupons for breakfast. The buffet was not very good. Only ate there once.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite hotel right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ddusija
Reviews.Content: It was a gorgeous resort hotel in Maui. the location was decent sine it was close to the town of Lahaina. The hotel provides shuttle bus to and from Lahaina where there are plenty of shops and restauarants. There is plenty of onsite parking for those with cars. Hotel gace a complete resort feel with an open lobby and buffet brekfast laid out at the cafe near the pool. The rooms were one bedroom suites. Extremely spacious wih an open kitchen, dining area and living room. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, silverware, pots and pans, cleaning liquids, etc. It had a dishwasher and washer/dryer too. The room also had a balcony with ocean views. The bathroom was huge with a big tub, shower, enclosed toilet and double sinks. The pool area had 1 large pool with a water slide for kids, 2 jacuzzis and a separate kids pool with lots of fun water play activities for the little ones. My 4 year old loved it. They also had a kids club with organized children's activities. She loved the Hula dance! Overall we were very satisfied witht the hotel and services offered.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: DaynaB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Villas for 1 week arriving Feb 18th. We stayed in a one Bedroom Premium Villa. It is a beautiful resort, with a wonderful staff. Our room was well appointed and beautifully decorated. The Heavenly Beds are extremely comfortable and the kids slept well on the sofa bed. We asked for bathrobes and a comforter for the sofa bed, all were provided promptly. No request was ever met with a poor attitude. Nothing was too much for the staff to provide. We had a mid-week cleaning as timeshare owners, and the staff did a great job. The grounds a pools are gorgeous and well maintained. The resort is split up into 2 sections, but feels like one resort. Both lobbies are beautiful with plenty of staff to answer questions about the resort or excursions. The beach is spectacular with excellent snorkeling right off the beach. Renting beach chairs and umbrellas is expensive. We did it one day, it cost $40 for 2 chairs and an umbrella. The next day we got beach mats in Lahaina for $1.49. We took them to the beach at the resort and elsewhere on the island, when we went exploring. Thanks to the Westin for making us feel like we were coming home each day. We cannot wait to return to Maui and this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway for the family”
Reviews.Author: gul1957
Reviews.Content: We has a 900 sq ft apartment with kitchenette, seperate bedroom, living room and huge bathroom, partially facing the sea - spent a whole week in early January. The property was beyond expectations... excellent value for money with children/family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from pool deck to dining to bed time.”
Reviews.Author: Bekah75
Reviews.Content: We took our first vacation as a family during the first week of February and we had a FANTASTIC time. From the moment we arrived at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali we felt welcome and part of a fun, warm, and family friendly atmosphere. Pool: Vincent was a charmer and won not only me, but my husband, and our nine month old son over from the word go! Vincent is on the ball and knows how to please those around himâ€”he helped us with umbrellas on the beach, floaties for our son, cool shades for me, and a great bundle of skin care products that saved our (shhh, sunburned) skin! Vincent is a leader and a joy to be around. Dining: We enjoyed a number of breakfasts at the resort. The buffet was great for my husband, but I always chose the continental which suited me best; the fruit was fresh and yummie. Kim, Cynthia, and Vivian were on their toes for us, but mostly kept our little boy happy with sweet smiles and goofy grins. We also dined at Pulehu twiceâ€”it is a MUST! Dinner was divine and the service was top notch. We were treated with such love it felt like we were with family; again, our flirt of a boy got some attention. Girls, "Tiki" misses you. The spaghetti and meatballs were so good I have been dreaming about them ever since and wish the sous chef lived nearby so she could cook for us daily! Suite: Because we have a young one, we spent a fair amount of time in our room. Our son was very happy in his special crib (we bought bumper pads as he is rather active in his sleep) and we slept like royalty in our king. The room was clean and ideal for a family. Be sure to make use of the BBQ on the pool deck, we'll use it more often next time! Beach: PERFECT, need I say more? We rented a Stand Up Paddle Board and took turns on the water while the other played with the babe. The sand was ideal for a new lil' beachcomber. We also took little day trips, but kept returning to the hotel for "our" beach and pool. Thank you to those of you who made our trip memorable, because of you we will be back. Sincerely, Tikiâ€™s parents

Reviews.Title: “Nice time share property”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Was here for three nights on a rest between business trips and wanted something more than a room or a suite. I booked a studio and as a gold got a nice one bedroom. Check in was easy, just a tip - find out if you are in the north or south areas as they have two separate but very close driveways. I was put in the south side which is the slightly older side in a nice one bedroom, corner unit with a long balcony with two lounge chairs and two seats and small tables. The view was of the entrance driveway but the landscaping did an amazing job of making the view nice. There was lots of space, a dishwasher as well as a washer and dryer. Bathroom was handicapped accessible so was large. There were tons of towels and amenities. My only negative is the current trend to have the bathtub open into the bedroom. This is the third property I've experienced it with and I don't get how the romance of the tub overshadows all the other stuff you do in the bathroom and why you want the sights and sounds to escape. There were two large screen TV's, DVD player as well as a great selection of TV stations. I didn't eat at the restaurants but found the on site store very expensive, even compared to that of the resort closest. They have free shuttles to nearby shopping running late in to the evening which is great. You can also walk to Ka'anapali town where there is a good market, small italian restaurant and coffee place. Services I did use were very well done, the staff uniformly pleasant and respectful. My only gripe is that there are a LOT of units which took away almost all the resort feel. It felt like an apartment complex on the beach, which BTW is pretty but rather narrow. I will echo the rest, if you walk a few minutes down the beach to eat at Dukes, the resort it's a part of is really nice with much fewer units and a much nicer feel. If I ever went back, and wanted a time share in that area, I would check out the other resort for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: mlachance
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Hawaii. We stayed both at the Sheraton Waikiki and the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas. Both hotels exceeded our expectations. The Westin's location is incredible (as is the Sheraton's). It was nice to be able to walk right out onto the beach. We could even see whales in the distance from the beach. Our boys (5 and 7) loved the pools. I liked that the pools varied in depths - from the pirate ship pool that is only about 2 feet deep to pools that were at least 4 feet deep. Even though the hotel seemed to be fully booked, we never had an issue finding a lounge chair near the pools. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which included a full kitchen. It was nice not to have to eat out every meal. The pictures on their web site truly do reflect what the resort looks like. We are already planning our next vacation to Maui and we plan on staying at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Property”
Reviews.Author: debinwa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third straight year of staying at the Westin Kaanapali Villas for a month. We were introduced to the property by Naomi of Maui Hawaii Vacations. We have stayed in both the studio and one-bedroom units. The studio is perfectly cmfortable for the two of us even for the length of time that we stay. Important to note that the studio units in the North building have lanais where the South complex studios do not. The property is impeccably clean, the staff outgoing and polite. We enjoy the barbecues and grill out often. The complex is quiet at night and most enjoyable for us. There are also shuttles to Lahaina Town and Whalers Village if you don't want to bother with a car, parking and parking fees. We are looking forward to going back next year for our 4th year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: annsean
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice time at the Westin Villas. We stopped at the grocery store in Lahaina and got some groceries, it was nice to have the option of eating at the restaurants on site, or cook in your villa. Twice we barbequed steak and fish and enjoyed it at sunset. The villa had everything we needed. The pool was very nice, the staff was wonderful, the room was very comfortable. FYI they had the best coconut cake as well. We hope to go back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beware..Paid for "Ocean View" got Parking lot view !”
Reviews.Author: Easystreet
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in Westin's so called "ocean view room". We booked this trip thru Costco 4 months prior and got upgraded from an "Ocean View Deluxe Studio to an Ocean view Deluxe one bedroom. And as you can see from my photo we had a marvelous view of the parking lot and palm trees off our balcony. I estimated that we could see approximately 5% of blue ocean water. But we did have 100% of car alarm noise in the middle of the night. When we vacation in Maui it is very important to my wife to have a good view of the ocean from our room. She was not happy that first and second day and when wife not happy, life not happy. Jason ( nice kid) at the front desk tried to help us but to no avail. So frustrated I then contacted Costco Travel and asked for another Hotel. Susy, who was very professional got back right way with a couple of choices. But being Valentines day week, Maui was pretty much booked. So we stayed. My advise to Westin, FULL DISCLOSURE on your room views. This was not an Ocean view or even partial ocean view! I could of paid for their garden view and saved a bundle. Next time, we will go back to the Fairmont Kea Lani. There, our Costco Reservation stated Full Ocean View. That's what we paid for and what we got. Another issue, on Friday, the housekeeping guy left our room door ajar after he finished cleaning. He did not pull it shut. Overall the hotel is a good place for families. Food was good at the pool restaurant, the grills are great for people who like to do that. Staff very nice and friendly. It just got off to a very bad start for us.

Reviews.Title: “Westin villas on Kaanapali Beach Maui perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Julie3522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Kaanapali villas South for two weeks, January 30 to Feb.13th,2011 After touring entire island, Kaanapali beach is still the best place to stay. We were in Maui 22 years ago, so was not sure if Kaanapali was still the spot to be. After touring the entire island, we decided it is still the best area. Great for families with babys, small children,teenagers, adults, and seniors. The Westin is in a perfect place for everyone, you can walk, use your stroller, for 2 miles along the boardwalk,which is next to the beach. The beach has calm waters, so, great for swimming, boarding etc. We stayed in Bldg.3, which is perfect, park your car in underground parking,ride the Elevator to desired floor, we were in 5313, a 1 bedroom unit with large porch, facing Black rock. The unit was perfect with Large Kitchen, dining, Huge Master suite with king bed, Jacuzzi tub, and Washer/dryer. The grounds were immaculate, as was the Villa, good restaurants, beautiful pools, many outdoor spas, Grills to fix Dinner, large fitness center. Wi/fi, grocery store with Deli. We had a wonderful time in Paradise, and will only dream about it until we return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch on the "ocean view room" and Ants Invaded our room”
Reviews.Author: grady97
Reviews.Content: I heavily researched lodging accomodations and this Westin time share project (Ocean Resort Villas) seemed to be a good choice. And if you are a time share owner, it might be a great choice. Were were regular hotel guests and I was extremely disappointed.. We paid for an ocean view room and we got a view of the back of a building, with the view of a parking lot directly south west and a faint glimpse of the ocean. it was a joke. when i requested a room change, i was told that the hotel was 98% occupied and that it is always 98% occupied and that the true ocean view rooms (forget ocean front-they dont even pretend to make those available) were reserved for time share owners and that i was basically a "second class guest". on my second day, i was offered a room change, which was a slightly better view of the parking lot and no blocking building, but still no real ocean view. in order to move, i was required to check out at 10am and to then check back in at 4pm and the hassle factor relative to the zero improvement in my view was not worth it. so my first tip is DON"T PAY FOR AN OCEAN VIEW ROOM, AS THERE ARE NOT ANY FOR A TYPICAL GUEST. And then to add insult to injury, our second floor room was invaded by ants. on our second day, we noticed a trail of ants (maybe 50-75) crawling along the wall and around the kitchen grout lines. we called the engineer, who came promtly, apologized and wiped down the ants with some bug kille (which of course, smelled for 2 days)r. Two days later, the ants were back. and even more this time, as they were on the ceiling crawling between ventilation grates, all over the kitchen . another engineer came and again wiped down the ants with bug killer. More smell and 2 days later, they are back again. at this point, we are ready to leave, so we just told the front desk when we were leaving that they needed to bug bomb the room with a strong insect killer. so when you check in ASK TO CONFIRM THAT THE ROOM DOES NOT HAVE A HISTORY OF ANT INVASIONS. the pool towel policy was a little annoying as well. other than a bait and switch on the room and the ants, and 2 obnoxious hotel staff members and the towel policy, the property was lovely and the staff was friendly and accomodating. However, we walked to the Honua Kai resort, which is 1/4 mile up on the beach. it is newer than the Westin, and just as nice and we will be staying there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ValerieSeattle
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at this gorgeous resort. This trip we spent 11 nights at the north tower. We loved our luxurious 1-bedroom villa--the kitchen is spacious and well appointed. Large lanai. Love the double sinks, HUGE shower, and jacuzzi tub in bathroom! It even has a washer/dryer in the unit. We enjoyed the pools (the water slide at the south tower is fun!) and the outdoor jacuzzis were handy (after a beachside shower) to warm up in after snorkeling right off the beach in front of the property. The restaurants are great. Not only is the property beautiful and well-kept, but all the staff are super! Front Desk Agent Lia Pani recognized our name from our previous trips when we booked our stay! She assigned us a gorgeous villa in a very convenient location. Lia is so sweet, thoughtful, and welcoming that she really made our vacation perfectl! She truly embodies the â€œspirit of Aloha!â€� and feels like family to us. Jacob checked us in and he was very helpful and professional. I must say he demonstrated a deep well of patience with a less experienced couple ahead of us. ;-) Leslie checked us out and was so friendly. She inquired about our stay and we could tell she really cared about our experience. She even made paying the bill a pleasant experience!! We canâ€™t wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “They treat the customer like a parasite.”
Reviews.Author: Junebug1482
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to the Westin Kaanapali with another couple and their three year old for our Thanksgiving holiday. We were so excited for a few days of rest and sun. Maui delivered all of that, but the folks at the Westin did their best to thwart our plans. First, we arrived and thought everything to be perfect - lovely lobby, friendly check in staff, nice, comfortable room, etc. However, that evening, after returning from a stroll and a bite to eat on the property, we found a letter that had been slipped under our door, informing us that we would need to have all of our things packed and ready to move the following morning (Thanksgiving day) by 10 am, and that our new room would be ready by 4 pm. The tone of the letter was curt and rude, and so started the decline of our tropical vacation. Over the next 24 hours, through much yelling, we were granted an extra day in our room so that we did not have to move on Thanksgiving day. We spoke with several managers, including an unpleasant woman named Corolla, who were condescending and simpering, and who acted like we were somehow trying to scam the Westin because we did not want to move into a downgraded room. In the end, we moved into a worse room on a lower floor without a view (and it was a handicap accessible room, so less lovely overall). We made the best of our situation, and in spite of the Westin's poor attitude towards us, enjoyed Hawaii. On our last night, we wandered down to the next resort over for dinner and found that it was much more beautiful, and about the same price as the Westin (we did feel some regret, but what could we do?). On another note, the Westin "nickel and dimes" you for everything - 10 dollars/day for cheap beach chairs (the kind with bands of plastic) and 20/day for an umbrella, no water service (you have to buy everything), and drinks/food on the resort are not great and super expensive. For couples without children - do not come here. It is set up around being a family resort, and is in no way chic or sophisticated in any of its offerings. The management treated us horribly, but the front of house staff (waiters, bell boys, etc) were very friendly and helpful (too bad they weren't running the place!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, good for the family”
Reviews.Author: pawji
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas over the Thanksgiving 2010 Holiday for 7 nights. The west side is not my favorite side of the island, having said that it was still quite lovely. The property is very nice and there appears to be tons of stuff for kids to do. Our little one was only about 6 months old so we didn't take advantage of it but I know they had a kids club. They have several pools, including an adult pool so if you need some "alone time" you can find that as well. We rented a 2 bedroom lockoff that was perfect for us! Both the 1 bedroom and the studio have kitchens and a pull out sofa couch that was pretty comfortable. There is a shuttle that makes several stops along the strip of hotels and onto Lahaina. There wasn't a lot of restaurants to walk to outside of the property (there was a castaway beach house that we went to most nights and Duke's), and I thought the property's food was average and overpriced. If you are traveling with children the reef directly in front of the Westin is really close to the break. So, wonderful for snorkeling but you want to watch that the kids don't step on any coral. Also, this reef (like many others) seem to be dying in Hawaii because of all the tourists like me and you who want to enjoy the water and wear sunscreen! It kills the reef. I just learned this last time so we are bringing reef safe sunscreen next time we go. I didn't know and I felt bad that we were contributing to the problem :) Overall, it's a very nice resort and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Buy, They Don't Try!!!”
Reviews.Author: lktaber
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this property!!! Although it says Westin on the sign it is a timeshare ownership property in which customer service does not exist! We were lured in on a promotional to visit the property with an option to buy. We love Maui and Westin, so we bit. Big mistake! We decided not to buy, after a "hard sell" presentation which required signing then and there. Soon after, we were asked to move out of our villa because an owner suddenly needed it. Another room wouldn't be ready until after 4 pm the next day. They graciously offered to store our belongings and allow us access to the property until our new villa became available, which by the way had a view of the employee parking lot. Needless to say, we decided to end our stay. After arguing with various managers and having a second day of our honeymoon ruined we were finally able to check out without penalties or so I thought. I got my credit card bill today only to find I was charged for the remainder of my stay. If you do decide to stay here I suggest that you schedule your tour the last day , because once they know you are not willing to buy, they don't try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice if you're looking for paradise!”
Reviews.Author: tilo0002
Reviews.Content: This resort and it's employees were amazing. Upscale when you want it, comfortable always. Clean, modern look and feel. We REALLY enjoyed ourselves and would go back a million times. There is much to do if you're looking to keep busy. I'd also say it's "kid friendly" as I have my own children (weren't with us on this trip) but the kids really weren't noticeable or in the way because there is a "Kids Westin" park/pool/activity place removed from both beachside pools. Downsides? Small, awkward pillows on the beds. Very pushy when it comes to selling timeshare opportunities - could do without this.

Reviews.Title: “The Aloha spirit is alive at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: KristinaCoffey
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the resort keeps getting better and better each year. Everything from the time we checked in has been top notch. If your going to get a facial or have your makeup done go see Liz at the Spa Helani. She was so nice and very knowledgeable. Be sure to visit Vincent and the crew at the Towel Shack South. They were extremely helpful with everything that we needed, even bought a new pair of Maui Jim's from them! My family took a trip out to Whale watch today with Captain Steve and had the best time ever. We had whales jumping out of the water about 20 feet from us. If your going to spend the money you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacore
Reviews.Content: I relied on trip advisor before our trip and wanted to make sure to give my two cents. This hotel is great, not sure about all the negative reviews I had read. Other than getting a room with a bad view I am not sure what there is to complain about. Rooms were clean, stayed in a studio and was just fine for my family of 5 (3 young children). One child slept on the floor. We spent little time in the room anyway. Transferred to the honua Kai just to mix it up, it is also very nice. Honua Kai is newer and is located closer to a major market and the food in the hotel is more reasonably priced then at the Westin. Lots of kids at both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic poolside service”
Reviews.Author: billhouser
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Westin Oceanside Villas, and were especially pleased w/ the service and friendliness of the poolside staff. Their Aloha spirit was tremendous. We would definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience-”
Reviews.Author: surfseattle66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an ocean front room--overall clean, however, several large spots on the carpet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. A young man by the name of 'Kalolo' was exceptionally helpful at the South Watersports Center. His warm, courteous, assistance was noted and greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort - wonderful for families!”
Reviews.Author: denvermom80206
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Report Villas. I have to say, everyone on the staff that we encountered was so nice and helpful - definitely made our time there that much better. We were guests of time share owners and had a two bedroom-lock off, and had an ocean view room in the south tower. The room was gorgeous and had everything we needed to be traveling with two small children (3 years and 15 months). The hotel provided us with a crib, high chair and diaper genie, which was great. We were there during whale season and could see whales from the path in front of the hotel - we could even see them from our lanai. The pirate ship pool was a HUGE hit with our kids and we made that part of our daily routine. We stocked up on everything we needed at the Safeway in Lahaina (about 4 miles before you reach the hotel) - that worked out great, as we had breakfast and lunch in the room most days. My MIL booked a couples massage for us one day, which was AMAZING - they had us in the "tree-house". Also, my husband and MIL did a whale watching trip with Trilogy - a really great outfit, that was affordable, had small groups (20 people or so) and very knowledgeable guides. Overall, a great experience - we would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but a few caveats.”
Reviews.Author: vision4bg
Reviews.Content: We got adjoining rooms for a Christmas vacation. This was actually really great - plenty of room for a family of 5 to spread out amongst the two rooms, a nice big kitchen, lanai and dining area. The large bathrooms were also great. My main problems were: - an interesting definition of "ocean view". We paid a few hundred bucks extra for ocean view and had a view of the parking lot. The staff refused to change the room. - Not many restaurants around. Duke's is the only one worth visiting in walking distance. - A sports bar on the beach? Blaring football at sunset? Such a wasted opportunity. - Pools were okay, but not great. Next time I go to Maui I'll stay somewhere else, but if anything the rooms were well suited for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Large Suite but Industrial Feeling”
Reviews.Author: Defender09
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights two of which my husband was with my daughter and I. The hotel is nice but it feels more like condominums than a resort hotel. The room was a one bedroom and was huge but not magical. Again, the room was large but they gave us a lobby view so I cant speak to any ocean or garden view. I suspect thats because instead of paying 550 a night for three nights, I got three for the price of two. I had signed up to listen to their ownership presentation but wasnt impressed enough to take a hour and a half out of my weekend to listen. We went to the pool instead. They have a pirate ship pool for the kids and a good waterslide. That was fun. The fish in the pond entertained my daughter. The food was good and not overpriced. The service was friendly. My husband didnt like the drink and they remade it to his satisfaction. The concierge set us up with a luau, a bit cheezy but worth it for our 5 year old and our 8 year old niece. The feast of lele was the luau and there was an abundance of food and drinks so the $100 a person was worth it. The show was great too, very fast and entertaining for the kids, but we have been to luaus so many times that we truly did it for our kids. The highlight was they sold wooden honus and carved the kids name on them. I asked for a late checkout and they only gave me 1230. It should have been 4 as an spg member paying over $500 a night. For that rate, I expect EVERY answer to be yes as they are definitely positioning themselves to be 5 star and appeal to that market so the answer should be yes again. I tried to stay another night but they wouldnt keep me in the same room so I moved. Granted I wanted to use points but I went to the Westin Spa with points and they gave me a 1300 square foot room for a mere $200 more. Also, at that price it was a bit disconcerting to see some of the crowd, seemingly local, that showed up at the pools with the inappropriate language etc. I dont mean to sound like a snob but for that price there should be a difference in the clientele. Overall it is very nice place just too industrial, needs more hawaiin feeling, and more 5 star level service. It felt like they were truly about money. Cant explain it but I already spent a lot, spent the most on rooms at this hotel, and they seemed to want more. I would not go back to this one. I prefer the Westin Spa and Resort.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: legendtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day stay at the WKORV and I must say that everything was awesome! I don't understand how anyone could possibly complain about this hotel. Some people are just never satisfied. We booked through costco (extremly good value) and were upgraded at checkin to a beautiful ocean view studio room in the South tower building 2. The room had everything you would need except a large balcony which I thought would be a problem, but we would just open the slider and sit in the chairs and have our coffee in the morning and wine at night, so we were very happy! It was our 25 wedding anniversary and the front desk sent up champagne, red wine, and some nice chocolates, which was very nice. There is alot of families with kids, but it was never noisy or bothersome, it just made us miss our 4 kids at home. We are going to bring the kids next time. We did the time share presentation and Jennifer did a great job explaining the starwood system and we are going to come back within 2 years and do it again because it is just not a good time to purchase for us right now. We received a whale watching cruise for doing this that was excellent it was called the Teralani and I would highly reccomend it. We had 3 whales swimming around and under our boat for about and hour. If you go to the Italian Grill order a lemon drop, it was the best one I have ever had and the oriental chicken salad at the ocean bar and grill was very yummy. The location was perfect because it provided a nice walk to whalers village and back which we did everyday, and if your down there for happy hour the Hula Grill has great Mai Tais and appetizers. My husband and I both had 80 minute massages and they were fabulous. We went to little beach which was quite entertaining, on Sundays they have a bongo and fire dancing locals show. But be prepared half the beach was nude, we kept our clothes on and didn't feel stupid, it was an experience to say the least! All in all I would say it was an awesome trip at an amazing hotel, we loved every minute of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Employees Like Breakfast with Pool and Ocean Views Too”
Reviews.Author: 94131Traveler
Reviews.Content: For the last three days, Westin employees have been enjoying breakfast, lunch and sunset with stunning poolside views. Nametags on, lounging at tables and chairs. I'm sure they work hard, but they really don't belong in this area, in full view of guests. See attached photos for pictures from today, Friday, January 28, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: AlohaDon
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we were treated like family. Our room was clean and had everything we needed to feel comfortable. The staff was friendly, providing information about local attractions and restaurants. Check in took just a few minutes. My wife and I used the fitness room several days. It was never crowded. The location of the Westin Villas is right on the beach. We could walk on the boardwalk all the way down to the end of Kaanapali Beach near the Hyatt hotel. The complimentary shuttle bus took us into Lahaina as well as the Westin Hotel and Sheraton Hotel.Many days we did not need to use our rental car.We would often stop at Whalers Village. Lelanis on the Beach has a great daily Happy Hour with entertainment. We enjoyed preparing most of our meals in the villa. There is a local farmer's market on Saturday in Kahalui where we picked up fresh fruit and vegetables. There is a Costco right next to the airport that has other grocery items and a good wine selection. Overall this was an excellent place for a relaxing vacation. It was always quiet, even though most of the villas were occupied. Staying in a condo type room with a separate bedroom is much better than a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing, convenient, clean resort”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4JOY58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the WKORV. We were a little concerned after reading some of the reviews but found the resort staff to be very helpful and willing to please. Our one bedroom was in the South villas and the rooms and lanai were very spacious. The entire unit appeared to be recently updated with granite counters (kitchen and bath) and new appliances. The jacuzzi tub was also large and nice. We had everything we needed to cook even though we did very little cooking. There were too many good restaurants to explore although restaurants on Maui are not cheap...especially the ones on site at the resort. Definitely try the Hula Grill and CJ's restaurant. Both were very good and priced about right for Maui. The location of this resort on Ka'anapali Beach is excellent and the beach walk is very nice. The grounds are maintained very well. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice, convenient, relaxing place to stay. If I get a chance to return to Hawaii, I would definitely stay at the WKORV.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not the Westin level we are used to”
Reviews.Author: Taylor54
Reviews.Content: We had some problems that made this resort fall below the normal Westin level. However, it is a beautiful resort with great amenities in an excellent location. We rented it from someone on redweek and were very pleased with the price we got. The three problems were with (1) housekeeping (2) the italian restaurant on site and (3) the spa. A few hours after we arrived I noticed that my 8 month old daughters legs were all dirty. She had been crawling around on the carpet. I checked the carpet and noticed it was wet. I called down to the front desk to inquire and they informed me that housekeeping probably had cleaned it. While that would normally be great, I was worried about it because it was still wet and my daughter had been crawling on it. Housekeeping informed us it had been steam cleaned. They asked us not to allow our daughter to crawl on it until they could dry it. When I inquired further (because she had been on it) they told me the substances used were "not that toxic". Considering housekeeping put the crib and highchair in our suite, I was not pleased that they didn't want my daughter on the floor and didn't bother to say anything. We decided to try the italian buffet at the on site restaurant. I would not recommend it. I have been to other italian buffets and they are much better. The pasta was not very pleasant after sitting in dishes for a while. In my experience, a restaurant of that quality would do pasta stations rather than leaving the pasta to sit in dishes. However, the real kicker was that even though the waitress told us on our arrival that my 8 month old daughter was free when I fed her 2 pieces of fruit and some noodles from the pasta buffet they charged $15 for her meal. I did not think that was very classy. The final issue was the spa. My husband decided to treat me with a GC to the spa. Unfortunately, I never got to go because it took them 3 days to get it to us after repeatedly making him wait in the room for the GC to arrive and then leaving me a message about it - ruining the surprise. The upside was that the spa took responsibility for their failures and gave us a nice little basket to apologize. All in all, gorgeous resort, great rooms (we were upgraded on arrival to ocean front!) fantastic location, nice grounds BUT simply not the level we expect of a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort but some rooms really have bad views”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one week in a large one bedroom, comfortable enough for a family of five. In many ways, this resort is very similar to other starwood villa resorts in terms of villa layout, overpriced but nice on site markets and restaurants, large beautiful swimming pools and manicured grounds. Unique to this resort is the availability of lanais which either offer a magnificent view with pacific ocean, frolicking whales and glorious neighboring islands vs...a really boring parking lot (aka "island view") for rooms in building 6. The hotel is very well located, within walking distance of restaurant areas. The beach is lovely. Many great activities for children: movies, smores by the beach, art activities etc... A definitely wonderful vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: SD4
Reviews.Content: just got back from the westin kaanapali ocean resort north. can not say enough good about the resort. must say we were skeptical, as we have never done an vacation ownership exchange and were afraid of the worst. from the time the valet opened up our villa to the time we checked out , we were impressed with everything. our villa was in bldg 8 on the 4th floor,great view to ocean and had open lot to the north. drinking coffee and watching the whales, and hearing the morning surf from our lanai were ever so relaxing. did most of our own cooking as the grill were plentiful and the villas were all supplied with all the utensils. the resort never felt crowed always was able to get chairs by the pool and used the adult pool by bldg 8 a lot. looking forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: K970105
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first trip to Maui. It was fabulous. Quiet, well-staffed, good service, all the amenities. We had a nice studio overlooking the main courtyard in the north building, which I think is a little quieter than the south building (kid-wise). The conceirge and front desk were very helpful and accomodating, and the facilities were fantastic. We appreciated their "green" program and were happy to take free buffet breakfasts in exchange for unnecessary room cleaning! The room, for being a studio, seemed large. Kitchenette is a must--saved us a ton of $$ on expensive Maui!! The beach is very accessible, but beware--the beach slopes to the water quite sharply and there is coral just offshore. Not the most swim-friendly beach for kids, I think, but just down the beach the conditions are better. The hotel shuttle into Lahaina and to the other Starwood properties was very convienent and we used it often! Overwall we had a great stay and would definitely come back:)

Reviews.Title: “Why stay any where else”
Reviews.Author: dmather258
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have been coming to this resort for the last 10 years and the experience keeps getting Better !! It is all about the Ohana spirit .. They treat us like family ... I have new Cuzin & bradhas every time I visit ... THANKS To Suzy & Dede for your deluxe accommodations, to Dom for taking care of our bags to Angel for taking car of my rental ... Even the new employees treat you with class, no matter if you are dressed to the nines or wearing a tank top & flip flops !! The food & drinks are excellent such that I don't even have to leave the grounds to have a wonderful day !! I want to personally thank GM Gregg Lundberg for delivering on a Quality Product & experience Mahalo & God Bless

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young families”
Reviews.Author: Lisawhip
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would be happy staying in a "resort." Too generic, too removed from the "real" destination, etc, etc, etc. Well, having kids changes everything. For our first vacation as a nuclear family that was not to visit our extended families (we live in Seattle), we chose the Westin Ka'anapali Villas and couldn't be happier. Our 4-year-old identical twin girls and our 8-year-old daughter all have celiac disease (genetic gluten intolerace--they get violently ill and sustain intestinal damage if they consume wheat and other gluten grains). The Westin accomodated us beautifully. The kitchen in the villa was a life-saver; we prepared 75% of our meals there and on the (impeccably clean) grills by the pool. I wrote ahead to make arrangements with the restaraunts' chef and food service manager--they even procured gluten-free pasta, bread and brownie mix so the kids could enjoy evenings out. When the twins were gluten-poisoned (by an unrelated restaurant), I needed help from the housekeeping staff. They were prompt, friendly, and assured me that helping me with an incredibly gross situation was no problem. Aside from the food issues, this place is a family's dream. Plentiful kids' activities, a wonderful "camp" facility, and great pool setup. The beach is lovely; a little strong for swimming for very little ones but ours had a great time in the sand. The concierge staff helped us with activities (including luau) and hooked us up with a nanny service when we needed it. The sitter was EXCELLENT. We were comfortable in a one-bedroom villa with a roll-in cot. I had two massages that were amazing (Triniti and Allison). I loved that local craft venors set up in the lobbies, so even if it were difficult to get away from the resort, we could still bring local souviniers home. All in all, a great vacation for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: grumpy_grewal
Reviews.Content: this place is a great place to stay in maui. The views, pool, service, rooms all amazing. Great shopping nearby and good food nearby as well and the views simply amazing

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY ON THIS RESORT”
Reviews.Author: ddd20101
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon and had booked a oceanview room. Well we were put in the very back near the dumpsters and service area on the bottom floor. When you are put on the bottom floor all of the plants and trees are so overgrown that you can not see anything. In order to see the ocean you would have to get through all of the plants and trees first then you would need bInoculars to be able to see any oceanview at all because we were put so far back and the resort is very big if you get my meaning. So we called to speak with the manager as soon as we arrived in the room and expressed our dissappointment because this was a once in a lifetime event for us and it was our honeymoon. The manager stated to us that the best rooms closer to the ocean are pretty much saved for their timeshare holders. THIS TRIP COST US ALOT OF MONEY AND WE WERE NOT SATISFIED AT ALL WITH BEING RIPPED OFF BY THIS RESORT. I HOPE IT SHUTS DOWN. I WILL NEVER REPEAT NEVER RECOMMEND THIS RESORT TO ANYONE. AND BECAUSE OF WHAT WESTIN AND ITS EMPLOYEES DID TO US I WILL NEVER BOOK A ROOM AT ANY WESTIN ANYWHERE AGAIN!!!!! PLEASE TAKE THIS WARNING.. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: WAneedsumsun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days here and had a wonderful time! We had bought a week from a timeshare owner, who owns a "beachfront view". We had a 3rd floor beachfront studio in bldg. 8 and loved it. The only downside was that we noticed that there was a "wind tunnel" effect on the north side of the building by the adults only pool, making it unbearable to use that pool. The other pools were much more protected from the wind.We enjoyed the pool at the South tower more (has a slide). At one point we had a clogged toilet and maintenance was there in 3 minutes to fix it! Found the best snorkeling at Black Rock and Napili Bay (tons of turtles there).Re. location, it was a bit far north of the buzz of Whalers Village, which the kids like. We stopped at Costco (by the airport) for breakfast and lunch stuff and alcohol and noticed there were discounted tickets for various luai's, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Westin? In name only”
Reviews.Author: Schtev1
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG Gold member, meaning I travel alot for work and pleasure. For those who take the timeshare tour, they will will tell you of all your benefits being a gold member...like 4pm check out etc. - generally very overrated. The hotel called me at home prior to my arrival, and emailed asking if there is anything they can do for me prior to my arrival, we made some dinner plans. Great service and kudus to Lukela for such excellent service. The resort knew months in advance of my arrival time and this is the first time I have arrived at a Westin that had no room available, (nor was I offered late check out, again a first as a goldmember) I gave them my cell, and they would call when the room is good, but forsure before 4pm. At 4:30pm I went to the front desk to see whats up, oh..the room is ready..they didn't bother calling. The first room we were sent to was unacceptable to us, and I went to the front desk where, grudgenly I was given a more acceptable room. The rooms are fine, certainly not luxury and looks like something I have seen at Disney world..a room that has seen alot of families and traffic. We didn't even have daily cleaning. The Hotel and Resort a fine..I thought the pool was a bit dirty, but overall..just average for a resort of this "stature" and price. Location is also off the beaten track, meaning you will need and use your car daily. Also the beach at this end Island is "short" and has a steep drop off once in the water. My Inlaws stayed down the road at the Hyatt..what a difference! night and day..we spent most of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SuperTrooper00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas (South) for a week the first week of December. Our stay could not have been more perfect. This resort is simply pristine, luxurious, and incredibly relaxing. The layout of the resort is terrific for a large complex. The open lobby overlooking pool and ocean is an incredible way to walk into a vacation. The Valet was terrific all week long, and we never waited for more than 2 minutes for our car. Our 1-bedroom Villa was so perfect for our family of four. We stopped at Wal-Mart on the way in so we could fully use the full kitchen. They had everything we would have wanted (blender, coffee-maker, non-stick pan, spatula, just to name a few). The bathroom is HUGE and is laid out perfect for a family. The bed is so comfy and lanai was very large. I honestly cannot think of one thing to complain about in the room. We had a bit of difficulty connecting to the wifi but the staff was great trying to remedy it. The pool areas at the resort are really the star. We never even made it to the North pool because our boys (2 and 4) were so addicted to the SOuth pool and the toddler pool with Pirate ship. The beach was perfect for us. The sand is wide and holds crowds very well (if there are any). There is plenty of room to play in the water (limited surf) without getting into the coral. I was originally worried about our kids being able to play in the water without getting in the coral. This was not a problem in the least. However, having the coral within swim reach was perfect to teach our boys how to snorkel for the first time. How often can you swim for 30 seconds and be in a school of fish? We LOVED the beach and pool. We didn't eat at the resort restaurants, but did get drinks daily which were fantastic. Their Happy Hour is great (4-6) and they have cheap Mai Tai's daily during this time (which were terrific). The staff was courteous and helpful, and we would have never known it serves as a timeshare as well. There is ZERO pressure, invitation, or presence. You would have to seek info about timeshares to get any. We walked down to Duke's restaurant 3 times. We love that place and it was such a beautiful and short walk down the lit beach path to get there. We did use the BBQ Grills to cook on and they were great. I would highly recommend doing that once at least. It was very relaxing and a nice reprieve from spending money. To put the entire stay into perspective: We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Maui after our week stay. The Hyatt is one of the best and highest rated resorts on the island (and should be, it is beautiful). As much as we liked the Hyatt, we completely missed the Westin Villas. All in all, we could not have enjoyed it more. Our boys cried when we left, and we will definitely try to come back again. The only negative to our entire trip is that we are already wondering when we can go back. Hopefully before we forget the smell, sight of tiki torches at night, sound of the surf, and the complete relaxation we felt after a week at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware "Ocean View" rooms and management”
Reviews.Author: gravel_path
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: Big disappointment. I was misled if not deceived when I booked a "Deluxe Ocean View Sunsational Villa" over Christmas at this resort and ended up with a room with a view facing a highway and a construction site. My disappointment led to complete frustration when I addressed the problem with a manager at the property who said that my issue should be taken up with Orbitz, only later to find out from Orbitz that she had the power to resolve. She also said I should have mentioned something earlier in my stay (which I did when I registered and was told there were no other options as they were at 100% capacity.) Thus, I found her response disingenuous at best, outright deceptive at worse. I later filed a complaint with Orbitz and was told that the property had no record of my complaint (I have since sent them e-mails proving otherwise.) I'm really shocked Westin would attach its name to this "resort" which is little more than an overcrowded condo with really poor customer service. (You'll find that hotel "guests" are second-class citizens to the condo owners at this property, who in turn, resent the guests who stay there for a fraction of their maintenance fees.) If this property had any integrity, they would accurately and fully describe the rooms and views. Simple as that. Yes, my room also had a view of the ocean, but why not disclose all information so travelers could make informed decision?! I would never have booked a room facing a highway. Unfortunately, the Westin KORV has an elaborate room categorizing system (which differs from the one published at Orbitz) so they can put you wherever you wish and come up with any explanation to justify it. I won't even go into how Westin claimed that they had no record of my reservation, which I had made over three months prior. Thus, I had to call and e-mail back and forth between Westin and Orbitz during my vacation. Let me also say that the place place was overrun at Christmas. Men's public bathrooms were swampy and both showers in the locker room were out of service. Trash from the condo units lined the hallways day and night. Pools were cloudy, even the "adult pools" which were overrun by kids. I've been to Hawaii over a dozen times and was NEVER once made to feel misled, deceived or outright lied to. Westin KORV is a disgrace to one of the best tourist destinations. The rooms are definitely nice, but there are far better run hotels and even better values to be found elsewhere. Look around!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MaryH4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom Ocean View suite, it was in the south building..not ocean front but nice location. Hotel is conveniently located near Lahaina. Only drawback is that the hotel property is SO large, it seems like you do a lot of walking if you want to use the pool on the north side ( they have 3-4 pool areas).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-wish the beach location was better”
Reviews.Author: winks1217
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to the Westin for vacation. We received excellent service and loved our ocean view room. The food was amazing at the hotel and surrounding locations. The biggest disappointment was the beach. If you enjoy swimming in the ocean, choosing the Sheraton or Westin Maui would be a better choice. We were instructed to not go past 5 feet in the ocean because of the coral. My boyfriend saw multiple people with scrapes, and even one person had to go to the hospital to check on the cut. After that day, we went to the Sheraton to lay on their beach and swim in the ocean. The hotel was packed with families. We didn't mind the abundance of children...except for the hot tub. There are rules clearly posted that if you are younger than 16, you need to be accompanied by an adult. Unfortunately, the hot tubs were a popular spot with kids and some were jumping in splashing like it was a pool, and their parents were not around. When the hot tub was overcrowded, we chose to leave the area. I read a lot of reviews about the north and south rooms. We were located on the south end and enjoyed where we stayed. Everything is a close walking distance and the views are gorgeous everywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but.....”
Reviews.Author: Sh5345
Reviews.Content: This resort is very nice for families. Kids a running around everywhere having a good time. For us, however, it was not such a great experience. To begin, when we checked in we specifically requested a room in a quiet part of the resort. We were put in the South bldg. by the pool with the big slide but were told it would be relatively quiet since the slide was on the other side of the pool. During the day it really wasn't a problem as we weren't in the room much. However, the night we checked in there was what appeared to be a corporate Christmas party in the lobby area near our room. The music was loud and thumping well into the night. They also blocked off the hallway between the room wings and the lobby so you had to go outside to leave the area - normally not a problem but it was raining that night. I find it inappropriate to inconvenience the guests in lieu of a staff party. We asked to be moved to the North bldg which is a bit further away from the action but were not accommodated That being said, the resort is well appointed and is great for families. I would think twice about staying here if you want peace and quiet. We will be staying elsewhere on our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A slice of heaven at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: lucidlilies
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a bit nervous staying here after reading some of the reviews on here. People seem to love it or hate it. Luckily I had the most fabulous time on my solo retreat to Maui. I stayed in a 1 bedroom premium villa with an oceanview. First of all, if you are looking for full service resorts, then you are probably best to look at the traditional hotels on Kaanapali. The Westin Ocean Villas is a timeshare resort with all the comforts of the Westin room amenities without traditional hotel services such as room service and daily housekeeping. That said, I loved it. I loved not having a housekeeper waking me at 8am to clean my room and having a full kitchen to cook and not eat out all the time (restaurants, by the way, are pretty pricey in Maui). The pools were great and I never had issues getting a lounge chair. But I was also there during the shoulder season. Lots of kids but it seemed to be ok. In terms of location, yes the villas are further north from the traditional Kaanapali hotel area. But I see this as an upside. The hotels right on Kaanapali are older, run down, and badly need of some TLC. Not to mention CROWDED. The villas are quieter but accessible to the main drag - the resorts offers a complimentary shuttle that takes you to their sister properties. The beach in front of the resort is great with good snorkeling but you can easily hop on the shuttle and go to the Sheraton to snorkel at Black Rock. The villa itself is enormous by most apartment standards. The bathroom was larger than most apartments where I live so I found it spacious. For two people it would be perfect however for an entire family, it might be cramped. The kitchen comes fully stocked with pots, pans, dishes, etc however there were a few things I wished they had (containers to store leftovers would be nice!). It also comes with a washer/dryer which comes in handy after multiple visits to the beach. Unlike some other reviewers, my place was pretty clean and I'm pretty picky about cleanliness. Most of the staff was friendly and always said 'aloha' - even the guy changing the light bulbs in the lobby! The girls at the Concierge were great (thanks Andrea!) and made me feel at home. After reading the other reviews, I think there is a difference from what you get as a timeshare owner and non-owner (ie. booking through Expedia). Timeshare owners get priority in room location and get the best ones when available. I rented someone's timeshare and thus got a great room. I look forward to returning to Maui and staying at the Westin Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay ever in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: bennalee
Reviews.Content: Pros: The BBQ grills for guests to use Cons: Westin Heavenly bed? The right side of the bed we had was slanted. My husband's neck was in so much pain after 1 night sleep on that bed. Rained during our stay there. When we asked to loan an umbrella, the staff said they were all out and we would need to buy one. What 4 star hotel runs out of umbrellas? Hotel promotes its DVD vending machine (magnetic sticker on the fridge). We went around looking for it. Turns out the machine was broken and sent for repair. Absolutely no respect for guest's privacy: during our stay, a security guard (at night) entered our room without our consent (though we have DO NOT DISTURB sign on). My husband came out from the washroom and was shocked see the guard entering the room without consent. The guard's reason for such rude action: he wanted to know if anyone was smoking in the room. It was obvious that none of us were smokers as he could not find anything he wanted to see. We complained to the front desk and the hotel management. The answer from front desk manager was that such action was necessary for "guests' welfare". What on earth does that mean? Weren't we the guests too? We got an apology call the next day and a $50 hotel credit as an apology. We appreicate the fact that management made the effort responding to our complaints. However, we rather the hotel treat all guests appropriately (like all other hotels do) than having to apologize to such a horrible and rude action taken by staffs. This was not an enjoyable stay at all. We never bother providing reviews to all the Hotels we stayed in HI as they were all great hotels. This is the only one we feel we need to comment on so that others can avoid such bad experience in heavenly maui. If you do plan on visiting this hotel, LOCK your room door from inside to protect your own privacy.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time in 2 years”
Reviews.Author: cjay0121
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have stayed many places on the island of Maui and as we have matured so has our standard. Anyone who knows Maui knows that there are few properties on the island that combine the amenities of a 4 star hotel with the convenience of a fully equipped condo quite like the Westin Kaanapali Villas. The grounds are beautifully kept and the location is fabulous for snorkeling, walking along the beach/boardwalk or venturing into Whalers Village or Lahaina. The rooms are huge, bright and airy and have always been immaculate upon arrival. There is but 1 negative that stands out with this property. An Ocean View is not always what you might imagine. As much as I absolutely LOVE this place my vacation would be far from perfect without the required view of the Ocean. On our first visit we were given a room that looked over the pirate pool and if you stretched over the lanai could catch a glimpse of the ocean. It took me 2 days of politely checking with the front desk before we were finally moved to a better view. The last 2 times we have requested the same room and have thankfully been accommodated. When we first discovered this property we thought it would be completely out of our price range however, thanks to Naomi at Maui Hawaii vacations we have had the great pleasure of visiting 3 times in the past 2 years. Her service is impeccable and it seems like she might have some pull to get us the room we request. Our most recent visit started with lovely fruit/wine basket compliments of Naomi. What a wonderful surprise! Maui No Ka Oi at the Westin Kaanapali resort Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Great villa resort in very nice area”
Reviews.Author: IVsystem
Reviews.Content: Since this is a ownership based all villa resort, this is not a place where you get pampered. But this is one of the nicest resort property on Maui. Landscaping is impeccable, great programs for kids and family, suites are very nicely equipped and very large. We had a 2 bed lock off villa which is basically 1 bed villa and a studio villa attached. We really like this type of layout since you can still manage to have total privacy. Housekeeping works hard but they are very slow which is common in hotels in Hawaii. Restaurants aren't very expensive, and the gym is equipped nicely. Since there are so many great eats near the hotel, we ate at the resort just once. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too far north!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravel8
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and the the 1 bedroom we stay in was average. The dryer in the room kept breaking so we really could not use the wash/dryer during our stay. Engineering team came to fix it twice but wasn't successful. As for the location, it was really far from most activities and great restaurants. For example, you would have to drive 2 hours one way for the Hana drive, Haleakala biking, Maui aquarium and dinner at Spago or Mama's fishhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Owner... but would rather be a guest.”
Reviews.Author: trock24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in beautiful Maui. Let me say that we are owners at this property. The property itself is beautiful and well kept, however, I will say... I would rather be a guest instead of an owner at this hotel. We paid a lot of money for an oceanview room, and what we ended up with was a partial view, no sun and sounds from the highway. Every year we have the same issue with our room, so owner services told me how the booking process works. I used their advice, and to no one's surprise... we get the same room area. I call owner services again, they tell me the exact same thing as last year. I hope one year their script will change. I would love to sell my timeshare, but looking at different websites, there are a lot who are also trying to sell. Don't get me wrong, we do love the location, the island, etc... I just get the feeling that they have my money so, I am no longer important.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to all those who made our stay in Paradise extra-special.”
Reviews.Author: drathman
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Paradise is coming to an end and we want to say a special thank you to Jason at the North Bell Desk and Tosh at the front drive (and everything else at the north villas), and Valerie Jimenez, the concierge who helped us on the desk our first day. These three people went out of their way to make our stay at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas a wonderful experience. They treated us like family and we truly appreciate it. They helped make our stay five star. Everyone else was very friendly too, but these three stood out. We had an unbelievable 12 days here on Maui and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Service was surprisingly brisk, competent”
Reviews.Author: yakimanic
Reviews.Content: My wife has problems sleeping without the white noise of a fan and when we notified management they immediately delivered a fan. Also I left some items in the room and was contacted via email immediately and the items were fedex'd out to me for a small charge. Loved the beach boardwalk. Snorkeling just to the left of the hotel was really very good, also surprising. Travelers should know about this. Renting snorkel gear from the poolside area was spendy but worth it. Internet access was tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: besita74
Reviews.Content: I am an avid trip advisor user, I did a lot of research and was very pleased with our choice to stay at the Westin Villas, booked thru travelocity, got a great deal and here are the details: * private beach, amazing grounds, beautiful ocean *clean resort, very upscale feeling, excellent service *we had a studio with a kitchen, a little small but nice beds etc, * Stay in North Tower if you can a little more updated * the rooms are close together so if you want a private ocean view book accordingly, most rooms have partial view not full on * Our son loved the koi fish on property, lovely * We traveled with a toddler and this is the best hotel for kids if you are a couple don't go here, hotel provided us with complimentary highchair and crib, very nice. * Loved the pool service and the offerings there, friendly staff * Food and drinks very mediocre one of the only downfalls but you can get happy hour deals * Jesse the concierge was AMAZING *Anona in the restaurant outstanding * Walking distance to Sugar Cane Train *Go To Dukes for eating out , short walk up the beach path, very good better than Westin * Kids club should be open later than 4 p.m.- this was a drawback * They also offer a free photographer service for families -ask concierge * Lovely sunsets, need some live music though *Don't hesitate to go here! We loved it and I am picky.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: CharmiefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort for a week and had by far the best family vacation we have ever had. Location was good and well within short driving distance to everything. It was across the street from one of the Sugar Cane Train's stop which was really cool for our 2 1/2 year old boy. The entire resort was beautiful and clean. The room was also clean and very roomy, we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was an upgrade to what we had originally purchased. We received daily cleaning from housekeeping with fresh supplies of towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap, lotion, dish soap, laundry soap, etc..... They even loaded our dirty dishes when we left them in the sink. I thought that that was awesome. The bed was very comfortable which felt really close to sleeping in our own bed. The bathroom was very roomy and clean too. Our son loved getting out of the spacious balcony with seats and tables. I think the studio rooms/suites don't have as big balcony as we had so don't expect a full balcony if you paid for the Studio room. We stayed in one of the buildings in the South part of the resort. I personally think it was a better part of the resort with the better pool. But I think it is more quiet in the North part of the resort. The beach was beautiful, clean and well kept. There are 3 restaurants in the resort but only one served breakfast and that is the one in the South part of the resort. Food was good, not entirely excellent. Make sure to try the Short ribs for dinner, it was tender and yummy. Sometimes we would get good service when we eat there, sometimes we get ignored where my husband has to get the booster seat himself. Overall, it was good. We tried Pulehu Restaurant where they were supposed to serve italian food and it was okay. One good thing to do there is attend a Luau in the other Westin Maui resort a few minutes drive from WKORV. This place is a TImeshare resort but did not necessarily felt that way. They were not pushy at all about selling you timeshare and my husband was only asked about it once. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this resort. We definitely will consider going back to this resort if we can do it again. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Westin staff is great with special needs children”
Reviews.Author: gdines
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spend a week at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resorts Villa in Maui with our 15 year old son Brian who has Cerebral Palsy. This resort has a water slide going into the pool. All the kids in the resort enjoy the slide. My wife and I want our son to enjoy all the fun activities the other kids enjoy. I carried my son to the top of the slide and was informed that the Westin safety policy would not allow him to go down with me or I could not catch him at the bottom. I went to the registration counter to find out what could be done to allow an exception of the safety policy to allow our son to enjoy the water slide during our visit. I talked with a loving, caring person named Dee Dee at the registration counter. Dee Dee called management on our behalf and asked them to grant our son an exception. Another caring person was Cameron, the Director of Recreation and pool side services. Cameron and the entire staff at the pool service were great with our son. Cameron wanted to ensure our son was included in all pool activities and arranged for us to use a beach wheelchair provided by the Westin to enjoy the beach. The entire pool staff are caring people and treated our son like one of the other kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sherwoodparkcouple
Reviews.Content: We are a early 40's couple that travel extensively. Fell in love with Maui. The resort was everything we needed. We stayed in a studio in the South Villas and it was sufficient for the two of us. The only time we are in the room is to eat breakfast and to get ready to go out. We used the Workout rooms everyday and they had enough equipment and free weights to do what you wanted. We used both the South and the North side gyms. We used the South pool the first half of the trip as we had some friends with kids on that side who liked the waterslide. The second half we used the North side pool which had less kids. The North side also had a great sports bar with about 8 screens which was great for football on Saturday and Sunday. It was right by the pool and towards the beach. Can't imagine any beter place to watch NFL football all day. In November the beach was great. The snorkling was phenomenal as soon as you got about 15 feet out from the beach. There were no waves but you could feel some strong pulls in certain areas. Nice walk down the beach and around the Sheraton to the Black Rock area and the main Kaanapali beach. Message me if you require more in depth info

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY OF SERVICE IS GOING DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: pamseattle
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here and I have to say that the quality of services in all areas has gone down. First of all, we used our week to stay in the one bedroom villa. We couldn't find a flight back until the following day so I booked another day stay using cash & point. I proceeded to send the hotel a message asking if we can stay in the same room for the additional night and I did this more than 6 months in advance. I also called the hotel a week before our arrival and the day we checked in to confirm and all they said was they don't know, the room has not been assigned.
