We didn't know until the night before that we had to pack up everything, including everything in the refrigelator and move to another room. It was a hassel to have to be out of our room by 10 a.m. and can't get into another room until 4 p.m. Also, it will be nice if the front desk staff can smile a little. The pool staff was the worst, rude and inconsiderated. I love Maui and planning to go back but we'll have to think about another place to stay eventhou we are a Starwood Preferred Gold member.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great facilities, average to below average service by Westin standards, definitely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: caazmark
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I did enjoy myself (how could you not in Lahaina). Unfortunately I may have had too high of expectations of the hotel and it definitely disappointed. First the positives...room was nice (even great for a family), pools were great, certain amenities were great like free wireless, kitchenette, free parking, washer/dryer. Now the downside...starting from our reservation. We were told a couple of things when we made our reservation that turned out to not be true. For example, we were told we would also have access to the Westin Resort and Spa and the Sheraton (as affiliated resorts). Not only did we not have access to the other resorts but (to make matters worse) the staff told us that the reservations people would "never" tell us that...like I was lying and like they would somehow know what another employee told me. Kicking us out made us feel bad enough but to call me a liar was terrible customer service and a terrible experience for my family. Second, the Westin told us that all benefits from being a Starwood preferred Gold member carried over to the Villas (e.g., upgrade to a better view room if available). The front desk clerk then told us that is not true because they are a timeshare. I didn't expect an upgrade as it's not always available but to be told different things is very frustrating. Then there's the terrible experiences with the concierge. Every time we wanted concierge service, we got the hard sell on the timeshare. Even worse, we made a reservation for a Luau with the concierge. The Laua was great but the frustrating part is he pressured us into taking the reservation immediately while we sat there telling us there were only three slots left. Turned out that wasn't true and there were plenty of openings. The concierge also charged us more than making a direct reservation. That's fine except no need to lie and say it's selling out when in fact it's not. Makes you wonder what kind of kickback they got. Again I don't care about the kickback...I just don't want it influencing how they sell us on different services. I definitely left with the impression that the staff (at the Villas being timeshares) are not trained to the same level as typical Starwood properties. Finally the price. I've stayed at alot of nice hotels (albeit the following without kitchenette's)...it's easy to find cheaper OCEANVIEW rooms at much nicer hotels (e.g., Ritz Carlton, St. Regis, Four Seasons etc.) than nonoceanview rooms at these Villas. In my mind, the Villas are WAY overcharging for that kitchenette. Don't need to say much more on that one. Personally, I'd recommend one of the other Starwood properties on Maui or Kaui. In sum, it was actually a very nice hotel. For the price, however, it needed to be closer to world class.

Reviews.Title: “Westin overall service has changed from a 5 to a 3 or lower in some areas”
Reviews.Author: nicole2003
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Westin Kaanapali North for two weeks and all 6 of us felt the service and attitude of the help had changed dramatically. First I must say we love the location, the rooms, the pools and cleanliness of the westin. The housekeeping staff are very accommodating. The front desk staff and according to them management direction we would now rate a 2 or less as compared to outstanding before. Many of them seemed put out by our requests for a room on higher floor or closer to ocean. We asked nicely and politely -It took the front desk less thany 2 minutes to search the options and find us rooms close to each other with an excellent view. I travel frequently for business and was shocked by some of the rudeness of the staff when the customers were being very pleasant. .In the resort world the front desk should be more than willing to accomate and assist the the customers/guests- if this does not fit their personality the manager should find them another position and not ruin the resort reputation. Second issue on both weekends the basketball area and some of the lounges were overrun with a group of locals (15-20) for the entire day. None of us could use the pool-basketball area and when we inquired if there was a time limit (such as 1 hour) the pool staff said not really and did nothing suggest that others have some pool court time. As there are plenty of high quality resorts on Maui that welcome guests and try to accommodate the room requests we most probably will not stay at Westin again especially if the front desk and management continues to get worse and not consider their guests.

Reviews.Title: “What a Trip”
Reviews.Author: jeff224
Reviews.Content: Thanks Westin for making our stay a Delightful one ! The Staff was more than friendly and so helpful with all our needs, especially one person, our room attendant. Her name was Violet N. She made sure our room was clean and fresh everyday , Thanks Violet !!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Ka'anapali - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnninAZ
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Maui in 3 years and I must say, the Westin Ka'anapali was the best location this time. We have stayed in the Ka'anapali area each time, but the Westin was top notch. We had a beautiful room, with a view of the park, and a partial ocean view. The room was very clean and roomy for two. The kitchen was perfect for us. We had a studio through Interval trade and the kitchen had 2 burners, a refrigerator, dishwasher, sink, and sufficient counter space, plus everything you could need for cooking and serving. The bathroom was beautiful and large, large shower and a tub. And the bed ~ absolutely heavenly, as in Heavenly Bed. We slept great every night! The grounds of the Westin are beautiful and maintained. We really enjoyed the beautiful beach, great for swimming, wading, snorkeling, right in front of the resort. We spent much of our time on the beach. We really appreciated the Westin Shuttle between the resorts, LaHaina, to Whalers Village, and you could also stop at Safeway which is a nice way to get around. It was nice not to fight traffic for a week. We also became new time share owners at this resort and Jenn & Susan were awesome. The Westin is fortunate to have them on their sales team! The resort does not push their sales on you at all, in fact, we had to inquire about it for our own curiousity. Also, the food was delicious at the on site restaurants. WE especially loved our dinner at the Italian restaurant and the chef made me gluten free pasta! Yummy. Some other things we really appreciated was the free internet access as well as free parking. We can't wait to get back to Maui and the Westin Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful , but noisy..”
Reviews.Author: travelbysue
Reviews.Content: First let me begin by saying the grounds, beds, rooms are gorgeous. My only issue is that the place gets very noisy, so if your expecting a nice quiet relaxing trip, think twice. During the day there is constant music throughout the resort, as well as rock music at the bars. Combine this with kids running around, servers getting orders from pool area and it gets a little old after a while. The beach is fabulous, perfect for snorkeling and the staff is very nice and accomodating, but I would much rather stay at a more low key type resort. We got a great deal in the mail and we had avery brief tour of the place, no pressure, but vacation ownership is just a fancy word for timeshare and it's not for us. The resort is large and there's a lot going on, but after a day of snorkeling and hanging out at the beach you just want to chill with a drink and not have so many distractions and noise. I would recommend this place for families. The restaurants are also a little overpriced, but venture out and find some good deals elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: DL0731
Reviews.Content: Great customer service - good location. right on the beach but not on the kaanapali beach. Kaanapali beach is short drive. clean rooms, great service. love having a full fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Shack Personnel Are Awesome....”
Reviews.Author: dougdjy
Reviews.Content: The group of people that work at this resorts Pool and Beach service desk are the best. Sean, Tim and the rest remember you from year after year and call you by name. Every day they greet you with a smile and a warm Aloha and at the end of the day, they say goodnight and look forward to seeing you the next day..... I wish the staff at this properties restaurant had the same attitude!!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Villas is the best of both worlds (hotel & condo)”
Reviews.Author: Smhyla
Reviews.Content: The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Villas Resort (AKA Westin Villas) is different from the Westin Hotel but both are very close to each other in Ka'anapali Beach area in the town of Lahaina, Maui, Hawai'i. The Westin Villas are not necessarily the cheapest but it's great value if you are looking for a nice room with kitchen and all the amenities like pools and a gym. Maui is not cheap so one way to save money is to cook instead of eating out. This is especially true for long vacations (at least 1 week). Otherwise a hotel may be perfect for a weekend getaway. Speaking of cooking, the Westin Villas offers several gas BBQ grills and picnic tables. There is now a 1-hour time limit if someone else is waiting. As with all hotels, alcohol may be consumed in the privacy of your own room but not in the public areas, so we simply be disgreet (reuse water or gatorade bottles or poor into regular glasses in advance). The Westin Villas provides almost all of the kitchenware that you will need, including the BBQ grill tools and salt/pepper shakers (but no salt and pepper). Grocery stores there are not cheap but there is a Costco right outside of the airport, so it's good to stock up once you have arrived. I bring a few food items in our sut case if small enough so that I don't have to buy it on the island, such as little packets of salt & pepper, ketchup and mustard. The kitchens come with a fridge, electric stove top, convection microwave oven AND dishwasher. Another bonus is the in-room washer and dryer which prove to be convenient when staying for 1+ weeks. Westin Villas provide a small bottle of liquid dish soap, 3 dishwasher pellets and 1 small box of laundry detergent (I suggest bringing 2 cups and a few cling free sheets from home). If you do NOT like to cook or want to treat yourself, there are a restaurants on-site and you can also use the restaurants at the other Starwood hotels which you can charge to your room. The best part of the Westin Villas is the reef right in front of the property. You must rent a car when staying in Maui because Ka'anapali and Lahaina are 40-45 minutes away from the airport without traffic, plus all the sightseeing requires a car. You can get a shuttle for $45 each way but the car is not that much more. My point is that you can walk into the ocean and start snorkeling easily right off the shore in shallow water (AKA save money by not going on an excursion). As timeshare owners of the Westin Villas, our maid service comes once mid-week during a 1 week stay. However, the studios and 1-bedrooms are available for rent on travel websites, while the 2-bedrooms are not. If you have 4 people, the 1-bedroom is good for privacy since the sofa bed is in the living room. The maid service is daily when renting. You can always put out the trash bag outside of your door and call housekeeping to pick it up. You can also call for extra towels. Additional maid service is available for a fee. The bathrooms are huge where the toilet is always separate in its own room. There is both a huge shower stall and a huge jacuzzi tub inside the bathroom. There is always 2 different entrances into bathroom, so it's nice that your guests can go into the bathroom directly from the livingroom/kitchen area without having to go through your bedroom. Like I mentioned earlier, Westin Villas are not cheap but you can watch for great sales on websites such as Orbitz.com. The best deals are when 4 people are sharing a room. Sometimes it might be cheaper to book the reservation for 2 people and then have the other 2 book their own flights, if you know what I mean. The other reason why the Westin Villas is better than the hotels is there is no $25 "resort fee" which other properties charge. The resort fee usually includes parking and internet access. The internet access is free here with wireless in public areas and wired ethernet in the rooms. Another great benefit to staying here is the free shuttle to the other Starwood properties (the sister hotels are Westin Hotel and Sheraton Black Rock Hotel) as well as to downtown Lahaina. So that both my husband and I can enjoy ourselves (no drinking & driving), we take the shuttle down to Lahaina for dinner and drinks, then take a $25 taxi back to the Villas since the shuttles do stop running around 10pm. Black Rock is another awesome spot for snorkeling which is a 15 minute walk along the boardwalk south from the Westin Villas or you can take the complimentary shuttle. However, the reef in front of the Westin Villas is much less crowded and much closer. The business center is also included. You can use a desktop with a printer for 30-minute increment. Printing is free. Better yet, you can email a document to the concierge or upload it to their designated website for free, then they will print it for you and have it ready for pick up at the front desk. This is convenient when you can check into your flight on your own laptop or cell phone in your room then go pick up your boarding passes upon check out. Geez, what else? We had our wedding in Maui last month, so that was the purpose of our visit. Some of our friends and family stayed at the Westin Villas which was really convenient. I wish everyone else had stayed there too but all the hotels are within 15 minutes driving when staying in the west side (West Maui), which is popular since Ka'napali offers the best beach in Maui. Again, this place is not the cheapest but it's good value for the money if you can afford it. This is a long review but hope it's helpful.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE MAUI!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: perfectReddeer
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing trip to Maui!!Our family of five,two teens,one younger,had our dream vacation!! This was our first time in such a tropical place,and wow was it awesome!!The resort was so classy and beautiful,everything about it was great!!From the moment we checked in,we were treated top notch all the way.Sheena from front desk was an angel!,she was so helpful and accomodating!,she made us feel like family!She went out of her way to upgrade us to a bigger room,with a full ocean view!!!!!!Thanks Sheena,for making our stay the most memorable!.The Westin staff were all so very friendly,everywhere we went,we were greeted with smiles,and lots of ALOHA's,it was fantastic.Housekeeping rocks!!,you did an amazing job,never had to ask for anything,you thought of it all.Our room was so perfect for us,and our ocean view was the icing on the cake!My husband and I really miss our morning coffee on the deck,basking in the glorius warmth of Maui,and looking at the ocean,we miss it so much.Thankyou Westin for making our stay truly a dream vacation!You are a georgous resort,in a most beautiful location.We can hardly wait to come back! It was perfect! Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrl74
Reviews.Content: Large resort- can sometimes be a walk to pool/beach, but if you don't mind that, excellent facilities - kitchen a great plus- grocery store in Lahaina easy to get to to stock up on staples, great snorkeling right behind hotel, pool staff very friendly. We were there after Labor Day, so no problem getting lounge chairs, or cocktail staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! How soon can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: bogberto
Reviews.Content: My wife & I finally took a honeymoon after being married 3+ years. We stayed here with my sister & her husband who are the timeshare owners. We love this property! It's clean, quiet, and has just about all you need to keep you happy. We had the smaller unit, which is basically a studio suite, which offered plenty of room for us. The larger unit was a nice size, and offered a big balcony. Restaurant food is pricey, but what else would you expect. The pools are nice, although the waterslide didn't really move you if you weighed more than 100 pounds. Walk out to the beach and start snorkeling!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nic626
Reviews.Content: This place is luxury all the way. Awesome villas, amazing grounds, great location, yummy resturant on site. We had a wonderful time and will be going back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas VS. Marriott Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: cmhrun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club several times and absolutely loved it. We found a reasonably good deal for the Westin and decided to give it a shot, as it had very good reviews. Our stay started on a very negative note, but improved as the week went on. We paid extra for an Ocean View 2-bedroom villa. After standing in a long check-in line, were were finally given our room. I was dismayed to find we were situated directly in front of a parking lot, with a somewhat obstructed view of the ocean behind it. One of the bigger negatives of this hotel is that it sits back further from the ocean than the Marriott Maui Ocean Club (MOC), and some of the ocean views are not great. At the MOC, it is situated very close to the ocean, and we have always had a FANTASTIC ocean view. There has never been an issue. I called the front desk to hopefully remedy the situation. After being put on hold for ten minutes, I called back again. This time I spoke with a woman at the front desk, who spoke to me about the issue, then put me on hold. She never returned back to the phone. By this time I was pretty upset, and went to the front desk, toting my young children with me, who were by now crabby and hungry. The front desk said they were almost at capacity and had no other ocean view rooms for me. I told them that was unacceptable, and asked the manager to call me. An hour and a half went by, and no call. It was now 5:30 pm. My husband called the manager and she said we could stay across the hall with a pool-view room. We reluctantly took the room, as no ocean view alternative was given to us. It turned out to be all right, but didn't come close to the ocean view rooms at the Marriott that I would have received. The room itself was spacious and clean. I did not care for the floor plan of the two bedroom,which is not good for families with young children. It basically is two separate hotel rooms connected by a front entryway. It was hard for me to monitor the children with the floor plan, and I did not feel very comfortable at night, as I was afraid I would not hear them if there was a problem. The MOC has a more standard floor plan that has the room connected at the family room. The hotel grounds were very pretty. They were nicely landscaped. I thought MOC's were prettier though. The pool is a big deal for us, with three small children. The 1 1/2 foot baby pool was nice, as was the pirate ship. However, I didn't like that the pirate ship pool was completely separate and about a 3-4 minute walk from the main pool. The Marriott's pirate ship is directly connected to the main pool, and much easier to keep the family together. We all agreed the MOC's pool was much more interesting and prettier than the Westin's pool, with all the waterfalls and the swim through cave it has. The beach at the Westin is wider than the one at MOC, with better snorkeling. However, I still preferred the beach at MOC. It seems more private and intimate, and is a closer walk to the pool. Both the Westin and the MOC have a nice walking path along the ocean, and actually connect to each other (which I didn't know about previously and was wondering if that was new...) Both the Westin and the MOC were very quiet. I did not hear much from neighbors. The biggest negative about the rooms at the Westin was that there was no trash chute anywhere. I had to call someone every time my garbage filled up, which was usually once a day. The staff would then pick up my garbage at the door, but then of course, I had to pay a tip, which I thought was annoying. When I had to throw out a dirty diaper, I had to walk all the way outside to find a garbage to put it in. Why the heck don't they have a garbage chute on each floor? It was very irritating. The staff for both hotels were overall nice and polite. The service was good, except for the issue with our room view. The only other negative about the Westin is all the wind, which I had read about before, but experienced first-hand. I'm not sure exactly why it is windier at the Westin than at the MOC, but it is very noticeable. By the end of the week, we were calling it the "Westin Wind Tunnel." At times, the wind cooled us off, but most of the time, the wind was just an annoyance. One day, we drove over to the MOC from the Westin. When we got to the MOC and walked by the pool, it was much less windier and much nicer to sunbathe. The Westin lacked a decent place on premise to buy "cheaper" food. It only had a sit-down restaurant close to the pool which was expensive and didn't have much casual fare, like sandwiches, and ice cream bars. The MOC does have the Market Pantry, which has a good assortment of things to buy, and is right next to the pool. It has an awesome view of the ocean. However, even items such as PJ sandwiches and Pizza are still somewhat pricey. As far as being the best hotel for kids, I prefer the MOC. First, as discussed before, the pool is better with the pirate ship connected to the main pool. Second, Westin has no playground for children, while Marriott has a great playground right next to one of the pools. The Westin also does not have a game room, while the MOC has one which my children really enjoyed. Finally, as a work-out enthusiast, I always try out the gyms a few times during my stay. Both the Westin and the MOC have good work-out areas with cardio equipment, free weights, and machines. MOC has the edge again, as their work out area has a beautiful view of the pool and the ocean, where the Westin's is in a basement, with no view. To sum it up, the Westin was a nice play to stay, but it just can't hold a candle to the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. We'll be staying there next time. It's a better fit for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful sums it up nicely”
Reviews.Author: SusieG1391
Reviews.Content: We're staying here now and today is our last day - got an offer in the mail for (island view studio villa) 6days/5nights for $749 including car rental and either 7000 Starwood points or $100 to spend at resort. We were first given a room on the 6th floor overlooking the garbage dumpster and above a compressor, so having the patio door open wasn't an option (and that's what we love to do in Hawaii) so asked if they could move us, and Kevin was very accomodating (he found us another room w/partial ocean view but no lanai, just a small ledge - but 10x better than what we had before). We love it here, the room is wonderful, the bed and linens are heavenly - all the fancy down linens. Jacuzzi tub, small kitchen with full size refrig, dishwasher, and all the ammenities you need (blender, toaster, coffee maker, dishes, etc.) free wi-fi, the shower is da bomb - large enough for 5 people, large flat screen TV, couch, safe, nice exercise room, etc. The pool is great (slide for kids and another pool area with a ship for kids) lots of lounge chairs, grounds are beautiful, clean and well manicured, on Kaanapali beach. Parking is free. We opted not to attend the timeshare preso although they do offer $100 cash to use at resort and 50% off future (non Hawaii) stay at other Starwood locations (although I am sure 50% discount is off of rack rate, so in reality probably not a big discount). We would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is a large property, so I wouldn't call it quiet and I imagine during the summer months it is packed with kids and families, so I wouldn't want to be staying here during that time of year, but if you have young kids it's probably ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: TripGalSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for part business, part leisure. We stayed in an ocean view room. Things that we: LOVED *Rooms were gorgeous, well planned. Nothing like sitting in the jacuzzi tub and choosing to watch the TV in the bedroom or gaze out to the ocean. *Quiet rooms. *Comfy bed. *Kitchen had everything ready - just stock the fridge and it's like you're at home, including a blender, toaster, utensils, etc. Everything was very clean. *View was breathtaking. *Spacious resort - was told they were over 90% capacity but it didn't seem like it. *Shuttles to Whaler's Village and Lahaina were frequent and complimentary. *Spa was very relaxing. *Concierge, bellmen and front desk staff were outstanding. *Several pools to choose from, with great views of the ocean. The pirates ship for kids is very cute. They have a water slide also. DIDN'T LOVE *TV was cumbersome to figure out and lacked channels (not that we watched much, but still) *Movie rental machines in both lobbies had technical problems (same as above, but nice to be available) *We weren't informed the credit card authorization to check in was $2500; we learned later when checking our bank accounts. All was OK but they should have told us upfront. *Noise from nearby main road, mostly daytime *WiFi did not work in our room. They tried to fix it but it never fully worked. The "business center" is basically one computer on a desk on the perimeter of the open lobby, so people walk by. *Hotel layout was hard to navigate; it took myself and many other guests a few days to learn how to get around. *Food/bev is VERY expensive. Hotel gift shop/market is very overpriced. Example - box of instant oatmeal packets is $9.99 (Safeway is normally $3.99). Breakfast buffet at Oceans is $25 (excellent, but pricey). Pool service - Pina coladas are about $9.50. Diet Pepsi is $5. You'll also pay to rent the beach chairs and cushioned pool chairs. Standard pool chairs are complimentary. And don't lose your towel cards or they charge $15. *Housekeeping was inconsistent a couple of days we were there (almost like they left in the middle of cleaning) *We were asked a few times if we wanted to attend a timeshare meeting Tips - when we were there, they offered a "go green" program. You'll receive 1 free breakfast buffet voucher per day in exchange for no housekeeping service that day. Ask the front desk about it. Also, they had a hot dog vendor there during the lunch hours on the weekend, selling hot dog, chips and soda for $7. Other economical food options include the Times Market, a few blocks away, or some of the restaurants (via shuttle) are fairly priced (i.e. Hula Grill, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co). The hotel does a very nice job catering to all types of travelers. We felt very comfortable on the business part of our trip, then just us for a romantic few days, and we also plan to bring our kids in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Position on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreStatus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, got a nice upgrade even though we booked with points. Great room, and overall nice hotel -in line with the reasons why i go to Westins. What sets it apart for me is its location. I ran the board walk all the way down to the Hyatt and back again. There are lots of hotels ontop of each other below black rock, with small beaches and crowded pools. This hotel seems to have the quietest position as it isnt surrounded by other hotels and the beach is bigger with great snrkelling.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: penolan
Reviews.Content: I believe this is my fifth year returning to this resort. The first time I saw it I bought a time share here and never regreted it. The location is absolutely wonderful; close to Lahaina, Whalers Village, and Kapalua. A car is a must for this Island. The resort, which includes the adjacent North property, have everything one needs from exercise rooms, sauna, steam rooms, outside grills for a sunset supper, and more. The ground at both properties are well maintained and provide a cross section of Island flora. The staff was courtious, especially the front desk. Once again I had a wonderful seven days and look forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: landlockedNebraska
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to an ocean view room. However, it was a handicapped room and had no shower. There was a sprayer that came out of the jacuzzi tub. Because of this and being above the pool we were a little reluctant to take this room. I'm glad we kept it. It was a beautiful view and we were shielded from the heat by palm trees. The pool was not noisy at all even though there were many kids on the premises. It was so convenient to the beach, restaurant and lobby. Our very clean studio unit came equipped with a washer & dryer, sink, small frig, cooktop and pots and pans. It was missing a microwave and we were brought one after bringing this to the attention of the front desk. The Westin bed was soooo comfortable. Large flat screen TV if you have time to watch. Beautiful sunsets! We always had service with a smile whether from the front desk, concierge, bellman, maid or restaurant servers. We enjoyed a couple of meals at the Ocean Pool Bar & Grill and were always pleased with our meals. Make sure you try the Pineapple cobbler. We shared one and it's awesome! If you want bathrobes, call housekeepiing and they will bring them to you. They are not kept in the units. We also had to ask for a hairdryer. The other ameniites shampoo, cond, lotion were very nice and the kitchen had cleaning supplies and soap. Grills are available so bring your spices along. It seems that most folks were shopping at the Safeway, but we also found the Times Market just a few blocks to the north to be a good place to shop. Great rolls from the bakery for sandwiches. This is the perfect beach for snorkeling. Beautiful fish as well as a possible turtle. Towel service near the pool is great (included) and snorkel equipment is available to rent if you don't have it. It's worth it for what you get to see. The lobby was inviting the minute we arrived. They keep a cooler of fresh water with sliced oranges available for guests. This is a warm, inviting place to stay in a perfect location. It's about 40-45 min drive from the airport. We would definitely recommend this Westin and hope to return in the future. I couldn't imagine a better place to stay on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Maui”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine0502
Reviews.Content: We love the Westin Kaanapali Villas! My sister in law lent us their timeshare as a wedding present. We stayed at the one bedroom villa for a week. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with warm hospitality from the staff. They were very accomodating even though we arrived earlier than check in time. The room and the view was breathtaking! You step out of you patio and Kaanapali beach is just a short walk away. We enjoyed watching the sunset every night we were there. We loved the place so much that we decided to own there! We look forward to coming back here next year and sharing it with family!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: thetrachwhisperer
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of our Hawaiian vacation at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort North. Upon our arrival, the staff immediately made us feel welcome. Our luggage was promptly delivered to our villa, and our one bedroom accommodations, with partial ocean view, were clean and comfortable - just what we needed after a long flight from the midwest. Love those heavenly beds! The property is beautifully landscaped, with many nice touches such as native Hawaiian flora and banana trees. My wife especially liked the koi fish pond behind the lobby - she would always stop to admire the fish whenever we walked by. Kaanapali Beach was a short walk from our villa. A boardwalk runs along the beachfront adjoining a park and other properties. We found this to be a delightful place for a morning or evening stroll. The beach itself is great for swimming or walking on the shore, and the view, especially when the sun sets between Lanai and Molokai, is simply breathtaking. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. We appreciated the concierge personnel, who assisted us in planning activities - mapping out the route to Hana (good advice - leave early), and getting reservations for a luau (Feast at Lele - fabulous!) Only caveat - things are very expensive here, even by Hawaiian standards. From renting beach chairs and umbrellas to eating in the restaurants, it's not cheap. We shopped at the Safeway a few miles down the road and cooked all of our meals. There are large barbecue grills by the pools, which we utilized on several occasions. Overall, we found the Westin to be a wonderful place to stay. Seeing the magnificent sunsets every evening seemed to make us forget about anything else. We hope to return to Maui in 2012, and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quality for its price.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter95076
Reviews.Content: I stayed there three times, but the last two was by far the worst. The second time was in April, and the grill area had no grills open, our room had something really disgusting on the bed, I prefer not to state, the tile floor felt as if they had used a dirty mop to clean it. It was very greasy. We also ordered food, and the meat was raw, all of the food was terrible, we took one bite and couldnt eat the rest. I have stayed at many hotels all over, the property was nice, but definately not for the price.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, relaxing, great views”
Reviews.Author: rumitummy
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite was large and had great views. food was great. beach was nice. very relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: thangnho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Beside the beautiful Hawaii weather, the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas made our vacation an unforgettable one. Thanks to Sulinn Aipa for taking care of our upgrade:) You're are the best. We have been to all of the Hawaii islands before and this was our 2nd time back to Maui. There is nothing not to like, except (this is not your fault) the water slide could have been higher and a little longer, like the one at Sheraton on the Big Island. Oh, 1 minor thing, the hospitality room could have been better. I was expecting a regular room with shower not a men locker room like we have in high schools. My 2 kids (ages 13 and 11) had a blast. Thank you Sulinn. Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikkoku2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 days over labor day weekend. Great kids friendly resort. It's close to everything, including a great supermarket where you can buy fresh milk and groceries. The resort has a full kitchen at your disposal so you can eat in if you so choose. There's also bbq gas grills that you can use. Although I haven't used it, I've seen other guests buy steaks and fish to grill. Cooking a night or two can save some money if you are trying to feed a family. I stayed in a one bedroom corner suite and it was bigger than I thought it'd be. Very comfy with a patio with partial ocean view. The pools and beach are beautiful. My daughter loved it. The only downside would be that it gets windy, very windy every day beginning early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, NOT a Westin”
Reviews.Author: FREEquentFlyerJake
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property and I have no complaints. This hotel however should not have been branded as a Westin since it lacks many of the Westin brand standards. Pros: - No mandatory resort fee. - Was never once solicited about purchasing a timeshare! - Inexpensive self parking and only $2 more for valet, though with their true abundance of underground and above ground parking, it is not in the least bit necessary. - Free wired internet in room (that is of pretty decent speed - even for paid 4mbps downstream / .5 mbps upstream) - Walking distance to Dukes Beach House restaurant. - Easy driving distance to other resorts, plus a free shuttle to their sister properties. - Breakfast buffet is medium sized and is good quality with a good variety of foods both hot and cold. - Plenty of true high definition channels on the large LCD TV's. - Ability to sign charges to your room at sister properties. - Large jacuzzi tubs and separate walk-in shower. Cons: - Rooms lack bathrobes - No room service available - Bathrooms lack privacy from rest of bedroom room - Restaurant at North tower closed on Tuesday and Wednesday - No restaurant at South tower - Pool-side restaurant/cafes close early, are expensive for quality, and the food is not very good even if it were cheap. - Lots of noisy equipment (a/c compressors, pool pumps, etc) right outside many rooms - No pay-per-view in rooms I WOULD come back to this property, it's a great place to enjoy a very deluxe suite, but lacks a lot of options for pampering (restaurants, room service, turn-downs, etc). This is a great setup to bring friends and family. Tips: - 20% off Spa coupons available from restaurant and bar servers. - Stop at Costco, Whalers General Stores or ABC stores on your way in for food to cook yourself at the property, not many food choices without driving away from property. - Double check which tower you are staying at in advance. You might find yourself waiting in a long line at the front desk only to find out you are at the wrong tower. - Great entertainment nightly at the Royal Lahaina, just south of the property, 5 minute walk. - Great food at Dukes Beach House, just north of the property, 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Another week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: mjs47
Reviews.Content: As owners at the VIllas, this is our 8th visit in 8 years. We can't imagine staying anywhere else on Maui. Being able to walk straight out to the beach for an early morning snorkel and see not only beautiful tropical fish but also spotted rays and the occasional turtle is a real treat. I've lost count of the pictures I've taken of the rainbows and occasional double rainbows over the ocean. The staff has been nothing but wonderful, especially our favorite concierge, Rita. We'll continue to return to the Westin Villas as long as we can handle the flight from the East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMWorld
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful. The rooms are big and comfortable and very clean. The pools are wonderful too. We never ate in any restaurants on property so can't comment on that. We are SPG Gold members and was upgraded to an ocean view villa even though we are not owners. Only complaint we had was the check out. We checked out on a Friday and being Gold members we NEVER have a problem extending our check out until 4PM. However, they could not extend the check out past 12PM because they were apparantly fully booked for the weekend when we left. They did offer a lounge and shower with locker room for those who need it (we did) so it was nice to be able to enjoy the day and then shower but we were very upset that we couldn't check out at 4PM being gold members of SPG. Otherwise, the villas are wonderful, the staff is friendly and the hotel is on a beautiful beach. Parking was $7 a night for self park and $9 a night for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: akd604
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel end of May/beginning of June with our 17 month old son. We exchanged our time share at the Marriott to stay at this place and stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. We loved this place and would definitely go back again. We stayed mostly at the resort, but found there to be lots of things to do. We loved that there were many pools and we went from one pool to another. My son loved the pirate ship pool. The really shallow baby pool was great too as it wasn't busy at all and my son could walk around there a lot. We bought food at Costco, but if you decide to do that, make sure that you bring a cooler or something because with traffic/construction, it took us about 1 hour to get back and 1/2 of our food melted. It probably would have been cheaper to just to go Safeway because of that. We used the shuttles to take us into town a couple of times. It was nice and quick. Just make sure you know when they're leaving so you can plan when you're going back and not have to wait around. Overall this was a great hotel. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Also very family oriented. Lots of people with young families like us.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Villas at West Maui--Wowie!”
Reviews.Author: kimcheedragon52
Reviews.Content: Having been to Maui over a dozen times over the last 20 years we have found that this resort has the best combination of luxury to casual elegance, where flip flops are as appropriate as any 600 dollar pair of red leather bottomed pumps. The Westin Kaanapali Villas are on the best stretch of beachfront with excellent snorkeling out the front doors and convenient shuttle buses to take you over to Lahaina to eat without worrying about that extra glass (or bottle) of bubbly. Kids love everything about this place, but the washer and dryers and extra large quarters with those famous "Heavenly Beds" make family vacationing a breeze. Grill NY strips out on the meticulously cleaned stainless steel mega grills by the pool and have a dandy dinner while watching the sunset into the Pacific with Lanai out to the right. A better vacation is not to be had. This place is great, clean, and well-kept. The people that run it are there year after year and have great attitudes, not that "I hate tourist" mug that I seem to encounter at other resorts, even on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: PatsTouring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Kaanapali at the end of August and thoroughly enjoyed it. The service was tremendous, people were extremely friendly and hospitable. It was a pleasure staying there and being so close to the ocean. The sunsets were magnificent and we were even treated to a wondrous rainbow when we first got there. The staff at the poolside was gracious and helpful. we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is what I'm talking about!”
Reviews.Author: PamnSteve2005
Reviews.Content: Saff was very helpful..Rooms were the best, very spacious and wonderful kitchen OOh that bathroom! Beaches in front of resort were less crowded and had plenty of room around the pools. If you want to BBQ, you need to plan on eating early tho.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrific pool, extremely bad service”
Reviews.Author: SkiSandLLL
Reviews.Content: We got an offer in the mail to stay here, and although the room was very nice and big, we had ZERO view of anything. The all-around service was very, very bad. Too many to mention here, but when we went to check out, there must have been 35 people in line. There should be a snack bar around the pool that has snow cones and food or something! The pool is great! The beach is nice but 10 feet out into the water, you'll hit a large coral reef. It's a great beach if you like to go snorkeling for tropical fish but the ocean is terrible for kids (as they and you will BANG your feet on the coral).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and servie”
Reviews.Author: sassie1oh1
Reviews.Content: We are on our last day of a five week stay at the WKORVS and has been 1 of our best vacations! The villas are roomy and well equipped with great veiws from our lanai. The pool staff, Cameron Tim and Sean were friendly and always tending to the needs of the guests keeping the pool area tidy and clean and were very helpful with activities. They made our vacation that much more pleasureable! The grill has a great menu and fair pries. My only negitives are that the poolside servers were a bit slow and appeared to be in their own world. (we sure missed Mosita at poolside again this year but glad to have seen her at the North Bar) And the other was with the internet service, wirless was poor in some buildings aswas the landline. It took me 4x of being disconnected just to write this review! We love it here and bring friends and family every year and will continue to do so! Mahalo to the entire staff at WKORV South!

Reviews.Title: “This resort has a great mix of amenities and is so comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Davern1
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here at the end of Ocotober 2009 for eight days. We met two other groups of friends here who had separate rooms. We arrived around 1:30 in the afternoon and the front desk staff was very nice and helpful during our stay. One group of our friends was in the North tower and the other group was in the South tower. We chose to stay in the south section and had a studio for the two of us. We were able to get into our room way before the stated check in time and the room was nice and clean. The valet brought up our luggage and Costco purchases. We sampled all of the pools and stayed primarily in the south pool. Each day we would play tennis in the mid afternoon, followed by more pool and then an hour or so of snorkeling in the late afternoon around four of five. We thought the snorkeling was great and not too far off Molokini. Its really nice and so relaxing to just be able to snorkel each day steps from the hotel room. The free shuttle service to Whalers Village was terrific for night time as we didn't have to worry about driving and parking. It adds to the relaxation if you dont have to jump in the car. We ate pretty much daily at the pool restaurant and the beach front bar. Service at these places were just average and the food was the same. The room was great for us. The bahroom is perfect and the beds and the best. Having a small kitchen was really convenient. We our friends over to each others rooms for drinks and appetiziers before we would venture off to dinner somewhere. We are actually going again next week and hope to have as good as time as we did last year.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: leselee
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Ocean Villas North in the beginning of September. It was an amazing vacation. We were on the top floor and had a great view of the pool and ocean. Our villa was spacious and we enjoyed having breakfast in the room. Our mornings were spent on the beach, snorkeling and we finished the afternoon at the pool. There were always plenty of chairs and shade at the pool. The parking was also never a problem. The only negative was the charge for chairs at the beach. We ended up purchasing some at K-Mart and then gave them to a family when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home on Maui”
Reviews.Author: travelmasterhi
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT stay at KOR and would recommend this to our friends and family. We have stayed at many properties on Maui and enjoy how KOR has maintained and improved the resort over the years. We stayed at both the Hyatt and Westin Hotels. They both need maintenance and repairs. We will not return to either property until they address the deferred maintenance rampant at both resorts. KOR was fantastic and the service first rate. I hope that in the future they address the need for more umbrellas around the pool, as it was stressful trying to find shade each day if you did not want to pay for it. Both Glenn and Sonia went out of their way to provide us with a wonderful stay. We have already booked for next year and plan to stay even longer! You will not be disappointed by staying at KOR

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful facility, friendly staff, fun pirate ship for kids.”
Reviews.Author: mommy2brady
Reviews.Content: Went with our 3 1/2 year old son and it was a treat. The restaurant by the main check in and pool area was wonderful for us because our son played by the koi pond while we actually got to enjoy a peaceful meal! Pirate ship pool for little ones was great. So much fun was had by all. We usually went in the afternoon, in which case the pool was shaded, so depending on the weather (sun) you can choose the time to go. Saw beautiful rainbows over the mountains behind the hotel. We were in the one bedroom suite, which was great & big and nice because son could go to sleep while we could be up in the other room. The only disappointment was that our room stated ocean view, but really we had a parking lot view with a glimpse of the ocean. The lanai was big and would have been amazing if we could have enjoyed it and heard the ocean, instead we heard cars parking at the local beach access. I WAS VERY SAD TO BE STUCK IN THIS ROOM. The staff did try to change our room but the hotel was FULL. I would be hesitant to return to this hotel just because of the chance of getting a similar room location. Otherwise, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I hope Heaven is this good”
Reviews.Author: WeTravel
Reviews.Content: I'm at the WKORV right now, with less than 24 hours left of our two week vacation. I'm sitting on our fifth floor lanai, looking out at the palm trees, the beach, and the incredibly blue Pacific stretching over to Molokai, its peaks covered by puffy white clouds. The breeze is like a soft cotton blanket. This is paradise. We've thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Our one-bedroom villa has been perfect. It's very roomy, and was very clean on arrival. We've eaten many of our meals here and made good use of the grills down by the pool. The grills are beautiful Kitchenaid gas grills. and the grill area is a popular place at sunset. We bought most of our food at the Times Market about a mile north of here. The beach here is great for snorkeling. Most days the water is clear and calm, and you can see an enormous variety of fish just off shore. I never saw a turtle, though others did. We were surprised to find that there is parking under our building, though it fills up quickly. We could usually find a spot, though, as the resort is not that busy now. We ate at the Ocean Pool Bar and Grill twice, once on Sushi night, and its a very nice outdoor restaurant. The one disappointment was the sports bar at WKORVN, by the pool. On both visits, a number of beer taps were empty, and one time we finally left after no one would wait on us. One employee threw menus on our table, but no one would stop by to take an order. I guess no place can be perfect all the time. We will definitely be back..

Reviews.Title: “Pool side service”
Reviews.Author: Hankster2010
Reviews.Content: The week we spent in Maui at the Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas was just fantastic. The pool area was a delight. The pool staff was always present, adjusting the chairs, keeping the area beautiful and always asking if there was anything that they could do to make our stay even better. The towel service worked very efficiently and there was no problems asking for new towel during the day. The staff there was very helpful always ready to offer tips on activities. They made our vacation wonderful. Thank you Cameron and your staff!

Reviews.Title: “great poolside service”
Reviews.Author: lynnmroth
Reviews.Content: We are just getting home from a week at the Villa's. We commented to ourselves before we knew Cameron's name that he was a worker and an asset to the poolside workings of the villa. Being the couple that needed nothing but rest and to hopefully be spoiled by the westin, we were spoiled ,and then some by Cameron and his staff. He was so respectful to his staff and took such pride in his work and that was so pleasant to see. We bought another timeshare while there and Cameron's attention and service is definitely a piece of that happening. I must say Agea ( Asia) and Kevin were great at seeing to our needs as well. Howie was a very helpful salesman as well, and I cannot help but mention that also. We recommend this resort highly. Our only complaint is that our refrigerator stopped working, but we were given a credit for the inconvenience. We cannot wait to get back next year with our entire family.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay and live here if I could afford it”
Reviews.Author: joann_ting
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights the beginning August 30th, 2010 and the entire stay was just fabulous. I have stayed in many hotels and this is the first I review I felt compelled to write. First off, I read reviews about this hotel before selecting either the Westin south of this one or the Sheraton but when I found out these were more condo style rooms with a laundry facility, kitchenette, and full sized fridge, as well as jacuzzi, I was pretty much sold. Given that my trip would be 10 days, eating out would be tiresome and washing bathing suits and clothes every other day at a laundromat was out of the question. There are also many BBQs that are available for guest use and we had no problem finding a vacant one during dinner time. Here's a quick recap of my overall experience: CHECK IN Checking in was quick. However, the front desk staff wasn't overly excited and quite expressionless but I suppose that is better than being awful and rude to guests. I did notice that during mornings, line ups would form but they weren't as bad as the lineups I saw when I walked down the Westin that is south of this hotel *yikes*. I had the impression parking was free but was later notified that it was 7 dollars a night, or 9 for valet. ROOMS We stayed in a Dlx Studio Suite in the North tower. At the beginning of this trip, the hotel is confusing as heck to navigate through. Elevator signs that lead you to more hallways, the numbering system of the rooms (listen to the front desk instructions carefully), etc. Hold on to those maps of the front desk agents hand you when you check in because they come in handy if you haven't been here. Once you got the hang of the buildings, it wasn't too painful. The hotel room was equipped with all your kitchen necessities such as pots and pans, cutlery, glasses, plates, etc which was fantastic. Kitchenette also had a dishwasher which made cleaning easy. I have read reviews about the odd window in the wall that goes through the bathroom into the bedroom area but it doesn't bother me as it made the room feel more open yet still retain privacy. The decor is simple and everything in the room was quite up to date in terms of style, so no complaints there at all. The bed was heavenly. Enough said. The large flat TV was great for watching a movie. The room comes with a DVD player as well as a Ipod Dock/Radio. The hotel is also equipped with FREE wi-fi which is AMAZING since many of us now cannot live without being connected. Not to mention, the connection speed was faster than expected and getting online was 100x easier than most hotels I have stayed at. RESORT The resort has a great kids pool for toddlers to age 5 with a large pirate ship to crawl all over. Its nicely tucked in a spot for families. There is two other great pools that are located elsewhere on the resort so you can take your pick on which you like most but they are equally nice. I went during down season when all the children are back at school so the pool area was rarely busy and chaises were easy to find. Staff have told me that it can get a little wild during Christmas and summer so beware if you are looking for that perfect romantic, quiet getaway during peak times. The overall appearance of the resort is quite spectacular compared to its neighbours. Really, it is. The lawns are trimmed to perfection, the lobby is beautiful, the hallways can probably use a good buff from all the snorkel gear being dragged around but overall, its well kept. SERVICE I love towel service. Especially since we are almost on the beach and there are plenty of pools, fresh towels were a great luxury. It was noted that housekeeping would arrive anytime before 5pm which seemed late but as it was clearly noted in the hotel directory and elsewhere, so we just accepted the fact. I believe you may request a time for a housekeeper to come in but I'm unsure if there are any additional charges or if this is frowned upon. Each clean was very thorough. Now, here probably comes the worst part of the trip which isn't that bad but suppose is worth mentioning. As I do not hold a deed to this hotel (this resort is part timeshare), I felt that the level of service at concierge was not as genuinely open to visitors of the resort. Not only this, but I asked for several directions on multiple occasions for certain activities held on the resort and was given wrong directions each time to where the activities were held and at times, they were even unsure when and where these places were. Keep in mind, these activities are held at the resort itself. This was incredibly frustrating to have to walk back and forth to different concierge desks located throughout the hotel to get proper directions. LOCATION Located on Kaanapli Beach, it is definitely one of the most luxe beaches you can find on the island in my opinion. There is a great Beach Walk on the resort that is open to the public and if you are willing to go the distance (I would recommend you drive though since the heat can get to you but I have seen people walk it), you can check out Whaler's Village for some shopping and eating, and other hotels to find out that you are definitely at one of the best. Stopping by at the Westin south, the night time vibe was more lively but during the daytime, the pool area is swamped. North of this hotel, you can drive to Kapula Beach for a snorkel or Honokeana if you are more interested in seeing sea turtles as there is an abundance located at this beach. Black Rock which is located at the Sheraton hotel is also fantastic for snorkeling. These beaches are close in proximity to each other and are only about a 5 minute drive away. There are also many others along the coast but these are ones worth mentioning. The town of Lahaina is about 7 minutes away and easy to get to. After visiting most of the area of Maui, the location of this hotel/resort is prime for snorkeling and dining. You also get a great view of the sunset on the beach. There is not much on the east side. FOOD There really isn't that much selection in terms of food at this hotel. I wouldn't highly recommended eating too much here as its really nothing to write home about. If you are a foodie, check out restaurants in the town of Lahaina or venture elsewhere along the beach walk. The drinks poolside can add up to cost an arm and a leg and bringing your own liquor is prohibited but happy hour runs from 4-6 so feel guilt free to fill up then. ACTIVITIES This hotel/resort offers many family friendly activities throughout the week such as hula lessons, ukelele lesson, water fit, etc (some are complimentary only). Its a nice break from going out to the beach all day but as mentioned, get the right directions of where they are held or you may lose your chance to participate. If you're into golfing, this location is prime for some spectacular greens I have ever seen in my life. The lawns were so green that it made the colour of fresh celery look pathetic. This place is pretty quiet at night compared to its neighbouring hotels which held luaus or live entertainment which was disappointing but we found that we were pretty burnt out by the end of the night anyway. If you want entertainment, it is not hard to find down the beach walk in the evening. To sum up, I really loved my stay here and would recommend it to anyone hands down if they are here during low season. Apparently it can be pretty crazy busy here with families, but you can really say that about any hotel. For the cost of what you get, and the amenities that are available in your room as well as service, I would highly suggest you select this hotel compared to its competitors. It is definitely family friendly, has an excellent beach, and is in the perfect location to everything you want and need from Maui. TIP* Do yourself a favour and rent a car when you visit this island. Public transportation is dreadful here as I only saw about 3 buses on my entire trip and taxis are rarely seen. With this in mind, don't forget your GPS, you will need it.

Reviews.Title: “Another breath of fresh air in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Opengtune
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Westin Villas this year for the first time. In our previous trip to Maui we had not seen the villas so we were a little concerned as to its location and general being of the resort. The resort was fabulous to say the least. We had a great room albeit the first floor somewhat restricting our ocean view. We did have a private porch for breakfast and drinks later in the day. We were poolside but the noise was never an issue. The staff provided a shuttle each day to town or to the other adjacent resorts. The shuttle was timely and saved the hassle of trying to park our rental car. The room was clean, new and although we had a studio size room it provided more than ample space for our needs. After all you are in Maui so go outside as much as possible. We hope to return to the resort again. we also hope to bring family to take advantage of the many swimming pools and beautiful sunsets. They do have an Italian restaurant on site where dined one our last night. This experience worked fine for us, although a little pricey. However, it it not priced appropriately or has the right menu selections for children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! But lacks service!”
Reviews.Author: CLEC
Reviews.Content: My hushand and I stayed at WKORV from September 4-12. We booked the first night using Starpoints and the remaining nights with Staroptions as we are WLM owners. We had called a number of times in advance of our stay requesting the two reservations be mergerd so that we would not have to change rooms. We were told no problem. However, when we arrived the check-in person told us she had no record of that request! and that we would have to change rooms! Ok so an error was made. My husband then went to the front desk to check-out of our current room at 0900 the next morning and was told that out new room as ready. Great expect that this person asked us why we didn't just go there yesterday. It was free!!! We were very disappointed with that. Also since it was our wedding anniversary my in-laws had called ahead and left a note for us indicating that they had purchased a gift certificate for us for dinner at one the restaurants near by. No one ever told us about it! Finally my father in law called us and asked us if we got it and then we went looking for it. It was sitting in the back office! Good use that would have been. The resort is very beautiful and the pools and beach are great. Some of the best snorkelling around is right outside the resort. There are great BBQ's to use on the grounds as well. However, we went to use them one night and they were not working. So we called "o" as indicated on the sign near the BBQ's and asked to have someone come look. We had to call back 3 times and finally after 45 minutes my husband went and found a maintenance person to do it. He said it was already done and cleared in the system. No one had coem and checked with us at teh BBQ's that they were working. The maintenance person just had to turn the gas on and they were working in 2 min!!! So I agree with the general view of WKORV that I have seen on this sight....beautiful location and resort but service is lacking BIG time!!!! Regards, Cindy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: fwdtraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. This was the largest hotel we stayed at on our two week vacation in Hawaii. We stayed in a studio which was really nice. We enjoyed having a kitchen for our drinks and snacks and used the washer and dryer every day. We loved the beach outside our hotel. We spent time under the shade trees and went snorkeling. We tried to swim in the adult pool but it was way to cold! No one was swimming in it. Anyone who came to the pool put their foot in and decided against getting in. My only complaint would be that for our 30th wedding anniversary trip our balcony overlooked the kiddie pool. Not very quiet or romantic but we booked using our SPG points so I was grateful to have a balcony which I used everyday. We were given champagne and chocolates upon arrival which was really a nice touch and made us feel special. We totally enjoyed our time at this resort and Maui and would definately return to the Westin Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach!”
Reviews.Author: momto3kids
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas North. We had a very nice stay. The best thing about this location was the wonderful beach right outside your door! The water was clear, clean and calm. Now i understand people go to Maui to surf - obviously this isn't the place for that. But if you want to just swim around and relax, it was perfect. The snorkeling was also very good here. It was nice to be able to snorkel right there and not have to go anywhere. The sand was very soft and clean. We never bothered renting chairs (with three kids, we don't really sit down much). We just sat on towels. I noticed that not many people used the chairs and I do have to say, for a resort, they were the sorriest looking beach chairs I have seen at a high end resort! They were reminiscent of the 1970s metal lounge chairs. They were rusted and everything! I can't believe you had to pay to use them. The pools were nice but we pretty much steered clear. Figured we were there for the beaches. Though my kids love pools, we tried to keep them out as much as possible. Almost every trip we take, someone comes down with swimmer's ear or an ear infection from the hotel pools! The pools at the Villas North was very quiet and relaxing though. Very nice layout with waterfalls. We did venture over to the other side (I guess it is South?) for the water slide a few times. It was much more crowded and crazy over there. Couldn't even get a chair (didn't have this problem at the pools in the North Villas). The kids seemed to enjoy the slide (ages 11, 9 and 7) though they have been on some of the biggest water slides around (think Atlantis), so I"m not sure what they found so appealing about this slide - maybe just because there were lots of kids around. That being said, the pool was closed a couple of times for "accidents". I saw way too many babies in diapers and swim diapers around. They really need to keep babies out of these pools. It is disgusting. Service was pretty good. Didn't really come in to much contact with personnel as we were on the beach all day or sightseeing, so really spent minimal time inside. We ate lunch a couple of times at the pool restaurant (can't think of the name). The service was good but as usual with resort food, it was pricey and marginal. Not much of a selection for a vegetarian (though I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised about how vegetarian/vegan friendly Maui was! Even the remotest roadside stands on the Road to Hana touted vegetarian food. It was much more progressive as far as vegetarianism than any other area I have traveled to in the US and Mexico and beats NJ by a mile!). We did have a few minor issues with house keeping. They come in once during the week to refresh towels/linens, etc. They did not replace the soap. We called down twice to get more and when they finally came, they brought shampoo and conditioner and no soap! ???? We also had a very unpleasant experience with a worker in the towel hut at the pool on the South side. The day the pool was closed down for the "accident", we were getting towels. I noticed the pool was all roped off with a police line (no kidding!). I asked what happened and some smart a$$ in the pool hut said "She pooped in the pool" and pointed at my 9 year old daughter! ?? What the heck? Obviously he thought he was being funny but it was disgraceful behavior. We were absolutely shocked. My daughter was devastated and mortified. What a complete loser! I have never encountered something like this and from an adult (I would expect this from my 7 year old but not a resort worker!). The location was good. Very close to Lahaina which is where we ate most nights. I highly recommend Mala for dinner! Great service and wonderful food. Hula in Whaler's Village was good. I also hear there are quite a few restaurants in Kapalua in the hotels but we didn't get a chance to go that way. I recommend trying the beach at Napili Beach (about a 10 minute drive). It was beautiful. Also very calm and clear and they had some awesome tidal pools in the lava rocks that the kids loved investigating in! We would certainly return to this property and are already thinking about next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort ! Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: gadheri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for 3 nights. Wish we'd stayed longer. Had minor issue at check in with the room given to us not the one we had requested or to our liking. As the hotel was almost fully booked it took a while to get a room in the category we had booked that was not occupied. However at the end Sonia Steverson (office manager) was able to find one that we were very happy with and at a lower rate. In addition for our troubles she gave us voucher for breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Thank you Sonia you were wonderful. We were in a studio in the north side villas. Very spacious and clean with a king bed, a sofa bed and a balcony. Kitchen was very nice. Bathroom was amazing with a tub and separate shower. Usually i'm hesistant to book rooms with kitchens as they can be quite dirty and smell, however this one was very clean and well kept. Resort is nicely spread out and never seemed overly crowded. Had breakfast at the Ocean pool bar one morning. It was alright, no omelette station. I would think most guests probably make their own breakfast as all rooms are equipped with kitchen. Overall had a great time and would definitely come back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Staff and Location !”
Reviews.Author: Rens1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our week stay (Aug 21-28, 2010) at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas and we loved this place !! The staff here is very professional and courteous. Right from the start, Miguel, the bellhop, made us feel at home and gave us tips on where to eat and what to see. A welcoming face after a long plane ride !! The resort is extremely clean and is managed very well. It is situated right on the beach and the snorkeling is great. We rented our snorkel gear for the week ( Captain Bob's Snorkel Gear $30 a person for the week ) and snorkeled everyday right from the beach. It was really conveinent to go snorkeling at the beach and then take a two minute walk back to the pool to go swimming.The pools are awesome and we never had a problem finding chairs. There were staff members that would walk around the pool area during the day and make sure that people weren't saving chairs. It didn't seem to be a problem, as in other resort areas where we have stayed (Marriott Surf Club in Aruba is the worst for overcrowding). Our conceirge, Barb, was great. She helped us book a Helicopter ride over Maui (by Air Maui). It was incredible! She also booked us on a sailboat excursion on the America II, which was a 60ft racing sailboat used in the America's Cup Race. Another excursion well worth the money !!! The resort is close to Lahaina and Whalers Village and has a free shuttle to both locations. Some of the restaurants which we visited and would recommend are Kimo's in Lahaina and The Hula Grill and Lelani's in Whalers Village. All in all, we were extremely impressed with the resort, staff and location and would love to go back to the Westin Ka'anapali in the future !!!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but pretty great!”
Reviews.Author: mrssimonsays
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this property and we would definitely consider going again. About 2 years ago we went in October and had a pretty different experience. We booked an Ocean View Deluxe One Bedroom and were very happy with our room. This time, probably because it was summer break, we played room roulette upon check in, which consumed the tiny afternoon window we had to enjoy the pool or beach after check in (4 p.m.). The first room had a real issue for us as well as some beat up looking furniture, the second was a handicap room--nothing wrong with it but we wanted a different bathroom set up--the third had an ocean AND a parking lot view. The fourth was fine but downwind from the restaurant which made it smell like cheeseburgers. We finally settled into the 4th room. (As an aside, we had a similar problem when staying at the Westin Villas in Palm Springs, CA. There they actually tried to check us into an already occupied room!) It was in building 3 with a view of the main pool and restaurant scene and a nice bit of ocean. We came to appreciate the view as my husband liked to jump up and see how crowded the pool was getting each morning. We were in the south towers which are older but also supposedly have bigger rooms. We never got to check out the north towers so I can't really comment. This is what a bell hop told us. I read here that they probably save their better rooms (ie closer to the ocean so better ocean view) for owners and I guess that only makes sense. Once we were settled, we really enjoyed everything this property had to offer. I guess except the restaurants. We got a few things from the general store but chose to eat more in the room (we picked up groceries on the way in) or at other restaurants. One of the reasons we choose this type of property is that we have small children and appreciate the having a fully stocked kitchen and washer and dryer at our disposal. We were able to pack light and save a little money. The general store has some basic food supplies, and some nice treats. Try the shrimp skewers. We broiled them in the oven and they were very tasty. The beach and pools at the Westin Villas are wonderful. We tried to visit both each day. My sons loved the pirate ship pool as well as the big pool. My older son loved the big water slide. The pools seemed more popular than the beach so we got to enjoy a very calm, peaceful beach scene. There were always plenty of chaises available at the pool but the morning seems to be the prime time and we did notice people reserving chairs with towels. The staff does come by and tag these chairs with a time left unattended tag so that you can have someone's stuff booted if they haven't shown up after an hour. The concierge service was a bit spotty. The first time we used them, the restaurant they reserved for us had no record of the reservation. The second time we used them, we got what we wanted but when we went downstairs to get our tickets printed, the concierge helping us seemed really scattered and rude. During this time of year, I would say that this is a better choice for families than for young couples or young singles. Maybe it's just my perspective but the group of drunken 20 somethings teetering down the hall seemed a tad out of place. Overall, we really do like the Westin Villas and would recommend it. There are some issues for renters but we were satisfied with the way ours were handled.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyn
Reviews.Content: I had 7 nights stay at the westin villas. It's very beautiful. Swimming pools for adults and pirate pool for kids. the lay out of this hotel is beautiful. koi pond is gorgeous. It's beautiful inside out. This is a huge resort. If you have family member stay at the 2 different tower, good luck with the walking. Kids are tired of walking from building 4, 3 to 6. There is north and south tower. My parents stay at building 4 south tower. My sister at building 6 north tower. I'm at building 3 south tower. The walking is long. Last 2 nights they have room available, we paid $25 cleaning fee charged to change room. Other than that it was a memorable stay. definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - really liked the room”
Reviews.Author: NoVAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in mid August. Check-in started a little rough. We arrived around 3:15 p.m. even though check-in is 4:00 and were told our room would be ready in 20-30 min. as it wsa going through a final inspection. We decided to explore the property and come back at 4:00. When we showed back up to check in at 4:00 the desk staff said the room was still not ready. A little annoyed we decided to wait in the lobby. After a few minutes one of the desk staff came over to explain the room inspection failed for a couple broken items that needed to be repaired. We appreciated the explaination and after another 10 min. our room was ready. When we got our room we found a very nice two room suite with a king bed, full kitchen, washer/dryer, large balcony, and a very large bathroom. We had requested two roll-away beds as the kids don't like sleeper sofas. The roll-aways, it turns out, are very comfortable, but at this Westin you'll pay $5/night/roll-away. This Westin is very large with separate North and South properties with separate mini-stores, restaurants, and pools, and a childrens pool too. Even though they were separate you still could use the services of either property. Since we were in the North building we used the North pool which did not seem to be crowded. The beach seemed nice but not very wide and we thought it was better suited for snorkeling rather than swimming (though there did not seem to be issues with people who just wanted to swim). We did snorkel right off the beach and saw lots of fish and the green sea turtles. The water was also very calm which made for good snorkeling. They also had a couple nice vendors in the hotel lobby during the weekend. One was a jewelry vendor who sold some very nice bracelets and necklaces at reasonable prices. The biggest inconvenience was the hotel design - basically a "U" shape. For example, since the property was so large the parking was on the other side of the complex of the North side. The hotel design made such that you have to walk from the outer parts to the bottom of the "U" and they out again to get to the parking, which also had very small spaces. The elevators also seemed only to be in the bottom of the "U" so if you are on the top you have to walk to the bottom to take the elevators down, the back to the top to go to the pool or the beach. Overall this was just a minor inconvenience that did not detract from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation, Perfect Property”
Reviews.Author: leahshabir
