Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel/resort. First class for sure. Great - Staff. Every staff member was always smiling and willing to offer their assistance with anything. Keith V. at the front desk was very accomodating at check-in and even remembered our names as we passed through a few days later. The grounds, pool, lobby, store, drinks, beach and rooms are perfect! Our daughter enjoyed the waterslide (and so did we). Negatives - the phones. No matter who you were calling (spa, kids club, etc) there were very long wait times - up to 10 minutes at times. Pool drink service. It was not too often that we were asked if we'd like a cocktail from the bar. We are used to resorts that have many poolside waiters to assist. They do harp you about attending a timeshare presentation. We did, it lasted two hours, we were not interested and they still gave us a $125 resort credit. We are going back next summer and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “awful experience, especially re: service - would not return”
Reviews.Author: slingomez
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 children ages 2 and 7) recently stayed in a 2 bedroom lock-off unit with another family (3 children, ages 8 and under). We had carefully done our research and planning, and had been looking forward to our long-awaited trip. Unfortunately, our overall experience at this resort was so surprisingly uneven that we would not hesitate to say that we would absolutely not return again, nor recommend this resort to others. Aspects of the resort met our expectations - location, pools, beach and beach access, rooms themselves, grounds. However, our experience was marred by the following issues, mostly dealing with service. First, we had placed a request for rooms in building 7. Upon arrival, we were told that our request had not been seen, and, not only that, the rooms that we were assigned to were in the worst possible location - in the older buildings, on the second floor, overlooking the resort entrance and parking lot. We were told that this was peak season and the resort was to full capacity and that there were no other rooms available. For the next 3 days, we kept checking back to see if there were cancellations, but had no luck. We didn't expect an ocean view room, as that's not what we had paid for, but in terms of non-ocean view rooms, we seemed to have received the worst possible end of the stick. Moreover, the staff that we dealt with, with possibly one exception, were generally unapologetic and condescending, and unsympathetic to our situation. Second, housekeeping service was uneven, at best. Most days, the housekeeping staff neglected to replace something. Several times, we had to call to ask for additional coffee, shampoo, etc. At least twice, one of our beds were not fully made. Third, upon our departure, our bill reflected telephone charges showing 25+ calls to the same local number, each made within a fraction of a second of each other. Each call was billed $1. We pointed out to the front desk that this was technically impossible , but they maintained that their system is incapable of making a mistake in its logging of calls, and even suggested that perhaps one of our children was playing with the phone! In the end, they agreed to erase half of the charges, but we were still left with a $14 bill for a local call lasting less than a minute. While we are on the topic of phone charges, it would have been nice if the $1 charge for local calls were disclosed somewhere more visible, like on the telephone itself, rather than buried inside in the resort handbook. A fourth issue, though less of a concern than the prior three, is that it is nearly impossible to get any poolside bar or food service. There are virtually no servers available. In the many hours that we spent at the pools, we saw only one server the entire time. Collectively, these disappointing experiences made our trip less ideal than it should have been. We had high hopes in the resort, and really wanted to enjoy it for all its wonderful positives, but with this experience, we really cannot recommend this hotel to others and most definitely would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Happy 25th Annivesary”
Reviews.Author: karenvee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort and Villas (North) to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We arrived after being on Waikiki to a tranquil and relaxing oasis. After reading reviews here, I asked our travel agent to request a villa in the north property. Upon checking in I was pleased to find out that our request had been honoured. While we were a distance away from the ocean we still had a direct view from our lanai of the ocean (7181). The studio accomodations for 2 were fantastic. The Heavenly bed was truly "heavenly"!!! It was fantastic to have the kitchen in order to cook our meals each evening and save some $$. The grills are a fantastic addition to the the complex. I had never snorkelled before and I was thrilled to start my snorkelling here . . it truly was spectacular just footsteps aways from our accomodations. The only thing I found frustration was the fact that people came out from their villas early in the morning (before 7:00 a.m.) to put their towels on loungers in order to reserve them and then not showing up until 10:00 am. or later. The "rules" state that this is not tolerated however the rules are not enforced terribly well. The staff at this resort are very accomodating and are available for questions or to make reservations for you. Despite the fact that this resort is a time share it definately has a "hotel aura" to it.

Reviews.Title: “Came with a toddler on a preview package”
Reviews.Author: mamahannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in August with our 18 month-old son. I would not hesitate to stay here every time we come to Maui. Great property, great location, lovely people. First, this is a Starwood Vacation Ownership property, so most of the people there are timeshare owners but anyone can rent a villa. Owners get priority in room assignment so the odds of an upgrade are slim. We came on a preview package. A letter arrived in the mail, I think because we are AMEX cardholders. We got a studio villa for 5 nights plus $165 toward a rental car for $749 ($100 less than what the letter said because we booked immediately). This was an awesome deal for this type of resort. When you arrive the concierge gives you a box of chocolates and a $75 resort credit for free. If you agree to go to a timeshare presentation they give you an extra $100 resort credit and a coupon for 50% off a future stay at any non-Hawaii Starwood hotel. It's easy to say no, but we agreed out of curiosity. The presentation was one-on-one with a very professional salesman and took less than 90 minutes. He was definitely a good salesman and it was easy to be tempted but it was also easy to say no. When you decline a second person comes in and offers you another preview stay for $2600 (not such a good deal). There was nothing shady at all about going on a preview package. I would highly recommend it if you have the option. We stayed in building 2, which was far back from the beach but still had a nice view. The only "bad" building is 4, which really does overlook the parking lot. We stayed on the original (south) side of the resort, but there is a newer (north) side as well. They have two separate lobbies but function as one large resort. The only downside (and it's a big one) is that the studio villas on the south side do not have a true lanai, just a little step out balcony. Otherwise, the studio we stayed in was very nice and plenty big for the two of us and our son's crib. I found the pools to be more tranquil and less busy on the north side. We were excited to try the pirate ship pool, which is between the north and south sides. There is a sign saying that you must be under a certain height to play there but it was not enforced. There were too many rowdy big kids there for my son to be comfortable, but it was better at certain times of the day. The beach is nice and clean, but fairly steep. Not great for a little one but not awful either. There were plenty of people there in the afternoons but not nearly as crowded as Kaanapali Beach proper. After seeing how congested the Whaler's Village area was I was very glad we stayed up the beach a little bit. The breakfast buffet was fine, although they Hyatt has a much more impressive buffet for only a few dollars more. Lunch and dinner at the Ocean Pool Bar & Grill were both fine but not memorable. We got takeout from the Italian restaurant a couple of times that was good, but would have been great if we had dined in. About a 10 minute walk north up the boardwalk is Duke's. We sat outside, where we had a limited bar menu but a lovely view and live music. A good place to try something different without having to go too far. We would also recommend Cool Cat Cafe (really wonderful burgers on Front Street in Lahaina Town) and Penne Pasta (thin crust pizza and pasta on Dickenson in Lahaina Town). CJ's Deli (in a strip mall just south on 30) was okay for breakfast. We had a nice dinner at Cane & Taro (in Whaler's Village) and they were very accommodating with the kiddo (stored the stroller for us, got us in and out very quickly). Our son cut his finger on a trash can at the airport, so our first stop was the emergency room at Maui Memorial Medical Center. They were wonderful. We were in and out in about 2 hours and they took great care of us. We went to Minit Medical in Lahaina for a suture check a couple of days later and I was not happy with their bedside manner or medical advice, at least for a pediatric patient. Other activities we enjoyed included the Maui Ocean Center, Iao Valley (stop at Maui Bake Shop on the way for a cookie), and the Surfing Goat Dairy (yummy and fun for kids, but don't believe them when they say the frozen cheese will last the flight home in checked baggage!). We also found several playgrounds, as our son has a serious need to climb. There's a rec center nearby on Shaw & HWY 30 in Lahaina with a park attached. Kahana Beach Park in Kihei has a nice big playground. And the 4th Marine Division Memorial Park in Haiku has an awesome play structure. There were tons of locals there when we went on Sunday afternoon. One more thing... The valets were great. You can self park in the same lot the valets use but they only charged us $2 a day for valet. We occasionally had to wait at busy times, but they were always very friendly and helpful. I have read in other reviews that this hotel is missing the aloha spirit, but I disagree. I think it's maybe a Westin thing, that their hotels have a more understated style. Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful, and seemed truly concerned that we enjoy our stay. I'm sure we will return someday, either on our own or in 5-10 years when our son is a more appropriate age for such an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: teaniw
Reviews.Content: We are a family here on Maui and decided to spend the weekend at the hotel for our daughters birthday. It was so nice, relaxing and comfortable with excellant service. This is a great place for a family getaway, or even a romantic weekend. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Maui, or even if your living here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Rooms, overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: LuminousMom
Reviews.Content: We loved our room, we had a full on ocean view, we're on the 8th floor so we had a great perspective, and loved the location (nice beach, nice shops) but the pool area, while beautiful, is not big enough. We waited around for 3 hours trying to get a chair and we couldnt. The staff does their best, but with so few chairs and so MANY guests, getting one is practically impossible. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly (especially the hospitality staff, towels and such), and overall we had a good time. Just... add more chairs please!

Reviews.Title: “Overly pretencious mediocrety”
Reviews.Author: DaShramp
Reviews.Content: Over priced, over sold, under delivered on everything but the location. The Beach is very nice, the grounds are well kept. The staff couldn't care less, but smiles and kowtows while doing so. I was very disappointed in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the standards of a Westin hotel”
Reviews.Author: pochacho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon, and having stayed in Starwood hotels around the world, we expected the same level of service/experience. Were we ever wrong. It all started when we arrive at around 2:00 pm and were informed by front desk that our room would not be ready until 4:00pm. We decided to come back around that time, and they told us our room still was not ready; meanwhile, there was another party checking in and they got a room right away. When we complained, the front desk girl (Moana) told us that she could get us another room which was even better than the room we were supposed to get, and we could check in right away. We took the room without thinking any more of it. Upon arriving in the room, we realized that it was a handicapped room, which meant there there was no tub in the washroom, and lower bars in the closets. We called back down to request a standard room. They then switched us to another room on the same floor; as soon as we walked in, we were greeted with a strong smell of detergent/smoke, we felt nauseous. We called down to complain again, and then they switched us to a 3rd room. There was a blood stain in the washroom (which we asked housekeeping twice to clean but they never did); however, at this point, it was now past dinnertime, we were so tired, we settled into the 3rd room. When we took a shower, we realized the rubber grip on the door was missing, and as a result, water leaked all over the unit. What a horrible experience. Housekeeping had to come in to clean. The worst part was, the hotel didn't even seem to care and when we complained, all that was offered was to waive our parking fees. In addition, all other hotels we stayed at during our honeymoon, was more than happy to upgrade us, and offer us a bottle of champagne. The Westin offered absolutely nothing. It seems that they did not care it was our honeymoon, and left us with a very sour taste of the hotel. It is really a shame as being a Starwood Preferred Guest, we have always thought very highly of the Westin brand. This hotel ABSOLUTELY DOES NOT LIVE UP TO THE STANDARDS OF A WESTIN HOTEL. We have no intent in returning to this hotel, and will certainly not recommend it to any of our family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly an intimate resort”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: With over 1000 rooms and eventual plans to expand, this is neither an intimate nor quiet resort. Realistically, this destination is best for those with kids and a desire to cook for themselves. The property is attractive, and the few rooms with a full ocean are treated to gorgeous sunsets over Molokai. Among us, we tried 4 rooms at the hotel, and all amenities were pretty well up to Westin standards. Views varied from dreadful (4am delivery trucks under the window) to divine. The studio had a tiny kitchen, but the larger room types were better laid-out and more relaxing. On-property dinner options are severely limited unless you want to grill or cook for yourself. The Italian restaurant is only open 4 nights a week, and we were told at the second restaurant you have to go into town for reliable food or drinks after 9pm. They have a shuttle which will take you to the grocery store and into town. The cab fare back is $20+. Self-parking is $7 per night, and although wireless internet is included in the mandatory daily resort fee, it was spotty and glacial. Washer/dryer combos are in the rooms. The beach is long but not very deep, and the currents were extremely mild (at least while we were there). Great for kids. Bring a mask and snorkel to see some half-decent fish right off the beach. You can rent them in town for a fraction of the price at the hotel. We did not even need the fins, the current was so gentle. There are several pools with varied entertainments. To use the beach chairs, guests have to fork over "rent." Not all the staff were up to Westin standards; housekeeping was friendly and thoughtful as was the restaurant staff; front desk staff were overworked, harried and too few (check-out at 10am???); the shuttle driver was genuinely rude ("Most of you aren't going to fit on the last shuttle back, so you're out of luck"--maybe a bigger or second shuttle would come in handy?).

Reviews.Title: “felt like a circus that was out of control.”
Reviews.Author: familyfun1435
Reviews.Content: we saved up to bring our family to a destination of a lifetime or at least thats what we thought when we booked this resort but to our disappointment this was everything but a wonderful experience. We have friends that are owners and told us about this resort was kid friendly but it felt more like a glass museum. We tried to participate in the kids activities and their child care facilities but it seemed so crowded in a small room. The activities were never easy to find and when we did find them in the lobby or on the lawn the staff did not look pleasant or happy. One of the employees even told us its just us for now and we have 20 kids way too many for two workers which scared me to leave my two children. I took the advice from the concierge and took my kids to the maui ocean center kids program. They had a blast doing ocean activities and arts and crafts we signed them up for 2 days. It was a journey but well worth it to see my kids happy. the resort offered nothing that we felt would meet or exceed our expectation as far as family fun or activities. If there is anything I would suggest it would be to recreate a more family friendly environment even by the pool it was a little uncomfortable too many kids climbing on each other and when we asked the pool attendant to do something before someone gets hurt he said I have to wait for a manager from the other side it took too long. We hope in the future these issues be addressed when I tried to contact the Manager (Mana) not sure if I spelled it correctly she never returned our call and we even asked for her at the kids care room and they sorry she's off try again on Monday. No opportunity to remedy or here our concerns which caused me to share through trip advisor. If anyone is planning on heading to Maui for a vacation think twice before booking here please check the Wailea side the Grand Wailea is where we will be going next year.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel I've ever stayed at in my LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: Gemelle
Reviews.Content: A fabulous resort with super friendly staff. I had a great view from our room and we had a standard studio, but we still ended up with ocean view! The kitchen and washer/dryer are so useful too. I've never been to such a nice and happy resort. Everyone from housekeeping to bell hop to check-in staff are super nice. Normally I'm used to grumpy housekeeping that are always mad when we tell them to come back. BUT NOT HERE!! At the Westin Villas they are super nice and even told us to "Take our time!!" Whenever we called housekeeping they would come by within 10 minutes. One time my daughter spilled water on the bedsheets and we had to get it changed and no one came in 30 minutes. I called housekeeping again and they were super apologetic and had someone knocking on our door in 2 minutes! I also like the fact that NO ONE left their trash outside their door. I always stay at 4 to 5 star hotels (yes I like to be pampered while on vacation) and it's always annoyed me that people leave their room trash outside their rooms. It simply looks tacky. BUT NO ONE did that here at the Westin Villas because housekeeping is just a phone call away. Every staff member made us feel right at home. Even when I took my daughter's floatie to the pool and was blowing it up myself ... the pool staff there stopped me and offered me to use their air pump for free! OMG! What awesome service! I'm used to pool staff that's indifferent and could care less BUT NOT HERE! Every staff member is so happy and helpful and that's EVERY SINGLE DAY during our 8 day/7 night stay. I think there's a bit of pride to be working at the Westin Villas. I also liked their self-parking option because it makes getting stuff in and out so much easier. We could have easily have asked Tosh, our assigned personal room manager to help us with getting things in and out of our car. But our hotel room was right next to the self-parking area that it was faster for us to just walk to our hotel room. When we first arrived, not only did Tosh help us get everything out of our car but he also gave us tips and tricks to do while he was getting our lugguage to our room. He also gave us advice on where to park our car for easy loading and unloading. Plus he mentioned that if we needed help with anything from ideas to good dining, to good hang-out spots, how to work the air conditioning unit, ANYTHING he was there to help us. Why can't all hotels have this? And most importantly all service is with a smile here, EVERYDAY! By the way, their beach is fabulous too!! I saw lots of fish! And the swimming pools were also terrific for both adults and toddlers! My 20 month old fell in love with their pirate ship pool! We stayed for one week at the end of July 2010 and we will definitely be coming back to this awesome resort. ---------- We decided to swing by the other Westin ... the Resort and Spa one and I can't say the same thing about them. We wanted to park there thinking the 2 Westins were interchangeable. But the bell hop/valet guy reluctantly came over to our car and told us we can't park there. I then asked him how the beach was and he told me that they had NO BEACH access. WTF? The Westin Resort & Spa is right on the beach and they had no beach access? That was a BLATANT LIE! He just didn't want us to park there. Anyhow I will definitely stay at the WESTIN VILLAS ONLY because they have a great beach and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: travel4ippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali North location for 8 days and thought the facility and location was great. Fly into Kapalua-JHM airport in West Maui. It is only about 15 min. from Kaanapali and a nice, small airport. We rented a car and ventured to Costco first to get some supplies to make our own breakfast and lunches. Loved heading to Lahaina town and other spots for dinner. We also booked a couple of boat excursions for snorkeling and wildlife watching. Our kids took surfing lessons and went snorkeling or skim boarding everyday. The wildlife experience just from the beach or neighboring BlackRock was incredible - amazing fish and sea turtles!! The rooms were clean, roomy and you got to love those Heavenly Beds! The resort is great for families who just want to lay back and have a relaxing place to hang out for the day and places to grill for dinner at night. There are also 2 general stores with a good selection of prepared food for grilling as well. We liked having the kitchen and it was well equipped. I would suggest bringing your own spices if you plan to cook and detergent for the washing machine. We liked the more secluded beach at the Westin location. We had a lovely time and it was truly paradise. We are already planning when to return.

Reviews.Title: “Westin offers many activities”
Reviews.Author: joanieg1
Reviews.Content: If you like variety, Westin Ocean Resort Villas offers a lot for adults and kids. Their Wellness Center offered Yoga/Tai Chi, Stretches, and Aquatic fitness Monday through Friday. I opted to take a 'special offer' which included all the classes all week for $70. Well worth it. Excellent instructors and fun group of men and women all ages in attendance. This property is immaculately maintained. BBQ grills, spa, grounds, and rooms all A++. There aren't a lot of evening activities, but after a full day, I'm usually tuckered out. Their beach has good swimming and snorkeling. The only improvement might be their food offerings. I was not that impressed. However since the villas have equiped kitchens, one has a choice. I usually went to local restaurants for dinner or lunch. Check in was quick and efficient. I arrived about 10:30 pm. When I arrived at the registration entrance, the valet checked on his walkie talkie to confirm that I was a registered guest. Security is good. They may check ask for 'identification' as only Westin residents/guests are permitted to use the pool (the same is true at Westin Resort and the Sheraton). Underground parking was great and plenty of it. Shuttles to other Starwood properties and nearby Malls is a plus, even though I had a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui but the Westin not so much”
Reviews.Author: pattycake57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for the first time, July 10-16, we had a little trouble finding the resort as our GPS was not functioning but I called the hotel and they gave us the directions. Upon arriving I inquired about the location of our room, right before we left I had injured my back and was having difficulty walking and was using a cane. I was hoping for something central to the pool and beach, we had been given south building 4, a room looking at the front driveway and no balcony, I asked if any upgrades were available, I was offered an ocean view studio for $75 more a night or a 1 bedroom suite looking at the same driveway for $150 a night in the same building. I ended up taking the studio upgrade, we were on the second floor and if you looked over the trees you could somewhat see the ocean view. Room was fine, it was nice to have the kitchen area and washer and dryer. We bought breakfast things and some lunch stuff, beer and wine coolers. The resort has activities, for a fee. We are used to staying at all-inclusives, could not believe they charge $15 for water aerobics, or $27 for yoga. We bought chairs at WalMart and sat on the beach in the park next to the resort, that way we could bring our own drinks and food. Also in the evening there was nothing, no music, or entertainment. I think one night they had a movie outside. The shuttle to Whalers Village was nice, we would take that and go to Hula Grill or the Sheraton for happy hour and pupus's, listen to the music and go back, to nothing, so we went to our room, sometimes at 8:00. I would return to Maui but I would not stay here, probably a hotel near Whalers Village or just rent a regular condo.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kimlovelife
Reviews.Content: I already miss maui. I had a great time with the family. The one bedroom was perfect for my husband and I have to a room to ourselves. Our room was by the spa which smelled wonderful evertime I went to and from the room. Of coarse had a great massage and a pedicure. Had the breakfest buffet almost every morning. One day travelled over to the buffet at the Westin Spa and resort which was a bigger buffet. We brought our own snorkel gear and went snorkeling everyday. My toddler loved the small toddler pool the pirate ship was a little to scarry for her to go down the water slide. On our way to the hotel after we rented a car at Almo we went shopping at Costco. I radomly picked up some pineapple wine. It was so good, I wanted to bring some back. Also, picked up some beef tenderloin, which we bbq at the Villas. tip: went on Hawaiian Airlines website and rented from Alamo we got a premium suv for $300.00 for the week. We wanted a 4 door jeep but they said it would be an extra hundred dollars a day. Yuk! Thet didnt have our suv clean so they gave a 4 door jeep for that price. My husband was happy:> They dont rent jeeps on the website only it you get there you can ask to get up graded. The stay at the Villas was one of the most beautiful and well accommodating. Beds are wonderful and the jacuzzi tub is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely would NOT return to this resort”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_AZMkim
Reviews.Content: Rooms are VERY dated - stained carpets, broken screen doors, broken hairdryers, faulty AC units, rotting baseboard (in 1 of the 3 rooms we stayed in) Ocean view room - 2 out of the 3 rooms we were in had barely visible ocean views and we paid extra for the view Lots of extra costs - we spent an extra $600 on pool and beach chairs because there were not enough to accomodate the guests and unless you paid you couldn't get two chairs near each other Housekeeping - we NEVER had our room cleaned before 3pm and there were a few times when the room was cleaned after 5pm Food and Drinks - both were sub par and VERY overpriced This resort is EXPENSIVE but you certainly do not get what you think you would for the money. We were very disappointed and would not return to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but don't risk paying for the Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: LasHutches
Reviews.Content: Liked the resort, but have stayed in nicer Westins. Was very disappointed when we got into our ocean view room, and couldn't see the water (see pics) unless hanging out next to the window. After waiting to get into the room, we had too little time to ask for a change of rooms before heading out for a function. And could feel the pain of the front desk agent when we asked about it. If you go - don't pay the extra for the Ocean View, I'm sure if our trip hadn't started this way, it would've been a better stay. The inner resort shuttle and shuttle into Lahaina was convenient. All facilities were good, but nothing outstanding. Got good service from Jay the Bellman and Katie at the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in Maui”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugged33
Reviews.Content: Back from Maui with family. We were able to stay 5 nights using our Sheraton points, so the review is based on expectations of a Westin for free nights. With that, I rate this 4 stars; however, had I paid $400/night for room, I would have rated it a bit lower. The good: - great property for kids. The pirate ship in kids pool entertained my 7 and 4 yr old for hours which they loved. - kitchenette proved to be really good which is reason we stayed her in the 1st place. - the main pool also very attractive. - the beach area very assessible and nice w/o being too crowded. We snorkeled there multiple days and it was actually better than Molokini snorkel trip. I actually took my 7 yr old snorkeling for 1st time and he loved it. - there is bbq area by pool which we didn't use, but was high quality and saw other families utilizing it. - nice deck to hang out at night. The solid - service was ok; nothing special nothing bad - no good evening entertainment options; would have loved to have a live music by poolside for happy hour. - had lunch at poolside restaurant which was fair, but overpriced. The slightly inconvenient: - had to drive to main shopping/restaurant areas as nothing within walking distance - they wouldn't give us late checkout, but we could have used their facilities had we wanted to. - the internet connection didn't work in our room Overall, we'd return again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Boring Resort,”
Reviews.Author: Danify
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Westin Resort in Maui. Service was below average and the so called adult pool was a joke. More like a puddle with kids all around it. Hot Tubs always full of kids . I love kids but when there is supposed to be a place just for adults they should really make it for adults. Food was just Ok and very expensive. Rooms were nice,very big one bedroom unit. I am a SPG Platinum and was looking forward to a upgrade. They said we have an upgrade for you to a 1 bedroom over looking the parking lot. Wow ,thats what I really wanted. Go to Maui and look at cars. I asked if they had a pool or ocean view. They said yes the same 1 bedroom unit with and ocean view. I said great we will take it! She fine that will be an extra $125.00 per night. I thought are you kidding me. But it had been a long day and I just wanted to get in a room so said OK. Went to the room and on the deck we looked into the back of the Kitchen of the pool bar. We could see the pool and a little glimpse of the ocean. $125 a night to look at people do dishes . Whatever, we did relax. Maid service missed our room twice so we phoned down and they came and did it. Went to the Beach . it was really quite nice. Sat on a Westin Lounger and a westin staff person comes up and says $20 Each Please. I said I am a guest at the Westin. He said thats why your paying the $20 each. We got up and went to the pool. My wife and I went for dinner at Dukes[really liked it] a 10 minute walk down the beach then said lets get a glass of wine at our Resort. It was 9pm . We got to the bar and the Bar Tender nicely said please do not sit down at the bar. Its last call and I am closing. Go sit at a table and I will bring you a drink. I said its only 9PM. He said ya. Thats the Maui way. Ok thats the Maui way so we went to our room and sat on our deck with a glass of wine and looked at Teen agers making out in the Hot Tub and Kitchen staff cleaning up. So as you can tell I will not be going back to this Westin. Its a great place for a Family and for kids. but not at all for a Romantic Getaway. Maybe the Sheraton is better.

Reviews.Title: “Check in from Hell”
Reviews.Author: michael1924
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at 2.15PM told could not check in until 4.000PM. Left hanging around for 1.5 hours. Romm offered was well below expectations. Ocean view booked but had mainly view of carpark. Balcony requested by phone, no balcony offfered. Front desk staff not particularly helpful. Offfered upgrade at cost, first room not good. Hotel offfered to cancel reservation but with no where else booked this was not realistic. Finally offered room which met my requirements albeit at 20% extra cost. It seems to me that the hotel could have resolved my issues earlier but I was left hanging around for 2.5 hours. Friends that we were travelling with had a similar problem. Perhaps the ffont desk staff try to place the worst rooms with unsuspecting travellers.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel goes the distance and then some”
Reviews.Author: ort009
Reviews.Content: maui will never be an inexpensive vacation so it comes down to getting the most bang for your buck. well, we found our paradise at the westin. we have stayed here 5 times, and although we have had opportunities to stay at other, more expensive hotels, like the ritz and four seasons, this side of the island is more versatile, and this hotel has the best property and landscaping and beach. the service at this hotel truly exceeds your expectations. we often wonder how is it possible for employees to be so consistenly friendly and attentive? after meeting with someone from management for a minor issue, it was clear that the entire operation is top notch, and this management inspires employees to be their best. the food at the colonade ( a quick breakfast for people on the go ) is a bit overpriced, but the refrigerators in the room accomodated our breakfast needs. what a beautiful hotel, and we are looking forward to our sixth visit someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mjjpower
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay from the Westin as a package deal. We have done a similiar package through the Marriott and were treated so well that I had thought we'd have the same experience at the Westin (of which I am typically a fan!). When we booked the room we requested a room in the North Tower...we were told that they would make a note and do their best. We received two confirmation phone calls in the month before we arrived and both times were told that they noticed we had requested the North tower and they would do their best. Okay, so we check in and our room is in the South tower...I understand that sometimes things just don't work out so we did not make a fuss (at all!) about it but I did mention that I was dissappointed...what irked me though was that there was no acknowlegement of our disappointment...what would have made all the difference to me is if they had just said "we are so sorry this didn't work out". I will say that the person helping us did seem to look at some options (I'm guessing that is what she was doing but she never did tell us) but then just said "nope, there isn't anything in the North tower, and since you booked on a package deal this is all we have". And so it began, I guess because we were on a package deal we were not treated the same? Caroline our concierge was very nice to us (although disappointed that we wouldn't do the timeshare presentation, but really? We had not had a warm reception at all so far) and she was able to get us all our hotel information, she also mentioned to us that since we were celebrating our anniversary they were going to send something to our room...we never recieved anything. We asked to opt out of the housecleaning in order to take advantage of the breakfast vouchers and they said "great!"...two days later our room was cleaned, I called and was told they would still give us the vouchers so I picked it up, went to the breakfast only to be told that only one of us would have the complimentary buffet because we only had one voucher. I offered to go speak to the front desk about getting the other voucher but was told they'd figure it out...which I guess they did but it put a sour taste in my mouth. The room itself was very clean and the bed was nice. We looked out at the parking lot and turnaround and we were on the first floor so we had a lot of traffic/people noise but when the slider was closed it was quiet enough. The shuttle is very nice...and the drivers were excellent. We also enjoyed the beach which had great snorkeling. I really don't have much else to add. I think this is my first somewhat negative review that I've ever written so I'd like to finish by saying....I believe this hotel/condo has the potential to be a fabulous place (and many people already believe it is) it wouldn't take much to make people like myself happy...just a little aloha spirit which I have read on many previous reports seems to be shared with some people...maybe just not the people who are there on a package deal...although as I mentioned earlier, Caroline and the drivers of the shuttle were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Shawna95
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a wonderful week at WKORV. We booked an island view 1 bedroom through Expedia. From what I have read they said be prepared for a unit in the south tower overlooking the parking lot. When I booked I made a special request for ground floor overlooking the pool. Maybe this helped, as we ended up with a unit in the North Tower overlooking the Pirate Pool (not the pool I had in mind - but it was still great and we heard no noise from the kids) with a partial ocean view. I could not have been happier with the location. Bldg 6 is in the middle and convenient for both sides. This place is absolutely beautiful. I will never stay anywhere else in Maui again. The rooms were nice and the beds great (of course). I loved the location of the resort as it is an easy walk to Whalers Village. Which we did frequentely. Also, the snorkling out front was wonderful. My 14 yo son hooked up with other kids the first day and we hardly ever saw him again. I give this a 5 star on every level. My only complaint about this resort, although it was minor - When I stay at a condo type resort I feel it is expected that you will be making some (if not all) your own food, drinks etc. We felt very uncomfortable bringing our own food/drinks to the pool. We felt it was expected you purchase thiers when you are at the pool. We usually poured our beers into a plastic cup and brought them. Nothing was ever said to us. One day the pool the man next to us very discretely poured a can of beer into a cup, in his ice chest out of sight. The pool waiter said he was not to be bringing his own to the pool. They guy said I was only trying to save a few bucks. The waiter replied "I have mouths to feed also". I can uderstand this at some of the other resorts, but I thought that was the point when you stayed in a condo. From there on, we just kept a few of the cups they serve beers in and then just went to the room and refilled them with our own. That is the only negative thing I can say. Other than that everything exceeded my expectations and I would highly recommend this resort to everyone. Got any questions, feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: cascott4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at this resort and it was heavenly. We had a 2 bedroom unit that faced the pool and had an ocean view. My 9 year old son met so many friends at the resort and had so much to do between all of the pools and beach. We have been to Maui several times so did not do a lot of sight seeing, instead hung around the resort. Everyone that works here is so friendly. Room was extremely quiet and comfortable. The outdoor grilling stations are wonderful. Can wait to go back next year. The only downfall is there is no nightlife here, and you cant find any food past 9:00.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas - 2006 Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdbronco
Reviews.Content: (We actually stayed at this property 9/6-9/9/06 and this review is from that time period. I'm migrating my reviews from another website.) Westinâ€™s Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas is the newest lodging along Kaâ€™anapali Beach. Built in 2003, this resort is very modern and built with impeccable materials. Many people do not know about this hotel/timeshare as it doesn't receive much publicity. I came across it on Starwoodâ€™s employee website and knew it was the Starwood property on Maui. Only one stoplight past Kaâ€™anapali Parkway, the Villas are billed as a timeshare resort. However, rooms are available and you can expect everything and more that Westins are known for. Others have reviewed the larger 1 bedroom rooms here. We stayed in a Deluxe Oceanview Studio Villa on the top floor with a view of the beautiful public park (see a wedding a day from the comfort of your couch) and Black Rock less than a mile down the beach. Our 500-sq. ft. studio was the perfect base of operations for sight seeing on Maui. The list of amenities in the room is as long as your arm. Iâ€™ll try to hit the highlights. All counters throughout the room were granite. The furniture and fixtures were tasteful and modern. All other hotel sink and counters should be patterned after this one. There is plenty of room to stow toiletries. The whirlpool bath is not to be missed. Shutters above the bath separate the bathroom and the living area. The room seems much larger than if a solid wall had been installed. The shower here is huge, about 4â€™x6â€™ with a bench to boot. The room containing the toilet was even larger. A stacked washer and dryer occupy a closet immediately after entering the room. My one complaint here is that you only receive one tiny Tide detergent box and two small fabric softeners. Iâ€™m sure the hotel could get them for less than 50 cents so when a room is going for $450 per night, I think they could kick down soap and fabric softener on request. The Heavenly Bed was superb. What more can you say about it? After staying at the Westin, little touches in our room were noticed. The HVAC system was light years ahead of the archaic unit in the Westin Resort room we had stayed at. The system at this hotel is even wired to the door so the air conditioner automatically shuts off if you open the sliding door (or donâ€™t have it closed ALL the way, to my chagrin). The biggest difference between the two room types here is that the studio lacks a proper lanai. Studios have a sliding door and about 12" of space. I used it to dry some flip flops one day. Another great feature here is the ample parking (not even a resort charge to justify it!). Whatâ€™s better, parking is available under the entire structure. This is great as we avoided a car baking in the morning sun every day except our last. I could go on and on about this place. If your budget permits, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever!! A great Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: mariofo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 nights starting June 8th, 2010. We were in the north tower with a courtyard view of the Koi ponds. The beds were the best I have ever slept on away from home! I must highly recommend the Pulehu restaurant in the North tower. We ate here our last 2 nights. My husband said it was his best lobster & fillet meal ever. It is Italian, but the steaks were out of this world. Our server, Justin was fabulous. I can't say enough about it. We also enjoyed the pools & the relaxed atmosphere around this hotel. We will definitely go back here some day. This side of Maui was so much nicer to swim and access. We drove to the grand wailea & Marriott side to go to the spa, but liked our hotel much better.

Reviews.Title: “Another day in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: birdatman
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Hawaii and was great from start to finish. Part of the reason is because I did several hours of planning and research prior to booking this trip. Please do the â€œup frontâ€� work and it will pay off, big time. We spent two weeks at this wonderful resort for our 30th wedding anniversary and did not have one bad experience to speak of. We own at the Grand Lodge in Breckenridge CO., which is a gold level condo and newly built in 2008. We do know what luxury is, and the Westin Villas north is very nice. This was a trade through II & we were told we got lucky by this location. We were in a 1 br. villa looking into the beautiful, huge pool area the first week, and then requested a ocean front unit for the second week. They had a studio available & we took it. Although smaller than the 1 br. unit it was great. We enjoyed the gorgeous kitchen in both units and cooked many meals which saved tons of $$$. This resort is very well maintained inside and out. The grounds were incredible, flowers, trees, sand, & beach. It is a short walk from the pool to the beach ( maybe 40 yards) and Ka'anapali Beach had as good snorkeling as the two charter trips we took. The North complex (buildings 5,6,7,&8) are the newer of the Westins Villas and a bit nicer than the South area. Although older the South complex is also very nice and we visited there and ate at their pools side restaurant one day. The front desk and concierge were very nice and helpful. I worked with them a few months before we arrived for some special arrangements for my wonderful wife of 30 years. They did all I ask for, and were excited to meet us when we arrived. The general store was a bit pricy buy hey, itâ€™s a high level resort so what can you expect. They did have a good selection of things. The shuttle is good and you can ride it all the way into Lahaina for all kinds of shopping, food , restaurants, and bars. Safeway is only a short ride or drive (5 mins.) and there is a Mall right there also. I took over 650 pics of the trip so I am not going to post them because they pictures can not truly express the way it is there. My advice is go for two weeks if possible, it took us one week to do the â€œsitesâ€� and â€œtoursâ€� on Maui. We then took the second week to relax at the resort. We rented a car for the first week and used the shuttle the second week. If you only have a week, do your sightseeing and trips the first part of the week then relax for a few days. Maui has their own pace that they operate at. Get ready to SLOW down and you will enjoy it as much as we did. If you want to go â€“ go â€“ go, and be entertained go to Vegas , if you want a beautiful, tropical, and laid-back time, go the Westin Villas North in Maui. Maui Hawaii is a vacation everyone needs to experience at least once in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome facility”
Reviews.Author: bussdr
Reviews.Content: wonderful staff, perfect accommodations we wil return. Great for all ages, but children are not allowed to run rampant

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: christine01028
Reviews.Content: Travelled with 8 family members ranging in age from 58 to 13 - and all agreed that the Westin Villas were amazing. We had a two bedroom unit - each had kitchens, W/D, and very spacious floorplans. Amazing bathrooms, and the most comfortable bed my husband and I have ever slept on. We found the service to be almost perfect. There were days by the pool when it was hard to find someone for a drink or snack, but all interactions with employees were pleasant and in line with the Aloha spirit. In fact, my parents asked to switch rooms due to a lacking view, and their request was accomodated immediately and with no fuss. I disagree however with the Westin's nickel and diming for everything. Want to take a yoga class? That will be $27 dollars. Lost your towel card? Another $15. Would you like to have their daily drink special? $8. It already costs buckets to stay here - why charge such exorbitant prices? Yet, the location is amazing. I waled everyday to the end of Ka'anapali at the Hyatt (4 mile beach walk) and found it to be the most refreshing way to start my day. I loved the beach park located on the property, and thought the grounds were lovely. Overall - I would give the Westin 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiDisneyFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in June 2010 and were very disappointed. The staff was somewhat friendly; however, was not accommodating when we requested a particular tower near the pool for the children. We have stayed there before, so I did not understand this. Since the property is large it was a long walk to the other pools. Also, the a/c was not working right for our entire stay. The 1st day we didn't really notice but by the 2nd day it was clear that the temperature was not getting cooler. We advised the fd and they sent someone up but it took almost a whole day to fix. We were in the room with no a/c and with workers working on the unit all day. Even after they "fixed" the a/c it was working but made a loud clanking noise. We did not want to call again though and waste another day of repairs. During the repairs I asked about getting another room but the staff said that engineering would have to make a determination. I paid a lot of money to stay at the Westin and I don't feel like we were treated well. We lost a whole day in our room with no compensation whatsoever. The best they could do was to tell us to wait in the hotel lounge room while they fixed the a/c...very unprofessional for a Westin property. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service - loved this resort.”
Reviews.Author: ccandcc1
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in - the service was exceptional. We had an ocean front room which was beautiful and clean. Liked having the washer and dryer in the room! Pool side was great. My husband and I snorkeled every day, lounged by the pool and just took it easy. The pool is nice - but it is not a party pool. We went to the Hyatt for the day - they had an amazing pool area - yet were swamped with people. Bottom line, I am fairly picky and give this resort 5 stars. Clean with exceptional service. By the way, Jeremy our poolside bartender is the MAN!!!! Go Lakers! : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Stevie017
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our visit here and I think the title sums up our experience and the experience of many others that stayed here during the same time. I'll start with the positive...the grounds are very nice, the pools are nice and our kids loved the "children's pools." The grills that are available for use are very clean and really nice. The rooms are big and comfortable, but I did hear those "banging pipes" from time to time, esp in the bathroom. Now for the not-so-good: Included in our stay was a daily housekeeping visit to make up the room...this happened every other day and only because my wife and I continued to call and remind them that the room needed to be cleaned. Their response was "well your prvacy sign was on the outside of your door." Yes, true, it was up while our kids were napping, for 2 hours a day...plenty of other time to come back without me having to call over and over (and get attitude when calling!) This place is not inexpensive. Do you really need to tell me that if I don't return a towel key when I check out that I will be charged 15 dollars per towel/key? One day we took a trip down to Wailea, and as luck would have it, there was a fire, and the road connecting "North" and "South" was closed (some said it would be closed until the following morning). So we were stuck in the Southern section with 2 kids and minimal clothes/diapers etc...Granted, Wailea is gorgeous and not a bad place to be "stuck." We called the hotel and spoke with the concierge, and they could not have been less helpful. They stated "yeah I live in the Wailea area so I don't know how I'll get home either." Then silence on the phone...no recommendations, no offers to give us updates when they received news about the road opening...nothing. My wife finally asked if they could call us when they received any information, and the concierge stated, "Yes, I already have a list going." Really, why didn't you mention this BEFORE I asked you? We were supposedly placed on this list, but never received a phone call or any update. We stayed at the Grand Wailea for the night, and they were extremely understanding/accomodating, offering a discount to all the people who were "stranded." In fact, we hung out at the pool at the Grand Wailea with 8 other families from the Westin, and all expressed their disappointment with the Westin's lack of helpl with the situation. I am in complete agreement with the reviewer that mentioned how they walked by the concierge several times and they never looked up. Poolisde service: very sparse but there if you really seek it out (i.e., walk to the restaurant and specifically ask for it). Service at the restaurant: Just ask the couple who told their waiter "Oh, you're our waiter..we didn't know because we didn't see you once during our breakfast." That's what we overheard while we waited to be seated, although we had 2 waiters who were outstanding during our stay...the rest were just not interested in customer service at all. I have actually never written a review regarding a vacation before, but I felt obliged to do so this time because so many others felt as we did. Like the family that bought a vacation share last year and asked it they could stay in the same room that they had last year...the response, "Good luck, we're at 95% occupancy." They persisted and eventually found someone who actually cares about customer service and made it happen. This place received so many outstanding reviews that we were expecting great things, and were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We keep returning....We love it here!”
Reviews.Author: debinwa
Reviews.Content: When shopping for a place to stay in Maui, I contacted Naomi of mauihawaiivacations.com and she led us directly to the Westin Kaanapali Villas. We have just booked our third annual stay for January 2011. The location is excellent...it's close to Lahaina and the Kaanapali hotels but far enough away that it's quiet and peaceful. The ocean is right out front and there is a nice walking path that stretches some distance in either direction. The management is super....any questions or concerns we've had during our stays were met with smiles and "can do" attitudes. The hotel is impeccably clean and the grounds are lovely. We have always found it to be quiet at night. It's a nice place for both familes and couples. The Heavenly Beds give a great night's sleep and the bathrooms are large with separate toilet area, granite counters and a large Jacuzzi tub. We enjoy having the barbecues available and it's a nice gathering place in the evenings.The Heavenly Spa is luxurious and I've always had wonderful service there. The restaurants are good but a bit pricey. We like it because it has a resort feel but there's no need to get all dressed up at night to fit in. We always stay in the North building because it's newer and every unit has a lanai unlike the South building. The studio is sufficient space for two of us. We use the small kitchen and eat some meals in and some at restaurants. We think it's a lovely property at a reasonable price and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “OK as long as you don't expect to find serenity and aloha spirit on the property.”
Reviews.Author: JillianH
Reviews.Content: Pros: - great beach 1/2 mile south of the hotel. Don't use the beach directly in front of the hotel. It was too windy and too steep. Further south the water was clear & beautiful and it was wonderful for snorkeling. - rooms are well equipped and very comfortable , 1 bedroom was large, and the bathroom was large & well appointed. - we were there on a timeshare exchange and asked for an ocean view room and got one. You had to go to the balcony to see it, but we were so happy to be off the road and see the ocean, we were very grateful. Cons: - always windy. I mean hold on to your tied on hat kind of windy. Yet we'd walk 1 mile south to the main Kaanapali beach and there was no wind. Itâ€™s hard to relax when you feel youâ€™re in a wind tunnel, and everything around you will blow away if you donâ€™t hold on to it. - not enough grassy areas on the property. We found the timeshare pool scene to be always hectic (and we were there in low season!!) and found nowhere on the property to escape to. The beach area directly in front of the hotel is small and steep and had no shade. The Marriott is also a timeshare but has lots of grassy areas that provide the serenity & views we look for - Location. I took my gps watch - it's a full mile to the Sheraton on the other side of Black Rock, 1.5 miles to Whalers Village shopping, 2.5 miles to the Hyatt at the other end of the beach. There is a very nice walkway, and we really enjoyed our morning walks, but found that we needed to drive if all 4 of us wanted to go to the main beach. - We heard the banging pipes sound that another reviewer mentioned. REALLY loud, more like a jackhammer! Impossible to sleep through. Fortunately this wasn't until our last night. - Staff was not friendly (other than front desk). We walked past the concierge in our building several times a day and they never looked up or smiled. No one said hello or smiled at us unless we did that first. On the first night of our trip we stayed at the Marriott in Wailea and every staff member we saw from housekeeping to grounds crew to pool staff etc gave us a warm smile and asked how our vacation was going. Everyone looks for different things in a vacation. I think we would have been happier at the Marriott on Kaanapali as it has the room comforts we look for, has a much better beach, is closer to the action for our teenagers, but also has some serene spots for the adults.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tarjida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with some family and friends and it was amazing. The rooms were gorgeous and because we asked for a connecting room we ended up getting a bigger suite as one of the rooms. The pool was beautiful and we were right on the beach. Did not dine in the hotel but everything else, including the service, was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach out front!”
Reviews.Author: triptravelCA
Reviews.Content: There are pros and cons: PROS: It is a great location, right on the beach and wonderful snorkeling beach. Nice large jacuzzi tub in room/giant shower. I had a problem with the fridge that was too cold and froze my milk and lettuce. Maintenance came to fix it,and replaced my damaged groceries! Very nice service. There was no fee to self park, and no resort fee. There was a bell hop to bring our luggage and groceries (this is a condo facility). Two nice pool and BBQ area, although it can be difficult to find space to lounge sometimes.. Nice jacuzzi close to the beach for sunset! You can choose to "go green" and forgo maid service and receive a credit voucher for b'fast buffet, notify at least one day ahead. Washer & dryer in room. CONS: We had a studio. VERY small. You walk right into the room and enter the "kitchen" with a small bar sink (can't clean any large item in sink), next to that 24" of counter space (under is 24" small dishwasher),then a two burner stove top, and a bar size fridge under the counter Because this is a condo, there should be a larger fridge! Really limited on cold food/drink storage. Maids came at 9:30-10am and we were not ready for the, then would not return till 5:30 pm and one day it was 8pm! You are not allowed to bring alcoholic drinks down to the BBQ/eating area. Our unit did not have an outside patio. We always have a patio/lanai to have meals and just sit and read. I did hear that the one bedroom condos were very big, much different from the studio.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Couple Loved It”
Reviews.Author: DaniDoll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are writing this review while finishing off our honeymoon (8 days) at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. Having read Trip Advisor we booked in the North side - stayed in Building 6, Island View overlooking the Koi Pond (we actually have a nice view of the ocean out our balcony which is a plus). Nice condo style studio with functional kitchen, washer/dryer, large whirlpool tub. Quiet building. Our self-parking was free and we've had housekeeping everyday - making beds, loading the dishwasher, replenishing supplies. All of the staff including the conceirge for booking activities were friendly, professional and accommodating. We received a bottle of champagne as a welcome gift for our honeymoon which was a nice touch. Pools are clean, lots of loungers, poolside drink service, lots of choice (shade, partial shade, full sun) and the beach is steps away. The boardwalk along the beach makes for a beautiful walk. Overall the grounds are immaculate. Room was nice. Only comment would be that it needs a good "once over" cleaning i.e. curtains need laundering, walls could use a wash. Otherwise very clean - housekeeping kept the showers, kitchen, carpets, etc. spotless. Also, don't bother eating at the restaurants onsite. We'd recommend walking down to Duke's or heading into Lahina to Maui Tacos (light lunch fare), Betty's Cafe (breakfast - good value) or bbqing onsite/cooking insuite. We had several beautiful meals on our balcony after a trip to the Safeway in Lahina. There are kids at this resort but we are laid back and don't mind. We will be back to this resort - hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Unless your an "owner", BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: TMiller150
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on business, and maintain platinum status with both Starwood and Marriott Hotels. My wife and I planned a week vacation to Maui for our 30th anniversary, and we chose the The Westin KORV based on TripAdvisor reviews - what a HUGE Disappointment. We were upgraded to an ocean view (when I inquired..), and booked into building 2. The furniture was very worn and scuffed, the carpets were stained, and overall, it was obvious that The Westin KORV is living on a "has been" reputation. I inquired about a new room the next day, and was offered a choice - in the same building (which had the same problems when I previewed it). It appeared to me that the newer buildings were on the north side, and I asked about moving into one of those - "no go", all of them are reserved for "owners", and the "transients" like us are placed in the older building where The Westin KORV houses it's best hotel guests. Why would I consider buying a timeshare here?? Save yourself the grief, and stay at The Sheraton Maui where we moved to for the remainder of our stay - outstanding staff, service, and property that is still maintained to SPG standards.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Maui”
Reviews.Author: chaub
Reviews.Content: The beach right in front of the Westin is my favorite on the whole island (and I've been to a lot of them). Snorkeling is great over there. You can walk directly out to it from the resort of course, and the sunsets are spectacular. The pools are great and they offer two kiddie pools (one with a giant pirate ship that the kids seem to love). This is a great place for families with small kids, elderly couples, honeymoon couples, etc. My parents own an oceanfront 2-bedroom every year here and we are always looking forward to it. The rooms are very, very nice and offer everything you could want. A two bedroom has 2 kitchens, 2 washer dryers, 2 kings, 2 sofabeds, and great bathroom fixtures. The only downside is the restaurant on site is very pricey (however you have 2 kitchens so it really doesn't matter much). I am a Marriott fanatic but I would recommend this property over the Ocean Club (even though I think the nightly rate is way more here). The beach is much, much nicer and a lot more private. You can't walk to whaler's village, but they do offer a comp shuttle that takes you there (driving takes 3-4 minutes). When you are staying in the Lahaina area, you will want to rent a car. There are a lot of things to see outside the resort and you can't walk to any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATLCTC
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. From the moment you arrive in the open air lobby, this hotel comes across as a first class establishment. We stayed in a studio unit and we loved the spacious bathroom, the refrigerator and the washer/dryer. The pools are nice and the beach/reef is beautiful and convenient. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Costco Steal”
Reviews.Author: washingtondcgirl
Reviews.Content: My family of four adults spent the first half of our 10-day trip to Maui at the Westin KORV in mid-May. We booked through Costco and got a fantastic deal for two one-bedroom units with daily breakfast and rental car. The property was great on all counts. It's north of the main beach, giving it a nice sense of seclusion but still convenient to local restaurants and downtown Lahaina. Our rooms were enormous and well-appointed with everthing we needed (full kitchen with oven, stove, microwaves, pots, pans, dishes, glassware, dishwasher and in-room washer/dryer). The oversize bathroom featured a jacuzzi soaking tub and a large shower. Each room featured "island view" balconies. As other reviews have said, you do see the parking lot, but one room also had a great view of the mountain hills and the other overlooked an inner courtyard with ocean views. The beach itself was small but not crowded in May. Also a great beach for snorkeling. Several pools on the property were more populated than the beach, but again still pretty empty in May and easy to find a deck chair. The front-desk, valet and pool staff were all very friendly, and housekeeping was awesome, even running the dishwasher once.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Clean. Efficient. Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Realaloha
Reviews.Content: Beautiful. Clean. Efficient. Nice pool. Great exercise facilities and classes. Stayed in spacious one bedroom with very large bathroom. Comfortable rollaway at no charge. Beach walkway and access.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet and restful.”
Reviews.Author: irishsiren74
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time there and were happy with the ability to "self contain". Kitchen is fully equiped (except oven) with cutlery, coffee pot, blender, pots, plates, cups, etc. Bring or buy the 3-in-1 washer/dryer sheets. There was enough dishsoap but wew were glad to have brought some dishwasher soap cubes. There are bbqs available by the pools and they get cleaned every morning. There is always some cleaning, painting, maintaining going on. The continue work and effort shows. Snorkelling in front of the hotel is as good as any where, I think we saw more variety of fish near the hotel. The concierge was helpful and was able to direct us to local sights for the budget conscious. The beds were comfy and no loud guests. There were loud birds in the early morning hours. There is a large stand up shower and soaker jet tub. There is a shuttle that leaves from the front of the hotel that can take you into Lahaina for shopping and a few other spots.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous villa and view.”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Kaâ€™anapali Ocean Resort Villas from 5/1/10-5/8/10 to celebrate our 5-Year Anniversary. Our friends are timeshare owners and they let us use their week. (Lucky us!!) We arrived at the Westin Villas around 1:30 p.m., so our room was not ready. Fortunately, the bellhop was able to store our refrigerated food and bags. We stayed in a one-bedroom villa in the North Tower on the fifth floor (Room 6554). Our room was gorgeous. We had a wonderful view of the koi pond, pool, and ocean. The North Tower seemed a little more mellow and had fewer kids than the South Tower. Our villa was very spacious with a full kitchen, jacuzzi tub, and washer/dryer. (They provided laundry soap/dryer sheet for two loads.) I would HIGHLY recommend upgrading to an ocean view room. There were a few locations where the villa balcony faces an empty lot or the parking lot. I would have been very disappointed. Also, there is complimentary wi-fi in your villa and around the entire resort. The kitchen is very well stocked. It had all of the essential utensils including silverware, steak knives, tongs, a spatula, plates, bowls, glasses, pots, pans, a pitcher, blender, toaster, etc. It also came with dish soap, dish towels, dishwasher soap, and a sponge. Thanks to a previous review, we remembered to bring our spices in plastic bags to cook with. We went to the Costco next to the airport on our way to the hotel and loaded up on items for all of our meals. (FYI, the prices are probably much higher in Maui compared to back home.) We really enjoyed BBQâ€™ing in the evenings. Itâ€™s a great way to save money, ensure a good meal, and meet people. (Bring some chips, salsa, and a margarita and youâ€™re set for the perfect BBQâ€™ing experience.) We never had an issue trying to get a BBQ, but the front desk said the hotel was only about 70% full and we ate around 5:30 pm which I think is earlier than most. I would also recommend bringing/buying foil for BBQâ€™ing veggies and sandwich bags if you want to bring lunch on a day trip. Also, if you forget anything there is a store in the front lobby. Since we were technically timeshare owners we had the option of valeting our car for $9.00/day or self-parking for free. The Westin provided complimentary valet parking the first night. We decided to self-park the rest of our stay. We never had a issue finding a close parking spot, although, the spots were extremely tight. ( I am sure we all left with a few extra dints.) The grounds and pool areas are beautiful. They do an amazing job maintaining the grounds. We never had an issue finding a chair by the pool, but it was pretty windy during our stay which I think detoured people for laying by the pool. Chairs under the umbrellas are prime property, so those can be difficult to obtain. We also enjoyed taking advantage of the drink service. There were normally one to two people walking around asking if we would like a drink from the bar. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that the â€œdrink of the dayâ€� was $6.00 and if you waited until Happy Hour (4pm) the other drinks are $7.00. All of our drinks were very tasty. One of the great perks of the Westin is the shuttle service. There are two shuttles (the concierge will explain) that run to the Sheraton, Westin, and three stops in Lahaina. Parking can be a challenge in both Kaâ€™anapali and Lahaina, so we always opted to take the shuttle. The drivers were extremely friendly and prompt. The Westin Villas are located in a great area. There is a Dukeâ€™s located to the north at the Honua Kai Resort. (Go to Dukeâ€™s for dinner and to watch the sunset. Amazing.) Also, we walked along the beach walk from the Westin Villas, past Black Rock, down to Kaâ€™anapali Beach. Itâ€™s a pretty walk and definitely worth doing. On a previous review someone mentioned to go up to the 8th floor of the Sheraton to get a view of Kaâ€™anapali Beach. We did and it was spectacular. The resort offers daily activities to participate in from yoga to Aloha Hold â€˜Em to making your own mug. Unfortunately, it was VERY windy the night we were supposed to make smores and have movie night under the stars. We did participate in the guided tour around the resort where the guide educated us about the plants and foliage. It was very informative, but a little long (3 hours.) Our only complaint with regards to the Westin Villas is the quality of the towels and toilet paper. For such a nice hotel that seems to pay attention to every detail, we thought the towels and toilet paper were very rough. From check-in to check-out each employee we encountered was extremely friendly. This made our stay even more pleasurable. Overall, I would highly recommend the Westin Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort, especially for those with young children!”
Reviews.Author: Snohoco
Reviews.Content: We found this resort to be perfect for our vacation with our 10-month old baby. We had read other TripAdvisor reviews and talked to friends who had stayed here before selecting it for our vacation. We were certainly not disappointed with it at all! Check-in was quick and easy, and our room was ready when we arrived, with the crib and highchair we requested already there. The room was very comfortable, with a nice kitchen. We really enjoyed the beautiful grounds, and the pools were exceptional. Our package included daily breakfast, and we loved that we had the option to use either the Ocean restaurant at the villas or the Sheraton or Westin Maui restaurants. We tried all three and ended up using the Sheraton most of the time. The Sheraton had a great buffet (well, they all did, really), but we enjoyed the morning walk to and from the Sheraton. We purchased food at Costco and Safeway to have in our condo, which was a huge plus. We used the on-site grills a few times, and they worked well. We did eat at their Ocean restaurant for dinner one evening, and it was very good. We also made a lot of use of the washer and dryer in our unit. It was great not having to pack as many clothes, and with a baby we needed to do more laundry than average. My wife and I remarked to each other that as a timeshare resort, the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas (KORV) is much more suited to families with children (probably ages 10 and under) than for people without children. In fact, we noticed a few couples that looked like honeymooners, and we both wondered if they were getting the "honeymoon" atmosphere people expect on Maui. Our baby LOVED being at KORV. He enjoyed the "pirate ship" pool, and we enjoyed talking with some of the other parents. We took advantage of the permanent thatched-roof "umbrellas" installed around the pool areas to provide some shade for our baby while we got a little sun. From reading reviews it sounds as though the housekeeping service varies depending on your particular arrangement or travel package. In our case, we were expecting a "mid-week tidy" and one "full cleaning", but instead our unit was fully cleaned (including a towel refresh) every day. The staff onsite was wonderful. We used the valet parking which was convenient and only $9 per day. As expected at any place in Hawaii, the food and drinks offered by the pool servers were expensive, so we brought our own food and beverages to the pool. KORV are a unique blend of hotel and timeshare condo - we have never stayed at a timeshare that offered so many hotel amenities (pool service, valet parking, daily housekeeping, concierge) which was a pleasant surprise. We also want to point out that we were not bothered at all to attend a timeshare presentation. That's a first! The location is really nice, and there is a nice beachwalk path to other parts of Kaanapali. Our only minor complaint is that we had an "ocean view" room in the south complex on the side facing the pirate ship pool. To see the ocean, we had to stand on one end of our balcony and look over the railing. In our experience, this would be a "partial ocean view" at nearly every other place, and it probably was more of an ocean view before the north complex was built. Bottom line - we found it to be a perfect place for our family, especially with our baby. We were not surprised with any unexpected fees or expenses (we have traveled to Hawaii many times, so we know to expect things to cost more than they do at home). The staff was wonderful, and for a timeshare resort the extra "hotel-style" services were a pleasant treat. It was a relaxing and beautiful place for us to spend our vacation. We agree that people looking for a vacation away from kids would probably not find the KORV as appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in so many ways!”
Reviews.Author: NelsKWDDS
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel! We have stayed at multiple Westin/Sheraton/Starwood hotels over the years, and this is our favorite. We also stayed down the beach and around the Blackrock at the other Westin and checked out the Sheraton while there and all were very nice. However, the Resort Villas has a very special secret that I did not see discussed much on TA..... the snorkeling and underwater park directly in front of the hotel is the best we found in Maui. We explored the Black Rock on day 1 and it didn't compare to the Westin. We also saw more fish and coral here than at Honolua bay and down in the Kihue area. We didn't get to go south past Wailea, but compared to elsewhere this was the best. We LOVED having the grills and the kitchen as well as the washer/dryer. We cooked every night and grilled out under the stars. The beach is nicer at this hotel than at the Sheraton or the other Westin, although it is near. The other Westin has more local options for eating and shopping, as the Whaler's Village is next door, but you can shuttle from this hotel every 15 min to the front of Whaler's Village, so no big deal. We found the grounds to be marvelous and the multiple pool options were nice. This is a great spot for couples or for families and I sincerely hope Westin will consider making more properties with the kitchenettes and washer/dryer. I highly recommend this hotel see few to no cons to report.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: michwitt
Reviews.Content: Our family (boys 12 &14) just returned from a 10 day stay at the Westin Villas. We had an excellent experience! I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels, and this was perfect. The room was perfect. We stayed in a studio villa which was fine for the 4 of us. The kitchen was perfect for our use. The boys usually made bagels/cereal in the morning while my husband and I worked out or went for a walk on the beautiful beach walk. We sometimes ate lunch in our room, but always had dinner out. There are gas grills located at all of the pool areas where people often grilled lunch/dinner. I thought this was a great option, although we never used them. The bathrooms are large and nice, and we had a great ocean view, which we didn't expect. Every room has a washer and dryer which was a bonus.
