We did a load of laundry everyday and went home with clean clothes-made for an easy return! The pools were great and there was definitely something for everyone of all ages. The location was perfect. The beach is absolutely beautiful. If you go to the south part of the beach, it is better for swimming. The north side is great for snorkeling. We went to a lot of places on the island to snorkel, but we found that the best snorkeling was right off of our hotel beach! The service at the hotel was great. Everyone was very friendly and would help with anything if you asked. Only Chris, at the main pool bar, was a bit arrogant and pompous, but we went to the other pool bar after we experienced his attitude and the bartenders there were much friendlier. The hotel is about a 5-10 minute drive into Lahaina where there are lots of great restaurants and shops. Go to Mala in Lahaina-the BEST food on the island and great location on the waterfront. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is really beautiful, clean, and friendly. It is a big resort, but it has the feel of a smaller resort. It never felt crowded. There were always plenty of chairs available at the pool/beach and there never seemed to be large amounts of people around. Our teenage boys loved it too and there was plenty for them to do. You will not be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever w/ 2 young kids”
Reviews.Author: CAMmuv3
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this resort and stayed in the villas with our 2 kids. Ages 4 and 2 at the time. We got a one bedroom villa. It was great for naps and making lunches/dinners. The resort has an awesome policy that you can forego housekeeping to get FREE breakfast. And the breakfast was GREAT. Fresh fruit, pastries, eggs, meat, bagels etc. Not just a continental. This is a very kid friendly resort as well. water slides, pirate pool, beach. We also hired a babysitter through the hotel so we could go to dinner one night and even went on a sunset cruise another night. The Sugar Cane Train was a great kids activity as well. Beautiful views. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: jiggs999
Reviews.Content: Hi, We found the Villas to be spacious, beautiful & immaculate. The property is breathtaking. We had an ocean view but overlooked the pool with only a glimse of the ocean. It's hidden by lots of palm trees. The beach is used mostly for snorkeling. The undertoe is strong & lots of rocks - not good for kids. There are numerous pools which the kids love. We shopped in Safeway and ate breakfast, a few dinners at villa. We made use of the complimentary shuttle to Lahaina & other starwood resorts. We enjoyed Bubba Gumps in Lahania & restaurants along Beach Walk at Whallers Village. We dined at Gerards, the best restaurant in Maui. It cost $220 for three course dinner for two with wine. If I had to do it over, I would have preferred to eat at other restaurants five times for the price it cost at Gerards. The food and service was excellent. The restaurants on site at Westin compare with others in Maui. I recommend the pupu platter for $16. It's an appetizer but good value for a huge lunch. We used the Ocean Bar and Grill on site. We rented chairs for the beach. For one day, a covered beach chair is $20 & an uncovered one is $10. If you plan to use the beach every day, it would pay to buy chairs at Safeway. There's a Cosco & Walmart nearer to the airport. There were lots of kids at the resort. We did not expect this since we were there from April 18th to April 25th. Apparently, kids were taken out of school to vacation at the villas. Mostly young families with kids. The mid-week tiddy up at the villa was fine. You are given enough towles. There is a washer & dryer in the villa also. Bring casual clothes. That's all people wear. Bring half the clothes you think you will need. We think the South rather than the North is the best location. The staff was very friendly & the service was PERFECT! Free business center use. We enjoyed it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Consy77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first family vacation to a destination resort with our daughter who is 2 years and 8 months. The staff was very warm and friendly and they made sure that they helped us whenever needed. The property is very large so be ready for four pool areas and a walk to breakfast if you stay on the north part of the property. I would warn people traveling without a family to understand that this is a family resort. We were originally going to stay here without our daughter and I don't think we would have enjoyed our experience because of all the kids. Plus the adult pool is located in the worst part of the resort and it doesn't have a view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a vacation and not a tropical nanny, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: kterhark
Reviews.Content: This resort is fabulous for families with kids. There is a kiddy pool where they can scream as loud as they'd like from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. There are hot tubs and pools that they can jump into and send big splashes over all the other occupants. There is a long, sandy beach where they run all over, bumping into everyone they see. no matter how long you stay, you get one cleaning. So use your one towel accordingly. Want to eat in your room? Good idea, it's fully stacked with utensils and the restaurant prices are ridiculous. The best thing about this resort is its location; there is a reef right here with great snorkling when the waves aren't too rough. Good access to everything you'd want to do as well. however, If you aren't into tourists stacked on top of each other, kiddies running around and absolutely no peace and quiet, look elsewhere. i can't recommend to anyone wh ois under the impression that Maui is a paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except for the sewer smell and the uneven floors...”
Reviews.Author: KC_Donkey
Reviews.Content: First, I have stayed at the original Westin Kaanapali Villas on 3 prior trips to Maui. However, this is my first stay at the newer North villas. There is one Irritant and one Show Stopper: Irritant â€“ The floors are not level near the walls. Really. I noticed upon entering my room that several drawers were open on the nightstands (both sides of the bed), and the dresser on the opposite wall. It looked like it had been ransacked. Thinking nothing of it, I pushed the drawers closed, but they immidately slid open. I looked down and noticed that there were folded pieces of paper under many of the legs throughout the unit to level them out! Having an open drawer is not a big deal until I banged into it at 3:00 am while looking for the bathroom. Show Stopper â€“ I had no idea that a sewage treatment plant was nearby, until the 10 mph wind blew it in my first night. Again, I had stayed at the original villas 3 times and never noticed this. As a test, I walked to the original villas and the smell was gone. A few hundred feet made all the difference. Iâ€™ll come back to the original villas, but not to the North villas. The fantastic view, the great kiddie pool, great poolside bar and friendly staff do not offset the smell of poo.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Bad Westin But More Of A Time Share Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourGuide4familyof4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights after a five night stay in Oahu at the Westin Moana. Pretty new Hotel and Really clean. The undergound parking lot gets full quickly and can't accomodate the amount of guests. This is the same for the pool area. On two seperate occasions my family & I couldn't find a lounge chair to sit in. With that said we saw alot of people laying on the grassy area near the Koi pond. We instead headed out to the beach which was quite empty and just as enjoyable. Our room was very nice, kitchen, jacuzzi, large shower and of course the great Westin bed. One bad thing however was on one day of our stay housekeeping never showed up to tend to our room. After reading the hotel amenities book I noticed that if your a timeshare owner you only get your room cleaned every 2 days. However, we wern't staying on a timeshare and after returning from a long day we had to wait 30 minutes for clean towels in order to shower before bed, that was a drag. We did not eat dinner at the hotel but the Breakfast at the Ocean Pool Bar was nice. Oh and my kids (ages 6 & 5) loved the Pirate ship pool area and pool slide. On my next return trip to Maui I would consider staying here again as my overall experience was positive but either I'll ask for extra towels next time or try the Westin up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Windy Westin Maui Adventure”
Reviews.Author: 2MuchFun4One
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with two teenagers went to the Westin Villa Resorts during Spring Break (March 28th thru April 4th) we are Starwood Vacation owners and had booked the Maui resort over 8 months ago during this time frame. We live in NJ and our flight was out of JFK (TIP â€“ Smart Park was great for parking!) on Saturday and we stayed at the LA Westin that night and took an early flight out of LAX the next morning arriving at OGG by 11am on Sunday. We rented a car (Dodge Journey, very nice) and were at the resort by 1pm. Our room was ready when we arrived, we had gotten the one bedroom premium villa, having stayed at other Westin Vacation properties we knew exactly what we were getting, separate bedroom, large bathroom, full size kitchen, washer/dryer, (TIP â€“ bring Â½ the clothes you think you need and do some laundry) dining area and large balcony. Upon arrival we were told that we were upgraded to an Ocean View room, however the Ocean View was a bit of a stretch, had to stay on one side of the balcony to get the view, straight across you were looking into the North building. We tried for another room but the resort was booked for spring break and made the best of the view, after all it was located on the fourth floor not 1st facing the pirate pool. The first thing we noticed while we were there was the wind. Very windy with gusts to 60mph and light rain showers on and off the entire week. The wind whipped the sand on the beach into your face and the rain was whipped around also. You can not do anything about the weather but it detracted from our experience of Maui. The wife and daughter went to the spa for pedicures and the employees there told her that this type of wind was very unusual for Hawaii. When the sun did come out and the wind died down a bit (Thursday) our Maui adventure truly began. The resort was full of families with smaller children (spring break) which really didnâ€™t bother us much. As parents of four older children we knew exactly what some of the other parents were going through, good and bad. Not sure about other weeks but if you are looking for a romantic getaway for two, I would think twice about going here or check posts that are not during spring break time. We stocked up at the Safeway down the street in Lahaina, grilling foods, produce, water, cereal, beer & wine etcâ€¦. (TIP - print out the Safeway club application from the website before you go, fill it out, at check out hand them the application you get a club card on the spot and the discounts, saved over a $100.00 on our weeks order) The grounds are beautiful and centered perfectly along the Maui coast with spectacular sunsets and great location among other resorts. It was very crowded here and challenging to get a pool chair (Spring Break) - started at 7am and still only got second tier seating, which was fine. When the chairs are all taken, go the beach, put your towel down and enjoy the Ocean and beach (a little on the small side) if you want you can take the shuttle to the other Westin down the road by Whalers Village and use the beach there, more sand and resort like. The pools themselves we were a little disappointing, no swim up bar and small. (TIP â€“ Go to the Welcome to your Vacation activity and find out about what Spa, Yoga and Bar specials that they will be running that week) If you enjoy jogging/walking, the Beach walk is perfect, jogging early in the morning watching rainbows over the Pacific â€“ Wonderful. There are two gyms on the property with treadmills, elliptical, etc... The equipment was sufficient but get there early if you want an early morning workout, place was packed by 6am. There are plenty of grills, but they were always packed and if you wanted to use them, you had to wait your turn and bring the food back to your room; all the outdoor tables were taken most of the time we were there. Still everyone was polite and courteous, stories, recipes and beers were swapped while waiting. Here is a brief description of what we did outside of the resort booked through the concierge service which was exceptional: Excursions â€¢ Cruiser Philâ€™s Sunrise Volcano Bike Ride â€“ A must â€“ family had a great Experience, thank you Thomas and Jonathan â€¢ Teralani Sunset Whale Watch Cruise â€“ Pay the little bit extra, worth every penny, clean sturdy catamaran, food and drink â€“ crew was FANTASTIC â€¢ Westin Luau â€“ Good for your first Luau â€“ had fun, we were able to upgrade and was not disappointed with the show or food â€“ Open Bar Our own Adventures: â€¢ Hana Highway â€“ This is something to check off that I did it in life â€“ doubt I would want to again. When we were able to park somewhere the sites were pretty amazing. â€¢ Town of Paia â€“ If you go to Hana you will pass through this town, find the public parking and enjoy this quaint town. Check out CafÃ© Mambo (Khula Pork fajitas) and Moana CafÃ© (Anything for breakfast!) We canâ€™t wait to get back to Hawaii, absolutely fantastic; the Westin Ocean Villas were very nice; just missing something; maybe it was the lack of an Entertainment Staff pool side, swim up bar w/larger pool- something. Would definitely would stay here again, but next trip we will try another Westin Hawaii property.

Reviews.Title: “Best time here with our grandkids & their parents”
Reviews.Author: like2g0
Reviews.Content: Everything was the best! The 2 bd suite was perfect for us (could sleep 8). The separate one bedroom "lock off" was just right for the 'kids' with their 2 kids, while gran & gramps got the luxury of the huge bedroom/bath. Living & dining are in the middle. Plus, after our stop at Costco by the airport, we needed the two full size refrigerators, as each side has a kitchen/kitchenette. The dining table was big enough, too. We did eat out, but with a 2 & a 3 yr old, eating in with the full kitchen was great. The grill area by the Pirate Pool was wonderful and, of maybe 6 grills, two of them had their own table with overhead covering. Had a party out there one evening. On most nights it's a gathering place to talk & swap easy grill recipies with the other travelers. Besides, the guys cooked!! Our first assigned unit was ground level with a path to a pool. If we had teenagers, nice. But ours are not. So we asked for an upper unit (came with 2 balconies) and the ocean view was amazing from there. Thank you Westin... My husband tells everyone he spent his vacation in 16 inches of water...and he did. At least part of every day. The little ones loved the Pirate pool. We tried all of them, tho. Walked across the street to the Sugar Cane Train. And the whales were popping! Our son-in-law snorkled way out (great snorkeling & beach) and came near a baby whale - wondered where momma was, and (where's the orchestra?) up she came from the deep....til the baby straddled her back. Awesome! The new restaurant in walking distance on the boardwalk is open. Dukes has the best views! Right on the boardwalk by the beach. Mostly open air, ate there 3 times. Great food. Bar, too. I am getting sooo homesick for Maui now. This was a truely great place for a family vacation. Altho, most of the people we talked to were couples. Don't hesitate to go. Loved these villas... the only downside is - we are not there now.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad of the North Buildings”
Reviews.Author: gabesz
Reviews.Content: We spent a week from March 20 to March 27 2010 in building number 6. Our room was a time share trade for our unit in Florida with Starwood Resorts. This room was nothing compared to our Florida resort in many ways. Here is the good part: Location of the resort is ideal. Right on a nice beach, nicely maintained public areas. Family friendly in the sense that there were kids all over the place. Here are the bad parts: Our room was a studio directly above the lobby. We had a view of the grounds and if you stood on top of a ladder in your room maybe you would catch a bit of the ocean. The balcony was tiny with 2 chairs and a small table. Barely enough room to sit on for one never mind two. The room had a kitchenette where you can cook breakfast but no real space to even put the coffee maker on a flat surface and the toaster to make bread at the same time. The dishes were in cabinets too high to reach and again you needed a ladder to reach most glassware, etc. The knives were relatively dull that could cut bread at the best. The design of the room was such that it had a small table for 2 to sit on near the balcony. If you made use of the pull out couch then there is no room at all for anyone to move around. The closet in the room is barely big enough to put one bag into it. The bathrooms is interesting since all doors are glass and when you wake up the middle of the night to go to the bathroom, unless you do not want to wake anyone up you are all seeing the light come through. The shower area had a door that opened directly towards the wall and the door therefore getting in and out of the shower was a challenge. I guess the designer who created the space did not think of functionality of the space when they created this room design. The walls are thin and you can hear the people above you and next door. Since we were the last unit before the elevators you could hear the elevators open and close all night, plus there was a constant sound of water running from some piping in the staff elevator area piping. When the door to the balcony is open at night you hear the waterfall in front of the lobby and that sounds like a faucet running and not the pleasant sounds of a waterfall to help ease you to sleep. Outside on the entry area is the delivery docks and you can hear the trucks coming and going delivering supplies to the complex. In the morning you can hear the kids screaming early as they go about the complex with their parents who woke up early and making sure the rest of us cannot sleep. The food is mediocre at best. At the bar by the pool the service is slow. The main restaurant is open only Thursday-Sunday night. So you are basically stuck with bar food the rest of the time. The small grocery in the building is overpriced beyond belief. A hard boiled egg is 99 cents and a small box of cereal is $1.99 per box when outside is a dozed of the same boxes for $6.00. Sandwiches are $9.00 while outside the same can be had for $5.00. Other then emergencies, do not waste your money here. Staffing is only friendly here if you start speaking to them otherwise they ignore you completely. Other places on the islands have staff saying hello to you just as they pass you. Overall the only reason I would return is the location of the complex, and I would certainly demand a better unit for my exchange. By the way they do take guests here who pay by the night, but I would tell you to go to the Sheraton down the road which has better service and same if not better units all ocean view unlike here where most units do not have a view of anything but the other building across the lawns.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: LisaCates
Reviews.Content: A great place to relax and for families. we spent most of our time here. the pools and ocean beach are great.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable at the beach”
Reviews.Author: gfwcchick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week as a guest of an owner March 13-20. We had adjoining rooms. We had studio and it was comfortable for 2, nice layout and great view on balcony of mountains and beach. We could watch whales morning and evening from balcony. Used the swimming pools and hottubs and were both enjoyable not overly crowded obn any occasion. Beach area was very enjoyable and clean. I liked the towel cards that were issued - just traded cards for towels with towel stand on arrival and throughout stay trade out towel for towel as needed and on last day - traded towels for towel card to be turned back in to front desk upon checkout. Worked very well for us. Also enjoyed the local arts and crafts that were set up under the tent between the north and south villas. Very unique items from art -jewely -soap - dishes, etc. and of very good quality. Checkin and checkout without a big hassle - it appeared there was extra staff available during the rush hours of 10 am and 4 pm and it was certainly appreciated. Also the interhotel shuttles and the Lahaina shuttle worked out great for us also. A definite plus and we used it the entire time we were there. Since it was March Madness the guys really enjoyed the TV's at the poolside bars so that they could watch their games and spend time with wives and chidren. Something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “real vacation”
Reviews.Author: mxperill
Reviews.Content: our stay was paradise. great to be able to see our kids have so much fun, and everywhere you went, people were so great. The ocean is safe, and there are kids options at rvery restaurant, and so many different activities for the kids to participate in â€“ we really feel like WE got a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Just incredible!”
Reviews.Author: GyW
Reviews.Content: Lovely resort, beachfront location. Rooms are just great, modern furnished. Highly recommended! WonÂ´t be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: GinOaklandCA
Reviews.Content: We are even-year time share owners at this resort and love it. It's in a perfect location - right on the beach. The shuttle takes you down to the Westin Hotel and Whaler's Village or into Lahaina. People who book here need to be aware that the studios have small kitchens and no balconies. The one-bedrooms have much larger kitchens and a nice balcony. The beds are luxurious and both types of rooms have large showers and jacuzzi baths. There are several hot tubs on the property and a very nice pool. Another thing to be aware of is that there are two resorts on the same property. The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas North are newer and have more rooms with ocean views. I think that resort has more pools - that is where the pirate pool is located (I haven't seen it, so I don't know what that means). Both resorts have a daily calendar of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations; Luxurious, Convenient, Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: dc5000
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: This was our first trip to Hawaii with twin 6 yr olds. We didn't want to mess this up. We wanted a large, at least semi-luxurious resort with big pool and beach presence. We were slightly worried that a "condo" style hotel might mean less services. It did not at all. This is a full-service resort. You just have kitchens, which ends up saving you boatloads on meals. This place more than satisfied our needs and went beyond what we thought it would be like based on the web/reviews. ROOM We booked a studio Island view as that was cheapest and seemed adequate. We were upgraded free of charge to 1BR Island view which absolutely could be called "Partial Ocean View." This room was gigantic, with full kitchen. GROUNDS: From website, pool grounds and beach all seemed like what we wanted. But the website does not do it justice at all. It is more vibrant and lush, and yes it's active with kids, but overall that just added to the fun for us. This place has the same "get there early to get a chair" problem that most resorts have, but we had no problems each day finding 4 chairs for the family. The "Pirate Ship" pool area is more fun than it looks on the site. Also - when they mentioned on-premises grills, I had no idea they meant STATE OF THE ART GAS GRILLS!!! Incredible. HIt the Safeway on Highway 30 first thing. Trust me. CONCIERGE: Corrin was excellent. They have suggestions for everything. FOOD: Lots of in-room cooking, also Ocean Grill which was very good, especially for breakfast. Also grilled out couple times. Dinners out - Hula Grill and Kimo's in Lahaina were both excellent. BEACH: First of all, it's beautiful. There are trees a little further north, the water is gorgeous, whales are breaching in plain view, people were snorkeling. But it's a little intimidating. It's rocky and reefy. You can still swim here, just wear aqua socks and beware of drop-off and current. Also, if you want to go to where it's sandier, walk down the beach south about 300 yds or so. You'll see it's slightly calmer and much sandier. There are many other options in this area, a short drive down Highway 30 and in Lahaina. SURFING LESSONS Goofy Foot in Lahaina. 8AM, private session with Matt. There is no way any other business can beat this level of service and professionalism. Awesome. If you don't pay $20 to get the professional photos, you're insane. LUAU At the sister property, Westin Resort. Food was outstanding, entertainment top-notch. Slightly annoying wait in line to get in but they serve you Mai-Tai's to keep you happy.

Reviews.Title: “NICE NOT GREAT EXPENSIVE OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: esch69
Reviews.Content: rooms nice clean and new and have small kitchen that is all i can say that is good about the place. let me start by saying place is on the expensive side of hotels i paid for a oceanview room and what i got was a ocean view but no balcony. they should tell u some rooms have no balconies and some do paid for a room and couldnt even enjoy the view the room had a sliding door and a railing no where to sit and enjoy the view that was strike 1 might as well have paid for cheaper room. place is loud full of children pool is loud if u want a relaxing quiet resort this is not the place. had to pay 7.00 dollars a day to park ridiculous. it is also a time share resort so a lot of trying to sell timeshares going on. do yourself a favor try a differnt place its overpriced and for no good reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort for a Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LivingtheDream32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and found the property, services and location amazing! Check-in was smooth and we opted to use their "go green" program during our stay. We gave up daily housekeeping in exchange for complimentary breakfast buffet coupons. Well worth it and when we needed fresh towels we just contacted the front desk and they were brought promptly. The buffet had lots of great options and was a tasty way to begin our day. The location of the property was perfect for us. We walked often along the boardwalk or hopped on the free shuttle to Whaler's Village. A short walk north of the resort is the Hona Kai property which has a Duke's restaurant. Amazing atmosphere and delicious food! The pools were clean and beautiful, but most of the time we opted to swim in the ocean as the water was warm. I had a massage at the spa on our last day and it was the perfect way to end the trip! The grounds of the resort were clean, beautiful and very peaceful. Our first morning we saw a group of humpback whales right off shore of the hotel-amazing! The rooms were the perfect size, had "heavenly" beds and although we were very close to the lobby our room was quiet. I have nothing negative to say about the resort-plus I got a great deal on expedia and during our stay we felt no pressure to attend a time-share presentation. The only negative thing that happened was a mishap with our google maps. We looked up directions to a restaurant and our GPS sent us on the northwest highway around the island. So Scary-one lane road, pitch black, but we lived to tell the story!

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: JoeMontroseBC
Reviews.Content: We had a garden veiw above the parking lot next to the highway. We could not sit out side because of the highway noise. It took 6 days to fix shower head. Microwave door handle was broken. Seat cushion outside was missing. I would suggest to bring a sharp knife for cooking as the ones provided would not cut anything. Had to wait for equipment in the two fittness centers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort!! Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Flyingmo
Reviews.Content: Outstanding resort!! Beautiful landscaping and layout, kid friendly, warm & friendly staff. Puelhu Italian restaurant is outstanding. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay For Families/Groups”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights through a package deal from Expedia. Combined stay with cost of inter-island flights from Honolulu. Price was actually pretty inexpensive when done this way. Arrived late (9pm), free valet-parking for first night. Checked right in. Upgrade from Garden/Mountain view Studio, to Ocean view studio in Building 2. We could see the Pirate Ship pool outside out "balcony ledge". Room was nice and spacious. Gigantic shower, whirlpool tub, separate room for toilet. Single sink vanity. Stacked washer/dryer unit. Two burner stove/top. Dishwasher. Refrigerator. King Size bed. LCD TV. Couch converted to Queen size bed for our two kids (7 & 4). Balcony was only big enough to stand on. We didn't come prepared to use the kitchen, BBQ's (outside by the pool). Our late arrival meant we couldn't hit up Costco on the way and we didn't want to drive all the way back. Plus we are on vacation, who wants to cook. The grounds/entrance are beautiful. The beach is right in front of the resort. The Ka'anapali Beach Walk runs between the beach and the resort. Very nice to run on in the morning. Beach is narrow and not really suitable for swimming into since the coral is only a couple of feet off-shore. Though the beach is long and beautiful. Sunrise isn't that big of a deal since the sunrise is hidden by the mountain behind you. Service isn't all that great as compared to a 5-star resort like the Four Seasons, but I expected that. This is more of a do-it-yourself resort. And if you plan it accordingly you can save a lot on cooking, etc. They did have some interesting activities like koi feeding, hula lessons, etc. But most of the time we hit the beach in the AM and then mostly pool in the afternoon. There are two larger pools, plus a kiddie pirate pool for kids < 5. I would definitely stay here again and think this is a great place for a group of people to congregate for a great Maui vacation. Some downsides were: 1. There was no gameroom area to speak off.... 2. The workout room was rather small for a resort of the size. 3. Beach chair are few if you don't get out pretty early.

Reviews.Title: “Playing in the ocean and pool - who could ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelers2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was wonderful. Our room was great (we had an ocean view on the first floor). The staff could be a little more attentive and prompt. I also wouldn't trust the concierge people - they steered us wrong a couple of times. Overall, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo style holiday”
Reviews.Author: H0neybeethree
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Villas. We stayed in building 3 and it was so quiet and relaxed. When we arrived at the resort everything went well. Valet parking was great and very reasonable. $9 for regular quests and $7 for timeshare owners - however as timeshare owners if we parked ourselves it was free!! In Hawaii!! Pool and hot tubs were just outside the doors and it was a short walk down to the beach. The beach was okay - good for snorkeling but have to walk about 100 meters south to get tot he beach where there was more sandy bottom. We saw many whales breaching right in front of the resort. Our room was stocked with the groceries we had requested but it is a very short drive into Lahaina to get anything you need. We primarily ate breakfast and lunch at teh resort when we were there - the only time we ate supper at the villa was after catching our own Mahi Mahi when we went deep sea fishing and cooked it on the BBQ that is available at the resort. The building, our room and the resort area was clean. As timeshare owners however, you do not get daily maid service - so we were washing our own towels (oh yea - they have washers and dryers which are great) and the shower seemed constantly filled with sand by our two kids even though we did use the showers outside. They come around once during the week to refresh the bedding and towels and to do a general tidy. We did not see many staff other than the concierge who is in every building ready to help. As far as timeshare pressure - we did not feel any as we are already owners (however at a different resort). It was a good holiday and we would consider staying here again the next time we are on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Sleep ever, and its a nice place to stay also!”
Reviews.Author: sask12
Reviews.Content: The bed is to die for, we have one at home so sleeping was awesome. There was myself and my wife plus our two children age 7 and 11. The kids loved the place they especially liked to hang at the pool with water slide. They just liked it more than the pirate ship and lazy river pool. Service was great, if you paid for the maid service keep it don't fall for 10 dollars off breakfast. Our maid was great just great. always clean with lots of supplies. Beach is beautiful don't let the B-Sers fool you. Their is Coral just off shore some 15 to 20 feet but kids were able to play every day. They snorkeled and boogie boarded. Oldest did cut foot and got 8 stiches but he fell off his board and kicked to get back on between a wage and cut his foot. Lots of barbeque's etc. Parking valet park first day then park below your unit in underground parking. If your out late you wont get your spot but re park the next morning. Don't buy from the stores their is a supermarket just down the street to NW second exit. Weren't bugged about time shares and concierge was good. Front desk made a mistake on bill and handled after a little looking. Bell men are great. Room is large has a huge balcony entrance living room or bed room. Large large bathroom with tub and shower. Safe in closet. Washer and dryer. Large fridge with ice maker. Plasma TVs in both living room and bedroom. Internet was fairly fast. Basically we will be back in 2012 for three weeks again. 2011 at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTravellingDude
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui in Feb for a week and stayed at the Westin. The rooms are fantastic and large. We were in building 3 and hand an nice view of the pool and the ocean from our balcony. The overall resort is great and the snorkeling right off the beach was great, probably the best I've experienced without having to leave the resort. The only downside was the restaurants were fairly expensive and not that great. We preferred to eat at Whalers Village. The Shuttle between Lahaina, the Westin, and the Sheraton was very convenient. Although we didn't have children with us, the resort appeared to be very child friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: pvtejasvi
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you are into eating out or cooking in the kitchen. The resort is extravagant and relaxing, it is right on the beach. In fact you can see the ocean from your room window!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, wouldn't go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 one bedroom suite rooms on expedia on a package where breakfast was included and room upgrade on availability. Well we recieved the worst location possible, building 7, farthest right, long walk. We were a group of 5 adults and one child, and all of us were disappointed with this resort. Service was terrible!!! The only good service was the bellman at valet. Front desk staff were horribly rude and unhelpful on more than one occasion. We also didn't like the location of the resort, secluded from anything else, you would be better to stay at the westin next to Whaler's!!!! We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest timeshare unit I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: cberenguer
Reviews.Content: i always like reading recent reviews about resorts that are to the point and cover what you need to know, so here is my attempt: - location is great. Right on Kanapali Beach and a great drive to other areas. Hotel offers a shuttle to the other Westin Hotel, Sheraton and close-by Whalers Village. I would recommend having a card though. - villa rooms are awesome. clean. specious. modern. new. don't have an oven, but the microwave couples as an oven. missing a couple of basics from the kitchen like a can opener, but otherwise has everything you need. - don't have to pay for parking - didn't pay any extra per night fees / charges when booking with points - the north tower is newer and better for those wanting to be in the "quieter" part and with less kids. The south tower is better for those with little ones as its near the kids pool / pirate ship. Its more busy - the best breakfast is at the Ocean Restaurant in the south Tower. About $22 and really great. - was disappointed that there was no lei greeting at check in - a little pushy at the concierge desk for going to see a timeshare presentation. They'll ask you each time to go. - bring water shoes and your own snorkel gear (or pay an arm and a leg to rent). The rocks are sharp in the water and you NEED water shoes to go in. For those using points to stay, for the same number of points, best to stay here as opposed to the busy Westin Maui Hotel. Bigger rooms and kitchen even if you don't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: scooterjuanita
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into this resort through Interval. This is one of the nicest resorts we've ever stayed out. Sumptuous is the word that comes to mind...everything from the lobby to the rooms to the pools. They also had a waterslide which kept my 6 year old happily occupied for days. Prior to this visit, we had always stayed at Kapalua Bay and this resort is absolutely comparable. It was a special treat to be able to sit on the balcony and watch the wales breaching. At that time of year, the ocean is whale 'soup'! On site scuba shop was great and took the 6 year old out 'snuba'-ing. THe restaurants on site were all great. I would enthusiatically recommend the Westin Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ramzer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the resort and we loved every minute. We were given a week as a wedding present from a friend so we were very lucky but that being said we would go back on our own for sure. We had the one bedroom and it was great having the small kitchen. One wish I did have is the bedrooms only have a small one foot wide balcony. We stayed on the south side of building 3; we had a great ocean view because the public beach parking is on that side so there is no building blocking your view. I read a lot of reviews on Travel Advisor and my biggest issue I have with a lot of the negative review is YOU ARE IN HAWAII stop complaining. I know that there is going to be rooms that donâ€™t have great views my advice is get out of your room and walk the 100 feet to the beach. The beach is great but be carful if the waves are big because there is rock not very far out and you can get pushed around. We spent a lot of our time away from the resort but we had some very nice days relaxing by the pool. The great thing about having the kitchen is you can make up lunch or snacks and bring them down to the pool help save a lot of money. Also there are bars and a person walking around to get food and drinks if you want to do that also. This is a timeshare resort but we were never asked once about it, we did not use the resort people to book any trips so that could be the main reason. If you expect nightly turndown with a custom chocolate on your pillow you might want to consider staying somewhere else. If you like a good clean resort that is right on the west beach of Maui and know how to have a good time then I recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome vacation in an awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: WinterVacationers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas from January 9 to February 8, an amazing 30 days. I can't say enough good things about this wonderful place. We had booked through Maui Hawaiian Vacations, where we found a great deal at 70% off the usual price. We were in building 6 in a 1 bedroom villa, and while we were supposed to have an island view unit, we were very pleasantly surprised to find that we had a decent ocean view as well as looking over the koi ponds. The unit was great, well equipped, comfortable and spacious. Having the large lanai was a real bonus, it got a lot of use. The staff were invariably friendly, courteous and helpful. Any requests were dealt with immediately, for example there was a problem with the freezer and someone came out within 10 minutes and fixed it. Housekeeping was excellent, and the entire complex was spotlessly clean and well-maintained. We spent a lot of time on the beach, and loved the fact that you can find as sunny or shady a spot as you'd like. We also loved the board walk and spent at least an hour each day walking either the boardwalk or the beach, an activity shared by many. I went snorkeling a number of times, very enjoyable, and when I had some difficulties with my prescription mask someone at the water activity centre spent time with me till it was just right. We ate at Puhelo 3 times, and while it was not inexpensive, we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experiences there. We also had the buffet breakfast a few times, which was also very nice. We also used the grills extensively, and enjoyed having the freedom to look after our own meals and snacks much of the time. One of our biggest thrills was seeing so many whales, we lost count after the first few days. On our previous 10 trips to Maui we had stayed in Kihei, and had never seen as many whales as we did in Ka'anapali, nor as close by. One of the things we really enjoyed were the many families that stayed there. It was lovely to see all the little children enjoy the koi pond, and the fun they were having in the pools and on the beach. We truly enjoyed every single minute of our stay, and can't wait to go back. We highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort! Can we go back now?”
Reviews.Author: Nanookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for two weeks via an Interval timeshare exchange. The grounds were immaculate. I loved all the landscaping and waterfalls. The koi ponds were a nice touch. We stayed in Building 2, in the same suite for the entire two weeks. The room was fantastic! We had a studio which was lots of space for the two of us. The kitchen was outfitted with the basics, so be sure to bring along coffee filters and any spices, baggies etc. that you might want or need. Or hang around by the pools/grills on the weekends when people try to unload leftover items prior to leaving. Our room didn't have a lanai, but a sliding door we could open. It was a partial ocean view overlooking the keiki pirate ship pool, which was great as that pool closed earlier than the others. However, we were directly above the service entrance, which was quite noisy during the second week with powerwashing and recycling starting by 8 am most mornings. If it had been bad during the first week, we likely would've asked to change suites, but on the 2nd week we weren't in the room much at all and moving seemed like more of a hassle than it was worth. We used the grills in the south areas a few nights. We were always able to get a grill and table without waiting and the grills were well maintained. The pools were very nice, especially the hot tub in the north pool, which has a great view of the ocean. Westin's literature says that lounges by the pool cannot be reserved with towels and that towels would be removed if left out for longer than an hour, which is an outright lie. At the same time, we never had a problem getting two lounges side-by-side, but the prime spots were often taken. You can also rent lounges with canopies or poolside tents. Lounges can also be rented for $10 each per day (or $25 for one with a canopy) on the beach which I found to be a bit of a joke, so we used our towels instead. There are sandy "entrance lanes" in the ocean through the rocks and coral near the end of Building 3. The surf was pretty rough on some days, especially in the afternoons so it was tough to see the bottom. Reef shoes are essential if you want to swim in the ocean no matter what the waves are like. The snorkeling in front of the Westin was decent, once you figured out how to get in/out safely. Westin also hosts a weekly craft fair next to the boardwalk on Fridays where you could get all kinds of great handmade gifts for less than at most shops in Whaler's Village or Lahaina. The conceirge services were very helpful - we made dinner reservations at Hula Grill through them, and they also suggested a number of restaurants one night when it was raining and we didn't want to barbecue. They even called ahead to see if there was room for us. We found the staff very friendly and polite. The bar service was very friendly, though the drinks more expensive in comparison to other restaurants nearby. The shuttle to the other resorts and Lahaina was fantastic. It made it easy to hop over to the Sheraton to snorkel at Black Rock. We were able to leave the car parked for a couple days, which was a nice change from having to hunt for parking in Lahaina and on those occasions when we both wanted to have drinks with dinner. The Westin also has a departure lounge with showers, shampoo/conditioner, towels hair dryers, lockers and another room with a tv and couches. The Valets also locked up your luggage while you could soak up that last bit of sun before leaving. This was really a handy service for those of us with late-night departures. We were very pleased with our stay at the Westin. The resort is beautiful and we loved almost everything about it. We'd return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: KGD'sMOM
Reviews.Content: I had heard of this place from friends and had read lots of reviews. I found what I thought to be a good price for eight nights in a 1 bed island view suite with Maui Hawaii Vacations, paid up front but money went to Westin so their 72 hour prior to check in cancellation policy was in affect so I felt more confident in case something happened to stop us from going. I asked very nicely on check in if there was a nicer view and we received a corner room that had a view of the ocean and pool. To be honest we didn't use the lanai so much but loved the corner room with all the windows along the side of the living room. Everything was spotless, I liked the layout and my daughter said it was the most comfortable pull out she had ever slept on. I laid on it and you couldn't feel a single spring, between that and the big screen tv she watched in bed she loved it. We used several different concierges (thankyou Holland) to book a luau and ziplining. MY daughter and I also participated in some resort activities which were fun, every memeber of staff we encountered were friendly and effiecient. We weren't too impressed with the food at the Italian restaurant on site, the service was outstanding but grossly overpriced even for Hawaii. We ate out nearly every day for lunch or dinner and that was the least favourite meal. I want to warn anyone who wishes to snorkel or swim in front of the resort, that there is nothing but coral that starts very close to the shore. There are small signs at the end of each walk way to the beach but we entered just past the end of the South building into the sandy area of water. We found the coral while snorkeling in front of the resort and didn not get close enough to the sandy part when getting out. It can be quite wavy at the shore line and my husband was caught in a wave and thrown against coral at the shore. He ended up with 25 stitches on his shin, nasty but could have been worse. If you require medical attention while there go to the Hyatt to Doctors On Call they are amazing. Anyway we learned our lesson, my advice is to enter and depart the water south of the resort where it is all sand. Saw lots of fish though and a huge turtle so worth trying out. We left Maui and went to the Big Island where we stayed in a condo right on the water, amazing view but we missed the Westin. We will return to Maui and I have no doubt we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: mmr1226
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband here for a conference. It was one of the most beautiful hotels I've been too. The service was wonderful, the beds were amazingly comfortable and the views were spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “best. place. ever.”
Reviews.Author: freakarikka
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel made me in aw: the scenery, the rooms, the service, the pools, the activities, the accomadations, everything. My experience was something that I will NEVER forget. I have been to it three times, because I always long to go back. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. p.s. we saw whales from our room

Reviews.Title: “Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas rating”
Reviews.Author: saltuz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms, views, grounds, and amenities. The beachfront was nice however the average swimmer would have difficulty getting past the shorebreak as well as dealing with the coral. There is no standing in the water at this location due to the sharp coral and steep drop-off.

Reviews.Title: “The Best spot in Maui for Families with Young Children”
Reviews.Author: Joannewithfamily
Reviews.Content: I say this was the best spot in Maui for young children because our 4 year old was so pre-occupied that it made the whole experience easier for us. We never felt pressure to take her on one excursion after another because all she wanted to do was play in the pirate ship pool. We rented a one bedroom villa from a timeshare owner (less expensive this way vs going to the resort directly) using redweek.com. We had heard very good things about this property so decided to try it out. Here are our tips and comments about this property and your Maui vacation; We have two children (4 year old and 1 year old). Our 4 year old loved the pirate ship pool. It made our vacation much easier because we could watch her play in the pool without always going in. However, it was fun going down the slide with her too. I recommend swim shoes for your toddler in this pool because our daughter got small cuts on the bottom of her feet. Our one bedroom was in the South building #2 overlooking the pirate ship pool with a good angled view of the Ocean. We could see whales from our room. I would recommend trying to get a villa that gets sun on the deck at some point in the day (our didn't but that was ok too). I would be reluctant to rent a Studio in the South building because most of them had laughable sized balcony's. Standing room only - absolutely no chance of putting a chair on them. Our deck was very large with comfortable deck furniture. The room was very nice with high end finishings throughout, very comfortable bed, huge bathroom and fabulous jacuzi tub. Everything looked very clean but I bought some clorox, filled my tub and ran the jets, just in case. The resort gives you a little starter set of coffee/tea, dish soap, laundry soap, dryer sheets, dishwasher soap, soaps, paper towel, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. You could probably request more of these supplies but we brought or bought them. You must get coffee filters, salt and pepper. I also asked for robes which they had no problem supplying. My son needed a crib and it was a full sized crib, very safe. I brought some crib sheets from home but this wasn't necessary at all. The resort also supplied a high chair for our room. I also brought some beach towels and wouldn't bother to do that again either. We had 8 towel cards and never needed more than 4 towels at a time. I always try not to pack too much but of course I did again. This can be an issue with a car rental as we just barely squeezed our luggage in the vehicle. Remember when you are packing that you have laundry facilities and 80 percent of your day you'll be in your bathing suit. So don't pack all those just in case extra clothes. We didn't want to spend a lot on food so we made the majority of our meals. The resort has bbq's set up around the property which we used several times for dinner. It was a great way to make a meal and socialize too. I did not hear anything great about the food at the resort so we only went to the Ocean Grill, for lunch one day. I thought is was very mediocre and we could make better food ourselves. We ate out at Sensei and if you like Sushi, you have to go there. Another great spot was Gazebo for their macadamian nut and pinapple pancakes. We went to the Old Lahaina Lua which I thought was primarily a waste of money. They give you fresh lai's when you walk in and you pretty much serve yourself all night. It is not great with a baby either, since it goes until 8:15pm. Both of our kids were sleeping by the end. If you must go to one of these, book early and get a good seat. The food was good, not great. There is also a higher end Lua that we heard about that maybe we should have gone to instead. If you want to drink your face off from 6 to 8pm then this may be the place for you. We received recommendations to go to Costco to load up on the first day. Costco is a stressful place to shop. I prefer going to Safeway. I don't need a massive sized ketchup bottle for an 11 night vacation. Car rental, we were reluctant but it was worth it. We rented a car for $320 for 11 days. It costs about $100 via taxi to get to the resort from the airport, so most of our rental costs were justified by the $200 savings on taxi's to get from and to the airport. We rented a midsized car from budget when we arrived in Maui. You may wish to arrange that in advance to save a little time. This being said, the shuttle offered by the resort is a worthwhile experience (takes you to whalers village and other close resorts, not the airport). We used it a couple of times to go to the Westin Hotel for a whale watching trip through Gemini (4-6pm), and to go to Blackrock for snorkeling. My favourite part of the trip was snorkeling at blackrock. I am very hesitant when it comes to the ocean, but I was so happy I went snorkeling. Almost the first thing I saw was a big Sea Turtle. Enjoy your trip and definitely try out this place. We plan to rent again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl090909
Reviews.Content: I was more than pleased with the service, cleanliness, and apearance of this hotel. The 1 bedroom condo that we stayed in was very spacious, had a great view, and was very pretty and clean. The beach area was great, and we really enjoyed all the seperate pool areas. (the kids especially enjoyed the pirate ship pool). The resort has many activities that were great for the kids, like watching movies on the lawn, making smores at sunset, and lei making, all of which was fun for the kids (and I can't lie I enjoyed them also). The restaurants were so-so but, we really took advantage of the grills and picnic areas which was a nice touch. If you are looking for good quality family time in a beautiful atmosphere this is definatly a great hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Maui2010_10
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time here in early January. We booked it through Orbitz at a great rate, and everything went very smoothly. We were in a Deluxe 1 Bdrm Ocean View room, which was perfect for our family of 4 - including our two young kids. Having a full kitchen saved us a lot of $$ on breakfast and lunch. Also, having the washer and dryer was a huge convienence. The best part was that everything was super clean - the room and the grounds! The daily maid service was great. We never encountered any sales pitches, which was a huge relief. All said - it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for days, loud, garbage in the room and they made us switch rooms numerous times”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLucy
Reviews.Content: We are here for the end of December, all of January and much of February (though we may leave early if it gets much worse- if that's even possible) No hot water so I call front desk who puts me through to engineering. They say it will be fixed and it is by the next day. But then I am told the next day it was a "temporary fix" and it goes down for TWO MORE DAYS. They said no credit would be issued to everyone because it was an engineering issue (whatever that means!) We were put in a sixth floor room (as high as it goes) right over the bar and at 4am they'd smoke and talk and we'd hear (and see) them taking out the garbage , clanking tons of dirty dishes, and spraying mats with a hose very loudly. At 4am! Not to mention we'd have to call security nearly every night as it's one big giant scary echo chamber in the courtyard and if people talk outside late at night on their balcony or go in the pool (which is supposed to close at 10 but people go in later) it can take a long time (if ever) before security steps in. Tiny thin beach is all coral and not good for swimming or body boarding. Good for snorkeling but I've seen better snorkeling AND the beach is at a nearly 45 degree angle so NOT good for walking.. There is a big giant opaque window between the bedroom and bathroom. Now since it's a FIVE HOUR difference when we arrive so naturally we might be on different sleep schedules. I would like more than a window between myself and the bathroom if my significant other gets up first (which he does!) and is in there shaving or showering/using bathroom etc. Such a joke. Gym is tiny and towels were overflowing.... I needed to call the room from there and is there is a phone but it's for emergencies only. I CANNOT EVEN CALL THE ROOM from the phone there to ask a question before walking what seems like a mile from the room (oh and even longer from room to the car!!!) and I could find no phones anywhere where I could call and ring the room if I didn't have my cell phone handy. We'd call front desk numerous times and they'd say we're busy we'll call you back. They almost never did. We'd have mail waiting for us but many times they'd not call to tell us even though it was important. Or they'd give us one piece and not the rest and it just sat in a drawer with everyone else's mail not sorted like at a NICE resort. Even once we moved to a quieter room there was noise next door with some kind of construction they had to do. As I write this there is more being done elsewhere in the building and our phone rang and there was no one there. The construction is getting louder and louder and I will quit writing now but would suggest that you never stay here, never EVER BUY HERE. and go elsewhere on the island or better yet... If you're far from Hawaii try a cheaper island in the Caribbean which is just as beautiful and much closer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to our life together”
Reviews.Author: BelisaSalon
Reviews.Content: The Westin Ocean resort villas were exactly what I pictured! Perfect for the start to our honeymoon. We stayed in an ocean front villa in the new North tower. It was spectacular. The grounds are impecable. So so so clean and sanitary. There were always workers working. It was great to see. And they were so friendly. Oh my God, its hard to describe but it was all just perfect and beautiful. We stayed there for one week, on the second week of our honeymoon we stayed at the Hyatt in Kaui, I cried when we walked into the room because I felt like we were downgrading! I wanted to turn around and go back to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort...Depending on which unit you get”
Reviews.Author: JFTD
Reviews.Content: Vacationed here with my wife and 10 and 12 year old boys. The resort is great for families. We stayed in a "deluxe ocean view studio villa" which was very similar to other traditional Westin hotels, but had a kichenette (no oven, however) and a washer/dryer. Our only reservation is that we think we got a somewhat less desirable unit. Our studio looked over the kiddie pirate ship pool, so there was a lot of noise during the day. No big deal - we have kids too. Our "ocean view" was just the slightest view of the water that you could only see if you poke your head outside on the terrace. The "terrace" was literally one foot deep, so you can't, for example, put a chair or table outside and drink coffee or read as the kids sleep in. Other studios in other buildings have better views and have real terraces, but none were available to us during our stay. The lobby, multiple pools, beach, and tennis courts were great. The whole place was very clean. Unlike others, we found the concierge helpful, but we used the main desk in the lobby, not the little satellite concierge stations. Parking was easy and $7/day. I think valet was the same price but we did not use it. Wired and wireless internet access was free. Use of the tennis courts and racquets was also free. The location is good with acceptable snorkeling off of the resort's beach, but better, calmer waters with better coral and fish are just 10 min down the road at mile marker 14. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants, as we always try to find less touristy, more local places to eat when we travel. We did not get bombarded with timeshare pitches - a welcome surprise. Despite our reservations of our specific unit, we enjoyed this resort and think it is a good value that is especially suited for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New resort that lacks charm and character”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with the small kitchenette. Everything is very new, you have your granite countertops which is standard now at most brand new/renovated hotels, and the neutral decor, flat screen tv, dark cabinetry, etc. Very nice, sleek decor. But it just lacked that Hawaiian flavor. It could have been the same interior decor at a hotel in NYC. Call me picky, but I've stayed at numerous hotels and resorts in Hawaii, and I just didn't get that wonderful Hawaiian cultural magic that you get at other resorts. No live Hawaiian performers, hula dancers on the premises, I didn't see any lei making (maybe it was there, just didn't see it). To me that's all part of the Hawaiian experience. These kinds of criticisms may sound hokey to some, but it really does add to the ambiance, believe it or not. But, on the other hand, I see why they do not add this type of thing at this place, it just would not fit. This place is very laid back. Although the pools can get very crowded. I really did not like their beach/pool towel policy...they were having guests not return towels so they more or less rationed them and you had to give them some collateral in order to get a towel. Thought that was VERY tacky. Again, been to MANY resorts in Hawaii, and never ran into this type of ridiculous policy. It creates unnecessary stress for the guest. This part of Kaanapali beach is very nice and uncrowded, the location is not bad. You can take a free shuttle to the Westin's sister resort which is right near the outdoor Whaler's village mall. That was nice for shopping and dining. I was just not over-impressed with this property. I give it 3.5 stars. It was kind of a very nice, new, but generic family resort on Maui. But, yes, I would still recommend it to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Love Kaanapali, but Westin needs to get back to basics with service”
Reviews.Author: mattkingston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children (5 and 2) just returned from a beautiful week in Kaanapali. We are owners of the Westin Kaanapali Villas North and usually have very possitive things to say about Westin properties, but this weeks experience left us dumbfounded by the lack of attention to detail and the sub-par hospitality and service. The property is beautiful and our room was great. Our complaints centers around the poolside service, kids activities, concierge service and overall general management of the property. For those that do not know, the two locations (South and North Villas) make up one large resort that share activities. The north location has a very good Italian steak house restaurant (open Thurs-Sun) and a pool side grill (hot dogs, sandwiches, hamburgers, drinks etc..) The South side only has the one pool side bar/grill (open till 10pm) The Bad: I should state that my wife used to manage a restaurant and we are generally very accomodating to restaurant staff and delays. This was not the case at either the south or north location as the resort was maybe 60% full and hardly anyone was at the pool side bar/grill. The wait staff had an "indifferent" attititude towards customers and seemed to not care less about the patrons or their hungry/thirsty children. We seemed to be intruding on their chit chat time. We ate at the Italian restaurant one night and had a great meal and service, unfortunately it is only open 4 nights/week. We ate at the pool side bar/grill at both the north or south location probably 6 times. Beware-the service at either pool location is terrible. If you like to wait for 10 minutes before even being noticed that you have sat down, then you'll love this place. We had to ask the "waiter" 3 times for water and then we just gave up and got our own at the bar. We waited 30+ minutes for our food and drinks and when we brought to the waiter attention that we needed Ketchup for the fries, mayonaise for the burger etc... we had to wait again... and it never did come. Plenty of "sorry for the wait" were thrown about, but day after day it was the same thing. Their attitude was "apologies for the service, and hope they leave". When you pay $15 for a burger and $4.50 for a coke, that attitude does not fly. Also note, that the pool side grill on the north side closes at 5pm for food (open to 8pm for drinks) forcing everyone at both resorts to go to one poolside restaurant during the evenings midweek. Why in the world the Westin only has one pool side grill restaurant open Mon-Thursday after 5pm is beyond me. It forces customer to have to walk up north to Dukes, or 10 minutes to the whalers village mall. They seem to be running such a skeleton crew, that they really don't care. Now onto the Concierge staff. You'll notice as your tour the properties, that they have booths scattered throughout the property with busy looking attendants tap, tap, tapping away on their computers (doing what, I have no idea). We had various questions about activities both on property and off property that we asked various attentants on different days and always got the same answer " I don't know, let me check google". One such day I asked a simple questions about the cost and departure times of the "lahaina train" that is located directly accross the road from the Westin. You would think that a concierge who works for the Westin, would either be trained or have some basic knowledge of the activities directly accross the street from thier hotel and surely a popular activity for children (at a family resort), but no. Once again, she had to search google for the times and prices of the train. Unbelievable! One evening I took my 5 year old to the "Smores" cookout which is run by the Westin Kids club staff. Once again, they either have no concept of how to run these activities, or they just don't care. It's a great activity, but can get very messy when todlers and small children are roastin marshmallows. Do you think they had the foresight or experience to maybe have napkins or wetnaps handy? Nooooooo. When I asked if they had any napkins (after noticing 10 kids with melted marshmallow in their hair and on their faces) the Westin employee looked at me and said "No, I can go wet some toilet paper." I had to laugh at the stupidity of this person. So I got up, walked to the bar, asked politely for a wet towel, and returned to the campfire and cleaned up my kid. The Westin employee just looked at me and said "Oh, I'll have to remember that trick". Sounds like I am slamming the Westin, and I guess I am, but for the prices you pay for these villas and the prices you pay for food and the activities, I would expect some level of professionalism and expertise. They have lots of people standing around looking busy, but in reality doing a lot of nothing. They should take the over staffed concierge employees and add them to the restaurant staff. Having to wait 30-40 minutes for service at a half empty pool side restaurant is just a sign of bad management and leadership. If I want poor service, I'll rent a room at the Ramada. The Good: The rooms are fantastic. The pools are glorious. The kids "pirate" pool is a great place for todlers up to pre-teens. The location is wonderful and peaceful. The shuttle service to Lahaina and the Whalers Village is very timely and quick. Make sure to do a "Gemini" whale watch cruse (4-6pm). Best money spent on the trip and saw tons of humpback wales, Sailfish at the surface, dolphins, False Killer whales etc... the staff is hillarious, and full of interesting stories. The food was great too. What a great evening.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GaPO
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels on Maui for months before settling on the Westin Resort Villas. The main reasons for this choice were - age of property, location, and kitchen. The property was immaculate. I believe it was built in 2003, but it felt brand new. We booked the studio, which accomodated 4 of us - 2 in the king bed, and the kids in the open up couch. We paid for island view, but had a view of the pool and the ocean. It was nice, especially w/ the balcony off the bedroom. The kitchenette, while small, was more than sufficient. We had a full size fridge, stove and microwave, plenty of plates, glasses, pots, pans, etc., for anything we wanted to cook. I would recommend that anyone staying here bring paper plates, napkins, plastic cups, etc., The outside cooking areas/grills by the pool were terrific. We did not visit the on site restaurant or stores, as it wasn't necessary since we did our grocery shoppping at the Lahaina Market prior to our arrival. Great for groceries if you want a good selection of wines, beers, cheeses, etc. Small store, but lots of gourmet choices. This property is a mile or so down the road from the big Ka'anapali hotels, which we liked; it was much quieter and I didn't feel like I was in an amusement park. The 3 pools were very clean. Our room looked out upon the small pool geared for young children and it was very quiet. The others were split - 1 for families/kids and 1 w/ mostly adults. The family pool was a little crowded. The beach was also quiet - I think because the location was just a little north of the big hotel chains down the street. It was very clean. The Heavenly Bed was very comfortable. The resort offers free shuttle service to/from their other properties, the Westin and Sheraton, although we did not take advantage of it as we had our own car. Parking was only $7 a day at the resort, which we thought was a bargain. When we went to Whalers Village, we parked w/ no problem and as long as we made a $ 15 purchase there, which is not hard to do, the parking was validated for 3 hours. We snorkled off of Blackrock at the Sheraton, my husband and son rented a surfboard and boogie boards from the Maui Surf Shop, located right as you access the beach on the edge of Whalers Village. They were fantastic; not only did they provide equipment, they had lots of good information for us. The concierge was very helpful and booked us for a Luau at the Hyatt as well as a Sunset Cruise w/ Whale Watching. The luau was too big for my taste and everyone was herded in like cattle; however, the food was excellent and my children enjoyed it. The cruise was booked thru Teralani and they did a wonderful job; we booked the traditional cruise w/ appetizers. I would recommend the appetizer versus the full dinner cruise they also offer, if you go during whale season - we found that we were too busy watching whales to want to go downstairs for food (or drinks for that matter, which were also included). My only complaint about the concierge was that she didn't warn us about the temperature at the Haleakala Crater - we should have known, and I"m sure I read about it - but we still weren't prepared and we froze our butts off. However, it was worth it - the sunrise was breathtaking. If you plan to go there, pack jeans, sweater/sweatshirt, jackets, gloves and hat. And bring a thermos of coffee! Overall, we were very pleased w/ the property - my only complaint is that they seemed a little stingy w/ the towels. We liked it so much we almost went to one of their timeshare info sessions. Speaking of timeshare, there was no pressure or any solicitation to speak of other than the mention of their offering while we were there, which we appreciated. I would recommend this location to families with small children or visitors who want a quieter location that is close to everything else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Condo, BUT NOT a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1973
Reviews.Content: The Westin KORV is an overall great CONDO, but I'd stress to anyone considering staying here that it is definitely NOT a luxury resort--for better AND for worse. I've been to Maui several times before, so I wasn't after the full-on resort experience and appreciated Westin KORV's low-key convenience instead. Just be mindful that it is NOT a luxury resort, despite the insistence of other reviewers and the Westin timeshare salespeople. For sure, the Westin KORV has lovely accommodations, convenient parking garage (in the north buildling, at least), a good fitness center (however small) with great equipment, a good-yet-expensive spa, and outdoor grills. Plus, it's nicely situated right on the beach. However, its grounds are impeccable but not luxurious. (It is visibly flanked by a municipal park and an empty construction site.) It doesn't have a golf course. In fact, there are only two "first come-first served" tennis courts on the whole property of 500+ units. (Yes, there were lines. And no, not one of the concierges could point me in the direction of the other off-site courts to which guests have at their disposal, at least according to the the website and in-room guide.) There are no nearby retail shops. For me, the true upset is that there is no decent restaurant on the property. The only "fine dining" option is Puleho, an "Italian" restaurant that is unremarkable at best. (Its Christmas dinner "special" entrees were inedible.) We dined off-site all but for that one bad meal. There's also an average pool grill and a sports bar (with a limited menu and even more limited service) for days at the pool. I stayed over Christmas and New Year's holiday, when the property was around 93% occupancy (I asked) and I must say the pool areas were packed. The proximity between lounge chairs made it easy for me to overhear several conversations between disgruntled and territorial timeshare owners at the property who seem resentful of the great deal that their exorbitant maintenance fees provide hotel guests. I found the staff mediocre. I spoke to several of them to help put a day of golf together and each gave me conflicting or partial info. Another member of concierge services advised that I skip driving to Haleakala Park to see the sunrise, which turned out to be my favorite experience of my eight vacations in Hawaii. Also, beware: I had a room near the lobby (Building 6) and heard the lobby muzak echo loudly starting at 7AM. It's not a problem the front desk cares to address. I tried several times. And a tip: Bring aqua socks or booties. The coral reef in the shore just in front of the hotel is fantastic, but dangerous and many people cut themselves on the rocks. In sum, expect a great condo, but not a resort. I'd stay there again, but I wouldn't recommend to anyone who's looking for the type of luxury and service available at other properties on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly families enjoying their timeshares, but great rooms, beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels503
Reviews.Content: Most people here are timeshare owners enjoying their annual week of family paradise. There are tons of families with young kids. The best part is that you are right on the beach and along a very nice beach walk (of various timeshare developments). You can walk out of your room and be snorkeling in only 5 minutes! Gorgeous sunsets. This is a very large development, many rooms, but the rooms are nicely renovated and very large. You could squeeze 4 people in a studio using the sofa bed. All rooms also have laundry and full kitchen. Families gather in the evenings to use the dozens of hotel-provided gas BBQs for grilling. The hotel's restaurants (and those in nearby hotels) are generally expensive. You can save money on your trip by cooking some meals yourself on the BBQ or in your kitchen. There are also reasonably-priced non-hotel restaurants nearby. The pools and hot tubs are very nice, but crawling with kids. There is a water slide and pirate pool for kiddies too. Fitness room is spacious and nice. Tip: Make sure to rent a car. This property has free self parking. You also don't have to pay a "resort fee" like you do at other Starwoods on Maui. Hotel has a very nice free shuttle service that takes you on a small loop, as far as Lanai, but not very far; shuttle drivers are great. Front desk staff is OK. There are around a dozen concierge desks, and the concierge staff is excellent. Poolside breakfast buffets are elaborate and a good (albeit indulgent) value for $20. If you have gold or platinum Starwood status, you might get nothing for it, as this property doesn't fully participate in Starwood benefits. Sit in for a timeshare tour if you want bonus points. Again, overall, the rooms are very nice. Free wireless Internet too.

Reviews.Title: “This location is FIRST RATE!”
Reviews.Author: anyonecandothis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin 14 years ago, and have been waiting to go back. The service was outstanding, and the location, hard to beat. The grounds are incredible and we enjoyed every minute. We have traveled to many exotic destinations and this is the first time my kids (18 and 13) said they can't wait to come back. (can we can we?) haha You will NOT be disappointed staying here...it's an amazing property!

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered...”
Reviews.Author: Gioia1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin KORV North for our first use of our Westin timeshare (we own in Cancun) from 11/14-11/21 of 2009. At the time I was in the beginning of my 8th month of pregnancy and had LITERALLY just gotten out of the hospital due to some complications. We almost didn't go on this trip....but we were so glad we made it! We stayed at the South property for our honeymoon (which influenced us to buy a Westin timeshare) and wanted to try the North this time around.
