We own a Studio Villa and were upgraded to Oceanfront when we arrived. We stayed in room 5416 which had a small balcony overlooking both the pool and the ocean...with the sliding glass doors closed you couldn't hear a peep - if you left them open at night you could hear the wind and the ocean. I was really limited in what I could do due to the difficulties I was having with my pregnancy so having such a great room and view was a blessing. We ate at both restaurants at this resort (Pailolo was the sports bar - some things tasty, but waaay overpriced. Pulehu was nice Italian but the service was hit and miss.) We also bought sandwiches from the on-site store which was not bad. We both got massages at the spa - and I got a mani/pedi. Extremely expensive, and a total splurge, but worth it at the time. We also used the watersports hut to rent snorkeling equipment for the day. They have changed the way the give you towels from the last time we were at the Westin - now they give you towel cards upon check in which you turn in for towels. If you want new ones, you must turn the used towels in, or if you want your cards back you can do that too and get fresh towels the next day with your cards. There was never an issue with getting lounge chairs by the pool...which was a little on the chilly side, but refreshing if it actually got warm (which it didn't often during our trip ...boo!). There are many different nooks and crannies to the pool, plus there is an entirely different kids pool on the property as well so it was really never crowded. The snorkeling off the beach was pretty good, but it was very windy the day we went plus I couldn't stay in for long so we only did that the one day. One thing we would say is that the concierges that they have there would do everyone a favor if they learned a bit more about the things to do on the island other than their "go-tos" ...we asked several about a few things we wanted to do that a simple internet search could turn up and no one had any idea of what we were talking about. Also they might want to get more than one computer for their business center. Parking is free for owners, not sure for those who are not. Other than that - we decided we actually prefer the North to the South ...it feels a little more secluded and calm, it has better restaurants and the spa. The only thing it is missing is that spectacular view that slays you as soon as you step into the South. Overall - great vacation/babymoon spot!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: 303-LittleBirds
Reviews.Content: I don't have time to go into a long review, so I will sum it up: We cannot wait to go back to this resort. The beach is perfect. The beachwalk to the Ka'anapali strip was perfect. Our room was perfect. The staff was super friendly. For anyone traveling with a toddler, the pools were great (for adults too!). The pirate ship pool and coy pond were absolutely the highlight for our 2 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful resort with super amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: hungtsai
Reviews.Content: The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas (The Westin KORV) was the perfect resort for us as we visited Maui on our honeymoon earlier this month (Dec., 2009). Since our arrival, on a Monday evening, to our departure the following Sunday midday (including a last second visit to the concierge desk for tickets to the Maui Ocean Center), the staff at The Westin KORV was extremely pleasant, professional and helpful during our entire stay. They took cared of my new bride when she needed some medical attention (bruised her knee in the pool). We wanted to moved the DVD player to the bedroom -- and even though I am more than capable of doing it myself -- they insisted upon sending someone to do it for us (and did it promptly). The restaurant staff were great (the food were awesome and priced reasonably), the front-desk staff attentive, the store clerk was helpful, the spa attendants were nice, pool attendants friendly...we had no complaints about any of The Westin employees (even the timeshare meeting with the sales staff was positive...we didn't buy and they weren't pushy)! Rita, one of the concierge in our building was pleasant to chat with despite the fact that we did not book any activities with her. We had already done the research online and reserved off-site activities in advance. The massage therapists in the spa were great when we utilized the facility and opportunity with a couples ritual massage and bath. And, the best part was the whole stay was our amazing villa upgrade! Through a friend, we were able to call in a favor and received a generous upgrade from a studio villa to a 1-bedroom OCEAN FRONT! We had a corner unit on the first floor with ocean/Lana'i and Moloakai view. The view from the balcony as breathless. We were even able to spot humpback whales from our porch! We dined at the poolside bar and grill (awesome fish tacos) as well as Pulehu and recommends both. We definitely recommend this resort. In fact we recommended friends who are getting married in January and looking to go on a honeymoon in Hawaii. As a Starwood Vacation Network member, We also plan on returning to this resort in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful introduction to Maui”
Reviews.Author: Woody98
Reviews.Content: Our family made our first trip to Hawaii with a trip to Maui in March 2009. We found this opportunity at the last minute from the Starwood web site. Te Ka'anapali abuts the beautiful beach on the west side of Maui. Behind the resort, the mountians are frequently shrouded in mist from the 400 inches of rain, while the beach area enjoys near constant sun. The resort has two adjacent branches, each with its own pool and other amenities. Our daughter enjoyed the pools, I loved the yoga and exercise classes offered at the resort. Rooms were large with hot tubs, full kitchens, wireless Internet, and a deck overlooking the pool. We watched whales breach and dolphins swim from the beach, and our whale-watching trip was a highlight. The resort consierege helped us arrange a luau from the many available. It was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin Villas”
Reviews.Author: heatherandjohn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Villas 12/11/09-12/18/09 in the north wing. We rented from an owner that we found through craigslist and felt we really got a great value for the money. When we arrived we were upgraded for free to oceanview, perhaps because we were there during a slow week. (We were in building 5, room 5407.) We had a great view of the ocean, but it also overlooked the restaurant area by the pool. I'm not complaining because we didn't pay extra for the ocean view. We were in a studio unit which was more than enough space for the 2 of us. We used the kitchenette almost every day to make breakfast and sometimes lunches to go. The kitchenette had all of the utensils that we needed. I did bring with me some items suggested by mamma0233 who is an owner and an expert on the Westin Villas. The items were: Coffee filters (regular not cone), gallon zip lock bags (for marinade, wet suits, storing leftovers, etc), small roll tin foil (to cover food and keep warm on the way back to the villa from the grill, salt and pepper shakers (picnic set), spices (small amounts twisted in saran wrap), fabric softener sheets, sample boxes of tide (or you could buy the powder and pre-measure out in ziplocks), and 4-5 dishwasher tabs. The only complaints about the villas, and they weren't a huge deal were the pool was only 3-4 ft deep which is great for children but not adults. And also the parking spaces outside were all for compact cars. We would park our compact out there and come out and be flanked by 2 SUV's and have dings on both sides of our car. There were some regular spaces inside the garage, but not a lot. The shuttle service was great for when you didn't want to drive to the Ka'anapali boardwalk or Lahaina. We felt no pressure to buy a timeshare; we were asked once by the concierge and when we said no were never asked again. Overall, a great value and great location and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Resort Villas - A bit of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Monsey-Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas for 6 nights in the beginning of December. We came in at Kapalua Airport which is a short drive to the resort. We arrived in early afternoon and were happily informed that our room in the north building was ready and that we had been upgraded to a villa in the courtyard with an ocean view. Although we didn't consider it a "villa", it was a very lovely studio suite with all the amenities we needed; Nice size room for 2 people, modern kitchen with granite countertop, wooden cabinetry (dishes, glasses, pots & pans, cooking utensils, silverware, etc.), full size refrigerator, large microwave, glass burners, washing machine/dryer, great "heavenly beds", living room area with a sofa, flat screen TV, table & chairs, jacuzzi tub, separate glass shower and a lanai. The landscaping around the property is exquisite. There are lush gardens and exotic flowers throughout. Coy ponds full of beautiful fish. Public areas artfully decorated. Multiple pools: large pirate ship one for young kids, water slides, waterfall pool, lazy river, hot tubs, all overlooking the beach & ocean. We watched magnificent sunsets there. The property has a couple of restaurants; live entertainment each afternoon by the one near the beach. Ka'anapali beach is breathtaking; fine, golden sand, aqua waters with small waves. Tiki torches light the property in the evening, giving it a a romantic and mystical feel. We found the staff helpful and followed up promptly on our requests. We used the Westin shuttle a couple of times and found it to be convenient.There was a wonderful craft fair under a tent on the lawn near the beach one afternoon. We loved our stay at the Westin Resort Villas. It was a bit of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel resort !”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas for 2 nights and I really loved it. I was simply amazed when I arrived in the room, it's simply an apart, you have everything ! Kitchen + marble countertop + washing machine + ... Breakfast buffet was good and served on a terrace at the restaurant. There's a big swimming pool + jacuzzi. The beach is nice, not too crowded. It's about 10 mins drive from Lahaina and about 45 mins from Kahului Airport. I suggest this hotel resort if you wanna relax with your familly or with your partner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but remember it is a timeshare”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in December in a one bedroom, The villas are very beautiful but don't expect any kind of view. As it has been written on TA before they are saved for the owners. Even though the resort was only about 60% occupied we got a crappy location. At first they tried to put us in a handicapped room. The housekeeping was off and on. We were supposed to have it every day as we were renting directly from the Westin. One day it was great and the next was horrible. A few times, besides taking out the garbage (that was ready to go by the front door) you never would have known housekeeping came by. Bathroom and kitchen not touched. Only other thing they touched was the undeserved $5.00 tip that was sitting on the counter. The pools and grounds were beautiful and the beach was very decent. Even got to see some whales from the shore. What we found was unlike the feeling of Maui in general, there is no warm fuzzy feeling from any of the staff members here. It seemed everyone from the valets to housekeeping, servers, concierge and front desk staff hated their jobs. No smiles or alohas. So unlike the Sheraton we had been to. Asked one concierge for some tips for the Road to Hana. He basically threw a map at us after circling part of the highway. When pressed for where to stop he told us "wherever you see other cars stop". Gee, thanks. They are there to sell timeshares so don't waste their time. Too bad because they are just sitting there all day doing absolutely nothing. With that kind of service who would want to buy into that place? They have one computer in the lobby. When we needed to print out a sheet for a car rental before leaving we were forced to wait over an hour as we were third in line for the computer. And no, the front desk staff nor the concierge who are sitting there doing nothing will not print it out for you. We ate once at the buffet breakfast. Offerings were very unimpressive. We sat with a pile of dirty plates waiting to be taken away. They never were. Coffee never refilled. After being seated we never saw the server again until presented with the bill. The general store is grossly overpriced for what they sell. The $3.50 rotting avocados, as well as pricey rotting limes and rusty lettuce. Stale sandwiches. The most expensive bag of Lays chips you will ever buy. ABC store items at 300 percent mark up at least. To boot, there is a tip jar for the cashier! Classy. If you want half day child care it will cost you $60 per kid. Any other kid activities have a fee where other hotels offer them for free, for example lei making. Overall just left with a very cold feeling at an otherwise beautiful looking property.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, convenient, with all the amenities...”
Reviews.Author: MandragoraMaggie
Reviews.Content: Little kids think this place is Disneyland! Koi the size of submarines, a flock of flamimgoes, parrots, swimming pools connected by caves and waterfalls...our 4 year old grandaughter was in heaven. All the rooms are very nice (the older tower a bit small) with comfy beds and mini fridges (could have used a microwave!). We chose the budget option overlooking the back of the hotel, with a beautiful view of the mountains, which we were happy with. We like to snorkel...and Black Rock is a fair walk...but still ok. Whaler's Village next door has lots of shopping and Hula Grill Barefoot Bar is far superior to the poolside restaurant at the Westin (lower prices AND much better food).

Reviews.Title: “Westin Quality service”
Reviews.Author: Annie_in_CA
Reviews.Content: Westin Service/Quality always delivers! The staff was wonderful, and the villas had a great homey feel to them.

Reviews.Title: “$342 a Night for Maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: travscam
Reviews.Content: $2,400 a week maitenance, in my opinion, is pure BS. If I had any idea that the fees would be so high, I would not have bought. I was staying at the Fairmont Kie Lani, 1 night free with 5, and really loved the location and weather. . I see salespeople escorting potential buyers around. Maybe they should stop and talk to a current owner while making their presentation. How would they sell around the maintenance fees. This issue is like a thorn in my butt. Buyer Beware!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LuvToTravel001
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the North Villas. Both times we were not disappointed. We stayed in a two bedroom villa and with young children did not have to think twice for anything. With a full kitchen we went to Costco and the local grocery store, did a weeks worth of shopping and were set. The BBQ grills were always available will all amenities needed in the room. Locaiton is great for families becuase it is secluded and away from the hustle and bustle. The shuttle service in very convineint. There is abundant room on the beach and pools. Great location for snorkeling!

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: 99torun99
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Westin Maui Resort. We had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the ocean, there are several pools, waterfalls and ponds with black swans. There are so many activities such as sailboats rides to Turtle Bay for snorkeling, wave runners and so much more that are located just outside the hotel or a short walk down the beach. Lots of shops and fantastic restaurants onsite and next door. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alaskaslack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the villas for eleven days and enjoyed every minute of it. We loved everything about the property my kids had a blast in the pools and the food was good but expensive.The service was top notch our room was cleaned every day. If you are planning a vacation with kids this is the place to go.We had a one bedroom unit and it had more room than we could have hoped for we definitely didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for families.....not great for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: spyder73
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui for 2 weeks, one week in Wailea and the other in Ka'anapali. The Westin is by no means a hotel with people waiting on you hand and foot... so for couples looking to have they're honeymoon there, think again. For people that have children or are looking to cut costs and not eat out every meal and still have a great vacation, this is it. Go to the grocery store or costco and buy a week's worth of food and drink before heading to the villas. The place is fairly new and very clean. I can't comment on the service, because the only people I really interacted with was the front desk, you are pretty much left on your own. If you own a timeshare, try and trade to stay at this one for at least a week.

Reviews.Title: “Best room for us!”
Reviews.Author: US9
Reviews.Content: The lady who checked us in upgraded our room to an ocean view (really), without me even asking. the room was very private from everone else because it was in the corner. The room was just right for 2 (studio)...no oven (microwave with grilling feature), room was dark without drapes pulled back all the way. washer/dryer in room... normal sized fridge... no counter space for prep work... dishes, pans, etc... like other timeshare villas gas grills in abundance with tools... ON BEACH ... pllos and restaurants on site!

Reviews.Title: “Best Italian Restaurant in Ka' anapali”
Reviews.Author: Ice091
Reviews.Content: Lee Ann was the server. Chef prepared the best Italian dinner our family had on the island. It's that simple. Make the reservation. Don't bother even thinking about looking elsewhere. We came back to our room and kept talking about the Pulehu Restaurant. Outstanding fare. Service. Atmosphere. Will we come back? You bet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best in the world”
Reviews.Author: lonnyzone
Reviews.Content: Not cheap. The owners get better treatment. I go every year.

Reviews.Title: “NOT AN WESTIN OWNER”
Reviews.Author: silkysmoove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are experiencing our last night at the resort, so this is still fresh in my head. We exchanged through Interval prior to making the trip. SINCE WE ARE NOT OWNERS WE DIDN'T RECEIVE OCEAN FRONT OR OCEAN VIEW. Our accomadations were beautiful in our one bedroom villa. THE FRONT DESK WILL MAKE IT VERY CLEAR THAT SINCE YOUR NOT AN OWNER OF THIS PARTICULAR PROPERTY DON'T EXPECT OCEAN VIEW OR FRONT. The owners probably pay over $80,000 for a view and $90,000 for a front. Actually the hotels in the area have a better view of the ocean than the villas and or condos. The amenties are better in a villas, of course. Please call the resort 2-3 days prior to request an ocean view and you MAY get something,but don't expect it if you don't ask. A VERY BEAUTIFUL PROPERTY OVERALL.

Reviews.Title: “Other side of coin”
Reviews.Author: Stoneharbor
Reviews.Content: I read aAbby Galel's review with a smile on my face. I am an owner and am very happy with preferential treatment. I can reserve further in advance and thus lock in a better room. If occupancy is low, traders will also have the opportunity of obtaining a better room. Did not understand the parking comment. We had two cars and always had a space. Absolutely no need for valet. The reviewer was also talking about KOV-N and not KOV. KOVN has a dark bottom pool.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT buy a Starwood timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Hurcules
Reviews.Content: We foolishly purchased a Starwood 2 bedroom Westin Kaanapali in early 2005 when annual maintenance fees were about $1,300. Starwood has since jacked up the fees to $2,361 per year, in part to reimburse the company for other owners who have not paid their annual fees. Fees will likely be even higher next year. It is timeshare hell. We can not afford these extreme fees and can not sell because no one else wants to bear this burden either. Starwood/Westin are very aggressive in selling and in jacking up the rates without regard for the timeshare owners. BEWARE. Please do not make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trade Into the Westin !!!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyGalel
Reviews.Content: We own 2 beautiful oceanfront 1 bedroom villas in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico on a floating week basis. This trip to Maui was our 5th trip, we traded one of our weeks through Interval International and obtained a studio unit at the Westin Ocean Villas North. I had done alot of research including Trip Advisor and felt very good about the trade. Upon check-in the Front desk showed me where our villa was. It was a parking lot and highway view at the very back of the resort. I told her that villa was not acceptable, the next villa that was offered was on the ground level overlooking the koi pond and next to the restaurant. I asked if there was a possibility to upgrade and she offered an oceanfront for an additional $150 Per night plus tax. We accepted....however the villa was in an oceanfront building our room had a view of an empty lot, construction site and a glimpse of the ocean. These rooms are called Villas but are really only a hotel room at best. They are very clean, have nice amentities but are tiny. The grounds are clean but the atmosphere at the Westin seems almost sterile. Where did all the beautiful flowers go?? The pools have all been painted a dark blue-green gray to make you feel like you are in the ocean ? Parking was a nightmare, we chose valet parking for $8.00 per day plus $5.00 for tax. The breakfast buffet at $20.00 per person was very minimal and the restaurants had no view. Were we really in Maui ? I placed a call to Interval World and shared our experience. Customer service offered to move us to the Marriot. I turned this offer down since we had already paid the extra $150 per night which is non-refundable. Interval did refund me my trade fee and return my week back to me. Interval World is a Class Act. Upon Check out the Front desk asked how my stay was and I explained our experience. I was shocked when she replied "Our Best Rooms Are for Our Owners. How would you feel if at your home resort you had a Non-Owner next to you." Unbelievable ! The experience is making us a little gunshy about trading our units again. I read a review today on the Sands of Kahana from another Interal World member who was told the same thing. Fortunately for them, SOK upgraded them from a horrible room to a nice ocean view. I just wanted to share this review with timehare owners to beware of what can happen when a trade goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place..... We stayed at the Villas North”
Reviews.Author: SkagitValleyBoy
Reviews.Content: Recently built, the Westin Resort Villas is a timeshare type property, and we had a 2 bedroom garden view room. On the trip was myself, my wife and a friend, so the two bedrooms worked out nice! The rooms were very nice, which would be expected from such a new resort. There were great garden views of the Koi pond, and could see the pool from our lanai. An ocean view or ocean front room would be spectacular, but we were not disappointed! All the amenities of home in the room... Frig, stove top, microwave, flat panel TV's... a nice BBQ area outside for all to share, we did this 3 nights! The staff was very friendly, and there are 2 different pools, plus a kiddie pool that has a cool pirate ship for the little ones to play on. The beach was only steps from the pool area, a very nice sandy beach out in front. There is two restaurants along with a pool bar, as well as plenty of dining options within a mile or two. Whaler's Village is just two miles south, and the quaint old fishing town of Lahaina about five miles. We ate there the nights we didn't BBQ! Close to all, but seemed secluded as well. Nice feeling, nice place. We hope to go back to this property again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelfromnyc4life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for a 10 day vacation - stopping in the Big Island and Oahu along the way. We stayed in a 1 BR villa and it was beautiful and very spacious. We especially liked the comfort of having a kitchen and washer/dryer in the villa which made it feel like home. They have a beautiful beach in the back of the hotel and the snorkeling there was better than many of the other areas that we tried out. You can swim pretty far out and the water is still shallow. There are also free shuttles from this hotel to a nearby shopping center which is a plus when you want to do a little shopping. The service is great and the pools were not crowded. It was an extremely relaxing hotel and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: kquarr
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked for a 12 night Honeymoon stay at the Westin, but after 2 nights we packed up and left. Our 'ocean view' room was at the back of the complex, overlooking a service station with constant noisy garbage and laundry carts rolling by. When we asked to be moved we were only given one option, which was overlooking an empty lot and construction site. I wouldn't consider either room 'ocean view'. I pre-ordered an expensive bottle of champagne to be waiting in our room as a surprise for my new wife on arrival. I couldn't find it, but she eventually found it shoved into the bottom of the fridge - no ice bucket or glasses. When we complained to management about our unhappiness, we were told to come down to the front desk to receive a welcome gift - we assumed that they were finally getting the picture that we were unhappy. Our 'welcome gift' consisted of a bunch of pamphlets on tours we could pay for. Thanks a lot. We spoke to at least 5 or 6 different staff about our unhappiness with the room and service, but nobody seemed to care - we didn't get a single apology and our calls were never returned. We've stayed at other Westin properties before and have always had good experiences, but after this experience we'll never stay at another Westin again. Not because of the property, but purely because of the horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved the Westin!!”
Reviews.Author: haneya
Reviews.Content: This place totally surpassed all of my expectations. My husband and I were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary. The room was HUGE and immaculate. We had a 1 BR villa. The staff were wonderful. We did the breakfast buffet 2 mornings and watched football or baseball while eating..it was wonderful. The fish tacos for lunch were absolutely fabulous. They have a wonderful lounge for departing guests and have an area to take showers with shampoos and soaps and towels so you can hang by the pool or beach on your last day and still clean up before heading to the airport. The beach was nice..we did snorkel out on our beach but found a nicer reef outside of the Sheraton right down the road for snorkelling. There is some beautiful black rock and we watched some cliff divers and snorkled and saw Sea Turtles swimming not far from the shore. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We stayed here with our transfered disney points. No one tried to sell us on this timeshare property at all. We stayed on the "older" south side but we walked over to the newer North building and actually decided that we liked the south side better..it was quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: isa99
Reviews.Content: The villas at the Westin Maui are the most amazing. With kitchenettes, living rooms and spacious balconies, I do not want to return home. I want to live life in paradise just a little longer at the Westin Maui Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Westin the Best”
Reviews.Author: jackswanzy
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Maui, this was the place to stay. Quiet, amazingly so, in light of the large number of children staying at this place. So close to the beach, the waves lulled us to sleep at night. Beautiful beyond imagining.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Joyce-DiV
Reviews.Content: Three senior women traveled and shared time share studio. We stayed at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas North. Large king bed and a pullout couch. Jacuzzi bathtub, Large glass shower, The kitchen was very well equiped, ice maker, dish washer. Lots of dresser space. Great gas grills, Beautiful pools. Clean and beautiful beach. Great snorkeling! Staff was warm and friendly. Plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MauiMama808
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful villas and facilities, wonderful weather, October is good time to visit Maui -- less crowds and traffic

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first vacation with family”
Reviews.Author: kimcheebaby
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip with a 6 month old so we were very apprehensive about where we stayed. We chose to stay at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort. It was a timeshare unit we traded for our unit elsewhere. ROOM: The room was clean, and laid out nicely. It had a kitchen, washer/dryer, tub, shower, large bed, and a seating area. They provided a "heavenly crib" for our 6 months old. She loved the crib! It had a nice mattress and the sheets were soft. We stayed in a studio so we had to create an area for the baby behind the sofa. SERVICE: Everyone was very friendly. They gave us an option to give up housekeeping in exchange for their breakfast buffet. We got housekeeping every 3rd day and was very comfortable. There were also grills downstairs by the pool that we used almost everyday. LOCATION: This resort is on a beautiful stretch of beach north of the main Kaanapali strip. The pros is that there is very few people at the beach, great snorkeling within a few yards from the sand. The cons is that you have to drive everywhere. With a baby, we stayed in most of the time and took trips during the day. It would have been nice to be able to go back to the room for a break but that was difficult to do. OVERALL: Great resort for some rest and relaxation even with a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but service could be better and there are better and cheaper hotels.”
Reviews.Author: rhysy_boy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a nice hotel with great beachside activities and surroundings, but after exploring the area and getting to know Maui and Kaanapali and Lahaina, there are certainly better hotels and more value to be had. The other Westin and Sheraton are by far better situated (in the heart of whalers village) and now that we have retrospectively checked were significantly cheaper for better rooms. The service was almost standard, nothing great, when asked for anything slightly out of the ordinary it was convoluted, time consuming and frustrating to deal with - not what you need on a honeymoon. After travelling around Maui, speaking to other holidaymakers and locals, we ended up checking out, and staying at the Maui Coast Hotel in Kihei - substantially cheaper, equally well positioned, great amenities and significantly better service.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel, location, swimming pools amenities great for kids”
Reviews.Author: mauiSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent 2 minuets to the beach walking distance to shops short drive to Lahaina. The hotel has great swimming pools, and amenities the rooms are quite small we are two adults one child so for us doable, very clean and comfortable, the buffet breakfast was excellent but expensive, all in all we had a great stay, and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: adhoboo1
Reviews.Content: We went through a costco package and enjoyed our time at the Westin Villas. We had a studio that was supposedly ocean view. We were on the 2nd floor though and our view was more of the pool and not the ocean. From talking to others, that seems to be what "ocean view" is. The resort is clean, nice, and has a great kids pool. Our 18 month old liked the kiddie pool with a pirates ship and 2 slides into the water. The resort is right on the beach, with fairly good snorkeling. We ate 1 night at Pulehu which was free with the costco package and the dinner was pretty good with a very good chocolate cake for dessert. We both got massages from the Heavenly Spa which was partially covered again with the costco package and enjoyed our time in the spa. We had the breakfast buffet every morning which was good. The location is very central and accessible to a lot of attractions nearby. We liked that the resort that was family friendly. Our only complaint is that the rooms are close together and you have to go through 1 door, and then another door. We had 2 noisy neighbors and everytime they went in or out, the door slammed and would wake our infant. On our floor, all the rooms are paired but im not sure if other buildings are like that. The costco package was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody needs to go to hawii once”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie3331
Reviews.Content: The Westin was one of the nicest place I had gone, From the check in time to the check out were the nicest people. Made you feel special, they were the best. Walking to the ocean right outside our door. Snorkled right there, The shuttle service was awesome always on time and the drivers were very helpful. Took a maui hike, the guide was great, took us where most people did not know. Zip-Line was scarey, but the rest of my group loved it. Very,Very,nice place

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place, but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: oregonmother
Reviews.Content: We have a 3 and 5 year old and stayed in the basic room with 2 queens. We were a little cramped, but didn't spen a lot of time in the room, so it wasn't too bad. The fitness center was awesome and the pool perfect. We will return, but may upgrade to a bigger room next time. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KarenAtx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas with my boyfriend during a trip for my sister's wedding. We had a great time. The resort is beautiful, on wonderful grounds. There are multiple restaurants on site, but it is also only a few minutes to Whaler's village, or 10 minutes to Lahaina if you'd prefer a different atmosphere and shopping. There was a mix-up with our room when we checked in, but this was taken care of quickly and professionally by the hotel staff. Our studio room was perfect for the two of us, and included laundry and a full kitchen. Only negative: the beach was nice, but there are better options in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Trip”
Reviews.Author: wireless_in_CA
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui and spent 4 nights at the Westin. We stayed in a one bedroom/one bath/kitchen unit and it fit us comfortably. Room was well maintained and had a good stock of kitchen items. Very easy access to their beach (snorkeling) and the slide and pool. Very easy drive to Lahaina and many nearby top rated beaches. The resort was busy but not so much that you were fighting for lounge chairs or spots on their beach. We visited two other resorts in Maui and those were just packed and too crowded. This The best part of the deal was getting this on Expedia at almost 1/2 off the regular rate during one of their one day sales. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui, Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: onceawolfgirl
Reviews.Content: We visited Hawaii for the first time in September 2009. We had a wonderful experience at the Westin Resort and Spa and enjoyed snorkeling for the first time as well as trips to Haleakala and Iao Valley. We found everyone to be friendly, helpful and gracious. My only complaint was the humidity so would probably plan a return trip at a different time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “awesome trip”
Reviews.Author: djbige
Reviews.Content: Are hotel room was absolutely perfect 30 ft from water. We could see gray whales every day from the lanai. When visiting maui may i suggest making your flight time and check out time close. we had time to kill and went to whalers village were are car was broke into and all our possessions stolen. Part of the ongoing meth problem on the island . greatest trip ever till last 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Surroundings, Beautiful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: nuts7hawk
Reviews.Content: While the time-share pitch takes some time, it's a great trade-off to be able to stay in these beautifully furnished units. Huge and spacious, I wanted to move in! The large balconies are a great way to spend your early mornings--and you will wake up before the sun when you first get to Maui. This resort is on a great stretch of Ka'anapali beach and within walking distance of great shopping and other Westin properties. What's cool is you can use your room number to charge dinners, drinks and souvenirs at those other properties. I guess I was the most wowed with the furnishings and ambiance--truly classy!

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice place”
Reviews.Author: hairbygail
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a nice place to stay. There are very nice and big Barbaque grills, which makes it a more affordable eating choice.But groceries are Very expensive! The rooms are spacious and nice. It was not real relaxing because of the SCREAMING kids. Also DON"T walk on the beach at night. My husband was muged on the beach. 4 guys beat him up and took his cash. The Italian restaurant was not good.The pool bar restaurant was good. It is a bummer that you have to pay to have a lounge chair on the beach. Also you have to pay to rent the Cabanas. The grounds and the landscaping are Beautiful! Overall we had a very nice time except for that nasty mugging.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Bad Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: dertwerksinc
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my wifes first trip to Maui. After reading a few reviews of this Resort, we decided to book the trip thru costco.com. We did not encounter any of the problems others on this site commented about. The staff was great, the room was clean and very nice. We had an Ocean-View Deluxe One Bedroom, room 7674. It was awsome! Great view, quiet and very big. We mainly hung out on the beach, which by the way has no waves, but is fun for snorkeling. Not many fish, but I did see a few and a turtle! It was a very quite beach, so it was perfect for us. We ate a few times at the Ocean Bar and Grill located on site and it was decent. Cost for the two of us was about $50 for dinner. The cocktails were about $9 each. The beakfast buffett was fair at best, but was free eveyday from costco. We did have one bad experiance. On one night we went down to Front St and ate at uths Chris Steak House. We love Ruths in San Diego. The wife and I had Ribeye Steak and Lobster. A few hours later we were confined to the restroom in our hotel room. On a side note, we were not approached about a time share with this property. When we go to Maui again, we would not think about staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Sterile Place Suited to couples and families more interested in Pirate Slides than ocean & beauty”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler who ended up in a family resort. With that said: 1. Misnaming: These are not "villas" they are hotel rooms with small kitchenettes. 2. No View: The hotel forms a "V" pointing to the ocean. Unfortunately, each room is set back 20 feet from the one before it. As a result, rather than looking at the ocean, all one sees is the beige wall of the neighboring room. What a waste! 3. The place is filled with plastic pirate ships and water slides and such. Perfect for toddlers. But hardly a romantic getaway place. 4. The resort is located on one of the more beautiful snorkeling reefs in Maui. Highly recommended. It makes one wonder why everyone is in the pool. 5. Prices are high, even for Maui. 6. The hotel is constantly trying to up-sell (activities, time shares, you name it.). It gets annoying after a while. 7. Getting to one's room requires zig-zagging through an unending maze of corridors. 8. On the bright side, the staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: wsbfamily
Reviews.Content: It just baffles me that anyone would write poor reviews about this property. Funny thing is that in nearly all of the bad reviews the reviewer talks about how annoying it is that their are so many children here..hello people, if you go on this property's website you will see that this is an extremely child friendly property complete with a pool with a pirate ship and small waterslides. Were these people misled that their might be loads of kids here? No way. If you do not have children or enjoy lots of kids around then do not stay here because you are a grinch and your expectations are unrealistic and unattainable. On the other hand, if you do have kids and/or enjoy kids you will LOVE this property. We actually moved to this resort from another resort for this specific reason. Kids and families are treated well here. They have a kids activity center, kids pools, and they accomadate kids well at the restaurants on-site with special menus and such. Hey, just because we have kids doesn't mean we don't deserve to stay at 5 star accomadations right?! Enough said about that... Food: Amazing. Staff is also very accomadating and prices are reasonable Rooms: Beautiful and huge. I agree that the foldout couches are uncomfortable, but have you ever slept on one that IS comfortable? I didn't think so. Rooms are clean and outfitted with everything you will need for your stay. Store on site...fabulous feature. Movie rentals on site too. The grounds and pools are just sensational, they take very good care of this property. Service so far for us has been second to none. We pulled up 2 hours before check-in and the valet quickly unloaded our car, put our groceries on ice and said they would handle everything...they did. They were fabulous. Since we were so early we couldn't check into our room yet as it was still being cleaned but they set us up in the day room so our toddler could have a nap and we could freshen up or whatever..we soon got a call on our cell telling us our room was ready early and they were most accomadating. Overall...excellent. Like I said, if you are parents, you will enjoy all that there is here to keep your little ones entertained so you can relax and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Suites work out really well for families!”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed in the studio-styled suite, it was comfortable for 2 adults and a toddler. The kitchenette was great - be forewarned that there is no oven, only stove and microwave. But there is a dishwasher and washer/dryer in the unit - FABU! We shopped and brought supplied to the resort. Ate one lunch at the cafe/grill - they did have a good deal where kids ate free, if you ordered an entree. I also noticed there was a happy-hour with specials but did not experience that. Our time at the Westin was spent just hanging out. We tried both regular pools and the pirate ship pool. I think there was also an adult-only pool, but we didn't bother looking for it. There was pretty good snorkeling right off the beach - clear water, good variety of fish, farily mellow waters. We did that both mornings. We are not usual resort-folks, BUT this was a great place with a kid. Any older kid or with multiple kids, I would have tried to get the one-bedroom suite, vs. the studio we were in.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place.”
Reviews.Author: bjouve
Reviews.Content: We only have good memories from this place. The staff was very good and welcoming. The room was nicely furnished, and it was worth the extra to be in front of the ocean. The best part is the combination of swimming pools. We wish we could have stayed longer !

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, location, and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SarasodaSeattle
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a small child this resort was great! Beautiful location and easy access to the beach. The pirate pool was a hit with my three year old. Staff were warn and friendly. Rooms looked new and clean. Third floor on the north villas offered a view of the ocean. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “They need to fix their shower door!”
Reviews.Author: viviewu
Reviews.Content: this is a five star vacation villa (with kitchen) that is typical of Westin starwood property. however few kinks still need to be worked out such as the shower door that doesn't seal properly even after repair and drawers that doesn't close because it isn't level. The Ka'anapali name is also a bit miss leading, it is actually north of the Black Rock (Sheraton, Westin Kaanapali and the Hyatt Regency are south of the Black Rock which is the real world famous section of the Ka'anapali beach) not that the beach out front isn't bad, it is great just not too many ppl and snorkeling isn't loaded with fish.....bottom line, this is a nice quieter resort. Lei class offer by the resort actually charged me twice for making TWO (2) lei The same class is free at the Whaler's Village shopping mall near the Sheraton resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2214
Reviews.Content: The Westin was wonderful to me and my colleagues...and it made our business trip very very memorable. I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are terrific. The beach is at your doorstep. I walked the beach every day...and the snorkeling was the best.

Reviews.Title: “best place in maui”
Reviews.Author: lovehawaiigirl
Reviews.Content: we just came back from maui and this is a best place in maui - we been maui many many times and we found this is the place to stay hotel have bus to everywhere(free) - lahaina, westin hotel which is right next to shopping mall, and sharaton hotel somebody are always cleaning, even 2 am - really really clean hotel if you travel with kids like us (we have a 2 years and a 9months old babies and this time we have 3 cousins with us -ages 11, 8 and 3 years old) you will love this hotel - kids club is worth to try($35) they do art project and feed fish...and lunch is including close to anywhere and had wonderful service we will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kmb467
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Maui. We had a wonderful time staying at the Westin Kaanapali villas. We stayed on the north side overlooking the pool and gardens. Besides our view being great, I found the rooms to be very spacious and clean. We were 3 couples staying in a 1 bedroom unit with the attached studio lock-off unit. The kitchens are well equipped with everything you'd need to stay in for breakfast or grill outside by the pool for lunch. I read some reviews from this website on this resort and found them very helpful. Here is what I'd recomend to save a few bucks, since Maui is a bit on the expensive side. Definitely go to "safeway" to pick up your groceries and alcohol. We saved a bundle by going directly to customer service and signing up for the club card. We ended up saving almost $70! And our total came out to about $50 bucks per person...this covered 3 breakfasts, 4 lunches, 1 dinner, and countless snacks and drinks. Also go to ABC stores. If you want to use a beach chair by the westin, they will charge you $10/day to use them. we bought a few beach chairs ($20) and mats ($2) and used them daily. Saved ourselves a bundle there as well...especially since we spent most of our time at the gorgeous pools where the chairs are free. Take advantage at check in too when they ask how many beach towel cards each person wants. We all used 2 per person. The grills are abundant and clean. It was nice to have them so close to the pool so we didn't have to change to go eat. Would recommend the following restaurants: Aloha Mixed Plate (fun, with good drinks and local food) Inexpensive too. Mama's Fish House...food was outstanding!! This is a must see place...the mahi mahi is out of this world. And the shrimp wontons appetizer is great too. Also had the banana dessert with macadamia nuts...YUM! Quite pricey, but when you're saving everywhere else you don't mind going there. Hula's...go just before sunset...the views are incredible! And the food was great too! Baja fish tacos, calamari, and ice cream sandwich dessert were just a few of the fantastic things we had. And for Sushi lovers...Sansei is the place. About 10 mins up the road from the westin. The concierge, LeeAnn, set us up there...said there is no better on the island...very fresh! And you must try the shrimp dynamite!! They have a few nights when they offer a 25% discount if you arrive before 6pm. And definitely make reservations....this place was packed with a line out the door down to the road. Seems everyone knows of it. Loved the 'Old Lahaina Luau'. Was a blast!! Been rated the best luau for all of hawaii! Also biked down Haleakula! So worth it to get up early to see the sun rise from up there. May have been my favorite thing of the week. Check out the Maui Ocean Center (aquarium) if you have time. Only takes a couple of hours to go through. We went when it first opened at 9 (since we are east coasters our bodies woke up quite early each morning) Overall, as you can see, we had a fantastic time on Maui...I'm sure you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT IM MOVING THERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melisa0214
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to an oceanfront. It was so wonderful. The hotel was very clean there were people always cleaning. My only one small problem was the breakfast buffet was not that great but it was free because I skipped on a roomcleaning so it was worth it if not you pay $25 a person for maybe 6 items.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: OneMundo
Reviews.Content: Their spa is gorgeous, spacious and oh! so bright and clean. Their Heavenly bed is most comfortable and their sheets are crisp and smooth. Will revisit at the next opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location on Kaâ€™anapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: hellocdm
Reviews.Content: The resort is located on a northern end of Kaâ€™anapali Beach which is quite nice because it is a lot less crowded than the southern end nearing Whalers village. Also, the snorkeling is pretty good on this beach because you do not have as many people in the water as you do with Black Rock. The grounds of the resort are very beautiful with waterfalls in front of both the North and South buildings and also by the pool with the slide. There is also a koi pond outside each of lobby areas at ground level. The grounds have lovely gardens with beautiful flowering shrubs, exotic plants, and trees and are very well maintained. We had a one bedroom unit which was quite large with more than enough room for the three of us. We really liked the dÃ©cor. My daughter really enjoyed having her own TV and room at night in the main living room. It was also great having a washer and dryer because we were able to wash our clothes before continuing our vacation in Oahu for 11 days. Our unit was on the ground level so we had a larger lanai then the units above us. We also had a view of the ocean when we looked to the right and a view of mountains when we looked to the left. The maid service was wonderful. Not only did they do a great job cleaning your unit but they also filled up and emptied your dishwasher, and replenished both bathroom and kitchen supplies each day and removed the trash. The resort provides paper towels, coffee, and tea, and sugar, detergent for both the dishwasher and the washing machine. We booked our trip using Orbitz.com. We paid $1,500.00 for our accommodations and full size car for the week. We originally booked a studio unit but we were upgraded to a one bedroom unit. Prior to our trip I had sent an e-mail requesting an upgrade and informed the resort that we were celebrating our daughterâ€™s 16th birthday. When we got to the resort, we were pleasantly surprised with the upgrade as the reservationist wished my daughter a happy birthday. When I sent the email I sent them my Starwood rewards number. So I would suggest becoming a member of this program prior to making a reservation. One of the other best things about staying at the Westin is the gourmet store next store at the Honua Kai Resort called Aina Gourmet Market. We ate there for lunch every day except for two when we were on excursions and also went there at night for dessert and the best cappuccino I have ever had. The gourmet sandwiches and wraps are outstanding and they also give you a gourmet side salad which was also outstanding. This was something we looked forward to every day. And the best part is the prices are so reasonable and the portions are so large that you could split the sandwich and side. Therefore, two people can have an outstanding gourmet lunch everyday with dessert for about $10 to $15 dollars. One thing you should be aware of is this is a time share resort and you are not going to get the same type of service as a full service resort since many people do cook their own meals and make their own drinks in the units. There is pool service and restaurants at this resort; however, they are not used as much as a full service resort. For example, we usually always have breakfast out when we are at a full service resort. At the Westin, it was just easier for us to have breakfast in our unit. Also, the Westin has gas grills that many families use to cook their lunch and dinners. We didnâ€™t use them but the resort cleans them meticulously everyday. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: lilmac2929
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, we were a tad nervous. All of our fears were completely unfounded. We had a wonderful experience. We stayed Aug 26 - Sept 5. Perhaps it was since it was off-peak, but we didn't find the resort to be crowded at all. We were able to get chairs by the pool, grills for BBQ's each day. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had to wait a tiny bit for check in (5-7 minutes?) but were thanked for our patience and given the same attention the previous group was given - a detailed introduction and welcome. We found some people being rude to the staff, which was a turnoff. The staff seemed to handle these "difficult" customers well and with respect. We booked an island view room, and were given a view that included an ocean view. We are non-owners and stayed in building 7 in the North Building. As non-owners, we were also given the option of daily maid service or free breakfast buffets. I think the maid service for owners is only every three days. We did find ants in our unit one day. When we called, they immediately came up to resolve the problem and were very apologetic and accommodating. Bottom line, it is an island - bugs happen. Tip - Refrigerate your food! The location was great - nearby Lahaina and Whaler's Village. Loved the Hula Grill! We also stocked up at Safeway rather than the store at the property and rented our snorkeling equipment from Maui Dive Shop. I would go back in a heart beat!! The room was great, the people friendly and the location unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: randalland
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here with three other couples in two 2-bedroom villas. Got ocean view room on ground floor which was fabulous! Staff was great, room fantastic and the property beautiful. Walked out our laini door right down to beach with excellent snorkeling. Courtesy vans to other resorts/Lahaina. Went to Luau at Westin Spa hotel which was best I ever attended. Spendy, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - will go back again”
Reviews.Author: barefootVA
Reviews.Content: We had a no hassel check-in and had been upgraded to an ocean view studio when we arrived. Although the walk to the room was long from the parking lot and lobby, we were in building 7 at the North Villas with a great view and very quiet, it was extremely nice and clean with a washer and dryer. They had a very friendly staff and great pools. The coffee pot did not work and they replaced it along with 3 new bags of coffee, nice touch. We traded our timeshare in South Carolina and it was a great experience. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “good for kids bad for everything else”
Reviews.Author: mseguin2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a vacation that involves in- room dinning or daily maid service this isnâ€™t it. I bought a week at this location at a charity auction and assumed because it was a Westin property the service would be similar to other Westin experiences I have had. There was no sense of urgency or anyone onsite that seemed to be authorized to deal with a problem. It was nice to have a big room with full kitchen and in room wash n dryer (that knocked like pots and pans on a chuck wagon), but I donâ€™t go on vacation to do stuff I have to do at home. It was also disappointing to get a â€œdeluxe ocean view villaâ€� that requires you to hang off your balcony to see the ocean. For a few hundred dollars more I could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton and had a slightly smaller room, at a better beach, with exceptional service. My son did love the Pirate Pool, but at the end of the day he has fun in our back yard. We go on vacation so my wife and I can get a break.

Reviews.Title: “We were provided with excellent hospitality and service... plenty mahalos to the staff!”
Reviews.Author: linagirl684
Reviews.Content: The staff was with us the whole way: from when we pulled up to the front of the hotel until we were packing at 5 in the morning. They made sure that we (my family & I) were comfortable every second of every day. Aside from the hospitality, the resort is at a wonderful location in Lahaina. There are so many attractions and activities to do in the area. There are 3+ pools at the resort alone (not including the jacuzzis: 3 adult size pools, 3 kiddy pools, 2 jacuzzis and a slide for the older kids to adults. It was relaxing, yet exhausting from all the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Last Minute Reservation”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELADDICT722
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui when we realized that we didn't like the arrangements we had made prior to our arrival. We toured around and immediately liked the Westin. Although we only had a studio room (kitchen and bedroom together) it served us well. The pool area had plenty of seating and were pretty clean (some people just do not beleive in cleaning up after themselves). They also had grills right at the pools that are cleaned every morning promptly at 7:00am. I watched every morning since I used them every night. I must say all of the residents were very cooperative and I never had to wait for a grill. I was impressed. As you have seen in previous reviews this hotel is definately a time share location. They will leave you a message on the phone welcoming you and stating that they have a gift for you waiting at the front desk. This is their way of getting you in. Just don't do it. We stayed there for 5 days never having to listen to their pitch. As far as the room cleaning, here is the deal. If you are a "guest" of a time share owner you would only get maid service every 3 days. However, if you make the reservation directly through the Westin reservation desk you get daily maid service. The only problem is that the room may not be cleaned as early as you would like. 2 out of the 5 days we stayed at the Westin we left for our daily adventures at around 8 to 9am to return at around 4 to 5pm and the room was still not made up. However, once we called the down to complain they arrived pretty quickly. We actually used the kitchen facilities which were functional. There is a "Foodmart" in Lahaina which had pretty good prices. Ask for a savings card at the courtesy desk and you will save even more. Give it a try and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We return every year”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: We really love this place. It's a home away from home. Try to request the South side because the North side are reserved for non-owners. You can pack less because each unit has the convenience of a washer and dryer. If you pay, you get daily maid service, if you rent it can be requested at small fee per day. Two of my family members were so impressed that both bought units. However, maintenance fee runs 2000.00/year and not sure if it was worth the price tag 48-69K. (now 68-94K) Internet is 'free' but there is a 'resort' fee of 25.00/day. Don't expect to get your room prior to the 4pm check-in time. The cleaning crew has a 3 hour window to make sure everything is clean and in it's place. If you arrive early, there are several places you can relax and look out onto the beautiful ocean scene. Place was booked full, but several pools had chairs readily available unlike the Westin Hotel. Kids prefer the Westin hotel pool, so they rode the Westin shuttle from the Villas to the Hotel on their own. (ours were teen-pre teen age). I recommend a quick run to Costco when you land (next to the airport) to stock up and then there are two local markets nearby, Star Market and Foodland. We BBQ'd everynight (26 of us) and had a great time! If you are looking for RitzCarlton hotel-type lodgings, and not one that reminds you of home, then this is not for you. Stay at the Grand Wailea, in Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: TenTenFive
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really clean and new. The facilities and amenities had enough to keep everyone happy. Everything looked new. They even offered us free breakfast for each day we didnt get room service, it was part of an eco effort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Drer
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, teen daughter and I) just stayed at this resort for 5 nights. We are and have been Starwood Platinum members for years, and have stayed at many Westin and St. Regis properties. We have always received excellent rooms and service. Not this time! This resort was an enormous disappointment, and I'd like to warn you about a few things if you're thinking of staying there. First, it's a TIMESHARE property, not a Westin hotel. If you're not an "owner," this means several things -- first, you will get the lowest priority in terms of room size, type and location, whatever your Starwood status might be. If a lot of "owners" are staying at the resort at the same time (which was the case with us), you are highly likely to get the worst room at the resort. Second, although most of the rooms at the resort are "deeded" as ocean-view and booked/priced accordingly, 90% of the rooms face each other and are really ocean-glimpse, if you lean far enough out of the window -- look carefully at the resort lay-out map. Also, a significant number of rooms have no real balcony -- this is an unconscionable design for Hawaii, but unfortunately true at this resort, and likely to be suffered by the non-"owner" guests. Finally, housekeeping is a disaster at this resort -- again, remember that it's a TIMESHARE property, not a hotel, so the rooms do not get cleaned every day (ours was cleaned once during the 5-day stay), and you may be expected to wash your own towels in your room's washer/dryer. This was never disclosed to us when we made our reservation and came as somewhat of a shock. Overall, I would place this resort in the "worst that Starwood has to offer" category.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: jp92506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from August 6th - August 13th. We chose this hotel based on the fact that it was a Westin but did not want to go back to the crowded Westin Maui. We were not dissappointed. We stayed in the south towers which were well kept. The room was spacious with a queen sized bed, a sofa pullout, and a requested roll away. The bathroom had a nice sized shower along with a jacuzzi tub. The grounds were well kept and the beach was nice. The beach in front of the hotel was good for snorkeling but if you wanted a swimming beach you had to walk farther south due to the reef. The hotel had a couple of restaurants on site which were pricey but convenient if did not want to leave the hotel. Overall, I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for families”
Reviews.Author: mblar
Reviews.Content: This may be the best property of its kind on this part of Maui right now. It's well suited for families, but don't expect to be impressed by the service. Perhaps most of the smiles are saved for selling time-shares or booking activities at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle of Maui (if there is any)”
Reviews.Author: JetSetLifeUS
Reviews.Content: As soon as we started to jet set we needed to go to Hawaii. We choose the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas as the Westin brand is top notch when it comes to affordable luxury. The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas overlooks the Pacific Ocean with a view of the ocean from our room. Being able to go grill on the beach was an unique experience. Due to the kitchen in the villa food expenses were lower then we expected. Prices are not that bad in Hawaii anymore because they local islands are growing livestock for beef and milk, and fruits are plenty. The rooms are large and has everything to save on packing lots of clothes with the in-room laundry. Very clean rooms. We attended a Feast at Lele luau which was a cool experience indeed. Wonderful food and dancers appeased us. Seeing the polynesian dances from all of the Polynesian nations was a real learning experience. Excellent value for the high cost. Renting a car is a must if you are wanting to see the landscape with many black sand beaches, red sand beaches, waterfalls, and the rain forest in Maui. See more about what I liked about these villas at: http://www.jetsetlife.us/resorts/WestinKaanapali/WestinKaanapali.html

Reviews.Title: “Pulehu restaurant in the North Villas, Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas”
Reviews.Author: oregoniantraveler
Reviews.Content: We often don't go for Italian, but we were staying at the resort and did not feel like cooking or taking the shuttle back to Lahaina. Kristen greeted us warmly and as she was taking our order, the power went off. It ended up staying off for a long period of time, and unlike other diners, we decided to wait it out. In the mean time, the staff had hatched a plan to offer a limited menu, which they would prepare from a gas stove, so we "reordered" our meal. In the meantime, Kristen and the other waitstaff kept us informed on the outage and offered us anything they could prepare without electricity. Eventually the power returned and we ate our original entrees. I had the Mahi-Mahi, and the fish was properly cooked and well presented, over risotto and a dreamy sauce. Husband had butternut squash ravioli and it was also delicious. For appetizer we had the martini shrimp, which was the only thing I could fault them on for being bland. While we were waiting for the power, we had the caprese salad and the arugula salad, both of which were tasty and presented well. Overall, a relaxed, delicious,meal served in a beautiful setting!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING”
Reviews.Author: luluEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Do not arrive at this resort until you have confirmed beforehand where and what your room will be. We had paid $500 extra for an ocean view and asked to be situated close to our teenagers. We were given a room 3 floors away from the children, with handicapped facilities and with a 5 degree ocean view, between the brick wall and the construction site. It took two nights to be moved from the handicapped facility room, to a room even further away from the children which was above an exit door and which had a view blocked by vegetation. No apologies were ever given. When I took it up with the front desk manager, she told me the resort was 100% full. I'm not sure it was, but anyway-that is not my concern. When I said I had not booked a handicapped facility room, she said I hadn't said I wouldn't have one either. So beware- on the basis that you do not stipulate that you do not require a room with handicapped facilities, you may be given one. At the North pool, garbage carts and dirty linen carts are trucked through fairly frequently throughout the day. The breakfast buffet is nice, but the other restaurants are not great. We loved Maui, but would not go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice combination resort for all your needs”
Reviews.Author: WaCrkgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom island view room in the South building with our family of five - including two teenagers and a five year old. We were very impressed with the room, even without an ocean view of any sort. We could watch the Sugarcane Train go by below us and hear the charming whistle blow, while sitting on our nice large lanai. Just a quick trip downstairs and the water was all around us - no complaints! The room was large enough for all of us to lounge without feeling as if we were tripping over one another. The washer/dryer was small but convenient to have! The kitchen was perfect - we typically ate breakfast and many lunches there, even a dinner or two. I'm sure that saved us a lot in expenses. It really was the perfect combination between fancy resort and condo convenience. We ate a few times at the Ocean Pool Grill, and the food was good. We explored most of the pools in both the North and South complexes, and all had great features. I was sure our teenage boys would love the water slide, but it wasn't wild enough for their tastes; however, our five year old loved it. She also loved the pirate pool, so pool time was always a treat. All the kids enjoyed the beach. We spent one morning trying to walk all the way to black rock, but kept getting sidetracked as the waves just were too enticing for the kids and they had to stop and play. The shuttle to the Westin and Sheraton was super-convenient, and certainly saved us having to find and pay for parking in the Whaler's Village. We did a parasailing excursion (UFO) and simply took the shuttle down to the lower Ka'anapali Beach and then back again. So easy! I would definitely agree with other reviewers that this resort is very family oriented. Travelers should be aware that children are everywhere, and though the resort is beautiful enough for honeymooners, the atmosphere is going to be more boisterous than serene. This is exactly what our family was looking for, so we loved it. I recommend purchasing boogie boards at the Safeway in Lahaina - at less than $20 you can get a brand new one for just about what you'd rent them for the week. We'd even drag them onto the shuttle and go down to the lower Ka'anapali beach, our boys in search for some bigger waves. We had a nice lunch at LuLu's in Lahaina, a restaurant I'd never heard of in the Maui guide books. Also, we had a fabulous dinner at Roy's in Kahana (so close to the resort!). We have been to Roy's in Wailea in the past, and have been extremely impressed with the food each time! It's expensive, but the combinations of flavors are awesome! Regarding service: I didn't have a particularly excellent experience with the staff, nor did I have a bad experience with them. I guess for the most part, I didn't interact with many of them. The front desk was busy, making it a wait to get postage for postcards or request info due to lengthy checkins, etc. Still, that didn't ruin my trip. I just didn't think anyone in particular stood out as having offered amazing service. A luau tip - if you're looking to see hula dancers and are not that interested in sampling luau food, the Westin KOR has a hula show right there on the grounds! Also, the Lahaina Cannery has shows (just look for the times posted as you drive by) as well. All for free! We couldn't bear to spend the money on a luau when 3 out 5 of us wouldn't be that interested in the food. Overall, this was one of our favorite trips to Maui. Most of the time, we return feeling we spent way beyond our budget (easy to do in Maui) because every meal was eaten out at a restaurant. The Westing KOR made it so easy to relax and enjoy our trip, because we could eat in our room or go to a fun restaurant. We would definitely return to the Westin Villas -- we miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Great villa resort for family”
Reviews.Author: neodog_BC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip to this resort w/ my wife and three year old toddler and I must say, it exceeded my expectations. First off, I just want to say that I didn't pay the $400 - $500/night that's posted on Expedia nor do I own this timeshare. I was referred to it by someone who did own one and got a magnificent deal on this resort so my Value rating is based off this. First the room. When we arrived, we were impressed w/ the front desk lobby area as it was grand and overlooked the beach and swimming pool area. Check-in was prompt and didn't have any problems getting into our room. We had a rental car and there was ample free parking in the resort. We got a studio room on the South building which is the older building. I read some of the reviews here and people are complaining that it was less maintained, not as nice as the North (which is newer) but I had no problems with it. It was clean and if I wasn't told that it was the older building, I would have thought that this was the new side. Like all rooms, it had a kitchenette, large jacuzzi tub, king sized bed, sofa bed, tv, dvd player, etc. When we looked out the window, we were surprised to have gotten a wonderful view of the ocean as we would have thought for sure that we would have gotten a view of a parking lot or something. We were very impressed. (note: the south side building was not built by the Westin so that is why some rooms have views of the parking lot) In the resort, there were two large pools (one on the north and one for the south), a water slide, and adult pool and a toddler pool that has a pirate ship in it which my son loved. The pools were all very nice and it's true about limited seating for lounge chairs though we never really had a huge problem. There was so much turnover that eventually you get a seat. By the pool there was a bbq area which we used one day. It's very clean and convenient to use. The beach also sits right in front of the resort and after being to a couple of other beaches in the area (Kapalua and Black Rock), this is my favorite. The water is calm and has a great reef which is great for snorkelling. In fact, we saw turtles out there on our first day. There are also a couple of poolside grills and we tried them both and it was good. Prices were comparable to outside the resort but that doesn't mean much as Maui is quite expensive. We tried their Italian restaurant which was good but quite over-priced. If I were to do it again, I would eat outside the resort. As for other amenities in the resort, there is free internet in our room so we used that daily w/ our laptop. If you don't have a laptop, you could use the business center for free and use their computer. There's a little vending machine to rent dvds if you want to watch movies in your room. Shuttles are also available every 15 - 20 mins to take you to Lahaina, Whaler's Village, the other Westin Hotel and the Sheraton so if you don't have a car, that's very convenient. Some tips, rent your snorkelling and boogie board gear from outside the resort. There are numerous other places to rent and it'll be a lot cheaper. There's a Safeway nearby that you can purchase drinks and food to cook in the bbq area or in your room. If you forget something, there's a general store in the resort to buy some small items like oil, butter, ice cream, magazines, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The best Kaanapali resort for the view and service.”
Reviews.Author: kauaiboundAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traded our timeshare in Kauai for one week at the Westin Kaanapali villas and stayed in a one bedroom premium villa. The room was so spacious, clean and appealing. It felt like we were there alone, so quiet and private. The view of the ocean was fabulous and we enjoyed the hotel so much. The free shuttle to Lahaina and other starwood hotels was great because parking was not an issue. Snorkling was great, right on our beachfront access! We will definitely be back when we get a chance to stay in Maui again! Thanks so much Westin and starwood for making our first year in a timeshare memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!! Especially if you are traveling with family.”
Reviews.Author: TexasLisaLisa
Reviews.Content: Top tips: 1. Go to the Maui Dive shop when you first get there to rent you snorkel gear. 2. So to Safeway and shop for groceries. (Get the store card for the discounts) 3. Might want to consider paying for the daily tidy up service, or you'll be washing towels a lot. (This is especially for the moms so they can relax as much as the rest of the family) We stayed at the Westin Ocean Villa Resort Villas July 18 - 25 and it was everything we hoped for. Our family, made up of my husband, me, the two kids (6 & 8) plus my 74 y.o. mother, arrived Saturday evening about 5:30 PM. The only real glitch the whole trip was we were supposed to have an ocean view room and they originally tried to put us in a island view room. My husband talked to someone and when I got back from the bathroom we had partial ocean view room and they gave us a $100 credit to use for dinner while we waited on that room to be cleaned. I thought the room was great since it looked out over the very pretty pool area, plus you could see the ocean. Everything, including the room looked as good as it did on the internet pictures. I would recommend arriving much earlier in the day than we did if you can. I thought it was the perfect blend of a condo combined with full service hotel. We had a 2 bedroom lock off which was perfect, since the four in the immediate family stayed in the 1 bedroom side, and my mother had a nice studio to herself where she could feel comfortable walking around in her PJ's or doing whatever she wanted to do in her own space. The studio does not have a balcony but you can open the sliding glass doors. The 1 bedroom side had a balcony. We had a full-sized kitchen & fridge on our side and my mother had a 2 burner cook top and dorm-sized fridge. Both sides had dishwasher and stackable washer and dryers. We ate one or two meals in the room almost everyday. It was great because kids like to lounge around in their PJs while they eat breakfast. They also have very nice grills outside that are available if you want to use them. The staff cleans them every night so they are just ready to use when you are. The snorkeling was wonderful right on our section of the beach and it was gentle enough for the kids to snorkel and boogie board. Equipment was very expensive to rent from the resort so I highly recommend going down the street to the Maui dive shop where you get some really good equipment, that fits well, for less than half of what you pay at the resort.
