They were out of boogie boards when we got there so they just took one right off of their sales floor to rent to us. They also are very knowledgeable about where the best snorkeling and dive sites are on the island. They have a game room which was basically a bunch of computers and TVs hooked up with Wii, PS2, XBox, etc which my son loved. I let him go in there a little while but not too much. I also really liked walking along a walking path that I believe stretches 2 or 3 miles, mostly right along the ocean. This is the first vacation ever that I was not ready to go home yet. Partly because there was still more I wanted to do and to a large extent, because it was so relaxing in the comfortable villas that I didn't feel cramped like I sometimes feel when we are in regular hotel rooms. The quality of the resort was top notch and I would definitely return again and would highly recommend this to those making a family trip to Maui, or those traveling in a group.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesb
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days here on a package deal. Upon arrival, after having read previous reviews about the check in doling out the worst rooms, I was prepared. My first room was at the entrance to the building and within 5 min, the outside door was banging and banging, and there was a shower curtain around the toilet instead of a door. We were moved to "island view" which meant the dirt across the street and right on top of the major highway. You couldn't open the sliding door because the noise was LOUD, even at night. I didn't expect the best room, but maybe the best one available. The receptions said this was it. Just to be curious I asked the maid if my floor was filled, she said about 1/2 was.... The resort looks to be basically run by college students. Not trained in customer service. The resorts a mile away looked much more fun! There was a boadwalk and tons of outdoor places to eat, shops, ponds and much more beach area at these other resorts. That would be their sister property and several others. The fitness center looked like it was in the basement, so skip that. They charged for getting a chair to sit on the beach at their hotel. This Westin, was just ok. The room very clean. This is basically a time share so I think there are many other choices on the island that would be more fun and have more of an island feel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Villas - the Only Negative of Our Trip”
Reviews.Author: lostinmadrid28
Reviews.Content: I am hesitant to write this review, as I know there are so many on Trip Advisor who own at the WKORV and love it, but I do feel it's important for me to share my experience as a non-owner and some of the concerns I had about the resort. My fiance and I are in our late 20's and this was our first trip to Maui. We spent 7 nights in Building 6 of the North Villas. We booked here because of the positive reviews we read on TA. A close friend of mine and her husband were considering buying here, so we thought we'd check it out for them and report back. Let me start with the positives. The room set-up is very convenient; my fiance and I were able to save a good amount of money by eating breakfast in our room every morning. Buying a bottle of Malibu and some pineapple juice was a nice alternative to the $9.75 drinks at the pool bar as well! We also enjoyed having a washer and dryer to clean our beach towels at night. The snorkeling, as promised, was fantastic off the beach in front of the hotel. It was especially nice during early morning hours when the waves were calmer and the beach was less crowded. Tons of beautiful fish and coral! Unfortunately, that's all I can say for the positives. Here are some of the things we encountered that negatively affected our feeling of "aloha" on this trip. 1. The room we were assigned to was on the bottom floor, right next to the koi pond. I didn't mind this at first, as I saw that all other first floor rooms had an abundance of foliage in front of them to maintain some level of privacy. Our room, however, had a walkway directly in front of it and no plants whatsoever. Resort owners/guests were constantly streaming past our room, which meant that we could not leave the curtains open at any time. I typically like to sleep with my balcony door open to get fresh air and I like to wake up with the sun, so this was a negative for me. I did not like that, as we sat on our lanai, people were standing directly in front of us, watching the koi and looking into our room. We were also put in a handicapped room, which meant that we did not have an actual shower and the floors were constantly soaked after showering in the morning or in the evening before going out. We were told upon check-in that the resort was filled to capacity. We watched multiple upset owners complain to the front desk about their rooms (thinking they had oceanfront/view and being given island view), so I did not ask to be moved. 2. Cleanliness of the resort - MANY areas of the resort were very dirty and unkept. On our first full day, we walked past the pool and saw a large pool of vomit floating along the edge. It was very obviously vomit, but no one seemed to notice and guests were unknowingly swimming around in it. WHO vomits in a swimming pool and does nothing about it? Also, due to the strong tradewinds, we saw many plastic cups strewn about the pool area and lawn. Many resort personnel were walking around throughout the day, but I never saw them pick up any of the trash blowing around. We had garbage next to our lanai as well that was never picked up. 3. Cleanliness of the room- This is where I nearly lost my mind. One afternoon we sat down on our lanai to eat lunch. As I was eating my sandwich, my fiance pointed out that there was a large lipstick print on my cup. Sure enough, bright pink lipstick that did NOT belong to me. Even after housekeeping came through, the cup appeared to have been cleaned, but upon closer inspection STILL had lipstick all over it. Another afternoon, I was drying off after a shower and noticed a large brown stain on the towel I was using. It was obvious that the stain was permanent and could not be wiped off - it was VERY off-putting. Why would this towel continue to be used?? I have no idea what caused the stain but I was disgusted that it touched my body. Housekeeping did not always "clean" as we would have expected - large clumps of hair were sometimes left in the middle of the bathroom floor. Some other off-putting aspects of the WKORV: young children in the jacuzzi tubs despite the signage stating that they must be accompanied by adults, ridiculously small parking spaces, a strong sewage smell in the parking lot/near the entrance to the North Villas, AC that wouldn't go below 77 degrees (an issue when you have to keep your patio door closed and curtains closed at all times). Lastly, we found the staff to be very unfriendly. We experienced loads of aloha all over the island, but never at the WKORV. Perhaps it's because we look younger than we are or it was obvious to the staff that we weren't owners, but I don't feel either of these things gives the resort staff good reason to ignore us. No "hello," not even a smile from many resort staff. When we ordered drinks at the pool bar, many other guests were served before us. Servers were short and did not seem interested in providing good service. In the end, we absolutely loved Maui as much as our friends, family and members of TA said we would and I was so sad to leave. This place has potential, but I had much higher expectations based on the glowing reviews the resort has received. I can't imagine I would be too pleased if I had actually paid to own here. My friend and her husband will be taking their money elsewhere as well. I am not overly difficult to please, but I do expect a certain standard at a 4 star hotel, especially a Starwood Property.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Villas was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Zamigaos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for six nights in mid-July and had a one bedroom, ocean view unit in the South Tower. We arrived about 230pm and our room was ready, even though check-in wasn't until 4pm. The valet "wisked" away our car and told us he would put our beer/wine/soda/water on ice until we knew if we were in a room or not. Sure enough, once we were in our room, everything arrived and was stocked in the fridge rather than getting hot in the car. A VERY nice service! (The rest of the week, we parked our car ourselves and had no problem finding good parking right by our building.) The unit we were assigned was on the first floor and a corner unit. Typically, we like to be higher up and asked to be moved, but nothing was available that day. And, we were told the corner unit was usually an upgrade. Well...it was HUGE. It was larger than our first apartment we lived in! And, we did not have hardly any issues with hearing people above us and NONE aside of us. We had a one-bedroom with a king, plus a living room with a queen sofa bed. Two large TV's, full kitchen with washer/dryer, a very large bathroom with twin sinks/large shower & jetted tub...plus, dining area for six and a huge porch. We were very pleased with the room, once we got settled into it. There is a concierge in each building and we found them to be especially helpful...Katie was great in building 4. The property is beautiful and our family loved the pools. We did not play the "towel game" and typically got to the pool around 9-10am. We had no problems finding two to three seats together in shade or sun. The pool with slide was busy, but did not feel crowded. Many folks brought their own cooler with drinks and snacks, but there is also the beach bar/restaurant for purchasing these. Or, the market is handy and was not too expensive. (Everything is in Hawaii.) We also used the Safeway in Whaler's Village to pick up food and beverages. We cooked a couple of meals in our unit, but didn't try the BBQ's. They did look very clean and nice as we passed them. We had coupons for free breakfast buffet each day. It was pretty standard stuff, but it was nice to have. I don't know that we would have paid the $20 per person to eat there each morning. We could have used them at Westin Hotel or Sheraton, but we never made it to either of the other places. I also know they have a free shuttle, but we preferred to have a car and go on our own. Parking was never an issue anywhere we went, but we were careful not to leave anything of value in the car. MANY people told us this over and over! Our family really liked the "feel" of the Villas...more like a resort than a hotel. It gave us lots of freedom for our last week in Maui. And, the property was beautiful. If you are headed here, I believe you'll really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to unwind, but Starwood status holds little clout”
Reviews.Author: DavidND
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and 1st-rate staff. Excellent place to unwind and take a long vacation. If you're platinum with Starwood, however, don't expect the usual perks. Since they're a timeshare, they don't seem to give you the same clout, although I did get an excellent upgrade room when it became available (I have a suspicion they'd give it to anyone who bothers asking for a better view, etc.). I checked out the Westin Spa down the road, and the Villas are MUCH nicer and the staff seems more pleasant. Keep in mind you're not in Wailea, so the hotel is more 4.5 stars than true 5 stars. :)

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mauidream67
Reviews.Content: Great location in Maui. The rooms were very comfortable with kitchen, washer/dryer, and a big jacuzzi tub. The resort had a big swimming pools/slide that the kids really enjoyed. The snorkeling right outside the condo was the best (better than Lanai and other locations). We went snorkeling almost daily. It was convenient to have a kitchen to cook breakfasts and they also have bbqs too. Very convenient and economical. Great place to stay. A slice of heaven. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Pool! Close to Black Rock too!”
Reviews.Author: jobshopr
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the best hotel I have ever stayed at anywhere. You will find plenty of details in other reviews so I will go over some things I would have like to known before I got there. 1. The rooms comes with no condiments, so you will need to buy them. You get soap, shampoo, detergent for the washer/dryer and dishwasher, but that is about it. 2. The frying pan in the room was the cheapest thing they could find and it warped when we heated it up and burned EVERYTHING. Be prepaired to buy your own if you want to cook or just pack one from home (cheaper). 3. You can snorkle and swim in front of the hotel, but the area called Black Rock in front of the Sheraton was AWSOME. Every other beach we tried was lousy in comparison and you get to use the showers, bathrooms, and pool of that hotel if you want since it's also owned by Starwood! The free parking only has about 15 slots, so most of the time we just paid at the hotel garage. ($2.00 for every 20/min or $20 max.) You can also use the free shuttle, but we had to much gear and small kids to do that. 4. Get all your gear (rental) in Lahaina the first day at Snorkle Bob's and save with the weekly rate. You can rent a boogie board here for a week for the price of a hotel rental for one day! DO get the top of the line snorkle gear (not the cheap $9/week stuff) and the boogie board. The Boogie boards are sooooo much fun at Black Rock. You will see Sea Turtles at Black rock! We even had them run into us when they came in close to eat the seaweed! 5. Some of the Maui books I read said to get your Groceries at Costco near the airport to save money. That turned out to be a mistake, because my sister-in-law went by herself to shop for 9 people and spent $500! We didn't need 5lbs of cheese or 2 gallons of maple syrup... The Safeway in Lahaina was resonable and we still had to make 3 trips there over the 7 days anyway. That said, here are some more of my feeling about the hotel. Good: There is no timeshare pressure. (This is a timeshare restort, so they do offer you goodies to sit in on one, but you can ignore the offers if you want and they will leave you alone.) The pools and waterslide were great. We loved walking on the boardwalk along the front of the beach (This goes all the way to Black Rock I think) The new towel card policy makes you track your pool towels, but they are good about forgiving mistakes (like returning more wet towels than you take to replace) Take the free valet the first day. (Don't forget to tip when you pull it out the next day to avoid charges) The late checkout lounge was great on our last day since we didn't fly out until 8pm. The lounge has showers, free lockers, vending machines, couches, and a big TV. The rest of our gear was just locked in the rental car. Bad: Towel policy is a pain, but I understand why they have it. "Private parties" made it hard to get a grill to cook dinner on some nights. Prices to rent gear by the pool is so high that no one does it. Stupid. They need to spend more than $3 on the cookware. Get some good non-stick pans!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay , wonderfull people!!”
Reviews.Author: Fnagle
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at this hotel and were blown away by the hospitality of the staff. Everything that we could have asked for in a vacation. We hung out at the pool a lot and did a few excursions. I would reccomend buying some beer at the ABC store next to the hotel and bring it to the pool. The staff didn't seem to mind, but the price of 1 beer at the pool was the same as a six pack at the store. You may get a few looks, but we did buy all of our non-beer drinks from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Traded from Harborside”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie7276
Reviews.Content: I just read a review on Harborside/Atlantis from a Ka'anapali owner and wanted to give a perspective from the other way. As East Coasters, we splurged and traded for one week in a villa and then another week at other islands and Starwood Hotels using points - Sheraton in Kauai and then the elegant and newly renovated Royal Hawaiian in Waikiki (yes, it is a very long flight - so go for 2 weeks from the East and both of these places are excellant) I'll limit my comments to say that there is no comparison from Westin Kan'apali Villas to Harborside/ Atlantis. First of all, we have a full 2 separate room, one bedroom, waterfront suite at Harborside that overlooks Nassau Harbor. In Hawaii, we had a one-room studio/efficiency with a dorm-style refrig that we could barely keep anything without it frosting over because it would not close. We had a glimpse of the ocean and NO BALCONY - we pushed our table over to the sliding door to see the view from our North Tower, but we were right over the outdoor restaurant that was always very noisy. As SPG Gold members, we did not feel this was anywhere near an even trade - when we asked for an upgrade, everyone just shrugs and says, "Well, this is Hawaii." Also, there were no resort-style activities that are abundant in Atlantis. Of course, there are activity charges, but they charge for everything in Hawaii as well and add in the cost of a rental car to get anywhere to do them while Atlantis is very walkable and has a free shuttle. But why take the shuttle? Walking among the yachts everyday is wonderful! Sitting in the hot tub right on the Harbor over Christmas and watching festively decorated international yachts come and go is not to be missed. There was even a charge for beach lounges (numerous beaches and no charge at Harborside) and you could not go into the Ocean without cutting your foot. There were no private, quiet areas and at Atlantis you can always find a niche - we love the Olympic pool area and the opportunity for lap swimming and there is no lap swim in Hawaii. Remember - all amenties, pools and all the areas at Atlantis are FREE for Harborside owners, then you can come back to the resort and unwind at a very quiet, waterfront pool area and really get an exclusive owners-type experience, rather than a hotel. Plus, we felt that Hawaii Westin Villas was also a hotel - we found could just book a room there, so we didn't feel like it was exclusive for owners as we do in Harborside - which is sold out for timeshares. We asked in Hawaii about how they could say they were sold out for timeshares, yet still rent rooms as a Westin hotel, but never got a good answer. Also, when we had our owners meeting in Hawaii, we felt like they just wanted to sell us, where in Harborside, we were treated more like owners with updates on the property and they asked for our input on future plans. Remember that Atlantis is a partnership and not fully owned by Starwood, so they do not seem to be as much aware of how much in additional to beaches and water activities there is to offer at Atlantis (world class casino, nightlife galore, top restaurants, full free movie theater) - perhaps they do not make as much profit here, so they steer people away Bottomline - Hawaii is wonderful to experience and we would go more frequently if it was an easy jaunt. The Caribbean, however, gives you an international flavor and for East Coasters, it is just easier (direct, reasonable and shorter flights) to get to - and much, much more available as well as better, larger rooms at Atlantis. Harborside is a private resort for owners within a fantastic, international first-class destination resort. Ka'anapali, while lovely, is just a resort. Everyone was very nice - so Mahalo and thank you to all in Hawaii for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the westin already.”
Reviews.Author: Skatedolphin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom lockoff at the villas north. Ocean front on the top floor. It was absolutely amazing. We had a great ocean view, top floors had a perfect breeze. Most of the staff at the resort are pleasant, there are two markets on the resort grounds, which have a great selection. The clerks in the markets need to be schooled on manners, everytime that we went into the markets to buy something the clerks were extremely rude and inconsiderate, almost like we were butting into their free time behing the register,did i mention extremely rude? They have no buisness working with the public. Other then the store hags the staff were extremely polite and were there for us whenever we needed something. Lots of activities for the kids to do, several pools and hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LadyWhoLovesBirds
Reviews.Content: These are Tiime Share units. We had a 1 bedroom for 3 of us; the living room has a queen sofa bed in addition to the queen in the bedroom. We had a Deluxe Island View which actually looked out over the pool with a peak at the ocean. We had 2 large TVs, a full kitchen, and a lanai (balcony). The bathroom is the size of a small bedroom with jacuzzi and twin sinks. VERY NICE PLACE. Very clean and up-to-date. We could not hear a thing from the surrounding apartments. WE also had maid service. The pools and the grounds are wonderful. The coy ponds were spectacular. The Villas are on the North side of Black Rock which has less crowded beaches. This place is VERY suitable for families with young-teenage children. My kids are 20-22 and also loved it. I went through a place online (Maui Holiday) who told me they got deals on these apartments and I did get a good deal. I think there are other deals out there directly from Time Share owers. We also stayed at the Westin Resort and Spa and much preferred our stay at the Villas. Just so much more like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Always looking for better, but it'll be hard this time.”
Reviews.Author: ToTheT
Reviews.Content: My wife, eight year old son, and three year old daughter arrived on June 9th. About a half hour from the airport, and with the ocean views, who cares. I actually wouldn't have minded stopping for a bit to watch the surfers in action on the way there, but the anxiety of reaching the resort is always to great. As we arrived, we were lucky enough to have the man at the parking lot podium, (who wasn't always there), direct us based on our reservation to the correct lobby. There are two...south building...and north building which in newer and according to reviews, much nicer. From the outside, it was very hard for me to see the difference. The room we received was a one bedroom, which is disconnected from the area with the couch, primary t.v., dining area, kitchen, and laundry area at the foyer. The bathroom was quite large with a shower that easily fit two adults. The double shower head was awesome. There was always hot water and great pressure. The toilet is in its own area, but is only concealed by a glass door that matches in style to the shower door. It's not totally private, so it may take a bit of getting used to if you have more privacy at home. The tub was great for the kids. Our 8 and 3 year old loved bathing together every night. We reserved our room through Pleasant Holidays and therefore received full maid service daily, and the breakfast buffet each morning. We also had the choice to dine at the Sheraton and The Westin down the road. We made it to the Sheraton, but were disappointed to wait nearly 30 minutes for a table. We had it great where we were. Mike, who works the poolside grill at breakfast always made us feel very welcome and stopped for personal conversation for a few minutes. He seems very content with his lifestyle. We made our own sandwiches each day and cooked most of our dinners in the unit. We bbq'ed a few times as well. Quite nice, but the units don't come with safe flatware for bringing down to the bbq area. I was always scared I was going to break something, but never did. The pools were as clean as can possibly be. Security comes around every 3-4 hours and kicks everyone out for a five minute inspection. Yes, it happens, kids do make there mark in the pool. They're great about keeping on it though. The grounds: hats off to the crew. They were always on duty, but never interupted the flow of the visitors. From my balcony I witnessed on multiple occasions different employees stopping to pick up bits of garbage here or there left behind for one reason or anther. The beach: on our particular stay, the beach was perfect. We had a few days of great waves for body surfing, followed by a few calm days for great snokeling. Food/Beverages: unless you can afford it, buy it at Safeway and make it yourself. Of course, even the shopping is expensive, but you're on an island, so that's expected. But dining out, especially at the hotel will hurt the wallet. Concierge was very helpful for directions. We also ordered tickets for the luau down the street, but found them much cheaper through the Hertz rental car magazine. Ulalena: great show at the town theatre....a bit expensive, but worth seeing. Something else worth noting. We hardly ever heard anything when closed in our room. Getting to sleep and staying asleep were "heavenly".

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with teen daughters”
Reviews.Author: kh57ca
Reviews.Content: After quite some challenge in deciding which resort to stay at, I decided on the Ocean Villa's as their price was the same I could get at a comparable hotel resort when taking into account the resort fee's. The upside was that we had the small kitchen in the room and the outdoor BBQ'ing facilities for meal preparation. Which ended up being a very nice attribute. We enjoyed the Westin Ocean Villa's quite a bit. I judge that on my own enjoyment and that of my teenage daughters. The pool, the ocean beach etc....were all great. I was surprised at the quality of snorkeling that was available right at the hotel beach, which ended up being used alot by my daughters. My only negative during the stay, was the daytime maitre de at the pool side restaurant. Whether it was a bad day for her, or it was her normal attitude....she was no fun to deal with. The other employee's at the restaurant were great. In fact one evening we ordered dessert to go with our self cooked bbq dinner. They were happy to give me some butter, spices etc.... that I hadn't gotten at the store. There are multiple options for nearby grocery stores for provisions which was highly useful. The store at the property has a good variety of stuff, but the prices are astronomical. The room was very clean and functional, no complaints. Parking was very easy.....we always parked underground....a very short walk to our room. And no extra fee's. The only challenge was finding lounge space at the pools. We typically were looking mid afternoon....when people started to leave. The troops were out staking claim on pool space by 7am if you want to compete for this primo spaces. there's also a very nice walking trail along the ocean that runs at the back of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TNMom22
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and two kids, 10 and 7. We had a great time. The pool was great. The water slide was a lot a fun. The rooms were very clean. The bathroom was huge. The beds were great to sleep on. The beach is a little sloped making it a little hard to walk. But if you are looking for a snorkel spot, then just walk right out in the ocean at the resort. Go just feet in, and you hit coral reef. We saw a lot of fish and even a sea turtle - twice. The pool hut has snorkel and scuba equipment right there for you. My 10 yr old daughter learned to snorkel and got to try scuba equipment in the pool (they were showing what they had one day). The pool side restaurant has a nice breakfast buffet each morning. The grounds are perfect. The grass is like a golf course. There are grilling areas with large gas grills and tables to dine at. The pictures on the website are good of the rooms but don't do the area justice. You are close to Lahaina and lots of places to eat. I would stay here again if we ever get to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful villa experience”
Reviews.Author: BettendorfTraveler
Reviews.Content: We own here, but this was the first opportunity we had had to stay here. We were definitely not disappointed. The experience was nearly flawless. The villa was ready when we arrived, and everything was functional. Had a problem finding the internet connection in one side of the villa, it was hidden underneath a sofa. Impeccably clean, and the mid-week tidy-up was all that was needed. Incredibly quiet - couldn't tell if the units near us were occupied or not. We were upgraded from oceanview (which we own) to oceanfront, but from what we could tell, the views from virtually every unit were pleasant. Great selection of TV channels - 2 flatscreens on one side of the unit, one on the other. Internet is reasonably fast and free! Restaurants were good, although not great. The hostess at one had a less than outgoing, engaging personality but she was the only individual in 1 week that I would have preferred not to have encountered. Prices were competitive with other restaurants on Maui. Prices in the mini-grocery were high and the selection not great, but there is a Safeway on the way to the villas from the airport. (Get a Safeway discount card at checkout - you'll save a small fortune!) Valet parking, although not necessary, was nice, and a relative bargain at $9/day. The guys were generally pretty fast in their response times. They were pleasant, friendly, and helpful with directions. Maui is definitely relaxed and laid-back compared to Oahu. Our fellow guests were generally quiet, pleasant people. They were of all ages, but most appeared to have pre-adolescent and teenaged children. We are looking forward to going back and are quite satisfied with our ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: KaraokeDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocean Resort Villas in October 2008 (it's taken me a while to get to writing this!), and found it comfortable and in a great location as far as being right on the beach. We were there celebrating my parents' 40th wedding anniversary, and the cast of characters included my parents (in their early 60's and very active), my sister, my brother-in-law, my fiancee (now husband), myself (all in our early 30's) and my two-year-old nephew. The space: My parents have a Marriott timeshare in Hilton Head that they switched for this, so they are not Westin owners. I'm not completely sure what sort of difference that might have made, but from what I've understood over the past year in reading about this place, that's probably why we were put in the older South buildings instead of the newer North. We had a two bedroom condo (the one bedroom suite plus the efficiency lockout), which was relatively spacious for the seven of us, though my husband and I drew the short straw and were put on the couch bed. I understand from my family that the beds are very comfortable, but the couch bed is pretty horrible. You have no chance of sleeping if you leave it on the frame, so we had to pull it onto the floor, and then called room service to ask them for several more comforters (they may ask why, but they'll give them to you) and formed sort of a pallet on the floor every night (the biggest problem was that in order to use the living space AND keep the 2-year-old from constantly playing on it all day long, we had to put the darn thing away every day and pull it out again each night). It was survivable, but not great. The bathrooms are enormous and very nice, and having the washer and dryer in the unit was awesome - fantastic for beach towels, if nothing else (I'll get to those later). The dining and living area in the place was nice, and we had a full lanai off the one-bedroom that was nice to hang out on (the "lanai" off the efficiency was a joke - I'm not really sure why they even exist). We allegedly had an "ocean view", but the ocean was actually off to the right and blocked by so many palm trees, you could hardly see it (that was a little frustrating) - the view we had straight off the lanai was partly parking lot, and partly the park next to the resort (which could have been worse - the park was at least nice to look at!). Honestly, the South tower is a little run down, especially compared to what I've heard of the North - it was very clean, but there were obvious signs of wear and tear in the furniture and carpet (oh that couch bed!), and it could probably use a facelift. However, I'm also told that the rooms are bigger in the South than in the North towers. Meals: The full kitchen space in the one-bedroom was great (you can cook in the efficiency, but it's just a small dorm fridge and a two burner stove), and we went to the Safeway up the road (yes, it's going to be more expensive than the on the mainland - just expect it! Still cheaper than eating every meal out) several times throughout the week so that we could do most breakfasts and lunches in the condo, and chose to eat dinner out every night except one (we were there to experience cuisine, after all - we couldn't cook EVERY meal in the condo!). The one night we didn't eat out, we chose to do steaks on the grills down by the pool, which was really nice. We didn't have any problems claiming a grill, and it was fun chatting with the other grillers on such a nice night. We did eat at the Ocean Pool Bar and Grill one night, and thought the food was very good (and priced pretty typical for Maui), but I seem to recall that the service was awfully slow. Hubby and I did hang out at that bar one evening (we were two of four people at the bar at 9:30 pm -- evenings in Hawaii end early!), and found that to be very pleasant and low-key. Activities: We love to snorkel, and over the course of the week we snorkeled and snuba'd at least four different venues (highly recommend trying snuba if you never have - lots of fun!), including Molokini Crater, Maluaka (Turtle Town), and Black Rock down at the Sheraton, but honestly some of the best snorkeling we experienced all week was right off the beach at the Ocean Villas - gorgeous! DO NOT rent your equipment from the resort, as it's an incredible ripoff at $18 per day (that was the pricing as of October, anyway). Go to one of the dozens of dive shops in Ka'anapali or Lahaina and get equipment there for anywhere from $1.50 to $8 per day and it's just as good for a fraction of the price. We went to the Boss Frog's in Ka'anapali and were perfectly happy with the $5 per day equipment (my bro-in-law even settled for the $1.50 per day stuff since the mask fit his face better, and he was perfectly content) that we rented and kept for three days. Pools: The resort has several pools, and plenty of space for everyone to play! We were nearest the South pool with the slide, and we hung out there several times and didn't really think the number of obnoxious kids were too out of control. The "grotto" hot tub being located right outside the entrance nearest our condo was nice, too. Having said that, we did wander over to the North pool several times, too - the pools, being newer, are a bit nicer and are quieter due to the lack of the slide (which obviously attracts the kids!). There was an adults-only pool on the North side, but it was jammed back into a corner that was a little depressing due to sheer lack of activity and sunlight (and it was way too far from the bar!), so we never used it. The kiddie pool was adorable, and we did take my nephew over there to play for a little while one day, but at the time he was still getting used to pools and beaches and didn't want to play for long. As for the towel situation, I think that you were supposed to check them in and out every day (I don't remember if there was a deposit involved?), and was already seeming like a big hassle on day 1. However, on our second day we found an giant stack of beach towels at a completely un-manned towel station, so we grabbed enough for all of us and just kept them throughout the whole week, washing and drying them in the condo every day. Then at the end of the week we simply left them in the condo. The shuttles: The inter-resort shuttle was really nice, and we ended up using it several times to get to the Sheraton (once for the luau went to down there, and once to hit Black Rock for some snorkeling) and the "regular" Westin (we hired a photographer for a beach photo shoot down there). There is also a shuttle that runs between the resort and Lahaina, that my husband and I picked up at Hilo Hatties one night when we wanted to stay in Lahaina while the rest of my family returned to the resort in our rental vehicle. Both are very handy, but make sure you pay attention to which shuttle you're getting on. I can't tell you how many ignorant tourists got on the inter-resort shuttle thinking they were heading to Lahaina and then yelled at the shuttle driver for their own obliviousness (it made me mad, since it specifically stated which shuttle it was ON the bus!). Overall, it was a nice resort and a very pleasant stay and I would consider staying there again, though I'd probably investigate other options first. It is definitely a resort more geared toward families, and I probably wouldn't recommend it if you're a couple looking for some romance. A group of older people might consider something a little less family-oriented, too.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations....”
Reviews.Author: Karasdad
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bdrm lockout for our family with two young girls and my mother in law. We went the second week of Spring Break. Nice and friendly, more upscale than the Kaanapali Alii where we had stayed last year. Kids had a blast in the pool, the beaches were nice and offered great snorkeling. Generously sized master bdrm and bath. Kitchen was a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HapiTravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with extended family...group of 17 people, including grand parents, teenagers, toddlers and infants. This place is perfect for families, we used both 1Bedroom and studio units. Having the kitchen and laundry facilities in each unit was very practical. Our rooms were the North Building were well appointed, clean and very spacious. The resort had something for everyone in our group...great pools (for adults and young children), direct beach access, gym and spa, and minutes away from great golf courses, surfing lessons, and shopping in old town Lahaina which had lots of great restaurants. Some days we'd eat in the different onsite restaurants which were quite good. Or we'd use the free inter resort shuttle to go to Whaler's Village for shopping/eating. Other nights we'd cook in. They even have barbeque grills for guests to use. Free internet access in all the rooms. We loved everything about the Westin Kaanapali....we're already planning our return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: badgoalie
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The room (a one bedroom suite) was perfect for our family. The kitchen was excellent and the bathroom was really nice. The pools and grounds were also great. The only criticism was the food and service at the restaurant. I was never impressed by the friendliness of the maitre 'd and the waiters. The food could have been better also...but, given that kids ate free, it was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly at home”
Reviews.Author: shannonblogs
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I vacationed here and exchanged our Worldmark for a stay at the Westin Ka'anaplai Ocean Resort Villas. We checked in early and expected to wait but they had our unit ready for us earlier than expected, and they gave us a complimentary ocean view upgrade (I thought all the views were ocean view?). Anyway, we stayed in building 2 on the 4th floor and had a once bedroom. Our first reaction to the room was, "WOW, this is NICE." We thoroughly used the kitchen and lanai, barely used the TV in both rooms, loved the king sized bed with fluffy linens and the huge shower was always a blessing at the end of a snorkel, swim, or hike day. The staff were always friendly and helpful and made us feel utterly spoiled. Thought it's been one of the best facilities we've ever stayed, I must say that our favorite part of the resort was the beach with coral reef not more than 5 feet off the shore to snorkel. The fish were brilliant, vivid, thrilling every single day. A couple of days it was a bit windy but when you're in the water, who cares?

Reviews.Title: “extremely nice”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0991
Reviews.Content: these are high-end condo-style timeshares, maintained and furnished by westin. pretty modern and luxurious. perfectly located if you want the kaanapali experience; easy drive to wherever. plenty of parking, at least in may. several pools, including a kid's "pirate" pool. jacuzzis in the rooms, outdoor "stone" hot tub. free shuttles to lahaina and adjacent resorts/hotels. 0 complaints.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great”
Reviews.Author: DuckUnder
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the north tower last week. The pools are great. The rooms are very nice. The staff was excellent. Ka'anapali is a great location. The best feature, for me, were the outdoor barbecues. We could just grill each night and hang out - loved it. They are a little thin on pool rental stuff and the prices at the restaurants are spendy, but all in all this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable vacation, which we never wanted to end!”
Reviews.Author: Overseas_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We exchanged in through Interval International and had a wonderful stay here. We booked a studio and were fortunate enough to be upgraded to an ocean view room with stunning views but would have found it difficult to be unhappy, even if we hadn't had the ocean view. We are a family with a small baby and the room was easily big enough. The bed was comfortable, as were the pillows (I am not easily pleased when it comes to pillows!) and our baby daughter slept well in a ''Heavenly Crib'' at no extra cost. The kitchen was small but more than adequate (fridge, 2 hob rings, microwave & a dishwasher) and there was also a washer and dryer. Baby high chair was also supplied on our request. Great location with a lovely beach and amazing snorkelling. Pools were also great and there were plenty of sunloungers available. Poolside restaurants offered tasty food at prices you would expect at a Westin resort but were not unreasonable. Happy hours every day from 4 - 6 pm were very enticing. Plenty of barbeques available poolside too, if you want to cook outside. I've never seen so many concierge desks before and so information was easy to come by. Parking is free and there is also free access to high speed internet, if you have your own laptop. If you're looking to shop for groceries, then Costco near the airport is the go or Safeway in Lahaina (make sure you apply for a clubcard if you haven't already got one). Snorkel Bob's in Napili or Lahaina will look after you well when it comes to snorkel and other rental stuff. If you play golf, make sure you play the Plantation Course at Kapalua - most stunning course I've ever played - pricey but play twilight, if you want to save some dollars. I rented my clubs from Hawaii Golf & Tennis at the Lahaina Gateway Centre and was very impressed at the selection of sets available for rental - I played better than with my own clubs! If you're looking for a good restaurant, then Roys in the Kahana Gateway Centre should not disappoint - try the chocolate souffle, which is to die for. We have visited the Hawaiian Islands 7 times now over the last 15 years and this is definitely the best resort we have stayed at. If you don't own timeshare, this would be a good resort to own in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for families with toddlers and preschoolers!”
Reviews.Author: 2hapamama
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay! Plenty of room in the 1 bedroom suite for 2 adults, 4yo and 1 yo. Our Ocean View was just that, yes, it overlooked the parking lot and the ocean, but it's a big property, it's hard not to see something other than the ocean. Friendly staff, great pools and beach. Crib and highchair provided for the baby too. All staff was very responsive. On our last day we were scheduled on a red-eye and planned to use the late departure lounge. The lounge had been reserved for an internal training without the knowledge of the front desk and they were nice enough to allow us to stay in our room until 4pm. Housekeeping responded to every call. Our package included breakfast, which we could take at the KOR, Westing or Sheraton. We found the Westin's breakfast buffet to be far superior and you can take the free shuttle there. However the waitstaff at the KOR buffet were very accomodating, allowing us to take breakfast to go when the baby was getting ansty. 4yo loved the waterslide and the shallow pool was perfect for the 1yo. The snorkeling out front wasn't fantastic, but good for our son to learn. We especially loved how uncrowded and low-key the property was. When we visited the Sheraton and Westin, things felt rushed from both staff and other guests. At the Villas it truly felt like Hawaiian time was in full effect. I did a ton of research prior to booking and ended up booking through Costco travel. got a great package rate with minivan, upgraded view and breakfast for two each day (our kids ate free too!) for less that the best land view I could find anywhere. We booked our air on our own on the web for the best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - great beach & location”
Reviews.Author: travel8866
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort....pools are beautiful and not too crowded...lots of pool lounge chairs & never a problem to get one...room was wonderful...very clean & in excellent condition ... great restaurant for breakfast with delicious food...nice gift shops...good service ... great location with excellent shuttle service to local areas if you don't want to drive ... nothing negative comes to mind at all...would definitely return...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: smith054
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort and had a wonderful time. We love staying at the Westin. Kaanapali is a great beach. We took our three children on vacation. The room was perfect. Westin beds are very comfortable and the jacuzzi tub was nice way to relax. The resort is very family oriented. Our children loved the pools. Children under 16 are not allowed to be in the hot tubs. It would be nice if the resort designated one hot tub for parents and children. The beach in front of the hotel is good for snorkling but it was nicer to walk towards black rock and swim where there was less coral. We had great service at the Westin. We liked the Lava flow drinks and Maui Bikini blonde beer. We only ate at the restaurant one time and the food was good. We ate several meals at Whalers village. The food there is delicious and the prices are good. We purchased our resort package on ebay for $950 total for 7 nights. Compared to hotel prices we got a really good deal. We can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great beach.”
Reviews.Author: TravelOakville
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Maui. The first time was in 2007 and we stayed at the Westin Maui Resort and Spa. This hotel/condo was much better with kids. The one bedroom has a pullout sofa and worked great for the kids. The pool and the beach was great, we brought our own snorkeling gear. The hotel provides free shuttles to the other hotels, the cannery mall and Lahina (sp). The kitchens are great, it comes with a blender for those fun drinks. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Beware before you Visit”
Reviews.Author: leeabbey
Reviews.Content: We went for 11 nights and it cost between $300 to $450 a night for an ocean view (which is a clear view of the ocean in my opinion). The prices are not cheap in the current market conditions. Donâ€™t forget you are paying for a shell not any food etc. Well where do I start I arrived to someone smiling on reception who gave me a key. We walked for nearly 20 minutes to the room and man was it bad. You could see the ocean like a pinprick in the distance and the view was looking over a building site and it was dirty I felt sick. I went back to reception to go through to assistant manager then manager of desk blah blah and after 3 hours of arguing and viewing rooms I got the room I thought I had paid for. The actual manager of the hotel said that the people with he timeshares have the ocean front not ocean view what I had??? I believe in being upfront and that the website should be correct so beware as you dont get what you think your paying for. I feel if you are a guest the staff try to treat you like a second-class citizen but allow you to pay Ritz Carlton prices. An "OWNER" time share person was rude enough to remove my towels when I went back to my room for 20 minutes to grab lunch when I came back down she told me that I was obviously new and did not know the rules as you can imagine I was not happy. I though I was staying in a 5 star hotel paying for luxury not a 3 star in Spain. To be honest there were to many of the Americans that dont leave America the ones without passports not necessary the most sophisticated. I kept thinking how could they afford this. There were no Europeans and I like Cosmopolitan hotels with all nationalities. The staff in general were ok but the managers had a big attitude problem with a cant do attitude. On the plus side the views were amazing it was like being in Lost the series. The sea was lovely and the hotels had BBQ's that guest could use for free. Once I had sorted my problems I stayed away from reception as did not want to be screwed up the rest of my holiday. Would not recommend the hotel for non owners as its not worth it. Any questions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit - Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlight206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and found the staff to be less than charming but the rest of the facility quite wonderful. Thanks to a good SPG rate we decided to go back.... We found it about the same - not quite as good as last time actually - and wound up checking out early and into the other Westin (there are TWO Westins on Maui) to complete our vacation. Glad we did. A few things have changed for the worse since we last visited the resort.... the food has gotten more expensive (breakfast was about $15 last fall... a decent value for Maui - it's $20 now... and it's the exact same spread) and they've introduced these stupid little "towel cards" you must exchange for a towel at the pool. The cards are something else to remember when you go to the pool - chintzy if you ask me. At the other Westin they distribute pool towels the old fashioned way and I appreciated it after fuddling with the cards... The staff, particularly the front desk, are as unpleasant as ever. With few exceptions, from check in to check out I found them seemingly annoyed by their guests. I stay in lots of properties (Starwood Gold) and on both of my recent stays I found the staff here (particularly the front desk) to be at the low end of hospitality when compared to other properties I've been to.... On the contrary, upon moving to Westin Maui (the OTHER Westin) I found the staff quite nice and definitely at or above the level I've encountered elsewhere. I would strongly encourage anyone considering this resort to realize it's a) primarily a timeshare, and b) don't expect great service. Oh and if you book Ocean View, realize they have an extremely liberal interpretation of what this means.... partial ocean view at the Westin Maui (the OTHER Westin), and most other Maui resorts for that matter, is full ocean view at this place... Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bking00
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Westin Villas (North) on an Interval International timeshare exchange and it was wonderful. We had a 2 BR unit and friends joined us and we had plenty of room everyone. I like the North villas better than the South because the 2nd BR has balconies. I love that they don't charge you for self parking...wonderful perk considering most hotels are charging $20 - $30 per day. We enjoyed it so much we requested the same property for next year...can't get enough of Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “You're going to shell out some bucks, but this place is paradise”
Reviews.Author: jhawks1510
Reviews.Content: If you don't own a timeshare, and didn't finagle a sweet deal somewhere on the internet or by invite, you are going to shell out serious money for even the cheapest room. But remembering that anything in a great location on the water is going to be pricey, this place is tops (we've been here twice). You can BBQ by the sunset, snorkel with giant sea turtles, relax by one of two giant pools, soak in hot tubs, work out in one of two gyms, play XBOX 360 (there's about 12 consoles and there's always one free), cook, bake, or have a party in your suite, have lunch by the pool, or eat at one of the two terrific restaurants on property. There's studios & one-bedrooms with lock-offs (full kitchen, fold-out couch, dining area, big-screen plasma TV. You won't go wrong here. If you do decide you are in the market for a timeshare, Starwood Preferred Guest does have a terrific program with some outstanding properties worldwode. Great for families or for a romantic couple or a bunch of friends.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Westin”
Reviews.Author: aragon44
Reviews.Content: Maui is a hidden Gem and I love it. This property is a Gem if your traveling with kids. If you have kids, is the place to be, except for the fact that kids aren't allowed in the hot tub. Very, very stupid and unreasonable. However, the service won me over. Sonya is the best. I repeat, Sonya is the best. Very helpful, we wanted to change rooms,no problem. Every time we came down to the front desk, she was helpful with everyone. That told me that she treats each customer that same. You can't train customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: LpLoLo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas from Mar 19-Mar 28th, 2009 and enjoyed every minute of our stay....the service was excellent, staff ALL extremely friendly and helpful, especially on the front desk and valet/front door staff (we rented road bikes and kept them in their storage area) we got to know the guys pretty well. Only used the concierge service once, but was at the front desk everyday for something or other! mostly to get the business office (2 computers) key ..they were always helpful and smiling. There was no pressure ever about buying property there and it was actually only mentioned once (by the concierge). We used the shuttle service several times to Lahaina and that was great as well, ran once an hour. Taxis to Lahaina are expensive, but we did use taxis as well. We loved the room, clean, spacious, Heavenly bed was so comfy! nice big bathroom with walk in shower and separate toilet room, kitchen with fridge, stove, dishwasher (we didn't use it however!) and a small washer/dryer we did use- fabulous!... (ocean view in bldg 2). They originally put us in bldg 4 with an 'ocean view' of a parking lot! so we were pretty insistent on getting another room and got a similar room in bldg 2 which we loved, overlooking the pool area........Only used the fitness room once as weather was amazing and did lots of power walking and beach walking, as well as some great road rides up to Honalua Bay.... The best best thing for me was power walking early morning on the boardwalk and seeing whales right offshore.....simply amazing, it is so BEAUTIFUL there and all along that boardwalk/beach. Would see people walking along smiling just so happy to be there, you could tell who had just arrived! The restaurants on site are expensive, only ate at the one by the pool. Ate at some great restaurants in Lahaina, notably Mala Ocean side and Pacifico, both on Front street at opposite ends of town....incredible seafood and vegetarian options. Found eating out very expensive in Lahaina as well but good quality food/wine. Service in these 2 restaurants was excellent as well. Went on two whale watching tours, we are members of the pacific whale foundation, only non-profit eco-organization that we strongly believe in! don't miss doing a trip with them, we did the 8:30 am cruise out of Lahaina. Liked best: friendly staff, excellent service, clean, spacious room, beautiful grounds, lovely boardwalk area and fabulous stretch of beach, Whales!!! Flowers, birds, and gorgeous turquoise/blue clear waters! Liked least: can't really think of anything, except leaving! I had a lump in my throat all day Friday before our departure the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping was poor and not to be trusted!”
Reviews.Author: Optoko
Reviews.Content: We came on a invitation to visit and listen to a time-share presentation...so the value was very good. The property was nice and the rooms were roomy.....but the layout was not friendly (hallway mazes, awkward room designs, etc.) General service from the grounds staff was warm and welcoming. The restaurant on site was excellent. But the housekeeping was deplorable. When we arrived, there was only one bar of soap to use between the vanity and shower; and no shampoo, lotions, etc. (We thought that that was standard since it was a timeshare.) After inquiring at the front desk, they said that there should have been a full complement of sundries. We also noticed that there were french fries on the floor next to the sofa.....obviously missed by housekeeping. In addition, the furniture on the lanai were dusty and never cleaned. After reporting this to the management, they cleaned the entire unit, but the results were only slightly better.....this was a true disappointment for a Westin property. Also, on check out, we were charged for a phone call that we did not make (we have our own cell phones). The call was apparently made by someone on the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonKath
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved, loved the Westin. Loved the lobby and common area, loved the beach...the pools...the promenade walk all the way down from the Hyatt to the Sheridan...loved the grounds...the service. We did not try any of the restaurants. They were overpriced and cliche. We had more fun finding the out of the way dining spots that were quirky and like treasures waiting to be discovered. (there were lots of choices - make sure you spend time on this site reading reviews...!). We found the hotel very accomodating and gave us our room at 9:30 in the morning even though check in is 3 PM. If you have the chance to spend some nights on a resort in Ka'anapali - do so! It is a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun, kids LOVE it and we do too!”
Reviews.Author: MamaOinOR
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Westin Ocean Resort Villas thanks to my in-laws who own a time share. It is a beautiful property on truly one of the best family beaches on the island. We were there two weeks - the first week we saw whales and dolphins and tons of marine life snorkeling right on the beach. We saw an eel, thousands of reef fish, green sea turtles and . . . 1 4' white tipped reef shark. It was amazing. The second week the waves picked up a bit and so the snorkeling wasn't as good but the kids had a ball riding the waves (our children are 2, 4 1.2 and 7) The property is beautiful, the rooms very comfortable and quiet. The kitchen is stocked in equipment but there are no spices or condiments. The BBQ's are a plenty and I have no idea what these people are talking about getting lost on the property?! My 4 year old can find his way around just fine. Weird. Anyway, I have been to Maui over 20 times in my lifetime and this is by far the nicest and most family friendly place we have ever stayed. Oh, one note. I inadvertantly left my cell phone in the room upon leaving. I was fairly upset as one could imagine, but I called the next morning at about 7am Maui time and the housekeeper had found it, turned it in to security and I had it back in my hands on Tuesday. I was truly amazed by that. Thank you Westin Kaanapali, we can't WAIT to come back! Oh, the only negative is that there are signs saying kids can't go in the spa - the kids are freezing after getting out of the pool on windy days, it's unreasonable to expect them to just towel off. We were only asked to have our kids out one time. This was new this year - hope they change it back! :) (We never eat at the restaurants on the property - not a great value for the $$$ for us - but we did love the convenience of the store and had a FANTASTIC massage at the Spa!)

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful What you are getting Booking on the Site”
Reviews.Author: ArtVandelayJr
Reviews.Content: I am going to be a little tough on these guys because I am not big on deception. YES Maui is beautiful and you can snorkel 20 feet into the water here and see whales right off the beach; which is AWESOME (but you get that anyway). We booked an Ocean View Studio Villa for $370 night. They put us in the SOUTH bldg 3. We had neither a deck or a flat-screen which were both featured on the virtual tour (or an ocean view without a window lean). They are cordial but give you nothing extra and would only change our room to a 1-bedroom for $125 a night add'l. Not even an hour extra on check-out. The on-site ammenities are great if you have an unlimited wallet; otherwise head to Lahaina for EVERTHING!!! Towel dude wanted $18 for 24 hours just for fins!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: pdxlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We travel to Hawaii (generally Honolulu) every 4-6 weeks between business and pleasure and stayed at this property for the first time in February. We had an amazing time and greatly enjoyed our stay. We were using Starwood points and upgraded to a ocean view room which had a wonderful ocean and pool view. We left the kiddos at home on this trip but wish we had brought them after seeing the incredible pool. We stayed at the Fairmont in Wailea in October and found this to be a far superior property and one we will choose again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: AJCVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: The location (right on Ka'anapali Beach) cannot be beat; the view was spectacular! The staff were friendly, attentive and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries!”
Reviews.Author: MauiHI
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin Kaanapali Villas and I must admit, I was a bit nervous after reading a few TA reviews. We arrived to a bustling entrance where the guard is apparently there for mere decoration, but always gives a friendly wave. We proceeded to the first entrance which is the South. A very helpful drive attendant immediately radioed someone somewhere and found out that we were booked in the North Villas which was comforting since this is the newer building. At the end of the drive, we found a well marked North entrance and were also immediately assisted by friendly valet and bellmen. Check in was a breeze even though it was a busy day (Sat.) We found ample parking and our room fairly easily and were pleased to find a parking deck very close our room. The room was beautiful, clean, and well equipped for a lengthy stay.....washer/dryer, full size kitchen, two tvs, huge entrance closet, and a large lanai. The furnishings are tastefully Hawaiian and not tacky tapa cloth everywhere. We felt right at home. As we ventured out and about, we could see how the property could be confusing, but we marked our trail and payed attention to the well placed signage. The pool was very nice and we particularly enjoyed the coi (koi) fish pond with the abundance of Hawaiian flora. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair and the literature states that after 60 minutes, towels can be removed from the chairs, but I doubt the staff would intervene since they did not pay one bit of attention to all the kids running about and hopping in the jacuzzi. They should just take down the 16 and older signs for the jacuzzi's because this is a joke. The adult pool was too windy and near the grilling area so we dealt with the kids and still enjoyed the pool area each day. Overall, my impression was one of a well run property with genuinely kind caring staff. We enjoyed our stay and will visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Way below expectations based on Tripadvisor feedback”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffiveBC
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a 10 day stay at this property. We all felt that the property overall was well below what we thought we would experience. Some examples include: - backed up garburator required service - fridge leaked water over the whole kitchen floor and needed repair - dvd player faulty and needed to be replaced - door handle broke off and needed to be replaced - had to request our mid week room 'tidy' 4 times and wait 3 days past due date for room to be cleaned - spa charges on final bill for over $300 which we were not responsible for This was a beautiful property when new and in a fantastic location, however the overall service levels from staff and the maintenance of the property is poor given all the defects and poor customer service we experienced. We stayed in the south building which is a couple years old now. The north building is newer but managed by the same management company so I would expect over time it will fall into the same disrepair. I would not recommend this property as a place to stay in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonder in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: preciousgemcrystal
Reviews.Content: Incredible property. The rooms are clean and very well kept. All the rooms are uniform so no one part gets "a better room". Their signature Heavenly Bed is a huge plus, loved them so much I have one of my own! Everything was wonderful. The staff were very pleasant and friendly, the grounds were gorgeous and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. My only small complaint is that the structure of the property is a bit hard to follow. We got lost trying to find our room not once but 3 times. I guess that's what happens when you stay somewhere so large! Other than that, perfection. Great for families and honeymooners!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort, devoid of anything Hawaiian...”
Reviews.Author: AllisonNNH
Reviews.Content: We just left the Westing Ka'anapali Villas and all in all, we had a very nice stay. We have been to Maui before, having stayed at the Sheraton (which we loved). The villas are lovely but they have zero Hawaiian character. You could be at any Westin anywhere in the US. We are owners at another Starwood property and exchanged here for this vacation. We had a 1-BR unit on the South side, "ocean view". Ha. Our ocean view was blocked first by a row of trees, then a couple of rows of parked cars, a full public parking lot for the adjacent public park, then the park.... If I stood on my toes and stared between a couple of trees, I could see glimmers of water. The unit itself was very comfortable. The beds were "Heavenly" as was the shower. The bathroom was huge (but IMHO a huge waste of space that could have been better used as living space), The furnishings were showing age, and the carpet was a wreck. We were told that our building was next up for a renovation, which they claim to do every 5 years. This place is more of a hotel than other timeshares we have been to, with bars and restaurants galore. It is HUGE and as others have said, a real maze to navigate. We always BBQ when we timeshare vacation, but the grills were very inconveniently located and a good 10 minute walk from our unit. My daughter and I did the spa which was very nice, but again, devoid of anything remotely Hawaiian. We also did a number of the activities offered, such as wine tasting, lei making, etc... All were really well-done and the staff was delighful and always friendly. Two beefs: 1) Chair saving is prevalent here, esp at the South pool. At 10 am, we could not find 3 chairs because almost every one had a towel on it , yet no people. When we mentioned it to the staff, they basically said they were powerless to stop it. 2) There are no free chairs available to sit on the beach. If you want a chair, you have to rent one. At the Sheraton, the basic chairs were free; if you wanted a canopy chair, you paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Westin Ka'anapali and Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Cappuccinolover
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Westin Ka'anapali back in January '08. I have no qualms about this hotel. It is truly a 5 star at its best. The rooms has its own kitchen, sink and washer and dryer. The staff were exceptionally friendly. The grounds were well kept. You need a car to get around Maui and parking at the hotel is free. The best part about Maui is the BEACH. It's not as crowded as Waikiki beach. We did two exurcsions: road to Hana and Haleakala. I would recommend both excursions especially Haleakala. Going up top Haleakala was a bit unsettling though because the roads were narrow, but watching the sun rise was an amazing experience i will never forget. Just a tip - - BRING WINTER CLOTHES! We absolutely froze while we were up there! Some people brought their own duvet covers. lol We had a lovely time in Maui and cant' wait to go back!.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful villas,though it was a windy tunnel while we were there.”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl2004
Reviews.Content: If you happen to be an owner as we are, we were disappointed to have been there on a week when it was absolutely a windstorm everyday. We were cold in our villa and tried to turn on the heat (there's none-just turn off the AC). Our 2 bedroom villa in the North section was beautiful - spotlessly clean, modern decor, impeccable. We bought ocean front and were disappointed to be over the pool which was noisy. If you are in building 8 north, ask for any villa besides 1 and 2 on the floors -those are the windiest. This place is busy - lots of families with little kids. Many dining options -including making breakfast in your villa which we did a lot. The breakfast buffet on the South side is quite good. The pool bar would probably be nice if we had packed a parka - honestly, the staff was wearing North Face windbreakers/jackets every evening while we were there because it was COLD and WINDY. We discovered many lovely places in Lahaina to dine - including Penne Pasta Cafe and Kobe Steakhouse for Teppanyaki. Cheryl was an excellent on site scuba instructor - our son had several great dives with her expert guidance. Of course we will return, we are owners,but we will pick a different time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: smileytraveller66
Reviews.Content: Wow.... Our trip to the hotel couldn't have been better. We stayed in the villas. The rooms were absolutley fantastic. So clean, and so updated and useable. The beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was amazing! The pool was great: included was a water slide. Great for kids and also for adults. Our stay really couldn't have been better. Would love to go back soon!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...as long as you know what you're in for and you don't stay in an”
Reviews.Author: Bighair87
Reviews.Content: This is a family resort-meaning there are lots and lots of kids running around, mostly families and older people. Which is great if that's the environment you're looking for. Not so great if you're a couple looking for a romantic getaway. The rooms are clean and well appointed with large bathrooms, a whirlpool tub, full kitchen (includes utensils, pots, pans, even a blender!) and my favorite-Heavenly beds. I cannot stress enough that if you have booked an "Island View" room you should call the hotel directly and request a room in the newer building (garden view rooms are the same price). In case you're wondering, in Hawaiian (at least at the Westin) Island View translates to something like "really horrible view of the parking lot with small patch of mountain in the background". Our bell hop even told us that the island view rooms were a hard sell because well, when you're in paradise you want to look out of your window and see palm trees swaying in the breeze, not 30 beat up rental cars, the highway, and rusty power lines. Our room in the newer building was very nice (and I barely heard any screaming children-hooray!). The bathtub and refrigerator were bigger and of course I could peek out my window and see a coy pond and palm trees, which made me very happy.

Reviews.Title: “We hope we are able to return next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: laroo906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for 9 nights. We stayed in the North Villas in a studio. We were very impressed in the resort. Our room was absolutely beautiful. We had a view of the pool. The "heavenly" bed was just that. We could walk the path for hours,, sit out on the sand by the ocean and watch whales or just relax on the lanai. We cooked in the kitchen no problem. I rented thru VRBO.com. and pd approx. 225/ night which was a great value. (Thanks Naomi.) We really do hope to do it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Ka`anapali. Beach is okay but hotel is perfection.”
Reviews.Author: slippahs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated off the main Ka`anapali Beach Resort area which is nice but doesn't share the nice strip of beach that those resorts have. The beach here is rocky about 4 feet in, which can be painful if you're just looking to splash around in the water. Snorkeling is better at the Sheraton Maui near Black Rock. The sand at this beach is not as nice as the beach farther South. But you do get the benefit of a quieter beach since less resorts use the beach fronting the Villas. And it's a great place to whale watch during Dec-early Apr. That said, everything else about this timeshare resort is spectacular. THE VILLA: We were booked into a 1-bedroom Island View and received a room in the newer North building. We are not timeshare owners but have stayed at the Villas before and must say that the rooms here are incredible. It's fully stocked with a full kitchen with almost every appliance that you could possibly need (we, being Hawaii residents, were disappointed to learn that the kitchen doesn't come with a rice cooker). Having a fully stocked kitchen is a great advantage of this room compared to other rooms, as you can save money by cooking your own meals. A Star Markets is only a 5 minute drive away North of the hotel and is open 24 hours. Washer/dryer in the room is great for drying your wet bathing suits. The vaccum is great for getting all that sand off your floor. The villa is also stocked with a DVD Player, which is great if you want to rent movies prior to arriving (note that there is no in-villa pay-per-view movie offerings as there is at other hotels). The TV has HBO and a full compliment of cable channels. There's also a Bose player in the room, though we couldn't catch any good radio stations. The bathroom is incredible and is at or above Westin standards with Westin amenities. The shower has the two-shower head Westin Heavenly Shower. And there must be special mention of the hot tub that comes standard in every villa. It was immaculate and a great way to unwind and relax following a day at the beach or the pools. Another great way to end the day was the Westin Heavenly Bed. For those who've stayed at other Westins before, this is your standard Heavenly Bed. POOL AREA: Great pool offering. We never had to fight to find a chair (though it seemed that occupany was fairly low while we were there). There are four pools at the Villas. The first is one within the main building, which includes a fairly dull water slide (the Westin Maui's water slide is probably the most exciting for adults). The second is a kiddie pool in between the Main and North Towers, which has a pirate ship play toy. The third is in between the North Tower, which has a basketball and volleyball net. And the fourth is an adults only pool at the northern most end of the Hotel in the North Tower. The pools are great when the beach gets tiring. There's a towel card that you must to get your towels (and you must return the towel card when you check-out or be charged $15), but other than that hassle, there's no other hassles involved. Do note that unlike other resorts, pool-side service was non-existant, meaning that if you wanted drinks or a bite to eat, you most likely have to venture to the pool-side restaurant (at the North pool). There was also a hot dog vendor on site at the North Pool. RESTAURANTS: With all the ono (delicious) food offerings that the Ka`anapali/Lahaina area has to offer, we didn't eat on site. Food was generally pricey but within reason for a resort. The hot dog vendor mentioned above charged $7 for two hot dogs or $5 for one. We opted to hold out for dinner and head to Sansei's (in the Kapalua resort) 50% off late night menu that includes great sushi and appetizers on Thurs and Fri nights. We also cooked our meals, having purchased groceries at the 24 hour Star Markets mentioned above. Make sure to purchase your groceries before arriving at this hotel as while there are two markets that are fully stocked with grocery items, the pricing is outrageous. OTHER OFFERINGS: The Villas offered its usual Westin Unwind. Specifically, on Saturdays, the chefs from the restaurant have a cooking demonstration, which we visited. The chef prepared egg rolls (it's different every week) and allowed viewing guests to sample. Not bad. COMPARISON TO OTHER HOTELS: We've stayed at the Sheraton Maui, the Westin Maui, the Hyatt, along with these Villas in the past. These Villas win hands down. First off, you're getting so much more for your money. You can use the in-villa kitchen to cook your own meals if you'd like to save more coin. Most importantly, there's no resort fee, so there's no need to worry about extra charges. Parking, internet (both wired and WIFI) are all included in the room rate here. The Sheraton, Westin Maui, and Hyatt all charge resort fees upwards of $25+/night. GRIPE: My only gripe is the check-in/check-out is 4 p.m. and 10 a.m., respectively, and non-negotiable, even for Starwood elites (who normally can request a 4 p.m. check-out at non-resort hotels). Other than that, we'll be back. This is a great hotel for the Ka`anapali area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation...Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: idgirl
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am VERY fussy about the hotels that I stay in! A bad hotel can ruin my vacation. My husband calls me a "hotel snob". I LOVED this resort! We stayed in a studio room with a garden view. I loved having a kitchen and a washer and dryer in the room. The view from our balcony was wonderful overlooking the pool, beautiful landscaping, and a small sliver of ocean. Check in was a little slow but typical for the Hawaiian culture. They just have a laid back, no worries attitude. :) Staff was always responsive and helpful! The bed was AMAZING! It was the best hotel bed that I have ever stayed in. We traveled with two other couples and we all loved the resort. We were never pressured to look into the timeshare option. We used the conciere to book a whale watch and she gave us the option to talk to someone about becoming an owner. We declined and that was the end of the conversation.
