The beach in front of the resort is great. It has beautiful coral beds for snorkeling. It was unusually windy while we were there and the snokeling wasn't great anywhere. We only found great snorkeling down south at the "Dumps" beach. (Yes that is it's real name..it was a dump site in the 1920's) We saw turtles. tons of whales, and even a pod of dolphins from the beach in front of the resort. The resort is big as other reviews have noted. I didn't find the layout confusing at all, however. We stayed in the North section. It appeared to be quiter and less crowded than the South section. If I was going with my children, the South section's pool did have a waterslide and the main activity center. The Pirate Ship pool was in the middle of the two sections. Overall, it was WONDERFUL!!! We would go back in a heart beat! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, poor managment”
Reviews.Author: dka001
Reviews.Content: Imagine my surprise to get a room without a shower. Who would have thought to confirm something like that. No problem, right? Call down and get moved to another room. Management was completely unwilling to do so. In spite of the excellent service from valet through dining, mangement's lack of concern for their guest's comfort make this an undesirable hotel selection.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed, well run, beautifully-situated resort”
Reviews.Author: hanalei
Reviews.Content: Although we were hesitant to get a studio, it was spacious, well-appointed, and had an ocean view even though we paid only for an island view. The person who cleans the room every day is meticulous: washes the dishes, restocks the laundry soap, and leaves extra towels and lovely leaf-shaped bar soaps. Every evening at sunset the bar serves happy hour priced and well-made tropical cocktails. The location is spectacular as the view of the other islands (I am guessing Molikai and Lanai) is very clear. Pools are well-designed (children's pool has a wonderful pirate ship) and there are many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious resort”
Reviews.Author: mikebayarea
Reviews.Content: Reserved a connected 1 bedroom and a studio island view at the north property. Despite island view rating, the room had a great ocean view overlooking pool. Units were beautiful and luxurious. Each side (studio and 1-bedroom) had a washer/dryer and kitchen. Kitchens had ovens, full-size refrigerators, granite counter tops, etc... Both sides had bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs and large showers with frameless glass doors. Each side had a large lanai with table and chairs. Resort is right on the beach with excellent snorkeling. We saw giant sea turtles every day. Saw a few whales as well. Several restaurants on location that were very nice. The higher-end restaurant in our building was open air, elegant, and overlooking koi pond. There was also an outdoor, patio style grill overlooking beach. Plenty of lounge chairs around the pools. Lots of grills available for bbq if you want to eat in. Free shuttle to Lanai and main drag in Kaanapali and cannery mall, so no car is needed. My wife tried out the on-sight spa for massage and relaxation and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - hell in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Venice_CaStoney
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst experience I have had in Maui in the 25 years I have been visiting. False advertising-rooms are loud and ocean view is not ocean view but partial pool view. Loud children running wild, loved the sign in the jacuzzi "if there is fecal contamination they will shut it down" YUCK, that really was a relaxing touch. Frankly the entire place was bad bad bad and they nickel and dime you. If you are used to bad service or don't know the difference maybe not so bad. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Great "short" visit”
Reviews.Author: Lvtolvlife
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Westin Villas for one night preceeding a full week stay at the new Marriott Lahaina & Napili Villas. Although we were only able to stay one night, we were very impressed with the location and staff during our time there. Our reservation was for a studio island villa. The front desk personnel kindly upgraded our family to a one bedroom when she saw there were 4 of us. The room was very nice. I have to admit, comparing this to the one bedroom we stayed at with Marriott, the living room was half the size. So our family of 4 was a little crowded for the one night. If my family had stayed here for a week, it would have felt very tight. The bathroom was nice is some ways.... the shower was awesome, as was the jetted tub. The weird thing was the "toilet area" was not enclosed. There was a "door" that gave some privacy but had a one foot gap between the floor and the door. My teenager did not like not having complete privacy and would not allow anyone else in the bathroom area to get ready while she was in there. The bathroom is open to the bedroom but you can shut the "shutters" for more privacy. Maybe I missed it (we were a little tired when we checked in) but I did not see an oven. We had a full size oven at the Marriott and it came in handy on many occassions. The one bedroom units did have a very nice size lanai.

Reviews.Title: “total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: kimspokane
Reviews.Content: Very easy easy... vacation. Stayed one week in January. Then last two nights at the Sheraton. We booked online at Westin website. Booked and ocean view one bedroom villa. We checked in at 2 or 3 pm and our room was ready. We have been to Maui many times and from my experience not everyone in the hotel business is extra nice or helpful but not the case here. Pulled up, very nice kid watches our car, unloads our groceries from costco... we walk into the lobby, met by a genuinely friendly front desk staff and w/in two mins had keys to our room. Building 8 (north side) second floor. Told us where to park, on second floor of garage and the vallet will meet us at the room. We park, walk up to room where valet meets us with our stuff and we walk into true bliss. I had read many reviews. I half expected some room over a parking lot and hwy. I could not book ocean front online nor would they change when I phoned them. I think these are for owners but we had a great room. Not sure this type would always be an option depending on occupancy but lucky for us it was. If I had just an "ocean view" which I assume would be looking at pools and then ocean, I would request highest floor so at least people would not be at eye level when you are sitting in robe having coffee and breakfast. If I had little kids I would probably prefer ground floor non ocean view as the patios open up to run around. I was debating garden view one bed villa or ocean view one bedroom villa but went with the ocean view in hopes of paying more, getting the upgrade. We have rented luxury homes on the islands, stayed in condos, hotels... I really liked the combo of having a better than suite style of hotel room with a seperate living/kitchen area, great br, daily maid service, pools, beach, service of hotel but condo style accomodations. I felt we also had the privacy. Of course there is more privacy when renting a countryside estate in Kauai but in doing so you forego the hotel aspects of this place. I also liked the little things like the rock formations that had a subtle music piped in when walking thru the property. Nothing loud. just a little jack johnson or izzy hawaiian music that u can hear, if u are listing, when walking or laying by the pool... In comparing the service at sheraton vs. westin villas there was only one small diff. The welcome and genuine service at the Westin was superior. Pool side service at the westin was available. You just needed to raise a hand or make eye contact/ask for a menu... At the Sheraton poolside the servers actually asked you if u wanted anything and came by fairly frequently to ask if u wanted anything more. No big diff to us. It did not trouble us too much to sit up and make eye contact w a server. Sheraton spa was still under construction. Westin's spa is great. Pools were not too busy at Sheraton or Westin. The Westin has two jacuzzis, one ocean front. I loved taking a jacuzzi in the mornings and at night before bed. There is a store on site. It has a starbucks and most basic groceries one would need. I found prices not much more than safeway and atmosphere, selection, staff much better. Lahaina Safeway is kind of a pit. Not much selection, high prices, very busy. I was fine with a bill that may have been a dollar or so more but more of a Larry''s market atmosphere with supprisingly better selection. Our flight arrived around 11 am. Came from snow and cold and were dying to get to the beach... We bit the bullet and did the Costco deal prior to going to kaanapali. It paid off. Bought steak, seafood... all at higher prices than Costco at home but in comparison to cost and selection at safeway in Lahaina we did great. We used about 60% of what we purchased. We BBQ'd several nights. BBQ's are by the adult pool and building 8. They are a little busy 5-6pm but outside this time they are pretty open. On the south property the BBQ's are ocean front. We also ate at the outdoor pool bar for lunch a few times. Had good food at less than half the cost of the Sheraton. Ordered hot wings one night at the pool bar that were subpar but otherwise food was good. My guess is that if we had only eaten out on site vs. bbq or in our room it would not have cost much more. We love to cook and bbq so it was great to have the option to do both. Also ate at Kimo's in Lahaina one night and food, atmosphere, service was fab. The Westin south and North properties are connected by a walkway but other than walking on the path we did not see much of the south property. No need to. Each has everything u need. I think the north is the only one that has the westin spa but they are two min path walk apart. Both north and south properties looked similar. Each with seperate pools, common areas.... we were never asked once about a timeshare presentation, nor did anyone phone us. The timeshare deal did not seem to really be evident. To us it seemed like a hotel stay with hotel service. At other SPG properties and hiltons, marriotts... it is more evident than at this actual "ownership" resort. I was supprised. Stevie at the front desk has to be one of the most gracious, helpful persons out there. She was great as was every staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Planning on Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiP
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas and can't wait to go back. It's a great location and a perfect beach. The property is well maintained, and all the rooms appear to be completely refurbished. We stayed in Bldg. 6 on the 3rd floor in a one bedroom suite. There was plenty of room for all of our things. The bed and the bed linens were heavenly. The kitchen was well appointed and there's a small grocery on the property. We ate all of the breakfasts in the room. Beautiful, huge bathroom with soaking tub and large, seperate shower. We never heard any ambient noise from neighbors - which is always a plus. There are three pool areas and plenty of lounge chairs to go around. The kiddies pool is adorable with a miniature pirate ship in it. In summary, a very nice comfortable resort. We always went to the beach - and they charge a $10 fee to rent a lounge chair on the beach - which was a surprise to me. But everyone on site was very helpful and friendly. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: kdru
Reviews.Content: I am SO disappointed. When we got here they told us they gave us a double upgrade because no one is here! We got to our room and it seemed fine but I immediately went to open the balcony and I was not met by ocean noise, I was met by a loud constant noise of the electronic pump that is used to make all their man made waterfalls run. We called immediately and they said they had a room closer to the ocean. We took it, got there and the same thing!! So close to the ocean and this hotel has it set up that you can't even HEAR the ocean!! So, the next night I decide to try to sleep with the balcony door open anyways. At about 3 in the morning I got up and all I could here was music!!! They were playing music somewhere and it resonated up to all the rooms. Besides the fact that their "ocean view rooms" only allow you to see the ocean from a small spot on the balcony. This place is great for young kids. But I would NEVER come here again, even with my kids. They took Hawaii out of the equasion when they covered up all the nature surrounding the hotel with artificial man made noises, loud music and an overall feeling that you are at a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas stay”
Reviews.Author: Alaska6
Reviews.Content: The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas (North) were fantastic. Excellent service, excellent view (we had a courtyard view of the pool). The rooms were very clean. The pools were great for the kids, they even had a pirate ship pool area for my youngst child. Would love to return here on future visits. We went through a Maui travel agency, I wish I could put their e-mail here because the service was also excellent. I guess I could say thank you Naomi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: regandry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a timeshare exchange. Very nice place. Reminiscent of an upscale Westin hotel with the convenience of a kitchen and living room included. We arrived late and were initially assigned a first level room. The desk clerk proactively searched and placed us in a better room (4th floor). Not really an ocean view, but our balcony overlooked the pool and you could see the ocean. Restaurants on site were okay, but a little pricey for what they are. Staff was friendly, food at the two poolside restaurants (we didn't eat at the fine dining place) were simple bar food with a few higher end items. The beach is right out the back door with great snorkeling. There are better swimming beaches a five minute shuttle ride away at Black Rock, as there is a lot of coral here, but overall it was definitely swimmable and as long as you are careful around the coral, a good beach. The pools are nice too, although only 4 feet deep for some reason. The south pool is big, with a waterslide and wasn't overly crowded. We never had to fight for a chair and the poolside service was a nice touch, although not executed perfectly. It seemed like you had to really flag them down if you wanted a drink or sandwich. They went out of their way to not interrupt your sunbathing, which is to say they seemed to ignore you if you weren't calling out to them. The location is also really convenient. Ten minutes from Lahaina, fifteen from Kapalua. Great restaurants in both places and five minutes from Fish Market Maui, which had great fresh fish sandwiches at great prices. Also had a very convenient shuttle to Whaler's village, Black Rock (great snorkeling and swim beach), and Lahaina. Overall, this was one of our favorite timeshare exchanges. Truly a resort feel with really nice accomodations and villa convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, great units”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: The setting is what it is all about. They are large units that face the ocean and a large ppol area with water slide. The grounds are nice but the lighting was not working properly. The views ot the whales was terrific. Great bathroom with wonderful shower. Staff was somewhat unresponsive. Breakfast buffet was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, attention to detail needed”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Smy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the North side Westin Villas in a studio room on the 6th floor (it's actually 4th floor from ground (reception) which is marked as 2nd floor. The room was nicely decorated, but showing wear and tear. Carpet was stained, tiles scuffed, curtains dirty, table chipped, balcony had 2 empty coke cans and stucco looked dirty. It didn't bother us too much, but we did end up buying some bleach cleaner and cleaned the most used areas (light fixtures, door handles) after seeing those 20/20 reports about fecal matter being found in hotels rooms during undercover investigations (some people lack hygiene, including kids). The hotel grounds are nicely kept, but the hallways are also showing wear and tear. Walls are scuffed, and carpets dirty. Overall, it wasn't enough to affect our stay as we have seen much worse before. However, I can't imagine why someone would want ownership in a place that isn't kept up to standards. I would expect more if I paid what they are charging. The hotel beach is nice, but narrow and steep to walk. There's a nearby beachwalk that extends for miles..great for daily walks. As for Maui, it's a beautiful place. Front street in Lahaina is a tourist trap with store after store selling t-shirts, art, jewelry and tourist trinkets. A car rental is a must to get around, unless you intend to spend your entire time at the hotel. We toured much of the island and took plenty of pictures. Must sees are the Haleakala crater, winding road to Hana and beyond, and whale watching. Kihei is more modern and has some nice shops. Food is more expensive than on mainland as is expected. For example, a loaf of bread costs $5. The biggest rip offs are the pineapples..there's a road stand next to Chez Paul's restaurant on highway 30 about 10 miles south of Lahaina. They sell pineapples for $10. The same Maui Gold pineapples go for $5 at the local grocery stores (Safeway, Lahaina Farms, Walmart, etc..). Even the airport sells them two for $18.95. Overall we had a wonderful trip and great time..we always make the best out of everyplace we go. The memories will last a life time. Despite what we have seen, we would stay at the resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Maui Maui”
Reviews.Author: PuraVida32
Reviews.Content: After getting situated, the Westin Villas provided one of the best rooms that I have stayed in while on vacation. When my wife and I first arrived at the villas, we were given an "ocean view" studio on the south side. Within five minutes of checking into the room, we were on our way back to reception to request another room. The rrom was nice enough, but the linai was non-existent and there was no ocean view. After speaking with Sonya, we were upgraded to a one bedroom on the north side, and let me just say our vacation began. The north side is newer than the south, and the room we were given was beautiful! It had a very nice linai, which was great for watching the ocean, reading a good book as the sun rose, and eating breakfast. The room was spacious, it had a nice kitchen and the it was cleaned daily. I've heard other reviewers complain about the late room cleaning, but if you're not on some crazy schedule it really doesn't matter. You're in Hawaii, so you should be rather relaxed. All of the workers at the hotel were friendly, and catered to any need that was expressed. I've stayed in some great hotels, including in locations such as Bali, Indonesia, Singapore, Rome, etc..., and I must say the villas ranked right up there with the best of them. Again, Sonya was amazing and truly professional!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: plainfieldmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas for a week last summer. What a great hotel for our family! Our kids were 5 and 8 and always had other kids to play with. The pools were beautiful, as were the ocean views. use LOTS of sunblock! The beach was very clean and fun for the kids. Watch for waves that come our of nowhere--some people we met had their cell phones destroyed when they got wet--and they were not very close to the shore. The poolside restaurants were good. We often went off site for dinners. It was great to have a washer and dryer in the unit, as well as a small kitchen (we had a studio, which was great, as we spent all day ot the pool, beach, or being tourists. We hope to stay again on our next trip. Some tips: But rafts at the local drugstore--for $2-3 vs. $7-8 at the Westin. Make sure to put towels and a personal item on pool chairs early in the morning, or you will be on the lookout all day for chairs. Definitely have a 'Tropical Monkey" while at the pool:)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel (also Hotel Map)”
Reviews.Author: avikas
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried when i read the mixed reviews of this hotel on TripAdvisor. However, my stay was excellent and I would really recommend this hotel. One of the problems for first time travellers is to figure out how this hotel is laid out, so I have scanned and attached a map of this hotel which shows you the building locations, etc. (see my attached photos). North vs. South side: We stayed in a studio in the North side. There is no separate kitchen like the South side but adequate for simple meals. Every room on the North side has a lanai (balcony). The South side pool is more fun for kids (they loved the slide) but you can walk over to that pool easily. Westin Villas vs. Westin Hotel: Don't confuse the two. The Villas (this review) is for timeshares, etc. and the Hotel is a hotel and located a few miles away (you have to drive there). The hotel is situated in a more lively area, near to Whaler's Village, shops, etc. The Villas are in a quiet area, with a very nice secluded beach. Activities: The snorkeling on the beach right outside the hotel is excellent. I have snorkelled in a lot of areas in the Carribean, Maldives, etc. and this beach was close to top of the list when you factor in the convenience. My kids also went on the underwater scooter and loved it (they rent it in the hotel itself with the instructor, my kids are 8 & 9 yrs old). Remember to go snorkelling to the Black Rock beach also (near the Westin/Sheraton Hotel). One more notch for this hotel was the free WiFi i could get sitting right on my room balcony. Lots of computer viruses though since its open WiFi so make sure your antivirus is up to date. All in all, had a great time. Did not purchase a timeshare though - could not deal with the $2000 annual maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms, Very "Time Share" Atmosphere, Misleading Marketing Information”
Reviews.Author: California2Maui
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui a number of times prior to this trip, and have stayed at the Four Seasons, the Sheraton, the Kea Lani, and one other resort. I tend to get the most enjoyment out of sitting poolside or on the beach and relaxing, so I am a pretty low maintenance guest. Of my prior stays, I would rate the Four Seasons the highest due to the general atmosphere, great service, and incredible beach (the sand is like baby powder and the calm ocean like a warm bath). I would rate the Sheraton behind that (a little lower in all categories, though the beach itself is overall the best on the island, in my opinion). I note this just as a frame of reference, as everyone has different preferences and enjoy different kinds of resorts and amenities, with different priorities. I went on this trip based on an invitation from Sheraton Vacation Services for the Sheraton. I requested a date within the 60 day window, for which they had nothing, but they said that they were able to book at other Starwood resorts, and had a cancellation for the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas. So I booked that for $750 for 5 nights, with rental car (mostly) included (guest responsible for taxes) plus a $75 credit, so it was a really good deal. Getting confirmation after paying was a challenge, but given the short notice, I have no complaints. Upon arriving at the resort, it is a little confusing as to where you are supposed to go, in that there are multiple buildings, poor signage, lots with dead ends and no where to turn around, and some construction going on (the back row of two rows of part of the main parting lot is blocked off by dumpsters). The lobby of the resort and views are very nice, but it is not as "inviting" as other resorts I've been to - i.e. no greeting, no lei, etc. While we visited the resort on a "deal", we did request a room upgrade, if available, prior to arriving. When checking in, we were told we received a free upgrade to an "ocean view" studio. Interestingly, in checking into the room and opening the drapes, all I could see is a parking lot filled with cars. This was not a problem, as I expected as much from the rate/package, but it was puzzling. The rooms are very nice. I'd probably rate the rooms with the highest mark, as far as reviewing the property overall. The room was "new" (compared with say, the Sheraron, etc.) and contemporary. For a studio, it was a decent size. It also included a little kitchenette with range and microwave and granite counters and dishes, knives, silverware - the basics you might need. It also included a mini clothes washer and dryer - very convenient. The shower, jacuzzi tub, and large king-sized bed were all very nice. No complaints at all, apart from the "ocean view" (which I had no expectations for) and the lack of a lanai, which isn't the worst thing in the world, as sometimes where you have lanais your neighbors get noisy and carried away. Also, even though it was looking out (ground floor) the packing lot and an A/C unit, it was very quiet with everything closed up - you'd never know. Generally speaking, when on Maui, I see the room as a place to sleep, so for me, it worked out fine. As far as the resort itself goes, it is very large and the grounds expansive. There were several pools and pool areas. It was very crowded and noisy - lots of people, lots of families and kids. So I would definitely not recommend this resort for honeymoons, etc. There were a number of restaurants, but we did not use any of them. It also is not the kind of resort where they come up to you at the lounge to take drink orders, etc. So all in all, a very different atmosphere. We were told that 95% of the guests were "owners" (i.e. they bought time shares) - I don't know how accurate that is (more on that later). But in talking with other guests, it does seem very family-oriented, with people stopping off at Costco on the way in and cooking meals for their families, etc. So all in all, definitely a different "vibe" from other resorts I've stayed at - not saying this is good or bad, just different. I know my sister and her family with three kids stayed there and loved it because of the accommodations, so it just depends on what you are trying to accomplish with your stay. The beach area was nice. While near Sheraton/Black Rock, it is not as nice but still very nice none the less. The beach/sand area itself is not near as deep (between the row of bushes/trees and the water) and the water itself has more rocks and coral than sand - so better for snorkeling than swimming. The key "selling point" to me on the resort and the vacation package was, in addition to the "deal", the promise to be able to go to the other Starwood resorts (the Sheraton and the other Westin adjacent to Whaler's Village) and use their facilities and pool area, and to get to and fro via the free shuttle service. As far as the shuttle service goes, it was very convenient. It was supposed to come around every 10-15 minutes, and while we waited upwards of 30 minutes a few times, it was an enjoyable wait (you are on Maui, after all). Without going into the long details, we were disappointed by the fact that every person you speak with at all three resorts seem to have different views of their policies as to using sister resort facilities. Leading up to the trip, I spoke with four different people through the Starwood Vacation line and one person with Sheraton about cross-use of pools and resorts, and they all consistently said that you can use all the pools and facilities at all resorts if you are a guest of one resort. In practice, we were treated quite rudely at times, and it seems the "official" policy is that you can use the restaurants at all the resorts, but *NOT* the pools and pool areas. This really doesn't make any sense, because anyone can walk in off the streets at any of the resorts and use their restaurants, so what exactly are they promoting? This was disappointing, as we had planned to use the pool/pool area one day at the Sheraton and one day at the other Westin, and upon checking in and arriving, we were told we could not. We did contact our "Vacation Services Coordinator" on site at the Ocean Resorts - I don't know if we can use real names in this review, so I will refer to him by his initials - "JDM". JDM was, overall, very unprofessional. He essentially accused me of lying about my conversations with other Starwood employees about use of services at other sister resorts, as well as my conversation with two employees at the other Westin while on the island. He badmouthed the other properties, implying I was misguided for even wanting to visit them (and in the case of Sheraton, revisiting). He was very nervous, would cite "policy" as having changed years ago that we later proved to be incorrect in talking with other employees, used profanity under his breath, and was generally just very negative. There were a number of little things he said I was "wrong" about which proved right, but it's really not worth getting into most of that (things like having a voucher for the rental car - I said I never got mine but saw someone else who had the exact same vacation package as us at Avis with one, Avis asked us for one - he said they don't exist - and I've since received it in the mail since returning from the trip). I was actually just shocked by our interactions, in that I was not angry or upset - just seeking clarification on what was marketed to us, and he was just very unprofessional. But, again, being on Maui, I just found the entire thing really more amusing than anything. Just very surprising that this individual was our sole point of contact for and representative of the resort. Shocking and bewildering, but ultimately harmless as to our enjoyment of the stay. The most interesting part was that he kept bringing up our "ocean view upgrade", which I told him was incorrect (and again, he implied I was lying about it). He proceeded to pull out a map of the resort which did not represent reality. He pointed to our room (#3101) to show it had a park in front of the "lanai", not a parking lot. I pointed out that we did not have a lanai, and again, he disagreed, saying I was wrong. He said it was two feet deep and you could walk out onto it. Eventually, I was able to get him to walk to our room so I could show him that the map was simply incorrect in its depiction. So we were standing in front of the room (#3101 for anyone who would like to verify this themselves), staring at the parking lot, and looking at the map showing no parking lot. He said, "it's not a parking lot, it's an employee parking lot". That and the adjacent parking lot are contiguous, so I couldn't help but laugh, as I stood there looking at a giant parking lot that the resort representative was also looking at, telling me it was not there. I also pointed to the "lanai", which could not be more than one foot deep. Again, it's not a big deal, I just found it incredible a resort representative would essentially call guests liars and say something as big as a parking lot - right in front of you - does not exist. Later, he did offer to switch us to another room (not something I asked for). He was leaving, so interrupted our leaving for dinner to meet his time table (one minute notice); ironically enough, he pulled up in his BMW in the parking lot that doesn't exist... It was his idea to meet us there... He gave us the key, told us it was a one bedroom room with a full lanai and ocean view and that he previewed it) and drove away. We went to the room, and while you could see the ocean if you stuck your head out the window - it was not one bedroom, but a studio like we had, and again did not have a lanai, but a one foot little balcony thing. It just wasn't worth it to us to go through the trouble to change rooms. We were also told that there is an adults-only pool, but every time we walked the property, there were lots of kids in all the pools (another point with which JDM told me I was "wrong"). Anyway, I don't want to harp on one little negative (but interesting) little "blip" on the trip, but just to provide other potential guests with some information. If you receive a letter in the mail with the initials JDM prior to your trip, just prepare yourselves. All in all, the room was great (with the thick window shade pulled closed), the shuttle was a nice feature, it was cheap, and we had a great time, because, after all, it is Maui. The negatives would be the Starwood people selling us, pre-stay, on a feature - using the full facilities of the other Starwood resorts - which does not seem to exist in practice (though your mileage may vary). Also, our interactions with "JDM" our "Vacation Services Coordinator". I, personally, would not stay there again, as the only real plus is that the rooms are very new and clean and comfortable with some nice amenities, but like I said, people with kids like my sister would probably prefer that over resorts that I would personally prefer. I've stayed at other resorts that I've found more enjoyable, but everyone is looking for something different. I would just say this is more "family with kids" oriented. I'm also not fond of crowded resorts, so that would be a negative for me. I am also the type of person who would never buy a timeshare, so that is not something that appeals to me in the least, and that seems to be the purpose of the resort (though we were invited to participate in a "personal tour", we declined). Having stayed on Maui several times, I would definitely highly recommend the Four Seasons and then the Sheraton if you are looking for less people, more relaxing atomosphere, better service, and a more "vacation" feel. The other Westin (by Whaler's Village) also looks pretty nice going by the resort and pool area, but I've never seen the rooms. If anyone has any questions that I did not address in the review, feel free to contact me. Jason

Reviews.Title: “Two Beautiful Resorts”
Reviews.Author: Love-Maui-101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are owners in both resorts, the original Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas and the North villas. Both properties have their pros and cons. The only negative regarding what we call the "South" (original) villas is that the studio side does not have a lanai. On the North property, both the studio and one-bedroom have lanais. The rooms in the original villas are a little bigger than the North and the South property is easier to find your way around. The North tends to be a little like a maze as it is a bigger property. Also, there is a full size stove with oven in the South units whereas the North units have a cooktop and convection bake microwave. However, both properties are beautiful and carry on the Westin tradition of luxury and comfort. I don't think you can go wrong with either property, but then again, as an owner I may be a little prejudiced. I would like to respond to one of the reviewers who remarked on the lack of cleaning/maid service. These resorts are not hotels and the maid comes in three days after your check-in date to refresh the towels, empty the garbage, change the bed, etc. Otherwise, you are responsible for the housekeeping chores. They do make it very convenient to get rid of your bottles, cans, garbage, etc., but you are responsible for running the dishwasher and making the bed during your stay. If you have the opportunity to go on a cut rate to listen to a timeshare promotion, it really is a good value for your money. You can always say no and still stay at a beautiful Maui resort far cheaper than if you booked a stay on your own.

Reviews.Title: “First trip as owners”
Reviews.Author: geekma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WKOR North Villas for two weeks, beginning September 20th. We are owners and this was our first visit to the property. Our first week was spent in the studio side of our 2 br lockoff unit. We own an ocean-view unit and were placed in Building 7 on the 3rd floor. Unfortunately, there was no view of the ocean due to the trees and right at the pool. I returned to the front desk and complained about the lack of view, spoke to the Manager and was moved to a unit on the 4th floor of building 7. This unit did have an ocean view in the distance, but was very close to the road and there is massive construction on the north side of the property. It was impossible to sit on the lanai b/c of the noise. The third day I went back to the front desk and noticed they had a sign stating upgrades were available. Alicia found us an oceanfront unit in building 6 that was fantastic. The rest of the stay was fabulous. The studio units are very roomy. the bed cozy and the bathroom was huge. Our second week was to be spent in the one bedroom side. Since we had voiced our concerns to the Westin Corporate office, they hand picked our unit for the second week. We were back in building 7 on the 6th floor. When we arrived, housekeeping was just finishing up "bombing" the unit for an unpleasant smell. The view was OK, but there was still the road and construction noise to deal with. The next morning we woke up to a rather foul smell in the living room. We noticed urine stains on the carpet and stains of some sort of body fluid on the couch. So much for the bombing the smell away. So, back down to the front desk to ask for a different room... We were given and ADA unit in building 6 on the 5th floor. The unit overlooked the lower pool and had a spectacular view of the ocean and sunsets. The unit itself had a very small shower (unusual-ADA units are often larger), but a huge bathroom the size of a small studio apartment. The rest of the stay was fabulous. So, during our two week stay we ended up in a total of 5 different units. We did learn the system and know what to book and when to ask for an upgrade for the next time we return to WKOR North. As an owner, I was very upset that the units deeded to be "ocean view" were lacking a view and so close to the road, as it was not represented as such when we purchased our unit. In fact most of the "oceanfront" units would be deemed as ocean view down at the Marriott. I was also upset to see the lack of care and concern regarding the cleanliness of the carpet and couch in our first one bedroom unit. Be that as it may, we were in Maui, the resort itself is beautiful and most of the staff were very accommodating. (Thanks again, Alicia and a shout out to Julie at the pool) We walked on the boardwalk every day, took the shuttle to Whaler's Village and had a great time exploring the beauty that is Maui. Our favorite restaurants were the Gazebo or Plantation House for breakfast, the Hula Grill and Leilani's in Whaler's Village (have a lava flow), Bale Vietnamese restaurant in the Cannery Mall, the fish market in Pa'ia, Lappert's for ice cream and of course Costco for home cooked meals. The Star Market up the road, Safeway and Lahaina Farms near the Cannery Mall were the best stores for stocking up. Everything is expensive on Maui. It's wonder anyone can afford to live there. But hey, when you're in Paradise I guess you make do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: 2irv
Reviews.Content: This is the best vacation villas we've ever stayed at. We stayed a week in a 1 bedroom premium in the newer north villas. The rooms were spacious for 2 people. The bed was indeed, heavenly! Almost too heavenly... add it to the 6 hr time difference and there were days towards the end of my trip that I didn't want to get out of bed!! The bathroom was spacious and well laid out. The kitchen was small but efficient for 2 people. The living room area again, was small but efficient and comfortable for 2 people. The lanai was perfect! We stayed in building 7 on the top floor. We had a view of the pool area as well as the ocean in the background. Perfect view of the beautiful Maui sunset right there from our lanai. Also, we slept most nights with only the sheers closed. Early in the a.m. as the sun came up we could just lie in bed and watch the beach brighten as the sun came up over Haleakalah. The grounds are amazingly beautiful!!! Well kept, no dust in any of our rooms or grounds. As you walked around the resort, they were in a constant state of cleaning the areas. The pool areas and koi ponds were wonderful. Though I found the hot tub a little too warm for my taste. In the evening sitting out on our lanai we heard conversations of the people in the pool. I guess the sounds drifted up. But did not penetrate into the rooms. Pools close @ 10 so it all ends up being a peaceful evening. The staff was superbly friendly and nice. I can't imagine finding anyone who did not exhibit the aloha spirit. In fact, on our last morning, we took our bags down to the bellman (they will keep your larger items until your departure) and my hubby was sweating. A staffer who was chatting at the front desk got him one of the towels they keep on hand that is kept cold and moist for hot travelers. It was such a nice perk that has never been offered anywhere to us before. They have a late departure lounge which was nothing special but served it's purpose. Showers, towels & soap were readily available. The only slightly negative statement I have is that the property is so large it is easy to get lost. I can appreciate that they are trying to keep the signs to a minimum but at the same time, everything is so spread out, a little more signage would be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jennyj290
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean resort Villas North and had a fabulous time. The resort was much more than I expected. I read other reviews and was a little concerned but this is how I saw it. The staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. From the moment we got there our room was ready an hour early and as requested, we got a top floor ( room # 6629 ) looking over the center of the resort ( pool, gardens etc. ) You really can't get an ocean view unless you actually own there. We own 2 weeks in Orlando but just bought there because the price was right and we always planned on swapping locations anyway. It was a smaller resort but it was just my husband and I and it was very relaxing. There were families there but the parents managed to keep their kids under control. The beach was FABULOUS and just beyond the pool. It was very peaceful and the water so crystal clean. The only bad thing was that you had to rent a lounge chair. The price was $ 10 for a regular one and $ 20 for a bimini ( the ones with a cover on them to block the sun). If you go later in the day, there will be ones that people left. so it will be free. I'm one to stay all day so it was worth it to pay the $ 20 bucks. The pool bar has good food and great drinks. Overpriced of course but we expect that. We both watched football with the other vacationers and had a blast. Lots of screaming and cheering. No better way to meet some people...Football and the cocktail of the day..( which was only $6 ) Try the Volcano.....My husband doesn't remember who won the game..lol. only kidding. We ate at both the villas north pool bar and the regular villas next door several times for dinner. Had fun The fancy restaurant in the middle of the villas North is nothing to brag about. Terribly overpriced and I was not impressed with the food. The atmosphere was very nice but save your money and either go into town or eat at the pool bars. The town of Lahaina is very cute. Lots of shopping and restaurants. Try the Bubba Gump restaurant for the best fried shrimp. Its got all memorabilia from the movie. Its right on the ocean. Casual and good prices. We went for lunch. There is a Safeway on the way from the airport to the villas..It will be on the left hand side right before you get there. We bought our essentials and always had cheese and crackers and wine before going out for the evening on our balcony. There is hardly any night life, Unless your young and like the loud music. Those days are over for us and we prefer a quiet night sitting by the pool and having our cocktails there. Our room was located on the good side according to how the sun set. ( room 6629 ) In the morning it shined on us but in the evening it was all shade. Thats when it was more important to sit outside anyway. All the other villa patios were blaring with the sun. Ask to have your room on the left side when you walk out through the foyer. Our room was very clean and new. We have never been dissapointed. We always request a 1 bed premium because we like the full balcony. All in all I was very impressed and had a very nice time. I got to read a lot while my husband played lots of golf. I would recommend this resort to all. Its smaller than most but you really don't need much when you go to just relax and have a good time. I just found it so tranqual and loaded with beautiful flowers and greenery. When you see the grounds on all these locations you understand the yearly maintenance fee is justified. Go and have a good time. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: sfsharona
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas. We found it through an owner ad on Craigslist. Despite reading a variety of reviews on Trip Advisor (most very good but a few that concerned me after I'd already paid the deposit) - we were very happy and so relieved that our room was exactly as pictured. We rented a Studio Premium Villa (North Side Bldg 5 - Room 5402) - it faced the ocean. The room was spotless - we had no issues with dirt or run down furniture/bedding. The Heavenly King size bed was amazing! The room size was very spacious - more than enough for 2 of us - very large bathroom area which was nice. The kitchenette was great - stocked with utensils and appliances so that we could cook there if we wanted. A couple of nights, we bbq'ed using the gas grills on the property and ate on our balcony. From everything i could tell, the staff was on top of keeping the place clean. A couple of nights, we left our trash bag just outside our door and it was picked up right away. We used the workout room which was also clean and had nice new equipment with TV's. The pool area was large but this resort is also located right on the beach so we spent time on the sand as well. The location of the resort was great - just close enough to Whalers Village and shopping but not right in the madness - easy access to Kapalua and Kanaapali. Staff was helpful and friendly. We did not eat at the restaurants at the resort so I can't comment on those but they looked nice - over priced as much as all the other restaurants in Hawaii. To address some of the negative reviews I read on this site, someone made mention of a bad smell and a sewage site next to the resort - there is no facility next door. There is a water reclamation plant just down the road on the opposite side of the road - I did not once smell anything foul - and we had some windy days. I think this place is great for families and couples without kids - we found it to be very comfortable and well kept and one of the nicest rooms we've stayed in. I would definitely go back. I did call ahead to request that we be placed in the newer wing however the South building appeared to be just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BigHock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the Mrs. for about a week in late October 2007. I think this was the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. We rented a 1BR and were upgraded to an Ocean View. The room was massive with a full kitchen, a living room and a bedroom. There was a roomy balcony on the side with clear views over the beach and ocean. Though nice I think the 1BR was a bit of overkill. Unless you need the space I would doubt any normal person would need the two rooms, particularly for a couple. On the other hand I had trouble with the massive time zone shift and so was always up at 5am and so having the extra room to repair to so as not to disturb the Mrs.' sleep was helpful. Some of the reviews talked about this place being loud with lots of kids. We didn't notice that. It was crowded and bustling but no more so than you'd expect for a place of this size. The hotel beach was actually very nice and pretty quiet. I really appreciated this after we'd been there for a day or two and we ventured down the beach to the neighboring Sheraton (forget name but at Sheraton there was a nice reef for snorkeling and even a few sea turtles). The beach there and beyond was mobbed with people so I was very appreciative with how relaxed the Westin beach was in comparison. Also convenient was the shuttle that ran back and forth to Lahaina. Even though we had a car it was nice to be able to hop in the shuttle and not worry about parking in town. So in summary this was a great hotel. Even though hotel was full of guests the beach was nice and tranquil and the pool scene wasn't too crazy. The rooms were huge and clean with great amenities. Would definitely recommend for any trip, particularly if looking for rest and romance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: danabeth
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Westin Kaanapali Ocean Villas through Maui Hawaii Vacations (www.mauihawaiivacations.com). The rates available were excellent, best we found through any online source. Naomi was an excellent resource for our trip, getting us the room we wanted at the Westin Villas. I HIGHLY recommend using Maui Hawaii Vacations for booking your hotel/condo in Maui! As for the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Villas: this is our second trip to this property. We stayed in the older section in 2006 and returned this year to stay in the new "North" section. The north section is lovely, the grounds are beautiful and the ground floor villas have direct access to the gardens or pool areas. If you are traveling with a young child a ground floor villa is perfect because there is plenty of room for your kids to run and play on the lawn just off your lanai. However the rooms in the older south section of the resort are larger and the kitchens are equipped with a microwave and a conventional oven. The north section kitchens are equipped with a microwave/convection combo. If you are planning on cooking your meals while on vacation you may want to consider staying in the south section of the resort. If you are not concerned about cooking or you don't mind using the microwave/convection combo for all your meals then the north would be fine. The resort offers nice outdoor grills for its guests but claim one early if you want to catch the sunset while you cook out. If you are traveling during the holiday season or the busy season you may want to stake your claim in the early afternoon. I also suggest getting in touch with the pool attendant 30 days prior to your arrival if you are interested in booking a gazebo while you are visiting. Gazebo's go quickly! All in all the Westin Ocean Villas is a great place to stay if you have children or if you are traveling with several family members. The two bedroom lock off is an excellent option but if you have only one child the one bedroom will accommodate you quite comfortably. I would not advise the studio if you are traveling with a child, it would be a tight fit. If you want more space for your money request the south section. If you want flat screen TVâ€™s and newer carpet then book the north section. The south sections villas are still in good shape itâ€™s just a simple fact that the north section is newer. It simply comes down to a matter of preference. One of our best meals on the island was at Pulehu Restaurant located on the lower lobby level of the north resort. We eat out often and we eat at upscale restaurants; Pulehu can compete with any of them. If you are looking for an excellent meal and you donâ€™t want to drive to town then give Pulehu a try I donâ€™t think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Resort Property”
Reviews.Author: RJZee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at this resort. This was our 6th trip to Kaanapali Beach, and we found this to be our favorite property in the area. We arrived late morning, but our room was ready for check-in. We were in the newer Building 6. The room was exceptionally clean and efficient. Just enough of a kitchen to make breakfast and lunch quick and easy. A full size frig was nice. The bathroom had a large shower as well as a deep whirlpool tub. Westin's "Heavenly Bed" is always wonderful. The resort is somewhat spread out, but that is because each courtyard has it's own pool area. The pools are beautiful. We tended to use the original pool since the other two seemed to draw more small children. We couldn't always get pool chairs close to the pool, but we were always able to get a chair somewhere in either the sun or the shade. There are a couple of bar/restaurants on the resort, but they also have a hot dog vendor in the pool area that sold a great dog with all the toppings, chips and a cold drink for $7. We love to snorkle, and we found the beach at WKOR to offer the best snorkeling on the island. The Black Rock is fine, but always crowded. We also snorkeled at Ulua Beach in Wailea - nice, with lots of turtles, but still not as good as the WKOR. We also did the Blue Water Rafting Snorkle Trip. It was a great trip, but still the snorkeling did not compare to the beach right outside our villa. We have stayed within the main Kaanapali Beach resort area before (Sheraton, Whaler condos), and we always enjoyed it and kept returning, but we found the WKOR to be less crowded, quieter, and away from all the hustle and bustle of Whalers Village. The Westin shuttle made it very easy to get down to Whalers Village to shop or eat dinner, or to snorkle at the Black Rock. All in all, we loved our stay at this resort. We are not "high maintenance" guests - we are quite independent and know our way around the island. Every encounter we had with the employees was pleasant. The front desk people and the concierge services were outstanding. The maid service was never intrusive but always thorough. We have no complaints at all. We enjoyed fabulous dinners at Pacific'O, Plantation House, and Kimo's. The upper level of the Mai Tai Lounge is cool - great appetizers substituted for dinner. A really sweet find for dinner was the Royal Lahaina resort, which you can walk to down the beach from WKOR. Follow the boardwalk until it ends and then head for the 2nd red flag. It was a nice surprise. Their pleasant restaurant is poolside/beachfront and feels very "Hawaiian". There was a torch lighting ceremony at sunset, followed by an authentic Hawaiian singer and a hula dancer. The food, service and price were great. If you decide to drive to Haleakala, plan to stop at the Haliimaile General Store for lunch on your way down. It's awesome! We would have returned for dinner but it's a bit of a drive from Kaanapali. Our best snorkle tip: We always rent the best equipment we can get from Snorkle Bob's for the whole week. This time we also rented beach chairs for $5/week. You can strap them on like a backpack and take them to whatever beach you go to. They will save you $10/day if you want chairs on the beach at WKOR. This resort would definitely be our first choice when we return to Maui in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Resort!”
Reviews.Author: PKRJP
Reviews.Content: As a preface to my review, I must say that I am not a novice traveler, nor a world traveler. I have been to South America, Hawaii, Alaska, and many of the states. This was my second trip to Hawaii, the first being to Oahu. The Westin Kaanapali was awesome. My wife and I were on our honeymoon, and despite the reviews that say it is mediocre for honeymooners, I thought it was excellent. We had a 1 bedroom villa. The full kitchen was awesome, as well as access to the BBQ grills. We cooked a few meals on the grill, and ate breakfast and lunch in the room a few times to save money on food. Restaurants in Maui are expensive, especially if you are on a budget. The jacuzzi tub and dual head showers were great! The Westin beds and pillows lived up to the reputation as well as the two flat screen TV's. You don't watch much TV there, but we did watch a movie one afternoon when we were exhausted from all of the snorkeling and touristy activities. The staff seemed friendly enough. If you are looking to be waited on hand and foot, you will be disappointed. I personally don't care if I see a staff member once I check in. As long as the front desk is accessible, that's all I need, and that is what we got. My wife and I don't drink alcohol, so we can't comment on the bar. We didn't eat at any restaurants at the hotel either. We were there during the third week in September and it was not busy at the Westin at all. It seemed like we had the place to ourselves. The beach at the hotel is awesome. We did a few sunrise and sunset walks which were awesome, and also snorkeled once on the beach in front of the hotel. It was great. We had a rental car, so we never took the shuttle. I would recommend a rental car to anyone who stays here. You can get by without it, but the transfer from the airport to and from the hotel is about $70 per person if I am not mistaken. We got a rental car from Alamo for $110 for the whole week. It was very convenient to have the car. Contact me if you have questions on getting good deals on rental cars. A few of the good restaurants in Lahaina are Bubba Gumps and Mala Cafe. The best restaurant we ate at was the Plantation Restaurant at the Kapalua Plantation Golf Course. We had an amazing breakfast there. We also had a fun snorkel cruise through Maui Adventure Cruises. They took us out to Lana'i we had some great snorkeling there and saw some turtles. I would highly recommend it. Also, we drove north on Highway 30 from Kaanapali to this little banana bread stand. It was awesome! The drive is short and very scenic. And much shorter than the famed road to Hana. And the banana bread was awesome! If you have any questions, feel free to contact me. I'd love to help anyone who goes there, especially if you are on a budget. I know now how I could have made the trip cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie!!”
Reviews.Author: KingDavid777
Reviews.Content: Great Room, Staff, Food... more to come on this review. We just got back from Maui and wanted to put something in. Overall a great vacation

Reviews.Title: “Second Time NOT a charm-DIRTY UNITS”
Reviews.Author: calypso1
Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment in the Westin! Last year we stayed in a 1 BR oceanview unit, it was so beautiful we couldn't wait to return again this year. This year, it was a completely different story. We checked in around 2pm, the room wasn't ready so we opted to go and walk around Lahaina. We called around 4, and found our room ready, so we headed right back up to the Westin Check in was friendly, we were given a room in building 4 which is the building to the back of the property in the original, not North section. Off we go to the third floor and open the door, at first glance it seemed bright and nice, on closer inspection it looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in the last 6 months. Chocolate (or something) smeared all over the sofa and the sheer curtains in the living room, a dirty tissue under the tv stand, and the rugs were so filthy I wouldn't let my son take off his shoes. Then I went into the Bedroom to look at the bed, the mattress pad was covered with a grainy dark red substance and had hairs all over it. Just gross. My call to the front desk didn't produce another room, so I went down in person and told the nice gentleman at the front desk that I was not going to stay in that room. At this price point (479.00 per nt plus taxes) I would expect a higher level of cleanliness. After waiting for more than 40 minutes, he was able to accommodate us in another room within the same building. Still didn't think it was super clean, but a huge improvement over the first. What a shame that the Westin management has let this property slide. I know many of the other reviews are good, but it seems as if many of them were accommodated on the North side. We are just puzzled and sad that our two experiences could be so far apart.

Reviews.Title: “great place for famalies”
Reviews.Author: nyorker3331
Reviews.Content: just got back for amazing week... excellent one bedroom villa with wash and dry and a full kitchen... very helpfull... very clean resort excellent concierge and room cleaning service in buliding 2. carlos is the best.. i booked ocean view villa with expedia... do not fool yourself.. unless u r in the ocean front room ocean view does not exist.. it is very partial and limited ocean view.. depend on the floor and the location... u most likely will see the pool and the garden and a bit of ocean... they should be more clear upon booking. only little complian i have is the front desk people can be a little nicer.. in few ocasion i used them they are very dry and will not go out of their way to help... will be nice if they will crack a liitle smile.. and will be on a positive note... bell boys were very nice and great specially rob.. this resort is perfect for famalies with kids very convinient... for couples gateaway vacation i will go to the other westin.. i had a chance to visit... excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: yoshapman
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 night stay through a pre-paid American Express package for $650 including all taxes and fees, plus $185 off our weekly Avis car rental (only had to pay $46 in taxes/fees for the Pontiac G6) and a $100 resort credit. In exchange for this, we had to go to a 90 minute timeshare presentation, but it was actually quite pleasant and took less than 90 minutes. The guy who gave us the tour seemed a little high (eyes were bloodshot, no Westin card to give us access anywhere, didn't know where the game room was) but this made it a lot easier for us to say no (which we were going to do anyway), so we didn't mind. Of course the sales manager came in at the end to try and sell us one more time but we said no again and that was that, definitely worth saving $1500+ off the regular room price. Oh, since it was a special occasion, they upgraded us to an ocean view (not so close but could still see the ocean) studio. It came with a couch, flat screen tv, microwave, washer/dryer, Westin heavenly bed, bubble tub, etc. It was a beautiful new room in the North wing. The pools were nice, not over the top like the other Westin property but perfect for swimming, water basketball and volleyball. They had 2 tennis courts outside if you wanted to play, and 2 nice general stores with a lot of different things to buy at reasonable-for-resort prices. There was snorkeling right off the property, and a shuttle available if you wanted to go to the Sheraton or Westin for a drink or food or to shop or snorkel there. All in all I would definitely go back if the price is right, though I can't see paying $400-$500 for an island-view studio per night, but for our price, it was great. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “great !!! w families!”
Reviews.Author: rose220068
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8/22-8/29/08. We had visited last year for the timeshare and knew we 'd want to stay here .. WE almost bought but then decided not too. but we traveled for our wedding w/ our family my fiance's two kids 5 and 8, our son of 6 mths old and the two grammas. WE got a great deal on the 2 bdrm villa.. First let me say the property is gorgeous exactly how it was last year. plenty of pools ,plenty of space not overcrowded except the Pool with the slides was hard to find a shaded area upfront.. we spent most of our time on the north pool and or beach it was hard to do the beach everyday but the beach location is great too. Last year we stayed at the Sheraton and love that beach and location too , the beach is a tiny bit of a walk but not that bad. We got there around 2 or so and they said no rooms were yet available check in is not til 4.. kind of late, one of our complaints and we didn't get a room until 4 no earlier.. then we got a room int he North side which was fine the room is gorgeous as others have explained , plenty of room.. but our complaints: we were very far to the north end w/ 3 kids two grammas that meant for alot of walking to and from the pool, to the cars and elevators our room was like the last on the 3 hallways away from the elevator. we asked if we coud be moved NO she said.. so ok we sucked it up and got used to it and found our way around I don't mind the walking but when you have a baby in tow and two grammas you want to make it easy.. The other complaint was the parking. the spaces very small, all virtually all compact so you have to squeeze your car or our VAN we had into these small spaces w/ making it hard to load/unload everyone. We suggest they make larger spots for those larger vehicles that most people have. The other complaint was the service on our safe. Our safe was broken on the 1 bdrm side they came right away and they couldn't fix it but said they'd be back. the whole week went by and noone returned to fix it. fortunately we had the other room/studio and used that safe.. The pool service there- was NO food or drink service would have been nice and i think for them it would totally drum up buisness for them. we would have loved to order a cocktail by the pool or some lunch w/out getting up .. Also more shaded areas needed by the pool w/ the slide.. not many areas and the pool was always packed. Other than that service was great. everyone was friendly at the hotels from our maid service, the concierge the activities desk etc.. the restaurants are nice even tho we only had lunch at the pool bar and wasn't bad at all.. the grounds are amazing. the villa comes w/ everything you need. we even got a nice rollaway crib for the baby etc.. we shopped when we first got there and did all our breakfasts and most of our lunches in the room so made it very nice and the kids had there own area/bed and tv so helpe dout and a huge bathroom on both sides. by far the greatest to travel w/ Kids . we didn't use the new spa or the shuttle just not enough time. maybe next time. we'd definitely go back as it had all the amenities of a hotel but a huge condo that works w/ kids . also they have some great grills /bbqing area and lots of people us ing them.. next year for sure i want to do that a few times and just cook out and relax!!! again we loved it here just w/ the few minor complaints all in all a great stay..

Reviews.Title: “Horrilbe”
Reviews.Author: glhowland
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 weeks at the Westin Ocean Villas. To be honest I have never been so misled by the sales agent and her supervisior in my life. I would give anything to be able to sell the units I own. When we bought we were told because we were buying 4 weeks and Platniumn Members we would be treated like gold. The agent, who's name I won't mention only her initials K.D., misrepresented us in every way. She told us anything and everything she had to to get us to buy. None of the faciliaties where build as represented. The service was terrible, now to mention we couldn't even get our rooms cleaned or bags carried to our room. The pools were nothing like they represented, and most if not all the perks of using the Westin Hotel were taken away after the fact. The salespeople will do anything and say whatever they need to in order to get you to buy. all i can say is buyer beware, especially of the young women pressuring you to have to buy NOW. I would happly sell my units for 50 cents on the dollar.Wesitn and SPG is no longer even a 4 star property on my list. Especially when you stay at a Four Seasons, One and Only, or for that matter even a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, Pool, Beach!”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Westin has a quality that is not stuffy and only for the rich but yet all of the 5 star amenites are there. With the new addition of the shuttle that goes into lahiana, as well as Kaanapali, this hotel is one you really do park the car for a week. We did not use our rental car the entire week, the only hotel in hawaii I can say that about. Loved the pool, the new addition gives you two pools and plenty of chairs. Prior to the add on you had to fight for chairs. Beach is one of the best for snorkeling, turtles right on the beach, amazing. Food was okay, pool bar was the best food in any we've had. With the shuttle why eat at hotel anyway to many excellent choices in Lahaina. This is a laid back hotel, don't expect Ritz service or you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a great first experience of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: bigcheeser
Reviews.Content: First time to Hawaii - long day's journey from London via LAX - tired drive from Kahalui Airport to Ka'anapali - and there was the wonderful welcoming Westin KOR. We were "hotelling" and not "time-sharing" in a one bed premier island view in the new North complex - and it was first class - really comfortable beds - great fixtures and fittings - and the whole property was delightful. Staff were welcoming, food was great, location was stunning. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Westn Villas is not about the peace and beauty of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtraveler123
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the Westin Villas Ka anapali. We were looking for the beauty and peace of Hawaii. This was not it. We were looking for a 5 star property. This was not it. Our ocean view room was on the second floor overlooking the kiddy pool, and the air conditioning unit. We could have been at the local park overlooking the kids slid and the swing set. The couch in the room had ripped cushions top and bottom on both sides, and it was really kind of dirty. They charge you for everything from lounge chairs for the beach, to the game room. The place was crowded, so much so we did not want to be there. All in all for us, a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great for timeshare, not as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourProTen
Reviews.Content: In Maui for combination business, pleasure trip. First night in our villa our view and location was 2nd floor overlooking dumpsters and delivery area. Temperature in villa never got below 80 degrees. The one air vent in the unit blew directly onto the bed. Listened to delivery truck beeps as they backed into dock. Also had the quite loud noise of a constantly running compressor just outside our villa. Moved to another villa. Better location. Wireless internet would not work in our villa. Called Westin support service in Kansas City and they were stumped. Fortunately there is an internet cable and we simply plugged and unplugged. Housekeeping is geared to timeshare, not hotel guests. Service was very sporadic. One day they cleaned the unit, the next day they did not. Had to go to front desk to get a new bar of soap. Seems to be a great place for families and those seeking planned activities and timeshare setting. Avoid if you are looking for hotel services, amenities and environment. Not a business friendly property. We travel frequently for business staying primarily at Hilton and Starwood proerties. We do not recommend this property if you are not coming for timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay at Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas Maui”
Reviews.Author: jlstewart88
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas on Maui. The resort was beyond our greatest expectations. From the edge of the property we had direct beach and ocean access to some of the best snorkeling on Maui. The one bedroom condo was very spacious and pleasing to the eye. The condo was equipped with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, balcony, and a jet tub. It very comfortably slept 4 with a king size bed and a queen sofa sleeper in the living room. The resort was located within a 10 minute drive to a great Fish Market and the resort was well equipped for out door grilling and dining with a Maui sunset as a backdrop. The pool and the waterslide in the South Villas were very nice. Our kids are 11 and 14and they enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: izzamracop
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 7 nights booking with an owner through VRBO. We stayed in a 2 bedroom with an ocean view for about $325 a night. Great upgrade from a traditional condo as the villas still offer a resort feel. Not as grand as those resorts in the Kaanapali area but still very nice. I was a little disappointed with the room size, room layout and so called ocean view. The 2 bedroom is more like 2 separate hotel rooms than a single 2 bedroom unit. I've stayed at other resort villas where converting to a 2 bedroom unit flows much nicer and gives you the feel of one large unit. Overall a very minor issue as we didn't spend much time in our unit and only ate in a couple of nights. Ocean view?.....well if you leaned out a bit on the balcony you could get an ok view. Overall a great week spent just wished it could be longer. Did not use any of the facilities at the resort (restaurants, bbq's, workout room, etc) and just kinda hung out at the pool with side trips to Lahaina, Kaanapali Beach and the blowhole.

Reviews.Title: “They don't care once they have your $$$$”
Reviews.Author: skibunny18
Reviews.Content: Their website and others say "Stay and Play" at 3 resorts, meaning the Westin Maui and the Sheraton Maui. They offer shuttle service between them all. But when we tried to use the pool facilities at the Westin hotel we were turned down. The manager there (at the Westin Hotel) said they change their policy according to occupancy rates and they were at 95% so we could not use the pool. When we inquired at the Ocean Villas, the manager there (Carol) said the "Stay and Play" only meant you could eat at the other facilities. I told her then that I wanted a table for 6 to play volleyball at the restaurant b/c to me eating at their restaurant was not playing for my kids. They wanted to go down the pool slide. They seem to make their policies on everything change as they please. Even after several complaints by us and other families, we were still not able to use the other hotel pools like they lead you to believe. We were even told on the phone when making the reservation that we could use the other pools. Gecko in our room too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, But Be Careful of Older Rooms”
Reviews.Author: FH2002
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 6 nite stay at the Westin Ocean Villas. Let me say that I am a fan of Starwood and I generally like all of the Starwood resorts. When I travel, I generally like to stay in nice hotels like the Westin, Hyatt, Renaissance, Ritz Carlton, etc... I had never stayed in a hotel that was used as a timeshare property before and doubt I will do it again. From the exterior, the resort is nice and generally well maintained. However that being said, the ocean view room I orginally checked into located in the older South tower was simply the dirtiest hotel room I have stayed in years. It reminded me of a night I once spent in the Days Inn New Orleans. There were scuff marks on every wall and floorboard. The curtains were soiled with brown stains (maybe coffee). The sofa was filthy with stains and general brown grime. The "heavenly bed" comforter was stained with black ink. The dust ruffle was just that...dusty and brown. There was black mold growing in the noisy refridgerator. There were dirty fingerprints on the bathroom door. And the general cleanliness of the room? The toilet seat was left in the "up" position and there was no evidence that it had been cleaned. Finally, I found long black hairs on the floor and short and curly hairs in the shower. Even the towels in the room were dingy and gray. No joke. I spoke with the night manager who seemed genuinely concerned about the problem. I was immediately moved to a new room in the North Tower. The room in the North Tower was fine. My stay in the North Tower was 4*, my brief 30 minute stay in my South Tower room was 1*. I can't imagine why anyone would want to buy a timeshare at this resort. The room in the South Tower was only 4 years old and had already been completely run down. The rest of the property from the gym, pools, and restaurants was generally fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lrBarany
Reviews.Content: We rented a friends of ours timeshare for the week for our honeymoon. The place is beautiful! We had a premium 1 bedroom villa that was huge! The bathroom is really nice and the jacuzzi tub was great. We were on the 2nd floor in building 3 and had a nice view of the ocean and the pool area. The full kitchen and washer and dryer helped us to save a little bit of money and pack lighter as well (important with the new airlines/baggage rules). We LOVED the grills set up near the pool. Lots of people used them but we never had to wait for a grill. They are all gas grills complete with lighting. All the tools you need are included in the fully supplied kitchen. The pool is nice but it did get a little bit crowded. We spent time on the beach and it was nice. The water there is so clear and warm. I guess most all of Maui is probably like that. The only place we ate at the hotel was the Pool Grill and Bar and we really liked it. The service was sometimes slow but they were always very polite and we enjoyed our experience there. The location is great! The hotel offers a free shuttle that connects the Villas to the other Westin hotel and Sheraton that are near the shopping/dining area -The Whaler's Village. We used this a bunch and it was defnately a nice thing to not have to worry about driving anywhere if we didn't want. The only thing that we didn't like was that often times the hottubs by the pools have teenagers in them. The sign says specifically no one under 16 but there were plenty that were younger. I don't really want to relax in the hotub with a ton of young hormonal kids getting there flirting/giggles on. We loved the villas so much that we took the timeshare tour and bought into the every other year plan. We will be going back several times and I really can't wait till next time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Families”
Reviews.Author: jxh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, awesome pools, great rooms and the best beach ever! Kaanapali Beach is an awesome beach to swim, boogie board and snorkel with your kids. The beach is right in front of the property so it is very convenient. Also, the pools are great (couldn't get the kids to come out). The restaurants are also good, service is hit or miss, but most of the time the service we had was great. A big improvement since our last stay (2005) is that the Westin North Villas is right next door and the two resorts feel like one big resort with the common use of all the pools and restaurants. Very big improvement. My only complaint is very minor - they seem to have two groups of housekeeping staff there. The normal staff were great. However, another group (wearing gray/black uniforms) were a whole different matter. They were rude and seemed to have an attitude. Just one example - we were walking down the hallway and two of the housekeeping staff were walking toward us gossiping about something.
