Anyway, they nearly ran us over and we had to make way for them to pass. I have never seen this in any hotel. Usually, the housekeeping staff are so gracious and courteous and always allow the guests to pass when walking in a narrow hallway. This was not the case with the black/gray uniformed housekeepers. They obviously need to be trained in guest etiquette.

Reviews.Title: “A very family oriented resort”
Reviews.Author: bigkahunatravel
Reviews.Content: Great Location and resort... Staff was great and upgraded us to ocean front room... prices were resonable and food was very good... Bartenders were really cranky.. Overall great experience.. the only problem we had was our refrig was broken and took about 2 days to get problem solved but manager gave us 100 resort credit..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: krmrn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Westin North Villas June 21. (we were ther 7 days) I am an owner and this was the first summer it was available to me. I have a two bedroom lockoff which is a studio connected to a one bedroom.. I was travelling with my 23yr old son and his grilfriend and my 21yr old son and my 17yr old daughter. We could of used another studio...my 21yr old used the pullout couch but it was fine. I think the rooms are lovely and well equipped and the bathrooms wonderful. Having a washer and dryer is great and you can really pack a litlle lighter knowing you have them. We were placed in the building closest to the ocean and had a wonderful pool and ocean view. We were close enough to the pool to run up for snacks and lunch. They have lots of BBQ's and tables but it was a hassle to use them as people starting reserving them in early afternoon. The one day we planned to BBQ we couldn't get a grill so we had to improvise on the stove...who wants the hassle. The winds really do kick up in the afternoon so it didn't look to pleasant eating out there. The tidy service was pretty much clean towels and trash but they were generous with the towels. The onsite food was good and the pool service great. The grounds and close by beach were beautiful. The pool staff and beach staff terrific. We used the conciege for dinner reservations and golf reservations and they were most accomodating and right on with the recommendations but don't use the golf club rental they suggest...I found him very misleading about what he was delivering. I saw another post said the spa had closed and been renovated...we used it around June 17...small but nice and the staff was very nice. Fitness room was clean and very well equipped. I loved the location (mid Maui) and easy to get to Lahaina...I actually bought more weeks at Kauai and would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “An Overall Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: planningsouth
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Kaanapali Ocean Resort in May and had a great time. The overall experience was very satisfactory and if we were lucky enough to return to Maui, we would not hesitate to go back. That being said, we arrived very very late in the night and there was no one on hand to help us with our luggage, which is understandable. Our room was a little small for a suite, but very well appointed. Most of the direct ocean view rooms are reserved for owners, but the receptionist at the desk gave us the best she could, which still had a beautiful view, No complaints there. The pool area was nice and there were plenty of chairs. The bar service was good, and the towel service was nice too. We were traveling with our one-year-old and every staff member we met really went out of the way to make sure we had everything we needed. The waitresses in the restaurant really helped us out a lot too. There were lots of families with little ones, which we were happy about. The property is spacious enough that people without children were also able to relax and have privacy. We hired a nanny from the babysitting service recommended to us by the from desk and WOW! That was the best idea ever. Sherri was our nanny and she arrived on time, with a bag of activities and the best attitude. She was also a certified swim instructor. She took our little one to the pool and even worked with her on her swimming skills!. We were very lucky to have her and I would highly recommend asking for her. The workout gym and spa were under construction while we were there but we knew that before going, so that wasn't a surprise. It was scheduled to open within a week or two and looked very nice. The only negative I could possibly come up would be that the beach staff pulls up the chairs on the beach at 4 pm. Since we like to stay on the beach later in the evening, this meant we had to move to the pool after 4. Overall, not that big of a problem. The beach itself was beautiful. The location was close to everything and the overall property was very nice. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: loriv247
Reviews.Content: We just returned from out 10-day stay in hawaii. We booked our package through Samsclub.com (linked to expedia but w/discount). We spent the first 4 nights of our journey at the fabulous Westin Villas. We only paid $230 a night during peak season and we reserved a 1 bedroom in the south property. It included a full, well appointed kitchen, pull-out sofa bed and king size bed in a separate bedroom. The bathroom was the largest we've ever had at a hotel. It had a walk-in shower large enough for 2 or 3 people, private toilet, his and her sinks and a jetted tub. If you stay here, be prepared for a lot of walking. This place is HUGE! In fact one of the locals calls it "Westinville" because its large enough to be its own city! My sister and her family stayed in the north end and it was literally far enough to drive to. They reserved a studio which was far too cramped for their family of 4. I highly recommend upgrading to a 1 bed. if you are bringing kids. However, the studio is highly functional. It also includes a kitchennette with a 2-burner stove, microwave, dishwasher and full-size fridge. If its just a couple staying in there, it would be perfect. Some previous reviewers have complained about being bothered to attend a timeshare presentation, we we'ren't asked once, not even at check-in! Here's the pros and cons: Pros: Newer, clean property Nice pools 4-person cabanas avail. for rent Full kitchen in 1 bedrooms Nice general stores Free wi-fi in your room Nice staff Washer/dryer in your room (even the studio!) Free shuttle to Lahaina Beach suitable for swimming More than ample free parking Polite and helpful bellman Cons: Confusing to get around, we got lost twice Huge property and a lot of walking Hard to find lounge chairs w/shade Buildings not marked w/#'s Parking a little more difficult at night Not very "cozy" because of the large size of the resort All-in-all, my husband and I would definitley stay at the Westin again on our next trip to Maui. A kitchen is a must w/kids and if you want to save $ making your own meals. We saved over $1000 just by cooking breakfast, lunch and some dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Crazytiger42
Reviews.Content: The resort was great! When we arrived I couldn't believe how beautiful the property was. The West Maui Mountains are in the background and looking out of our room we could see other islands through the trees that lined the beach. Everything was first class. Lots of nice loungers all around the resort and lots of BBQ grills located throughout the property. The bed was to die for and I didn't want to leave it behind. The only things that we didn't really like were the lack of on site entertainment and there was a gassy smell that would drift over from a construction site from time to time. There is also depot for the Sugar Cane Train right across the road. You can get a 2 adult & 2 child 2 week pass for $80 at the resort and if your kids like trains, they will love it. It is slow but the kids like it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New North Property”
Reviews.Author: lovemonterey
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the new North Villas. We purchased at this site before anything was built and waited two years to stay here. The North villas are much better than the first phase of villas. It really had a calming sophisticated feel to the whole resort. We were the first guests to stay in the two bedrrom lockoff unit. It was very quiet with very few children unlike the other phase which is centered around families. The quality of furnishings and all other amenities were superb. The only drawback is housekeeping. We paid for tidy service and it was not worth the fee's at all. Nothing is cleaned during your stay only new towels are provided. For the amount of money we spent to be owners actual housekeeping services would have been appreciated. We also had an incident of another guest walking into our room. This was very upsetting and the management was notified asap about their error. We had a very nice time and will be spliting our time between this North villa and the Kuaui villas in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with excellent service - even the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: JBonds007
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at Kaanapali Ocean Resort (KOR) and we loved it again and again (I'm actually writing this review during our 2nd trip to KOR). The first time we reserved a 2-bedroom lockoff with an ocean view in bldg 3 (on the left side of the pool) and this time we're staying in bldg 3 in a premium deluxe 1-bedroom with an extra long lanai (w/ 2 lounge chairs and 2 upright chairs with tables), facing the waterfall fountain. The rooms are excellent, as is typical with all Westin time share properties, and this time around we have enjoyed the pools and beach almost every day. We even enjoyed the kids' pool with our young children (age 6 & 3) with friends who were also staying in Maui and have young children. Our daughter also enjoyed the Westin Kid's Club during our owners update. This year, we were able to visit the North property and had dinner at Pulehu which has an excellent view of the koi pond. The ambience kind of reminded me of the Wynn hotel in Las Vegas near the Okada Japanese restaurant. The room accommodations are nice and while KOR doesn't have the flat panel TVs like the KOR North property, this is of minor point since the rooms are larger in the South property. I personally think the pool is also nicer on the South property. What can we say about KOR except that it is one of the nicest Starwood time share properties. Our parents also own at Princeville and we own at Mission Hills (Rancho Mirage), Lagunamar (Cancun) and separately at Walt Disney World (Wilderness Lodge). We have stayed at Rancho Mirage, Desert Springs, the Kierland, and stopped by to see the St. John lobby when we were touring the island. My only two minor complaints about our stay are 1) I wish the TV cable connection was cleaner (there was ghosting on a number of channels) and 2) I wish the room had filled salt and pepper shakers. Other than that, there are plenty of pros to list. The concierge staff was able to book reservations for an underwater sub tour on the Reef Dancer for ourselves and our kids and even worked behind the scenes to credit our account when our tour was cancelled on our first chosen day by the Reef Dancer tour and then subsequently re-booked us for another day. We also attended an "owners update" to find out the current inventory on hand for sale. New units are practically all sold out on the North property with the South property being sold out long before (only a few units are available on hand from owners trading in for units in the North property). The sales staff was very pleasant and did not try a "hard sale" on us as we have experienced with other time share companies (we've tried them all). Unfortunately, the units that we would ideally like to purchase (Ocean View on the North Property) are already sold out so we opted to not purchase one of the remaining Island View units nor purchase the current Kauai (Princeville) property since our family already owns that property. We will definitely be back at KOR and perhaps we'll add to our Westin collection if we can find our ideal property on the open resale market since Westin no longer has inventory for our ideal unit.

Reviews.Title: “Condo convenience, resort amenities, spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: gnolect
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Sheraton timeshare in Orlando and swapped to stay here. This place is wonderful. We knew what to expect in terms of unit features and it fully lived up to expectations. Units are fairly new and well appointed. This was our second week in Hawaii and after a first week of hotels and going out for breakfast and trying to snack in room, it was wonderful to have a full kitchen. Everyone got up at their own pace, I had my Kona coffee sitting on the lanai.The extra space in a condo-unit makes for a much more relaxed attitude. The pools are excellent. Crystal clear and warm. There are several between the various buildings and all beautifully designed. And you are 100 feet from the ocean on a private beach. A board walk leads you down. Towel service was extremely convenient. Picked up a little sand? No problem,. just trade your towel in for a fresh one at any of the towel booths. They also offer snorkeling and other equipment for rent which is great because you will definitely want to swim with the fishes (not in the Godfather sense). The poolside restaurants are very relaxed and convenient. You can spend the entire day eating, swimming, body surfing , snorkeling, relaxing, drinking and never have to even put on shoes. The complex is huge, connecting both the south and north units which are treated as separate resorts, but it's really all one big place. It's located 10-15 minutes north of Lahaina (depending on traffic). Driving is very easy but parking in Lahaina can be tricky. At teh resort there is nothing within walking distance other than the resort restaurants so you'll definitely want to get out once in a while. There are many good restaurants along the main road and in Lahaina. And there is plenty of parking at the resort so it was never a hassle coming back. We were there second week of May and it was still considered "off season" so it was wonderfully uncrowded. It was easy to find open chairs in the shade any time of day. While you are there, be sure to do a Luau. There's plenty to choose from. They all sound similar. We did the one at the Hyatt and it was what we expected. If you are a but more adventurous, you can try scuba diving. I highly recommend Jay at Scuba Gods (scubagods.com). Nicest guy you'll meet, patient and great with beginners. None of us had gone scuba before. We did an 'introductory dive' where he provides basic training just to get comfortable with equipment and breathing underwater, etc.. Then he guided us out along the coral reef for about 45 minutes. It was an awesome experience. And I recommend you opting for teh second tank as you will want to do a second dive! And most definitely take a helicopter tour of the island. There's many to choose from. We went with Blue Hawaiian. My only advice is don't skimp because of cost. It's expensive anyway, so go with a full island tour. Our tour included landing on Haleakala to sip some pineapple "champagne". There are many many resorts to choose from on Maui. But from our experience, you won't go wrong at the Westin VIllas.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Henry098
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Westin Villas in Ka'anapali. As we knew this was primarily a time share resort, we were a bit hesitant to stay here as had concerns over service and being unduly pushed about purchasing a time share. However, we were drawn by the convenience of having more of a condo set-up than a traditional hotel room (w/kitchen and ensuite laundry) and decided to give it a go. Things did get off to a bit of a rocky start. Upon checking in, we found our room to be lacking in cleanliness. While neither my wife and I are neat freaks or are overly fussy, we do expect a certain standard to be met (especially upon initial check-in, we didn't necessarily expect to have full cleaning service during the week). Walking into a bathroom that had a dirty toilet seat (I won't go into details) and hair (clumps not the odd strand) in the shower did not really set a good tone for the first part of our stay. A stained comforter and a sticky drink spill on the kitchen floor didn't help much either nor did not replenishing our soap and shampoo the first couple of days. We did politely raise with the front desk our first night and asked them if they could do a more thorough clean when they came in the next day. When this was not done, we escalated our concern into more of a complaint and they actually got the housekeeping manager to personally address with his team the following morning and to his credit, the cleaning was better the rest of the week. Other hotel service such as the pool attendants, bar/restaurant staff was just o.k.. Not bad but not great. It was sort of like Westin has fielded their "B" team while the the Westin Hotel down the road probably has the "A team. They may want to consider reallocating some of their small army of time share and activity/excursion concierge folks into base services. However, again in fairness, this is again primarily a time share resort so I do have to keep everything here in perspective. On a more positive note, the resort facilities are good. The grounds were well maintained and I liked the spacious open air layout and the amenities were more or less up to regular Westin standards. The beach is decent although you can't really swim due to the coral (but the main Ka'anapali beach is just a 5 minute shuttle away). While we didn't use it as much as we had planned, having a kitchen was convenient as was the ensuite laundry. If you have kids (we don't) you could probably save big bucks. We figured we saved about $400 in not having to pay any hidden daily resort fees, preparing breakfast and a couple of lunches in our room, free Internet etc. Of course, with this set-up this resort is primarily a family oriented establishment that does have more than its fair share of kids running around (but this is par for the course in general in Ka'anpali!). We'd probably look to go a couple of weeks earlier or perhaps in October the next time around while the majority of schools are still in session. Overall, I'll give the Villas a passing grade. I'm not sure if we'd stay there again (and would probably lean to the actual Westin or Sheraton hotels down the road) but I would still recommend this to folks, especially those with families. Pros: -No hidden charges (i.e. no daily resort fee) -Kitchen and ensuite laundry -Nice open concept grounds and pool areas -Decent gym and spa -Complimentary wireless Internet -Free shuttle to main Ka'anpali strip (i.e. Whaler's Village) every 15 minutes and to Lahaina hourly Cons: -Not same Westin service as at one of their hotels (notably housekeeping) -Marginal restaurant/bar facilities -Late departure lounge/locker room facilities poorly serviced (again, primarily from a cleaning standpoint) -No ocean swimming from beach -Timeshare pushing (although not anywhere near as bad as you get in other places like Mexico)

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, but be careful what you book...”
Reviews.Author: Silva9006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas for one week in March. I have stayed at this resort before, and really loved it. The pool is awesome, the beach is great and I personally think some of the best snorkeling is right in front of this resort. We were there during whale season, and I would be snorkeling and could hear the whales under the water! They were jumping and playing like mad, it was awesome! The Westin never fails when it comes to the staff, they are always top notch with outstanding service...which is why we always stay at a Westin. That be said, be careful what you book. We paid for a Ocean view, only to end up facing the kiddie pool with a sliver of a view of the ocean. I tried to correct this with management, but it was over-booked and it was what it was. Disappointing, but we spent most of our time on the beach anyway, so it was fine. I do not recommend any of the restaurnats there, way over-priced and the service is awful! Our favorite places to dine are Mala's, Pacifico's and Mama's Fish House....but bring your money! Overall great stay, would recommend staying there...but be aware that this resort get over run with bratty screaming kids and the parents are no where in sight. Why can't parents whatch their kids better?

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Maui at the Westin Ocean Villa Resorts!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeeitAllNow
Reviews.Content: We are owners of the Westin Rancho Mirage property and also Vistana in Florida, and as faithful Starwood owners, we were absolutely thrilled with our 1st stay at the Westin Ocean Villas -Kaanapali last summer (2007). We re-booked for a 10-day stay this coming September (2008) and can't wait. Last summer (2007) our room was in the older original section and we were happy about that since the units are larger than the new ones-North, and just as nicely appointed. We were assigned a 1 bedroom premium that was on the 3rd floor at the far south end of the building overlooking a landscape fountain near the front entrance of the property. From our room we could sit on the really spacious lanai and see a lovely ocean view and nearby public park. We know that many people may likely NOT have preferred this room location with the constant fountain sounds , but we LOVED IT!! We are light sleepers and were thrilled to leave our slider doors open every night and hear the fountain...it was like the ocean and it masked out any in-coming traffic from the main highway. No complaints! Got be sure to tell EVERYONE to please order the homemade chicken soupat the ocean bar and grill...main building. OMG! It was so good we ate it several times while there...and the service was terrific....everywhere we went on property. One day at lunch at the pool grill, I'd kicked off a pair of expensive new leather sandles and then left to go back down to the beach. The helpful staff at the pool restaurant had retrieved them and were holding them for us and saw that we'd gotten a message in our room. The Westin concierge/greet staff was fabulous and helped set the tone immediately for a great stay with their helpful info and cordial assistance that started many weeks earlier when I'd called to have some dinner reservations made...and a floral arrangement delivered to our unit upon arrival. Having the Westin shuttle at our disposal was wonderful and we really utilized it many times when we just planned on running down to the Hula Grill at Whalers or into Lahaina for dinners and wine or the Cannery for quick grocery trips. Note: If you're a distance speed walker like I am...it's only about 4 scenic miles from the resort right into downtown Lahaina...and if you're too tired to hoof it back...just pick up the Westin shuttle that has several stops in Lahaina at KOBE restaurant, Hilo Hatties and also at the Cannery Mall a little bit north of downtown Lahaina. Maui is indeed paradise.....but the real paradise is being able to enjoy the island from such a lovely 'home-base'....the Westin Ocean Villas! Never hesitate to book a stay at this resort property and...NEVER hesitate for a second....to become a Starwood Property owner. As my brother (and also my financial advisor) said to me when we bought about 5 years ago...not only are we buying Starwood and all that comes with that name...but we're paying for TOMORROW'S VACATIONS with TODAY'S DOLLARS.....MAN WAS HE RIGHT! I could sell Starwood properties I'm so thrilled with the benefits of ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: kmcneer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks stay at the Westin. It was absolutely great! The rooms were perfect for our family. We reserved 3-1 bedroom units. The only problem we had is that we had requested they be close to one another and we were all on seperate floors. Each unit is well equipped with all the necessary amenities. The pools were great and the kids enjoyed the water slide. We rented chairs on the beach several days and enjoyed the peace and quiet. The snorkeling is fantastic right off the beach...no need to take a tour in Maui. My only gripe is that when we went to the conceirge to inquire about tours, we were really pressured into taking a tour of the units for sale. I am on vacation, I do not want to think about any type of business!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort - caveat re: Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: allplanetsearch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom condo in this resort. The unit was very new, well appointed, and in good shape. The bedroom was spacious and so was the bathroom (connected to the bedroom but with separate access through the hallway as well). There aren't many dining choices on premises: a couple of pool bars, a very well-stocked convenience store, and a nice, more formal restaurant. No room service at all. Since all the units have full kitchens, I imagine theyâ€™re expecting you to dine in. The pools are very nice and were not crowded. You can rent floats, covered chairs and tents (and do so in advance if you really want one of the four-person tents). They are building a spa within the complex, but it was not done in May. For spa services, you have to drive (or take the shuttle) to the Westin hotel down one mile the road. The only major caveat that Iâ€™d make is in regards to what they call â€˜ocean viewâ€™ suites. We paid extra for an ocean view unit and, upon check in, were shown to a third floor unit that was pretty much facing the kidsâ€™ pool but had a partial ocean view from the balcony if you looked all the way to the left. I called the reception to say that we had booked an â€˜ocean viewâ€™ suite and not a â€˜partial ocean viewâ€™ one. They replied that all ocean front units are reserved for time share owners (which we are not) and that anything with an ocean view was then called â€˜ocean viewâ€™. In other words, contrarily to most other resorts, they fail to differentiate â€˜partial viewâ€™ from â€˜ocean viewâ€™. Our loss.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: rockytoprb
Reviews.Content: Very nice place. Rooms are usually quiet. Very complicated layout, Hard to find anything. Routes to pool, parking, lobby are not well labeled. I would not want to be in some of the rooms if the place ever caught fire. Not enough parking and parking spaces are too small. Great views from the property of ocean, beach and other islands. Great sunsets. Views from most rooms cannot be that great., My room was mountain view with partial ocean view. You can see the mountain on the other island with a telescope and you might could see the ocean with binoculars. Lahaina is nice area. Lahaina Luau is very, very nice. Hard Rock Cafe food is terrible. Mixed Plate restaurant is very bad. Food and gasoline costs on Maui are exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: SoCal10
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Villas, first in the new North rooms. Now that they have opened the North area, the resort seems huge, not very personal. In the North rooms, the studios have balconies that you can actually stand/sit on unlike the South studio rooms. Positives - 1. very comfortable beds 2. very nice rooms (jacuzzi tubs, dual showers, granite countertop 3. free shuttles to Lahaina and Ka'anapali all day long 4. free internet in rooms 5. no ridiculous "resort fees" 6. family friendly 7. Lots of pool areas 8. snorkeling right behind resort comparable to Black Rock 9. granite barbeques by pool area 10.. you are in Maui Negatives - 1. often very windy around pool 2. pool chairs use to have padded cushions, no more 3. service is not great (safe did not work in our room when we arrived, we called, they promised and when we left a week later, safe still broken....same with a shower issue) 4. only had one workout area opened, not enough room 5. timeshares going on constantly thru out the day 6. closets very small Neutrals - 1. Lots of kids

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: steph_mlt
Reviews.Content: 3 words - heaven on earth!!! I stayed here for a week in the beginning of March & I absolutely loved it!! 5* rooms, 5* service, 5* pools.......... absolutely nothing to complain about! I could actually live there !!!! My stay in Maui was a dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: FloridaAlaskabound
Reviews.Content: This was a timeshare exchange and it was great. We ate at the bar/restuarant for dinner the first night since we were sooo tired. The food was great and the prices very reasonable. We had a 2 bedroom unit and was fantastic. Very clean and everyone was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: nigike
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a month trip to Hawaii. I spent most of the time by myself except one week. Lahaina was my second and third week. I chosed the Westin because of its location. It is in Lahaina where is the most nightlife is in Maui. Overall I loved the hotel, of course their bed is unbeatable. However I had few problems. The staff was not always friedly (except one occasion when I used their unopened gym and they let me finish my excercise. The person escorted me after my workout and showed me where the other gym is and let me know when they will open the one I used) The front desk was not nearly this friendly. No specifics but... If your room is looking at the pool it can be quite noisy. I requested ocean view and got a partial view but since I loved the room I did not bother to change it. The breakfast buffet was not what I would expect from the Westin. Not too many choices. To get to my room took forever and the hallway is not nice at all. The chairs by the pool are very unconfortable and if you want better ones with pillows and covered with mattress you have to pay additional 10 dollars. You can rent snorkeling equipment but you can literally buy for yourself one for one and a half day rental price. On the other hand the rooms are great , fully equipped kitchen, Wash and dryer in the room which is great. Big bathroom with nice shower. Parking is free. Free tennis court which is also nice. With small problems I loved the hotel and I will return and would reccomend to others. Have fun and enjoy Hawaii...Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mortimoss
Reviews.Content: The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Villas are some of the best accommodations you'll find in Maui (I have stayed at several places all over the island). We stayed in the North (newer) end of the resort. Super comfy bed with feather duvet and pillows, stainless appliances and granite countertops. Spotlessly clean. The whole resort was decorated in what I would call "modern Polynesian". Very tasteful (not Hawaiian tacky, as some resorts are). The beach at the resort is probably the best beach I have been to anywhere is Hawaii- smooth sand, clear water, very quiet and un-crowded. The staff was gracious and accommodating, the breakfast buffet was quite enjoyable and you could not beat the atmosphere. Oh, the pools are fantastic too! You really couldn't ask for more. I will go back to this hotel every time I go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: civicDuty
Reviews.Content: Eight friends and I stayed in the Westin Villas (North) from 4/27-5/3. We were extremely impressed. I had thoroughly researched the resorts in the area and decided, if we could pull it off, that this was the place to stay. Another reviewer on Trip Advisor wrote she got a good rate from Maui Hawaii Vacations (www.mauihawaiivacations.com; I swear I don't work for them). After searching through all the VRBOs and standard travel sites, I contacted them, and they were able to get us two 1 BR + 1 studio for more than half off the lowest VRBO rate I found. The rooms went quickly--we were barely able to confirm the reservation in time--and they clearly went out of their way to help us. When placing the reservation with Maui Hawaii Vacations, we had asked for rooms that were close together, on a high floor, and preferably not overlooking any parking lots. All requests were fulfilled. We had adjacent island view rooms in the Westin Villas North that also had views of the ocean. The front desk made keys for all the rooms for all of us and promptly answered service requests (e.g., rollaway beds, extra blankets). Our travel agency's package included daily maid service. They were thorough and professional--one member of our group couldn't find a book after a cleaning, and the staff searched thoroughly and promptly for the book and eventually found it (it had accidentally gotten wrapped up in sheets and sent to the laundry). I was also impressed (and relieved) that the hotel did not require us at the end of our stay to re-sort the dishes and kitchen supplies provided in each room; group dinners meant that we occasionally combined dishes from several rooms. The shuttle to Lahaina, free parking, grills, and excellent snorkeling outside the hotel were all handy amenities. Perhaps because we didn't go during a busy season, we had no trouble finding free pool chairs. Our only minor complaints were that the concierge was only occasionally helpful, and the fitness center was way too small and industrial. (Would've been nice if it had a view of some kind.) I've heard they're opening a new gym. There were also some jewelry vendors in the foyer. They seemed slightly inappropriate for such a nice resort. I stayed at the Halekulani in Waikiki, a hotel renowned for its service, in December. Service at the Westin Villas was the same quality, and the resort was much more comfortable. I'd also recommend Maui Hawaii Vacations for booking.

Reviews.Title: “the westin maui resort & spa...Just what the Doctors ordered”
Reviews.Author: xplr8n
Reviews.Content: The Westin Maui Resort & Spa/ Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas was just what the Doctors ordered! Needed to get away...and recharge the batteries...with a four year old in tow is...normally a challenge...thankfully, not so here! As a Centurian (over 100 countries traveled) I have seen it all from "WHAT you want ME to pay YOU...for THIS" to OH my... This room was beautiful, imaculate, well layed out and equipt. All the amenities for an extended stay, or a stay with a rambunctious one: Washer/dryer, convection/microwave and other utilities that riveled my own. Decor, comfortable, almost homie, but definitely upscale without feeling overblown. Love the Westin Dream Shower and Jacuzzi tub. ANd the views from this room...stunning! Sunsets over Lanai and Molokai...whale antics and spouts...really special memories. My favorite feature...THE PIRATE POOL! Why? Because my son was perfectly happy to spend every waking moment there...sliding, tunneling, swimming...making friends. This is not to take away from the other pools, Koi Ponds, lush grounds, great (kids eat free) resteraunts or clean beaches...keeping my octopus happy...allowed us to get the rest we needed! It's close to everything with the complimentary shuttle...and the "Sugar Cane Train" station being literally across the street added a touch of old Hawaii, and another adventure for our train crazy boy. All in all a great experience...

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay on maui”
Reviews.Author: SherryHa
Reviews.Content: We purchased a time share here 1.5 years ago, preconstruction and stayed here for the 1st time, wow, wow, wow, wow, wow. I loved the washer and dryers in the unit, the kitchen was usable, had everything you need, the balcony was the best, had really comfy furniture - we fell asleep listening to the waves more than once on the balcony -- great pools, good location and free shuttle into town and other westin/sheraton hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: NSW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are staying at the north villa for a week with our 2.5 year old daughter. We couldn't be happier with the resort. The room (studio, island view) is beautiful, brand new, and quite stylish. The bathroom is huge, with a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. We especially love the in room washer/dryer and kitchenette. They are invaluable assets when traveling with kids! We can prepare breakfast, keep drinks cold in the fridge, have ice at the ready, prepare easy meals. We have a crib for our daughter, which easily fits in the entry way (like a mini room for her) which gives us more privacy. If I were traveling with 2 kids, however, I would definitely get a 1 bedroom villa instead of the studio. Who wants to go on vacation and sleep in the same room with their kids?? Not us!! In the 1 bedroom villa, the kids sleep in the livingroom and the parents can have the bedroom to themselves. Though the resort caters to familes, it is very elegant and the landscaping is magnificent. We love the koi ponds, and the lush tropical plantings. The pools are fantastic, though we spend most of our time at the two toddler pools, which our daughter loves. They are super clean, safe, and so much fun! The resort's restaurants are decent, but not amazing. The great thing is that kids eat free, which works for us. When we wanted to go have a really good meal, we used Happy Kids babysitting service so my husband and I could go out by ourselves and check out the new sushi bistro at the recently remodeled Ritz Carlton. Highly recommend it for tasty sushi in a lovely setting. In sum, can't go wrong at this resort. The weather is absolutely perfect, not as cold and windy as Kapalua. The beach is gorgeous, the staff are friendly, the resort is relaxing, comfortable, and totally easy with kids. Probably would not recommend this resort for people looking for a quiet getaway. This is a large resort that caters to families, so honeymooners or other folks looking for a totally silent retreat in the middle of nowhere will probably want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at Westin Villas!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimerstomaui
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two parents & two kids, ages 4 & 7) just returned from a week here. It was spectacular! After a 7-hour delayed layover at LAX, we finally arrivied on Maui well after our scheduled check in time, but the check in was a piece of cake. The lobby is gorgeous and welcoming and the staff are very accommodating. We were assigned to a room on floor 3 of building 7. We couldn't believe our luck that our lanai directly overlooked the North prop pools, landscaping and straight out to a great view of the ocean. The room itself was very clean, and we ordered a rollaway instead of using the sofabed. (Major improvement). We took a boat trip (Four Winds) to Molokini and it was great fun, but we saw tons more fish right off the beach in front of the hotel & swam with at least 5 different sea turtles and puffer fish @ Black Rock. We even saw whales breaching from our rooms & from the beach out from. We wish we had made the time to get some fresh Island fish & grill it right there at the resort at the outdoor grills one of the nights. We also took a day trip to the Nakeleke Blowhole, Olivine Pools, Honolua Bay, etc. and they were all beautiful, but the resort was just incredibly relaxing. The restaurants aren't anything superb, but just okay (though pricey) and we preferred the dining in Lahaina town for dinners. The weather, staff and resort were excellent, and we are already counting the day when we can go again!

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home, great snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: Daisy Larchmont
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to spend a late spring break on Maui (April 7-13) with my two kids, ages 9 and 13. We usually stay in Napili at the Outrigger (a lovely, low-key property), but since my husband couldn't join us on this trip, I was looking for a slightly upscale place that had a wide range of resort-type services (room service, onsite dining, beach gear rentals, and onsite beach activity rentals), and where my kids could be comfortably set loose at the pool for the day. I also wanted a place where I could fix a few meals if I chose to. This place fit the bill perfectly. Checkin was a breeze. We arrived via rental car, bearing loads of groceries. The bellman asked if I wanted it all taken to our room while we checked in, and I said sure. They put away all my groceries for me, and gave me a full tour of the resort while my kids settled in. They really made me feel special, and valued. Valet service ($9 day, self-parking is free) was quick and friendly. Parking is no problem at all. Each complex has an underground lot, very useful as cars left outside during the heat of the day can get quite hot. It also rained nearly every morning/night we were there, so the underground parking was the way to go. I booked a one-bedroom "island View" villa, knowing full well from the other reviews that this meant a view of the highway and parking lot - I was willing to gamble that a free upgrade might be available. Upon checkin, I politely asked the front desk attendant if there were "quieter" rooms available away from the road, as I was worried about the road noise and car alarms. She hated car alarms, too -- and so gave me a partial ocean-view villa fronting the pool, a huge improvement (Rm. 2211 in the South complex). The rooms felt very big to me, and the bathroom was large, clean, and well-stocked with amenities. We never used the jacuzzi tub but I liked the fact that you could soak in it while watching TV if you wanted. Maid service was daily, which suprised me (I expected just once during the stay) and they always restocked our free laundry detergent, fabric softener, dish soap, etc. The villas were very quiet and well soundproofed. I never heard any noise at all from another room. The pool is open until 10pm, but the windows seal wel and close out most sound from outside. At first, I couldn't figure out why the A/C wasn't working, then I remembered another reviewer said you have to make sure all the windows are closed completely. I had to push the balcony slider hard to make contact with the switchplate inside the panelframe, and then it kicked in. Not a problem, really. The Westin Villas' location on North Ka'anapali Beach means less crowded conditions & plenty of sand for everyone, and great snorkeling is found right offshore. The reef is close-in and is still very healthy, as the water is just deep enough to prevent the coral from being trampled, but not so deep that you can't see the fish & marine life. I used to live near here, and was worried that this reef would be destroyed by all the people, but thankfully this has not happened, largely owing to the rather steep dropoff from shore. During our stay, the ocean was very calm, no waves at all, very good for swimming/kids. (Even during a swell, this beach doesn't get big breakers, but big surgey waves.) The pool was very warm which I like -- and the hot tubs were HOT! Delicious after snorkeling. The villas are a ten-minute drive from the north end of Lahaina, and there are free shuttles to the Kaanapali Beach resorts/Whaler's Village shops (every 15 mins) and to Lahaina (every hour). If you have a car, do your grocery shopping at Star Market in Honokowai, just 5 mins. to the north - they have a much better quality and selection than the Safeway at Lahaina Cannery Mall. Also try the Honokowai Okazuya (takeout) for delicious, restaurant-quality takeout - the lemon-caper mahi mahi is legendary. This resort is far less crowded than the other Ka'anapali Beach resorts, and I was impressed by the lovely landscaping. It's really very nicely done. I have to say I prefered the South complex to the North, due to the openness of the South Complex to the ocean (the North Complex is a bit closed off at the ocean end, obsuring the view from the grounds), and better pool (the South's Ocean Pool is larger, and has a waterslide for kids). However, if you are booking a studio unit, the ones in the North complex have actual walk-out lanais; the studios in the South unit only have balconettes (you step out to a railing). In all, I would recommed this place highly for families w/kids. If you are looking for ultimate luxury, and/or peace and quiet, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway despite ATA debacle/Love Starwood Properties”
Reviews.Author: ReneeV40
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days in Maui (was supposed to stay 5 in Oahu 5 in Maui) but due to ATA we extended our stay in Maui , the day after we got there ATA announced their closure. Our flight to OGG was with ATA, the crew was awesome, the flight great (and arrived early), my heart goes out to all of the employees. We had to change our trrip home via Phoenix (USAir) and stayed a couple of days in Scottsdale (due to long lay-over). USAir was great in the clutch as they had a very reduced rate on our return flight (boy did we get lucky). I recommend using Kayak as a your search engine, it was a priceless tool. We got upgraded to one bedroom villa (with peek-a-boo ocean view). WE stayed in the newer North building, check in was a breeze. Room was great, large bathroom, clean with all amenities. The pros Easy check in, we got there early and they were all ready for us. Shuttle to Lahaina and other Starwood properties made getting around island very easy Food at the two pool bars was very good (but expensive), try the onion rings, dipping sauce is great. Very quiet, no overhead or noise from other rooms Responsive staff, friendly, very accomodating and wonderful after our ATA debacle, they extended a very reasonable "distress rate" to us (Sonia at front desk). We chose to move to Grand Wailea as they were offering a nice rate too (wanted to try something different) Beautiful grounds, lots of beautiful foliage, waterfalls, etc. Great on-site photographer, very reasonable rates, very accomodating Comfy bed, great accomodations Beach is great, saw lots of fish and a huge turtle There is no tax or resort fee!!! The cons. The area (or maybe it was the time of year) was a bit windy, it almost fills like a wind tunnel through the North Building. Water temp at pool a bit cold. No hooks for hanging stuff in bathrooms We stayed at a sister property in Scottsdale (Westin Resort and Spa), there did seem to be more poolside activities for the little ones. We will definetly be back at this resort; hope to rent a week on Redweek next June. Next time we plan to use the kitchen facilities to save some ca$h. I highly recommend this resort to families with children. Loved the fact that we paid no hotel tax and daily rate, which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Stressful stay at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas”
Reviews.Author: BEMac
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-night stay at the Westin Ocean Villas and were very disappointed by the experience. To begin, we were greeted by a 45 minute wait to check in that was reminiscent of a airport security line. Given the crowds in Maui over spring break, the hotel's staffing of two receptionists on a busy Saturday afternoon was inexcusable. Our assigned "villa" (really a glorified hotel room with a small kitchenette) overlooked the parking lot and the main Kaanapali strip. While the room was adequate, it wasn't very clean with an unappetizing wad of hair left in the shower drain and some dubious looking brown spots on the telephone console. During our stay, the maid service was very erratic and rather than coming during the day while we were at the beach/pool, it either arrived at 9:00 before we were ready to leave for the day or at 5:00 after we retunred to get ready for dinner. On several occasions, the bathroom sink wasn't even wiped down after cleaning. The property is decent -- although not particularly special -- but the number of guests completely overwhelmed the facility. We arrived at the pool our first morning at 9:00 AM and were unable to find four beach chairs together as the savvy timeshare owners appear to make a habit of going to the pool in the early morning and "reserving" a chair for the day with their towel and personal items regardless of when they intend to actually use the chair. The overall pool experience is pretty mediocre on top of that with too many people crammed into too small a space. While the beach in front of the property is nice enough, it was super windy while we were there and not comfortable after about noon. I can't say whether this is typical or not for the property. On the plus side, the snorkling was very good. On the negative, the reefs are quite close in and are rough on the feet for general swimming. We left the Westin and spent the final four days of our vacation at the Four Seasons Koele Lodge on Lanai and the contrast was remarkable. We went from being one of the masses to special guests in an instant. While you do get what you pay for, the price difference between the Westin and the Four Seasons isn't all that great given that the Westin nickels and dimes you for everything and many items at the Koele and its sister resort the Manele Bay were provided for free as part of their great service. For example, beach chairs, umbrellas, and snorkling equipment are complimentary at the Koele/Manele. Those same items cost well over $100 per day for a family of four at the Westin. And that doesn't even take into account the free cold pineapple slices, popsicles, ice water, lemonaide, cold towels, and Evian mist at the FS. I would not recommend the Westin Ocean Villas to anyone looking for a luxury experience and professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: exp
Reviews.Content: ur family of four spent two weeks at the North villas at the end of March, beginning of April. We had stayed at the South villas last year, so it was nice to compare. Both resorts are spacious and have very nice furnishings. It is like staying in an apartment with the full kitchens, washer and dryers, and full bathrooms. It makes it very convenient with families. The BBQ grills also came in very handy and were fun as you could watch the ocean. the location is wonderful with a lively and colorful snorkeling beach right in front of the property. My husband and I snorkeled with a turtle, saw an eel and a couple of squid. there are lots of beautiful fish too. The whales were visible in the distance, though they seemed to be slowing down toward the end of our trip on the 5th. The pool bar and grill was very good, although they stop serving food around 4pm and move to bar status. The pool bar/grill is open for dinner at the south villas. We didn't get to try the main restaurant, but heard it was very good! It was a wonderful stay and location, but housekeeping was a little lax. If you stay for two weeks, they get very confused about cleaning your room on the 7th day---it happened last year at the south villas as well---something they need to work out. I highly recommend the North villas. They have not opend the store, work-out facility or spa yet, but they should be opening soon. It is a great family destination!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas for 7 days and loved it. We were a family of 5 as my Mother came along last minute with my husband and two kids. At first I thought it would be too cramped but when we saw how large the one bedroom unit was, we couldn't believe it. It was like a nice size apartment. Large foyer, huge bathroom ensuite and massive heavenly bed. The kitchen was a great size with granite counters and a pull out sofa bed. We immediately recieved a roll away bed for my kids. Our view from the original part of the resort was amazing. It was a pool, beach view. We could watch the never ending whales jumping in the ocean from our magnificent balcony. The resort is amazing. Very expensive but very relaxing which is what we wanted. When you got bored of the pool, we moved to the fabulous beach. We used our kitchen for most meals. The restaurants are crazy expensive. The kids club is a fortune. I thought it was free when I booked but it's actually $65 per day for each child! My kids are 8/10 and found that the kids there were quite young so we didn't bother. The activties for the children are basically non existant. They last 10-15 minutes and barely anyone showed up so eventually we didn't either. I sound like I'm complaining but I'm not. The place is amazing and that is a very mild complaint. My kids loved being there as the pool was terrific and the beach was calm. I'm used to the all inclusive resorts in Mexico so it took some getting used to. Everything here is very calm and relaxing compared to the never ending music and activities of Mexico. This place is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: We had a package from Starwood that they sent us after we spent a lot of nights with them in Kauai. We picked the Maui Sheraton property and were having a hard time getting rooms so they made an exception and sent us to this property which is a timeshare. We got a basic parking lot view studio room which we were not happy with. It was during Spring break so the resort was full. We paid for the upgrade and spent 6 nights ina 1 bedroom ocean view that was large and immaculate with beautiful views. We loved the place so much that we extended remainder of our stay there instead of the Marriott Wailea where we were supposed to shift for the last 6 days. They moved us to an ocean view studio in Building 7 on the North side which had opened just 2 months back. Everything was brand new. All the kitchens have granite and come with a dishwasher, full size refrigerator, washer and dryer units and we had the ones with jacuzzi tub. It's incredibly convenient when you have young kids. The beach is again kid friendly and snorkeling is great. They have snooba and scuba lessons that a lot of kids and adults took. The best part is the location. We saw atleast a dozen whales from our room and just while we were at the beach. We are talking about them completely coming out and breaching. In addition a school of dolphins were 3 feet away from us at the beach. They were flipping and having a good time amongst all the people. We also saw fishes that jump out of the water like it's running a relay. It kept on jumping and going back in. The shuttle bus that others mentioned is a good touch. They also have good discounts at the restaurants on the property. The Pulehu restaurant on the North side is very very good and a great value if you eat dinner early (5:30 - 7PM). Being in Kannapali the sunset views were spectacular. We have also stayed at the Grand Wailea before but it's seriously dated and snooty and pales in comparsion to the rooms and comforts at the Westin. I highly recommend this place for families. There is absolutely nothing negative I can say about this place. It's immaculate and perfect

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNutMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children stayed in the North property at the end of March for 10 days. We booked a studio and after reading some reviews I was a little concerned we weren't going to have a balcony. Fortanately that only pertains to the south property. So if you are booking a studio, definitely try and stay on the North property. The room was great, and we had a partial ocean view. Partial because the trees block the full view. The kitchenette was nice as well as we were able to eat breakfasts in and some lunches if we happened to be close to the resort. The Westin also has stainless steel gas grills throughout the property which we used one evening to grill steaks. It was a nice break from eating out. The time we were there was spring break for most of the U.S. as it was Easter week, which really made this location nice. We had full access to the Sheraton and other Westin next to Whaler's Village. There is a free shuttle that runs nonstop. It was nice to visit those locations and it made it easier to snorkel Black Rock and visit that end of Kaanapali Beach. But our location, although busy wasn't as crazy as the Sheraton and certainly not as loud as the other Westin. Also as I mentioned it was nice to be dropped off at Whaler's Village for shopping and most importantly utilitze the restaurants. We were also impressed that even though the resort was full, it was very quiet at night. We weren't disturbed once. Unless they just do that great of job of soundproofing the rooms. The grounds were great, well manicured and beautiful. The pools and hot tubs were wonderful. Nice restaurants and outdoor bars. But here is the best part. I/we did not miss one day of snorkeling. We snorkeled black rock, Molokini and the Turtle Arches via a Pacific Whale Foundation tour, as well as a location just north of Kapalua (sorry I forgot the name), and right in front of our resort seemed to be the best. Maybe it was the time of year, I don't know. But the quanity and quality of the fish, and yes we did see 4 sea turtles in front of our resort, was awesome. The reef starts about 6-10 feet into the water and the snorkeling was wonderful as soon as you got in the water. I would highly recommend this property. Did I mention the whales we saw at sunset?

Reviews.Title: “Like a hotel but better”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this Villa as an owner and our first impression was fantastic. The villa is more like a Hotel with valet and bellmen service as well as food delivery and a chef (â€œchef in actionâ€� they call it) to prepare a meal in your private accommodations as an added option to fine tune your vacation. They also have daily activities for the family members. We really like the rooms; they are larger than a hotel room with a kitchen. The rooms are clean contemporary design with an upscale flavor. The bed continues to be heavenly. Our two week stay was great. The complimentary Internet access made our stay a home away from home. Most of the staff was friendly and the grounds are nicely groomed. There is no workout center, grocery store, business center or boarding pass printing. You have to go to the main building which we found disappointing and inconvenient. They are expecting the workout area and grocery store to be installed sometime in the near future. We both enjoyed the excellent quality at the Pulehu restaurant located on the first floor. They also have a complimentary shuttle to each Starwood hotel (Sheraton Maui and Westin Kaanapali Hotel) and to the Canary shopping center and Lahaina town. The beach is narrow unlike the beach at the Sheraton Maui. You can charge any of your consumables from any of the Starwood Hotels to your room, but you cannot charge any independent merchants products found on any of the Starwood hotel grounds. You will have to bring your own towels if you are renting a cabana at the Sheraton Maui (I hope they change that) There is a pool for adults and a pool for kids which is nice for families. Barbeque grills are also available on the family side of the villa. If your vacation starts on a Friday, Saturday or Sunday, make sure you get there a few hours earlier then the 4:00PM check-in to avoid the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: rlpolobear9
Reviews.Content: Me my girlfriend and her entire family stayed here for 9 days in Sep 2007 and I must say it was the best experience of my life. Her parents own a two bedroom suite here so it was a free vacation which allowed us to do everything we wanted to do. My girlfriends brother also was married on the beach on our third day which made for a really nice ceremony. We also stayed at the Sheraton Kanapali before moving to this resort and although it is nearly as delevopled as the Sheraton it is still a very nice place to spend a vacation and much less crowded. I would definetly recommend renting a car as it is pretty hard to get around to any of the sights without one from here although you can take the free bus service. Which at night is filled with many crazy women out to have a good time (i.e. cougars) Some things you should definetly try and do if you stay here: -Go snorkeling off the beach in the morning you will walk three feet into the water and see the most beautiful species of fish, turtles and coral. (wear swim shoes as it can be rocky and you can get cut on the coral or step on a sea urchin) -Old Lahaina Luau Really fun best in Maui great food and took tons of pics bought a bunch of tiki's and turtles -Bike down Haleakala Yes you have to get up at 2am. It's worth it as the view danger and breakfast at the end where incredible. Just be careful, it is dangerous. When we where up on top we saw a girl with a girl with a broken leg from the day before and a few days later a woman got killed. Black Rock- At the Sheraton really fun jumping of the cliff and again great snokerling better than wasting money in going out to Molokini (big waste as it's rare they actually take you out there and instead you go ot some crappy spot where you see no fish and waste your time) Also they have a show which is really cool at sunset. Lahina- Go down and havea few drinks at one of the local bars walk the street sand do some shopping and relax in the quaint little town feel.You can also take in one of the various shows and sign up for a time share presentation to get discounts from here. We just went to boss frog's rented gear for 7 people plus cameras for free just for me and my g/f to go to one which saved us over $300 as we then got huge discounts to all the events for 90 mins of saying NO NO NO :) We ate at Moma's Fish house which was amazing if you can stomach the prices it's worth it. Also ate at Sanz in the Hyatt great food. The food at the resort was just so so. All in all it was such a great vacation and surley on I will never forget. There are tons of things I'm forgetting but ce la vie.

Reviews.Title: “Kid-friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: traveldadOntario
Reviews.Content: We were assigned a room in the North Villas. We weren't given an upgrade to a one bedroom but we did get a partial ocean view upgrade on the 4th floor and a later check-out for no extra charge so that was nice. The grounds are nicely landscaped with koi ponds and pools. They have a water slide for all ages at the main pool and a separate pool with the pirate ship in between the north and main villas for children only. There is also an adults only pool at the north villas. The beach isn't rocky or windy at all but it isn't as wide or as busy as the main Ka'anapali beach. They have signs up that indicate that they in the process of rejuvenating the beach but don't worry it's still very nice right now. We didn't really use the kitchen except to make breakfast and to keep the drinks cold but it was still great to have. I think it is perfect for families. PROS: 1. Spotless 2. Brand new & looks exactly like the photos 3. Huge bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower with a dual shower head 4. North Kaanapali Beach is nice - steep drop off in the ocean but that makes it even better for snorkeling - no need to go out too far 5. Free Parking 6. Free in room Wifi 7. Free access to business centre (Internet, faxes, printing) 8. Room amenities - washer/dryer also provide broom & vacuum 9. Kitchen amenities - fully stocked kitchen including a dishwasher, toaster, blender etc. (they also provide a free starter kit including Tide, Bounce, scouring pad, Palmolive, tea towels, tea/coffee & paper towels) They don't provide salt or pepper so don't forget to pick that up at the market. 10. Daily housekeeping - they even did our dishes for us! 11. In-room Entertainment - LCD TV with 100+ channels, Bose CD player/radio & DVD player (movie rental machines are in the lobby though we didn't use them) 12. NO Resort Fees!!!!!! Yay! 13. Free local calls 14. Free shuttle to Lahaina and the other starwood resorts (we never used this though since we had the car) 15. Free 4x6 photo taken by a professional photographer. 16. Nice sized Lanai overlooking the pool - only studios in the north villas have a Lanai in the main villas studios just have a juliette balcony 17. Huge gas BBQ's for use CONS: 1. Shallow pools ( this might be listed as a pro for you but for us we would have liked something deeper - at its deepest the pools are I think 4 1/2 feet) 2. Some hallways in the North Villas seem unfinished - room is gorgeous but the hallway is un-carpeted in parts and seems a bit utilitarian not like the rest of the resort ( I think they're still working on this, though there was no construction going on while we were there) 3. North Amenities aren't finished (spa and 15,000 sq ft gym still in progress) though you can use the amenities of the main villas. 4. Early check-out. Regular check out is 10am and even though they extended the check-out for us our flight wasn't leaving till 9pm. They do give you full access to all the amenities and a guest lounge. But you have to use the gym's locker room to shower and change in. That was crappy I would have preferred a hospitality room like most other hotels provide. 5. Somehow the beds in the N. Villas are queens and not kings (so weird apparently it was some mistake and they are going to order all new beds or something - not that we really needed a king bed but just kinda odd) 6. No access to the other SPG (Sheraton, Westin) pools. Apparently they had to stop that last year do to overcrowding. You can still charge things at the other Starwood resorts to your room but that's it. They also have a full list of activities but we didn't do any of them as we were mostly out and about or at the beach. But if you want to do one I recommend the free cooking demonstrations by the chef from the Sheraton. We just happened to walk by when that was happening and they just invited us over. So we pretty much learned how to make some delicious gourmet food that is easy to make and then ate it all. Yummy. And then he did a giveaway of his cookbook (which we didn't win but maybe you'll be luckier!) So as you can see there are a lot more pros than cons. We really liked it and it'll be even better for those with kids as we found it really is geared to families w/ kids.

Reviews.Title: “Just to Relax”
Reviews.Author: I_wanna_go_places
Reviews.Content: The trip to Maui was a simple trip set up for easy relaxation and rest. The Villas were the perfect place to do both. They are located about five minutes (driving) from the main strip of Lahaina. It's near the restaurants and shops. You can also watch the whales right off the shoreline at the Villas. Between the location and the peace and quiet the trip was great. It can be a great place for families or a quiet break from work for couples.

Reviews.Title: “very busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: EHDx2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Westin in Maui. The hotel is very nice. When we arrived we were put in rooms on the second floor at the same level as the roof. There were water and beer bottles scattered about on the roof and a very small view of the ocean. We had booked through Pleasant Holidays and requested an ocean view room. The room also had a king bed when we requested doubles. We called the front desk and were on hold for a very long period of time. The front desk was not helpful and so we asked for a manager. We were given a manager that helped us change our room to a higher level room with a lovely view. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Please beware that if you are looking for something quiet, this is not the place!! Kids under 12 eat free with an adult and there is a water slide. There are tons of kids and one adult pool and getting a chair required going out at 7am to secure a seat. Chairs on the beach cost $5.00 and umbrellas are $10 and they don't have enough to go around. These costs are not covered by the $20 a day resort fee that is added to your bill. Location is good, next to Whaler's Village for shopping. All in all a really good trip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the North Villas!!!”
Reviews.Author: scrambler329
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our first stay as the North Villas have just been open for 6 months. First some things are still not in place like the spa, general store, lanai screen doors, some information booklets in the room. Second, the grounds and pool are wonderful. We were there during Presidents Day week and yet we never felt crowded or could not find peace and quiet. I can say there was a noticable difference in noise between North and South. The beach was nice with good snorkeling. The staff was nice enough. The 1 bedroom unit was great with the near new appliances. One negative that I did not care for is the midweek houseclean was really just a towel exchange. The food at the restaurant was above average but not extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Constant NOISE, but fun for kids”
Reviews.Author: Euryop
Reviews.Content: Two complaints, and them some praise. Westin Villas are great fun for kids but won't provide a restful vacation for adults because of all the NOISE! Multiple pools provide screams of joy from early, early morning to late at night. Worse, every (yes, EVERY) morning we were awakened as early as 6:30 a.m. by the very loud reverse gear "BEEP, BEEP, BEEP" of the constant hotel shuttle buses and delivery trucks echoing between the buildings. Also, the staff power washed with the loudest compressor every (yes, EVERY) morning for hours at a time. Also, the staff was often unable to ACCOMODATE large groups. The restaurant hostess, waiters and others seemed to have trouble finding and serving a table for 10 or more, even with advance notice, the restaurant ran out of certain foods, the pool ran out of towels more than once, and the some of the staff just seemed a bit exasperated. Now the praise. The grounds were immaculate. Very clean buildings. Gorgeous landscaping. The pools were great fun for kids of all ages. The koi ponds were beautiful. The hotel provided live music and quality vendors in the lobbies. If you're looking for a beautiful but sleepless vacation, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see whales in February!”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueOcean7
Reviews.Content: We own a week at this property so we may be a little biased but I haven't been too disappointed. This is our third visit here. The staff from the bellmen, concierge, check-in, shuttle drivers, and housekeeping have been very friendly and knowledgable. The facilities are clean and well maintaned although some stained upholstery & drapery can be replaced. A sister facility has opened which expands the space/pools/restaurants which were pretty good in the first place since they run shuttles between here and the Westin Maui and Sheraton Maui for guests. You can only use the pool for the property where you're staying. However, you can charge dining charges to your room regardless of where you're staying. This place has kitchens/kitchenettes depending on which size suite you're staying in. The pools can get very busy so be prepared to get up early to get a good seat. The poolside beverage service isn't as attentive as the Westin Maui but the bar is nearby so you can order drinks if you really want it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Westin North Villas”
Reviews.Author: irishiz5
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Sheraton Vistana Villages in Orlando. We have a 2 bedroom which only translates to a studio in Hawaii. After being awake for 22 hours we arrived in Maui. The bellman opened the car door and immediately started telling us he will park our car and take our luggage for us. Nothing like giving us a moment to get our thoughts together to check in. I told him just hold on, that we needed to check in. I went to check in - I asked if there were upgrades available, I thought that maybe since we were owners in the Starwood network that we would have a decent chance). The clerks looked at each other and convinced themselves that all 1 bedrooms were booked, although there were a lot of dark windows that week in other condos. They never made the effort to check. The best was that I received an email the week we were there, as a general email to Starwood owners about all of the current available rooms at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas North. I guess that's just until you get there. We went back to our car and I went to get a luggage rack. Big No-No here. The bellman appeared and informed us that we weren't allowed to use them. that only the bellman can (kind of snotty, may I add). I went up to check on our room while my husband parked the car (he took the luggage out and set it by the bellman's desk). I misunderstood the room number (the first number is the building #, not the floor # - my husband said they did tell me, but I was exhausted and didn't hear that). Bottom line, the bellman disappeared and we had to take our luggage up ourselves. Sorry, couldn't use one of the 34 luggage racks sitting there. I was quite ticked and let the desk person know in no uncertain terms. We would have had the bellman do it, if he were around (there was only one there that night). My husband had one of the bellmen bring up groceries later in the week on the luggage cart. That guy was very nice. We get to the room and the carpet was stained in several spots. Hmmmm, was I at a Best Western and no one told me? Nope, because I could at least use the luggage rack at Best Western. This was just a deluxe hotel room. We did luck out with an extra large lanai because we were right over the restaurant in the main building. In the room there was very little space for clothes, personal items in the bathroom, or items in the kitchen. The toilet was plugged up, the shower door wouldn't close properly, the kitchen sink/garbage disposal plugged up and the safe wouldn't open (yes I did a test run before I locked it). Any of the people that came to fix things were very nice. The grounds were nice, the pool was nice. We called about a channel guide and they said they didn't have one, although we did later find one on our welcome pamphlet that had gotten buried (remember - no space). Also, there were no computers available for use in this complex - you had to go to the regular Villas lobby. How hard is it to set up a few computers? Also, the general store is still under construction. The bathroom is set up kind of strange. There are windows that open right above the jacuzzi - I guess for if you want to watch TV while you're in there, can't think of any other reason. There is no duct in the bathroom, so once you close the door, you get absolutely no air in there. Also, fyi, as soon as you open the lanai door, the air stops working, so make sure you close the door tightly when you leave. The telephone operator was great though - she answered any questions we had. So, we had a fantastic time in Maui with our various activities, but the Westin was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelreview12
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights in a 1 bedroom villa at the Westin Villas and had a great time. We spent our 8th and final night on Maui at the Westin Resort and the experience there didn't even compare. The Villas were much more comfortable. We felt crowded at the Westin Resort but never felt that way at the Villas. The washer and dryer make packing a lot easier. The full kitchen was perfect. The pool at the Villas was not as fancy but the water was much warmer. The beach out front was great for swimming and snorkeling. The restaurant was average at best although a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 children 12 and under) can eat hambergers with drinks for less than $30. Not bad for Maui. We do not own a timeshare and booked our room through a travel agent for $1850 (7 nights in an ocean "view" 1 bedroom villa.) This included daily maid service. My only real complaint would be that the cleaning was minimal. Sand would remain on the floor even after they cleaned. At various times we have stayed at the Hilton Waikoloa on the Big Island, the Hyatt on Maui and Kauai, and the Westin Resort on Maui. We really enjoyed the Hyatt on Kauai and the Hilton on the Big Island but would choose this resort first for our next visit due to the beach, size of the rooms, full kitchen, and value.

Reviews.Title: “We Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: TripTimeOregon
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this resort. We were refered by a friend who bought a time share at this property last year. Because of the referal we were able to book a studio villa (king size bed in the same room w/ pull out sofa bed) that included washing machine/ dryer, small kitchen area w/ stove, small refrigerator, and dish washer for $749 for 5 nights plus a discount on a car rental as well as a room credit good for use towards anything charged to the room. We ended up upgrading for additional $150 a night for a one bedroom (king size bed in seperate room w/ pull out sofa bed in the living room area and full sized kitchen) but over all still got a great deal considering how expensive Maui lodging can be. The room set up was perfect for traveling with kids and the property itself had many kid friendly activities including a great kids pool with a mini pirate ship. We were also able to arrange for a crib in advance for our 3 mos. old which made for one less item to bring along. The only thing that I did not like was the plantation shutters between the bathroom and bedroom area. The shutters are next to a wonderful large jet tub that when open allow the person in the tub to look into the master bedroom. Romantic yes but not so good when you are with two little ones. The bathroom (sinks, shower, tub) were in a large room w/ floors that were tiled which made it kind of loud in the bedroom next to it. This is a time share property so it is somewhat expected that you attend one of the tours if you get in on the same deal we did. I was pleasantly surprised with how laid back they were though and felt no pressure to buy. We would come back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent beach, snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: oatmeallover2003
Reviews.Content: We requested the north villas and was granted this request. The north villas are quiter, newer and if you stay in a studio you have an actual balcony. Let me first say, the resort is kid infested and there are what seems like hundreds of children running around screaming. The resort is very clean as is the beach. The snorkeling is excellent, best on the island right at your doorstep. The kitchen is fully stocked and comes in handy for breakfast and lunch. The major downside is the 4pm check-in and 10 am check-out, both which seem ridiculous. A few days during the week they had a guitarist and hula dancer in the garden around 6pm, which you could hear from the room and is pleasurable to listen to on your balcony. I would definitely stay here again, only with kids. If you are a couple, or single adults this is not the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: LRM43
Reviews.Content: We booked a 7 night stay for late January 2008 back in September 2007. We had an ocean view two bedroom lockoff villa and could not have been more impressed. Very clean, they even did our dishes with the daily housekeeping service. We paid $3,400 for the week through Maui Hawaiin Vacations.
