This rate comes to around $242/night for a one bedroom condo which I was pleased with esp for the Kaanaapali Beach location. We shared with another couple and had a mini "foyer" like hallway between the two suites. Our suite (master) had a spacious bedroom with the heavenly bed which was so great! We had a spacious bathroom as well with double sinks, jacuzzi tub (which we never even used) and of course, the heavenly shower. Nice flat screen TV in bedroom and another in living area. Our living area was also very spacious (a completely separate room) with a couch and chair, coffee table and a full size dining table and six chairs. The living area had a lanai entrance too (shared with the master bedroom) with two wicker chairs. The kitchen was done nicely with complimentary dish soap, coffee and all needed utensils and dishes. To top it off we had a stacked washer and dryer off the kitchen enclosed in a closet. They even included Tide and dryer sheets. The adjoining one bedroom across the "foyer" from us had it's own entrance and was similar to our suite just smaller. Their lanai was very tiny, could barely stand there, no chairs to sit. Their living area was like that of a larger hotel room where the bed and living area are the same room, not separated like ours. and they only had a kitchenette with mini fridge and not all the amenities we had. Their bathroom, although spacious, only had one sink but they did have their own washer and dryer too. Same heavenly king bed and shower. We did not know the accomodations would be different but it worked out fine for all of us even though one suite was a little larger. Since we traveled together and shared the cost it worked out fine. Although I did feel a little bad that we arrived first and got the nicer, bigger suite. The pool was above average and the beach area is nice. The grounds were very lush and tropical, very well maintained. The concierage was excellent and we used different ones for different activities depending on who was at the desk that day. All were friendly, competent and very knowledgable. An awesome value for 2 couples traveling together but would also work well for families. Our suite alone could have slept another two out on the pull out sofa - no heavenly couch there but kids don't care, right? The adjoining suite could have also accomodated 4 with the pull out couch. We were on the first floor overlooking the pool area. The onsite restaurant/bar had average food and the little grocery store onsite was convenient but expensive. The bartender, Mike was fun and made us a yummy drink called a volcano on our first night. Also nightly entertainment on the lawn around the pools. A local dance studio put on a really great hula show one night we were there with boys and girls ages 3 all the way up to around 17. They were excellent and it was very entertaining with great hawaiian music. We just sat out on the lawn with our mai tai's then walked over to the beach for the sunset. They alternate nights between the North Resort and the one we stayed at. The North resort can be accessed by walking over and you can use their pools too. They are a little newer and had a fancy restaurant overlooking their koi pond. We ate there and the food was good but it was a little overpriced and stuffy. Nice view though I can't remember the name of the restaurant. The North resort also seems to have a nicer pool area for little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and invigorating.”
Reviews.Author: blue_eyed_1
Reviews.Content: Due to a few family birthday celebrations, we headed to West Maui and the beautiful Ka'anapali Beaches. Timeshares are avialable here. We had ocean views from the room (5406/5405), as well as a near full kitchen with fridge, stovetop, microwave, dishwasher, plates and utensils to eat, drink and cook with. The service was great, the multiple pools, jacuzzis, landscape of koi ponds and outdoor barbecue grills as well as being steps away from the beach - all made the trip remarkable. You can rent snorkeling gear from the pool water sports kiosk, and there are shuttles to take you to Whaler's Village as well. Lahaina is only about a mile south, and is full of boats ready to depart for sport fishing, whale watching, and snorkeling trips. Jogging along the southern pathway, and making use of their small gym was an invigorating experience as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KYSU
Reviews.Content: Definitely enjoyed our stay at the Westin Villas. We were put up in the North Bldg, Bldg#5 3rd floor. We initially had a studio but got upgraded to a 1 bedroom which made a world of difference in space. It was immaculate (one of the cleanest places I've ever stayed in), modern, and had everything we needed (double sinks in the bathroom, seperate shower from bathtub, spacious living room and master bdrm, very comfy "heavenly" bed, washer/dryer, 2 large closets, well equipped kitchen with some supplies included, great view of the pool, and koi pond) We were so impressed with the thickness of the walls....never heard a soul during our entire 5 day visit. Spent some time at the north pool and the "kiddie' pool which has a huge pirate ship in the middle that sprays down into the water (we have a 2 yr old). Went over to the south pool once but it was quite packed and fairly loud. The beach was wonderful (love all the trees and grass along the beach walkway, glad they preserved them) long and spacious....never had an issue finding a quiet space on the sand. Great snorkeling out front too and a wonderful place to watch the sunset. Plenty of grills if you're want to cook with tables and chairs right by them. Didn't eat at the restaurant but had a few drinks at the outdoor bar area (on the north side) and listened to some live music (that I believe they have every day around 6). The location of the property was nice.....away from all the other hotels along Ka'anapali. Short distance from Whalers Village and a 10 minute drive to Front Street. There was not a lei greeting at this property and aside from one very friendly and very professional front desk employee, the others did not see to fired up to be there. We were never pestered with time share (I thought for sure we would have had at least a message on our voicemail in our room...but never got one). Would highly recommend the Westin Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but lacking warmth”
Reviews.Author: rachellemb
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids, 6 and 8, and I stayed here Jan. 2008. We had a nice stay, but the property didn't excite us. The property has a very modern, luxurious feel but I have to agree with a previous reviewer that there is a lack of Aloha here. We were in the North building, in a studio, and our room was very beautiful, comfortable and clean. Having a washer and dryer in room is a huge bonus when traveling with kids. Everything we needed was provided. The North building is not complete, and many of the services are located in the South building and some services in the South may not be provided in the North building. It is a very short walk to the South building, but in the wind and rain it was a little annoying. The atmosphere in the North and the South buildings are completely different. The North building is very quiet, felt more sophisticated and my kids were the only kids at the pool. I felt uncomfortable being there because I didn't want to bother the adults in the quiet , relaxed atmosphere. Then we decided to check out the South pool. What a difference! Life! Activity! Families! We were obviously in the wrong building. The South pool is great for kids with the slide and other families. So, if you are an adult with no kids and don't want to be bothered by other people's kids, stay in the North building. If your traveling with your kids, stay in the South building if they will let you. I'm trying figure out myself why this property didn't wow me, when it was beautiful, had everything, and it should have. I have to say it was the lack of genuine friendliness from the staff, the constant wind at the property, the timeshare presence and being put in the North building instead of the South. The staff was always courteous but not relaxed and genuinely friendly like at the previous Starwood property we stayed at on Oahu. It was more like a forced courtesy because these guests are paying a lot to stay here. They must have mistaken us for a fussy, wealthy travelers. There was also a constant wind at the property the entire 6 days we were there. The Kaanapali area in general is a windier part of the island, you have to go to Lahaina to escape it, but I couldn't stand it. These weren't gentle tradewinds, but constant gusty winds. Sitting at the pool or beach everything had to be anchored down and the sand stung you during the big gusts. The lobby was like a wind tunnel. No one else has mentioned these winds, so maybe this was a fluke, and it is not the hotels fault, but it was hard to enjoy the amenities. Future reviewers, mention the winds if they are worth mentioning. I'm curious to know if it is always like this. They have a handy shuttle that will take you to the other Starwood properties and to Lahaina. Using the pools at the other properties is not allowed. You must be a registered guest at that property to use the pool. I can understand why this rule was put in place. Check out is early at 10 a.m. and we were finishing up packing when at 10:10 we got a knock on the door from housekeeping that they needed to clean the room for the next guest and that we were past check out. I appreciate that they want to have the room ready for when the next guest arrives, and it was past check out, but it felt like an eviction as they waited outside the door for us to clear out. We were out the door by 10:17. Overall it was a good stay, and I could recommend this property to others, and I would stay again if I can stay in the South building, the winds are more gentle and the staff was more genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven! Wonderful all around experience.”
Reviews.Author: Swirlz5
Reviews.Content: My b/f and I enjoyed 5 wonderful nights at the Westin KOR on their promotion package. We were not required to attend a presentation but received an additional "gift" for doing so ($100 hotel voucher - on top of the $75 voucher that came with our package deal which consisted of an Avis rental car and Studio Villa). First off we arrived a little late, I believe close to 8pm and we didn't receive a lei greeting but we were more concerned with getting checked in and seeing our room. We asked if there were any complimentary upgrades and to go from a studio to a 1 bd they wanted another $200 per night. They did however upgrade us from an Island Studio Villa to a Deluxe Villa which we were told was slightly bigger. Sadly we were on the ground floor and did overlook the parking lot to the public beach but for the price we weren't' complaining. The building was exceptionally quiet and we were a 60 sec walk out the door to the beach. We would have loved to be on any floor above ground level but as it was we just closed the blinds most of the time. The rest of the room surly made up for it. The bed was a dream, the room was very roomy, and having our own washer & dryer came in handy after our Kaanapali Zipline tour. The rooms has maid service daily on this package whereas renting the standard week does not offer daily service. Also, coffee, teas, soaps (Laundry & dish) were all provided. The bathroom is absolute luxury.. . huge counter space, jacuzzi tub and separate dual head shower. Wonderful. So then came the calls. After checking in we hit the lounge for cocktail. When we got back to the room we had a voice mail telling us to stop by in the morning to pick up our voucher and this was also so they could arrange a time for our timeshare tour. Everyone was extremely nice and always had a hello. Had we wanted to avoid taking a tour we could have ignored the call(s) or just not checked our messages. They were not pushy and were all very nice about it an always had a treat of somesort. We got chocolates and postcards when setting up the tour time and then durning the tour we were offered beverages and snacks. I recommend the Iced lattes :-) The tour did run a little long but we got through it and got this out of our way our 2nd day at the resort. This left the remaining 3 days of piece and knowing we wouldn't be bothered any further. I highly recommend taking this deal if you come upon the offer. We enjoyed all the pools and hot tubs at the resort. The snorkeling right out front was excellent and great for first timers. Going in October I guess it was a bit slow, we had no trouble finding chairs or space on the beach. There is also a free shuttle to Whalers village every 15 min for hotel guests as well as a free shuttle to Lahaina. We had a rental car but often took advantage of the shuttle to save on parking. All in all this was a great trip and we loved everything about the Villas. We are already planning our trip back in Feb 09. The next trip will be at the North property.

Reviews.Title: “loved it.”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in buidling #2 and loved it. The property is well kept and very modern. The rooms (we had a one bedroom ocean view) was GREAT. Large living area with a pullout sofa, dining table, kitchen with marble countertops, large bedroom with king bed and a very large bathroom with jetted tub and seperate shower. A washer/dryer are also in each room! We will definately stay here again. The pools are great and warm as well - the beach has excellent snorkeling - as good as any tour - save your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: quelvie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay! I own a Starwood timeshare and traded my week for a week in Maui. The entire staff was friendly, helpful, and absolutely accommodating. We were never hit on for any sales presentations. And, I only mention that because other TripAdvisor members do. The room was very clean and comfortable. Great water pressure and a comfortable bed. The exterior ground were beautiful and well-maintained. Service at the pool area was superior and the valet service was super helpful. When we checked in, we asked for an upgrade and were granted one. We love the area and when we return to Maui will definitely stay again. By the way...both of us have been to Maui several times and can honestly say this was our best time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: gatech33
Reviews.Content: This resort is so wonderful that our family stayed there in 2002 and then again in 2006. The pool is probably the best on the island of Maui because of the slide, swim under caves and hot tubs, several different lounge areas, and wonderful service. There are beautiful coy ponds, live parrots, and of course palm trees overlooking the ocean. The rooms are amazing and of course the Heavenly beds are unbeatable by any other resort anywhere. This was a wonderful experience and you have to enjoy the long walks on the sidewalks on the beach because they are lit up at night with lanterns and take you to the shopping area just ten minutes away. I would never stay anywhere else in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: vacationer28216
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights of our 17 night Hawaiian vacation at the Westin, and all of us wished that we were here all 17 nights. It was GREAT. The staff is wonderful, the grounds are more beautiful that any other resort that we have been to, and it is fun and inviting. You can not possibly be disappointed with this hotel. Our one complaint is that the prices are a little high ($16 for a cheeseburger), but the restaurants that are a 2 minute walk away are GREAT. There is a beach front restaurant with the tables actually set on the sandy beach, and a great open air sports bar. (Favorite part of our Maui trip....Helicopter tour of Maui and Molokai (Fly the Black Beauties). It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymmon overall....with a few problems.”
Reviews.Author: TravelFromKC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon from Sept. 22-29, 2007. Let me preface this review by saying that we came from the VERY luxurious Marriott on Kauai before staying at the Westin Villas. The Westin is a totally different atmosphere that the big Marriott on Kauai. So, nevertheless, our expectations were high after our stay on Kauai. We traded on Interval International as a gift from my husbands parents. We were initially supposed to stay at the south property...but ended up at the north property. Upon check in (which took forever), we were told a room wasn't ready for us. Although we arrived well after the 4 pm check in time. It took about an hour for them to get us a room. When we got up to the room....it was as bad as it could get. We were stuck in what was supposed to be an "ocean view"...but was behind the public parking lot for Ka'anapali Beach Park. It was in the corner on the first floor. Needless to say, as honeymooner's...we were disappointed. Not only was the room in a terrible location, but the hallways were crowded with kids running without supervision and were extremely loud. The south property itself was VERY crowded and overrun with people in the lobby and at the pool. We could tell that it wasn't the low key vibe we were looking for. The front desk at the south property was of no help....so we ventured to the north side. We asked if there was any way that we could transfer and our wish was granted! They moved us to a studio in the North property (3rd floor) and sent us a bottle of wine for our troubles. This whole process took about 4 hours, which did cut into our evening plans. But, we were so happy to be off the south property...we didn't care. Now for our good experience with the Westin south property. Our room was beautiful and hadn't even been stayed in yet. The resort was only at about 60% capacity because construction was still going on. The room: Typical Westin modern rooms. Our room overlooked the courtyard and the koi pond, but still had a good view of the ocean through the buildings. There was a full kitchenette that was stocked with everything we needed. The bed was only a queen size and we were expecting a king. But the bed was "heavenly" There was a full lanai which we took full advantage of for morning coffee and many meals. The bathroom was very luxurious with a separate shower and jacuzzi tub. The jacuzzi tub overlooked an opening in the wall into the sleeping area. We had a mid week clean up which wasn't really up to par, but we didn't care too much at that point. The pool: Very quiet and serene. We never had a problem finding a lounge chair. The pool at the south property was more crowded and a little larger, but we liked how quiet the north pool was. There is a separate adult pool that was not ready when we were there. The beach: Ka'anapali beach is just beautiful. Although, if you have been to Mexico, Virgin islands etc, you will be disappointed to know that there aren't loungers on the beach. This is the case in all of the islands. You can get loungers on the beach, but it will cost you $30-$40 per couple, per day. The snorkeling off the beach was great. We saw lots of turtles and tons of fish. Black rock was good for snorkeling too, but it was quite a hike on foot. Overall, service at the hotel was great. The staff was helpful and the concierge was great. We did get some pressure to do the timeshare presentation, but mostly in the form of voice mail in our room. I think this is a great hotel for families. It would not have been our first choice for a romantic honeymoon spot, but it was free and we ended up loving it. If we were paying ourselves, I would not have chosen this hotel. But, for a free week in Maui,,,we loved it! Some of our favorite things to do: The Feast at Lele, The road to Hana, Mama's fish house, Sunz restaurant at the Hyatt. Aloha and Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: kvbanga
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui this week. It was our first time and we loved Maui in general and this hotel in particular. It was very luxurious and peaceful even though the hotel was full. The location was unbeatable. The suite was very comfortable. There was a kitchenette and a jacuzzi bath tub. The view was really beautiful. It was an island view not an Ocean view but it was beautiful. We had a view of the pool and the restaurant and the Molokai lawns. When we checked in the check in experience was so efficient and fast. We loved the smell in the lobby too :-). We would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “All good !!”
Reviews.Author: Barry0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the North property for a week beginning Dec 14, 2007. The North and South property are really the same resort with separate pool areas. The North property is complete now - nice pools but a little quiet for us so we ended up going to the pools at the south side. Overall we were extremely happy with our stay. We got this week for $2100 on craigslist - and got an ocean front room upgrade - called a couple of weeks in advance to request. We are a family of 5 and we fit into the 1 bedroom condo with no problem (free rollaway bed) - nice full kitchen, 2 flat screen tvs, dvd player etc. Great balcony - we were in 5308. Washer dryer was great too with small kids. The location is good although on the northside of black rock (about 10 mins walk on the beach) so away from the main kaanapali strip. the shuttle is great for whalers village etc - seems like every 10 mins or so. Snorkeling offf the beach was MUCH better that an black rock which was crowded with very few fish One surprising aspect was the new restaurant at the north property - we had dinner there the last night because we were too tired to go out - it was fabulous - not what we expected from a resort restaurant - great pasta and fish - about $120 for 2 including a nice bottle of pinot - great ambience

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with a few minor tweaks”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvisorAddict
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the newly constucted North property. The final phase is still under construction but virtually no noise as they are finalizing the interiors there. We did not rent a car since we planned to spend most of the time on the beach or in the pool. Definitely would rent a car if looking to go to dinner in neighboring towns, see the island, or enjoy any activities. The North buildings are very well constructed, little noise even though we were above the Kiddie Pool. Requested Ocean View room and even though we were in the main building, they felt the "slice" of Ocean we could see past the main pool qualified as an Ocean View. Nonetheless, we were in Hawaii and who spends much time in the room :) the heavenly bed and comfy suite were very nice but not as elegant as some Starwoods we've visited. The restaurant food and service, both inside and pool side were nothing special but there are many great places to eat if you take the shuttle bus to Whalers Village and the $1.00 town bus to nearby Lanai. Dave Scott's Lanai Grill is fabulous, and we had wonderful meals at Longhi's. The week before our arrival heavy rains backed up the Treatment plant, so ocean bans in place and the beach was not available. Surpised it took the Westin three days to start the clean up of downed trees and debris. Pool side service was ok, but just one person for more than 100 guests at any given time. We would go back, but this does not compare to the Westin St. John or the Bahamas Atlantis. To be fair, the North property has only been open 3 months, so I think given time they may work some of the kinks out. Just remember, you are in Paradise so any minor inconveniences, really who cares! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “2nd year to maui”
Reviews.Author: lovinsj
Reviews.Content: Bought a week on ebay from a timeshare owner.. Wow, this hotel was wonderful. The room itself made it hard to leave! We had a view of the beach area that we were married on the year before.. Overall, the stay was great. The pool area was amazing but you had to go down early to reserve a decent spot. Service was good, as well as the lounge chairs were very comfy. The clientele at this hotel is on the uppity side, didn't bother us but we noticed it. The beach in front and around the hotel was very nice. We left this hotel for our first week and moved to the Ka'Anpali beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rob6732
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a good rate through a friend's connection, and we absolutely loved it! We were upgraded from a studio to a 1 bedroom, and the suite was fantastic! It was brand new (we were in the North Part, which is now almost completely finished). Although the view was so-so (small view of the ocean, but more a view of the garbage cans), we were delighted by the suite itself. It had a king bed, very comfy, huge bathroom, very clean and modern, huge jacuzzi tub, great shower, etc. It had a full kitchen, and a comfy living room. I agree with the other reviewers that the restaurant food was bad (very so-so at a very high price). It has been our experience all over Hawaii that you have to leave the hotel grounds to get a good dining experience. But because we had a full kitchen, we simply bought some groceries and had breakfast and some lunches in our suite. Great location. They also have free wireless internet, which I am using now. All in all, we just loved it, mainly because the suite itself was so new, clean, modern and nice. Perhaps I would be more critical if we had to pay full rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Original Ka'anapali Ocean Resort vs. the new Ka'anapali Ocean Resort NORTH”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Having just visited the new WKOR North property (and having stayed at both properties), I thought it might help to clarify some of the differences and similarities between it and the Original WKOR. The North property has only been opened for around 4 months and is about 70% complete. I'm not sure if some of the observations I will list are things that will be attended to within time. Most of the loud/external construction is finished while they complete the interiors of the farthest-most north wing and the last adult pool. The staff is attentive and helpful. Upon entering, the lobby is less grand and simpler that the Original KOR. It has a similar open style but something about it seems less dramatic (less flowers perhaps?). The whole layout of the wings are closer together which gives a more intimate, close-in impression as you walk the grounds.The landscaping is very pretty but cannot yet compare to the more mature growth of the older property. The main pool is smaller but meanders so there are more unique areas to sit. There are also more pools with the inclusion of a very sweet Pirate Ship pool for the very young that looks like fun. The Original property is more spread out and has a larger pool with a slide. Therefore, there is much more energy around that property in general. The halls are also less appealing. I venture to say, downright ugly. They are all open-air which prompted them to install plasticated, mold-proof flooring and the most basic of ornamentation There are even places where there are no baseboards which leads to a very unfinished look. There will be more Ocean Front rooms although some that are listed as ocean front, you must actually look over the top of the pool restaurant. There are no screens on the glass sliding doors and although insects in the area are few, we were forced to close our door at night to prevent mosquitoes. This is a shame since we love the sound of the breaking waves while we sleep. We did not see the Ocean view category of room but the Island View suites would be much more desirable on the North side. There are no units looking a parking lot as with the Original building. The units themselves are very, very similar. Layout and caliber of appointments are virtually identical except the square footage of the rooms in the new property is considerably smaller. They've chosen to decrease the size of the living and bedrooms while the massive bathrooms remain the same. The walls are thick and we did not hear another person within the unit the whole week. Even though Westin is a non-smoking property, they do allow it on the lanai's so unfortunately, you can have someone smoking around you and the smell will waft in through an open door. The trademark Westin bed and shower/bath are awesome! They even changed to a frosted shower door on the 1 bedroom side. this is great if you have multiple people in the unit that sleeps 4, the person in the shower can have privacy if others want to use the room. They have replaced the rectangular dining table with a round one that only sits 4. I'm not sure of the philosophy of this decision and I don't think it was an improvement especially if you are using the 2 bedroom option with more than 4 guests. The restaurants, although open, are not at their full capacity. We were told that both properties are being currently being served from the same small kitchen in the original building. The rumor was that the only thing worth eating at the beach restaurant are the burgers since they are cooked on-site. Our choices (not burgers) confirmed this impression and were not very good. The other main restaurant is currently be run as a buffet. It was often empty since there are kitchens in the hotel's rooms. We were told that they will at some point convert this to a first class destination restaurant. The beach is inviting and the surf is approachable. The surf had a a nice balance between not being too calm or too rough. There is a very nice snorkeling reef not far from shore. They rent individual chaise chairs with shade cloths on the beach. Around the pool, they have both cabanas and double chaise with shade overhangs for rent and "palapa" style umbrellas scattered around for shade for free. We visited on a non-school holiday so most of the guests either had very small children or none at all so it was much quieter. This could also change when the hotel is at full capacity. It was our observation that the North property is better for adults and very young children whereas the Original has more going on for school-age and older families. They are both beautiful properties worth the visit for true Hawaiian relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Best place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Shea80
Reviews.Content: This is such a beautiful resort!! We booked an island-view studio condo and were upgraded upon check-in to a partial ocean-view. We stayed in KOR South (the older section, but in our opinion the best). The room had a small kitchenette (coffee maker, convection micro-wave oven, toaster, and full-size refrigerator). The kitchen was stocked with all the kitchen essentials (wine glasses, cups, dishes, ect). There was a washer and dryer, which was great for the long vacation. The heavenly bed was truly heavenly. Also, the bathroom was HUGE with a whirlpool tub and heavenly shower. The only down-side of the room was the balcony, all studio condos only have a "step-out" balcony...there is not room to actually sit on the balcony. The condo was great for a couple, but I would recommend spending the extra money to get the one-bedroom and the full balcony (all rooms with the exception of studios have full balconies. The beach is fantastic! The best area of Kaanapali. We snorkeled right in front of the resort and saw sea turtles and all sorts of fish. The beach is long and great for walking. The water ocean was calm and great for swimming. The sunsets are amazing! The resort had several pools. There is a separate pool for children with a pirate ship. There was also other areas for the kids. This seemed like a great resort for families. My husband and I did not have kids and never felt overwhelmed by too many kids at the resort. Almost every night there was live singing and dancing (including fire dancing and hula). We had a great time in Maui and will be returning to the Westin KOR. Great places to eat in Maui: Okazuya Deli (take-out food from the former chef of Mama's Fish House...5 min from Westin KOR, by Star Market). Hula Grill is fun with live singing. Sensei's in Kihei or Kapalua is great and has a "reverse happy hour".

Reviews.Title: “What Lanai!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoPat
Reviews.Content: I've attached two pictures of lanais at the Westin. The large one with chairs is what we had in our one bedroom (they upgraded us!). The miniscule, 12' "lanai" is what appeared to be in the studio's. Our room was great, the hotel was good. The 1 bedroom was very good sized, great bed, furniture needed some cleaning. We ended up with a great view of the prettiest pool/grounds as well as a great ocean view. Could have turned out badly because some other towers had only a kiddie pool with a pirate ship or no eating places in the immediate complex. We ended up in room 2319 which was absolutely perfect. Also there was a great little reef directly in front of our complex with lots of colorful fish about 10 feet from the beach (great snorkeling). The beach was clean, pretty, and uncrowded. We even saw a green sea turtle who lives around there. Food was terrible and super expensive. You'd be wise to good into Lahaina via free shuttle. Hawaii airlines worked out great - good staff, food, fresh pillows and blankets both directions. No problems

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hawaiian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LLW07
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely beautiful! It was the perfect place to spend a week for our honeymoon. The rooms are very well decorated, clean and comfortable. We were in a one-bedroom ocean view (building #3) with views of the ocean, pool and gardens. The staff was very friendly and helpful. September must be a nice time to visit because the resort did not seem overly crowded. There was a nice flow of people, including families with children, honeymooners and other couples. The weather was great. We loved the pool and lounge chairs. One bummer was that you had to rent chairs on the beach as well as snorkel gear. There was plenty of parking. The area surrounding the resort was very nice, and only a short drive to restaurants and shopping. If you don't have a rental car, the hotel also has a shuttle service. The food at the Ocean Pool Bar and Grill was good, especially for a lazy morning at the resort or a casual lunch after being on the beach. Our room was cleaned every day. The bed was comfortable and there is a cool whirlpool bathtub in the bathroom as well as a shower with double shower heads (my husband's favorite). I would recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Maui. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: TKSF
Reviews.Content: The Westin Resort on Kaanapali Beach was amazing. The rooms are pretty standard for a Westin...pretty trendy and a great bed. We had a run of ocean room which had an amazing view of the ocean from the balcony. The pool is fantastic. There are three separate pools connected together by waterslides. There are plenty of drinks and food to be had out there. The beach is then about 2 feet from the pool area and there is hardly anyone on it! Great views of Lanai and Molokai. The town of Lahaina is about 5 miles down the street and has plenty of good restaurants and stores. The food at the Westin is good just expensive. The service is great. Use the parking that is included with the resort fee...it's right next to valet and no reason to shell out another $10 or $15 a day. Definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Kaanapali Beach...

Reviews.Title: “When at Ka'anapolai - Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Suzyd1964
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure we were treated with a friendly smile and helpful suggestions. We had a large ocean view room - although it could have used a little updating. Food was good on property. Pool, grounds, and all facilities were clean and pleasant. The Concierge desk is helpful - although the wait could at times be long. We felt right at home. Plenty to do for our 17 year old. A good time.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: melisacnp
Reviews.Content: A Great resort right on the beach! You can expect the quality beds, linen and service you get at the chain! The check in staff upgraded us to a 1 bedroom, they had a crib ready with lines! I was impressed! THe down side is the food here isn't good! It is a little drive into town for dining and shopping, they do run a shuttle but the times may not be convient. A car is a MUST! The rooms offer a kitchen as well as washer and dryer which is a real plus with kids...easy to pack light! The pool area is beautiful, chairs can be a tough find if it is busy! Overall a great spot for a perfect MAUI vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: presch52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Westin Villas as a part of our wedding/honeymoon. The resort was very nice and a lot of the summer traffic had left when we stayed here (8/26-9/2/07). We stayed in Building 5, which is the north complex, and I must say it was awsome. The staff was very friendly and they really take care of you and make sure you are having a nice time. The room was beautiful. We had a jacuzzi tub, that the wife absolutely loved, and a small kitchen area that we used to cook several meals. The bed was awsome (Heavenly bed) and the room was very well maintained and cared for. We overlooked the small kid's pool with the pirate ship and you could not hear the kids playing with the door shut. It was very quiet and comfortable inside. Overall, the trip was comfortable and nice and we really enjoyed are stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Dana_SF
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds are exceptional, and staff are extremely helpful and eager to please. All the lounge chairs I saw by the pool had nice cushions on them, so I'm not sure where that comment from another reviewer came from. Very family-friendly pool, but there is also an upper pool with jaccuzzi and bar that is for adults only. The beach is fantastic: clean, with a nice wide swath of sand for sunning, and the water has a soft clean sandy bottom with no rocks or coral out at least 20 ft from shore. Compared to the Hyatt (3 hotels down the beach), the Westin is not quite as upscale, but the Westin's beach is far better (the Hyatt's beach is almost nonexistent, and rocks come right up to the shoreline). Overall, we had a great stay here, and I would highly recommend it to anyone. Tip: there's a great shopping center about a mile before you get to Kaanapali, with a Longs drug, Safeway grocery, and ABC general store (lots of inexpensive clothing, souvenirs, etc). Stop here and buy boogie boards, beach chairs and umbrellas, snacks/drinks etc. The cost of the equipment is less than a 1 day rental at the hotel's beach shack, and you can save substantial $ on the food (sunscreen is also plentiful at mainland prices, so don't worry about packing a ton of the stuff).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Killpards
Reviews.Content: This resort can only be described as outstanding.We travelled all the way from the UK and all i can say is it was worth every hour spent getting there. The staff and managment were excellent and made are stay as comfortable as can be. As for the resort well i can not fault its location or presentation.The rooms were a great size with huge bathrooms.The pool was an excellent size to with a great slide for children. This resort is a must stay. 10 out of 10. Darin and Emma

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Maui stay”
Reviews.Author: aloha25
Reviews.Content: Our stay on Maui at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas was wonderful! Two bedroom, two bath villa - spacious, clean, great views, beautiful lanai, well appointed. Snorkel right off the beach on the reef there. Pool is lovely, beach is great. This is a time share but you can also rent them from different sources. Our teenage kids loved it, so did we. This was our 3rd stay there and each time we love it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: perrineh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids, ages 6 and 8 in Aug. 2007. We had a studio with kitchenette. Our room was on the first floor and in close walking distance to the pool. It was very quiet, and I rarely heard any noise from outside or upstairs when we were in the room. This was despite the hotel being fairly busy. It was definitely a big plus how close we were to the beach. It was nice to just take a short stroll down to the water, and be able to play, swim, and snorkel there. The water was nice and fairly calm. Our kids were able to run in and splash without too much worry. Plan to catch the sunset from the beach. You get the best view right there from the hotel's beach access. The pools were also really nice at the hotel. They have 3 different pool areas. The one on the north side has kind of like a lagoon/river sort of arrangement, which is very nice. This pool was always less crowded than the main pool on the south side of the resort. This main pool had the big slide by the waterfall, so obviously it would be the most crowded pool. Then there is a smaller pool area for those with toddlers. It has a big pirate ship that shoots out water and has small slides for little ones. Kids eat free with each adult meal at the hotel's bar and grill, but we were disappointed with the food. It really tasted like it was just reheated frozen food, rather than fresh-made-to-order. We preferred to take the complimentary shuttle into Lahaina and try the restaurants there. One place we enjoyed and found to be reasonably priced was the Aloha Mixed Plate restaurant behind the Cannery Mall. You should definitely make a stop there at least once to have some local food. We also went to the Hula Grill at the Whaler's Village, which had really good burgers. I also highly recommend taking advantage of the complimentary shuttles into the different parts of Lahaina. No need to stress on driving and parking! Overall, we had a great stay, and would recommend the Westin Ocean Resort Villas. I am giving 4 stars only because we were disappointed with the dining options at the hotel. Too expensive for sub par food. However, the hotel is extremely clean, well-kept, and the staff is friendly and very helpful. Enjoy and aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you want or would expect for 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: YounginMaui
Reviews.Content: We decided we wanted to take a weeks vacation in Maui at the Westin Resort and Villas.. Upon our arrival the smell of the lobby certainly gave the Maui ocean feel... The valet was quite nice and assisted us with our bags.. Upon checking in the girl behind the front desk said she had a BEAUTIFUL room for us with ocean view and high upgraded... The first thing I noticed when I we were walking to the room was the amount of running wild children. No parents in site.. Running up and down the halls in soaked swim trunks making the hallway have a watered down stench.. The room was attached to another villa which shared a public door although it was locked... From there I noticed that the maid service only occurs once a week.. Our bathroom in our room looked as if it was made in the 1970's.. Our water pressure was terrible and the so called jacuzzi still had sand stains on it from the previous occupants... I was quite annoyed... The next morning I wake up to the pounding sounds of children screaming and crying throughout the hall... I look outside our so-called ocean view room only too see the large pool full of children running wild.. The first thing that came to my mind was there has to be pee all over in that water... My girlfriend and I wanted to catch some rays so we attempted to find a space with ample sun.. This was near impossible... The few cabannas they had were rented for 2 weeks out! So it was up to us to find a spot to lay around all these running and screaming children... We finally find a space where we had to literally lay down right next to someone else.. It was like flying coach on airplane.. We crawled into our spaces over a child who was swining a towel at another child while screaming about it... I thought Maui was suppose to be about relaxing.. I finally just am fed up with it... I would rather spend time in my private room then be around these children.. The next day we found that there was an area just being finished called the "North" side which seemed to be quite fresh and new... No children around... Just adults eating their breakfast... From there I new we needed to switch rooms... I asked the front desk if it would be possible to switch.. Nicely enough they switched us! :-) I thought it was only uphill from here... Until the next day... I went for a workout in the Westin's gym.. Just a quick note on that... The YMCA in Scottsdale looks better than this! After finishing my workout I went back to the room.. As I approached the door my key card didn't work... I was somewhat upset because we had just received our keys the day before and this was suppose to be a totally new room.. Just finished July 27th I was told... I walked to the front desk in the "North" property which has a much nicer lobby than the South... The girl named Jessica behind the front desk greeted me... I told her my room number and that my key wasn't working... She gave me a new key and I was on my way... ALTHOUGH!! She didn't even ask my name!! Anyone could have said my room number and she would have given them a key!! This was quite alarming.. Not what you would expect for a 5 star property... Upon returning to the room I get to the door and the key doesn't work again!!! Now I was upset.. Instead of walking back down again... I called the front desk and "Jessica" whom I spoke with before answered the phone... I told her this key wasnt working either... (Not to mention this whole time I am on crutches with a broken ankle). She asked me to hold... I waited 15 minutes on hold!!! I was very upset at this point...I walked/crutched back down to the front desk with my cell to my ear still waiting on hold... I get to the front desk and she is just standing there doing NOTHING!! All the while I am still on hold...I demanded to speak with a manager.. She came out very friendly and asked Jessica again to give me a new key... Also she asked security to walk with me back to the room so this wouldn't happen again... The security guard indicated to me that the flashing yellow light indicated the key was expired... This was only after one day!!! We walk back to the room and finally I get it... I was VERY upset... We are regular Maui vacationers.. Typically twice a year... We have stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea (which is the REAL 5 star property although you'll pay $6000 for a week easily!).. The Ritz Carlton right up the road in Kapaula is another regular place we stay... Currently they are under renovations which made it not possible for us to stay there this time... So we tried the Westin.. I thought since it was just finished not even a month ago everything would be crisp, clean, and ready for use... How wrong I ever was... Stay away from this property unless your bringing the entire brady bunch with you!! Your's Truly, Maui all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Still Loved Staying Here the 2nd Time”
Reviews.Author: Ca_natives
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the Villas from July 22 to July 29, and what a wonderful time we had, again! The resort was beautiful, the staff kind & gracious. Our one bedroom was roomy and comfortable for my husband, my daughter & I. The view of the beach from our room & the deck was wonderful! We took walks on the beautiful beach in the morning & snorkled in the marine preserve in front of the Villas. We often lunched at the Hula Grill or Leilani's (both fun & delicious with great serving staff), or Kimo's, Lahaina Fish Company (great, again), or Hard Rock Cafe (fun) and grilled fresh fish (great fish market close by with many varieties of fresh fish you don't often find in CA) or steak or chicken kabobs (you can buy them at the Villa market) at the barbecues in front of the beach at night. The other owners we met were all so friendly & nice. Our second week we stayed at the Sheraton with an ocean view for a few nights & then the Westin (both great) & then ate our lunch & dinners out at restaurants in the Whalers, in Lahaina, or Mama's Fish House (about 45 minutes away, pricey but worth it). We are already planning our trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, but no microwaves”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravel07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 4 nights during the second half of my honeymoon. Overall the experience was great and the hotel was good (I used Starwood points so for the price - just the resort parking fee - it was excellent!). Only real complaint I have is that there are no microwaves in the hotel rooms... really weird considering your standard motel usually has that. The Adult Only swimming pool is definitely a plus. My husband and I would always end up there...even with 4 others to choose from. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. The rooms are clean and welcoming and the bed is incredibly comfortable. Tip: The breakfasts are pretty expensive...we bought a cinnamon roll and a small cup of coffee one morning and it was $10. Take a less than 5 minute walk next door to the outdoor shopping area or if you have a car, drive 5 minutes away to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Maui = Beautiful Resort = Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sundevil25
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time to Maui and to the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas. What a wondeful resort!!! The resort itself has everything you need and is gorgeous. The Staff: Absolutely wonderful and always helpful. We were greeted by Akamu as we pulled up to the resort and throughout our stay was always smiling and making you feel at home. The rest of the staff was great also. It does get crazy on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays though due to a high level of check-ins/outs. So, be patient with the Bell Service staff. The Rooms: We stayed in a one-bedroom. For a family of 5, there was plenty of room (and we even had a roll-away bed in the room). Having a full-kitchen in the room was a great help in keeping our vacation costs down. And after realizing how much it costs to take the family out to eat, it was a blessing in disguise. Because this a timeshare-resort, room service is weekly. You can pay extra if you want room service to clean-up your room regularly. We had a partial ocean view room. The room had a great balcony to soak in the morning and view the beautiful Maui sunset. Location: The beach by the resort is a great place for snorkling!!! There was no need to take the family anywhere else. We did snorkel at other beaches, but the beach at the resort topped them all. Boogie boarding/body surfing is not good though, but there are plenty of local beaches to the north of the resort (Fleming's) that will satisfy your hunger for boogie boarding/body surfing. The resort beach is also a great place for the little ones. There is plenty of room for them to play in the water and the sand without a lot of waves. You can rent lounge chairs from the resort for an all-day fee, but I recommend you reserve these in advance. They get picked-up quickly. Poolside: There is a slide for the kids. It's kind of slow for the older kids, but perfect for young cjildren. I would rather hang out at the beach, but a lot of the guests prefer hanging out at the pool. (I don't get this?!!?) Lounge chairs are at a premium, so you need to claim them early in the morning. Good luck in trying to find a spot during the day. Shuttle Service: The Westin provides a great shuttle service to Lahaina and to the Whaler's Village area. The shuttle runs until 10:00 p.m. every evening. We found this very convenient for our family to get around. Timeshare presentation: Be aware that you may get swept into a timeshare presentation. But, let me tell you, the Westin Resorts are a great deal if you own at one of their properties, especially at this resort. They are building another bigger and better resort next door. How it can be better is beyond me? I can't wait to check it out. Resort Services: The resort has a poolside restaurant/bar and the food is always good! The breakfast buffet is fantastic and kids are free with an adult purchase. They do serve drinks/food poolside and the servers come to you (at your lounge chair). The resort also offers plenty of activities for adults and children. Our kids enjoyed feeding the Koi Fish and learning to make Lei's. There is a decent workout room and game room also. Also, each building has a concierge station to help you plan your stay in Maui. The resort also offers concierge services in the main lobby. We'll be back next summer!!! We can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: crandles60
Reviews.Content: First, the bad news. Unfortunately, we had a similar experience as SherilovesMaui did. We received an offer in the mail - 5 nights, rental car and $100 in resort credits for $599 if we would sit through a timeshare presentation. Great deal, right? Well, not so great. We too booked almost a year in advance and specifically requested a room NOT overlooking the construction of the additional units. Of course, that is exactly what we ended up with when we arrived. We were told we couldn't change rooms because they were booked. No apologies. When I asked what time construction started in the morning, they told me by 7:00 a.m. So, we were unable to leave the sliding glass door open. Not to worry though because when you are in a studio, there is NO BALCONY. Just a sliding door to NOWHERE. The pool area, although pretty, was packed. The lounge chairs, if you could get one, were so close together and so uncomfortable (hard plastic) that we didn't venture out there for more than maybe 10 minutes. We were told however that if we wanted something more "cushy", we could pay $10 a day. The pool water was a bit cold for my liking. Not pleasant. Also, way too many kids. We're recent "empty nesters" so the condo life is not our cup of tea. Now the good. If you have a family traveling with you, this could work for you. You can cook in the room and BBQ on the grounds. (Not sure why you would want to do that on vacation but I suppose that's why Baskin and Robbins has 31 flavors!) We really liked the room. It was very nicely furnished and the "Heavenly Bed" can't be beat. It was also nice to have a full sized fridge and a washer and dryer. We came home withe a suitcase full of clean clothes for a change. The Westin offers a shuttle which goes to the other Starwood hotels, Whalers Village and downtown Lahaina. We found this extremely convenient, not having to deal with finding and paying for parking . All in all, we made the best of it and had a great vacation, however, the majority of our fun was not hanging out at this "resort"!

Reviews.Title: “No Wowie in Maui”
Reviews.Author: SherilovesMaui
Reviews.Content: Buyers Beware! We were sold on a 1 Bedroom Ocean View. However, if you call a view of the Public Parking Lot and Public Beach Park with traffic noise an ocean view 2 out of the 3 years we have stayed! Especialy when I booked our reservation 11 months in advance! Along with the first year there not being enough lounge chairs by the pool, so we had to sit on the grass. When we saw plenty of new lounge chairs stacked in the garage. You would think Westin would want to take care of their owners that have Purchased this as their home property. But as you can see, they don't care about them. From the Reception Desk to the Owners Services. Even the Concierge had a condesending response that they never hear complaints about the rooms. Obviously he has never seen this site. I am truly dissappointed in Westin. I have recently purchased a lesser timeshare and had much better service. I will be purchasing additional timeshare weeks, but you can guarrantee, it will NOT be at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas.

Reviews.Title: “loved the westin villas”
Reviews.Author: grace_cruz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui and contrary to some reviews, my family loved the Westin Kaanapali villas. We were booked for an island view but we actually got a partial ocean view room which was great!!! I have to agree that the pool temperature was a little cold at first but then you get used to it after awhile. (my 5 year old did!!!). Very family friendly hotel! Not the best hotel for people who are on honeymoon/singles/people with no kids. Great for families/people traveling in groups.

Reviews.Title: “Why 0 Why O Why O Did I Ever Leave Ohio”
Reviews.Author: Bajan_at_heart
Reviews.Content: This place really is pathetic. No views despite the ads. Rude and indifferent on site management. Crowds. Noise. Crowded pools with screaming kids who cannot stand the pool temperature. Why even try to "get away from it" and stay here. Might as well stay in Venice Beach California.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, would love to go again”
Reviews.Author: Kg002g
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend for a week in early September. We had a great time. The view from the lobby is spectacular. The pool and beach are great. The room was top quality and couldn't have been cleaner. I loved my stay and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Weston KOR”
Reviews.Author: RRamanathan
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old daughter and I stayed at the Westin during the second week in May. While we stayed in a Studio villa, we found it to be more than adequate in terms of space and ameneties. The kitchenette was nicely appointed and the bathroom was excellent. The pool on the property was really nice but a lot colder than the ocean. The beach was also very good and allowed for great snorkeling. While the water was marginally less clear than at the Black Rock, it still had all the fish and coral you could ask for. There is even a resident turtle that makes an appearance every morning for those patient enough to look. My only complaint about the hotel were that housekeeping was a little inconsistent in their time of arrival even though they did a good job when they got to the room. But overall we really enjoyed our stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation on Maui at the Westin Villas”
Reviews.Author: leannayoung
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from an 8 night stay at the Villas. We are not timeshare owners and opted not to do the presentation. We stayed in the studio which was large and plenty of space for the two of us. The only downside to the studios is that there is no lanai so you have to go down to the pool area or the tables downstairs to sit and have our coffee. The pool was better than I expected and the beach right outside the villas was great. The snorkeling right outside on the beach was amazing. The shuttle is another definate plus, we used it many times. We also took our snorkeling stuff to the Sheraton and snorkeled black rock where we saw many sea turtles and fish. Whalers village is a great place to shop or grab dinner. We recommend the rusty harpoon for happy hour and we really enjoyed the Hula grill, the seared ahi was amamzing. If you don't have kids I would recommend driving to Hana but rather than spending a lot of time in Hana continue North towards Ocheo Gulch. (I think that is how you spell it) Take the 2 mile hike to the waterfall and hike through a bamboo forest. I have heard the zipline tour is great but it books up fast (like 2 months in advance) so we were unable to do it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, but on a lesser stretch of Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: D1andonlyDman
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood Villa timeshare owner in another area (Scottsdale), this is basically the Maui option for me to trade my stay. Certainly, February is the best time to go to Maui, as the Maui Channel is basically teaming with Humpback Whales. So much so that they could often be seen from the beach itself - but this is true ANYWHERE from Lahaina to Kapalua during this time of year. The portion of Kaanapali beach that fronts this property is probably the weakest aspect of this place, as it is rather narrow and in some places a bit sparse of sand. The section of Kaanapali somewhat further south, between the Sheraton and the Hyatt, is generally wider and has more and softer sand. But other than that, this is a beautiful place. The pools are quite beautiful and large, but right now, they tend to be quite crowded, as this resort is not fully built out yet. When it's done, there will be twice as many rooms, but 3 times as much pool. The rooms are quite plush and spacious. I tend to book a 1 bedroom studio, which is the smallest option, but for one person or a couple, it's HUGE, and the size of a typical small hotel suite, with a full kitchenette, spacious bath with separate shower and jacuzzi tub, and separate living/dining area. A two bedroom villa would be perfect for a family with kids. The hotel has a nice fitness center and game room as well. The dining options are basically typical poolside restaurants, but I generally ate either in my room using the kitchen (breakfasts), or at the nicer dining options in Lahaina or Kahana/Napili. There is an activities/concierge desk that can book your restaurant reservations and day trips, but don't expect any deals compared with those same tours offerred at the various tourism booths in town. They run a convenient shuttle to Lahaina town and to the Sheraton and Westin Hotels further south on Kaanapali, but since I had a car, I tended to drive these trips since they were short hops.

Reviews.Title: “Good locations and rooms”
Reviews.Author: azroadrunner
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful trip to this timeshare resort. Checkin went smoothly after our 5 hour flight. Rooms are nice with great beds, washer dryer, and free internet access in room. We saw the new building whcih is almost ready. No problems at all with noise as we sat on the patio and saw them doing final steps on cute pirate theme pool. We ate some in the room, went out, and enjoyed the restaurant. Our server was very friendly and attentive. We liked the fresh fish and the lobster/steak dinner. We also had the buffet breakfast one day - good food and relaxing way to start the day. The shop has good food things and nice souvenirs for all those family and friends back home. Very family oriented resort with parents, grandparents and kids. There are probably more kids there when school is out but it was not overly crowded on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overpay for the Ocean Villas”
Reviews.Author: jps08
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice property, but only stay here if you get a good deal. It is a little over priced for what you pay here. We had some problems with getting service when our appliances were not working properly. We also were mislead into taking in a presentation of the Starwood timeshare buy in by promises that it would take under an hour with no obligation. Be aware that these people are the equivalent of the used-car salesman of vacation ownership. They hold you hostage for 90 plus minutes (yes- we found out there is a time limit you have to stay) and they have a complete meltdown when you don't make a decision to hand over your life savings in that amount of time! I would recommend staying here as long as you don't let the pushy concierge desk talk you into the high pressure sales presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha greatness”
Reviews.Author: XYNYJAYDUB
Reviews.Content: Westin Villas have great service and very attentive concierge staff. The food servers are great too.The rooms were spacious and the heavenly beds were great. Food service ends way too early. I wish they had 24 hour room service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Westin!! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: leizy1
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare for this! We've been to Maui a few times, but this is only our 2nd time we traded & wanted to try this place out. Westin is about 45 - 55 min fm the airport and on the beach. Our bldg had underground parking. We arrived early so they let us check in since our rooms were ready. There was 5 of us & it was perfect. This is the nicest trade timeshare(hotel) we've been to. We booked a 2 bdrm (which was a 1 rm villa + a studio w/seperate entry doors). The villa is a mster bdrm w/ a full kitchen, dining rm & living rm. The studio was basically a hotel rm w/ a mini kitchen. Both rooms had King size beds (VERY NICE), whirlpool tubs, walk in showers, etc. (Their website will tell you what it comes with). The rooms were very nice. We were in bldg 2, 6th floor. We had a partial ocean view & of the new additions (they are adding another part of this hotel). Construction was ongoing & we did see the crane that everyone talked about, but we rarely stayed in our rms except for dinners & sleeping. It wasn't disturbing to us at all? If you can, try to get a pool view, it's beautiful. The conceirge (Deidre) was very helpful. We ordered take out (we have a 3 yr old) from the Ocean Pool Bar & Grill & brought it to our rms. The prices were moderately comparable to other restaurants on the island, but everything we ordered was wonderful and convenient. We had Penne w/shrimp $27.50, the Prime Rib $ 21.95 was really good. They do have daily dinner specials. We cooked breakfast in our hotel room most mornings. Stop at the Costco or Safeway before you check into the hotel. It's easier and saves you money. They do have a small market, but it's pricey. The pool was nice. Our son had a good time in the kiddie pool. He forgot to wear his rubber swim shoes one day & he kept slipping so remember to pack those water shoes. The pool had a waterslide, every kid seemed to enjoy. Cabana's were rented out & the lounge chairs were not that hard to get in to. Towels had to be re-checked in or you would of been charged. They also had pool stuff for sale where towels are checked in. The beach was windy, but you can't control the tradewinds. It has really good reefs for snorkeling & it's just a 3/4 of a mile walk to snorkel at Black Rock, which is easier for beginners. We did see some turtles in both places. They do have daily activities like lei making & keiki's hula show. They have shuttle service to Hilo Hatties, Lahaina Cannery Mall & the Whaler's Village. They have a business center to print out your e-tickets for your flight the next day. They have a nice work out room. We used it to weigh our luggage to make sure it wasn't over the limit. =) Now since we were timeshare traders, they only did a mid-week towel replacement and trash pick up. Which was fine with us. They did not replenish anything else. No worries. Overall, the hotel was very nice and exceeded our expectations. It's probably one of the nicest we've been to. We will return next year! We'll try to add pictures to this review in a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “"Windy Westin"”
Reviews.Author: mck2002
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the viilas May 11th 2007.Stayed 6 nights and overall it was nice. The 2 bed lockoff 6th floor oceanview was nice and roomy.My one huge complaint about this property was how windy it was...all day everyday! No one could enjoy laying out on the beach because of the sand storm. Big big disappointment. So we had to go to the other side of black rock to have the perfect beach weather. On the other hand the beach in front of the villas are perfect for snorkeling.Not to walk around on for the bottom is very very rocky...hense the great snorkeling. All in all it was just alittle above average. Next time we will stay at the kaanapali ali or waliea beach villas......only would return if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: curlz4
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 amazing days of our 2 week honeymoon at this incredible hotel, after checking out of the terrible Royal Lahaina! Everything was perfect at the Westin! From the linens in the room, to the in room washer & drier. You name it it was perfect! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a visit to Maui. The pictures on the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas are really what it looks like.. there are no exaggerations in the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0110
Reviews.Content: Awesome! The room was gorgeous and the furnishings were ideal! Our entire stay was above and beyond typical hotel stays. We travel all the time and this is a great place. Romantic bathtub and shower. Super beach and snorkeling experience and nice pool side service menu. We'll be back~

Reviews.Title: “So Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: skinners
Reviews.Content: The Westin Villas are wonderful!! We stayed in a one bedroom, ocean view room in building #3. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean. The kitchen has all of the essentials. The bathroom is fantastic. We are purchasing the double shower head because we loved it so much. The staff is friendly and not overpowering when they asked us to attend a timeshare presentation. The grounds are just so beautiful. The daily activities are a lot of fun. My husband loved that he won the Texas Holdem' poker game. We had such a wonderful time and wanted to let everyone know that this is a good place for kids and honeymooners too.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is the best!”
Reviews.Author: island22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was back in July 2006. We are owners at Westin Kierland in Scottsdale AZ and this was our first experience as Starwood owners and the Westin Villas did not disappoint! The resort is beautiful. The staff is very accomodating and the few times we dealt with the concierge staff we found them to be very professional and helpful as well. We stayed in a studio unit, which was more than enough room for myself and my husband. We were lucky enough to get a unit that had an acutal lanai/balcony vs one of the units with just a ledge or no acutal balcony you can go out on to enjoy the beautiful trade winds and ocean breezes. We didn't eat at the restaurant on the property so I can't comment on that. We chose to stock up on provisions at Safeway to cook at home most nights. Just a tip, when you are at Safeway, sign up at the service desk for a saver card and get discounts on any sale items the store is offering that week. It just takes a minute and you get your card right away. The stainless steel grills were spotless and well maintained although it was a bit disappoining not to be able to have an adult beverage while grilling out before dinner. But understand there is an ordinance that prohibits this. The pool area was nice but very crowded and we found it difficult to get a chair, much less one in the shade. The cabanas rent out quickly and I understand that you must make a reservation well in advance to secure one. The temp of the pool was a little chilly and the time frame we were there it was crowded with lots of children, but to be expected in summer months. The beach out front is a very nice and we heard the snorkeling was great although didn't get a chance to check it out. Tiki torches light the pathways at night and that was a great tropical touch. Little attention to detail is what really makes that resort. The general stor was very nice too, very well stocked, prices as you would expect for Hawaii and they had a nice deli/meat case with pre-marinated steaks, chicken etc ready for the grill. Prices weren't that bad. Note, if you want utensils for the grill get them at the general store and go early as they get checked out quickly. The studio was very comfortable with the signature heavenly bed that was just that, heavenly. The bathrooms are spacious for the size of this unit, with a jetted tub and a large shower also, double vanity etc. We spent at day driving upcountry and went to the Tedeschi Winery. Awesome drive and beautiful tranquil place. First time I ever experienced upcountry and the area around the winery and it was stunningly beautiful and peaceful. If you go, pace a picnic lunch to eat while at the winery and soak in the scenery or stop the the Ulapaulakua ranch store just across the street and sample an elk burger for lunch, excellent! The wine was great too, we picked out a mixed case to have it shipped home and are just finishing up the last of our wine just in time for our return trip to the Westin next month. WIll post another review upon our return. We took a sunset cruise on the Scotch Mist a 50 foot sailing yacht the last night of our trip, it was a thrill to experience an actual sailing yacht and the crew was great. I would recommend them highly, the night we went it was a small group, just myself and my husband and another couple so it was almost like a private cruise! They served champagne and chocolates and some interesting tales of sailing the waters in and around Maui. They also offer day snorkel cruises in addition to the sunset cruise. To sum it up, the Westin is wonderful, the experience is what you would expect from a Starwood property, top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A little Sterile”
Reviews.Author: AlohaTime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villas in March. There was a mixup with the reservation and we ended up in a small ground floor room facing the parking lot. It was noisy, especially when all the work trucks came through to the construction. The facilities are nice, but nothing more and less than many, of the other area resorts offer. Nearly everything has a charge associated with it, often excessively so. Park your own car, the valet will browbeat you on arrival to let them do it. The parking is easily accessed by all the rooms and works out to be closer than going to the valet usually. The snorkeling is a little murky due to the shorebreak most of the time but has a very nice variety of fish and coral. Getting in and out can be rough. Whales were frequently sighted off-shore and many turtles right off the beach. There is a nice little park right beside the resort. Great for picnics. The bed was so soft it was hard to sleep. We travel a great deal and usually can tolerate the various feels, this was just way too soft. The staff was pleasant, particularly in the restaurant. The store was well stocked with essentials for cooking. The barbeques were clean and have lights attached - which is a nice touch. The rooms and resort interiors seemed rather sterile. They are clean but are missing that "Aloha" feel. I would stay here again only if the price was really good. I think there are better, more enjoyable options all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare and Resort”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: We had a family/extended family vacation with our 4 & 7 year old kids, grandparents, and aunt. Our inlaws own some of the timeshares here so they treated to the rooms. First, the rooms were fantastic. With that said, we probably had one of the nicest rooms on the property so I don't know about the others (6th floor, 2 bedroom suite with full dining area, kitchen, etc). The room was fantastic. The grounds were nice but it was very difficulty to get a decent chair at the pool unless you go early. The beach was beautiful and not too crowded, but there weren't enough beach chairs to rent and they would run out early. The snorkling right off shore was great. The pool was very nice and the kids loved it. There is only one restaurant (by the pool) on the property and the food was pretty good. Would have liked to have other choices, but we had a car and traveled extensively to eat. Negatives included the lack of daily room cleaning (guess this is some time share thing that I don't understand), lack of more restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: lizbonne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Ocean Villas for 7 days with our family. What a beautiful resort. When you first walk into the lobby you can see the pool, then the ocean. It's all open and has a wonderful tropical smell. We stayed in a one bedroom. The Heavenly bed was comfortable and we loved the Heavenly bath, the two shower heads were great. It was convienent having the washer and dryer and kitchen. We cooked many meals in to help with the cost, after all it is Maui. We used the bbq's one night on the property, they were clean and we never had a problem getting one. One night we watched the sunset from their beach and saw turtles swimming in the water about 15 feet out. I would highly recommend the resort and our family can't wait until we can go back again. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Westin”
Reviews.Author: hookedonhawaii
Reviews.Content: One word would have to describe this place...WOW! The grounds are beautiful, the villa was VERY NICE, the heavenly bed was absolutely to die for...what can I say other than I am ready to go back. Had my 10 year old daughter with me, she loved the pool and waterslide. The only downside was that the surf comes in a little rough on the beach in front of the hotel--wouldn't feel safe letting my child in the water there but the hotel offers free shuttle service every 15 minutes to the Sheraton and to the Westin Maui which both have great pools and beaches that are safer for the kids to play in. The rooms are all equipped with full kitchens as well as washer/dryer which was very handy. The hotel has a great little store that sells not only gifts, but sandwiches, salads, some grocery items as well as marinated meats and fish that you can cook outside on the several very nice gas barbeque pits that are available for use by the beach. I was very impressed and am already planning a trip back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can”
Reviews.Author: WirelessTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from 3/10-17 and would easily rate this as a 4 star hotel. The 1 bedroom suite was plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 children (pull out bed was comfy for the kids and was queen sized). The bathrooms are great and the kids loved the jacuzzi tub. The room had a large deck that had side views of the ocean. The pool area is convenient and safe for the kids (ages 10 and 7), with a great water slide. The restaurant was also very convenient and the food was really good. I would recommend this resort to anyone going to Lahaina area of Maui and is easliy one of the top 2 in that area of the island. The staff at the resort are awesome, there are lots of people ready to help with horse back riding, cruises, snorkeling, hiking, kayaking, whale watching, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort in Aloha Land”
Reviews.Author: ABohemianGirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here 24 Feb. through Mar. 3rd. (She owns a timeshare here) We stayed on the 3rd floor (2315) 1 bedroom, and had a view of the pool area and the ocean. As stated by others, the kitchen had adequate amenities, the bath had a huge Jacuzzi tub and walk-in shower, and the bed was perfect. I wanted to sleep with all the windows and sliding door open, but my sister couldnâ€™t sleep with the waterfall noise and palm trees blowing. So we called Housekeeping the next morning and ordered a rollaway bed (I couldnâ€™t do the couch bed) the rollaway was wonderful! Thick mattress, with nice sheets and blanket. Every morning we were able to just lift the bed on end and roll it near a corner, no problem. It would be nice if there were room on the balcony for a table with the chairs.
