(We improvised and took the luggage rack and placed the wooden service tray on it and used it as a table:) Someone mentioned the foliage was rather sparse. There were gardeners with flats of plants out most of the time we were there. The mangroves on the ocean side do look icky, but arenâ€™t they protected? Even though we had coffee available to brew in our room, I would go down in the morning a get a large coffee in the little market and my sister and I would take off on an ocean walk south. You kinda need to do a joggle around the Sheraton, but we picked the path up and continued to the Hyatt, which is the end of the road. We stopped and had the buffet breakfast at Swan Court and walked back to our place to continue our day. In the evening, we took a beach walk north and checked out the construction next door. (My sister has a week in the new building also) What will be great about the new buildings is they are in a V shape, so the ocean views will be much nicer. I believe one of the buildings will be open in July and the other in November. It looks like a kiddie pool is in the works with a little pirate ship at one end. I think the pool area and foliage will be very nice. The Concierge took care of all our restaurant and spa reservations. The business center offered free Internet and we made car reservations for Kauai and checked emails. No one was ever in there except for us. Housekeeping completely changed all our bedding and towels, trash and cleaned up mid-week. The little market has drinks, a bakery, fresh meats you can grill, sandwiches and a little bit of everything from souvenirs to drug store items. Every day out on the lanai, there would be several local artistâ€™s selling their wares. We did not experience a lack of chairs available at the pool, but there is in fact a problem with people leaving towels on chairs and not returning for hours, sometimes all day. You need to sign for towels with your name and room number. I did not care for this. We got a call later that afternoon that someone used our room number and name similar to ours at the pool bar. I thought maybe someone saw our little pool towel slips and tried to forge? Donâ€™t know. We had smoothies at the pool, which were ok, but did not contain fresh fruit as was touted. The coconut shrimp was good and the Lava Flow drinks were darn good! Some restaurant reviews: Mala Ocean Tavern in Lahaina. On the water with tiki torches and the sunset, awesome. They serve a guacamole type dip that is actually made with edamime. We had a lovely white wine similar to Pinot Grigio. Very laid back and full of locals. Hula Grill was ok. My Mahi was a bit dry, but the sunset and wine made up for it. David Paulâ€™s Lahaina Grill: Out of this world. Expect to pay about $200 for two with wine. Elegant but didnâ€™t feel stuffy. Splurge and have dinner at this establishment. Pineapple Grill at Kapalua: Took my sister here for her birthday. They have a nice wine list. The fish was jumping off the plate fresh. Not a great view (Tennis court and golf course) but it was evening and the atmosphere inside was pleasant. Plantation House, Kapalua: We had a nice lunch here. Fresh Mahi over salad with a silky tasting dressing. The restaurant sits up on a hill and the view was a lovely, plush golf course and you could see right to the ocean. A little annoying was birds flew in the open air windows (cardinals) and perched on chairs. If you werenâ€™t in motion, they would take it as an invitation to come snack on whatever was on your table. A fun place to eat up in Paâ€™ia is the Paia Fish Market. Just a little place on the corner with a menu board above. It is popular now, so donâ€™t expect to pay 8 bucks for the Mahi plate anymore. Mamaâ€™s Fish House was renovated from last year. The old entrance is blocked and has a new dining area there. Still a winner and beautiful beach cove area.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: travel-world-mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan 29 to Feb 3 at the Villa at the invitation of Starwood--they were trying to convince us to purchase a property. One would think that they would try to impress the potential buyers, but no. The management just cannot get their act together. The room is small, and the kitchen is, well, an insult to the word "kitchen". The bed is comfortable as a typical Westin bed, but i cannot find any other positive things that make it worth the $500 a night price tag. Honestly, the rooms are so worn (I had to exchange 3 times to find a functional room!) that it is no better than the old Westin hotel in, say, Los Angeles airport, with a lesser service. I have been in Maui 4 times and 3 times each to Kaui and Hawaii. This has to be the most disappointing trip. I would not want to stay there again, and I would consider myself insane to want to buy a share near there!

Reviews.Title: “Our third wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kblb
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners, and this was our 3rd visit. We have the opportunity to exchange our time here for other hotels/resorts, but so far, we haven't seen all that Maui offers. We really enjoy the staff - from the bellmen at check in, the bartenders at the pool bar, the waiters, housekeeping, concierge. All are first class - really interested in making your stay wonderful and memorable. As owners, we bought an ocean view so we have never stayed in a unit overlooking the construction site. This should not be a problem in the future as construction should be completed later this year. Then the resort will have an upscale restaurant and spa. (Note: No matter what unit you stay in, you'll get to use the pool and amenities (Spa, restaurant) at the site under construction now.) Rooms are large and well appointed. Kitchens are completely outfitted. Heavenly beds are...well, heavenly! The rooms are very soundproof, so we didn't hear noise from other units. The bathrooms are quite large (amazingly so in the 1 bedroom unit, and still very good size in the studio). We thought the drinks were a little high at the pool & bar, but the food was a good value and well prepared. Servings are large (their club sandwich could easily serve three people). Take advantage of the pool work-out or the yoga/pilates class. Very well done! There were some places in our 1 bedroom that weren't quite up to the cleaning standards we expect so we called housekeeping when we checked in on Sunday. Within 1 hour, the housekeeping supervisor was in our room, removing spots on walls, and wiping down woodwork and doors. We enjoyed Pacific Whale Foundation whale watching, the Trilogy cruise to Lanai (great whale and dolphin watching, snorkeling, and a wonderful tour of the Island along with a great lunch.) Our favorite restaurants are Kimo's in Lahaina (Macadamia Nut Crusted Ono) and the Pioneer Inn for breakfasts. In Whaler's Village, Hula Grill, Leilani's for drinks and appetizers. In Napilli Shores, the Gazebo for a wonderful breakfast (long wait so be prepared...it's a small place with only 12 or so tables, but the view while waiting is wonderful with Molokai and Lanai and the whales to watch.)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, I can't wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_ann
Reviews.Content: What a relaxing and totally enjoyable resort. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. We had a glorious stay. You'd think with the resort being so large you'd get swallowed up amongst the people and stuff, but that was so not the case. Though, we had an ocean view on the construction side, it was fab. The bathroom is as big as a bedroom, with a jacuzz tub and walk-in shower, now that's what I call living. We're returning in November and I can't wait. Oh yeah, tons of whales that could be seen off the shore. Everyday there was an awesome whale show.

Reviews.Title: “"Heavenly Beds" in Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: sellingcincy
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our Marriott timeshare for a week here...Beautiful resort and sensational service. What we loved...shuttle service to both Whaler's Village and Lahaina for restaurants...villas are top notch with great baths and kitchens and beds!...pool area has nice padded chairs and views of ocean for whale-watching. Note--Westin villas are NOT near Westin hotel .This was a surprise to us since often the hotel and villas share some common ground. Also--Studio rooms do not have balcony to sit on--just open like window.Ask to switch if you can. Nice touch--The Marketplace ( small grocery store onsite well stocked but pricey) offers prepared dinners for 2 for $19.95 which was convenient if you want to stay in sometime.Also the underground parking is nice but usually filled up Construction--Not that bad and we were partially viewing site--they stop at 4:30. Restaurants we loved--Mama's Fish House--go for lunch for amazing views and even better food but bring $$$. Casual but good was Hula Grill--service much better than nearby Leilani's where they RUSH you through like cattle. Special treat is SONZ at Swan Ct in Hyatt! Best activity is Trilogy sail to Lanai--sailtrilogy-- we left at 10am sail,snorkle,tour of island,dinner,return at 7.Capt.Owen & crew are worth it.Not for small children. Road trips--north to see surfers and south to Hana and crater-- Get a convertible--you're in Hawaii! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Birthday Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SocalGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond my expectations. I loved the view, the relaxing atmosphere, wonderful staff/housekeeping, and everything about it. We arrived in the early afternoon, three hours before our check-in time, and as expected, our room was not ready however they were nice to suggest the many things we could do (i.e. start using their amazing facilities while they keep our luggages for us). There was a definitely change of mood once you step into their lobby area because your eyes will automatically get caught on the beautifully placed view of the ocean. Our suite was huge and has a full 'iron chef' kitchen. We never cook while on vacation, but because the kitchen was so nice, we actually went out to the grocery store to cook for one night...and I always make a mess when cooking, so i had a huge amount of dishes/pans/pots in the sink. Our schedules were pretty booked the next day with many activities to do so we left the dishes there to do when we get back...to our surprise, when we got back...everything was neat, back in order and clean. Yay for no need to wash dishes!!! :o) We did see the construction, but luckily was upgraded to a different building/wing of the resort so that was not a problem at all. Wonderful vacation. Definitely coming back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Lewisville
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, which was too short. We are owners at the Westin Kierland in Scottsdale, and were able to use some of our StarOption points to book the WKORV as an add-on to our Hawaii vacation. The resort was just outstanding. The lobby entry (dimmed lighting showcasing the pool and ocean view through the far end) set the tone for a very high quality property. The internal courtyard with pool and waterslide was very nice and well maintained. Some of the pool decks are raised, providing better ocean views. The pool areas was on the crowded side, but there always seemed to be a few available chairs here and there. I will agree with previous posters that a non-owner will take some risk as to their unit view. Some units (about 10%?) overlook the back parking lot with Hwy 30 in the background. We were fortunate enough to get a room overlooking the pool area with the ocean in the distance, about halfway down the building on the 3rd floor. The pool was the perfect temperature. There did not seem to be much activity at the neighboring site to the north, so perhaps the major phase of construction has been completed. I would guess that ocean front would virtually impossible if not an OF owner. The balance of the units will vary as to views. For those concerned about the next door construction, there did not seem to be much activity /noise at the neighboring site to the north, so perhaps the major phase of construction has been completed or is on hold right now. I think there was still a crane on site so it may resume at some point. The rooms are quite soundproof. The snorkeling is supposed to be excellent here; however, a storm system that had come through earlier in the week made the swells too big to snorkel. We thought the food was good quality and "reasonably" priced for a top Kaanapali resort. As an economical option, there was an on-property hot dog cart selling a $6 combo for hot dog or sausage, lots of toppings as desired, chips, and a soft drink or bottled water. Generally, I think it's difficult to vacation in Hawaii on a tight budget, and it's far easier to simply pay the higher prices found everywhere and not compare pricing with establishments back home. The rooms had a feel more modern than Hawaii style, but were great quality. The bathroom in particular had a rich "spa" look. The washer and dryer were easy to use and were tucked out of the way in a closet behind the front door. Also, the resort is very accomodating to those with a later flight. There is a spacious late departure lounge with adjoining locker rooms. We used these to shower and change a few hours after checkout so we were able to enjoy the nice facilities and Hawaiian sunshine as long as possible. I wanted to briefly investigate the North villas info. (the adjoining property under construction) for future exchange possibilities. However, with so little time, I didn't check into the North property. And, my wife thought this property was so wonderful that she would rather return here. Bottom line: This resort is up to the hype! Stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “2 weeks (1 bed) then studio”
Reviews.Author: kbalthaser66
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of our 2nd week at this resort. Let me start by saying this resort is BEAUTIFUL. The staff is wonderful and the free amenities are amazing (wireless network - free parking - computer room). From everything we have heard from other travelers these type items are not free at the rest of the hotels/timeshares on Maui. Our first week was in a 1 bedroom (4307). The unit is nice and the kitchen is wonderfully done with all amenities you could possibly need. This unit has a nice view of the ocean. Our 2nd week we were moved next door to a studio unit. This unit is a bit small and a few warnings - the fridge is not a true fridge - no real freezer - this really an icebox and not a fridge (I wish I would have known this because we had TONS of food that did not fit in the mini fridge). There also is no oven in this unit. There are 2 burners which is nice. Excursions - Whale Watches - we did several whale watches (2 Pacific Whale Foundation tours and 1 Adventure Maui Whale Watch). The 2 Pacific Whale Foundations were AMAZING. I would highly suggest Pacific Whale - in fact I have a few more days on Maui and I am thinking of taking yet another whale watch with Pacific Whale. I will attach some pictures of these - we got close to the whales - I would say for about an hour or so there was a group of whales within 25 feet of our boat on one tour and the other tour we saw a breach and a competition pod with whales slapping thier tales - etc..... We also went on a raft with Adventure Maui but we did not really see anything on this tour - nothing special. HELICOPTER - Sunshine (Circle Island Tour). This was supposed to be a circle island tour West Maui - Haleakala - Hana. We only saw Haleakala - Hana and one waterfall right after take off. This tour was expensive ($275 each) and I would not recommend this tour. When we complained that we only saw part of the island they did not have much to say. Also if you are seated on the opposite side of the pilot you only really get a good view of the coastline - everyone else on the helicopter leans forward to see the stuff on the left side and if you are on the right all you see our heads - no real sites. I was extremely disappointed with this tour. DINNER SUNSET CRUISE - Spirit of Lahaina - ($89 each) - this tour was alright - but not what I was expecting. The food was VERY GOOD but I was hoping for a romantic sunset ride with dinner at individual tables and this is not was it was - It is a buffet dinner and you are seated in cafeteria style bench seats (six to a table). Once again the food was good. We only went out a bit on the ocean then parked the boat slightly off the shoreline and reamined at that spot for the 2 hours. Considering this was only $89 I was not terribly disappointed but it just was not what I was expecting. We have a Lanai snorkel tomorrow as well as golf over the next couple of days and I will post more after then. Maui is beautiful and this trip has been amazing so far - just thought I would point out a few things.

Reviews.Title: “The Best I Have Ever Stayed At... EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: kebanos7cs
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such a gorgeous resort in my life... fun and beautiful. Our room had everything that we needed plus more. Our room had a perfect little kitchen with every appliance you could possibly need... refridgerator, dish washer, sink w/ disposal, toaster, microwave/oven combo, electric stove, blender.. and all of the needed plates, bowls, cups, glasses, baking supplies,.. I could go on forever. It came with a washer/dryer in-unit.. the show was HUGE with a double shower head.. and also a whirlpool hot tub. The bed was VERY comfy with a down comforter. NIce TV with also a DVD player too and clock radio. The room was just amazing. The outside was so great too. How they built this resort was just perfect. While walking around the resort you just keep thinking to yourself... "This is what a vacation in Hawaii is all about" The pool is huge along with a 100 foot water slide. The surroundings is just gorgeous... My wife and I thought long and hard about if there was anything to improve this place.. we came up with nothing. We love The Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas!!! One thing... be careful if you snorkel on the beach right out from the resort... there are some shallow reefs there that could hurt you. I would reccomend Black Rock instead... it's very easy to get there.. The Westin has a free shuttle for their guests!!! They also have one that goes right into Lahaina too!!!

Reviews.Title: “People, you're in Hawaii! How bad can it be?”
Reviews.Author: hmbgal
Reviews.Content: I had never been to this hotel before so I made sure to do my research; i.e. I read about 40 reviews on trip advisor. com! My feelings were mixed before I went. Would the pool be cold? Would there be too much construction noise? Would it be the best trip I ever took? Well, suffice to say, I was not disappointed at all. After thinking about what I had read, I tried to put everything in perspective. Here goes: Yes, the pool is refreshing. When it's 85+ degrees, do you really want to swim in a pool that's 85 degrees? The irony is that the kiddie pool was the coolest but it was still nice. We had no trouble with getting chairs by the pool (people were not putting their towels down early). My advice-try not to travel there when they are at full occupancy. I could see it being a problem but it wasn't when we were there. The construction noise was hardly noticeable. I'm sure that was our timing and location. It wasn't a big deal at all. There was no pressure to go to a time share presentation. That's what happens when you pay full price. If you only paid $700 for this nice of a property, well then, you're going to have to give 2-3 hours of your time. In general, think about your vacation. We have 2 kids under 3 years old and this was great for us. I wanted a place where we could have the kids sleep while we were in another room watching tv or hanging out (hence why we chose the 1 bedroom apt style). I loved the kitchen. We were able to save money on our meals, control what we ate and give the kids the food/snacks that they liked. The kitchen was well stocked with kitchen items but not stocked with any food except coffee, decaf, tea, sugar and powdered creamer. I wish I had known that and I might have brought salt and pepper. I would also like to offer recommendations. You can shop at Safeway (south) or Star Market (north). If you have a car, you can easily get to these markets. If you don't have a car, use the shuttle. The store on the hotel premises is expensive and doesn't have as much variety. If you want some really good fish, go to this fish market. Head north. When you get to the turn where the Star Market is, take a left there. Stay on that road and then you'll see a small strip mall with a pizza hut and storage place. The fish market is in there and they will marinate and prepare your fish for you (just grill, pan fry or bake when you get back). Hubby says it was the best fish he had all week! If you stay on this road (I think it's Lower Honoapalani road), go a little further. On the right is a store called "Farmers Market" good for natural, healthy, organic foods. Great banana bread as well as guacamole. Also, on the way out of Kahului, there's a store called Down to Earth which has wonderful organic foods as well as bulk foods. They also have a nice salad bar and hot food bar. My takes on restaurants-I liked the Gazebo at the Napili Shores Resort (my husband was less impressed). The Hula Grill in Whalers Village was good (both of these offer good kids meals). Pacific' O in Lahaina was tasty but expensive. If you eat in the hotel, kids eat free (for every adult dinner). That's a good value! If you have a chance, check out the spa at the Westin hotel. Very nice and relaxing. I hope you found this review helpful! I tried to give you an insider's view.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Westin!!”
Reviews.Author: micromacguy
Reviews.Content: We came to the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas on a six day/five night special through Westin Vacations. They made it clear that they could not guarantee a view which we interpreted to mean we may get a mountain or garden view vs. a pool or ocean view, but nothing could have prepared us for what we have experienced so far. First, we are on the first floor with a view of the construction going on next door (upper floors are worse, not better). Construction starts at just before sunrise - we know because that's when the trucks pull in (just before 6:30 a.m.). Then the pounding and the racket begins. We have to keep our shades drawn for privacy (the workers are nice, they wave at you). When we took the problem to the manager, his response was that they put 99% of the people coming in on this package on this side of the villas (building #2, even number), and that there's nothing he can do. He referred us back to the Westin Call Center who booked us in. He did send us a bottle of wine to make up for it... whoopee. If you plan to come here, be very clear with them up front that being placed on the construction side is absolutely unacceptable, and if they can't guarantee that won't happen, don't come. This is a waste of our time, our money and their marketing dollars. The front desk even told us that this was a reason to buy into their timeshare - so we would be guaranteed not to get this bad of a room. If we do not go to the timeshare presentation, we will be charged full rate for the room. I was somewhat surprised at how aggressive the Call Center was prior to our coming here, particularly in light of it being a Westin. Now I understand why. Their job is to get people here - what happens next is not their concern. p.s. the Marriott Vacation Club on the other hand is a first class organization - the Westin could take lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel/condo development, right on the water”
Reviews.Author: mrkane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Ka'annapali last year and absolutely LOVED IT! It is a great location and worth every penny that you spend. My wife and I paid more money for another condo in Maui, and this one cost less and was so much more. Westin Heavenly Beds and Heavenly Showers...flat screen LCD televisions. Bose stereo systems. Best of all, a full kitchen that you can pre-order as fully-stocked before you arrive at the hotel. My wife and I pre-ordered, and then stocked up at Costco and K-Mart, near the airport, and had an absolutely wonderful stay... As well, there is a full washer-dryer unit in the room, so it was great for not packing much! Overall, I highly recommend this propery to anyone who makes it out to Maui...it is a little pricey (it's downside), but like I said, we still paid less that a week in a much lesser condo. TWO GIANT THUMBS UP!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For us it didn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: cvmar
Reviews.Content: We had a full 2 bedroom unit on the 6th floor in building 3 with a very nice view of the pool and ocean. Check in was quick and easy and they had the one bedroom side ready for us at 1:00 PM. Although we didn't stay there that first night we checked in at got our keys. The foyer between the units is a complete waste of space and I had to buy door stops to keep the doors open between the units so my Mother in Law didnâ€™t feel unwelcome to come into the living room and kitchen located in the one bedroom side. The kitchen was a nice size but the refrigerator and freezer had a horrible smell so I went to the store and purchased 2 boxes of baking soda and put one in each location and it didnâ€™t even touch the smell. The dining room table is too big for the space and the furniture placement wasnâ€™t the best. The furniture was well used, very soft and needed to be replaced. The dÃ©cor was not very Hawaiian and really could have been any Westin anywhere. It had more of a Southern California feel than a hawaiian feel. Having the washer/dryer unit behind the entrance door was a real pain if you wanted to keep the door to the unit opened. I had heard the washer/dryer was a complicated to operate European set however our unit had a whirlpool stackable set that was very simple to operate. The bathroom was huge and very nice and I loved the heavenly showerhead. The pocket door to the toilet area was extremely heavy and hard to close. I donâ€™t know why they would use a solid core pocket door for a toilet area. We never used the very large jetted tub. The bedroom was a decent size but the heavenly bed was way too hard for both my husband and me. (This was a disappointment because we need a new bed and I was waiting to try the heavenly bed before buying a bed because everyone seems to love them). When I called housekeeping and asked for 2 egg crate mattress toppers they seem shocked I did not like the bed and asked me to check under the mattress to see if a board had been placed there for a previous guest. There was no board and they do not have any mattress toppers for the heavenly beds so we made due with the mattress toppers they provide for the sofa beds. The studio side was very nice and I really liked the mini kitchen set up. I thought they did a very good job getting everything you would need into a small space, mini refrigerator, dishwasher, sink, microwave, smooth top 2 burner cook top, toaster, blender, coffeemaker dishes and utensils. The studio side would be just fine for a couple or small family. The only negative to the studio was no balcony. The grounds were nice and the resort is set back from a beautiful beach with excellent snorkeling. The resort is set back further from the ocean than I expected and I missed not being able to hear the ocean when out by the pool. The pool slide was a big hit but the pool seemed too small for the resort especially when they were using part of it for water aerobics classes. I canâ€™t imagine how busy the pool area must be during the busy Holiday and summer seasons. The pool temperature did not seem too cold for us. It felt cool (refreshing) when you first got in but in a couple of seconds it was just fine. If you wanted an umbrella you needed to find one by 7:00 AM and the pool shack does not open until 8:00 AM. At the end of the day we would get fresh pool towels and take them up to our room to use for the next morning and that worked out fine. One morning around 7 a woman placed towels and books on lounge chairs under an umbrella and did not return until 11:30! At about 10 I mentioned this to the pool staff and they said there is nothing they can do since they also have personal items on them, although there is a notice at the pool shack stating chairs cannot be held for more than an hour. The wait staff at the restaurant and pool were extremely nice and I cannot say enough kind things about them. They worked very hard and always had a smile on their face. The food at the pool side restaurant was good although we never ate dinner there, breakfast (off the menu) and lunch (usually by the pool) was just fine and we were always satisfied. We were not on the construction side and never heard any construcion noise so it was not an issue for us. All in all it is a very nice resort but offers nothing that I would say is exceptional for the price you have to pay to own at this resort or to rent from an owner or directly from Westin except that the units are spacious and unless it was a super great deal or free (which it never will be) we would not return to this resort. Our family prefers the Marriott Ocean Club and that is where our future Maui vacations will be. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise!”
Reviews.Author: quiet-pro
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a one week vacation at this property and had to endure seven days facing a very noisy construction site.The trucks engines and constant beeping started at 6.30am every morning,including weekends,and evening overtime was not unusual.We had specifically requested that we not be placed on the construction side and although we were aware that no guarantees could be made we were still surprised that the front desk staff said that we could not be moved every day that we enquired during the week.Believe me,I am not exaggerating,the noise is enormous!The room itself was fine and the swimming pool was good,no problems with the water temperature.The kids had fun at the beach right in front and got to know several others during the week who were also driven out of their rooms before 7.00am. The amount of people that were shuttled through the property on timeshare presentations was incredible and you have to give Westin credit for the enormity of this very slick operation. Would we go back for a relaxing family vacation? Absolutely not!Go somewhere else where your valuable time is appreciated and respected, not to a somewhat sterile atmosphere where making a very large profit takes precedence over respect for the individual. P.S. We still love Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “some people are just spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: mamma0233
Reviews.Content: I guess our family is from a different strata of society...we LOVE this place...pool too cold..HUH?! Lovely and refreshing! Pool chairs...HUH!? Always there, no problem, my crew normally went to the pool about 11am or later and had no problem with chairs...although people should not be allowed to dump a towel and expect it to be there when they come back from the beach. This is an amazing place for a vacation, the fact our adult "kids" wanted to join us was terrific. We had a blast! If you really want to have a Hawai'in experience get off your butts and explore the real world of Hawai'i, get out of the resort, Please!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Nanachelle
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort on the prompting of a "special offer" to view the "ownership" options (like time share, but it doesn't expire, etc.) Although we did not purchase, we did enjoy our stay overall. Upon our arrival, we were upgraded us to a "ocean-view" room - even if it was a view through the adjacent parking lot. We figured that it was better than facing the construction next door as we feared all the "special offer" rooms were located. (Also note, none of the "special offer" rooms have balconies!) We loved the beach in front of the resort - great for snorkeling. The pool water slide was a hit with our 7-yr old (although the pool was quite cold! My daughter took to wearing her wet suit so she wouldn't freeze!) The pool chairs were also mostly taken by 9 am or so. I don't know about you, but my idea of relaxing isn't stressing out to get to the pool early so I get a chair! We were told that at this time, we were NOT allowed to use the pools at the "sister" hotels (Westin or Sheraton), although we could take the hotel shuttle to these properties and use our room-charging privileges for meals, etc. The time-share presentation was not as painful as it could have been. There were "concierge" everywhere in the hotel, some were more helpful (and knowledgeable) than others. Another interesting note, we spoke with several people during our stay and we discovered that it can be MUCH more cost effective to purchase a time/ownership share through resale. Best to explore that option before you purchase - it does have some limitations, however. Overall, I am glad we experienced this hotel. I found our second week in a private condo in Wailea (Polo Beach), however, to be much more relaxing and a lot less hassle.

Reviews.Title: “We love this resort”
Reviews.Author: bellasmama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our very first stay at the Westin Ka'anapali Resort Villas and we love it there. The villas have been reviewed by many people on this site and have been descriped in detail, so I won't repeat the descriptions. Excellent accomodations. One of the biggest complaints in previous reviews was the pool temperature. We found that the pool temp. was perfect. We have a pool at home and I keep it between 82 and 84 degrees; I don't like it cold. The pool at the resort was, in my best guess, about 82 degrees; which was perfect considering how warm it was outside. It was very refreshing and most comfortable while swimming. I spent a good deal of time in the pool and didn't get cold. The other complaint mentioned most was the lack of rooms with an ocean view. I can't comment on that from personal experience because we purchased a center ocean-front room and we were on the 6th floor. PERFECT! That view is incredible. All you see is water from every place in the villa, including the shower and tub. We know we always want an ocean front view so we purchased an ocean front unit. Apparently there will be many more ocean front units in the new phase that is currently under construction. I also read some reviews online that complained about the garbage removal. We called the front desk and asked about what to do with our garbage and they told us to have it sitting outside in the morning before 8:00 a.m. and they would collect it from outside our door and leave us a new bag. No problem with that. The staff at the resort was friendly and helpful. We were there during the earthquake and there were no problems. They had generators on quickly with lights in hallways, etc. We were told that the building codes on the new buildings in Hawaii are more restrictive than California in regard to earthquakes. Although this earthquake was very strong and we felt it roll for what seemed like a very long time, the building never creaked. No cracks, chipping,etc. We were happy to be in a relatively new building; something we had never thought about prior to this trip. The grounds are beautiful, the beach is awesome and the ocean water temp. was perfect. We used the BBQs 3 times during our stay and they were always clean and in working order. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed in this resort. It has everything you could want on a Maui vacation. For those who are unhappy with the rooms, views, pool temp., patios, some spots on the carpet, etc., simply go down a mile to one of the Ka'anapali hotels and rent a hotel room with an ocean view and see what it costs you for a room with only a bed and a bathroom. And those hotels are showing their age. No matter how you look at it, the Westin Ka'anapali Resort Villas are a bargain on Ka'anapali Beach, and a luxury slice of paradise. Great vacation, great resort, so happy we own there.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the visit”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first ownership week in early October. The visit included some family friends (two adults and two small children) and myself (single adult). We had a 2 bedroom deluxe island view unit on a corner. The resort is easy to get to from OGG and looks beautiful upon arrival. The wonderful weather and blue oceans made the open-air lobby very inviting. Check-in was fast. I asked if an OV was available, just in case, but unfortunately there wasn't one. However, we were very lucky and pleased to get the best IV unit at the resort: top floor facing the lobby building, pool and ocean. I couldn't believe this was an IV unit! The rooms was standard Westin: huge Heavenly beds, jacuzzi tubs in both bathrooms, granite counters, tons of amenities, Internet, etc. I can't think of anything that was missing. I let my guests take over the main 1 bedroom unit while I took the lockoff. The keyed entry leading to our separate doors was perfect; we could keep them closed for privacy or open them up when we wanted to connect. With the doors shut, I couldn't hear much noise coming from their unit. I ended up using the mini-kitchen quite a bit. There was plenty of room and I felt absolutely relaxed throughout the week. My friends thought the pool temp was on the cool side, but otherwise no complaints. They attended one of the movies and participated in a couple other activities. The general store has just about everything you could need. Room service was on the weak side (limited menu), but you can order from the grill and pick it up, which I did the first night. Service was generally good, no issues there. I went to the spa at the hotel on the last day. Service was also good but not necessarily memorable. Allow 30 min if taking the shuttle; it took 15 min just to arrive at the villas, but the ride itself was fairly quick. The concierge was excellent; they staff several desks throughout the property and are available for extended hours. There's a lot of construction going on now, but we were far enough on the south side not to hear much of it. Avoid the north building if you can. Other than that, there's not much negative than I can say about the stay. I was considering selling my week before I arrived but I just might hold onto it a little longer to go one more time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Maui Experience....Just wouldnt buy there”
Reviews.Author: Bananz
Reviews.Content: We were guests of my husband's parents who own 2 timeshares at the villas so seeing that it was free for us to stay there was excellent but I really couldnt see myself forking down a ton of cash to buy a timeshare there...and boy oh boy did they have a sophisicated operation of trying to get people to buy a timeshare....we must have witnessed at least 50-60 tours in one week.....but that's besides the point. Let's get to what I liked and didnt like: LIKED: awesome beach snorkeling is great (saw turtles) nicely decorated rooms great pool (fun slide) shuttles to local shopping comfy bed no lack of cushioned chairs at pool big shower great ocean/pool views nicely lanscaped nice friendly staff tiki torches at night good for famiies and kids aqua aerobics was fun DIDN'T LIKE too commercial hard sales pitch for timeshares expensive food & drink only cleaned your room every 3 days poor drink service at pool food was just average only one restaurant at entire resort no on-site spa noisy construction next door A/C wasnt cool enough gym was often crowded with only 2 elipitical machines covered beach chairs were $$ no room service The Villas are great. Dont get me wrong. I like Hawaii but I dont LOVE Hawaii. I prefer the Carribean more so if you love Hawaii then check it out. If you want to visit a tropical location with more 'soul' then skip Hawaii all together.....its a little touristy!

Reviews.Title: “Westin is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cynthia22
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Westin and it was wonderful! Don't be put off by the bad reviews on this site, you will love it. 1. rooms- We had a garden view and it was very nice and quiet. The beds are wonderful and the housekeeping is great. Our friends stayed on the top floor (floor 11) and I noticed they were in the process of renovating this floor so carpets were newer and stuff. Not like the matters though, the other floors are in good enough shape too. They did say they heard the elevator and a little bit of construction on their floor. We stayed on the second floor and it was nice and quiet. 2. pool- is gorgeous and a great temperature. There is a fun waterslide there too. There are plenty of lounges so we never had a hard time getting one. My one complaint would be they need more umbrellas to shade the lounges by the pool. People get up at the crack of dawn and put their towels on these chairs and then leave so they are hard to get. These people are total jerks but I have been on vacation at a lot of different places and unfortunately they are everywhere so it is not unique to this resort. I guess some guests are so type A that they can't just relax and be fair about it. Nonetheless, you will still be able to get a lounge chair. This is a very kid-friendly hotel but they do have an adult only pool. 3. the beach. gorgeous, one the the nicest . The water is warm and clear. A bit steep, not much of a wading area. 4.location- great! 5 minutes from the town of Lahaina, right next to Whaler's village with great shops and restaurants. You can't ask for a better location. All in all, it is a great hotel and I highly recommend it. FYI-saturdays seem the most busy of the days at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - Would Come Back Every Year!”
Reviews.Author: Emelina
Reviews.Content: We are owners of this resort and it's worth every cent we spent on it. We stayed for two weeks at the Two-bedroom Ocean Front Deluxe Lock-off Villa (1 week in studio, 1 week in 1-bedroom, total 1750 square feet), which are corner units with awesome views of the beach and ocean from our rooms and lanais. Both units are new and gorgeous with minimalist designs and comfortable furnishings. Beds and baths were heavenly! The kitchen in the studio was small but had all the conveniences of a microwave/convection oven, sink, refrigerator and stove. The kitchen in the 1 bedroom was truly a full-size kitchen with so much counter space that you can spread all your groceries on the counter without having to store them anywhere. We traveled here with two young kids so having kitchens made it much more comfortable than staying in a hotel room. We cooked breakfast and lunch there very often. Not only were the accommodations wonderful, the beach is beautiful and has snorkeling a few feet from the sand. Black Rock was just a short walk south, where there were many green turtles. Food at the resort was good, not exceptional. Try the spicy chicken wings. There's a general store in-house that also sells all kinds of essential items at reasonable Hawaiin prices. You can also order marinated meats to grill at the poolside barbecue areas. The pool area was wonderful for the kids and for suntanning. Westin is building a sister resort next door that includes 3 pools, including a kids-club area that should be awesome. I hope we will be able to use them as well. (By the way, the construction noise was minimal. We stayed in building 2 near the construction site and couldn't hear any.) The location is terrific as we felt that we were away from the hustle and bustle south of Black Rock at the Whaler's Village area, but are only 5 minutes from them with a complimentary shuttle ride. One thing to point out is most of the non ocean-front rooms (ocean view rooms) do not have spectacular views. If you come hear and book an ocean view room and expect a great view, you may be disappointed, since the buildings are perpendicular to the beach and you may be stuck at the back of the building. Also, the lanais of the studios are almost non-existent. Furthermore, a few of the staff at the resort (especially at the Pool Bar area) should be more trained to be more knowledgeable and service-friendly. I can't wait to come back next year when everything near the resort is more developed, and enjoy watching the whales from the lanais with my pina coladas.

Reviews.Title: “Another quality Westin stay guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: rkuchel
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, friendly staff in the midst of beautiful Maui. This is a fine resort which rates above 4+ stars in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: carlareno
Reviews.Content: Lobby is fantastic - truly wonderful. Too bad the rooms are just "so-so". The musty/damp smell was unexpected given the room rates. Beach is TINY - but a great place to snorkel. Breakfast buffet was quite nice - but VERY expensive. Concierge was helpful in scheduling activities.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned after reading reviews for over 6 months on here...”
Reviews.Author: floridahokie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Westin Ocean Resort and Villas (celebrating our 5th anniversary), not to be confused with the Westin Hotel. I have been reading reviews on here for over 6 months, and I have to admit, I was a little concerned about going. We actually bought a week from a timeshare owner (via ebay) that was not able to use their week (or they just wanted to make some money?). We got a great deal, no where near the listing price on the website of 350-400/night. I called back in February requesting a building on the other side of the construction, as well as an Ocean View room. (Neither were guaranteed) When we landed there was a 2 hr delay getting our car rental, so we weren't going to arrive at the resort until 8pm. I was sure by then that we would be facing the construction, plus not being an actual owner....I was prepared for it. I called to let them know we were going to be late and they were very courteous on the phone. To my delight when we arrived, we had building 5 with an Ocean View. I've heard people complain that you have to strain your neck and look down the side of the hotel to see the Ocean, but we had no problem with our view at all. We could stand on our Lanai, overlooking the pool, and see plenty of the Ocean. I think all the rooms that face the pool would have a similar view, which i thought was great. The room was clean, Westin quality stuff. (nice) The construction....was not an issue at all. We were staying on the other side, but I work in construction industry so I was intrigued and I stopped by to gaze at their current work, and it was never overly loud with 'jackhammers' or anything. Even if we were facing it, I dont believe that it would have been as big of an issue as people have made it out to be. The pool- There were more hesitations here when so many people said the pool was cold. The pool was maybe cold if you sat in your air conditioned room all day, then jumped in the pool in the shade and stood still. The pool was very refreshing, albeit cool. Neither my wife or I are big swimmers but just playing around in the pool, we were very comfortable. I wouldn't want the pool any warmer, it wouldn't be refreshing. We ate once at the restaurant/bar and it was fair. Expensive as expected and really just convenient. I would only eat there again out of convenience. What received high marks in my book were the grills. Beautiful stainless steel gas grills, that were kept very clean. There must ahve been a dozen or so. We grilled a few times. Either buy stuff from the general store at the Westin (that seemed actually reasonable) or at the Safeway/Walmart, etc. They give you the utensils for free to use, and each morning they cleaned the grills. Our second to last night we grilled and ate at the tables and watched the sunset. It was wonderful. We didn't have any problems with the staff. In fact, our toilet got clogged and I requested a plunger, and they actually sent a guy to do it. I offered to do it, (as it is embarassing) but he said its his job and he had it flushing again in no time! We did have 2 voicemails on our phone about timeshare interviews, but we were never hasseled or anythign to go. We never returned teh calls, but the people I did see that were walking around the resort during the interviews, didn't seem to be pressured or anything. There did appear to be some people on their honeymoons, but I woudl say the majority of the people their were families. I guess this should be expected in part if you're staying at a place that has multiple rooms/suites and full kitchens. We didn't have any issues sharing the pool with kids. We didn't have any problem surprisingly with parking. We were able to park every day/night in the garage below ground. There was one night when we returned it was rather crowded and we had to park on the far end of the garage, but for the amount of cars/people there I was pleasantly surprised that we never had to park in the lot....but if we had, I can't see why that would be a big deal. The tennis courts looked nice, which had a basketball hoop which we shot around on for an hour one day. Nothing really special, but a nice amenity for those who play. We loved the resort. I don't think I would have paid 'full price' of 350-400/night, but I dont think I'd pay that for anywhere. I would have paid 250-300 a night though. Overall we were very pleased. A few things you should do: 1. Buy Maui Revealed. Everyone has it, and it's unbelievably helpful. Even some residents we ran into had it just to help them get around that had been living there for 8 years! 2. Take the drive to Hana and use Maui Revealed. The bamboo forests were amazing, truly like something out of Hollywood. The 4 waterfalls (I forget the name) where he says most people only go to the first two and stop. Go there. Youcould even go with kids. We stayed in Hana one night, and would definitely do it again. 3. Mama's fish house- Don't go with kids. Its expensive, very expensive, but some of the best food we've ever had, and teh atmosphere could not be drawn up any better for a romantic evening at the beach. We spent a lot of money here, but the waiter, the food, that atmosphere, was all top notch. Don't go to Maui and pass up on this place.

Reviews.Title: “But it's a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMan1965
Reviews.Content: When we checked in our balcony Lani was dirty, the bellman said they would address it and have it cleaned of the cigarette butts that were everywhere and the chaise chair seat cushions were burned in spite of that It was a Great Location. If it wasn't for the pool and the comfortable bed I felt it is just an average place. The food and the drinks at the Pool bar were also average at best.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip this time and should get better.”
Reviews.Author: alohaguy
Reviews.Content: Well here is my story. We purchased in 2003 before it opened when staying at the Sheraton Maui (best resort on Kaanapali beach). We video taped the presentation and the test room since some family back home was interested in purchasing. Well a few things that were told to us on tape were not the case when we first stayed there in 2005. Some of those things were that we would always be in building 2 (the first one open) and that the parking under the buildings would be for owners only. Well when we checked in August 2005 we were put in building 4 that does not even face the same direction as the two along the beach. We were looking at a parking lot from the 2nd floor with our â€œocean viewâ€� way in the distance. After complaining we were moved to building 2 the next day but not until 5:00 (wasted one whole day with no room to be in). There were some other issues last year but it was mainly because they tried to open the 2 last buildings at once without increasing the staff. Well this year we were put in building 3 just above the pool restaurant. Not the best view of the beach but not the parking lot. Service was good and the resort was in great shape. The food at the pool side restaurant was better than many of our favorites on the island. Lobster at Hula Grill (awesome place) was 8 oz for $38. Lobster at the Westin Villas was 10 oz. for $28. Parking was not as bad as I remembered last year but maybe it was the times I was trying to park. The reports of the pool being cold are no where near the truth. We were at the Sheraton and Westin Hotel before checking into the Villas and it was the same temp and equal to the ocean which they said was unusually warm (reported 80 degrees). Even the little kids we had with us did not react to the water temp when put in the big side of the pool. Some problems we encountered were the abuse of people going down early and leaving stuff or towels on all the chairs with shade but not showing up until the late afternoon if at all. One morning we went down at 7:30 AM and there was not a chair without a towel under an umbrella and we have little ones that canâ€™t just sit in the sun all day. That same day I hardly saw one of those lounges occupied. They need to do what the Westin Hotel does and have signs that tell them that if towels on lounges are left unoccupied for more than 30 minutes they will be removed. Also the rental of the cabanas or gazebos is run by an outside company. Not only are there too few for that size resort but they let people call and book as far out as they want. Lets just say not only were they booked for this entire summer but next summer is almost completely booked. We hardly saw them used even though someone booked them. The Westin said they only way that will change is if enough owners complain about the outside service. Another issue I had was the two newer buildings had slightly different things that what we had in the original building. For one the refrigerator in the studio is half the size of the original room design. Also the chairs on the balcony are not the lounges that were in the original building. You would think they would keep it the same. Now this location is perfect and the snorkeling right at the beach was even better than a snorkel cruise we took. Save your money and snorkel at the resort. Also there are plans to expand the resort with the â€œNorthâ€� addition. This will add more pools (kiddy, family, and adult) as well as two restaurants. There is no construction allowed next to the new part of the resort (it is a greenbelt) but beyond that is a new village style shopping and restaurants going in from the same designers as Whistlers village. They are trying to make this a better version of Kaanapali south with Whalers Village. Because of what this area is going to become as soon as 2008 we sold back our every year Ocean View full double lockoff unit and paid the difference to get an Ocean Front in the North addition. One reason was to have an Ocean Front and not worry about where we will be put in the existing resort (parking lot, or next to an air conditioner or looking at the building next to you). The other reason was to be close to all the new amenities. The original resort was designed by another company and they could not afford to finish so Westin bought it but could not change anything. The new resort is all Westin designed. The rooms are similar but with better used spaces and the studio side now has a balcony you can sit out on as well as the one bedroom having a full table on the balcony to sit at and eat. We have visited other villas and nothing compares to the Westin room and now the location will be hard to beat once everything is done. We were ready to sell after last year but things are getting better and the new North Villas should remove the last few worries we had.

Reviews.Title: “Must go!!!”
Reviews.Author: 30yr-old.traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after having a bad experience at the Ritz in Kapalua. We were lucky to get a room because most of the places are timeshares. When we checked in the staff was wonderful. Our room was absolutely beautiful! We had a kitchenette, huge bathroom and a soaking tub. The bed was super comfy and the location of the hotel was perfect - far enough away from town that we had privacy but close that it was only a 5 minute drive. You cant walk to Lahaina from here, or Kaanapali, but its close enough to take a short cab ride. The beach area is really nice and the pool is great for kids. The restaurant was wonderful, as pricey as any other, but the food was good. There is a great little store on the premise, too. I would definately stay here, in fact, i plan on coming back on my first wedding anniversary - my husband proposed to me on the beach of this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: viper915
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an amazing vacation at the Westin Kaanapali Villas. Had read some mixed reviews but mostly positive ones. I guess the main complaint people had was the construction noise of the new phase. We had a one bedroom lock-off villa which is actually a one bedroom unit and a studio unit. Each has a separate entrance but a common foyer. It was in Building 4 and nowhere near the construction. We did not have any construction noise. Parking is free and easily accesible from all buildings. Each building has a concierge in each lobby which is also nice. The units were both spacious, extremely clean and beautifully furnished. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the service was superb. We had a couple of things like a burned out light in the bathroom and one t.v. in the bedroom that had bad color and engineering was there 5 minutes from my call to fix the problems. The beach was beautiful with snorkeling right in front of the hotel. We had 2 kids and they loved the pool and the pool slide. The pool was perfect temperature - some complained it was cold! This was not the case. Having a condo with all the amenties of a hotel was fabulous. The on property restaurant was average priced for a hotel restaurant and kids eat free for breakfast and dinner. We loved having the shuttle to Kaanapali and you are able to do room charges at both the Sheraton and the Westin in Kaanapali. They also have barbeques which people utilized nightly and eating areas right next to the barbeques. You can buy prepared meals to cook - pricey but very convenient. Actually the markets are so expensive there - the price is worth the convenience. The only downside was that we had an island view room which looked back at the highway. It was noisy on the balcony - but we were rarely in the room and the grounds are so gorgeous that we enjoyed our evenings out by the pool with all the tiki torches. We were really pampered here - the concierge called me on my cell phone a week prior to my arrival to welcome me and ask if I had any questions and if wanted any assistance in booking daytrips. It was a really nice touch. I will definitely be returning to this resort - great for kids and extremely kid friendly. There were lots of daily activities for all ages even if the kids were not enrolled in the kids club. I highly recommend this resort for a relaxing Maui vacation with all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed it so much we purchased a second time share in the hotel next door that will be ready in 2008. Snorkling was great right in front of the hotel. You are close to shopping, restaurants and other amenities as well.

Reviews.Title: “Westin KOR”
Reviews.Author: Bobk61
Reviews.Content: Very Nice stay! 2wk owner - 6th floor ocean view was magnificent!. Snorkeling is as good as the Sheraton Black Rock - many turtles! Agree the sandy beach is limited due to the closeness of the coral, but this is great for kids snorkeling - not too far to swim! Also agree the pool @ times is a little too cold - I think Westin mat be limiting the heater usage due to fuel costs! The Resort restaurant is "OK" - lots of other otions in nearby Lahaina/Kapalua. Poolside service good. Intoductory SCUBA available onsite as is PDAI certification - a plus. Construction of similar KOR North units not a problem unless you face that way - request pool view and you'll be OK. Used shuttle to/from Westin Maui/Sheraton Black Rock frequently - runs often and free. Also, safe for teens who don't drive to get to/from Whaler's village etc. Very safe. Bob K.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali Villas Take Shape”
Reviews.Author: UnbiasedReviewer
Reviews.Content: Maui is my favorite Hawaiian Island, and after a week there, I can say the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort is an ideal place for families. The pluses are beachfront with ocean views, a cool minimalist design, well appointed suites (all with kitchens, DVD/CD players, bose stereo, washer/dryer), luxurious bathrooms, great clientele (this is not party central), friendly non-obtrusive staff, a small but functional gym, a concierge who can refer you to restaurants and activities, and free shuttle service to the mall (Whaler's Village) for your teenagers. It's not uncommon to see 3 generations travelling together. There is a really nice poolside bar with TVs. People say the pool is chilly, but I didn't find that at all. If you'd like, you can rent you own poolside cabana. The studio suites are an enormous value compared to smaller, older hotel rooms in Kaanapali that don't have kitchens or washer/dryers. Westin keeps this place IMMACULATE, as they should because they are successfully selling interval ownership units (timeshares) in this resort and its Phase II next door, which is 80% completed. We attended their timeshare presentation, which was professional and informative, without any hard-sell guilt trips. If you're in the market for an interval ownership, Westin is a great operator. What's the downside? If you're not paying top dollar, you may only have a sliver of an ocean view, or be looking across the way into another building or into the parking lot, but that's only fair. Freebie upgrades to the best units went out with the 1990's. Currently, you're not within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The on-site general store and restaurant are okay in a pinch, but pricey. There are plans to add more shops and restaurants within walking distance, along with the Phase II Westin Villas and an adjacent condo project. Finally, traffic has become more of an issue in West Maui, but is bearable. If you buy here or stay here, I strongly recommend getting out to see other parts of Maui. We toured the volcano in the afternoon and it was great (have breakfast at the Kula Lodge on the way up). Swimming with fish and seeing an occasional sea turtle is something I'll never get tired of (we snorkeled). If you can, spend a night or two in Hana (the hotel Hana-Maui is very romantic and has a nice spa). It's a scenic drive and it's really like visiting another island (have breakfast in the town of Paia and check out the stores on Baldwin Ave.). Stop along the way to check out some of the funky places on the road to Hana. Go to the 7 sacred pools at the state park and the other beaches in Hana, or go horseback riding. Another good excursion is Makena beach in Wailea or the Winery near Wailea; bring a book, a cooler, and have a picnic lunch--heaven. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “VERY pleased with the Villas!”
Reviews.Author: atfred
Reviews.Content: We, too, read all the reviews and were a little nervous about what to expect. When we arrived, the place was just gorgeous. We loved the lobby, pool area, beach area, garage parking, etc. The staff were so so nice, very laid back, friendly and helpful! Our room, as we expected, faced the construction, but was also an "ocean view". We had read on the reviews that some ocean views were just barely that, but ours was such that we could have watched the sun set over the ocean had we stayed in our room at sunset! Beautiful! We could see mountains the other direction, which was a treat as well. The room was immaculate, felt like home with a big kitchen with granite countertops, the truly heavenly bed, tons of room, cozy robes, double-headed shower, etc. We were pleasantly surprised they gave us dish soap, dishwasher powder, Tide and Bounce, paper towels, etc.! As for the construction noise, it wasn't as bad as others have said, but it did start promptly at 7am. They were usually done and gone by 4pm though, and it wasn't bothersome to us at all. The pool was beautiful and yes, it was cool, but what a refreshing dip after sitting in that hot sun. We even played on the water slide (we're in our 30s). The beach was gorgeous and not crowded at all. There were many people snorkeling the reefs just 10 feet offshore behind the hotel. Overall, this place was great, we weren't bothered by a timeshare presentation, and it was clean and comfy. We will definitely return here again in the future... we can't wait to see the new part completed next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: OandO
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort! As you frist step into the lobby, you are breathless as you look out onto the clear blue ocean. Helpful and friendly staff. We stayed in a one bedroom villa, which had 2 queen beds in 1 bedroom and a pull out couch in the living room. Large Kitchen with a full sized refridgerator. There was an electric oven and stove top with a microwave. Also included in the kitchen was a toaster, a blender and coffee maker. The pool was divided by a small waterfall - one side about a foot deep and the other side ranging from 2.5 feet to 4 feet. There are also 2 hot tubs. The general store sold everything from sundaries, gifts, beach toys, coffee, and even take and bake dinners. The "heavenly beds" were very comfortable. We stayed on the side facing the construction. However, we hardly heard the noise because the glass doors were so thick. However, the construction did start about 7am. There aren't that many spaces to park underground and they tell you to park outside, but if you do happen to get a spot underground, the elevators from the lot to your room can be very convenient. However, walking through the beautiful lobby and pool to get to your room isn't so bad either. The accommodations were very clean and comfortable and the biggest decision we had to make each day was...beach or pool?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1stclass
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying here with the earlier reviews that were so negative. We decided to try the property and we took my mom as well. My mom stayed in the lovely studio with an ocean view and my husband and I were upgraded to a 1 bedroom ocean view villa. It is the most beautiful spacious comfortable property we have ever stayed in. The heavenly shower and the jacuzzi tub are awesome everyday and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We were also there on business so having the high speed internet in the room was excellent and their service provider is superb. There is a full kitchen (dishwasher, disposal, fridge, stove, and microwave) with granite counter tops. We are going to be building our own home in Maui in 3 years and I have asked the property who did their tile work it is so spectacular. The grounds are beautiful and very manageable and the shuttle to the other Kaanapali Starwood resorts is a nice change when you do not want to drive. There is LOTS of parking and always available. The service was great and checkin and checkout was very fast. There was a true feeling of Aloha at this property!

Reviews.Title: “Good family vacation spot (info on handicapped access)”
Reviews.Author: BlessedandLoved
Reviews.Content: I just completed a one week stay with my husband, 13 year old son, 11 year old daughter and my mother. We are owners at the Sheraton Vistana Villages in Florida and switched out to this one. We stayed in a two bedroom ocean view lockoff in building 3, 6th floor. Our villa faced the park, parking lot and had a partial view of the ocean. I'll address two recurrent issues in postings: THE VIEW: Contrary to the many irritated reveiwers on the site, I did not have any problems with my view and enjoyed spending time on the balcony in the evening. CONSTRUCTION: I was not on the construction side. Therefore I would not have been able to tell construction was going on had I not seen the crane when driving up to the property. I think both of these issues are VERY overblown unless you are on the construction side. POSITIVES: * Wonderful rooms typical of the Westin. Spacious, minimalist Westin decor, Westin beds. * Beautiful!!! ocean view from the pool, lobby and restaurant area * Easy access to the beach * Shuttle to other Starwood hotels and to shopping in Whaler's Village * Responsive concierges helped with activites and dining options. * Clean towels quickly provided. NEGATIVES: * Yes, the pool is COLD. I can't understand why when it was 88 degrees. My kids only went in a few of the days. * Food at the restaurant was terrible!!!!!! The breakfast buffet was the worst. * Check out is at 10:00am. They have a late stay lounge (which is nice) with lockers and a shower room which was DISGUSTING by the time we wanted to use it at 4:00pm. Wet towels all over the floor. No washcloths. No soap/shampoo. ICK! HANDICAPPED ISSUES * Housekeeping had a shower chair for my mom to use in the shower. * Villas are close to the pool / restaruant area which helped since my mom is partially handicapped and can't walk long distances * Westin's wheelchair is old and rickety. Order one in ADVANCE from a vendor - the places they referred us to were booked up OTHER * BUY FOOD AND COOK IN THE VILLAS!!! Most of our dining out dinners were so-so yet cost $300 for the five of us. There are nice grills on property * Rent and reserve a shaded cabana IN ADVANCE for your check out day. That gives you a place to hang out once you leave your villa. * Go to dinner at the Heile Meili General Store. PHENOMINAL. Overall I enjoyed my week but probably won't go back to Maui. Too many other new places to see and nothing there I couldn't get elsewhere. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Westin easily exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a one week stay at the Westin for part of my honeymoon and went during late May/early June and then spent 4 days after at the Four Seasons in South Maui. For the months preceeding our visit, I was looking at the trip advisor reviews for the Westin. I was shocked that a Westin was getting such average reviews. I've stayed at Westins before and was always very satisfied with how nice the hotel was. Anyway, read lots of people complaining about the construction, hotel staff, pool temperature, wind, etc. My main concern was the construction. Once I checked in I realized we weren't facing the construction and was relieved. If you had a room facing the construction, I imagine it would be a big letdown. The room we ended up with was an oceanview - facing the ocean with a parking lot inbetween. A lot of reviewers seem to think oceanview is similar to oceanfront for some reason. Regardless, the oceanview was great, lots of beautiful trees, good balcony, parking lot was hardly noticeable. I heard the construction once or twice the entire week and that was while on the beach. The construction was not a problem for us. The actual hotel room deserves 6 stars. We had a one-bedroom villa and it was huge! Gigantic bathtub with jets that can open up to the bedroom (you can watch tv from the tub even). Bed was extremely comfortable, room had washer and dryer, everything was clean. Better room than the Four Seasons. It was nice to be able to eat-in and use the grills on site once in awhile too. The location of the hotel is perfect. Easy to drive to Lahaina. Star Market and Safeway are both close by (I found Star Markets a better option). Plenty of restaurants nearby. I heard in advance the hotel restaurant was bad so I didn't bother. The beach is wonderful. Yes, there are rocks and coral everywhere so it's perfect for snorkeling. You can just step out and dive in and look on tons of great fish. Didn't see the advantage of walking down to Black Rock to snorkel, had better luck right outside the hotel. Go to Snorkel Bobs in Lahaina and get the cheap snorkel gear for $9/week, it works fine. No need for beach chairs, you can find plenty of spots to lay down on the beach and there is shade for trees that you can find if you need it. At the pool there are plenty of spots to layout and, if you are diligent, it isn't too hard to find chairs that are shaded. The pool was a little cold but not too bad. Very pretty pool and quite big, not very busy with people. Some kids but nothing that bothered a couple honeymooners. Hot tubs by pool were nice and rarely occupied. Overall, I was very satisfied with the beach/pool. It gets a little windy in the afternoons at the Westin, but it's nothing that should ruin your day. The hotel staff was nice from my experience. I'm not incredibly demanding so I had little contact with them. Didn't even look for workout room, got enough of a workout swimming and walking up and down the beach. No problems with timeshare people. Basically no problems at all. If you are looking for a great location, great room, great beach/pool, you won't be disappointed. As I said earlier, we stayed at the Four Seasons after the Westin, and I by the end of the trip, I think I liked the Westin Villas more than the Four Seasons. Even if you get a room facing the construction, I think the Westin VIllas would be worth your time. In closing, I have the feeling that most of the negative/average reviews are from very picky people. This is a wonderful hotel, I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd time experience”
Reviews.Author: oc4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe Ocean View One Bedroom Suite as we did last year. Both times we paid a lot ($400-500 per night) but both times we weren't disappointed. We got the view we expected (ocean and pool) and tons of space. People who go at the super low special rates are of course going to get a construction and/or parking lot view. This year the construction is almost unnoticeable. It is hidden to the far side of the hotel which you never see unless you were driving up toward Kapalua. No noise and no problems. Love the Heavenly beds (no icky bedspreads) and the shower is fantastic too. If you are going to stay in a suite in Maui at a nice/luxury hotel you are looking at $700/night so I really prefer to stay at the Westin villas. You also get the benefit of the full kitchen and washer/dryer which is essential with kids. You can probably get a better deal on a condo but if you want to stay at a nice hotel with kids I highly recommend the Westin Villas. Yeah the pool was kind of cold but as the summer warms up I am sure it won't be a problem. Great snorkeling at the beach and love the proximity. Maid service is spotty but we just gave the front desk a call and they came the one day they forgot. I wouldn't necessarily recommend the hotel for honeymooners or 20 somethings (not much of a social scene) but again great for young families. Not too many kids or people at the pool - not hard to get a nice lounge chair (they have the nice padded wooden ones) and you can sit by the umbrellas if you get to the pool by 9am or so. I still think it's worth the money - I have stayed in a regular room at the Hyatt which is like $400 and the Westin suites are easily triple the size. Only the 1 restaurant which has decent food but you have your ktichen and you are so close to whaler's village and lahaina who cares...I got worried when I read the reviews before going this year but I definitely wasn't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui & Liked Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, the 1bdroom is great - very large and roomy and everything is new. This time of year seemed very good as the weather was great and the water was warm enough to swim (~78 degrees). One of the added benefits is that they are linked to the Sheraton and Westin one street up in Ka'anapali. To set expectations, there is not much as far as activity at the Westin Villas and the pool area is kind of bland (comparatively). The beach is often too windy and there is a lot of coral in the water (even at the beach edge), so if the water is rough, you may get cut up. The restaurant at the hotel is not good (avoid). One more comment, if you will be hung up about whether there is a parking lot between you and your Ocean View or if you have to look right to see the ocen in your ocean view room, you will not like it. We had Ocean View and had a parking lot between us and the ocean, we lt it go as we were on vacation and would be out at the ocean. Like I said, though, there is a FREE shuttle that runs every 10-15minutes all day and night long between the Westin Villas and the Sheraton/Westin Maui. At the Sheraton is Black Rock which has some great snorkeling and a jump off point at the top of the rocks. The pool area is wonderful at the Sheraton. You can charge anything at the Sheraton and Westin back to your room at the Westin Villas. We rented boogie boards, went snorkeling, lounged in the river-like pool, had drinks at the pool bar. You can also get your towels from the Sheraton. There are also plenty of really nice restaurants in Ka'anapali, Kapalua, and Lahaina to eat instead of the Westin Villas restaurants and we bought groceries from Safeway for breakfast and some lunches. It is not a money thing, you will prefer to eat chicken nuggets from the freezer section that eat the food at the hotel. Some nice restaurants are: Plantation House (Kapalua), Vino Italian Tapas (Kapalua Golf Course), Longhis (Lahaina), and you must do either the Old Lahaina Luau or the Feast at Lele (includes fire dance). So, stay at the Westin Villas for the extremely nice rooms and take the shuttle to the Sheraton for your water activites. You will enjoy the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Kaanapali...overrated”
Reviews.Author: outtolunch55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November of "05". I have to agree that the place was AVERAGE at best. I think some of the people who own here really overrate the place. We are NOT owners and payed about $275 per night for the studio room that faced the construction site from HELL. LOUD noises EVERY day. Even though we were in and out, the noise got OLD fast! COLD pool...too cold for our son! It was PRETTY to look at, but what good is it if you can't use it? Housekeeping? Where were they? I paid for maid service but they "forgot" several days in a row! When they did come, the job was mediocre. MANY people were MAD, and I don't think the resort is ready for "prime time" yet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average - but just slightly”
Reviews.Author: Debye
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I had a last-minute opportunity to stay at this resort the first week in May, and based on the reviews here I almost passed it up. While I am glad that I made the decision to stay there, I am not convinced that I would go back. We got great value. If I was paying $300+ per night, I would NOT feel that way. First the negtives: We were fortunate enough to stay at this resort at the Friends and Family rate of $125 per night. We knew that this would mean we would get the worst room in the hotel, and Iwe were not disappointed.
