Our first-floor construction view room gave us the sights and sounds of the next phase of construction 6 days a week from 7am on... and even when there was no construction happening, we could not open the sliding glass doors because the air conditioning unit for what seemed like the entire building was right outside the doors. There was no lanai in our room, but fresh air might have been nice. While we got what we expected in terms of a room, it seemed like we might have been the only ones. Every time I was at the front desk, I was next to someone who was unhappy about their room. It appears that everyone was on owner who reserved an ocean view room a year ago and is now stuck inthe back of some building and they want to be moved. Now. It's no wonder the front desk people were cranky - and they were. Housekeeping - They have different schedules for owners versus nightly folks. We got no housekeeping the first day because we were incorrectly identified as owners. Housekeeping also seems to come VERY late in the day, and there is no opportunity to ask for early service by way of a door-hanger like you can at many places. Out of 5 days, we had no husekeepingthe first day and turned it down another day because they came as we were getting just getting back to the room to shower for dinner. Gym - Very high windows, no view although it FACES THE OCEAN - seems like a wate of the view to me, and it felt like a prison. Beach chairs - It was $39 per day for 2 beach chair rentals. Why? Timeshare sales - Very pushy about signing up for the presentation, which we never did. Check-In/Check-Out - Check in at 4pm, check out at 10 am. They mean this. Now the positives: The room was wonderful. Spacious, comfortable, loved the full kitchen! We went the grocery store and stocked up on breakfast items and also had a few lunches inside - beasts the $11 from the pool bar for a veggie wrap! Very comfortable bed. Beautiful property. Loved the grills and the outdoor tables for eating. Never ate at the hotel restaurant, so can't address othres concerns in this area. Nice location. Convenient to get to Lahaina, but not as crowded as Kaanapali 'proper'. Pool - Temperature was comfortable - but then again, it was nice warm weather that first week in May, so the pool was refreshing! Value - We had a smoking rate. That made a lot of the negative stuff easier to swallow. In closing, if you get a great deal (I saw someone say they paid $600 for 6 nights bplus a rental car credit) in my opinion this would be a great place to stay. At $300+ per night, I would think that you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Time At The Westin!”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at this resort and agree the bad comments appear to be unwarranted. This was my second stay at the resort and am ready to go back. The first thing I would like to coment upon is the wind. First of all the Westin is not responsible for the wind. For those of you who do not get to Maui that often, let me tell you, during this time of the year, it is always windy here. The Wailea side is calm. During the months around Septemper the Trade Winds change and it is calm and hot at the Westin KOR. So if you do not like the wind do not go during the months it is windy! The other comment I would like to address is the pool being cold. I was at the resort during Easter weekend and the pool temp was great! The only problem I had was with all the kids. But what do you expect at Easter time! The only complaint I have of the Westin, is that the Jacuzzi specifically states children under 14 are not allowed. However, this was not enforced. At any given time there was between 10 & 15 unsupervised kids in the Jacuzzi, leaving no room for us adults. At one point, I even counted 22. That's right 22! While I don't mind a few supervised kids in there, this was out of control. I beleive it was especially bad since our room was above the Jacuzzi and could hear the kids all day and night. I decided to resolve this problem by selling back my ocean view room and as of next year, will have an ocean front room at the resort next door. Everything else went great. The staff was wonderful as was the service. We had a small maintanence problem that was quickly delt with. The food at the resort, is good but not great. However, you can not beat the fact it is so convienant. Having the little store and market is a plus as well. We took the shuttle to the Sheraton and snorkeled at Black Rock and then had breakfast there. This was the best breakfast buffet I have ever had! Later we took the shuttle to the Westin, or actually to Whaler's Village for some shopping and dinner at Leilanie's. This was very good and much less expensive than the hotel food. Keep up the good work KOR as we will be back next year at the KOR North in our ocean front room! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Simply... 'Paradise'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back and it was great.....yeah!.. the pool was extremely cold, but the snorkeling and the easy access beach diviing made up for it...the location is perfect...easy driving to downtown and nearby shopping.....if you're not driving ?...the resort provides a complimentary shuttle service between the Villas and the hotels(Sheraton and Westin Maui)..there is a huge shopping mall 'Whaler's Village' right next to the Westin Maui -great shopping for unique island trinkets...or maybe just for a McDonalds cheeseburger and fries! ......there's only 1 restaurant at the villas and it stops serving meals at 9pm with no exceptions!..we found out the hard way!........however, Tropica at the Westin Maui was excellent !..the ocean view and best view of the sunset on the island made it priceless...the buffet breakfast there was also bountiful (and pricey @$25/person)...also try cocktails and lunch at the Sheraton poolside (their lazy river style pool is alot warmer!).... the snorkeling in front of the Sheraton is easy entry and very calm (Black Rock) compare to in front of the Villas....they make it easy for you to stay at 1 hotel and play at 3 hotels with the shuttle service, you can also make charges to your room from any of the 3 hotels ....we had a 1bedroom villa and it was very spacious, the bed and linens were the signature Heavenly Beds as well as the dual head 2 person shower and jacuzzi tub....the constant island breeze was so relaxing and the lanai (patio) made it easy to enjoy....there are also stainless steel Kitchenaid bbq grills and dining areas oceanfront if you prefer to stay in...you can purchase pre-marinated, steaks, chicken, kabobs etc... in the hotel deli..they also provide grilling utensils if needed...the deli had a little of everything-snacks, icecream, wine, coffee, pastries, gift items, you name it ! ...the prices were comparable to shops elsewhere- it was great for last minute presents...Overall it was a great experience, and fortunately we did not get a construction view which is going to be there until 2008 ! ..I hope this is helpful to all who read it !...Aloha !...Maui is the Best.....it is Paradise.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not sure what prompted some of the bad reviews and comments of some other visitors our stay was great. The rooms are spacious and above average for finishes. Mix up in adjoining rooms which was corrected the next day. We only paid for an island view and had a slightly indirect view of the ocean. No disruption with construction noise. Pool was not cold..... not sure what others expected. The kids pool was great for toddlers... my son was it in constantly. Beach wasn't as nice as the Sheraton but most of the coast isn't. Restaruant food was great. No pressure from staff to purchase time share. In fact we had to contact them to find out more info... and ended up buying! Really good family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - great snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a bit worried, but boy was I pleasantly surprised. The property, despite the construction, was beautiful, the past pool problems appear to have been solved, and the rooms were comfortable, spacious and beautifully appointed. My only complaint is the one, and fairly mediocre restaurant. But the real highlight of the properly is the snorkeling right off the Westin beach is fantastic! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the begining of April in the Eve and was excited to arrive and stay at the Westin until we opened the door in our room to our balcony only to see" 3 GIANT CRANES" and lots of CONSTRUCTION!! Beware if you are in Building "C" facing north and above the second floor, you will be seeing the same thing!! And it didn't end there. At approx 6:30 AM the following morning and every morning we were there the constuction began including sounds of Cement Trucks, THE CRANES, Hammers, Jack Hammer type noise etc... The very next morning my Wife and I met with "Dawn" who welcomed us with some Hotel gift certificates and invited us to a "Time Share Presentation". She could sense that we were not happy with our room and did try to help us with the front desk to try to change rooms but was unsucessful. The front desk told me to check back in 2 days for a possible change but again was unsucessful. The front desk person told me that they would have the manager get a hold of me but they NEVER did.The swimming pool was FREEZING and the "Hawaiian Trade Winds" didn't help. We went to the "Time Share Presentation" and met with "Chip" who was trying to get us excited to buy a share but at a starting price of $45,000 and nearly a $2000 dollar per year maint. fee, he was going to face Mount Everest in Hawaii and me at the top to convince me to spend a penny to buy a share. If the resort wants it's guest to buy a Time Share they shouldn't have put us where they did and showed lack of professional courtesy. All in all the grounds were beautiful and the room was nice. After the experience I would not return as there are significantly better choices like the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua where we stayed 3 years prior.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for Families”
Reviews.Author: skatz
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and kids age 11 and 13)just returned from an enjoyable stay in a one bedroom at the Villas. Having stayed at the Westin Maui Resort on our honeymoon some 15 years ago, now that we have our children with us, we appreciated the extra room the Villas provided. Mom and Dad had their own bedroom with a very comfortable king size bed. The kids slept on a queen size pull out couch in the living room. The full kitchen enabled us to stock up at the Safeway in Lahaina and save around $50 per day by simply eating breakfast in the unit. We also made some of our own lunches and ate them either poolside or at the tables adjacent to the barbeque grills the resort has installed for the use by resort guests. In addition, the washer/dryer in the unit enabled us to keep the dirty laundry to a minimum. The bathroom is huge, with a whirlpool tub, a two person shower and a large vanity with two sinks. The big fluffy robes where a hit with the kids, and housekeeping brought us all the extra towels we needed. I have read the prior recent reviews and I agree that the pool was way too cold. We were told that it was not being heated due to the island-wide propane shortage, however, I question the veracity of this story. Notwithstanding the cold termperature, however, my son spent hours in the pool, and the ocean water was warm, so the temperature of the pool did not affect my review as much as it apparantly did others. Snorkeling at the beach at the resort was fantastic, better in fact than some of the snorkel trips that you might pay for (which we did as well). We saw hundreds of fish, as well as turtles and an octopus within 40 yards of the beach at the resort. My kids also took the resort scuba class and went on their first dive at the beach at the resort (I am a certified diver and went along with them). We found the staff at the resort to be very courteous, even if the concierge did get the time wrong on several dinner reservations and always asked if we wanted a tour of the new units being constructed (read - timeshare sales pitch). The poolside restaurant served tasty food for both the kids and the adults. There was also poolside service of food and drinks. In sum, I would highly recommend the Villas for families with children. During our stay, there were lots of kids playing on the grounds, and my son made at least one friend with whom he spent time playing on the grounds and in the pool. The resort is new and beautifully maintained inside and out. Parking is free and is plentiful. I would probably not recommend the Villas to newly-weds or couples without children who are looking for a more quiet, exotic Hawaiian experience. For them, I recommend South Maui which is certainly quieter and more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort, hard to get a room with ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Villa during Spring Break after we received an invitation to stay for a promotional rate which included credit towards food and car rental. We got a studio and I love the fact that there is a washer and dryer, as well as a full size refrigerator in the room. Our room was nice, standard for Westin, except they gave us a non-ocean view facing the construction site. I understand that since we got a bargain and we are not an owner, I did not expect much as far as view is concerned. I thought that the property was well kept, pool was okay (cold!!) however, rather small compared to other major resorts in Maui. Considering what we paid, I think we got a bargain, compared to others who might have paid over $300 - $500 a night, or even worse having purchased the time share. We kept running into owners who complained so much about how hard it was for them to get a reservation (many of them made it one year in advance), as well as not getting what was promised by the sales people. I can understand their frustration; I would be upset if after having paid so much money (probably between $40k-$100k) I need to call every month, every week, or even every day to reserve ocean view, something that was promised to you anyway when you purchased the property. Honestly I think the management oversold the units; every day I see tons of people from the other Westin resort and Sheraton coming to "preview" the property and pressured by the sales people to purchase their new units. We were also pressured to go to the sales presentation however we never returned their phone calls after hearing all the comments from the current owners. All in all, this is an okay property if you don't have to pay too much money to stay here. There are a lot of other nicer resorts in Maui, for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware - Pool and Staff cold!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We purchase because the property is gorgeous as are the rooms - but in Maui you want to be outside. We were promised with our purchase we would also have the use of the Westin Hotel & Spa and the Sheraton. We were excited to spend spring break here. Weather was not great but that is out of everyone's control. can't be down at the beach when the sand takes your skin off - LOL! Good thing there is a pool - NOT! It's freezing!!!!!! What do you do with kids when they turn blue after 3 minutes in the "heated" pool? And you can't use the jacuzzi because there is 30 little kids in it and it's green - yuck! Little question to staff was responded to in a hostile aggressive manner - I guess I was not the only one complaining. Kind of sad when you walk around a beautiful pool and there is not a soul in it. Guess it should have been a sign. When we asked to go to one of the other hotels promised they said they took that program away. Too many people from Villas "invading" the hotel. Well the quick solution would be to heat the pool. I would not buy here and will definately trade or sell. We also own a Marriott Ka'anapali and have never had a problem - we have been 12 times in the last 4 years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: cindi and kevin
Reviews.Content: Having booked The Villas as an exchange for our Westin Timeshare in Colorado, we were avidly following all the reveiws for 5 months and were real nervous about the construction. We lucked out and requested Bldg B (as told to by a previous review). We did not request a certain floor or view--just bldg B and not C. Our one bedroom was incredible--beautiful overlooking the park and could see the ocean from our patio. It was plenty large enough for us and our married daughter and son-in-law. Baths are wonderful. Location is great, resort is very quiet, great people and nice van to take down to Whalers Village every 15 minutes. Beach very nice--no problems getting chairs around the pool and concerige (Lisa the Best) booked all our restaurants and golf. Great Grills on site that they scrub daily--we cooked dinners, lunchs--this place is wonderful IF you don't face the construction which will not be completed until 07. Restaurants to die for and pricey--Sansei and David Pauls. Great places to have cocktails and watch the sun set--Hula Grill and Leilanis at Whalers Village. The reviews that slam this place are only those whose rooms face the construction---everyone we talked to thought the Villas were heaven sent.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place with great service, but not the view you can count on”
Reviews.Author: simbacrystal
Reviews.Content: I am a new vacation owner at the Ocean Resort Villas. Having made reservations 9 months before my arrival in a one bedroom premium deluxe suite, I was shocked when I opened the door to my brand new beautifully decorated unit. The large balcony in the livingroom and bedroom directly faced an enormous construction crane and work site with a slight ocean view. Although I could detect the ocean, I faced the construction crane on the fifth floor. I was devasted and immediately left the unit to request a room change. There was no way I could sit on my balcony with that view. Prior to arriving at the Westin, I contacted reservations about 4 or 5 times to ensure that I would have a pool and ocean view. I was told that they had my request for a 6th floor unit facing the pool and ocean. Management was not willing to change my unit, as they were filled to occupancy as I was told. I was also told that since I booked late for owners, there was some first come first choice policy I was subject to. I was absolutely furious and demanded a change of units. Having traveled over ten hours by air, and paying more than a luxury car for my vacation ownership, I expected to be pleased by my view, not sickened by it. I threatened all sorts of actions, because I felt I had been subject to fraud and deception. I demanded that the daily renters be given those units, not the owners; who had invested a lot more than weekly rates. Actually no one should have had to face the construction site, unless they wanted to, at a discount rate. I can't even imagine what the noise was like. I was not told that I would be able to move or be accommodated that day. I felt that this was the worst mistake in my entire life. In my lifetime of travel, I had never experienced a situation like this. Management was so insensitive. The next day, several units became available with better locations. I picked one, but had to wait until 2 pm to move. Two days of my seven were wasted on packing, and repacking. There were some mishaps with our luggage and belongings in the move as well. I met several other owners who had unhappy similar experiences with the construction views. With anger like mine, some were able to move. For my inconvenience I demanded some compensation. I was offerred some room credit as well as points. I really wanted another vacation that was not spoiled by such a horrible experience. That was not provided to me. My anger and stress compromised my immune system. I developed a slight infection which prevented me from going swimming, or engaging in normal athletic activities that I routinely do. I never swam in the Pacific or in the beautiful but crowded pool or hot tub. Eventually both my anger and infection subsided as I was able to gaze out my balcony and look at the ocean. The Pool side restaurant was excellent. The concierge terrific. I felt like I had a personal assitant arranging all my travel plans very well. Although it took some persistance finding chairs by the pool, it was very pleasant there. The property, except for the construction site was beautiful and well maintained. Maintainence throughout the hotel was excellant. Their schedule of daily activities on the grounds with crafts was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin is getting greedy”
Reviews.Author: djaddis
Reviews.Content: I must start out by saying we stayed in Wailea, at the Fairmont Kea Lani the first part of our trip, prior to meeting my inlaws (who are owners) at the Westin Ocean Villas. We loved the Fairmont (see my review of that separately) and were sad to leave. I was really worried about our location and the construction at the WEstin and did lots of research, on this site and others, before our trip. We called at least 3 times explaining that we had a 2 yr old and were seriously considering purchasing a time share (we were as we love Hawaii and the planned expansion in Kauai is very appealing-our favorite island). When we were in Wailea, we also called and checked on our room. We had booked a Deluxe island view ($500/night) which we thought would be fairly quiet and somewhat nice albeit not an ocean view. When we checked in, we were given a 6th floor room in Bldg 4 directly facing the huge crane and the road of traffic. It was extremely loud- all rooms seem to be pretty loud here. After several calls, and rude service we were moved to a much better unit. Our parents however were not and sadly are facing the crane the remainder of the week. The rooms are great though, typical westin and I think are better than most on the island. My major issue with this property is that it feels very crowded and I think with the new units going up next door it will be a madhouse unless they create more open space. After staying at the Fairmont- where we paid less for a suite- where it was lush and quiet I felt like were sardines on the lounge chairs here. It is pretty and I love the room but for the # of units they need more green space, pools and lounge areas. Aside from that, call me snobby but I am just not a fan of Kaanapalli- when we return we will definitely be staying in WAilea, most likely at the Fairmont- where there is impeccable service, much more class and for a moderate suite, a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyCris
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was uncomparable. The room was very spacious with a view of the golf course (even numbered rooms basically have the garden view whereas odd numbers generally have the ocean view) which wasn't disappointing in the least. Of course, there was the Heavenly Bed that was so comfortable for a hotel bed. My husband sells mattresses, so I can speak as an expert on this subject. The service was excellent. The shower has two heads, one for your head and one to massage your body at the same time. They have a huge selections of items you can have sent to your room if you forget them. I didn't travel with my kids, but if you bring them, check first with the hotel before you pack a ton of stuff. They even offer a jogging stroller. We were served poolside, and the wait wasn't long for food and drinks either. The pool was EXCELLENT. They have an 87,000 square foot pool area with several levels, a waterslide, and a jacuzzi tunnel. You'd be tempted not to go to the beach! Also, the location was great, adjacent directly to Whaler's Village and a short stroll to Black Rock, one of West Maui's best snorkel spots.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone Should go It's paradise”
Reviews.Author: HPGR195H
Reviews.Content: We went there in jan. with the 5 night special. we had read and were anxios about some of the comments and it was our honeymoon. we can not begin to tell you how thrilled we were with this beaut. resort. it is one of the best on maui. a big thank-you to tanya who made this a memorable time. beaut. room upgrade, the studio and the 1 bed. ov are gourgeous, great treatment and grounds, we will come back again and again, again a big shout out for TANYA thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the view and service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are oceanview owners of the resort and made our reservation early. We still got a parking lot view. Management was quick to point out that we did have an ocean view when we stood out on our lanai and looked past the parking lot. I have asked several times for an explanation as to why we were assigned such a poor room, but I have not yet received a response. Lots of promises were made at the point of sale which did not turn out to be true. Seems like being an owner of this resort means you are down-graded on there lists.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bulatada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several resorts in the Ka'anapali area and this is one of our favorites. We are not owners and no one ever bothered us about attenting the time share presentation. The rooms were clean and spacious. We stayed in building 4. The view was amazing. The pool area is very nice. We went scuba diving right outside of the hotel. We saw turtles, eels, eagle ray, and many tropical fish. From the beach we saw a couple whales. The beach area is nice- not as nice as the beach on the other side of black rock. Don't miss Warren and Annabelles in Lahaina. We spent a month on Maui this year and we hope to be back soon. Love the Westin. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: love_going_vacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most beautiful resort on the island. It is a perfect place for a family vacation. The beach is fantastic. We saw turtles many times. I highly recommend this place. I was there with my family and we all had a blast. It is a real pearl on Kaanapali Beach. I will definitely go there again. Rooms are very clean, very comfortable. What a beautiful place. Perfect choice for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it but started off bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We purchase a Deluxe Ocean View Lockoff preconstruction in 2003 when staying in Maui. We had our first visit to the Villas in September 2005. The resort looks great but as much as we enjoyed our stay it was a little bumpy. It started out that we booked 1 day out of our owner preferred booking time so we were put into a room in the back building (behind the two buildings on the beach) and as the Hawaiianâ€™s say â€œHe kuikawa ka 'ikena o kela wahi ho'oku ka'a e waiho kala'e ihola ma 'o!â€� (This view of your parking lot is incredible!) We asked them how we purchased an ocean view room and we end up with a parking lot view. They said that you could see the ocean past the parking lot. Also we were on the second floor so we would sit on the balcony and look into the windshield of people pulling into a parking spot. When we signed up they told us we would never be out of the building where our unit number we purchased was. That turned out not to be true in their presentation. Also we were told that owners were the only ones to have access to the underground parking (that goes fast) and that turned out not to be a true statement during the sale either. We asked to be moved and they could move us the next day but we had to check out early, wait in the long like at check in with everyone else at 3:00 and that try and get our bags delivered by 5 or 6 PM. So there went one whole day. Once we settled in it was nice. The rooms are great but not kept very clean. Great amenities but stains on the carpet and dirt on the tile. One of the Jacuzzi tubs did not work and was not fixed until the last day. The food was not great at the restaurant and was expensive. The beach was nice and quiet with great snorkeling but the beach was smaller and steeper than when we stay at the Sheraton. I actually find the Sheraton to be the prime location of Kaâ€™anapali beach and we might trade in our villa to stay there again. We stayed at the Sheraton a few days before going to the villas and it was nothing but perfect. I realize that the report is harsh and makes it sound as if we did not enjoy the villas at all but we are not sorry we purchased. We have used the points all over the world. The resort is well done if they learn to keep it up. They did listen to our complaints for a few hours and took notes because their goal and ours is for the villas to be a wonderful place to stay. We are going back this next July and I hope the experience is better than the last visit. The things they are adding should be an improvement once they are done with the construction (which can be a loud experience depending on where your rooms is). If you are an owner and have seen problems it is important that we bring it to their attention so that it gives them a chance to respond. I still believe it is one of the best properties they have and I realize that many of the problems we encountered were because they had just opened two buildings a month before and were trying to run it with the staff that was set up for one building. They are expanding their villas to other islands (Hawaii, Oahu and Kauai) so owning Kaâ€™anapali is a huge advantage to getting into the other Hawaiian resorts. They have the max amount of points offered out of all the villas. I would have liked nothing more than to have a glowing report about the Westin Villas and I even waited a few months to report but I had to be honest and I have faith that some of the bumps will be ironed out.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, even if you are a Starwood Owner, you might get construction view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed a at the resort for 6 nights. We had booked a Studio Suite for a week as a trade within the Starwood Ownership program in April 2005 for our long awaited honeymoon. Needless to say, we were very disappointed when we arrived and had a partial view of the ocean on the 5th floor and a FULL view of the new construction next door! We checked in on Saturday and I immediately requested that we be moved, but the front desk told us there was nothing else available. I requested that they notify me ASAP, as I knew Monday morning the construction workers would return and we would get some noise. Well, Monday morning came and the front desk was still saying nothing was available, but management would contact me. Tuesday morning.....no call from management. I was very frustrated because we could not open the windows or really enjoy the balcony during the day and at night there were no lights on that side of the building so you could not see anything from the balcony. The last straw in this saga was when we went on the Volcano Bike ride and on the way back from the bike ride in the van to the hotel, I was speaking to another couple who was staying at the same place They bragged about how horrible their own timeshare was, but they had traded through Interval (II) and got a Studio at the wonderful Westin. And to it off, they were graciously upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite when they arrived! That was a slap in the face for me being a Starwood owner. On Wednesday of my 7 day stay, management finally offered me 10,000 starpoints for the inconvenience.....another slap!! I insisted on more points and got them, but I was very disappointed as an Starwood owner. You would have thought that I would have received more consideration. So it was a lesson learned.......deposit my week into Interval and I will get better accommodations instead of trading withing Starwood! All in all, the resort is beautiful otherwise and is a great place to stay. It was wonderful to be right on the beach. The grounds are well kept and pleasant. Just beware of the construction view in Building C!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kcarpen1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Westin Ocean Villa's. We loved it! We stayed in a studio that was more than I had imagined it would be. The room was a perfect size for two people with a large "Heavenly Bed", that was very heavenly! Small but more than adequate kitchen. A huge bathroom with separate toilet area, large walk in corner shower, granite top vanity and sink and a really nice Jacuzzi tub that has a shutter like door that opened into the bedroom area. A large screen TV, Bose sound system and a DVD player really topped things off. There is a nice table, couch and coffee table as well. Outside the pool is huge, great for kids. There were a lot of people there, I was told the resort was full but we never has a hard time getting a chair by the pool, by the way they're nice, puffy, padded pool chairs! Also the poolside gas barbeque grills were an added bonus. They are nice, large gourmet like grills, each with there own cooking station. We brought out our own burgers to grill for lunch. The beach was great! Sea turtle and tons of fish right off shore. We rented gear from Boss Frogs for both of us, snorkel, fins and boogie boards for $65/wk. I would strongly recommend using Boss Frog's snorkel map for snorkeling instead of buying a snorkeling trip. We did both, went out on the Pride of Maui to the Molokini crater. The boat tour was a lot of fun and the staff were fabulous but were saw a lot more stuff snorkeling off the beaches on the Boss Frog map. Napili and Kapalua beaches/coves were the best! We had a great time and would go back to the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Villa's again.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing Honeymoon here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin villas on our honeymoon, through an exchange on Interval and our stay here was incredible. We were a bit worried as we heard there was some construction going on, but it was on the opposite side of the building we were in (we stayed in building B) and it was not an issue. The staff was friendly, the resort was clean and the rooms were fantastic. We had a "partial" ocean view, we could watch the sunset from our balcony which was nice. We loved the 1 bedroom suite, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was huge, with an awesome jacuzzi tub. The pool area was great, lots of lounge chairs and quite quiet. The beach is nice and close and we totally loved the snorkeling and saw tons of cool fish, eels, turtles. We bought snorkel gear in town ($30) instead of renting it for $45 for the week. It did rain a bit here and there but it was refreshing and would only last for a couple of minutes (plus made for some fantastic rainbows). Otherwise the weather was great, sunny and hot every day. The restaurant was pretty good and it was nice that they had a store but if you are going to stay here, you should go into Lahanai to the Safeway to buy food and booze as it is way cheaper. All in all, we had a great honeymoon and we would definately come back here if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cal04
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Westin Mission Hills in Rancho Mirage in California and did not have any problems making reservations at this resort. We had a partial view of the ocean and the villa was large and comfortable for our family of four with two adult children. The resort was very nice, the pool was fun, the beach and snorkling was great, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative that I can think of is that the fitness center is in the basement with no windows or view. I understand that the expansion that is being constructed will include a nicer fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time at this beautiful Westin. Can't say enough about how accomedating the staff was, every staff member I encountered smiled and greeted me, asked if everything was ok. Every request was met. The 1 bedroom was more than enough room for two people. the privacy was great to have, the furnishings were very tasteful and even the sofa bed was very comfortable, more so than a lot of reg. beds I have slept on. The pool is very nice a little chilly, could use another pool. The only resturant on the site is not what I would expect, compared to the rest of the resort, altho your very close to lots of other fine dinning. The location is awesome, beautiful sunsets, wonderful spot to sit and watch the sun go down. The snorkeling is excelent, be sure to get good gear, I would recomend renting from some other place not at the resort. Put on your mask walk out into the ocean about 5 steps, and start swiming with beautiful fish and sea turtles. AWESOME!! will return soon I hope

Reviews.Title: “Top Tier Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the most part, this resort is amazing. My family fell in love with the facilities. As everyone is stating, the rooms are 5 star, in line with a Four Seasons Hotel if not better. This property is more like a W Hotel than a Westin. We attended via a Promo for $650 for 5 nights; a great deal. We even got bumped up to a 1BR, though we had no view. We had a unit on 1st floor in Bldg C. Be wary of stranger or thieves trying to enter your lanai. The kitchen was great as we cooked half of the time. The lobby area was beautiful; staff was great including front desk, concierge, pool staff. The pool area was good too. The gym was good though it should not be so far back of the hotel. Bathrooms were huge and beautiful; jacuzzi tub was a very nice and the Heavenly Bed was heavenly. I was very impressed that they had Bose stereo as the speakers to the TV. The hallways of the buildings were very very nice, clean, and professional. The store was well stock and fairly priced. The restaurant was ok, not great but not bad; of course overpriced for what you get; but it was worth the ambiance of seeing the sunset during dinner. I agree w/ everyone that non-timeshare owners do not get the best room views. We got no view facing another building but a 1BR is better than a studio so I'm not complaining. We were so impressed with this resort that we bought a Timeshare(we already own one in Cabo so not sure how I got roped into this; had to be good)at the new one they are building(Villas North). The view as you enter the lobby area is very impressive as you see the water and palm trees. To compete w/ Marriott, Starwoods needs to expand its properties and get rid of Sheraton; Westin is great, Sheraton is not. This property is one another level above Marriott in terms of quality of rooms. We went in mid Oct and the weather was great; never rain; sunny everyday. Beach was wonderful though could have been more blue water. Went to visit the Westin Maui and Sheraton; Sheraton was very lame and old while Westin was old and cramped; clearly Westin K Villas is the crown jewel of Starwoods Maui properties. Bottomline, this is a great place; not perfect but a wonderful place to take the family; like a get away vacation home; better quality than most peoples homes. If you can afford it, buy one. If you can't take advantage of the promos before they end.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui many times, but this was our first stay at the Westin Villas. The units are beautiful and very spacious. The full kitchen + washer/dryer are excellent features. It is situated in a very relaxed area of Kaanapali beach - outstanding views of the ocean (though watch out for the coral close to the water break!) The onsite restaurant food quality was very good and less expensive than other close by dining options! Our only recommendation would be for additional staff at the pool area. Otherwise, we would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “The "Orlando" of Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: chorncast
Reviews.Content: OK........going here with the kids is perfect, but stay far, far away if this is your choice for a romantic couple trip. This literally reminded me of a cross between Grand Central and the Magic Kingdom. Busy, croweded, mega-resort that kids will love. Great location, ridiculous prices ($8 for a ham biscut), and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Restraunt prices and service”
Reviews.Author: Vacationspots
Reviews.Content: The onsite restraunt needs some work; never had utensils, napkins or condiments on the tables. Always had to ask for them, with a slow response. Food was decent but way over priced, $2 to $3.00 per item more than in Lahaina or Whaler's Village. If Westin wonders why people bring so many items to the units in the form of soft drinks, wine and liquor its because their bar prices are outrageously high. $5.50 for a beer, $7.00 for well drink. Last year the Sheraton next door had great happy hours at $3.00 for a Gin and Tonic. A little consideration for the people who stay there might keep people from going to Whaler's Village for Happy Hour.

Reviews.Title: “Problems reserving date ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are contemplating taking up the "deals" being offered up at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas be aware of what you are getting into. It sounds like a great deal at first ... 700 with free car for 5 nights in Maui in a villa but here's the kicker ... they don't tell you what a PAIN it was to try and get a date. I had even asked when the "nice sales person" was trying to get me to purchase the packet ... is it hard to get a date? Oh NOOO! It's VERY easy. Just try to call about 60 days ahead! Truth is ... I tried at first a month out ... o.k. too early, no go; 4 months out ... again, too early; 7 months out, nothing; fine 13 months out ... too far in advance. I got to a point where I was thinking I had to just take initial the $400 already paid into it as a loss and a lesson learned on my part never to fall for something like this again. The operators were HORRIBLE ... they acted like they were doing you a favor to get you a date. TOTALLY not customer oriented AT ALL! YOU had to keep calling back ... and they advised NUMEROUS times a day to try to get a date ... not only that ... every week and a half or so, their system updates and they have no access to any dates for a few days or so at a time ... but YOU are the one who needs to keep calling back. I even asked well, can someone call me back when the system updates ... nope. You need to call back. To top it off, they tell you not to book an airline flight until you get a date ... well, in my situation, I was trying to get our family over on mileage flights ... well, that's pretty hard to get in general ... but ... you had to wait to get a date from them first, then wait 2 weeks or so for their confirmation letter to arrive BEFORE you book your air because any changes on their part is an additional $25. I really thought I had to climb all these hurdles to get an actual date. We FINALLY were able to get an agent that actually was actually sympathetic to the customer and was willing to call back when the system updated and dates were available to view on their system ... I finally got the date I was hoping for and had on hold with the airlines. I wound up calling Westin/Starwood Hotels again about a week later to see if the dates were confirmed and they were. But once you get your confirmation letter ... what really stood out ... your getting a "NON-VIEW" room. Which once again, they did not mention in the offer letter. When I called on it ... NOPE ... those are what are offered up on these offers. Anyways, we haven't gone yet to see how it will be but I will let you know when we do. Bottom line ... be aware what a headache you are getting into. I don't know if it will all be worth it in the end but I am hoping it is just remotely decent. Unfortunately when I was considering this offer, there were no reviews warning me of these hassels, otherwise, I probably would have DEFINITELY had second thoughts on purchasing the packet. Good luck to you!

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Problems B4 Even Getting There”
Reviews.Author: amazingthree
Reviews.Content: We could not believe how incredibly difficult it was to secure a reservation. After paying our deposit money, it was like trying to get help from FEMA to Hurricane Katrina victims. We honestly thought oh no how could Westin allow such a ripoff scam to take place. We were told to call back every few days because they did not have the manpower to note any preferences nor make a waiting list to call back. In the meantime, rates for jet fuel have skyrocketed even though we told Westin we would like to get a reservation set as soon as possible so we can secure our flight at a decent rate. But they simply did not care. One Westin agent was "empathetic" and said they will call me when something opened up. But guess what. No such luck. We tried to get a refund back on our deposit but Westin said tough luck. Once a deposit is made and X number of days lapse, too bad for you. Well Westin has caused all that time to lapse. So, after months and months, finally someone said ok there may be some dates open but that anything we wanted was already booked up. We ended up taking a mid-summer reservation for next year. Then, we got another shock. After getting the confirmation letter, it said NO VIEWS room. When we called back to get a clarification, they said they could not specify what kind of room we would get other than we would get a room on the specified reservation date. Remember this is BEFORE we even start our vacation! As you can see, why would anyone want to even contemplate purchasing a timeshare with Westin when all you get is aggravation. You would do a whole lot better just making a regular hotel reservation, specify the type of room and view you want, and secure a nice discount with a combined fly-hotel package. Morale of the story: Consumer buyers beware---stay away from Westin and you'll have a much more enjoyable vacation experience elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SonJon
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Westin resort, Kaanapali. Rooms: a bit small for the standard room, but very comfortable beds and nicely furnished. Pool: AAA+++.. I have two young boys.. they couldn't get enough of the pool and water slides. Get to the area around the small slide early if you have young ones. Its a great vantage point for watching the kids or joining them.. if you have older ones, head towards the bigger slide area. For those without kids, the adult pool is nice. Location: Convenient to Whalers Village for Leilanis or Hula Grill. Don't waste your time on buying a snorkel adventure, just walk down the beach to Black rock in front of the Sheraton and go out to the point for great fish and sea turtles! More food: The Luau at the Marriott was excellent.. Good entertainment and drinks and a great buffet.. go to Barefoot Toms for some pretty good pricing. The buffet breakfast at the Westin was OUTSTANDING. Its a real feast. Pricey, but worth it. Go late.. like 10 am, and you can just have two meals a day.. and kids are free. Service.. with one exception during lunch at the Westin, the other service was great.. Enjoy.. JKL

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: DSCmePleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: We were invited to stay at the Westin Hotel on the beach via a special deal that came in the mail. A good price $800 for 5 nights. Weâ€™ve always wanted to stay in one of these beach front hotels and play in their pools and walk out to the beach. When booking day came we were told that weâ€™d be staying in the Villas up the road because there wasnâ€™t space in the hotel the week we wanted. We were assured that we could still use the facilities at the Westin Hotel including the spa and pool. On top of that we could use the facilities at the Sheraton as well. When we arrived at the Villaâ€™s we were told we couldnâ€™t use the pools at the other hotels after all and that there was a new policy put in place banning use of the pools between the different policies. Strike One We booked a Luau through the hotels activities desk. Promising a good show, good food and open seating so weâ€™d be wise to get there early. We got to the luau early so we could get close seats and waited inline for 1 hour. Guess what, seating was open by section and we were in the back section. Talking to other guests at our table we found out that we paid a 150% more per ticket than other guests at our table! The Westin Villas obviously was not looking out for our interest or enjoyment on that evening. After that.. we priced a trip to Molikia through the hotel and ended up buying through a retailer downtown because the hotel wanted $170 more for the same trip. Strike Two. We were told as part of our package (prior to booking) that weâ€™d be expected to participate in a 1.5 hour presentation on ownership. We were up for that â€“ it was part of the deal and we were going to uphold our end of the deal. After about 2.5 hours of presentation and our answer (no thank you), we were asked why we had requested the tour and presentation. Apparently the sales pitch wasnâ€™t part of our deal and it was our choice to go or not go. But we were only told this after weâ€™d spent nearly 3 hours doing this wasted morning. Strike Three. So that is all the â€œnot good stuffâ€�. There is some good stuff. The room was VERY nice and spacious. We are a family of 4 and in a small suite we felt we had plenty of room. The rooms are very nicely decorated with big flat screen tv, dvd, and Bose radio. A jacuzzi tub, and double headed shower and separate toilet from the rest of the bathroom area. Kitchen was big enough with Small fridge, stove top, dishwasher, coffee maker, stacked washer and dryer. The exterior is pleasing and the pool area kept clean and neat. The beach had great snorkeling about 30 yards out! The restaurant had friendly service and the food wasnâ€™t bad (although expensive) what isnâ€™t in the Maui? If you can go on a good price like we did.. its worth it. But donâ€™t expect to be taken care of by the staff. Make your own plans for activities â€“ or go downtown to Lahina and purchase tickets from a discounter.

Reviews.Title: “Even owners can't depend on Westin to deliver”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Aloha
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have said that unless you are an owner at this property, you will probably not get an ocean view room. What I would like everyone to understand is that even owners can't depend on getting a room with a decent view either. I am the owner of an "Ocean View" unit at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort Villas and my family recently made our second visit there to use our timeshare. We love Hawaii and usually go to Maui due to the abundance of nature, activities, and the great people there. As another reviewer commented, Maui is getting over-developed, but we decided to purchase a timeshare at the Westin anyway, as it promised so much. We're now having second thoughts. Our first visit was fine, as the resort had just opened, and everyone at the Westin was focused on making things perfect. Our second visit last month was a disaster. Not only did they fail to put us in an Ocean View unit (my contract says I own one), but the front desk manager was unable to change our room and even claimed that all units are "partial ocean view" (who cares what a contract says anyway). We got a view of asphalt, tailpipes and back of building (more below). Definitely not what we travelled to Hawaii for. After complaining to Westin in writing, I was informed that the unit we were placed in is considered to be an "Ocean View" room. I've posted a picture I took from that unit's lanai - you decide for yourself whether you would agree that this is an Ocean View room. I doubt that Westin would want to use this in any advertisements. The main problem with this property, in my opinion, is that Westin got a bit greedy and decided to build a third building back behind the other two. The majority of the rooms in the newest structure, "Building C" provide views of not the ocean or pool area, but of the back of Building B, a huge parking lot, and/or the highway. Making reservations at this property is definitely hit-or-miss. Finally, if you plan to visit this property, please keep in mind that there are 3 buildings full of guests, so there is a huge demand for space. If you leave your towels, etc. on a beach chair next to the pool and go for a swim for a while, when you return you are likely to find that either your stuff has been removed or a friendly note has been placed there informing you that your stuff will be moved to the activities cabana due to "high demand for chairs." Also, don't plan on having an outdoor barbeque dinner if you like to have a drink with your meal - alcoholic beverages are banned from the barbeque / picnic table areas. Guess they want to keep people from lingering in that area, enjoying the sunset. Unfortunately that's exactly what I wanted to do, since I couldn't see the sunset from my own room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... But will be much better next year”
Reviews.Author: Mestermenn
Reviews.Content: We are owners at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean resort villas and stayed here in a Two Bedroom Ocean View Room for a week from July 24-31, 2005. What we found was a resort that was struggling with its growth. In late June, they opened two additional budilings to the resort basically doubling its size. They were woefully unprepared for the additional people that came with that opening. They did not have enough pool and beach chairs for everyone (the GM stated that 150 additonal chairs are on a barge to Maui right now), we asked for items that are promised to us as owners such as a high chair and diaper genie and they were completely out (the head of housekeeping told us that she requested additional from the GM prior to the opening but was told that they would not need the extras, and that they have since placed a large order), three of the six new BBQ grills were out of order, the landscaping was not even close to being done around the new units (this will be very nice in a year), and they did not have enough staff to handle check in or the bar restaraunt. They also canceled the "Stay at One, Play at All" pool benefits with the other Starwood resorts on Maui. They still had it on brochures and their website that were in the rooms after they told us at the desk it had been canceled. This cancelation came as no suprise to me after they opened the new buildings, but Greg Lundberg the GM has a long way to go in effective communication. There was no advance notice and they flyer under the glass notification at check in was unprofessional. The rooms and facilites are top notch, but it is clear that they are struggling. I think they need a new GM or need to give additonal training to Greg and his staff. This is the flagship property for Starwood Vacation Ownership and they have too much invested to allow it to fail. I know that an Orlando based management team was onsite at the end of stay assessing the changes that need to be made. I have stayed here in the past and will return next year in June. I fully expect that these minor kinks will be hammered out and that they will have appropriate staffing levels. Once that is done, this will be an unbelieveable resort that many will return to year after year. I would expect the fixes to come in relatively short order.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: highloyo
Reviews.Content: I will address the terrible service first since it left such a bad taste in my mouth. I feel because it is an "ownership resort" and hotel, the staff gets confused as to who are owners and who are hotel guests. Owners do not get daily housekeeping services unless they pay extra for it, whereas it is included for hotel guests. Well, we must have fallen off their list because 2 out of 5 days, we did not receive any service. The 1st instance, after returning from sightseeing at 6:30pm, our room was still not cleaned/made up. I called to complain and their reason was they had a number of people checking out and were behind. I countered that it isn't my problem and that I would like the room cleaned and fresh towels. Fortunately, we had 2 extra towels. Well, someone finally came at 7:30, so we dcided to leave for a quick dinner. When we returned, our room was serviced rather poorly. The trash was emptied, but the beds were made quite sloppily. the worst thing, though, was all the dirty towels were taken away but not a frsh towel was left, we had not a single towel, not even a face cloth. I called the front desk immediately and they said we would have some sent up. I waited over an hour and by now it was bed time. We never received towels. The next morning I stormed downstairs demanding to speak with the manager after explaining my plight to the desk clerk. She offered to get me some pool towels for now which I declined. Her supervisor saw how upset I was and said someone will deliver towels to my room asap and offered a $50 credit. I told her $50 does not even cover the inconvenience, time and aggravation I spent. The second instance happened on our 3rd night where we again had to call for service once returning in the early evening. It took over an hour for someone to service our room but it was still inconvenient to have to leave once we returned to relax. The desk clerks are rude and not customer-oriented. They have a "there's nothing I can do at the moment" attitude. I don't think I was out of line either. DVD's can be rented on a daily basis through a credit card machine in the lobby. Another problem was the DVD player did not work, like it overheats after about 1/2 hour of the movie. The remote control didn't work either. We called the front desk about this. Without the remote control, it is inconvenient to do anything aside from playing the movie. Well, engineering left a note saying the the DVD player worked fine and they replaced the batteries on the remote. I had to argue again to get credit $7.95 for the movie since it is a daily rental. Well we started the movie again and wouldn't you know it? The player stopped in about 1/2 hour again. I called and said just replaced the player instead of telling me there's nothing wrong, which they did. How aggravating. The rooms are very nice and well furnished. The bathroom was spacious with an exquisite shower and separate jacuzzi bath. The bed was very comforatble. The kitchen was convenient as well as the washer and dryer. However, I did have a horrendous view of the new connstruction from my room with machinery starting at 7:30am. Fortunately we are early risers cause it did get nosiy and dusty. They said the hotel was full and couldn't change my room. The pool area was beautiful as well as the beach located right beside the pool area. It was quite windy every day. I hope it's not like that all the time. The sunsets are magnificent from the pool. The bar service in the pool area was adequate at best. The hotel has only one restaurant and it is fair. So you are stuck due to the lack of restaurants unless you leave the property. Parking is free but spaces are limited so may have to walk quite a ways. It was a pain one evening as it was raining quite heavily and we were without an umbrella. I would stay somewhere else for the price.

Reviews.Title: “If your not a time share owner, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: Heres the thing; beautiful, new studios with all the nice trimmings including marble composite counters in the large, apartment sized kitchens next to the small living room spaces & huge bathrooms, with an open spa tubs, that seem to be the center piece of the units & super comfy Westin beds. Nice. BUT, if you are not an owner, you are apparently not going to get a room with a decent view~ALTHOUGH they infatically state that ALL UNITS are "ocean view", don't believe it! It is a carefully constructed (no pun intended) half truth!. The building was built like a long shoe box with the one end on the beach, with all the units either facing inward, towards the pool & "tropical landscape" areas (where you want to be) or the other, Northern side, facing an open pit & large contsruction site! We paid over $500. 00 a night for that? Sure, if you walk out onto the balcony & look left you see a strip of blue water, behind some trees, in the distance, but directly in front of you is a huge scarred space that is just a fraction of all the construction going on in Maui that to us is just a crime & a ---- shame! Lahina was equally over built & overrun by tourists & the souvenier hawkers that are EVERYWHERE! Now, don't get me wrong, we like a Starbucks in the morning, if we can find one, but the obvious & voracious greed of the builders, on THIS part of the island just makes me sick & I really felt sorry for the poor Hawiians' that are just being taken over by all of it! We looked at caved in shacks, by the side of the road & wondered if they would be going for $500, 000. in the near future. I won't be back & would hope that mainlanders with a heart will not either!

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, it is quite an experience right now at the Westin "vacation owernership resort" at Kaanapali. If you are not an owner in the resort, I would highly recommend that you pay attention to this review. I booked this room in Jan. '05 as an 8-night hotel room for $439/night expecting a great new resort with lots of extras, etc. We regularly stay at high end resorts (Fairmont) and also the lower high end Westin Maui. I was really interested in the spaciousness of the condo and the new beach, both of which turned out to be fabulous. So, for that I would say it was almost worth a visit. However, the rest of the resort is under major construction! We were up at 7am three mornings due to both cement drilling and jack hammering on the far end of the pool deck (for new BBQs and pathway). I complained on the first morning and was able to get a room rate reduction to $339/night. I told them that I still wasn't satisfied and would like to know what they intended to due to make it a better resort experience. Nothing as it turned out. Also, if you are not an owner, you will more than likely be put in a unit facing the new construction on the North end of the property, which is extremely unsightly. I refused two rooms at check-in before I was giving a very nice pool/ocean view room (which I was assured wasn't available when given the other two rooms as the only rooms left). Nice tactic. Honesty is not a priority here for sure. What is a priority is selling the rest of the units, which becomes very clear after seeing the hundreds of couples that get toured through the property constantly in "Private Preview Shuttles." At check-out I reiterated my concerns and let the very nice front desk manager know that I would be sharing my review with others who were planning a stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it so much I bought a unit!”
Reviews.Author: dgtray
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Hawaii and first to Maui. We own a Starwood unit in Orlando and traded for a week in Maui. The resort is spectacular which I expected since it is relatively new. The only drawback was the construction, but it wasn't that big of a deal. We had a 1 bedroom premium unit and it had everything you would want. The master bedroom and bathroom were excellent, and the rest of the unit was very comfortable. All of the amenities were top notch. The pool is beautiful, the fitness room has just about everything you need (treadmill, elliptical, bikes, weights), the general store was well stocked and the restaurant was good if you wanted to eat in. The shuttle will take you to the Westin and Whalers Village. The is a nice sidewalk near the beach that will get you to all of the resorts and shops. I'm a runner and if you get out early running on the main road isn't a problem. The sun rises early and it gets warm very quickly so go early. The rest of the review will focus on things to do in the area. If you like to explore the island then I highly recommend "Maui Revealed " by Doughty and Friedman. It will give you maps and details on all of the major attractions in Maui. The first adventure we took was the road to Hana. You need to plan on an entire day and leave early, but what a blast. The views are spectacular and there are lots of interesting side trips to see waterfalls and beaches. The road is very narrow with lots of twists and turns but it is worth it. We decided to turn back at Hana which was a mistake...we should have continued all the way around the island (the roads are okay even though you will hear different opinions). Another trip was to Haleakala Summit. We didn't go for the sunrise or the bike ride, but arrived around noon. Unbelievable views of the island as you drive up, and the crater looks like another planet. Take some warmer clothes, because it's a lot cooler at 10,000 feet. Also, if you plan to watch the sunrise take really warm clothes! On the drive to the crater we took a sidetrip to hike to the redwood forest. It was an interesting trip, but the drive to the trail was tough with the last 4 miles a narrow dirt road. We spent several hours in Lahaina and there are lots of shops and places to eat. We made a trip past Kapalua to the top of the island and hiked to a blowhole and tide pools. If you take these trips have some shoes with a good grip, so you can hike down the hill to the ocean. Some tips for the side trip. Buy a cheap cooler and take your food with you. There are great places to stop and have a picnic with a beautiful view of the ocean. The Safeway in Lahaina was the best bet for groceries. We went to the Drums of the Pacific Luau at the Hyatt and had a good time. If you want to be in the first groups to eat then sit on the left side as you face the stage. Unlike the Big Island you really don't need 4 wheel drive in Maui. The roads are close to the ocean, so the hikes are short. Since 4 wheel drive will cost you more save the money and spend it something else. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we bought a 2 bedroom deluxe unit every other year. I can't wait to return in 2007!

Reviews.Title: “Mainly a response to weather problem”
Reviews.Author: godisney_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June of 2004 for one week in a 2 bedroom unit and had no complaints at all about the rooms or resort. Everything is top notch. We purchased a week in a 2 BR 3 years ago and it was the best investment we ever made as we've been able to exchange all over the world for hotels and visit some wonderful Westin and Sheraton ownership resorts. In response to the weather problem in the previous entry, we've spent a lot of time on Maui in all different seasons and what we've found is that you will definitely have better weather on the North Kaanapali area in the summer and fall than in Winter and spring. In the winter the swell and winds usually affect the north and in the summer the south. Their general rule on the island of where to find calm water is "in south swell go north (generally summer), in north swell, go south (generally winter, spring). When we were there in June we went all over the island looking for good snorkeling spots with our kids, only to find the very best was right out our front door! We saw turtles, and more fish there than anywhere. The waves at the Sheraton just south of Black Rock knocked me over and just about swept our daughter out to sea, whereas the weather back at the Westin KOR was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Rooms - Iffy Weather”
Reviews.Author: sooeeypig
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights starting March 28, 2005. You will be hardpressed to find rooms that are this new and in good condition anywhere else. Granite countertops, nice carpet and tile floors, etc. The complaints about the views etc are probably justified, but it's just for certain rooms - most seem to be "as advertised". We stayed in a 1BR, with our three daughters aged 4,6, and 8 and there was plenty of room. The thing that bothered us really was the weather, something that I haven't heard many people complain about on this thread. The wind was just awful - blowing almost constantly everyday at 25-30mph plus I would guess. Also, it was often accompanied by a light rain/mist - again several times a day, sometimes for at least several hours at a time. Several people told us that it had been going on for at least two weeks. Funny thing is, even driving down a mile or two south to the Westin or Whaler's village is was much calmer and sunnier. It makes me wonder if the weather on far north Kaanapalli where the villas are, is consistently worse than even the south part of Kaanapalli. We would be in Lahaina (5 miles south) where the weather was gorgeous, virtually no wind and only partly cloudy and by the time we got back to the villas is was raining with huge wind gusts. To me, that is a major issue. I think it was also why there was virtually nobody at the pool most times. your towels, even your shoes would just blow away if you weren't there to hold them down and you could basically forget about reading anything. It also made the water very rough on the beach beside the hotel, making snorkeling virtually impossible as well. We would strongly consider buying a timeshare week here, if we were confident that the weather wouldn't consistently be this bad. I'm curious if others that have stayed here did not experience the same high winds and consistent rain/mist as we did - or if it just didn't bother people as much. Conversely, Wailea was just beautiful weather-wise compared to Kaanapalli.

Reviews.Title: “noisy room with no ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family was there in mid-February. We booked 11 months in advance and the room location was extremely disappointing. It was on the first floor facing the empty lot to the North. Outside was the air conditioning unit for the north building. The balcony had negligible ocean view and the air conditioning made it too noisy for use. We asked the time share folks and front desk how this room and others adjacent can ever be considered ocean view. And also Westin plans to build 6 stories condos on the North side. The location of the entire project is great and they did a nice job on the interiors and grounds. HOWEVER, buyer beware when Westin tells you are buying ocean view !! Their sales tactic is highly deceptive in my opinion especially when they are putting up six story high condos to the north. Attached picture shows the balcony view.

Reviews.Title: “ok timeshare experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui after staying in the Westin Villas. It is a beautiful resort but the studio is definitly small. Our exchange did not meet our value in this resort. Small kitchens with no space to cook, bathrooms large but without 2 sinks in this luxurious room. French balcony with very little views except the construction dump. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: dfhauk
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week 2/20-27 in an ocean-view studio. It was expensive, but the place and the experience is flawless. There is the usual "lounge hogging" that goes on at most sunny resorts, but we're not into the melinoma scene, preferring to be off hiking or snorkeling or touring. I snorkeled the coral reef in front of the hotel several times a day and always saw turtles and even a few rays and eels. Since it is humpback whale season we celebrated every sunset with drinks and binoculars to watch the whales leap just off our beach. The bed is the most comfortable I've ever encountered, and the bathroom is huge and luxurious. The kitchenette in the studio is small, presenting a challenge to preparing a large meal, but I have to say that it is completely equipped, right down to the dishwasher detergent. The people at the front desk, at the activities desk, at the pool center are all polite and responsive. Clearly this is the best resort on Maui. The only thing I can think of that detracted from our week was some light construction noise, and the slightly irritating fact that the water slide at the pool isn't steep enough and I got stuck a few times. But maybe that's just my new swim suit. If you go, don't forget your binoculars.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for 7 nights in a studio (kitchen/bath, king bed, *land* view, not ocean as advertised). Price: about $200/night via Expedia. This resort is 5-star, without question. It is the most conscientiously constructed building I have ever been in. Great attention has been paid to all the important detail -- water pressure was at least double what it is in most business hotels; 2 shower heads; great bed as advertised; high ceilings (at least 10 feet) with tasteful moudling; nice prints on the wall; etc. The staff was attentive and attractive. Our one gripe is that they play by the book too much, like when the bartender made us go back to our rooms to get ID. But then he gave us a round of drinks for free. The setting is SPECTACULAR. This resort is north of the older Ka'anapali resorts, and so the beach is uncrowded and unspoilt. The 20 or so acres next door are completely undeveloped, so there is a nice view of Molokini and some undeveloped beach next to the hotel's yellow sand beach. There are 8 grills with a view of the ocean -- we used to get fresh fish from the supermarket each day and grill up lunch looking at the Pacific. This place is also cleaner and better maintained than most resorts. Perhaps this is because it was just built (in 2003, I think). They are still working on a 3rd wing of the hotel which is a minor nuissance. Parking garage downstairs is always full at night. The 2 tennis courts are concrete and usually empty -- this is obviously not a tennis resort. The concierge went out of their way to be helpful -- from morning orientation sessions about what to do on the island, to giving us a free "Road to Hana" CD ... if there is anything wrong with this place it is the pervasive (and I mean PERVASIVE) sales culture ... every staff member exists to SELL you a time-share in one of their units, in some subtle way. Once you get over that, this place is paradise.

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 6 Kai Ala Dr, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
